1.content:
Bryan Smith was a brilliant and highly respected research scientist who had been employed with EDL Labs for the past fifteen years. His work on several cholesterol drugs had been pioneering but his true passion always focused on a secret side project he had been nearly obsessed with for the past five years.

And six months ago, he had achieved a nearly impossible breakthrough. Although generally accepted throughout academia as an impossibility, Bryan had developed a shrinking formula, and of course, an antidote. After an extremely light regiment of testing with lab animals, Bryan made the hasty decision to try the formula on himself.

Over the past three months, Bryan had shrunk and returned to normal size four times. Each experiment had been meticulously planned and thought out. Each time, Bryan shrunk himself to where he was only about one forth of an inch high. The intense rush was a high like he thought he could never experience. During one of the tests in his office at home, Bryan remained at the insignificant size of a quarter inch for nearly three hours.

He was overwhelmed and fascinated as he explored the gargantuan objects throughout the vast, enormous room. He stared in complete awe at a simple pen that was lying on the floor. It seemed as large as a Boeing 747. His desk seemed to extend up endlessly. Even at a sprint, he could only cover small distances. He figured it would take him a half day’s hike to travel the office wall to wall.

Bryan could only imagine what it might be like to encounter a real person at such a minuscule size. A normal size person would appear colossal to him. The thought of such an encounter began to consume Bryan’s every waking hour.

- - -

Bryan was once again sitting at the kitchen table daydreaming about the next experiment with his shrinking formula, when the phone rang.

“Uncle B…what’s up?” Bryan’s nephew Zack was calling from California. “Just checking up on you to make sure you havn’t bored yourself to death.”

“No, not yet Zack,” Bryan said with a chuckle. His job and life were normally very boring, but Zack had no idea of his uncle’s recent discovery. “How’s school going?”

“Couldn’t be better Uncle B.”, Zack replied. “The weathers great, and there is so much to do. You gotta come out here and I’ll show ya how to surf…And, by the way, I love the Acura.”

Bryan smiled. Since Zack’s dad left when he was very young, Bryan had been like a father figure to his sister’s son. Bryan was paying for his nephew’s college, and had bought him an electric blue Acura RSX for his high school graduation.

“Wish I could Zack,” Bryan responded with some disappointment. “But you know I can’t get off work. I’m glad you like the car.”

“You never take vacations,” Zack argued. “What the hell are they going to do at EDL…fire ya? You made that dum fuck company. Just take off this weekend and fly out here. I want you to meet my roommate anyway. He’s one crazy dude.”

“Zack, you know I can’t,” Bryan tried to reason with his rambunctious nephew when suddenly a crazy idea filled his head. “But here is what I’m going to do. I am going to send you something very special in the mail. Expect it in a couple days. Okay Zack?”

“Well, unless you’re in it, don’t bother Uncle B.,” Zack responded with sarcastic disappointment. Zack had always wished his uncle would spend a little more time with him instead of working all the time. But instead, his uncle just bought him anything he wanted. “There are some things more important than that fuckin job!”

“I know Zack,” Bryan tried to console his moody nephew. “Just calm down. I think you will really like this. Be on the lookout. Okay?”

“Whatever Uncle B.,” Zack replied with the typically defiant tone of a teenager. “Guess I’ll see ya at Christmas. Take care.”

Bryan’s head spun with a fury of ideas and possibilities. Could he possibly do it? Was he daring enough? All rational had been replaced by sheer adrenalin. Yes! Yes! He would do it. He would shrink himself to the ridiculously small size of a quarter inch and mail himself to his nephew Zack in sunny California. He rushed to his office to get a yellow note pad. He would plan it all out perfectly to the smallest detail. If he did it just right, what could possibly go wrong.

A sudden knock on the door returned Bryan to a mild sense of reality, if only momentarily. Bryan went to see who it was.

“Hey Mr. Smith…ya got any jobs for me?” Tommy asked enthusiastically. “I need to earn some cash for a rad new skateboard.”

“Tommy, the yard really doesn’t need m….,” Bryan began just as an incredible idea entered his head. No outline. No meticulous planning. Bryan was now going to wing it. “As a matter of fact Tommy, I have an extremely important job for you, and its going to pay really well.”

“Awesome!” Tommy blurted out, unable to contain his enthusiasm. “What is it?”

“Well, I am going out of town tonight but I need a very important package mailed tomorrow,” Bryan began unable to believe he was just making this up as he went along. “Show up here at three o’clock tomorrow and let yourself in. There will be a key under the mat. I’ll leave the package on the kitchen table along with a hundred dollar bill. Take the package to the post office and mail it. And you can keep whatever’s left over out of the hundred. Think you can handle that Tommy?”

“Oh yes sir!” Tommy spoke hardly able to contain his excitement. “Don’t worry Mr. Smith. You can count on me.”

“Oh, and make sure it goes overnight mail,” Bryan added as Tommy began to walk away. Tommy shook his head okay still with a huge grin on his face.

“Well I got some packing to do,” Bryan thought to himself. “I guess I’m going on a vacation.”

11.content:
After several trips to his office, Bryan had loaded up the kitchen table with a variety of items he deemed a necessity for his upcoming adventure.

A small cardboard box about three inches wide and three inches high would be his mode of transportation. Bryan quickly calculated that at his reduced height of about a quarter inch, the box would appear huge to him, about 500 square feet and a height of 72 feet.

A quick shiver shot down his spine as he realized how really minuscule and helpless he would be at such a tiny size. But there was no turning back now for the brilliant research scientist. He was determined to carry this plan out to the very end.

Bryan took a key and opened a small metal box. With a pair of tweezers, he carefully lifted out some very tiny clothes—several shirts, pairs of pants, underwear, and last, a tiny vial of antidote. Bryan had first discovered how to shrink inanimate objects, which came in handy during his shrinking experiments.

“Hell, if anything goes wrong, I’ll just take the antidote formula and quickly return to normal size,” Bryan reassured himself confidently. “What could possibly go wrong?”

Bryan began to pack his small transport box. He loaded it up with his extra tiny clothes, some bread crumbs for food, and a soft handkerchief to cushion his journey. He set his initial wardrobe for the trip and the vial of antidote on the kitchen table. Bryan would shrink himself on the kitchen table, get dressed in his tiny clothes, and enter his box with the vial of antidote in hand. Then it would all be up to Tommy and the post office to do the rest.

Bryan carefully sealed the box with tape and made a small incision at the bottom of the box just big enough for him to squeeze through after he shrank. He then punctured several tiny air holes at different points around the box.

As Bryan set the small box on the table, it began to dawn on him just how small he would be during all of this. He wondered if he should call his nephew and fill him in on the complete details of the plan.

111.content:
Zack Smith was returning to his dorm when his cell phone rang.

The 19-year-old jock fished the phone from the front pocket of his workout shorts.

"You've got the Zackster!" Zack said into his Razr cell phone.

On the other end of the call, his uncle smiled at the brash and confident way his nephew always answered calls.

"Zack, it's Uncle Bryan," he said.

As Zack walked down the halls of the dorm, many of his friends, fellow jocks like himself, greeted him loudly despite the fact Zack was trying to hold the phone tightly to his ear.

"It's great to hear from you," said the 6'2" tall college freshman.

"Listen, Zack, I am going to be sending you a package," Bryan said.

"What's that?" Zack said into the phone.

"A package," Bryan repeated. "You'll be getting a special delivery, and I just wanted to make sure you keep an eye out for it, and be very, very careful when it arrives."

"Sounds mysterious, Uncle Bryan," Zack said.

This time, it was Bryan who could not hear well because of all the background noise and conversations taking place around his nephew in the crowded dormitory.

"Can't hear you really well," the scientist told his nephew.

Zack ducked into his dorm, but there was very little peace and quiet. Two of his friends were sprawled on a sofa watching a game on a small TV set placed on a rickety wooden stand.

They greeted him enthusiastically, until Zack gestured wildly to show them he was trying to listen to a call on his phone.

Zack ducked into the bathroom, which was cluttered with socks and underwear, still on the floor where he had dropped them prior to showering. He did laundry about once a week, when his supply of fresh clothes began to deplete.

He spoke into his phone again. "So, what's in this package?"

Bryan considered telling him the truth, but even as the words almost left his mouth, he changed his mind. "I don't want to spoil the surprise," he said.

"Well, Christmas is over, and it's not my birthday," Zack said. "You do so much for me, you don't really need to send me anything."

"You may get a kick out of this," Bryan said in a dreamy, hopeful tone.

Zack, for lack of a better place to sit, put the lid down and used the toilet for a seat.

"When does it arrive?"

"I am having it sent Overnight Express," Bryan answered. "You should see me...uh, you should get it tomorrow."

"Can't wait," Zack said as he stared down at the dingy bathroom tiles. Suddenly, to his disgust, he saw a cockroach crawl from beneath his discarded boxer-briefs.

He slowly moved his right leg and lifted his sneaker over the unsuspecting bug. He brought it down over the roach, which met its demise with a satisfying crunch.

"Gotcha," he muttered.

"I didn't hear you," his uncle replied on the other end of the call.

"It was nothing," Zack said. "Just had to take care of a little problem."

"Well, look for that package," Bryan said. "And please, be very careful with it."

"No problem," Zack said.

"I can't emphasize enough..."

"Don't worry," Zack said smoothly. "I won't let anything happen to my surprise."

Bryan smiled in relief, glad he had called his nephew. "That's what I wanted to hear," he said. "Bye, Zack."

"Bye, Uncle B.," Zack said.

He snapped his phone closed and slipped it back into his pocket. Still seated, he tilted his leg and looked at the crushed remains of the filthy roach.

"You won't bother anyone again, sucker," Zack said, chuckling. He reached for some tissue paper and cleaned most of the remains from the rubber sole of the sneaker. The tall, muscular jock stood, lifted the seat off the toilet and flushed the tissue and bug remains. He frowned as he watched them swirl down the drain and out of sight. Not much got on the big jock's nerves, but he hated bugs with an almost irrational zeal.

"I wonder what's in that package that has Uncle Bryan in such a state," he said aloud. "Well, guess I'll find out tomorrow."

In the meantime...

1111.content:
After getting off the phone with his nephew, Bryan made one more call.

He waited patiently until, on the fourth ring, his neighbor answered.

"Tommy, it's Mr. Smith," he said.

"Hey, Mr. Smith," the teenager said. "How's it hanging?"

Uh, just fine," he replied. "Listen, I've decided to go ahead and get that package ready that we discussed. Could you stop by in about an hour?"

"Sure thing!" Tommy answered enthusiastically. "I'll see you soon."

"No, I won't be here," Bryan explained, not adding that, technically, he would be present, but only as a tiny man concealed in the very package he had arranged for Tommy to mail for him. "The package will be on my kitchen table. Take it to the post office and mail it Overnight Express."

"You can count on me," the youth said.

"I am counting on you," Bryan said. "In a really big way."

The confidence expressed in him by his adult neighbor boosted Tommy's mood. "I really appreciate you believing in me," he told his neighbor. "Everyone else thinks I am just a jerk-off that can't..."

Normally, Bryan would have listened patiently and offered some verbal encouragement, but he still had a lot to do since he had advanced the timeline for his scheme.

"Never mind, Tommy," he said. "Just be here in an hour, and take the package straight to the post office."

"I'll do it," the teenager said.

"Oh, one last thing," Bryan blurted out. "Umm, just be really careful with the package, OK?"

"Is it breakable?"

Although he didn't want to think of himself as "breakable," he knew it might be best to emphasize the fragile nature of the package. "Yeah," he said. "It's going to my nephew, and I don't want anything to happen to it."

"You can count on me."

"Thanks, Tommy," he said. "Bye."

After ending the call, he hurried with his final preparations.

He took a seat at the table and carefully wrote out a mailing label by hand and stuck the adhesive fixture onto the box.

As promised, Bryan placed a hundred dollar bill on the table, securing it under the salt shaker from his table.

He then packed the box with the essentials, including the vital container holding the antidote to his shrinking formula. Thinking ahead, he sliced a small tear in the cardboard wall of the box, which would permit his entry after he had reduced himself to the size of a bug.

Now, all that was left to do, was to shrink himself...

11111.content:
With an odd, giddy sensation at the realization he meant to go through with his plan, Bryan took a small vial holding a pale green liquid.

"Here goes," he said, upending the container and swallowing the formula.

The formula didn't taste bad. He'd had the forethought to add a minty flavor enhancement, but it left a strange aftertaste.

Of course, he didn't have time to dwell on that as the room began to rapidly grow larger. Everyday objects expanded to unbelievable size.

He knew he was being fooled by his senses, so he closed his eyes until the shrinking stopped.

When he opened them again, he looked out onto an alien world as a man now a mere fourth of an inch tall. He stood, mesmerized for a few moments, but he knew he could not be caught outside the box once his next-door neighbor arrived.

He didn't hesitate, but made straight for the box, where he knew he had clothes and other supplies waiting. He had sealed himself inside the enormous container in plenty of time for Tommy's arrival.

When he felt the box picked up, he knew he was on his way.

111111.content:
Sending himself as cargo through the U.S. Postal Service, in hindsight, had not been his best idea.
From the moment Tommy had dropped off the parcel at the local post office... no, even before that... the journey to his nephew had been horrendous.

Despite the request that Tommy "handle with care" the package Mr. Smith had paid him so handsomely to hand deliver to the post office, the teenager had been none too gentle on the walk from Mr. Smith's kitchen to his car waiting at the curb.

After Tommy dropped off the package, concluding his part in his employer's crazy scheme, he spent some of his earnings at the closest fast food restaurant, ordering a burger, fries and soft drink, all super-sized, ironically.

For the past 24 hours, Bryan had barely slept, as the package was constantly jostled, shaken, abused and jarred along each stage of the epic journey. Now, although the tiny scientist had no way of knowing what was taking place in the outside world, an employee at the campus post office had shoved the package into Zack's mailbox.

This gave him a much-needed period of peace and quiet. Unable to hear anything from outside the confines of the box, and much relieved to have the bone-jarring motion he had endured for an entire day at an end, the teeny man simply fell asleep.

He woke, not certain of how much time had passed, when he heard a clicking, metallic sound, followed by the sensation of the box, yet again, behind man-handled by some unseen giant.

1111111.content:
Zack Smith worked the combination lock on his mailbox, reached into the narrow, metal slot and retrieved his mail. He immediately took notice of the small shipping box with the address label so carefully written in his uncle's hand.

"LOOKS LIKE UNCLE B'S PACKAGE GOT HERE," Zack said. "JUST LIKE HE SAID IT WOULD."

He considered opening the box, but a glance at his wristwatch showed him he was already running behind schedule to get to basketball practice.

Remembering his uncle's somewhat obsessive request that he treat the package with care, he unzipped his gym bag and put the small cardboard container among his workout clothes, some fresh from the wash, some not quite so fresh, including his pair of practice Size 14 sneakers.

He cushioned the box between a worn T-shirt and a pair of his boxer-briefs.

"I CAN OPEN IT LATER BACK IN MY ROOM," he muttered before he zipped up the gym bag and hoisted it over his shoulder.

*******

Bryan felt the box lifted, and tried to prepare himself for the inevitable jolts as some unseen giant held the box. The period of violent jostling proved unexpectedly short lived. He heard a grinding noise like metal against metal (as his nephew zipped the bag closed) and then the box began to sway back and forth again.

It wasn't long before an intense odor wafted through the air holes the scientist had punched into various locations in the box to ensure a supply of vital air during shipment. Now, he almost wished he hadn't taken that precaution as the reeking odor of sweaty jockwear permeated the interior of the box.

The tiny scientist coughed and gagged as the stench grew even more intense without any fresh air entering the closed gym bag.

*******

Zack arrived in the locker room to find most of his teammates already changed into their practice uniforms. He unzipped his bag and removed the clothing he needed, shoving aside the package in his haste.

He changed quickly and was ready to zip the bag closed when Chad, the team's towering center, approaching him with a sheepish look on his face.

"Zack, do you still have that spray?" Chad asked as he scratched at his crotch. "I'm itching bad."

Zack laughed. The lanky basketball player had suffered from jock itch and athlete's foot ever since he had known him. "Fungus loves you, Chad," Zack ribbed his teammate.

"Do you have it or not?"

Zack stood. "It's in my gym bag," he said. "Just put it back when you're done."

Zack hurried from the locker room, not really wanting a repeat of the time when Chad had unashamedly applied the spray right in front of him.

Chad walked over and picked the gym bag off the floor. Placing the bag on a bench, he began to dig through the shamble of contents to find the spray canister. In the process, he removed a small box. He left the container perched precariously on the bench as he continued looking.

"THERE IT IS!" Chad exclaimed.

At that moment, the shipping package dropped from the edge of the bench, landing on the tile floor.

Chad applied the spray and gave a deep sigh of relief. He then returned the canister to Zack's bag, but never bothered to pick the small box off the floor as he hurried to join his teammates.

*****

Bryan had just started to feel better when some unseen giant again began moving the box. Then the moving stopped, only to be followed a moment later by a lurching drop and a sudden hard impact.

When he recovered, he decided to...

11111111.content:
That last jolt had been a doozy, and the tiny scientist inside the box had struggled back to his feet, dusted himself off and tried to figure out what was going on outside the confines of the enormous cardboard container.

If he had arrived at his destination, why hadn't his nephew opened the package already? As he pondered this question, the speck-sized man crept through the dark interior of the box, moving toward what, to someone of normal stature, would have been an almost imperceptible tear in the cardboard wall.

Before shrinking himself with his astounding formula, Mr. Smith had been certain to slice a small sliver into the box to permit entry once he had reached the dismal size of a quarter-inch.

Now, that same crevice afforded him an opportunity to exit the box, take stock of his surroundings and ascertain what had caused this delay.

He debated whether that might be the wisest course of action. If he remained patient, his nephew would not fail to open the box. Curiosity, however, got the better of the tiny man. He decided he would step outside the box just long enough for a quick look.

So small now that he could easily slip through the insignificant tear in the cardboard wall, Mr. Smith stepped into a strange, alien terrain, leaving behind the claustrophobic security of the shipping crate.

His tiny feet stepped onto a vast concrete floor. The gray plain stretched to the horizon, where a row of towering metal monuments rose toward a distant sky. The artificial "sun" in the sky, he determined, was one of the bare bulbs dangling from dingy foam ceiling blocks.

He raised his eyes and saw that he was standing beneath six massive slats of polished wood that formed a platform supported by four iron columns.

"It's a bench!" Bryan exclaimed as all the visual cues finally made sense in his brain.

Behind him was the squat, square box, still looking the size of a warehouse. A short distance from his box was a vast object. As his eyes scanned the lumpy outline of the object, he recognized it as a gym bag.

"I must be in a locker room," the bug-sized man announced aloud, wondering as he did so if his nephew had collected the package, but made a detour.

Overawed by the scale of his surroundings, the little man realized he should return to the safety of the box.

He meant to do so, but his eyes kept fastening on other unbelievable sights, including a pair of discarded sneakers that looked as big as ocean-going ships. He stood, mesmerized, until...
11111111.title: Outside the box

111111111.content:
What forced Bryan Smith out of his awestruck reverie was not the fact that he had reached a decision.

Instead, circumstances forced a decision upon him, one that he would almost instantly regret.

He was still marveling at the sheer colossal proportions of the college locker room when his nephew and an assorted dozen or so other athletic titans thundered back into the room.

Until that instant, the shrunken man had not directly encountered a human being of ordinary size. From his lowly perspective, each the team's rowdy athletes looked like a terrifying giant from myth, titans, or a colossus akin to the guardian of Rhodes.

They moved with such unexpected speed and agility, despite their enormity, that despite years of scientific training, despite a mind usually orderly and focused, the tiny scientist panicked. He fled, away from the box by the bench.

A single sneaker smacked the tile mere inches from the fleeing scientist. The impact knocked him off his feet. He recovered, but only in time to find himself plunged into the shadow of another sneaker the size of a cruise vessel.

-----

"CHAD!" Zack complained loudly when he saw the package from his uncle so carelessly discarded beneath the bench. "WOULD IT KILL YOU TO PUT STUFF BACK INTO MY BAG WHEN YOU BORROW SOMETHING?"

Chad, a few inches shorter than Zack, and with a more solid build, walked toward the bench. "I'M SORRY, MAN," Chad offered.

Zack bent over and retrieved the small shipping package off the floor, stuffing the box back into his gym bag. "NEVER MIND," Zack said, lifting his gym bag off the floor and onto the bench.

He sat on the bench and leaned down to untie his sneakers. After he removed the footwear, he peeled off his socks, followed by his practice jersey. His other teammates, busy at the same sort of tasks prior to heading to the showers, would not have bothered to look down at the tile floor under their feet.

-----

He had been certain of death under the sole of a gigantic sneaker, but the shadow passed over him as the shoe sailed past, its owner making an enormous stride across the room.

When he recovered enough to realize he had been spared, the quarter-inch-tall man recognized the titan.

"Zack!" Bryan screamed.

As he watched, a hand dropped down, and grabbed the small box, the one that had delivered Bryan into his present situation, and placed it back into the enormous gym bag.

"No!" Bryan cried, as he tried to outrace the enormous hand.

He realized he needed to get back inside that box or, failing that, attract the attention of his nephew. "He's my only hope now!" Bryan gasped as he sprinted toward the monumental bench.

Before he could complete the journey...

After he put the package in safe storage, Zack finished stripping off his clothes. In a hurry to get to the showers, he let them drop casually to the tile floor, knowing he had fresh clothes in his bag for after his shower.

He headed toward the shower area, not waiting for Chad.

------

Sprinting as fast as his thin legs could carry him, the bug-sized man made a futile race to reach his nephew. He had made some progress when the light was swallowed by an enormous shadow. He had time to gaze skyward before a huge amount of gray and white cotton fabric descended upon him, burying him beneath folds and hills.

After his initial panic (for all he knew, the shadow had been cast by a titan's destructive shoe or bare foot) the shrunken scientist calmed enough to recognize what had happened.

"Zack just...he dropped his underwear on me!" Mr. Smith stammered, astonished to find himself a tiny speck buried beneath vast yards of cotton fabric. When he inhaled deeply, he also detected something else. An unmistakable masculine scent that screamed power and strength.

He knew he needed to get out from under the shorts, and renew his attempts to be seen by his nephew.

He plunged ahead, but found the overwhelming scent of his nephew's manly sweat highly distracting.

Nevertheless, he plunged ahead and...

11111111111.content:
Chad, the opposite of the always hyperactive Zack, took his sweet time. The big jock was still in a pair of blue shorts with gold and white trim, ready to join Zack in the shower but in no real hurry.

He wasn't wearing anything else over a muscular, smooth chest with wide pecs peaked by solid, quarter-sized nipples. The lack of body hair on his torso makes the abundance on his hairy legs even more noticeable.

He also has a boyish face despite the hint of fuzz on his cheeks and over his upper lip. His dark eyes are framed by a head of long, shaggy hair, some of it tamed beneath a backward-turned baseball cap.

Chad glanced down and adjusted himself in his loose-fitting shorts.

Plunging into open space, the tiny man found himself free of the almost overwhelming scent of his nephew's manly, distracting sweat that lingered in the fabric of the briefs. When Zack's tiny uncle, after wandering blinding beneath the vast pair of briefs, finally emerged, his eyes fastened instantly on the titan towering overhead.

He saw an enormous tanned form in blue, gold and white shorts. The titan is groping himself, and tiny Bryan can see the outline of an unbelievably huge package beneath the flimsy shorts.

At the same instant, Chad's eyes fastened on to something tiny crawling from beneath Zack's shorts on the tiles.

"Oh shit!" Bryan squeaked, knowing he has been seen by this total stranger.

"What the fuck?" Chad muttered while his slack expression began to show some curiosity.

"Look! I can explain," the tiny man screams. "Get Zack!"

He grimaced when he heard the tiny thing produce squeaky noises.

"I can't stand fucking bugs," Chad declared in a voice tinged with loathing for the tiny creature near his bare feet.

The shrunken scientist stared in terror at the titan's hairy legs and massive feet.

"No, wait!" He cried. "You don't understand…"

Looking down at the insect, Chad thought… What a dumb-ass bug! Just standing there squeaking at me.

Bryan, still trying to explain while praying Zack will return, is paralyzed with shock when he sees Chad lift one of those monstrous feet.

"No! I'm not a bug!" He offered in a futile gesture before turning and running.
11111111111.title: Bad time for an emergence

choices: Turn around and head back to Zack's things
Continue towards the showers
111111111111.content:
Bryan screamed over and over, "I'm not a bug! I'm not a bug!" as he raced desperately away from Chad. He didn't need to look up to know that the giant's bare foot had already positioned itself directly over him. The only warning he got was the sudden darkening of the shadow as the foot plunged downwards.
Acting purely on instinct, the tiny scientist lunged to the side, throwing himself in a different direction. The giant bare foot slapped down on the floor behind him with a loud 'smack'.
Scrambling to his feet he spied the opening to the shower room. It was probably a futile gesture but he sprinted towards the huge doorway. It was where his nephew had disappeared and the only thoughts he was capable of, other than "I'm not a bug!" and "Please don't step on me!" was "Find Zack!"
He expected to be smeared beneath the giant jocks' foot long before he could reach Zack but he had no choice but to run. He had no idea that Chad thought that he had smooshed the tiny bug into paste and had immediately lost interest in it. The first warning the tiny man got was when the giant stepped over him and headed in the same direction.
As his eyes travelled up the the massive legs to the bare cheeks of his ass, Bryan let himself slow to a jog then stopped altogether.
Sucking in deep breaths he thanked his lucky stars that he had survived. Maybe this whole shrinking business had been a really bad idea after all.
With the threat of being stomped no longer his number one issue, Bryan realised he had a choice.
111111111111.title: Try to reach the showers and Zack

choices: Going with Zack
Left in the towel
1111111111111.content:
Bryan realised heading into the showers made no practical sense now that the immediate threat of being stomped by Chad was gone. It was a lot further to go and then he would have to find his nephew amongst a room of naked giants.
The tiny scientist shivered in fear as his mind filled of all those bare feet slapping down on the wet floor.
He figured it made a lot more sense to head back towards Zack's bag and the box.
The sports bag was a monolithic structure that loomed far over the bug-sized man. Never an avid athlete, the thought of trying to scale that monstrosity was truly daunting.
Bryan knew that simply standing on the floor and waving up at his nephew was unlikely to be constructive and he didn't want to risk getting left on the locker room floor.
That left climbing the pile of discarded clothes.

- - - - -

Zack walked back over to his bag, a large white towel wrapped around his waist. He nudged his dirty clothes out of the way with a foot before sitting down on the bench and pulling out his clean clothing.

The tiny man's new-found hope was suddenly interrupted by huge object crashing nearby.

"FUCKING HELL." The huge BMX biker grunted. The tiny scientist just had time to look as a large mustard-stained lid landed before a massive mud-stained skate shoe slammed down nearby, knocking him down. Bryan felt despair as he took in the now familiar sight of the teenagers huge hulking form looming over him.

The baseball cap (since turned forwards) cast a shadow over the masculine features of the enormous 19 year-olds face. Bryan watched in horror as the giant casually licked the from his thumb as his cold blue eyes focused on the stray mustard lid.

-------------------

Tony grabbed the lid with his stadium-sized hand and prepared to stand up when he noticed a line of ants coming from the baseboard stretching out to the refrigerator. His brow furrowed with annoyance as he rose back up to his full height, his muscled 6 foot frame dominating the landscape of the kitchen floor. Tony lifted his right sneaker and stomped it down on a group of the pesky ants.

His cocky male mind thought nothing of crushing bugs, which was just a mundane act to him and happened often without his knowledge. Easily crushing the remainder of the nearby ants, his annoyed gaze locked on to a lone ant trying to escape at a pathetic pace.

Grunting, he easily overtook the bug and cut it off with a lumbering step unaware that this was the very ant he failed to crush with earlier, the determined Tony smirked and prepared to deal with this lone ant.

-------------------

The tiny scientist froze with fear as the monstrous teenager rose back up to his natural towering height. Tony's height may be considered average height to some, but to the ant-sized scientist at his feet there was nothing average about it. The young titan loomed seemingly two miles high to tiny Bryan, his muscular shoulders and thick tattooed arms made him look even larger, and gave him the appearance of a destructive god rather than a typical nineteen year old guy.

The giant stood still briefly, his Circa skate shoes firmly supporting the massive man's weight. A such a minute size, the massive actions of the giant seemed slowed down, even from his slight distance, the sound of the grimy rubber sneaker tread lifting from the sticky linoleum floor made the tiny man cringe. The humongous footwear stomped heavily on a group of the helpless ants.

Flashing through his terrified mind, the tiny scientist imagined the terrifying skate shoe logo on the sole of this young guy's sneaker being the last thing the ants see. Bryan sprung into action, and began clumsily sprinting in the opposite direction of the destructive giant crying out in vain. He dared a backwards glance as another heavy boom was heard, seeing the titan stomp his foot down on more of the doomed ants.

Not knowing where he was going, the little man raced to the opposite end of the kitchen where a looming archway led to the living room.

Without warning a huge object crashed down in-front of him, missing him by only a few feet and sending tiny Bryan on his backside. Towering before him was one of the terrifying sneakers. Bryan was aware of the smell of warm rubber as he took in the sight of the shoe, its rough mud-stained rubber sole, and the worn black suede material with frayed stitching that made up the body of the popular brand of footwear. Covering the top of the shoe was the thick dark khaki coloured pants that seemed to stretch endlessly into the sky.

"Please! I'm not a bug!" He yelled desperately with tears streaming down his face.

A horrible feeling of deja-vu crept over the tiny man as he remembered his close call not long ago, he didn't feel so lucky this time.
11111222211.title: Tony the Exterminator

111112222111.content:
"No! Why is this happening to me?!" Bryan wailed, his pathetic, diminished voice cawing in futile determination. "Just look closer! I'm a man, not a bug!" He shrieked.

A heart attack, or perhaps even a car accident is how the tiny scientist envisioned his life ending. A stain on the sole of a massive teenager who barely passed basic Algebra? That would of sounded simply mad to the little genius before now.

With a sticky squelch, the humongous sneaker raised off the filthy floor and loomed over him. Recently flattened ants were visibly pressed into the colossal tread, along with mud and bits of unidentifiable refuse stuck in the aggressive pattern. The mortifying skull logo embossed in the rubber seemed to glare right at him, a bit of muddy grass wedged near it, informing the tiny man of his fate.

Barely a moment later and with terrifying speed, the massive footwear crashed down. Tiny Bryan Smith's vision went black instantly as his tiny life-form was successfully flattened once and for all under the enormous sneaker. His entire existence reduced to nothing, all his remarkable scientific accomplishments meant nothing at his minute size, especially against Tony's cruel sole.

All this mattered little to the towering teenager, who viewed all bugs to be non-sentient beings that served only to be invasive pests.

----------

The whole ordeal taking only a few seconds, Tony lifted his foot and chuckled. The cocky youth thought nothing of the little ant, nor the dozen others he had crushed. Gazing around the floor he didn't spot anymore visible ants, and took that as a "job well done".

Completely unaware of how terrifyingly huge, and cruel he appeared to such small creatures, Tony casually returned to his nearly finished food. A few finishing touches later, he revealed his highly anticipated sandwich in-hand, and rushed out of the room to watch TV. Not a second thought was given to the kitchen ants, as Tony heavily propped his sneakered-feet on the coffee table causing it to creak in protest.

"What took you so long, bro?" Mason said with a brief glance at the sandwich, "Don't tell me that is only the third course?". Mason jabbed the bulky Tony in the side.

"Perfection takes time, dude" Tony responded with a full-mouth and an exaggerated wave of his hand. Before he could come out with another clever zinger, Tony reacted to a sudden positive change from the flickering television. "Fuck yeah! Kick their asses!" He exclaimed, spitting out half-chewed food all over the carpeted floor.

A couple hours and Xbox games later, after Mason and Pete went to bed, the tired Tony prepared to do the same. He pulled off his shirt, dropping it to the floor, and stomped to his room lazily. Pulling off his large, stinky Circa sneakers, he dropped them heavily before the base of the bed and plopped himself back. With a stomach full of digesting sandwich, and an obliviously content mind, the teen fell asleep with loud snores.

The sneakers hit the ground hard, and almost unnoticeable to someone like Tony, tiny crushed insect-parts and hardened bits of mud dislodged from the heavy tread of his footwear.

Among them, the ant-sized remains of a once brilliant scientist who single-handedly discovered a shrinking formula with fatal results.
111112222111.title: A Cruel, Cruel World...

choices: Go for the trash now!
Wait until all the giants are gone
111112222112.content:
Pete, now fully dressed, suddenly strolls through the doorway, surprising Tony. Looking up he realizes he had been so focused on the bug he hadn't even heard Pete stomp through the apartment.

"Dude, what the hell are you doing?" Pete says with a grin. Pete doesn't notice the ants he flattens under his sneaker with each footstep. Tony is staring at him, the shock fading to quick embarrassment and then satisfaction that Pete hadn't noticed his surprise. Pete was the type to poke fun at people sometimes and after a day like today, Tony wasn't in the mood.

"Just taking care of our ant problem." says Tony. Pete glances down and sees some ants alive at his feet. He laughs and lifts his sneaker over them, crushing them without hesitation. "Dude they're ants. Who gives a shit?" he says looking back at Tony.

"I think this place is infested..." Tony replies. Pete looks around to see ants crawling on the floor, as well as finally noticing the ones he had tread on. Pete was the worst of the bunch when it came to making a mess and usually was the last one to start cleaning. He didn't want to get blamed for anything and honestly didn't really care that the kitchen was so filthy.

"And?" he paused but Tony, confused, said nothing. "They're just ants, what are they gonna do to you? On the floor all they can do is get stepped on. Big deal, I'm not worrying about it!" Pete reached to the counter to grab the potato chips he had come for originally. With his prize he walked out of the room, never looking down to see what ended up beneath large feet.

Tony watches him leave and then glances at the floor. He doesn't see the bug he had been after. For all he knows Pete stepped on it, or it had gotten away. Tony decides Pete is right and as long as the bugs leave him alone, he won't care.

He spins around facing the counter to continue constructing his sandwich, his mind focused on what he can do to make it as good as possible.

---

Bryan backed away slowly from the massive sneakers, the fraying pieces and smudges so much more evident at this size. Suddenly stomps rattled him to his core and a roar sounded from above. Bryan jumps and spins around to see the red-headed giant entering the room. The one who almost crushed him had seemed so impossibly large, but this giant towered even higher. Seeing these giants kept reminding the tiny scientist just how insignificant he had made himself.

The other giant, in a pair of blue and black Vans, carelessly stomps through the kitchen. His massive footwear crashes onto the oblivious ants, crushing them without even noticing. Above him the giants speak to each other, but Bryan barely listens. He is horrified, now surrounded by two enormous pairs of deadly shoes. He hears a laugh from above. He sees the red-head looking down before moving his sneaker over a few lucky ants he had missed. Flattened ant bodies rain from his sole to the ground below as he moves the shoe. The kitchen rattles as his shoe slams down, the ants disappearing underneath. Bryan looks back up to see the giant already staring at his friend again, clearly unconcerned about the fate of the bugs.

Bryan finally snaps into action. As the giants keep talking, he bolts towards the fridge. Behind him he hears voices and the occasional shifting of massive feet. However he doesn't look back, scared of what he might see. To his complete relief he makes it beneath the towering appliance safely, although he realizes he still must be wary of any other tiny inhabitants of the teens' kitchen.

From beneath the fridge he watches the blue and black Vans shift towards the counter before stomping out of the room. The black Circas don't move at first before spinning around, making a terrible squeaking noise. They tiny man cringes and covers his ears. The feet shift slightly every now and then and after a few minutes they approach the fridge.

Bryan cries out and starts to run before remembering he is safe. He trembles as the massive footwear steps right in front of him. Above he hears the fridge door open and light floods the shoe, illuminating the grimy floor at the titan's feet. When the door is slammed shut, dust rains onto the tiny man sending him into a coughing fit. The shoes finally turn and stomp out of the room, leaving Bryan alone once more.
111112222112.title: Distraction

choices: The boys don't want anything, Pete stands up and returns to the kitchen
Mason walks with Pete, wanting to have a look how bad the bug infestation is
1111122221121.content:
After a while of starring into the light in front of him, Mr. Smith came back into clarity. There was no movement to be seen, and no near sound.

"They're gone.", Mr. Smith said to himself in a relieved tone. And after the relief his logic mind jumped back into action. "Now or never.", Mr. Smith said while standing up. He still was laying on the kitchen floor, where he stumbled moments ago in a sudden rush for escape where he already was safe, "I have to go for that trash can".

Still very unsure if this was the right decision, "But wait, of course it was the right decision.", he thought to himself, "This should be easy, the trash can isn't that far away from here. Just start moving and hurry.", Mr. Smith looked one final moment to the left, then to the right, and after a brief moment, a tiny single ant, just a mere speck, and not very easy to detect, if it wasn't moving, could be seen from a normal human point of view, how it was slowly, very slowly, leaving its secure hideout.

"What took you so long?", Pete asked Tony with a grimace, who was just joining the two other teens, "Did you have another problem of dealing with your bugs?".

"Oh shut up, dickhead", Tony spat to his roommate while taking a seat next to Mason, who again was switching through the channels, but then half minded asked, "Bugs? What bugs?".

Pete was faster than Tony and interrupted, "Oh it seems we have a little pest problem in our doom bro, you guys are just soo messy". He looked over to Tony with a dirty smile on his face, and because of Tony's reaction to his face, he knew he poured some salt into the conversation. Pete loved this kind of fun. He always tried to mock his friends and play little tricks on them. He was a typically high school jock.

Tony thought if he should say something in response, but while he was thinking what to say, Mason did for him. "Uhm guys, that's disgusting, I hate all kind of insects, they freak me out. You say there are bugs in our kitchen? Not cool. Really not cool.", while saying the last sentence he looked to his right where Tony was sitting.

"What?", finally Tony found back his words, "Why are you looking at me? You know who the messy guy here is, and it's definitely not me.", and both teens changed there angle at the same time over to Pete, who had just opened his chips bag and shoved one huge chip into his mouth.

"Relax...", he spoke while spitting tiny little bits of chip mass out of his mouth. "They are just tiny ants, OK?", "No roaches or shit. Just relax man.". Shortly said, he shoved another chip into his dry mouth, and suddenly remembered something. He had forgotten to bring himself drink with his chips.

"Uh, well,", Pete said while licking his fingers clean, "If it calms you down, I will reduce any leftover shitty bug I encounter to a smear under my shoes, that's better for you? And besides ladies, I forgot to bring me a drink, does someone else want something from the kitchen?"
1111122221121.title: Go for the trash now!

choices: Mason notices the gum on Pete's shoe and tells him
Bryan remains stuck in the sticky wad of gum
11111222211211.content:
At the conclusion of high school, Mason and Pete contacted their good friend Tony who had graduated a year earlier and the three decided the pool their resources for an apartment.

This apartment rested on the second floor of an old building in town, and looked dated and abused. Old wallpaper torn and stained in the living room and bedrooms, and the plaster walls were scuffed and cracked in the kitchen and hall. All rooms, but the kitchen and bathroom, featured aged carpeting that proved popular in the late 1960s and was matted with grime. Because of this unpleasant hygiene, the apartment was an easy target for all manner of invasive pests such as ants, flies, and spiders.

Fortunately for the busy landlord, the three young adults cared little for clean surroundings, and readily rented the space for a reasonable amount.

------------

Having shrunken himself only just that morning, Bryan Smith made slow progress across the vast kitchen floor of the apartment, huge crumbs littered the floor all around. The once white linoleum now appeared a dingy yellowish colour, and was sticky to the touch. A fact that went unnoticed to the teenage occupants powerful feet, but made the tiny man's progress more difficult.

Since the gargantuan teens left, the tiny insect inhabitants repopulated the food-laden floor, causing Bryan to take care in avoiding their notice. He didn't want to think what would happen should he be found interesting to a vehicle-sized ant. Holding his breath, he avoided a particularly large ant that was investigating a smashed pretzel-piece.

"I am almost there!" He thought with vain hope. The still distant trash bin seemed reminiscent of a looming mountain from his minuscule perspective.

------------

Pete stood from his chair, having only briefly sat down before realizing his forgotten beverage. Yawning lazily, he lumbered towards the kitchen, deciding if he should grab a soda or a sugary juice drink.

His feet thumped heavily on the floor. At his size, Pete never considered the heavy vibrations his large threatening feet caused the tiny occupants of the flat.

-----------

Once again, Murphy's Law kicked in as tiny Bryan felt dull, heavy vibrations approaching.

With a whipping motion, he turned back to the doorway. He felt his heart sink as Pete's towering visage dominated his view. The huge, gangly red-headed youth would dwarf any skyscraper. Clothed in fitted jeans, a black t-shirt, and large Vans skate shoes, Pete was pale and lanky, but had a lean build from his many years spent skateboarding and participating in other activities.

Covering huge distances with each lumbering stomp, Bryan screamed in terror watching the titanic teen head right for him. His tiny form had only brought him to the middle of the kitchen floor, right in the giant Pete's path.

"No! Not again, just let me be! Please!" His wailing voice didn't even phase the huge teenager. Running, arms in the air, and with a clumsy fashion, Bryan was thrown roughly back as Pete's huge sneaker crashed down before him with powerful concussion. The rough rubber sole loomed before him, easily three-stories high and stained with dirt and grass from outside. Before he could even crane his head, a powerful boom was heard distantly and the footwear before him suddenly lifted off the sticky linoleum with ease.

His mouth agape, the tiny man watched the huge sneakers stomp heavily away, the ground trembling with each booming step. Noticing he wasn't the only one suffering, he saw many tiny ants disappear under the colossal Vans, not to be seen anymore when the large shoe lifted away, raining clods of dirt and dislodged pebbles. The terrifying teen came to a stop before the fridge, pulling the humongous door open with ease.

"I need to get out of here!" The realization struck him, and looking around, he clumsily hurried to safety. He still felt shell-shock from his close call, his little heart racing.

The tiny Scientist's mind returned to the familiar state of panic and shock he'd been experiencing since he shrunk. This young guy was simply walking through his kitchen, utterly unaware of the destructive force his unimaginably huge sneakers posed. His feet running at a desparate pace, the little man thought he was safe when an ominous shadow covered the area.

Pete was preparing to return to the living room, his lofty perspective not picking up the tiny speck trying to get out of his way. Two quaking steps brought the huge sneakers right before the bug-sized man, and with cruel patience, the right sneaker lifted over Bryan.

Still running, tiny Bryan was given a full view of the filthy waffle-sole of the gigantic teen's skate shoe. The thick tread took everything it crushed with it, mashed-ants, pebbles, and a dirty wad of gum near the toe.

Bryan's lungs felt like they would burst as he let out a blood-curdling scream, watching the impossibly huge sneaker come down on top of him.

------------

Passing through the doorway into the kitchen, Pete continued to the refrigerator without even glancing at the floor. A rough pull, and the contents of the fridge were before him, displayed in the yellow light from within. Deciding he wanted something carbonated, he reached his pale hand in and snatched one of the many sodas, not noticing the tiny ants crawling up the side of the door.

He casually stomped back through the kitchen, oblivious to the ants he flattened underfoot. The excitable teen had already lost interest in the infestation, and didn't give anymore thought to the minute insects on the floor.

With a heavy plop, he seated himself back in his previous chair, and popped his can of soda open. His keen hazel eyes focused on the flashing screen, and he idly propped his feet on the coffee table before him, revealing the filthy sole. Unknown to him, an ant-sized scientist was pressed in to a wad of gum that became stuck to the tread of his Vans sneaker at the skate park earlier.

A sudden vibrating in his pocket alerted Pete to a text message on his cell phone, pulling it out, he idly began typing on it.
11111222211211.title: Careless Teenagers

choices: Tony decides to go collect his quarter
Bryan pulls himself from his sticky prison
111112222112111.content:
Mason watched the flickering television with an intent expression. This episode had been long in the waiting, and he was excited to learn of the outcome of the plotline, and the possible battle between rival characters. The scene ended, and the annoying jingle of a local grocery mart sounded as the commercial break started. With a slightly sour expression, Mason glanced towards Pete, his buddy intent on his texting.

Pete had his sneakered-feet propped up before him, exposing the soles to his two buddies sitting across from him on the couch. A wad of dirty pink gum was clearly visible, stuck in the waffle sole of Pete's skate shoe.

Raising his eyebrow, Mason smirked and said, "Dude, you got some gum stuck to your shoe". Pete glanced up briefly, "Yeah, yeah, sure I do...", he laughed sarcastically, returning his attention to the cellphone, idly swatting a bothersome gnat.

"Seriously, Pete. There is fucking gum on your shoe." Mason re-stated, gesturing to Pete's feet. Tony gave a quick grunt in agreement, his attention focused on a commercial for an up-coming film.

A slight frown crossed the red-headed teen's face, and he pulled his tattered sneaker to view the sole. Sure enough, the wad of gum was where it was rumoured to be. "Shit..." Pete grumbled, his temperament dampened. He hated stepping in gum as it could be a pain to peel it off.

Leaning over, he dug his hand through Tony's backpack, which was slumped against the wall near his seat. With a swooping motion, he brandished a quarter with dramatic triumph.

"Dude, keep your freaking hands out of my backpack!" Tony warned as he noticed what Pete was doing.

"Calm your panties, I am just going to use it to scrape off the gum. It will survive." Pete retorted half-mindedly as he prepared to scrape the pesky gum off his shoe with the purloined quarter.

------------------

Tiny Bryan had never felt so low, much less disgusting, in his life. Here he was, smaller than a common house ant in some strange apartment, and pressed into a wad of revolting chewing gum stuck to the sole of a teenager's sneaker. He couldn't even feel thankful that he survived underneath the huge footwear. He was literally lower than a wad of gum stuck to someone's shoe.

The worse part was that the three behemoths had no idea he was even there. They didn't even know him personally, much less know that he had shrunken to ant size and was scurrying around their filthy flat. He kept his eyes closed, not wanting to look at the seated titans, and trying to ignore their thunderous voices.

All this self-pitying came to an abrupt end when Bryan's situation fluctuated once more. After the giant's finished speaking, the sneaker moved suddenly from its placid state, causing the tiny man feel like he was stuck on some out-of-control carnival ride. His brain spun wildly as his environment changed, his little eyes trying to adjust at the intense speed.

"SHIT..." Roared a deep, but now familiar voice directly above him. His vision cleared and with a gasp he saw the colossal red-headed guy's face towering above. The gargantuan teenager's head was tall as any skyscraper. Bryan felt his heart leap when he saw the lake-sized eyes seemingly look at him.

His little speck-like form burst into pathetic struggles, his shrill, squeaky voice squawking with new-found vigor. "How could he not see me from this range?" Mr. Smith thought in excitement. The huge face showed no sign of recognition, at his size, Bryan looked like a tiny speck, unimportant to the massive Pete. The tiny man frowned as the gigantic Pete turned away. His frown contorted into screams of terror when the face turned back, revealing a massive round metallic object held before him.

A quarter. This huge metallic object was a quarter! With little further time to react, the parking lot sized currency crashed to his side, digging into the chewing gum.

"Help! Help me! I am in the gum, please look! Help me!" The little man's pitiful cries didn't even reach the large youth's ears. The firm, yet sticky gum contorted around him, pushing him out somewhat. He watched in horror as the gum gave way to the huge piece of change, a colossal thumb visible at the top of the quarter.

A sudden rush of vertigo and his world began spinning wildly, air whipping all around his pink rubber prison.

------------

With a forceful push, the slightly hardened chewing gum lifted from the thick waffle tread of Pete's Vans sneakers. He grinned, glad that the gum gave in so easily, and completely unaware that the small black speck on the surface was a tiny scientist and not a grain of sand. With a happy-go-lucky motion, the careless youth flicked the gum-covered quarter towards the trashcan.

"Fuck you!" Tony growled, annoyed that the petulant Pete used his quarter to scrape gum off his shoe and then proceeded to throw it away. He roughly threw his baseball cap at the chuckling red-head with annoyance. Pete was quite satisfied with this outcome, having been able to frustrate the slightly older Tony.

A clinking sound reported that Pete's throw was off, as the quarter landed at the base of the trash bin. Not really caring either way, Pete returned to his idle text-chatting, placing his feet back on the coffee table, uncaring of the plethora of other refuse stuck in the thick waffle tread.
111112222112111.title: Saved by the Quarter

choices: Tony picks it up
Something else
1111122221121111.content:
Tony was usually the favourite of Pete's antics. He especially disliked when people took his stuff, even if it was just a quarter.

The flashing television screen brightened suddenly as a commercial break began. With an annoyed expression, Tony stood up, trying to tune out the annoying commercial jingle and stepped over to his backpack. He easily lifted the heavy bag and stepped back to the couch, dropping it with a heavy thump next to it.

Preparing to sit back down, the teen thought about his wasted quarter. Glancing over to the kitchen doorway, he grunted, and decided to just go retrieve it. He could probably just take the gum off and drop it on the floor in Pete's room.

A slight grin resulted as Tony considered it. Stepping around his backpack, he lumbered to the kitchen with heavy steps. Unknown to him as he stomped through the archway, his huge footfall sent strong vibrations through the floor, alerting the tiny insects of his approach.

_____________________

On the kitchen ceiling, a small spider had just entered via an air vent, this strange new world fascinated the recently born aracnid. Tony's booming steps actually caused everything in the kitchen to rattle slightly because of the unstable floor. The surprised spider as not prepared for the seismic display, and fell down to floor, far below.

Without a chance to even get back on it's many legs, the helpless creature looked up just in time to see Tony's titanic Circa sneaker crash down. The aracnid's first human encounter was also it's last.

__________________

Oblivious to the tiny lifeform he just crushed underfoot, Tony stopped before the grimy trash bin. Gazing inside the receptacle, the teen saw no sign of the misused quarter among the slimy trash inside. Happening to look straight down, Tony spotted the gum covered quarter resting near his left foot. It figured that Pete would miss, he thought.

Reaching down to retrieve it...
1111122221121111.title: Retrieval

choices: On the floor with the gum
On the sandwich
11111222211211111.content:
Bryan groans unhappily. His head was still spinning from his frenzied flight and subsequent rough landing. He could barely think straight, only knowing that he wanted this nightmare to end.

Just before he has fully recovered, a quake shakes him to his core. “What now?” he laments, turning to face upwards.

He is greeted with the sight of a black and filthy shoe sole slamming down onto him

Tony grunts as he leans down and snatches up the quarter. Prize in hand Tony returns to the living room, deaf to the aged floor's creaks of protest caused by his heavy footfall. Without pausing, Tony slugs Pete in the shoulder as he passes. Pete grunts in surprise, but decides not to directly retaliate.

"Aww, is Tony mad at me?" he taunts as Tony drops into the beat-up recliner.

"Tony needs you to shut the fuck up!" he snaps back, staring pointedly at the television. Pete grins; he really knew just how to press Tony's buttons.

"Damn guys! So much hostility!" Mason says, mocking concern. Pete chuckles and Tony grunts, but no more words are exchanged. Still in control of the remote, Mason starts flipping through the channels.

Meanwhile Tony grabs the sandwich and finally takes his first bite. "Shoulda put more mustard..." he thinks to himself as he chews. With the quarter still in hand, Tony uses his thumbnail to absently start picking at the gum clinging to it.

---

Bryan winced, letting out a pathetic high-pitched squeal as the titanic shoe slammed down. When the only impact he felt was a gust of wind, he gingerly opened his eyes. He was still in light and was staring at the smudged rubber wall that was the side of Tony’s shoe sole. He whooped in joy.

However his celebration was short lived. A shadow was cast from above, drawing Bryan’s gaze. He screamed yet again as long fingers reached down for him. Still screaming, Bryan felt his lungs relocate to his stomach as the coin was wrenched upwards, resting in Tony’s expansive palm. Before he knew it he was closed in semi-darkness as Tony held the quarter in a loose fist. Bryan couldn’t help but be amazed by the calloused skin that surrounded him in every direction. At his current size Bryan could easily fit between any of the wrinkles in Tony’s palm!

Bryan takes a deep breath, trying to clear his mind. He didn’t have time to marvel at this behemoth’s size, he needed to focus on getting it the antidote. When he had been flung towards the trash he could see the thing was still full, and though he hadn’t seen the package, he knew that’s where it was. Fortunately it seemed none of the massive young men had any interest in taking out their overfilled trash can. Their disgusting habits would work to Bryan’s advantage!

Bryan whoops as the thick fingers deftly move him towards the thumb. It simply didn’t seem possible that such large things could move so quickly and accurately! Bryan is amazed by the wide nail bed, ending in a short nail that was pitted in places and dotted with dirt. Clearly Tony wasn’t concerned with his nails’ appearance.

Without warning, the thumb starts to lower over him eliciting a screeching “NO!” from Bryan. However with a flick the thing skips over him. Bryan winces as the massive thumb repeats the movement, this time jostling him slightly. “Yes!” Bryan shouts happily realizing the giant was picking the gum (and by extension him) free.

“Finally good luck!” he cheers turning his face upwards in joy.

He is greeted with the sight of a pair of smacking lips and a gulping noise. A monolithic sandwich, grasped in the other enormous hands soars over head as the mouth widens. Bryan grimaces at the disgusting sight of soggy piles of bread and other sandwich ingredients briefly visible in Tony’s mouth before he closes his jaws around the food. With a hair-raising chomp the bite is pulled free and Tony starts to chew. As his lips part with every munch, Bryan tears his eyes away. “This guy needs to chew with his mouth closed!” Bryan thinks to himself.

Still, he can’t help but be amazed by the ease at which Tony was obliterating the hill of food, and the disgusting display it was causing.

---

After placing the sandwich back onto its plate, Tony chews slack jawed; every ounce of his attention on the TV. He continues picking at the quarter, making slow progress. Just as a commercial starts up, Pete glances back at Tony. He can’t help but notice Tony is still picking at the quarter.

“Dude, you’re such a fucking cheapskate!” Pete sneers. “Fuck off!” Tony retorts back, his words however lack force. Simultaneously his thumb flick’s the filthy gum free of the quarter. It lands gently on Tony’s sandwich. Tony hurriedly brushes it off.

“Ew dude! That shit was on my shoe!” Pete cried out.

“It’s fine! It wasn’t even on there a whole second!” Tony replies defensively.

He glances at the sandwich, “It’s clean!” Tony declares, not noticing the gray smear where the gum had landed on his bread.

Pete inhales to take another jab at Tony, before deciding he had grown bored. Instead he shrugs and returns his attention to the TV.

Tony stuffs the quarter into his pocket, and reaches down for his sandwich.

Meanwhile Bryan was…
11111222211211111.title: Cheapskate

choices: Bryan made it!
Bryan didn't make it...
111112222112111112.content:
Bryan flailed in panic as he clung for dear life on the edge of some kind of cliff. Though his body ached from the impact it seemed nothing had broken in the fall. After being jolted free of the sticky gum he had managed to save himself from plummeting into oblivion by latching onto the oddly spongy ground. He was unable to suppress a scream as the huge chunk of gum was knocked away, bathing him in much brighter light.

As his eyes adjusted Bryan could see the fearsome behemoth still towering over him. He was turned to his side, so that Bryan merely had a view of his looming chest, and neck lined with a faint stubble outlining his prominent Adam’s apple. His jaw moved as the giant let out thunderous words, though Bryan wasn’t focusing enough to make out what was being said.

He grunted as he pulled himself up over the soft, white ledge. Gasping for air, adrenaline still pumping through his veins, Bryan instantly recognized where he had ended up. After being freed he had been deposited onto the titan’s sandwich!

Stretching off in every direction was a pitted white landscape, though most holes weren’t nearly as large as the one he had barely escaped. Immediately surrounding him were various debris that had also been shaken free from the gum upon impact. Bryan sneered in disgust at the bits of grime, twisted lint, and chunks of dirt scattered haphazardly around him.

Shaking his head Bryan realizes rather than observing his surroundings like a scientist, he needs to flee like a survivor. Now.

As he stands to run, Bryan is bathed in shadow. He looks up to see a gargantuan hand stretched out over him, each finger easily dwarfing a jumbo jet. After only two steps, Bryan is sent tumbling by a jarring quake as Tony lifts the sandwich upwards.

---

Tony brings the sandwich to his lips, biting blindly as he stares at the television. It felt great to just kick back, munch on a sandwich, and watch some TV after being on his feet all day at the bike shop. Still munching on his bite, Tony stretched his legs to get more comfortable, resting his sandwich against his chest. The stretch brought on a small yawn, with Tony facing down in an unconscious and unsuccessful attempt to cover the said yawn. Now more relaxed, Tony brought his jaws together twice more before gulping the food down.

Glancing down at his tasty creation, Tony noticed a large glob of mayo and mustard that had collected at the corner of a bite mark. Bringing the sandwich to his lips, Tony slipped his tongue out to lap up the sauce before taking another savage bite of the food. He sighed, staring at the ceiling while chewing as a commercial started playing on the television.

“Dude, I can hear you chewing from over here.” Mason stated abruptly, his flat tone indicating some disgust. Tony grunted, raising an eyebrow as he turned his head to face Mason. “Ouh… mah bahd!” Tony said through his full mouth.

He then leaned toward Mason, chomping his food obnoxiously. “Bettah?” Tony asked sarcastically, sticking his long tongue out for effect. Mason made a face at the pile of soggy chewed food. “Dude you’re nasty!” Mason said with a grin. Tony leaned back, withdrawing his tongue and closing his mouth. He took a moment to swallow before responding, “ What can I say? I make it an art!” he said as he grinned.

Before Pete or Mason could respond, all three young men refocused on their flat screen as the show restarted. Entranced by the show, Tony continued to chow down.
111112222112111112.title: Soft Landing

1111122221121111122.content:
The intensity of the sandwich being lifted was similar to being passenger in a rocket ship as it left the atmosphere.

Bryan was thrown aside, nearly crushed beneath a building-sized finger that crashed landed. "Nooo! Heelp meee! I'm right-...!" His squealing cries cut off when the dirt-crusted fingertip shifted and pushed him into one of the many air holes spanning the gigantic surface. He landed in a thick pool of white goop. Bryan struggled to keep his head above the oily surface as the G-forces forced him down.

From above, he heard a strange, deep guttural noise. Looking at the source, Bryan was given a horrifying view of the behemoth's gaping mouth as it enveloped his portion of the sandwich. Thick gusts of rancid air washed over the sandwich, smelling of everything the huge teenager had consumed that day.

"NOO!" He gurgled on a mouthful of thick mayonnaise. Bryan spat it out and flapped his arms desperately. "Stop! Dear God, I am on the sandwich! STOP!"

Without mercy, the giant slammed closed his gargantuan maw. A powerful symphony of tearing, crunching rang out before finishing with a loud thunk. The tiny man's body went ice cold as he stared before him; his heart skipping more than enough beats to stop entirely. Not more than half a dozen feet from his gooey position the young giant's teeth had met. Bryan felt time slow, watching the gigantic wall of calcium loom before him. Streams of frothing saliva coated the yellowed surface, dripping down past ridges and barely visible fissures that coated the surface.

Suddenly, horrendous sounds of wet shifting emitted from behind the building-sized teeth and they pulled away. Bryan was too busy staring at the mountianous lips slide back over them that he wasn't prepared for the sandwich being returned to the plate.

It felt like falling to Earth on a city-sized meteor. The oblivious giant carelessly depositing the simple snack without any real thought or exertion.

The sandwich landed with a light boom upon the plane of white stoneware. Upon impact, gravity and weight caught up to the tiny man. The glob of mayonnaise lightly slid down the fresh bite mark, taking tiny Bryan and other foreign particles with it. He pealed pitifully, roughly pulled into the avalanche of thick, oily goo that tumbled down the cliff-like surface of bread.

Bryan resurfaced quite suddenly, gasping and wiping thick condiments from his eyes. His physical limit had been reached and passed long ago. It was a miracle he managed to tread the gooey surface. His stomach reeled from all the intense pressure change, violent movements, and vast quantities of mayonnaise. Bryan wiggled towards a hunk of bread larger than his car and grabbed on.

High above, Tony towered over the scene. The gigantic youth kept his gaze fixated across the room, allowing Bryan a similar view from before. Unlike last time, the youth exercised his massive jaw, rotating it with slow powerful crunches. Bryan could only cringe at the sight; imagining how close he came to being reduced to paste by those fearsome teeth. Tony idly reached an enormous hand up, slamming huge digits into the side of his head and scratching carelessly.

Bryan clutched the pitted surface of his crumb, deciding to try his only card again. "Heeeeeeelp!" His lungs hurt terribly and his stomach threatened to dry heave. "Pleeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeaaaaase! Help meee!"

A dark shape surfaced nearby, twitching weakly. Bryan started with a gasp, looking at it. It was nothing more than an ant: barely clinging to life, missing more than half of its legs, and trying to vainly to escape. It was a pitiable sight - the shrunken genius realized he was lucky in comparison.

Shadow washed over the landscape of glazed ceramic and breadcrumbs. He looked up to see the gargantuan hand returning, soaring overhead with outstretched fingers. With a strong jolt, Tony wraps his huge fingers around the sandwich once more and pulls it into the sky.

Caught in a glob of mayonnaise and mustard, Bryan is afforded a frontal view of the titanic teenager. Both gigantic eyes looked away, uncaring of the cruelty and devastation held before them. Incredulous, Bryan shook himself and screamed as loudly as possible - a solid note of pure desperation.

No response. Only a thunderous smack of the giant lips and a grotesque display when the enormous tongue appeared to coat the lips.

It was plain to him long before that any sound he made was far less than insignificant. He might sound like a shrill buzz close enough to their cavernous ears if he was lucky. Even so; he refused to give up without a fight!

"Look at me! I am RIGHT heree! Just LOOK!!!"

Like an answered prayer, it happened. Tony's eyes slowly moved, rotating like a planetary body to fix upon his position. Bryan felt nothing short of pure adrenaline looking directly into the giant's gaze. The eyes of a god, Bryan couldn't help but think.

"Thank goodness! I'm rescu-..."

Like many times before, his assumptions proved wrong. A mighty snort released from the monumental nose, sucking up a multitude of mucus that collected around the gaping rim. Bryan stared at the two nostrils momentarily before returning his gaze to the mouth. It opened with slow, remarkable grace and unleashed a torrent of tepid breath. Tendrils of saliva dripped down from the thick yellowish teeth, each one capable of pulverizing many buildings. From the darkness within, emerged a gargantuan tongue. It slid out sluggishly, growing larger and more terrific as the sandwich neared.

Bryan belted out with all his might, screaming. The monstrous muscle merely absorbed each minuscule note as it neared, slimy and coated with bits of food. It came right for his location, seemingly to collect the tiny man. Truthfully, Bryan was of such insignificance, the suffering ant was more viable than himself.

It only took a few moments, nothing more. the bumpy pink surface crashed into him with tidal force. Bryan was instantly mashed into the surrounding gobs of mayonnaise and mustard. His screams more meaningless than before as the tongue absorbed each particle it touched. The oblivious giant then retracted his tongue.

Inside the mouth, Bryan had completely lost his wit. Darkness prevailed, barely lit when the huge lips parted slightly. Beads of saliva dropped like bombs around him, crashing and holding everything they touched like glue. Bryan merely lay pasted against the warm surface below, held by a foul mixture of saliva and condiments.

His thoughts had all but shut down, except for one question that kept running through his mind: did that stupid ant survive? It was an insane thought and he could only cackle between each choking gasp for fresh air.

Light flooded the interior when the lips yawned open, the teeth raising with them, revealing large chunks of mashed sandwich caught in each groove.

"This can't be happening..." Bryan pulled himself up slightly. Beneath him, he could feel the tremendous muscle shifting in response to more food. "Fuck! This is just some fucking crazy dream! I can't actually die like this!"

He watched the massive continent of half-eaten bread, deli meat, and condiments slowly enter the cavernous mouth.

CRUNCH!
1111122221121111122.title: Bryan didn't make it...

choices: Tony tells Pete about the wad of gum under his sneaker
Pete needs to go to the bathroom
111112222112112.content:
„Mr. Smith?“, „Mr. Smith, are you OK? Wake up...“, Mr. Smith slowly opened his eyes. His mind dazed and every bone in his body hurting, Mr. Smith vision still was too blurry to see anything. He winkled his right eye a few times, trying to get a focus. “Wha, what happen... where am, who's..”, Mr. Smith tried to say. Was there someone speaking to him before? “My legs, uh, my legs...”, “Easy Mr. Smith, I'm so glad you're OK. I was worried about you when I found you”, suddenly the familiar voice spoke to him again. Was it, no, that can't be, but it did sound like, “Is this the package?”. Package? Mr. Smith's mind got clearer now and his vision came back and he saw, no, that cannot be. “Tommy!?”, “Yes Mr. Smith, it's me. Is this the package you wanted me to bring to the post office?”, above him, Mr. Smith looked into the face of his well known teenage neighbor boy, who was kneeling over him, wait, over him? “Oh, my head”, Mr. Smith touched the back of his head with his left hand and tried to sit up a little bit with his right hand.

“I think you slipped and knocked yourself out just a few moments before I got to your house”, Tommy said with a smile on his face, “You should be happy I found you.”. “No..., I, this cannot be. Tommy, you, I was... you look...”, “Yes, Mr. Smith? What are you talking about? Do you feel alright?”, Tommy's smile went into a worried look while standing up. While he did, Mr. Smith could see the boy was holding a small package in his right hand. It was his package, the one the prepared to ship himself in, after he shrunk to the size of 1/8 of an inch. But that all did happen already, and it went terrible wrong. First there were those ants, and then Tommy tried to..., and he got inside, and then, wait, where was he? He was home, it was his kitchen, and he was laying on the kitchen floor, but how... “Alright Mr. Smith, I'm really in a hurry. You should put yourself some ice on your neck, while I bring your package to the post office, OK? I'll come back later again to see for you.”, the handsome teenager said, taking the money from the table, and went for the kitchen door.

His mind still blurry and everything hurting, Mr. Smith tried to sit up on his kitchen floor. He didn't really know what was going on, was it all just a bad dream? Did nothing happen of what seemed to has happen before? Was his nightmare, over? “Eww, yuck...”, Mr. Smith suddenly heard Tommy say from the left, which immediately sent a shudder through his body. “Mr. Smith, it seems you have ants in your kitchen. I just stepped on a few without noticing, and they were all smeared over your kitchen floor. But don't worry, I'll take care of your bug problem Mr. Smith.”.

“No... no, Tommy wait, I...”, Mr. Smith's vision suddenly got blurry again and for a moment he thought he would black out again. But he was able to open his eyes, and... “Nooo...”, Mr. Smith silently screamed in his mind. He was, he was the size of an ant again, no, he was smaller. But where was Tom..., “I really hate insects Mr. Smith”, a thundering voice started to speak. “But don't worry Mr. Smith, these two ants here in the corner seemed to be the last ones, and they met with their tiny little friends under my shoes, he he.”. Mr. Smith looked to his right, and there was Tommy standing in one corner of the kitchen room while twisting his right sneaker.
