It would be difficult, but doable in comparison to other seemingly impossible feats he had accomplished today. Off to his left, Bryan identified a button - long and metallic against the white casing, and visibly worn from repeated use. It proved just the thing as the bug-sized man scampered up the side, grabbing the slick edges and pulling himself up.

Feeling invigorated for the first time, he prepared to position himself on the massive black surface.
11111222211221112211.title: A place to be noticed

choices: The floor
The giant's shirt
111112222112211122111.content:
It was a strange experience, Bryan thought as he padded across the slick surface. To the naked eye of a regular viewer, it was nothing but the smooth screen of a touch-pad smart phone. But, Bryan Smith had an impossibly more detailed view of it: dramatic dents coated the surface, caused by daily wear and tear. To the tiny man's dismay, the surface proved to be coated with slick oils left by the gigantic owner, along with dried gunk that dotted it like foliage.

"This is my best bet to be noticed," Bryan said, ignoring the rather disgusting state of the cellphones surface. "I'll stand out like a sore-thumb here - it's a sure thing!"

As if on que, Bryan heard a terrible crash that emanated deep within the apartment. Moments later, the speck of a scientist paused to listen, both hearing and feeling distant pounds that grew closer.

The seismic disturbance grew enough that Bryan fell to his side. He bopped his head against the dark surface, quickly trying to pull himself upright. Just in time, he watched the behemoth man who unknowingly brought him here appear around the corner. The entire room seemed to tremble with every step, as if the giant enjoyed stomping around instead of merely walking.

Still unprepared, Bryan devolved into a clumsy ritual of screams and frantic flails in a plight for attention.

Like a skyscraper of mythic proportions, the strange giant overtook the horizon. Unlike such a construct, this colossus moved and flexed, lifting a monumental foot for each step that sent powerful vibrations through the countertop. More quickly than he liked, the titan headed straight for Bryan's location, halting at the counters edge.

His thoughts raced, bordering on panic. "H-h... HEEELP! Pleaaase, HELP!" Each note seemed hopelessly shrill.

Before him towered a sheer wall of white fabric. Plastered upon it, bigger than Bryan's neighbourhood, was a faded logo that resembled some sport team. The looming folds of cotton shifted against the gargantuan guy's body. A simple action that more closely resembled a snow-packed mountain crumbling before an avalanche. Bryan screamed again. High above, the unknown titan's face was visible, looking directly at him without a shred of recognition.

"Fuck... Please...." The ant-sized man babbled. "Oh, fuck! Just help me dammit!"

His only response was a parting of the lips and an unleash of cataclysmic sound from the giant's mouth. Even from so high up, the noise blasted Bryan with a shock-wave that sent him reeling, and large globules of saliva and meteorites of chewed cookie. The disheveled titan looked utterly unimpressed by his own power, raising a hand that could easily encompass the entire town, and wiping it against his chin.

Then the same appendage was lowered rapidly towards the gigantic cellphone. The sight of the out-stretched fingers turned the minuscule man's pleas into wordless shrieks.

---

Hands behind his head, Chris smacked his lips and blinked sleepily. Shifting, he looked to his wrist for a moment before realizing it lacked a wristwatch. Grabbing it from the nightstand, the time shone out to him via digital numbers.

"It's only 9:30? Fuuuuck,,," The young guy grumbled.

Chris groggily strapped the watch on, fumbling with the clasp, and rose up from bed looking around as he scratched. The bed was unmade, and he knew Maya would get onto to him about it. He would worry about that later. Instinctively, he reach into his pocket for his phone, but felt nothing. Blinking, he suddenly remembered and cursed.

"Prolly gonna be dead," Opening the door, he tromped down the short hallway. "Fucking starved."

The floor boards creaked with each step that carried him to the kitchen. Upon entering it, Chris spotted the device upon the counter, near the bag of cookies he tore into earlier. His mind determined their fate as destined for his stomach, but he focused on the smart phone that lay on the edge of the counter. In his grogginess, Chris had set it down before pounding off to sleep again, he stupidly forgot to even plug the damn thing in.

Looking down at it, he hoped it wasn't dead. Without a thought, he belched loudly, not noticing bits that spattered against the counter and phone. A sting of acidic orange and chocolate flavoured his mouth while he wiped crumbs and saliva off. Snatching the phone with the same hand, Chris looked at the dark screen as he repeatedly depressed the power button.

"Shit!" He cursed. He wanted to check his mobile games, but now he had to wait for the fucking charge to build. "God-fucking-shitting-chr..." The string of baleful cussing halted when a small form slid across the phones surface. Still sleepy, Chris attempted to hold the phone steady and squinted. The shape squirmed and then began moving.

"You little fucker."

The ant wriggled around on the screen, sliding due to Chris's slight movements. He merely frowned at the pesky intruder, aware only of how gross and inconvenient it was to him. Never once had he ever thought of bugs as anything but a nuisance. And, this damn apartment building had so many problems with bugs: in the hallways, in the bathrooms, and especially in the kitchen. Maya hated them, and their existence annoyed Chris.

Stifling a small burp, he blew on the indignant ant, sending it sliding, but it still remained. Grunting, he just tilted the phone and swept it off. The insignificant shape was lost to him instantly, and unless he spotted it fucking around again, he could care less. At least it was just an ant, and not another cockroach.

---

Barely able to believe his intense misfortune, Bryan found himself relocated to...
111112222112211122111.title: A nuisance

choices: He escapes back to the hall
Something botches his escape
11111222211221112212.content:
Bryan stood atop the counter, a tiny pale speck a midst cookie crumbs larger than he was.

Turning his head, he surveyed the apartment that made up his world. It appeared much like the previous apartment--except this kitchen was open to what looked like the living room. A humming fluorescent fixture cast light into the kitchen, giving the room a cold white glow. Bryan continued looking around, his eyes narrowed when he spied a hallway that emitted rumbling snores.

A scratching sound caught his attention. Curiosity--something to be expected from a scientist--drove Bryan to investigate the strange noise, that seemed to be coming from the living room. Crossing the span of tiled counter top, he approached the edge.

The open space at the ledge was daunting, turning Bryan's stomach with vertigo. He peered at the vast room. Decorated with a leather couch, coffee table of teak, and an entertainment center with an impressive DVD collection. Tasteful pictures, and window dressings gave the place a homey look, and showed the definite signs of feminine touch. A pair of sneakers set next to the shelves seemed the only indication of a male presence.

Something across the room caught his attention. His skin prickled with recognition.

"They have a pet..." He said, squinting for a better look.

An animal of likely mammoth proportions, he figured. Judging by the size of the pet bed, it didn't seem to be a chihuahua. "Even that would be gigantic" Bryan mused at the thought of a Cerberus sized toy dog.

"That's enough. I've got to get out of here!" The teenager's apartment had been a death trap, but he felt at least a small attachment to them. Nodding, Bryan spied the front door. "At least they keep the door painted" It lacked the peeling, stained texture of the teenager's apartment, and instead sported a dark blue paint job.

Bryan decided that escaping would be relatively easy. The open floor plan would give Bryan almost direct access to the door if he descended the looming counter that met the wall adjacent to the door.

If he hadn't already come to the conclusion to leave, the next thing he saw left him no choice. Quick and nearly silent, swept a cockroach of terrifying measures. Bryan fell back with a squeak at the sight, watching the monster bug skitter towards the spilled bag of cookies.

He sighed. "Dear God... cockroaches?!" Above all insects--except arachnids--Bryan despised cockroaches. It never occurred to him how prevalent insects were until he explored the world as one. He felt queasy just thinking of such things.

Bryan, now more assured in his decision, looked for a way to the floor.
11111222211221112212.title: Nope!

1111122221122111222.content:
Maya's rushed exit had shaken Chris awake. With a shrug he plods over to his couch and sits down on the overstuffed cushions. Reaching for the TV remote he turns it on and flips through channels before settling on a morning rerun of one of his favorite comedies.

*Gulp!* Chris laughs at the TV as he snatches another cookie in his hand, and pops it into his mouth. *Crunch, crunch! Smack! Gulp!*

He reaches into the bag and pulls out another cookie, a coating of dust on one side goes unnoticed. As he raises it to his lips, his cell phone rings. With a sigh he stands and retrieves it from his bedroom.

"Hey babe!" he says to Maya, her voice buzzing over the phone. He brings the cookie back to his lips and stretches his mouth open wide. Desperate screams from a tiny speck on the cookie are easily overpowered by his own voice.

"No... I don't see your ID anywhere..." He pops the cookie into his mouth.

*Crunch!* "Weowl... I cahn loook foar yoo..." he says through a full mouth. *Crunch, crunch*

"Yaah, luhb yoo toh!" He says before hanging up and returning to the couch. *Crunch! Smack! Gulp!*

Chris pops another cookie into his mouth, deciding to look for the ID in a little bit. He wants to enjoy his lazy morning.

*Crunch, crunch!*

Deep inside Chris's body, a small speck joins the growing pile of cookie mush. Completely overlooked, and as easily dismissed as the rest of the cookies, Bryan realizes very quickly: He has no chance.

His screams of defeat echo around the stomach. Never once does Chris realize what's going on inside his gut as he continues to munch on his cookies, staring blankly at the TV.

*Crunch! Smack! Gulp!!*
1111122221122111222.title: Crunch! Smack! Gulp!

choices: Start climbing
Before Bryan can climb...
111112222112212.content:
Bryan stares at the door in the distance. It is so tempting to escape these terrifying giants, who are so ignorant of their destructive presence. But Bryan also knows there is nothing out there for him. If he leaves, he abandons the only antidote. Having no idea where in town he is, his chances of returning home safely are nearly zero. Even if he did manage to get there, at his size, what could he do to help himself at that point?

Bryan turns and faces the looming tower of trash. Thankfully the towering teens who used it had poor aim and often left things where they had fallen. The resulting mountain of trash seemed far more accessible to the tiny Bryan than it would have if everything had been inside the garbage can. Near the top of a pile resting against the side of the bin lay the crumpled remains of his box. And surely the antidote as well!

The apartment was still as silent as it had been when Bryan first woke. He continued to pray that it would remain that way as he approached the trash can, heading away from the front door.

Forced to zig-zag around scattered crumbs and wandering ants, Bryan's progress is slow. However his determination is not dampened. This entire ordeal had been a nightmare and though he was proud of his discovery, Bryan was pretty sure he had experienced being tiny enough for several lifetimes!

Slowly the mountain of trash appears taller as he approaches it. However he freezes when a creak cuts through the silence. He turns abruptly but a faded off-white wall blocks his view of what he can only assume leads to the giants' bedrooms. Nothing more happens and Bryan quickens his pace, though it seems to make little difference.

Only a couple minutes later a loud groan echoes from the unseen hall. Bryan gasps in surprise but this time doesn't stop moving. An extended creak is accompanied by a grunt and is followed by some thuds. Footsteps. Someone has awoken.

There is a seconds long pause before the footsteps begin again, each one sounding closer. Bryan desperately searches for somewhere safe but has nowhere to go.

However there is a slam of a door followed by hissing of water. Thankfully the giant, which ever one it was, was visiting the bathroom.

Bryan feels panic coursing through his body and fights the hysteria threatening to overwhelm him. Ahead the field of debris across the filthy floor stretches a fair distance to the mountain of trash. He is so sick of the constant fear. “Why did everything go wrong!?” he shouts at the sky, or rather the far above ceiling.

The muted sound of water, first a sink and toilet and then a shower, is constantly in the background. Delayed for now, at any second a giant could come thundering down the hall. Bryan smiles seeing that he has managed to cross most of the distance to the trash can, though he still hasn’t reached the disgusting peak.

He had smiled too soon as the sound of water ceases. Bryan only stops for a second, before he starts to run. After an agonizing minute there is a long creak from an opening door followed by a few thuds and a slam. Most likely the giant has gone to get dressed, which means he only has a few minutes at best. Bryan needed to make them count!

---

Tony sighs as he plods into his room, his bare feet still wet from his shower. ‘Someone needs to sweep’ he thinks unhappily, feeling dirt and crumbs clinging to the soles of his feet. After pulling on a fresh shirt and pair of jeans, he reaches down and lifts his foot to brush it clean before pulling on a pair of socks.

As he crosses the room he ruffles his brown hair and pulls a faded hat over it. The floor creaks in protest as Tony stops next to his shoes. He glares down at the faded, and filthy pair that are starting to fray. Just the way he likes them! Slipping his long feet into them, Tony pulls his door open and slowly stomps down the hall.

As he rounds the corner from the hall into the kitchen, Tony stretches and yawns loudly without stopping. His footsteps shake the room, as his massive sneakers crash down onto the crumbs and helpless ants scattered across the floor. Tony however is focused on the fridge ahead and is completely oblivious to his monstrous presence in the world at his feet.

---

Bryan struggled to catch his breath. As soon as Tony had appeared, Bryan remembered how tiny he was. Tony easily dwarfed the dated counters, tall even by giant standards. Bryan had broken into a sprint, as he was finally closer to the trash than he had been since arriving in the disgusting apartment. Each quaking footstep threatened to knock him over. He could see the wriggling forms of ants mere seconds before they disappeared beneath the gigantic shoe. Though he had seen it so much in such a short time, he doubted he would ever get over how callous and oblivious the giants were to the tiny creatures sharing their home.

The titan’s yawn echoed around the room as his footsteps thundered by. He stretched, the muscles flexing in his towering frame. As Tony reached the fridge Bryan moved slowly towards the mountain of trash. He had incredibly enough reached it in one piece. No longer concerned with Tony’s cruise ship sneakers and soaring height, Bryan instead focused on how to scale the mountain of trash standing before him.
111112222112212.title: Choose recovery

choices: Tony decides to compact the trash to save space
Tony decides to recollect the trash and take it out
1111122221122122.content:
Bryan was nearly out of breath as he reached the base of the huge trash receptacle. He swallowed nervously as he took in the sight. Sheer walls of dull steel rose up to meet a bulging mountain of garbage. His cardboard package, stained and torn, was just visible from his position far below.

Overall the kitchen floor was filthy with crumbs, spills and dirt, but around the trash can it seemed to be concentrated. Ants monopolized the fallen refuse, clustering around sticky lagoons of dried soda and carrying off bits of crumbs. Bryan gave a disgusted scoff as he maneuvered around the busily foraging insects. Being finicky, Bryan could not believe that people could let this much filth accumulate.

As he continued, the shrunken scientist scoped the towering receptacle for any means of climbing. It was all for naught, as the dirty, yet sleek sides of it yielded no handholds. Despair began to wash over him again.

"I am so close... There must be some way...!" He sadly looked up at the package high above. A line of skittering ants easily climbed the side, which made Mr. Smith glower sourly. Why was he so weak and useless? He had no abilities beyond his intellect to aid him.

Rage suddenly filled him. "No! It's not fair!" Bryan stamped his feet and flailed his thin arms in contempt. Why was everything against him? He snatched a fist sized crumb and hurled it at the climbing ants. He wasted all his time getting here for nothing.

It would require an act of God to help him now...

-------

Soda, milk, more soda, a bottle of beer, and various other condiments lay before Tony in the refrigerator.

He grunted, considering the sparse selection. This happened nearly every morning, nothing easy to eat. Tony hated it, but he never went out of his way to restock the fridge beyond buying pizza or take-out. His eyes settled back on the carton of milk.

Cereal was always a good choice. "Crap..." The soggy carton of milk felt rather light, revealing that only a small amount of milk was left. An apartment with three teen aged guys was always lacking in food. A reminder grumbled from his stomach, causing Tony to sigh. The young man would have to go out for food.

The carton of milk was still in his hand. Might as well finish it off, he figured. With a single gulp he drained the remaining milk and wiped a trickle that ran down his chin. He patted his firm stomach and turned away from the dated appliance, closing it with a slam. Imagining himself as a basketball star, he lobbed the empty dairy carton towards the trash bin.

"Goddammit!" Too much force. The carton collided with the teetering pile of trash collected at the top, causing it to fall to the floor.

Frowning, he crosses the kitchen to the mess, his heavy gait thudding on the floor. He came to a halt, standing over the mess. Almost a dozen various items of trash had fallen on the floor, some spilling whatever remaining contents they had. The offending milk carton, three Styrofoam cups, a small cardboard box, and many other trash items.

Tony unhappily surveyed the spread, thinking only of how inconvenient and annoying it was to him. The tall youth was unable to appreciate the mortal danger he represented to the tiny world below.

-----

It seemed as if the sky was falling. Huge objects, larger than buildings, crashed to the ground around him. Bryan dove to the ground covering his head in futile.

"GODDAMMIT!" Bellowed a deep voice like thunder from afar.

Bryan shakily raised his head and gawked at his changed surroundings. Disheveled ants crawled around furiously. A gigantic cartoon cow leered at him from a mountain sized milk carton, and beyond that lay huge soda cans, Styrofoam cups, and... His box!

The abused cardboard sat a good distance away from him, sporting a dented edge from the fall. He couldn't believe it, it was the miracle he had been hoping for! With clumsy excitement, Bryan sprinted towards the large package. His mind rang with happiness as he ran on pure adrenaline.

This miracle came with another obstacle. Thunderous steps shook the floor. Bryan was knocked back to the ground as the enormous Tony approached, his huge skate shoes crashing down on the unsuspecting ants. The titan came to a stop, looming over the trash ridden landscape.

Bryan followed the huge denim-clad legs that towered up to a massive torso. A faded hat shaded Tony's giant face, giving a more dark and cruel appearance. Tony scanned the ground with contempt, the "Independent Truck Co." logo on his black t-shirt clearly legible.

Bryan gulped roughly. Despite himself, he felt his little body frozen with fear. His salvation was so close, lying in wait just a short distance away.

He just needed to be quick!

------

"Damn, why don't those two ever take the trash out?" He never bothered to take the trash out either, but he could hardly blame himself!

Tony glared down at the trash. A terrible scent was wafting from it, causing him to frown more. Leaning down, Tony grabbed a Styrofoam cup laying near his shoe. Giving it a quick inspection, he discovered it was covered in tiny ants.

"Ugh. Fucking gross..." Dropping it back to the floor, he lifted his sneaker and crushed it with a muted crunch.

Looking back to the mess, he sighed and scratched his neck. The trash needed to be dealt with.
1111122221122122.title: An act of God...

choices: Tony starts stomping
Tony notices the postage box
11111222211221221.content:
Stupefied, Bryan gawked at the humongous sneaker before him. Without any warning, an enormous mass of styrofoam had been sent from high to crash against the ground. Ants and bits of gunk flung loose from the soiled cup as it settled, towering near the frightened man.

"Oh, hell, it's huge!" The diminished scientist exclaimed. It would easily dwarf the world's tallest skyscraper, with more height and mass to spare! Bryan couldn't believe it was just an ordinary cup.

"FUCKING GROSS..."

Rang the deep thunder from above, alerting Bryan to the real danger. Quicker than anything that massive had the right to move, loomed a gargantuan sneaker over the cup. The dark mountain of dirtied suede and rubber mercilessly smashed down upon the cup with a tremendous boom.

The linoleum landscape shuddered lightly, while the giant twisted his sneaker with intent. Apparently satisfied, Tony lifted his huge foot away, allowing the decimated cup to fall free from the sole. The styrofoam had been utterly, and completely, compressed with ease - its broken shape now conformed by the tread of the huge sneaker.

Bryan felt more terrified than ever. Despite all his brilliance and boasting of a high IQ, he found himself staring dumbly.

---

Unable to appreciate the grandeur of his simple action, Tony reached for the trash bin. He decided to make the most of the nearly full trash bag. It would be a waste to open another, only to fill it immediately.

Pulling the bag from the receptacle, Tony gave it a look-over. The trash sunk a bit deeper into the bag, now suspended from his hand, but still not enough to fit the fallen garbage. He stepped around the mess, preparing to open the pantry when his gaze stopped on the styrofoam cup.

It had been reduced to compacted shreds of its former self, taking up far less space.

Tony felt the idea bubble to life in his head. With his size 13 and a halfs, he could make short work of the remaining garbage.

"Fuck, why didn't I think of this before?" He grinned with childish excitement.

Smashing stuff was always good fun. In this case, it even helped to clean up their trashed apartment. What could he lose?
11111222211221221.title: Compact the trash!

choices: Tony also decides to stomp any bugs he sees
Try anything to get Tony to notice him
111112222112212212.content:
Having found himself reduced to the lowly perspective of a mere insect and trapped in a gigantic home shared by three titans more terrifying with each encounter, the shrunken scientist found all his vaunted intellect of absolutely no value to him in trying to rectify the mistakes that had led him into this perilous situation.

Watching Tony crush the Styrofoam cup into flattened rubble had left Bryan quaking with fear. The titan's next actions did nothing to ease his alarm.

"Fuck, why didn't I think of this before?" Tony bellowed in that terrifying voice that jerked tiny Bryan's gaze skyward. The shrunken scientist saw the wide grin forming on Tony's humongous face.

Once again, Tony raised high his enormous shoe, never guessing how his action left a tiny, unseen voyeur frozen in fear.

The shadow passed over the tiny man, allowing him to finally break free of his paralysis. He took a deep breath, but then felt more terrified than ever when the enormous structure of frayed suede and rubber hovered over the building-sized postage box that still held the tiny scientist's vial of vital antidote.

The little man felt faint with fear as he heard Tony's shoe drop with a loud crunch on the shockingly fragile cardboard container.

"Oh, please, stop," the little man cried out in his weak, shrill voice.

The giant moved his massive leg, forcing the sneaker to twist violently while resting atop the flattened box. This final act of destruction left the cardboard flattened and ready for addition to the enormous plastic bag nearly filled with garbage.

The titan reached quickly with one hand, plucking the ruined cardboard box from the dirty floor and dropping it into the bag with the other collected garbage. So far, his plan to fit more garbage by compacting individual items beneath his shoes was working perfectly.

Stunned to see his only hope of restoration cruelly wrenched from him, Bryan fell to his knees, mute with defeat and despair.

Without access to the antidote, which has probably been smashed even flatter than the huge cardboard box, the little man's only avenue to regain his normal size now rested with Tony or one of the other titans.

So far, his only goal had been to escape detection and remain well out of their way. Now, if he hoped to ever escape his exile in a world of the tiny, he needed to think of some means of getting their attention.
111112222112212212.title: No more antidote

choices: Bryan worst nightmare
Out with the trash
1111122221122122121.content:
Many of the unwary garbage met their fate under Tony's feet as he tromped around. His shoe crunched a soda can into a pancake of aluminum, sending another grin across the big guy's face.

As a kid, Tony would always enjoy stomping discarded cans. His brothers often paying him a dividend for collecting them around the neighbourhood.

Stepping over some flattened cans, Tony surveyed his progress. "That went fast!" He grunted, looking over the now compact mess. The BMX enthusiast's eyes settled on a new prize: a cardboard milk carton. "Awwh, yeah!"

Two steps and he was standing over the defenseless Cow-a-Bella milk carton. He nudged the container with his shoe, turning it over to reveal the cartoon mascot on the front. Without giving the inanimate carton a chance, he placed his large shoe over it, covering the cartoon's face. It compacted into a soggy mess easily, offering no resistance to Tony's weight.

"Oh, fucking nasty!"

Remaining milk that had been left inside the container had since curdled and squished out under his sneaker. Tony scraped his already filthy shoe off the smashed carton, and kicked it a couple feet away. He figured he could pick the trash up after he properly stomped it all.

Looking around, he felt his excitement dampen. Besides some pizza crusts, shreds of paper, and other miscellany; everything was already crushed and compacted. It seemed his fun activity was over and now he had to clean up.

With a bored face, he crouched and reached for the carton. It was soggy to the touch, slightly dripping rancid milk, making Tony knot his brow in disgust. He quickly tossed it into the garbage bag and prepared to wipe his hand off when a slight sensation caught his attention. Another prickle irritated his wrist as he inspected it with annoyance.

"Fucking damn ants!" He strung together his frustration and swept the tiny black speck off, back towards the floor.

Still crouching, Tony scanned the floor and realized a good many more ants occupied the trash ridden space; crawling and writhing among spilled crumbs and pools of splashed liquid. He paused for a moment to watch the invasive pests while an idea sparked in his mind.

Another grin flashed upon his face, akin to the excited expression he had earlier. Standing back up, Tony adjusted the trash bad in his grip and turned his attention to the floor. Right after he arrived home, Tony had dealt with many ants near the refrigerator, stomping them out. Yet they returned, and since he was bored, Tony was going to eradicate these in the same fashion.

Lifting his shoe, Tony begins by slamming it down upon a group of the hapless insects, finishing with a twist. He proceeds with this, crouching intermittently to grab scraps of trash and stomping his large skate shoes on any ants he sees. Bits of food in the way end up crushed as well, pressed into the aggressive pattern of his sneaker.

Not for a moment did the young guy stop to think - how any of his actions could be possibly cruel. They were just mindless bugs to him.

Tony spots more ants, crawling in sprawling patterns to escape. All for naught, Tony easily lifts his sneaker over and introduces them to the huge size 13 sole. He spots the last piece of trash, a crumpled microwave meal, and quickly snatches it up. Immediately, more than a dozen ants are revealed and begin to spread out in an attempt for freedom.

Tony merely grunts and raises his sneaker.
1111122221122122121.title: Dealing with the trash and bugs

11111222211221221211.content:
Having taken dubious shelter beneath the damaged and dented container that remained coated with the remnants of a microwave meal, tiny Bryan Smith cowered in abject terror as the titanic titan Tony proved a wrathful god with his every destructive action.

For the shrunken scientist, who had conceived a wild, and ultimately reckless, plan to ship his shrunken body to his nephew, we was now dealing with the fallout from a cascade of unintended consequences.

As other tiny bugs, attracted to the scraps of food and the dark, shadowy recesses of the container, brushed against the tiny man. Each touch from a spiky insect limb elicited a thin, panicked scream from the miniaturized man.

Those fears were nothing, however, compared to when the quakes started, produced by the cataclysmic stomps from Tony's massive Size 13 sneakers.

Peering from beneath the building-sized container, the tiny man saw a group of confused ants milling around on the dirty kitchen floor. Suddenly, in one swift, final action, the colossal sneaker crashed down, obliterating dozens of tiny creatures in an instant.

Shrunken Bryan felt the awful reverberations of the stomp as they made their way into his very bones.

"FUCKING FILTHY PESTS!" The titanic teenager growled with the fearful scorn of a titan far, far removed from the shrunken man's new place in the universe.

One of the ants sharing the bug-sized scientist's shelter, spooked by the vibrations from the mega-stomp, brushed past the tiny man as it ventured into the open.

"No!" Bryan cried, realizing that was the last place anything tiny and vulnerable should place itself.

Sure enough, the sharp-eyed Tony spotted the little bug. "Oh, bet they're more of you little pests hiding in there," he said, staring down at the semi-crushed microwave food container.

Tony's gigantic hand reached down and snatched the crumpled microwave meal carton off the floor.

Immediately, more than a dozen tiny, dark shapes were revealed as they scattered in multiple directions in a panicked bid for escape. Among the fleeing dark shapes he saw one tiny, pale bug mingling with the ants.

Other than that observation, he wasn't too interested. Bug's a bug, after all. He lifted his sneaker, ready to snuff out another dozen or so lives.

"No!" Bryan Smith screamed defiantly. "Not some damn teenager stomping me like a bug!"

He ran faster than he thought possible, perhaps pushed forward by his desperate fear, but he couldn't outpace the falling shadow.

He heard Tony chuckling as he lowered the huge shoe.

In a last futile show of defiance, Bryan Smith stopped and raised his hands in an assertive gesture demanding he be accorded the measure and respect afforded to any man.

Tony didn't even notice.

He crashed his foot down, relishing the fact he could so easily eliminate the unimportant, reviled pests. He twisted his sneaker over the dirty floor, ensuring there were no survivors.

For the teenager, it was simply pest eradication. How could he ever know he had just obliterated one of the world's most brilliant, if misguided, intellects?

Bryan Smith had invented the shrink formula, but he had failed to fully appreciate the meaning of a new place in the scale of things.
11111222211221221211.title: Bryan's worst nightmare

choices: still searching for an antidote
sticking to Tony's sweaty palm!
11111222211221222.content:
Tony let out a defeated sigh. No longer could he ignore the overflowing trashcan. Leaning down, he gingerly grabs the crushed Styrofoam cup, trying to keep any surviving ants from hitching a ride on his hand. Tony tosses it the short distance to the trash can where it strikes the top of the remaining trash before tumbling back down to the floor, bringing even more garbage with it.

Tony grumbled under his breath in frustration. Stepping up to the trash, Tony roughly pulls at the drawstrings of the bag. It’s so full, the can lifts with the bag and bounces off of Tony's legs. He grunts in disgust before using his knees to push free the bag from the can with a small pop.

Bag in hand, Tony takes a step back. A crunch from the floor grabs his attention. Under his right shoe are the flattened remains of some box. With an uninterested snort, Tony lifts his foot and kicks it towards the center of the field of trash. He circles the kitchen, kicking any errant bits towards the center, where he could pick everything up all at once to toss it out.

---

Bryan rushed forward in a panic, blocking out everything except for his battered box ahead. An earsplitting crunch, however, got Bryan to turn his head in reaction. Running in one direction and looking in another caused the tiny man to stumble and fall. Sprawled out on the ground he stared up at the towering young man, who was lifting his filthy sneaker away from a pulverized, warehoused sized cup. Bryan could see flattened ants amongst the folds of crushed Styrofoam.

Not wanting to meet a similar fate, Bryan quickly stands up and bolts in the other direction. As he progresses, he resists the urge to look back in spite of the various sounds and crashes of the behemoth moving uncomfortable close by. Hulking pieces of garbage crash down around him but mercifully don't strike him down. Fear courses through his veins joined by adrenaline. He keeps running without pause, knowing reaching the box is his only chance.

Without warning, Bryan is cast in shadow. Still fleeing, a glance upwards reveals a filthy shoe sole spotted with trapped grime and dead bugs flying overhead. "NO!" Bryan screams in terror as a split second later it crashes down onto his box, further crushing it. With a gusting snort from above is followed by a careless kick from the shoe, sending the huge box skidding towards Bryan.

He finally halts and rushes sideways to avoid be mauled by what ought to be his salvation. The thing screeches to a halt where Bryan had been standing moments ago. Around him other pieces of trash come skidding in as the giant kicks them into a more dense pile.

Bryan only hesitates to find an opening through which he could enter the box. Having now been crushed twice, it doesn't take him long to find a conveniently placed tear. Feeling excessively thankful at the sudden turn of events, Bryan rushes up to the box and jumps in.

---

Tony leans down snatching up the trash. He drops each item into the bulging bag, only pausing to compact the trash so he can force more into it. The last thing he grabs is the crumpled cardboard box. Unaware of its significance or the tiny man frantically searching inside, Tony callously drops it into the bag.

He pays no notice to the sweat forming on his palms, and saunters out the front door into the shared hall. Marching right up to the trash chute, Tony crams the bag in and sends it on its way.

An angry growl comes from his stomach, reminding Tony of his need to go out in search of breakfast. He quickly locks the front door and pounds down the stairs. Emerging in the sunlight, Tony takes a deep breath of fresh air before headed down the sidewalk.

Bryan meanwhile is...
11111222211221222.title: Recollecting

choices: Explore the rest of the apartment
Continue looking for the antidote
11111222211222.content:
Bryan returned to consciousness with a strained groan.

"Oh, my damn back..." Shoots of pain, both soreness and from the many bruises he had developed, riddled his back. He rubbed it and yawned, still groggy.

It took him two strained attempts to sit up properly and look around. Bryan's blood went cold when the memories of his ordeal rushed back. He found himself still nestled underneath the dust and crumb ridden fridge. A world of dimly lit linoleum spanned out before him, stretching for miles.

It was a cruel sensation. Upon waking, tiny Bryan had initially figured it was yet another day of persistent back pain. He didn't want to believe that his current situation was real. Unfortunately, there was no mistaking it.

Bryan rubbed sleep from his eyes and slowly ventured from the protection offered by the gargantuan refrigerator. The flat seemed still; no sounds of footsteps or voices could be heard. Only the thrumming of the kitchen appliances and what sounded like a fan broke the silence. Hovering over the world-sized kitchen was a digital clock, hung over the pantry door. It stated the current time with harsh red numbers.

"It's almost noon!"

Exclaiming this made Bryan shiver once more. He felt as if such a realization would summon one of the gigantic tenants to come stomping into the kitchen. Yet the stillness remained.

A few ants had already begun their daily grind. Bryan noticed a small ground carrying a piece of cereal, while others investigated possible candidates for food. The tiny man also noticed the nearly unrecognizable splotches that dotted the ground. Among the multitude of flattened crumbs, were the smashed remains of unlucky ants. Just looking at their grotesque appearance made him want to hide under the fridge once more.

"No, I need to remain calm." He breathed in and out, albeit weakly. "This is my chance to... to..."

It abruptly struck him. He didn't have an immediate plan of action. What should he do?
11111222211222.title: After they had all left

choices: Nix to rescue... Explore!
The front door opens!
111112222112221.content:
Bryan stared flatly across the enormous expanse of linoleum. It stretched for what seemed like miles; the flatness interrupted only by slight bumps in the material and collections of crumbs and food particles.

He turned his gaze upwards and squinted at the dim atmosphere of ceiling. A single light rested in the center of the popcorn spackled ceiling, draped with cobwebs and dust. Bryan expressed his distaste for the environment with a sigh.

"Messy kids... This place is uninhabitable to anything but freaking bugs!"

As he spoke the words, all around existed an ecosystem of such inhabitants. Ants scurried to and fro - some with wriggling white eggs on their back and others with large clumps of food. In the stale air above them flew flies and gnats. They zagged around, seeming almost like giddy pilots enjoying the freedom of the skies. Besides these benign examples, many other tiny creatures existed in the filthy apartment - all of which Bryan preferred to never interact with.

He watched two ants pass by, their mandibles clutching a particularly large crumb as they moved along.

Above all these "tiny" bugs existed the three teenaged renters; each mostly unaware, or uninterested, in the menagerie of insects invading their apartment. Bryan felt a chill run down his spine as he looked at the doorway leading out of the kitchen and remembered just how big the giants are.

Flicker of red broke his thoughtful trance and Bryan gazed at the digital clock set up above the space. It now read 11:42 AM. The constantly ticking seconds filled him with a foreboding sensation.

"They must have left for the day," The tiny man assumed and began a steady pace towards the distant doorway. "If I want to do anything, now is the time."

That said, Bryan headed towards the rooms monumentous exit. He gave a brief glance towards the trash container; his shipping box hopelessly nestled on a summit of garbage. There was no way in any dimension he could reach it. For now, he would scout the gigantic apartment out and search for some viable options of rescue.

"Gah, gross!" His foot pulled from a pool of slimy gook. The squelch it created made him slightly queasy, especially when he noticed some ants greedily feeding from the disgusting slime.

He reached the open doorway in relatively good time. The ants seemed disinterested in him as they scampered about, barely giving him a cursory brush from one of their antennae. The threshold into the next room loomed tall and wide, entering into another world space of the dingy apartment.

Light dimly emenated from a sun of frosted glass set against the cracked popcorn ceiling. Bryan noted a muted effect of sparkles that seemed to be mixed into the bumpy surface. "This place is like a nightmare from the 1960's...." He assumed this equally dirty room must be the main living space. A lumpy couch coated in lint and dust bunnies dominated the right wall. Across from it, stood a flatscreen of impressive size and grace when compared to the flimsy stand it sat upon. Between them, a coffee table towered on square legs.

The idea that these three guys could live here seemed unbelievable. It more resembled some kind of flop house than the (very) modest home of three teenagers.

Two other exits led out from the squarish space: one being a tall, thick door painted red and lined with locks. Underneath, Bryan saw what looked to be some paper notice that had been slipped beneath the jam. He didn't feel comfortable leaving the place, despite his misfortunes, and turned away to survey the hallway. To his immediate right, the hallway stretched seemingly forever - though likely no longer than a dozen feet. Four doors were miraculously crammed into the walls, all closed but for one.

"That must be where their rooms are.... I could..."

He trailed off, looking from each of the huge doors. The mere thought of entering the bedrooms owned by these young giants made him feel slight elation. Entering them unbeknownst to their owners made the feeling all the more potent. When it came down to it, Bryan had had other intentions besides cheap travel for his shrinking formula. The giants in question didn't fit Tommy's standard, but were interesting nonetheless.

Bryan's decision felt swayed towards exploring, yet he knew that rescue should be his top priority.
111112222112221.title: Explore the rest of the apartment

choices: Explore a mountain of clothes
Investigate the food by the bed
Try to climb the bed
1111122221122211.content:
Bryan decided he could find rescue when the giant teens returned. For now, he wanted to explore! Making his way towards the bedrooms he, soon found himself at the entrance of one of the large rooms. Bryan entered through the enormous doorway, taking in the massive landscape before him.

On the floor, enormous mountains of clothing were strewn about. Worn and used, they had been discarded there without a care, but for the tiny man they were gigantic obstacles. He stared at a pair of boxers, visualizing the giant guy who would wear them, and what was concealed inside.

Food and wrappers were on the floor next to the bed. Whoever lived in this room clearly knew nothing of cleanliness. This however, presented an adventure for Bryan, because there were so many things on the floor to see!

The tiny scientist surveyed the room, trying to decide what to do next. After careful consideration, he decided to...
1111122221122211.title: Nix to rescue... Explore!

choices: Bryan heads towards the closet
Bryan decides to explore elsewhere
11111222211222112.content:
The world space that was this simple teenagers bedroom was anything but mundane to shrunken Bryan Smith.

He felt as if he had entered a grand cathedral - huge ceilings that loomed higher than he could fathom and filled with tremendous structures that dominated the skyline. The bed was the foremost of these monuments, rivaling the living room couch that Bryan thought so big. It was simple, if not penurious in appearance. Thick metal wheels supported the single mattress and a humongous wall of vandalized pinewood could be seen as the headboard.

"I bet that is comfy!" Bryan mused. He scrambled over a splintered pencil that lay in his path. It had been nearly an hour and his progress into the room was slight.

Bryan directed his gaze from the mammoth mattress to his destination at the foot of it. Wrappers of all colours lay heaped at the base of the bed and towering nightstand. As he approached, Bryan thought the discarded foil and plastic more resembled a debris field left in the wake of some colossal war than simple packaging for snacks!

Immediately, his nose was assaulted by new smells - thankfully something besides the pertinent stench of body odour!

"Bloody hell! I'm famished... and stale or not, this is a meal!"

He ducked under a torn scrap of shimmering plastic, barely taking note of the grinning cartoon character that spanned the surface. Underneath the wrapping, Bryan squinted and peered in the dimness before gasping.

"Chocolate!" He pealed while giddily swishing his thin form towards what could be a lifetimes worth of chocolate. It easily outclassed a semi truck in mass - and all made of solid milk chocolate!

"Come to dadd-..."

Bryan's rollicking suddenly cut short when he found himself no longer alone. An ant peered through a tear in the wrapping, flailing and clicking inquisitively. It scuttled inside without any regard to Bryan's presence or regard to his finder's claim. A thick antennae came lashing out like whip and knocked the tiny man off his feet. The ant quickly fell upon the large chunk of sweet with feverish excitement.

"Hey! You ungodly fucking bug, that is mine! I found it!" Despite the anger welling inside him and his hurt pride, Bryan didn't dare rise up from his fallen state. The ant - normally, nothing more than a simple, common black house ant - was capable of tearing him in twain.

He bit his tongue and watched the greedy bug with disdain. It buried both mandibles into the jagged chocolate surface and lifted the huge chunk into the air with a simple turn of the head. Bryan could only watch as the impressively adapted insect exited the plastic interior, chocolate in-tow. Just like that, Bryan was alone once again. This time without any over-sized chocolate to keep him company.

Standing up, Bryan cursed the rude bug, vowing to take his revenge on their kind when he returned to normal. The thought made him grin; but would have to be nestled away for later, as he had more pressing matters to attend to.

Outside the plastic foil, Bryan looked over the ruined city of crinkled, torn, and discarded wrappers. There were many more of them - and undoubtedly more crumbs to be feasted upon. Many more ants populated the area: weaving in and out of the colourful scraps, some clutching crumbs, while others busily followed in lines. His flair for exploration felt dampened after his rude altercation with the ant. Little solace was offered by a small chunk of chocolate left on the floor near his feet. It wasn't much, but something to sate him and for that he could be thankful.

Lazy rays of sunlight beamed in from a window set high into the wall. Posters and wall hangings surrounded it, along with a clump of hoodies, jackets, and hats hanging beside it. A large draping blanket was messily pinned over the bed. Looking up at it, it was evident that this young man's decorating left a lot to be desired.

"So many damn hats... Jesus." The bug-sized man remarked, his head craned back to better view the immediate wall. The brims of many caps could be seen poking from the ledge of a shelf. Bryan could only fathom why this kid would need so many.

Munching his meager chocolate chunk, Bryan continued to investigate the collection of wrappers on the floor. He was less eager than before, but no less diligent because of the constant stream of car-sized ants skittering about. The bugs did good work cleaning up. Crumbs were hard to come by, even small shavings that would be insignificant to an ant.

Bryan passed through a canyon created by the colourful snack foil. One side sported nutritional facts stamped in letters eight feet high, while the other depicted a group of athletes that endorsed the snack. He emerged from the ride and found himself looking over a stretch of flooring (littered with junk, of course) that ended in a tremendous closet. Darkness saturated the interior, barely visible through the yawning bi-fold doors.

A collection of branded stickers and photographs were tacked onto the wood surface. Bryan kept his position but tried vainly to make out the subjects captured in each picture. It proved fruitless, as they were too far and impossibly high up for him to clearly make out.

The filtered light from the window began to dim as the day waned - a fact that went over Bryan's tiny head. He was agog with the mystery of the closet; staring at it and the surrounding objects. A skateboard was leaning against the corner beside it, one wheel was missing and the helter skelter of graphics under the deck were scratched to hell. As the crow flies, socks and a mountainous jumble of denim lay in his path - but the journey was certainly doable.

Plus, it was near enough the hallway door, that Bryan could explore it before heading back into the apartment proper.
11111222211222112.title: Over-sized

choices: Somebody comes home
Bryan tries to concoct a plan
111112222112221122.content:
Bryan's eyes glazed over with thoughts of what items lay inside the closet. Of course, most of those items also lay outside the closet; mostly strewn about the floor.

The pictures pinned to the wooden bi-fold doors were clumsily pinned together, separated by stickers of various sport brands. Bryan wished he was able to will himself larger or smaller, so he could investigate all these items more easily. He digressed, and turned away from the looming closet and scanned the bulk of the bedroom.

Like a behemoth mountain the bed dominated the majority of his view, casting a limitless shadow over the discarded wrappers and discarded clothing.

Bryan decided he would like to investigate the room itself further, and began hiking around the bed. He purposefully forsook the more direct route underneath it for reasons of safety. It was likely that ants weren't the only invaders in this room, and the darkness under the bed offered the best sanctuary for such nasties.

Time marched on, and so did the shrunken man. He came upon many socks; bunched up like enormous meteors of cotton, and some splayed out covering huge portions of ground. Past the foot of the bed, Bryan could see other monumental pieces of furniture: a chest of drawers painted a sickly blue and covered with scratches and more stickers. Beside it sat a red laundry basket, overflowing and supporting an expensive looking guitar.

"Damn, this guy has a lot of crap!" Bryan remarked idly, turning his eyes in each direction. His own space was tidy: not a scuff of dirt, or a misplaced item in sight. Any type of mess normally disgusted him, and this space did not disappoint. Yet, in the back of his finicky mind, Bryan couldn't help but feel attracted by such... masculine clutter.

He neared an odd mass that rested at the foot of the bed. It made him think of a plateau; not perfectly level, but raised off the wooden floor like a dark blue mesa on the horizon.

Bryan approached it, intrigued, and was quickly overcome with an incredible stench.

"Sweet Jesus!" He clapped his hands over his nostrils, but to little avail. "It smells like... like..."

Despite the thick aroma, he reached the edge of the strange mass, blinking tears from his eyes. The material had been worn down enough, that Bryan could scale the side. He was deposited atop an enormous surface. Filth seemed to call this place home, as grime, hairs, and dirt caked the surface. Bryan padded forward and immediately screamed as he slid down a steep incline.

He released his nostrils, more used to the intense smell and began to explore. "What the hell is this?" The incline he had fallen down seemed to span around the entire landscape, which stretched farther to his right by far. One could easily host four or five matches of football on this surface. He found each step to be rather spongy - almost moist. Large smears dotted the surface, ranging from small to massive, and one looked to have once been a living creature at some point.

Bryan continued, following a distinct line of faded white thicker than a road. It continued on and on, until he realized it was leading him in a circle. In the middle of it, Bryan noticed what appeared to be digits.

"Numbers? Are those numbers?" He rounded the tremendous printed circle again, trying to make the 40 foot tall digits legible. All this investigating made him feel like some sort of explorer.

"....12? What the fuck?" As he spoke this out loud, the realization struck him with tidal force. "Fucking size 12! I'm on an insole!"

The enormous plateau seemed to take on a new, foreboding light. Bryan had been scampering about this tremendous surface, like somebody traversing the grand canyon, and it was nothing more than a discarded insole!

He backed away from the huge digits, feeling overwhelmed. With a gooey smack, he fell back into a glob of black gunk that reeked worse than he could comprehend. The bug-sized man screamed and ran, all while trying to scrape it off. He pulled himself over the incline - specifically, the impression left by the owner's heel - and fell back onto the hardwood flooring.

Why would anyone leave their old insoles laying around like that? It was positively revolting, no matter what light you saw it in! Bryan clucked indignantly, trying to wipe himself off against the rough grained floor.

Bryan just wanted to go home; now more than ever. He was tired of being puny - tired of his life constantly being threatened. His bed and a nice Hallmark movie sounded nicer to him than anything!

He needed to be rescued and end this nightmare!


"
111112222112221122.title: Moving On

choices: Tony is back - with friends!
Pete is home from work!
1111122221122211221.content:
Using his hand, Bryan scraped some of the tacky foot gunk from his shoulder. He felt his stomach churn, threatening to heave the meager food he had managed to find.

"Gross! This crap is toxic!" His face plainly showed disdain as he wiped his hands on the ground.

He stood up, groaning and grumbling. This entire fiasco seemed to be getting worse, no matter what he did. The more he thought about it, the more ridiculous it seemed. Here he was, tiny and lost, in some trashy apartment occupied by three hulking teenagers that were strangers to him. It was preposterous!

"Now I smell like foot fungus to boot!"

SLAM!

Bryan instinctively cried out. He flopped to the ground and took cover beneath his thin arms. His ears pricked up, listening to the cacophony of noise emanating from the living room. Somebody was home!
1111122221122211221.title: Somebody is home!

choices: An Used Sock
A Pair of Boxers
11111222211222112212.content:
Bryan, startled by the loud noises, looked around the room nervously. He was out in the open, and didn't have many options for hiding. He could only run under the bed, or burrow within some dirty clothes, and neither of those choices seemed enjoyable.

The bed more than likely harbored some kind of disgusting family of insects under it, along with the ants circling around the food wrappers he'd investigated earlier. Bryan already had the opportunity to be assaulted by a particularly greedy ant, and didn't overly want to discover what other rude bugs were taking shelter under the enormous furniture.

While the choice of hiding within clothes would certainly provide shelter from being seen, the stench of doing so was not enticing for Bryan. He could hardly walk by the dirty laundry without gagging, so the thought of crawling under it made his stomach flip. Plus there was the chance of being crushed under a careless foot stepping on whatever discarded item of clothing he chose to hide under.

As Bryan tried in vain to think of a spot to hide, booms came closer and closer to the room, and the tiny man recognized them as massive footsteps. Bryan saw a light turned on in the hallway outside the bedroom, and then suddenly a large figure appeared through the doorway.

--

Pete entered his bedroom, after a long day at work. He was tired more than anything, and just wanted to get out of his work clothes and into something more comfortable. Pete walked over to his bed, unbuttoning his shirt in the process, exposing his muscular torso, void of hair. He caught a glimpse of his tanned skin in the mirror on his dresser, and smirked. Seeing his progress in the gym always gave him a good boost.

Pete dropped his shirt on the floor next to the bed, and then sat down at the end of the bed. He leaned down, peeling off each sock. Standing up again, he unbuttoned his pants and pushed them off, followed by his boxers. He walked back across the room and found a pile of clothes. Searching for some comfortable pajama pants, he kicked a few items of clothing away from the pile towards the bed. Finally, after finding some satin pants, he threw them on and headed back to the living room to watch TV and enjoy a beer.

--

Bryan screamed as Pete made his way across the room. His primary concern was not being stepped on. Running across the floor, he made it closer to the bed. He refused to go under it completely, but he was fairly close to it so it was doubtful he'd be seen. The tiny man watched as Pete undressed. This man was an absolute god from this size, his muscles looked enormous and so perfectly developed. Bryan continued to watch as Pete pushed down his boxers, and watched the giant butt cheeks flex as Pete walked over to a clothing pile. Bryan normally wouldn't be so inclined to stare at a naked man, but the display of power was amazing.

Suddenly though, Pete kicked clothing away from the pile towards the bed. Bryan watched as a sock flew through the air and landed next to the bed. More giant pieces of Pete's laundry were launched by his foot, and bryan screamed when he soon found himself in the shadow of..
11111222211222112212.title: Home from Work

choices: Mason decides to do the laundry
Mason collects the laundry, but only deposits it in the hamper
111112222112221122122.content:
The pair of green and blue plaid boxers blocked out the artificial light from the "suns" screwed into light sockets in the light fixtures placed in the ceiling.

He felt frozen in place, rooted to the spot, immobilized, as the enormous swath of fabric settled onto the floor and directly on top of him.

The musky smell told Bryan instantly that the boxers needed a turn through the washer. Yikes! What if he gathers them up for the laundry? "I've got to get out of these!" Bryan squeaked.

Even as he tried to navigate the maze of green and blue squares, he felt the vibrations from each of Pete's footsteps. With the giant obscured from view, the quakes produced by his movements seemed even more terrifying.

"Where is he?" Bryan shrieked.

He finally told himself to calm down. The giant was not likely to step on a pair of shorts on the floor. Pick them up or kick them aside, perhaps, but he ought to, temporarily at least, be safe from the ill effects of a well-placed stomp.

Safe wasn't going to get him rescued.

Bryan knew this instinctively, but at the present time the overwhelming scent of man that lingered in the fabric distracted him.

He began to try to actually picture how he must look, the size of a big, crawling over folds of fabric.
111112222112221122122.title: A Smelly Pair of Boxers

choices: He loses his grip, falls and must start again
Muscle cramps cause a delay halfway to his destination
11111222211222113.content:
The one thing foremost in the shrunken scientist's mind was the need to get off the floor. If he wanted to get into contact with one of the remote behemoths, doing so from the lowly vantage of their footwear was foolhardy, if not completely suicidal.

As much as he was tantalized by the twists and tunnels of fabric in a mega-sized pair of discarded boxer shorts, he didn't see exploration of the garment doing anything to improve his hope of getting back to a normal status.

Fortunately for the speck of a man, the hem of the cotton bedcovers trailed to the dirty, litter-strewn floor. Taking a few tiny steps closer, Bryan Smith felt that break represented a change in his fortunes. He wasn't the most athletic guy, but it didn't look all that difficult. He could grab handfuls of fabric and pull himself onto the bed. From there...

He paused, staring way, way...way up at the distance. It looked more intimidating the closer he got. Even if he got there, what would he do?

He shook his head, as if he could scatter such defeatist thoughts.

"I've got to try," he said aloud.

Maybe he could find something to wave. The closer he could get to the eye level of the apartment's occupant giants, the better his chances.

He began the ascent, choosing to push himself through a fold in the blanket that resembled a uncovered tunnel.

He soon realized that the attempt would be more difficult than he imagined when...
11111222211222113.title: Choosing the summit of Mount Bed

choices: Bryan tries to make contact with the gigantic exterminator
The exterminator stomps through the living room
1111122221122212.content:
His tiny brain had just began to fantasize when something disrupted him.

Dull, thunderous voices invaded the sanctity of the apartment, coming from behind the front door. Bryan watched it; both curiosity and fear glinting in his gaze. He hoped they would leave, trailing off harmlessly like in movies. They didn't; Bryan could hear the muttled speech as each tone seemed to travel through the floor.

"Don't come in, don't come in!" Bryan turned to run, but fell aimlessly into the tangled fibers of carpet. He wasn't prepared in the slightest! Metallic rattling and clinking could be heard as the door jolted with a sudden click.

How could fate be so unkind? This was the worst timing possible! He was more exposed out here than in the kitchen.

A shrill screech burst from his lips when the door swung open.

---

"Did you get any reply on 2B?"

The apartment building's manager led the tradesman from apartment 2A, turning to lock it again before responding. "No... no. Those kids never return any calls unless I threaten them about rent increase." He gave the young tradesman a strange look, as if debating if he too were a "kid".

Stopping in-front of the red door, the manager looked it over and frowned. He crouched and retrieved a sheet of red paper from under the door and scoffed.

"Dammit; they didn't even pick up the notice about it. I dropped these two days ago to inform about the visit."

A bit taller than the building's owner, the tradesmen shrugged in response. "Alright. Still want me to spray inside? The company's got me booked next week - solid."

The manager crumpled the paper, stuffed it into his pocket, and began flipping through an impressive set of keys. More than two weeks ago, he had contacted the extermination service and set up an appointment to clear the building of pests, once and for all. There was no way he was wasting the effort because of some unresponsive teenagers.

"Yes; Definitely... This is good timing, they aren't at home. I can't afford any bugs hiding out in there and re-infesting the building." The exterminator smiled affirmatively and followed the older man into 2B. He had been paid in advance to do the whole building, and the rented spaces were relatively small. An easy job, if anything.

"Holy shit..." His boots sank into the dingy, soiled carpet and the noise from the opening door seemed to startle whatever was living here. Gnats buzzed around excitedly, eager to greet the apartments visitors. He batted them away and surveyed the room. "This is the worst yet!"

Giving the exterminator a grimace, the building manager stepped back into the hallway. "Just get rid of all the bugs in there. This is probably where they started from." He watched the younger man pull a pair of gloves on and snap a white face mask over his mouth. "Good luck!"

Pulling the mask back, the exterminator looked unfazed. "None needed - no tiny critters will be left alive once I'm through." He was given a nod in acknowledgement before the middle-aged man strode away, muttering. The room was already lit by a ceiling fan and was sparsely furnished. Coats and hats hung on one wall, while some random parts and tools for a bike were crammed in the corner next to the television.

Unlike the apartment building's manager, he wasn't grossed out by the space. Even for an exterminator barely out of training - who admittedly lived in his own unkempt space - this was all par for the course.

Completely unaware that his presence endangered more than just bugs, the exterminator closed the door and stepped inside.
1111122221122212.title: Good time, bad timing

choices: Bryan survives... Stuck underneath!
Bryan is safe...
11111222211222122.content:
"Uhmm... Oh, shit..." Was all Bryan could muster as he took in the new arrival.

The new giant stood tall and mighty, clad in a mass of thick clothing and gear. Bryan just took in the humongous form, his eyes both wondering and fearful. This unexpected visitor not only threw a wrench in his plans, but offered no viable reason for his presence.

Shifting in the thick fibers, the tiny man stared at the giant who in turn scanned the vast room. "Great... Another one? How many fucking people live in this dump!" The expression of anger subsided from his tiny face, becoming a frown. Seeing this giant reminded Bryan just how foolish he was reducing himself to such insignificance in a world dominated by behemoths. "Crap, he's fucking huge..."

Unable to even remotely appreciate tiny Bryan's opinions, the titanic stranger raised one monolithic arm to fasten a mask that hung around his neck over his huge face. Only then did the giant's gear develop significance; heavy dark cargo pants, thick long-sleeve shirt, and large work boots. All combined with the face mask, tools, and gloves to clothe what could only be one person.

"He... He's a..." Bryan felt his face drain of blood, turning to a ghastly white. "Oh, Jesus Christ, he's an exterminator!"

Unlike the previous giants he had encountered, this new (and unwelcome) addition terrified him beyond description. High above, the oblivious titan thunders deeply - his harrowing proclamation completely unintelligible due to his mask. Tools of the extermination trade are stored in a thick belt, and in both loops and pockets on his pants. All designed to eradicate pests, Bryan realized. Unlike the clumsy and uncouth teenagers, this huge man specialized in the genocide of anything tiny: including his shrunken self!

He had to stop him. Some how, some way, Bryan had to not only avoid being inadvertently killed, but to get this terrifying man's attention. "And not as an insect!"

On a different plane of existence than the ant-sized scientist, the gargantuan exterminator unleashes a terrific roar upon the huge room. One huge hand raises and stifles the titan's yawn underneath the mask before he suddenly shifts into gear. The first step sends a powerful shockwave through the carpeted floor, rattling the entire room. Bryan screams and throws his arms in the air, completely forgoing contact for survival as he clumsily flees.

The ground shuddered once more, followed by a dull crash. Not an inkling of his destination, Bryan barely kept steady pace as he clambered through the grimey stalks of carpet. Each fiber was taller than himself, but coated with years of filth and grime that reduced it to a lumpy terrain instead of a tangled forest. Nearly tripping for the umpteenth time, Bryan found his immediate vicinity and beyond drenched in shadow.

His gaze looked up just in time to witness the cause. "Shit!" It was beyond comprehension: both in size and detail. Each thick lug of hard rubber blown up to city-sized scale and packed with dried mud, pebbles, and refuse from other jobs and apartments.

Thoroughly uncaring of yet another tiny life, the massive work boot loomed above, ready to pulverize the tiny man. Bryan feared his incredible journey had come to an end - all without the gigantic man even knowing he existed.
11111222211222122.title: Specialist

choices: Bryan's Slice
Top Slice
11111222212.content:
Tony leans down to look into the fridge, a can of soda in his hand. He scans the filthy shelves caked with who-knows-what. Stacks of boxes and containers are crammed into the fridge, only some of the food still edible. Tony decides he should clean the fridge out, but first he lays eyes on a bent pizza box. Pushing it open with his free hand he snags the last three slices. Tony sidesteps to the microwave and tosses the pizza in. His friends always thought he was weird for not liking cold pizza, but Tony preferred to have the cheese a little stretchy and warm.

He waits patiently, staring intently at the beat up microwave, as the timer counts down. Behind him he hears the TV blaring where Mason sits watching it, light flickering across the dingy room. His thoughts drift to his job where he is surrounded by parts he wished he could afford himself.

A ring signals the pizza is ready and Tony pulls his pizza out and slams the door shut harder than necessary. His hands are full, one with soda and the other with pizza when he glances down.

Near his right sneaker a line of ants crosses the kitchen. Tony frowns, having assumed he had taken care of the pests already when he had grabbed his pop. He easily moves his long sneaker over the bugs and slams it down. Without looking at the bugs he had squashed he follows the line slamming his dirty shoes down repeatedly. With each footfall the top third slice in his hand shifts and when Tony is next to the counter it slips off and lands on the faded linoleum floor with a smack.

"Motherfucker" Tony mutters unhappily as places the other pizza on the counter and snatches up the fallen slice. Glancing at the floor he decides there weren't any ants where the pizza dropped. He gives the pizza a once over. The glistening cheese, hanging off the slice in tendrils and greasy pepperoni look too good to pass up. He blows on the food and drops it onto a plate on the counter deciding its fine. He drops the other two slices of pizza on the plate, picks it up and heads into the living room.

---

Bryan watched as the giant rifled through the fridge. He was torn between his desperation for aid and his complete fear of the titan’s massive shoes. The young man steps sideways, his heavy footfalls felt and heard across the kitchen by the tiny scientist. He sees some wandering ants disappear under the sneaker unnoticed.

Deciding to avoid the giant, he recalls the antidote in the overflowing trash can. He turns to the doorway between the kitchen and living room where the trash can is. Light from the TV flickers from beyond the frame giving his goal an ethereal glow as Bran begins to move towards it. In every direction the dirt and grime provide obstacles for him. The bugs that the giants for the most part seem to overlook also provide a moving danger for the tiny scientist.

He doesn't get far before a ring fills the air. Near the edge of the counter, Bryan watches Tony pull the pizza out of the microwave with one hand. The giant turns as if to leave the room before his green eyes fall to the floor. A sneer forms on his face far above the floor. Bryan sees the line of hapless ants making their way across the floor. As the incredibly tall titan’s enormous sneaker slams onto the bugs Bryan feels both terror and a bit of sympathy for the defenseless bugs, if only because he is as helpless as they are against the giant young man

The second stomp is closer to Bryan and he realizes as Tony lifts his foot again that the giant is headed straight for him. With a yelp he begins to flee but trips over some grime on the floor. The giant makes quick progress and he feels a forceful stomp rattle the area around him. Suddenly Mr. Smith finds himself engulfed in gooey warmness.

Bryan struggles to move as he hears the giant mutter under his breath, the voice muffled by whatever has landed on him. Bryan is blinded by light as he feels himself move rapidly.

“Gah!!” he sputters in shock as he is stuck to something. His eyes adjust and again he yelps in surprise. Above him is the young man’s face staring at him intently. From below a strong brow his green eyes bore into Bryan’s soul and he feels hope rise in his chest.

However the giant gives no sign of recognition and suddenly his lips, surrounded by trimmed stubble, form an “O”. A cold gust batters Bryan before he falls away from the giant’s face. As he feels his world stop abruptly Bryan realizes where he is.

He is stuck fast on his back in warm gooey cheese, on the giant’s reheated pizza. The giant carelessly drops the other two slices onto the plate. The pizza lays in a messy stack with Bryan’s slice at the bottom but the tiny man is still out in the light. The giant holds the plate in one hand, making Bryan feel as though he is on a ship at sea bobbing up and down.

---

Tony drops the plate onto a scratched up end table and plops into a faded but very comfortable recliner. He looks at Mason and nods at the TV. “Well? Who’s winning?” he asks. Mason points at the screen. “Them” he says dismissively. “They’re fucking dominating, it’s already kinda boring.”

Tony faces the large flat screen, probably the nicest thing in the apartment. “Then change the channel. I don’t care. Just find something good,” he says with a shrug. While Mason channel surfs Tony reaches for his plate of pizza. He grabs the top slice as Mason settles on ‘The Walking Dead’. “Missed this episode!” he says happily. Tony grunts as he chews. As he swallows he realizes just how hungry he is and takes another large bite.

---

Laying on his back Bryan can see Tony’s face staring blankly ahead as light from the TV flickers across it. He stares at the giant’s rising and falling jaw followed by his bobbing Adam’s apple as he swallows. Tony lifts the slice up to his lips and a massive bite disappears into his mouth.

Bryan struggles against the cheese holding him solidly in place. He manages to pull his head free, as it hadn’t sunken deep in the first place. He awkwardly turns his head from side to side, taking in his environment in case it could help him escape.

His first thought was to question Tony’s sense of cleanliness. The gigantic young man clearly hadn’t looked closely at the slice of pizza. What the young titan had decided was a clean slice was actually littered with dark specks of dirt and grime from the floor. Tony’s dismissive eyes had even missed a couple of ant bodies trapped in the cheese, perhaps dismissing them as small spices. The tiny scientist has to suppress a gag at the clearly filthy food the young man planned to eat.

This idea shakes Bryan to the core. He is stuck to a filthy piece of food where if he doesn’t do something soon, the giant towering above him will gulp him down without another thought. As if to emphasize this, Tony swallows the last bite of his first slice and burps loudly. He sighs and smiles before reaching for another slice.
11111222212.title: Journey Interrupted

choices: Bryan was burped up
Bryan was gulped down
111112222121.content:
Still very hungry, Tony reaches for the larger slice at the bottom of the plate. He raises it to his mouth and takes a large bite. He stares blankly ahead at the TV as he chews, his every thought focused on The Walking Dead. He swallows and turns his head towards Mason as the commercial starts up.

"Dude, what would you do in a zombie apocalypse?" he asked. "Ummm..." Mason trails off. While waiting Tony takes another bite of his pizza. A slice of pepperoni gets caught halfway out of his mouth and Tony starts to chew before sucking it between his lips. "I think I'd head to Walmart or some shit like that. They've got everything there!" Mason says. "Defense? Weapons?" Tony asks through a full mouth. Mason's shoulders slump. "Fuck" he mutters, "I dunno, loot a gun store first?" Tony stares at Mason and swallows. "That's not the shittiest plan I guess... But I got my dad's guns at home. I'd bring him along, his hunting aim is beast!" Tony says seriously.

"You guys are fucking retarded!" Pete yells from his bedroom. Tony and Mason start laughing.

"These commercials last too damn long!" Mason grumbles. "Now I'm hungry!" he adds glaring jokingly at Tony.

Tony grins as Mason stands up and stomps into the kitchen. The show comes back on just after Mason leaves the room.

"Hurry up!" Tony shouts before lifting the slice to his mouth again.

---

Bryan flails as the gigantic young man eyes the slice he is on. A hand appears; its long, grimy fingers grasp the crust of the slice.

"Noooo!!!" Bryan shouts in terror as he continues to thrash wildly. He feels like he is riding a roller coaster as the slice flies up to the titan's face. Bryan shouts as he looks at the young man's eyes, but they are focused in the distance. Ahead he sees the lips part, the massive tongue sliding out of the mouth like a monster. Bryan grimaces as he sees the tip of the pizza, with the bits of grime and a single ant body, enter the shadow inside the mouth. His jaw shuts quickly, a dull crunch shakes the slice. The slice is pulled away from the mouth. The cheese stretches, thins, and finally rips leaving a few strands hanging from the lips.

The massive titan's jaw begins to move up and down to a rhythm, any sound of chewing masked by the TV. Bryan watches, transfixed by this everyday activity that could easily end his life very soon. He sees the jaw clench and the Adam's apple bob as the colossus swallows, sending the food on its way. The giant licks his lips to get the hanging cheese. He turns to his equally gigantic friend and asks him a question, his voice booming over tiny Bryan.

Bryan however is in shock. He just watched, in closeup, this young man effortlessly down a huge amount of food and not even think twice about it. A few more bites and Bryan would be eaten, just as dismissively. The young man would devour the shrunken scientist, and would never know the difference from any other bite of food. Bryan shivered. He had been reduced to a mere crumb.
