"No! I'm a genius! I won't be so demeaned!" he shouted angrily. Before he can do or say anything else the slice below him flies forward. His moment of personal strength drains away as he watches the greasy lips ahead of him part.

Strands of saliva stretch from the roof of the mouth to the tongue as it slowly extends. Spread across the back of the tongue are the soggy lumps of crust, and tangled strings of cheese; the few remnants of the massive slices the giant easily devoured. The tiny scientist begins to scream as he sees this terrifying scene get closer. He sees the large, white molars crammed with bits of flattened pizza. In the very back the uvula hangs over the dark entrance to the throat: his final destination.

Bryan gags on the sour wind that gusts out of the cavernous mouth. He finally stops moving and looks up to see he is directly below the titan's protruding nose, out of sight of the eyes. "Help me!" he shouts desperately.

The front teeth sink down just ahead of Bryan, a wall of off-white sinking into the landscape. He feels the slice begin to move back and is overjoyed to have more time to possible escape. However he stops and moving and suddenly he is dangling from a strand of cheese attached to a piece of pepperoni held in place by the giant's lips.

He feels the "landscape" beneath him shift as the giant begins to chew. From this close he can hear the squishing and squelching as the food is effortlessly destroyed just out of sight. Without warning the lips part with a loud smack. Bryan screams as he sees the soggy pile of crushed crust and gooey cheese spread across the mouth. The pepperoni, with him attached, slide forward into the scene of destruction.

Before he knows it he is sealed in darkness and humidity. The giant, unaware of any tiny scientist in his mouth, resumes chewing. Bryan's shouts are drowned out by the squishes and squelches of chewing as he is thrown about randomly narrowly missing molars. He finally is flung to the tongue where he holds on tight. The cavern rumbles loudly and light flashes as the giant seems to speak. While some bits fly out, Bryan isn’t so lucky. The sounds get soggier and he feels the tongue move. There is a slithering sound and then a loud squelch and gulp. The tiny man can't help but feel elated because he wasn’t gulped down.

Bryan doesn’t have a chance to move as the giant deafens him by speaking again, the sound clearer and devastatingly loud without the food to muffle it. As the tiny scientist clutches his ears in pain, the mouth widens and light floods in. It begins to bob up and down as the giant laughs, a stark contrast to the terror and pain Bryan had been feeling since shrinking.

The piles of food on the tongue, lit up in the light, have shifted but are still just soggy piles of crust and strands of cheese. Around tiny Bryan are the bits of grime that had come from the floor, still discernible in the mouth.

As it slows the lips mostly shut, allowing thin light into the cavern. Bryan finally gets his bearings. He is near a set of towering molars, the front of the mouth to his left. He stumbles forward on the soft, slimy tongue which won’t stop moving.

Before he gets far the giant booms something even louder than before knocking Bryan down once more. His ears ringing, he feels the tongue under him shift. He looks outside the mouth, past the jagged teeth, to see the half-finished slice approaching the open mouth. Despair blankets his senses as the pizza enters the mouth and the lips shut, sealing him in darkness once more.

---

Tony watches the show, wishing the girls were a little... sexier. He stops chewing as he feels pressure in his chest. He leans back and burps loudly. Mason returns to the room and laughs. "Nice" he exclaims. Tony bows his head in mock thanks before swallowing. He pops the last of the slice into his mouth and focuses back on the show. He grabs his pop and washes the bite down. He leans back and stretches, getting more comfortable in the recliner. Tony kicks off his large sneakers and they pound to the floor. He stares at the TV, thoroughly enjoying the show.
111112222121.title: Bigger Slice

choices: Clutching the rope-like hairs of Tony's stubble!
Somewhere in the room
1111122221211.content:
Unknown to the young man, a small living speck was stranded on the food-ridden expanse of his tongue. This speck was shrunken Bryan Smith, a scientist who invented the shrinking formula and foolishly decided to test it in an extravagant fashion. Now he found himself precariously trapped in a massive teenager's mouth, a teen that Bryan didn't even know personally, all this combined found the little man at his breaking point.

Having miraculously survived another round of pizza, holding onto the huge, slimy muscle that was Tony's tongue, Bryan desperately searched his mind for any ideas on escaping. A deep booming sound crashed loudly through the enormous cavern, light flooding in as the huge mouth opened briefly. Bryan was able to take further glances around the moist, dripping interior, surrounded by the tall yellowed teeth, and a huge gaping darkness that lead down into the rambunctious teen's stomach. His nose crinkled in disgust from the rancid stench around him, which was only strengthened every time the giant spoke.

Slowly, sopping with the putrid saliva, the tiny man crawled up the expanse of the tongue as if it were some steep hill. This squishy, yet firm landscape kept moving constantly, raising up and down frequently. "Please don't eat anymore pizza..." He begged silently, his eyes tightly shut as he crawled. A sudden reek became apparent, this one much stronger and far more foul than the normal aroma.

A sudden influx of light came as the huge mouth opened, strands of saliva hanging from the giant teeth. Bryan felt a howling breeze as the giant inhaled, and his heart froze as he feared what came next. His little body had no chance in holding against the explosive gale that burst forth from behind.

_________________

Comments and praises burst forth from the two teen aged males as they watched the television. Comments ranging from praises to the death scenes, to snide comments on what the characters wore, they kept a steady banter.

"Did you see that chick? Bitch was missing her fucking jaw!" Tony grinned bemusedly, pointing at the screen. Mason chortled at the remark, and they both clapped as said character was put down violently. "Dude, Pete! Your missing out, this episode is awesome!" Mason leaned his head back and called out, not taking his eyes off the screen. A low, undecipherable response was heard from the nearby hall.

Tony scratched his chin, trying to think of another zinger. His thoughts were interrupted as a familiar rumble was felt traveling up his body to his mouth, and he casually let out an intrusively loud belch. Bits of food, and a minute wriggling pale speck flew out of the teenagers mouth as he expelled the belch. After almost ten seconds, he stopped with an accomplished grin on his face.

"Holy crap, that was epic!" Tony's buddy said, giving him a high five. Tony grunted with satisfaction having always been known for his "awesome" burps.

Unbeknownst to the two young men, the unseen speck landed...
1111122221211.title: Mt. Tony

choices: Close Call
Not Again!
11111222212111.content:
Bryan had been sent flying forward by the thunderous belch. He had not gained much air and collided with the lip as he exited the mouth. He tumbled over himself finally landed sprawled in what at first glance appeared to be ropes.

The massive teenager was leaned back, his chin being a relatively level area for Bryan to land. He sat up and looked around himself. He was surrounded by the forest of brown hairs sprouting out of the skin, undoubtedly short for the giant, they were easily shrub height for the tiny man. Behind him the lip rose in a steep , glinting slope. Ahead the chin dropped away to show the rest of the giant's body stretching away like a landscape, the room like an even larger valley.

He felt the ground, or rather the giant's chin, begin to steepen. Instinctively he latched onto a hair as the giant leaned forward again.

---

Tony, having gotten his praise for his burp, sat back up. Unaware of the life that had been saved he lifted the rest of the slice to his mouth and took a savage bite. He chewed, still occasionally commenting on the show. He didn't notice the spray of saliva and chewed food that shot out of his mouth with each word. Tony easily finished the slice in just two bites and as he swallows, he rests his hand on the final slice.

---

The giant lifts the pizza to his mouth and easily tears through the slice. Moving up and down with the jaw, Bryan can hear the squishes and rips of the pizza being chewed. He is unable to suppress the images he has from having been inside the mouth, reminding him how close he still is to danger.

There is a slithering noise as the chewing stops and a loud gulp sounds as the giant swallows his bite. Without a second's reprieve the jaw drops as the mouth opens wide and the giant literally tosses the final piece between his lips. As he chews Bryan realizes how thoughtless the giant is of this seemingly mundane act, completely unaware of the life, Bryan's life, that is in danger.

Bryan shakes his head. These thoughts aren't helping. Clearly he can't get to his antidote by himself. So he should try to get the massive teenager's attention! He tries yanking on the hair, but at his size Bryan lacks the strength to move it.

Before he can think of another plan a shadow covers him. The giant has lifted the slice above and stuck his long tongue out to catch a long strand of cheese hanging off the tip of another slice of pizza. From his perspective, Bryan can just barely see past the outstretched tongue to see a struggling ant trapped in the cheese. The giant however doesn't notice and lowers the slice onto his retracting tongue, his teeth tearing the bite free. As the sounds of chewing resume Bryan can't help but shudder for the unfortunate ant, now going through what he had just barely escaped. Deep in his recent memory, Bryan doesn't see the string of cheese hanging from the giant's lip.

---

Tony lifts the pizza of the plate. A string of cheese swinging from the tip catches his attention. In response Tony lifts the slice above his mouth, opens it wide, and stretches out his tongue. He fails to notice the struggling ant in his food and lowers the tip of the pizza into his mouth. His jaw shuts around the bite, as the commercials on TV start. Without another thought he begins to chew, utterly unaware of the tiny being trapped in his mouth.

He feels a string of cheese hanging from his lips as he finishes chewing. Just before swallowing Tony laps up the loose cheese and then gulps down the bite in his mouth.
11111222212111.title: A Moment's Reprieve

choices: Tony just ignores it
Tony heads for the bathroom
111112222121111.content:
A squelch sounds behind him and Bryan looks back to see the massive tongue coming straight for him, bits of chewed food and a string of cheese clinging to it's slimy surface.

"Augh!" he shouts out, letting go of the hair he clung to only to get caught up in others just like it. He watches the tongue retreat, like a monster returning to its cavern, its prize of the string of cheese successfully captured.

Realizing that every second he waits is one more to remain at this size, one more second where some random accident could spell his doom, Bryan begins to climb sideways. The giant's unkempt stubble stretches along the jaw up towards hair, and more importantly the giant's ears.

---

Tony continues to eat, finishing off the slice as the credits roll for the show and a preview for next week's episode plays. An itch starts in the stubble of his jaw and he idly scratches it. Mason starts flipping channels after the preview ends and Tony merely grunts in response to any channel he pauses on.

---

Bryan's progress is slow. He is no climber, or athlete and his strength is quickly being spent. It is not made any easier by the jaw moving up and down as the giant eats, while Bryan does his best to ignore the terrible noises. Before long he is panting, running purely on adrenaline.

Although afraid if he stops, he will not continue, Bryan simply needs a break. He stops for a second, hanging from a hair. Feeling his arms willing him to let go he forces himself to move once more, now significantly closer to the giant's thicker hairline.

Mere moments after continuing to move, a gigantic finger collides with the area he just was. Bryan tries to move away from it faster as the short, grimy fingernail digs into the skin. Flakes rain away, a terrible scratching noise sounding around him. Bryan continues to move, realizing had he remained there he could have been crushed or knocked free. He suppresses a shudder and continues to move sideways and up.

---

Mason doesn't manage to find anything very interesting and finally settles on a rerun of and old sitcom. Tony however can't focus on the show because of his beard. Well... his stubble of a beard. Though no longer itchy it still seems to be... tingling. He begins to debate shaving it off.
111112222121111.title: Scaling Tony's Jaw

choices: Bryan falls into Tony's pocket
Bryan clutches a massive finger
1111122221211111.content:
Clutching on each thick hair proved difficult for tiny Bryan. After a hard day's work Tony had sweat much and his face remained slightly greasy because of it. This grease covered the large stubble making it slippery, not to mention gross. A shaking glance towards his destination showed he had made small progress over the behemoths jaw.

He muddled on, each desperate grab quick and clumsy. Bryan tried to keep his timid mind focused, not wanting to look up at the teen's massive sized face, and especially not wanting to look down. It was like climbing the side of Mount Everest, but Everest didn't move, breath, and speak. Every time the behemoth shifted, or spoke, it caused catastrophic results to the tiny climber.

Unknown to Bryan, every time he moved, clutching a new hair, he caused the massive Tony slight annoyance. Even something as minuscule as the tiny man proved to be a nuisance to the huge young man.

-----------

The intro to a good action movie began, flashes of fire and brutal action brightening the dim living room. Tony grunted in approval, able to ignore the light tingle on his jaw better when entertained. It was one of his top favourite films, so he had little trouble paying attention.

"Dude, this movie sucks!" Mason complained after a good ten minutes. He grabbed the remote, ignoring the furious glare from his buddy. Mason always preferred comedies, something that could make him laugh. He also knew Tony loved this movie, so it amused him to change it.

With a click, the channel changed to a sitcom re-run. "What the hell, man?" Tony leaned over and attempted a swipe of the remote, failing. He was an easy going guy, but childish behaviour from his younger roommates peeved him. "This damn itch on my chin..." Tony thought as the sensation seemed to intensify.

Giving in, Tony roughly scratched it. To his satisfaction the sensation dissipated quickly. Grumbling, he decided to just watch the sitcom, made more bearable with the annoying tingling gone. Tony never noticed the tiny speck that had been dislocated by his large fingers.

Leaning back, he rested his muscled arms behind his head and concentrated on the flickering television.
1111122221211111.title: All better

choices: Work, at the bike shop
The skate park, deciding to skip work
11111222212111111.content:
It was a gut wrenching fall. Bryan's luck turned sour when the giant teenager spoke, his huge booming voice indiscernible at such a close range. Then the building-sized fingers returned, destructively scratching the entirety of the chin. It was like the fingers of God.

Once again, Bryan survived. At this point it seemed as if fate was only keeping him alive to bring along more terrifying scenarios for him. His head span, and his empty stomach lurched as he lay, sprawled out on a strange landscape of rough dark brown fabric. Ignoring more thunderous booming, Bryan concerned himself with the sudden movement of his new placement. The land shuddered violently. Looking up, the minute scientist was given a frightening view of the ever familiar titan, his huge torso towering up above, impressive physique visible through the dark shirt.

Bryan gawked still when the ground began moving again, the huge giant above raising his powerful arms in a breath-taking display as he casually crossed them behind his head. The tiny man wasn't prepared for the sudden slanting of the fabric land, and he tumbled roughly backwards rolling like a watermelon down the steep incline. The world darkened around him as tumbled deep into the gargantuan cavern.

His consciousness came to a sudden halt when he collided with the lid of a massive cigarette box. His little form lay at the base of a 15-foot tall letter "M".

------------

Meanwhile, Tony fell asleep in the comfortably worn chair. He awoke the next morning, the television blaring loudly.

His wrist watch read, 11:53 am, the morning was nearly over. Mason was gone, the remote visibly abandoned on the air of the couch. Tony clicked it off. "He left the TV on, the fucking douche..." Tony mumbled sleepily as he rose from the chair and proceeded to his room. He needed to get ready for work. The owner of the bike shop was a cool guy, and often allowed his employees to be late.

Tony groggily slid a new t-shirt on. He slid his pack of Marlboro cigarettes out of his pocket, and pulled on a pair of black and grey camo shorts. A small speck fell into the pack, landing a top a cigarette as he did this. Dropping the pack into his pocket, he lumbered back to the living room, his socked feet thudding heavily. Sitting in front of the chair he slept in were his Circa skate shoes, worn from use.

They had sat there for many hours while he slept, and unknown to Tony, a few foolhardy ants had scaled the huge sneakers in an attempt to find a way to kill the destructive objects that were like mountains to them. The ants had no way of escape as Tony stomped up to the shoes and slid his gigantic socked feet into the footwear.

Picking up his backpack, Tony left the apartment, his two roommates still slumbering, and oblivious to the tiny passenger in his pocket and the insignificant bugs crushed in his huge sneaker.

Mounting his impressive BMX bike, he rode to...
11111222212111111.title: An unconscious journey

choices: He notices a tiny bug on the cigarette
He lights up
111112222121111112.content:
Tony sped quickly, his powerful legs pumping the wheels easily. He had spent a lot of time and hard earned cash on his sport bike, all the bells and whistles that only an avid BMX biker could apply. He spent many of his free hours biking with his buddies at the local park, which offered a large area for both BMX bikes and skateboards.

The careless guy had decided already that he would just skip work. His boss didn't care and usually closed the shop to go biking himself. Plus, Tony's buddies texted him about a new half pipe just installed at the park. No way he would miss out.

It took only 15 minutes to ride to the park, which was on the edge of the sprawling city park. The huge cement area was populated by many like himself. College age guys, grade school kids, and many other guys were visible. Tony shouted a greeting to a few of the bikers and skaters, as he approached the new half-pipe.

Dismounting, Tony nodded casually as his buddy Scott walked to meet him.

"Yo, dude, didn't think to see you today!" Scott greeted. He was older than Tony by a few years, and had shaggy ear-length hair covered by a beanie.

"Skipped work. I was late already, so fuck it." He replied casually, reaching into his pocket for a smoke. All around skaters and bikers did impressive tricks, while others chatted.

Tony popped the lid off of the half-empty box, and reached for a cigarette...
111112222121111112.title: Tony's Day Off

choices: Bryan is right next to the cigarette!
Bryan landed near the front tire of Tony's bike
1111122221211111121.content:
Discussing the possibilities of the new ramp, Tony raised the cigarette to his lips.

"Bro, you got a tiny passenger on your cig" Scott joked as his buddy fished in his other pocket for a lighter. Tony stopped, his brow raised as he inspected the cigarette.

It seemed to be wiggling around, as it clutched the end of the huge cigarette. With a powerful blow, the unknowingly cruel guy sent the pesky bug flying, disregarding the slight noises it made in protest.

"Little shits are all over my apartment." He remarked, not paying attention where the annoying ant landed. Why should he care about something so tiny and pathetic? "Roommates are fucking slobs." He failed to mention that he was just as careless as they were.

Scott remarked with a funny comment, before returning the topic to the new ramp. He dropped his own already spent cigarette to the ground, and raised his large skate shoe to grind it out.

Oblivious to the plight of an ant-sized scientist at their feet, Bryan Smith found himself...
1111122221211111121.title: Out of the pan...

choices: Drenched in a flood of saliva!
Safe for now!
11111222212111111211.content:
Bryan whipped through the air, screaming as he plummeted an immeasurable distance to the ground below.

Among emotions of overwhelming terror was a tweaking, nagging realization: close as Bryan had been, he was still mistaken for a bug!

His tiny body flipped around, limbs twirling and his face peeled back against his skull. Bryan just continued his screams. There was nothing he could do but scream - falling for what felt like hours through vast empty space.

Then he met the ground with a swift thwack! He lay there, groaning and sobbing. Most of all, Bryan rued the day he decided to concoct his formula for shrinking. Righting himself with a grimace, he suddenly yelped.

"Fucking... My arm! Mother of God, I think it's broken!" The offending limb was bent unnaturally, pulled farther back at the shoulder than comfortable. Bryan prodded it with his other. "Oh dear God... I need help..." Bryan's shoulder crunched, slipping back into socket like a door latch clicking into place. He squealed, throwing his head up in agony before suddenly falling silent.

Tones of deep thunder cracked from above, as if God himself responded to the tiny man's plea. Fear flowed through Bryan's thin body, sending away all thoughts of mental and physical pain from his mind. Completely detached from Bryan and his suffering, loomed the behemoth that brought him here, emitting booming notes of speech in-between vast intakes of smoke.

So far, Bryan had yet to even learn the name of this young guy - and despite a lack of introduction, this giant had put Bryan Smith through more torment and suffering than he had ever before experienced. All without ever knowing that Bryan even existed.

Now, Bryan was back to the ground, hopelessly craning his neck in order to even glimpse the titanic BMX riders face. The giant face that Bryan had been close enough to feel (and smell) the titan's breath. Shifting his eyes, Bryan relaxed his neck and looked upon the enormous black sneakers planted in the distance like dark monuments. Dirt coated the black rubber sole, stained a light green in some places. One shifted slightly; a mere trifle to the mountainous owner, but causing a heavy grind of gravel and sending strong vibrations through the hard ground.

As he figured, Bryan had two options; run for it, hopefully finding someplace safe to hide, or try for the umpteenth time to be recognized.

Still considering, the tiny man had no chance to prepare for what plummeted from above. It landed with a tremendous crash, rolling heavily, spraying hot embers and smouldering ashes. It rolled like a tipped grain silo for many feet before slowing to a halt. Bryan yelled, coughing and brushing hot ashes from his limbs.

"What the hell!" He looked at it stupidly, as if he were staring at an object from outer space.

Smoke plumed out as fuming hot embers greedily ate it away, spewing more fumes and causing Bryan to gag. He teared up. Bryan angrily racked them away, blinking dumbly when he noticed an enormous shadow overtake the scene. Realization clicked, his body whipped around to face the oncoming doom.

The shoe belonging to the other giant lifted into the air. The sole slowly loomed into position overhead, completely eclipsing the sky.

Bryan could only gape, taking in every detail of the approaching plane of ridged rubber. Various chunks of gravel were caught in the tread at random, pressed between thick canyons of tread. Grimy deposits of mud were jammed along with mangled stalks of grass and bits of white-ish garbage. Barely recognizable carcasses belonging to both ants and larger insects were spread through the deep ridges, carelessly obliterated by the gigantic owner as he stomped around the park.

"NOOO!" Bryan shrieked in a voice devoid of hope. He stumbled backwards, no longer cognant enough to realize any attempt would be futile against the gigantic sole.

He continued to stare at the immense tread of filthy rubber. In the arch section, clearly standing out in scuffed red rubber, a gigantic letter "E" denoted the shoe brand, half-covered by a mass of unidentifiable black gunk.

Without warning, Bryan's step met thin air and he fell backwards just as the city-sized sole fell upon the earth with cataclysmic result.

---

"-...me and Hunter were skating it earlier. He got some serious air," Scott grinned at his buddy, gesturing the "serious air" with his hands as he twisted out the spent cigarette."Fucking legit! Even launched an awesome boneless and aced it!"

Dragging his shoe back to ensure complete cigarette destruction, Scott continued. "Hunter flipped it and landed on his ass earlier. Almost busted his deck!"

A few skaters zipped by on their way to the new ramp. Tony exhaled smoke through his nostrils, watching them whip over the jump with varying tricks. One landed roughly, falling to the ground but recovering quickly.

"Dude, that looks freaking awesome!" Tony reached down and adjusted his knee guards, pulled his socks up and looked back to Scott. He took another drag of his smoke and flicked it to the cement impatiently. His step missed it slightly, crushing the stub only halfway. Tony paid no attention as he hopped back onto his bike and prepared to take the new ramp on.

"Gonna try a new spin on it, check this shit out!"

He sped off, pumping furiously to gain proper speed. Scott shot him a thumbs up, his foot still over the demolished cigarette stub. He stepped off, attention completely on his buddy, but leaned over momentarily to hock a slimy wad of saliva onto the ground. Scott never cared where it landed, instead planting a foot on his board and pushing off.

Never thinking again about his dispensed cigarette that he inadvertently drenched with his foul saliva.

---

Meanwhile, Bryan found himself lying in a crack in the cement...
11111222212111111211.title: Back to the ground

choices: Gigantic dangers at the skatepark
Find someplace safe!
111112222121111112111.content:
Bryan stumbled back and fell. His body jolted hard, landing on his back to give him a near perfect view of the enormous stranger's sole.

"No!" Was all he could muster to scream.

The plea was lost upon the filthy skate tread. Each note of the shrill cry absorbed by the merciless rubber wall as it fell to make contact with the ground once more.

BOOOOM.

His minute body jolted hard from the impact, an intense wave of force smacking upon him. Bryan's teeth cracked together painfully, his head bumped hard, and his very bones rattled - yet, miraculously, he was alive! Darkness enveloped him, and in the next moment he was able to detect the distinct scent of rubber before pandemonium began.

The oblivious skater proceeded to eliminate the cigarette, simply twisting and grinding his shoe against the abrasive cement.

For Bryan, this was a completely different matter; the ground began vibrating with more intensity than an earthquake. The massive plane of aggressive rubber shifting above him, each groove of rubber deep and wide enough to easily fit the bug-sized man, but fully capable of squishing his life out. Dirt crumbled upon him, along with other things he could not identify in the darkness. Something long, thick, and segmented landed next to his face, smelling of citrus house cleaner.

Just as he feared dirt, pebbles, or tobacco shreds would suffocate him, Bryan heard dull shifting from above. The huge sneaker ceased grinding, emitting a distinct groan of deep pressure before suddenly lifting off the ground.

Light immediately flooded in. Bryan trembled, watching the terrifying underside raise into the sky. He kept his stare fixated upon the spot where he should have been obliterated; a location near the base of the huge "E" logo. As the giant moved his foot out of view, pieces of shredded cigarette lightly rained upon the ground with bits of ash and paper.

For the first time, Bryan was able to see his would-be murderer. Standing almost directly over the tiny crack, the gigantic young man shifted, swing his leg around to set his foot down with a distant crash. His head seemed to be watching something only he could see. Dark tangles of blond hair poked from a worn beanie the colour of his dark shirt.

Bryan wanted to scream; he wanted to be rescued more than anything. But, he could not get himself to move - only stare timidly at the great colossus above his humble position.

The giant animated once more. Bryan could hear the shifting of his clothes: the baggy denim adjusting as the giant moved, craning his tremendous body and pursing his large lips.

"Oh God, what is he doing?"

A distinct sound of swishing liquid reached the tiny man's ears. Then, the uncaring giant released a large devastation of saliva in the form of a glob, directing it over Bryan's location.

"Wait...! No!"

It collided with a loud crash. Bryan was instantly pulled into a torrential flood of thick, gooey spit. It spread over the cement, filling the small crack as it mixed with dirt and shredded cigarette.

Bryan tumbled through the depths, vainly beating his limbs to reach the surface. He inadvertently swallowed some of the foul liquid, causing his tiny body to heave and jolt in disgust. Breaking the surface, he gagged out mouthfuls and gasped for air violently. He screamed, padding to keep afloat. "Thisss.... isn't faaair!"

Ahead of him burst a dark shape, squirming like he was. It bobbed in the frothy, yellowish liquid. Bryan passed it, recognizing it as an ant caught in the revolting flood. It fell still, weakened and consumed. Bryan didn't notice as he reached dry cement and tossed himself onto it like a climber reaching the summit. He immediately began racking his body: peeling off tendrils of warm, sticky spit. It smelled of smoke, energy drink, and Mexican food.

Laying there, Bryan was nothing short of incredulous.

"Fuck me..." He muttered. "Just... Fuck me and my damn formula!"

The unknown giant was nowhere to be seen - thankfully. Bryan sat up and gazed at his surroundings. He was on an endless expanse of rough concrete. Large chunks of gravel and bits of small trash littered it for miles. All inconsequential to the regular eye, but nothing short of overwhelming for the shrunken scientist. Most of all, Bryan shivered. In every direction, he could see many gargantuan shapes looming. Some on skateboards, others on bikes or rollerblades, and more walking or standing.

How could this be worse? Thrown off a freaking cigarette, then almost stomped like one. Just to add insult to injury, he was then doused in some huge punk's spit! "....and I'm stranded here now!"

He cupped his face, fending off tears. If he wanted to survive, he needed to do something!
111112222121111112111.title: Devastation of saliva

choices: Bryan climbs out of the gap
Bryan follows the crack
111112222121111112112.content:
Among many cracks that webbed across the old cement, none of them stood out to the many park goers that walked, skated, and biked over them. Bryan Smith had been the same way until he found himself small enough to fall into these breaks in the cement like somebody falling into a ravine.

Lying in a painful heap, Bryan moaned painfully. Stars danced merrily with the spots, blotting out his vision while antagonizing his throbbing cranium. "Ohh... My head..." High above, he was able to see the oblivious youth that nearly erased him from existence. The gigantic skater stomped back onto his board and blasted off without ever looking towards the ground.

The pain subsided quickly, despite the tiny man's heart-stopping encounter. He stood and surveyed his surroundings. The gorge was a bit over seven feet deep and ran seemingly forever in either direction. Sniffing, Bryan twisted his nose in disgust, realizing that one way was completely saturated in a monsoon of frothing liquid.

"Is that...?" He questioned, surveying the mass flood of vile goop. "Gross!"

Without thinking, he turned and padded the opposite direction to escape the horrendous smell. It permeated the air with scents of tobacco and Mexican food. Bryan barely kept himself from retching until he saw a twitching shape of a drowned ant submerged in the thick spit which sent him into a fit of heaving.

How did he get himself into this mess? It seemed almost a blurred memory. Nestled in his package, retrieved by Tommy, and then disaster when his safe world had been torn asunder by a blundering giant! Why... Or, more importantly, how did this even happen? It seemed a series of events possible only in movies.

"I need to find help..." The words sounded well-worn - used over and over to little effect.

Looking up, Bryan decided to gather his bearings and find exactly where he had been deposited. The ravine was filled with dirt and grime, built up at random, which he found the highest point to climb from. Pulling himself so his head poked up, he immediately shrieked. He was face to face with a slimy, clacking set of mandibles large big enough to smash a park bench. Bryan fell backwards, landing hard on the dirt in the gaping crack, and looking terrified at the huge bug that peered with shining black eyes.

"Get away from me! Leave me alone!" He yelled with flicking hand motions, hoping to deter the large ant.

It merely clicked at him in response, rotating a oblong head curiously. The powerful mandibles clashed together, causing Bryan to yelp and scramble backwards as the ant leaned over the ledge with flailing antennae.

Between his already traumatized body and mind, Bryan felt nothing short of incredulous that his end might be at the jaws of this greasy bug. Determined to survive, he began padding the rough, gritty ground for any means of defense when he felt the disturbance.

The ground began vibrating; slowly at first, and not more than the usual disturbances he had been feeling, but now rapidly increasing. A cacophony of loud grinding; the thundering of what sounded like a massive industrial machine grinding a mountain into granules. Then, before either Bryan or the ant could properly react, the glaring sunlight cut out. As if for his tormented benefit alone, time seemed to slow to a sluggish space.

From behind the ant, loomed an enormous mass of stained, gouged, and worn white plastic that rolled with thunderous power. It took but a bare second for the huge mass to roar over the slight crack in pavement. Bryan was thrown back by the tremendous shock, bumping hard against the jagged wall, failing to see or hear the reaction of the now terrified ant. He recovered quickly. The ground continued vibrating and looking up, Bryan saw a moving ceiling of random colour and gigantic images flowing past. He felt his stomach drop when the explanation suddenly struck him, but his mouth opened into another scream when a second force of giant white plastic rolled overhead.

Bryan curled into a ball, hoping his thin arms would guard him against the danger. The intense noise and activity quickly subsided and he dared to peer from under his limbs after a few moments.

"Eeek!" Looking right at him, not more than a few feet away, was the beastly ant. It twitched with a slimy grunt and fell still; suspended from the same ledge in gruesome death.

The sight was enough to make his empty stomach churn. Pushing against the grimy ground, Bryan distanced himself, unable to take his eyes off the horrific display. The ant remained only partially intact - the front half; three legs, one antenna, and a body of bloated guts seeping from a popped eye and breaks in the hard armour.

His mind focused more on the cause of such a gruesome, but well-timed atrocity. "It was...a-a-a... fucking wheel!" He burst, almost unable to believe it despite his past experiences. "A giant, building-sized wheel! Shit...!" Bryan could hear - and feel - similar disturbances constantly roaring in the distance. He realized with a shudder that he had just encountered a common skateboard.

"It was huge!" It was an obvious statement, but one he couldn't help but speak. After all, you don't see a skateboard from that perspective everyday, do you? He remembered the glimpse of the gigantic wheels: big as a freaking commercial building, and with enough power to decimate a mountain range!

He shuddered, jumping girlishly when another went crashing over the crack much further down. For just a moment, he could see the looming shape of the rider - gargantuan and ominous as a god of myth.

Glancing back at the mutilated ant, Bryan blinked and pushed it from his mind. He had far more important things to worry about than stupid ants. If he didn't want to end up like one, he needed to formulate some semblance of a plan!

Should he climb out of the gap or travel it further?
111112222121111112112.title: Gigantic wheels

choices: The sidewalk
The grass
1111122221211111121121.content:
More than anything Bryan just wanted to be done with this nightmare. Wake up and be at home in his bed, normal-sized. He couldn't believe that his dream of shrinking himself had turned into such a cataclysmic disaster.

He just needed to be rescued - seen for what, and who he is. Shuddering but ready, he decided upon his course of action. Go and get noticed; not matter the cost! Hiding like some pathetic insect in the cracked cement was sure as hell not helping!

Walling his fears and past failures behind a mental levee, Bryan scrambled up dirt slope collected against one side of the canyon and climbed up.

His senses were immediately assaulted by the world above. The skate park - a small section of the city park with cement slopes, metal rails, and open spans of cement - was never a destination for the pale, awkward scientist. He gasped at the world around him. It was apparently moderate day for the park, which only catered to not even two dozen skaters, bikers, or rollerbladers. Bryan could see them, towering dark shapes - slow moving in their immensity, and all around him. He saw giants of all ages: young kids, teenagers, twenty-somethings, and older. One pair of young BMXers paused, chatting far off as they obliviously towered above the world. Another behemoth with short dark hair and stubble, pushed a small child on his board, eagerly nodding as he lumbered alongside, keeping the child balanced. Many more strange giants were indiscernible as they thundered around the park.

Bryan's resolve began to waver. "Oh! What the hell do I do now?" It was too overwhelming. "Where do I go... Who do I..."

Stuck in his thoughts, he blindly ran forward without any idea or direction. In his near hysteria, he failed to notice one tall skater that thundered towards him.

"Eeek!"

Bryan flung himself, just barely avoiding one wall of gouged, dirt-stricken plastic that flew past him, crushing everything caught underneath. Laying on his back, Bryan stared upwards at a moving ceiling of tall graphic letters all but scratched from existence by heavy use. He locked eyes with a mostly intact sticker, bigger than a cul-de-sac, that featured a sneering cartoon flame. The second wheel blasted past, eliciting a terrified shriek from the bug-sized man as it flung boulders and dirt in its wake.

Then, as quickly as it came, the massive structure ended and sunlight basked over the pale speck trembling on the ground. Bryan rolled over, watching the gigantic skateboarder rumble away. He was both awe-struck and incredulous. This unfathomable giant was nothing but some teenaged kid, at least 16 years old, who was innocently riding across the park.

Realizing his rather foolish decision to venture out, Bryan decided to find cover to avoid the same fate bestowed upon that unlucky ant.

The world kept moving as the minuscule man had his epiphany, and the ever-trembling ground began to vibrate more violently as a massive shadow fell over the cement landscape. Bryan turned from the now-distant skater and faced a new threat with a scream that seemed to instantly evaporate in the deafening commotion. Standing atop a much-too-large board that loomed like a plateau, stood a tremendous three-year old that looked more like the colossus of Rhodes turned infant. The huge skateboard and child roared forwards, propelled by a towering man who sported an expression of warm admiration as he balanced the toddler with huge hands.

"Help! HEEEEELP!" Bryan screamed. The monster child chortled, loud but barely audible over the deafening grind of wheel against cement. "WAAAIT! STOP, NO, STOPP!"

Starting another round of screams, Bryan tried to escape the path of the massive board. Unable to realize such a tiny existence, or care about anything in his path, the gigantic father directed the board elsewhere, his unfathomably huge feet slamming against the gritty cement as his did. The tiny man attempted to flee, but found himself thrown to the ground by such intense seismic disturbance. A heavy crash jolted the earth, caused by the giant man's tattered skate shoe landing in the distance, but Bryan barely noticed as he looked up to see the other sneaker lifting overhead.

Bryan overcame his hoarseness and screamed at the merciless sole encompassing his entire sky. The perforated tread had once been tan, but now looked discoloured throughout with dark smudges and trapped dirt. Each round lug looked big enough to fit his living room; and, packed with all manners of crud. Dirt and pebbles of all sizes were crammed into the holes and lines at random, with bits of gooey organic splotches smashed against the rubber throughout. Among these disgusting collections, near the heel that was almost worn flat, the identifiable remains of a small creature smashed partially into the dirty tread with a few legs crusted around it.

His eyes settled in the region he was destined for, near a huge logo surrounded by blue rubber. And, as it crashed downwards with a great rumbling of air, Bryan merely screamed.

"NO!!!"

It was as if the sky fell upon him. The impact was beyond description: landing with such tremendous force that Bryan blacked out momentarily. His head spun, ringing painfully, his whole body throbbing. Bryan's entire form was compacted painfully into a narrow and sticky crevice; and, as he gasped, it tasted both sweet and earthy like gum dropped in the dirt.

Suddenly, he felt a huge release in weight and dull creaks as the oblivious titan shifted his massive foot above. Then the ground slid beneath him and he felt himself rising up.

"Oh, God! Help, me - please, not like this! Help me!" He barely wheezed the words out when a grotesque shape dangled free before him, smelling of foul house cleaner. He jolted, attempting to pull back as he struggled, when with a grinding shift, he suddenly fell almost a dozen feet with a cascade of sticky dirt and pebbles.

Landing flat, the tiny man recovered and watched the massive sole briefly lifting away before it crashed down with a powerful quake. The sneakers heel now faced him, a white sock dusted with dirt stretching up a muscled leg fraught with dark hair. The word, "LAKAI", is stitched in frayed off-white letters and barely recognizably printed on the rubber heel. Bryan looked upwards, hearing another giggle from the excited child and a deep thunder of encouragement from the oblivious father who only had eyes for his son.

The huge man stomped away, easily pushing both the kid and board, his massive sneakers lifting and crashing powerfully against the ground with dull booms. Bryan just watched, completely beside himself as he saw what would otherwise be an endearing experience between father and son from the horrifying perspective of a bug.

"Jesus Christ! I almost ended up crushed like a bug," Bryan had already began running in the least populated direction as he spoke. "This is suicide, I just need to get the fuck out of here!"

Praying to whomever may listen, Bryan ran for...
1111122221211111121121.title: Out of the gap...

1111122221211111122.content:
Scott followed Tony's example and pulled his own pack of cigarettes out of his pant pocket.

"...oh, dude, it was fucking sweet. You should'da seen it!" He recounted his story to Tony while striking a flimsy cardboard match to light his smoke. Scott absently rested a foot upon his skateboard, rolling it back and forth slightly.

Standing next to his bike, Tony leaned against it and rotated the unlit cigarette in his mouth. He resisted the urge to chew the filter as he fished around his pocket for his lighter. A gift to him by an ex from a couple years before. Despite his young age, Tony made use of the lighter most every day--just about the only good thing to come from that relationship.

All the while, unknown to both Tony and his buddy, resumed a remarkable struggle for dear life upon Tony's cigarette.

---

Twisting and rocking, Bryan held on to the gigantic cigarette suspended thousands of feet in the air. His hands became slick with sweat, sliding and slipping over the sheer surface.

"H-... How can this be happening! ...guugh!" Bryan squeaked when the huge surface rocked again causing him to slip. He managed to regain his grip, albeit tenuously.

Looking up presented the terrified scientist with a view of his oblivious host. The giant looked otherworldly; huge lips supporting the skyscraper sized cigarette with idle ease. The whole scenario seemed unbelievable to tiny Bryan, like something he would gloss over from a trash magazine. Yet here he was, cradling himself desperately against the end of a gargantuan cigarette.

Taking advantage of another reprieve in movement, Bryan lifted a thin arm and waved it at the planet-sized face directly before him.

"Ackk... Uhhm...H-..Help! He-..HELP!" He yelled.

Another blast of air greeted him sent from the enormous nostrils that flared above like a living cavern. The huge cigarette rocked beneath him again, sending another wave of vertigo through his petrified body. His hands began to slip again, sopping with nervous sweat. Bryan cried out again. "God, this isn't fair! Help me, please!" He knew that falling to his death would be the least of his worries.

Ignoring the vile smell of tobacco and the gales of stale breath, Bryan shouted up at the mammoth face again. His voice cracked, but let out strong. "I'M RIGHT HERE!" He craned his head. "RIGHT. HERE! JUST LOOK DOWN, PLEASE!"

He whimpered, dejected. "God... Please, look down..."

As if the clouds parted and the sun returned, the huge eyes looked downwards. The sensation of being looked upon by such a titanic being was both terrifying and thrilling.

Hope bubbled in his frail heart. It filled him, looking into those huge eyes like one looks upon a lake from a plane. Bryan felt sure that he had been seen! Without warning, a building sized finger and thumb crash landed before him. The entire cigarette shuddered. Then he heard the disturbance below. It only sounded after the distinct feeling of something humongous moving beneath him, hovering.

*CLICK!*

"Oh, Fucking shit!" Came the words from the tiny man.

*CLICK* *CLICK!*

Then hell broke loose. With a hefty blast the lighter beneath him burst into flames, quickly igniting the flammable paper stick. Quick and swiftly, the towering flames appeared around him. They greedily ate the paper and tobacco, burning in a circle that seeming surrounded the bug-sized genius. He screamed, unable to think of anything else to do and far to incredulous at his circumstance to flee.

The paper guttered and crackled beneath his hands and the air became thicker than stew with smoky fumes. Bryan felt his hair crinkling away and his skin bubble like plastic when thrown into a bonfire. He lifted his hand, only to find the skin seemingly melt away before his eyes.

"NOOO!!!" The wail escaped him and without hesitation, he attempted to fling his smouldering form into free fall.

---

Tony lit his smoke, pinching the cigarette between his index and thumb he took a hefty drag.

His ears pricked slightly when an odd screech; high pitched and dreadful, it seemed to come from his smoke. The BMX biker pulled it from his lips and stared. For a few moment he studied it before tapping away accumulated ash dismissively. Scott burned his own cigarette, blowing puffs of smoke at a fluttering bug, and spewing details of more "awesome" and "rad" tricks he recently did.

"Dude, this chain is bomb, look at this," He nudged the off-colour chain with the toe of his shoe while Scott looked on. "No skids or fuck ups. It's smooth as ice going over anything." He patted the tense springs under the seat. Tony told his own story, full of technical details only a guy like him could care about.

Fortunately, Scott was just as interested, and the two continued enthusiastically.

Skaters and bikers sped past the two, zipping over ramps and inclines with both impressive and comical displays. Scott pointed at one who whisked over the new half-pipe with practiced grace. Scott took one last drag, allowing the cigarette to nearly burn his calloused fingers. "Mother fuck..." He let the cigarette drop to the ground with a half-hearted curse. The smoldering stub bounced near the wheel of his board, which he rolled back with one foot and ground the spent cigarette with the other.

Tony followed suit shortly after. He released the last round of smoke through his nostrils, gazing at another skateboarder who glided over the new half-pipe. "Looks freaking sweet! Gonna show these fuckers how it's done!" His thoughts rested solely on the task at hand: riding the new half-pipe. He could of cared less had he known about the minuscule sized life-form he unknowingly incinerated.

He flicked the smoking stub to the ground. It landed much in the same fashion as Scott's, bouncing a foot before stopping within reach of his foot. He lifted a worn sneaker over it, and promptly obliterated it.

The glowing cinders proved nothing against the aggressive sneaker tread which easily ground it into the cement, bits of ash and grit wedging into the tread. Tony hopped onto his bike and sped around the park. Gaining enough speed, he turned towards the half-pipe with an excited grin.
1111122221211111122.title: A Blaze of Glory

choices: He falls to the floor of the hallway
He manages to regain his grip
1111122221211112.content:
Tiny Bryan continued his perilous climb on Tony's huge jaw. He tried to calm himself, lest he begin to shake and his hands become sweaty. The thought of another errant finger terrified him further as he progressed.

"DUDE FOR FUCKSAKES, THIS SHOW IS BORING!" The huge booming voice thundered. Bryan's ears throbbed in pain from the deep voice, and to make matters worse, the giant's jaw violently shifted when he spoke. The tiny man held on desperately, determined to survive and return to normal.

A heavy gale of wind kept blasting him at intervals. Bryan identified the source as two massive cavernous nostrils high above, the interiors coated in darkness. The bill of a mammoth baseball cap loomed higher above, looking like a mega-sized stadium canopy. It was almost inconceivable that this living mountain was just a normal laid-back guy.

Despite discomforting movements, and running on waning adrenaline, Bryan began to feel he was making good progress to the safety of the forest-like hair.

-------------

"Dude, for fucksakes, this show is boring!" Tony complained loudly. His tingling stubble was making him more impatient than usual, and he had little care for the soapy old sitcom Mason chose. "Change it!"

"I went through all the damn channels! Nothing else is on." Was the indignant reply, much to Tony's annoyance. The BMX-biker frowned and considered snatching the remote from his buddy's hand in order to find something, but his ever tingling stubble stopped him. He usually shaved every other morning, only leaving a slight soul patch on his chin. The past two days he hadn't bothered to buzz the facial hair off, since he had been clocking some extra hours at work.

Grunting disapprovingly, Tony decided to shave the pesky stubble off. Planting his sneakered feet on the carpet, he exited the room. He was unaware of the tiny insect occupants of the apartment that watched his large sneakers stomp thunderously across the room, sending powerful vibrations through the floor. The teen was also oblivious to the minute passenger on the side of his jaw holding on for dear life.

------------

"Help me!" The tiny scientist cried out in terror as the huge teenager stood up, causing violent movements and powerful gusts for the tiny man.

A distant boom was audible as the gigantic guy walked with powerful steps. Bryan was hopelessly whipped about, his tiny hands clutching the rope-like stubble vainly. He dared a fevered glance downwards, which gave him a terrifying view of the massive sneakers thunderously stomping far below like some kind of giant doomsday robot.

Without warning, the massive fingers soared back into view. The huge digits crashed down, almost right on top of the bug-sized man, and began roughly scratching again with disastrous results. His tiny screams prove ineffective in gaining any attention from the gargantuan Tony.

As the building-sized fingers lift away, the violent motion of Tony's heavy gait shaking his tiny form, Bryan feels his hands slipping.
1111122221211112.title: A rough ride

choices: Tony suddenly emerges!
An opportunity presents itself!
11111222212111121.content:
The tiny man emitted a pitiful shriek as his hands slid down the greasy rope of hair. He grasped for salvation from the many other hairs jutting around him. Another distant crash proceeded a violent shudder through the oblivious behemoth's body. His throbbing hand slid once more and fell free from the thick stubble, causing him to dangle dangerously.

"Eeeyyaaauuugghhhhh!" Bryan screamed as the filthy hallway floor came into view thousands of feet below. Clutching for dear life, he watched Tony's worn black skate shoe lift for another step. It slammed upon the dingy floor with a quaking thud, the thick laces settling heavily from the motion.

Bryan could only scream as his precarious position shook from the tremendous motion. Both the intense G-forces of the gigantic BMX bikers movement, and his own weakness coupled against him in an almost deliberate way. A loud guttural boom blasted from behind the mountainous lips high above. Bryan grasped at the hair once more, gaping upwards as he did, and unaware of the looming menace approaching from behind.

Tony's mammoth fingers collided with the sheer surface of the chin like buildings flung at high velocity. The index finger looked more like a cliff-side coated in thick indentations crusted with dirt and grease. It pounded against the surface, heading straight for Bryan as it did.

"Waaait! Nooo - You'll kill meee!" He pealed. "Fuuuuuuuuuuuuuuck!"

He was thrown like nothing more than a speck-sized bit of dirt. Flung into the open air with violent force, he screamed with all the energy he had left.

---

Damn fucking itchy stubble, Tony thought as he pounded out of the living room. God! Itchy as motherfucking hell!

His face remained expressionless despite these thoughts and the grunt of irritation he made. Lifting his hand, Tony idly scratched at his chin again.

Then he paused for a moment. His index finger had contacted something. Something small, but moving. With a half-hearted frown, he gazed at the fingertip: turning it slightly to check for any offending parties; he saw nothing but dirt and grime caught beneath the nail.

"Hmph..." Ignoring a loud uproar from the TV, he instead used the finger to rub sleep from his eye.

His face became blank again. Tony quickly returned to the thoughts at-hand and stomped the last few steps into the bathroom.

---

"Aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah!"

The fall was nothing short of heart-stopping. Bryan couldn't imagine this was far from what a sky diver might experience should their parachute malfunction. He screamed the entire fall, only a relative few seconds before impacting the ground.

Bryan's body stung from impact, but he remained intact - and alive. It was unbelievable. The giant youth had merely scratched his chin. Nothing but an innocent attempt to remove an irritation that was none other than shrunken Bryan Smith. For the speck-sized man, it was like being hit by a truck at full throttle.

Opening his eyes, Bryan immediately opened his mouth for a rasping yelp.

Looming above him was the oblivious teenager in all his gargantuan glory. Bryan resided in between the titan's dangerous black sneakers, lying among collections of dirt and grime, as well as dark splotches plastered against the dirty floor. Looking up at the nearest shoe, he was amazed by just how massive it was. Easily spanning many football fields in length and towering over 350 feet high, it was positively monumental to behold. Looking further, Bryan follows the massive leg clad in heavy cargo pant to see the gigantic teenager inspecting his dirt crusted fingertip.

Bryan feels light-headed just gazing up at such a huge being, especially thinking he had been that high up. He collects himself and begins screaming vainly for rescue. It was an overused, and much failed, device - but all he had at his disposal.

"HMPH." The giant BMX biker thundered.

The tiny man cringed, watching him idly rub the filthy finger into his eye. Suddenly, a cascade of boulder-sized crust plummets from above, sending Bryan into frantic squeals as he dodged the massive eye crust.

Leaping out of the way as one blasts the ground behind him, Bryan hears a heavy groan from above. He looks to the huge sneaker, standing like a black mountain crafted from worn, stained suede and sprouting thick cords frayed from everyday use by the gigantic owner. It shifts under Tony's unimaginable weight, and suddenly lifts from the floor with the sluggish grace of an animated cliff. The wall of black rubber changes to scuffed tan rubber that makes up the sole of the huge skate shoe. It peels away from the floor with a deep squelch.

It rises above Bryan, breaking through the air like a jumbo jet. He glimpses the familiar sole; packed with dark dirt, huge boulders, and tiny splotches both living and obliterated caught between each heavy lug.

Covering an immense distance, it crashes heavily with a deep quake that shakes Bryan to his core. The other lifts in the same fashion, sporting a similar display of callous destruction pressed into the aggressive treads. The oblivious titan pounds into the nearest room, flicking on a light and slamming the door with an earth shattering explosion.

Bryan shudders. "Fuck him...! He has no goddamm clue just how huge and terrifying he is!" He stares at the massive door dumbly before shaking himself.

Now he was back on the ground. A place proven very dangerous for anything as tiny as himself. Looking around, Bryan found himself in a new locale: one with miles of wooden flooring spotted with grime and gunk. Three doors besides the occupied bathroom loomed far off in the distance, shrouded in slight darkness. Behind him, Bryan could easily identify the living room by the flickering lights, dingy carpet, and rumbling voices.

The tiny man realized he should probably hide. Any interaction with these callous mega-sized teenagers seemed pure folly. Looking at a mangled mess of dried legs and carapace that was flattened against the floor only proved this. Bryan was smaller than these ants for godsakes. If they failed to notice them - how in the hell would they notice him?

"Oh God, I've got to..." He declared before...
11111222212111121.title: He falls to the floor of the hallway

11111222212111122.content:
Bryan sputtered as he grasped at the thick hairs around him, searching for a stable grip. Another thunderous step swung him violently. Bryan screamed as the dingy floor came into view thousands of feet below him. He could see Tony's dangerous black sneaker slam down as he walked, sending another tremor through the behemoth.

As Bryan's body swung uncontrollably in response to the rough movement, his free hand grazed a rope-like hair. Immediately his hand clamped around it in an iron grip. With one hand secured Bryan was able to further secure both hands. Though Tony's steps continued to rock him about, Bryan's grip held.

Bryan celebrated his small victory with a loud cheer, before looking around to figure out where the titan was taking him.

---

Tony plodded into the bathroom. Ignoring the various spots and smears on the mirror, he leaned forward studying his face. He dragged a couple fingers through the stubble lining his jaw. Tony's ears didn't detect the pitiful screams of a tiny scientist as thick fingers, spotted with dirt narrowly missed crushing him. Turning the sink on, Tony snatched a can of shaving cream off the counter.

"Hm, this is Mason's," he thought to himself. "Fuck it, he'll live," He decided with a shrug. Tony popped the cap off, sprayed the foam into his hand, and began smearing in onto his unruly beard. Rinsing the extra foam off his hands he searched briefly for his razor before starting to shave.

With smooth strokes Tony shaved off the pesky hair, rinsing the used shaving cream down the drain. He smiled at the sound and feeling of the razor slicing the hair from his jaw.

After a few minutes Tony put his razor down and turned the sink off. He admired his clean shaven face, rubbing his chin and grinning. "I'm one handsome mother fucker!" he grunted to himself. As he stood back, he noticed he had forgotten to rinse it off one last time.

---

Bryan face contorted into a frown of disapproval as the giant entered the bathroom. Every surface was covered in some form of stain, with various bottles and toiletries scattered across the faded counter. Looking forward, Bryan could see the titan studying his face in the mirror. He noted that the young man had a gruff, handsome face. Bryan realized that in spite of the terrors he had experienced because of this behemoth, ultimately he was just a teenager, oblivious to his monstrous presence in the world of tiny creatures all around him.

Bryan screamed as two impossibly thick fingers narrowly missed smearing him as the were dragged across the forest of stubble. "Hey, HEY! RIGHT HERE! HELP ME!" He shouted, waving with one free arm. As the giant leaned away from the mirror Bryan realized even he couldn't detect his tiny form in the reflection of the giant's face.

Bryan began to debate climbing, or waiting for another opportunity, ignoring the what the giant was doing at the sink. That is until he heard a loud splat nearby. Bryan's scream of terror was cutoff as a wall of white engulfed him.

The thick white cream, though loose, prevented him from going anywhere. A small amount got into his mouth and Bryan gagged on the taste. Also a man, he instantly recognized it. "Shaving cream!" he gasped.

Immediately following that realization, a chilling scraping noise was accompanied by a slight movement of the skin he was stuck to. The mountainous young man was starting to shave!

"No! I'm tight here! ON YOUR FUCKING FACE!" Bryan's screams, just as his movements had been, were subdued by the cream surrounding him. He did not stop struggling as he could hear the razor approaching.

Finally he heard the scraping noise closer than ever, and a second later a silver blade came at him. "Augh! No!" he shouted, trying to avoid being sliced in half. The cream that had held him prisoner, shifted removing him from danger. Bryan cried out as he fell quickly with the huge razor, it was placed onto the counter.

He sputtered, his heart pounding in his chest. A manic laugh burst from his chest. "I lived! I can't possibly die, because I just keep living!" he cheered, still laughing feverishly. Looking around he could see the cream, now looking like a white hill, its surface dotted with fallen stalks of thick hair.

"I'M ONE HANDSOME MOTHERFUCKER!" thundered the towering titan above. Bryan's gaze followed the billowing shirt, up to the titan's face far above, rolling his eyes at the unsurprising arrogance.

"Hey stupid ass! Pay more attention to you're surroundings! There's a tiny man, ME, right here!" he shouted angrily. Tony's eyes fell to the counter and seemed to lock right onto Bryan's battered body. He cheered as the wide hand reached downward, the palm filling Bryan's entire line of vision.

When Tony grasped the razor's handle and moved it towards the sink, Bryan couldn't suppress a howl of disappointment. At the same time Tony's other hand flicked the faucet on.

"No, no NO!" Bryan screamed as he saw what was about to happen. A waterfall smothered him, violently washing his body away. He screamed, struggling to swim in the storm. The last thing he clearly saw was Tony's face, far above, devoid of emotion as he rinsed off his razor. He couldn't tell which way was up. Frothing water surrounded him as he sharply inhaled, before blackness quickly engulfed him.

---

Tony tossed the rinsed off razor onto the counter and pounded out of the bathroom. Unaware of the life snuffed out as he had merely shaved his stubble, Tony settled onto his bed and began a successful round of COD. Bryan Smith's unnoticed corpse remained amongst small hairs plastered to the filthy walls of the sink, another tiny casualty of the oblivious actions of Tony, Mason, and Pete.
11111222212111122.title: Another casualty

111112222121112.content:
Bryan hears a squelch behind him and looks back to see a pink surface slam into him. He feels himself stick and moves with it as it moves backwards.

"NO!" he screams in terror.just before he slips between the lips.

Back in the darkness he is quickly moved to the back of the mouth with the rest of the captured food. The stench and humidity are unwelcoming as the first time. He begins to sob as Tony quickly swallows, the gulp resonating around him as Bryan sinks into his esophagus.

The ball of food lands on the growing mountain of chewed pizza in the titanic teenager's stomach. As Bryan slows to a stop partway down the slope he looks around in awe. This mountain of food seemed so excessive to the tiny man... and the giant who had just consumed it was undoubtedly unaware of its existence.

Bryan is at a loss. He cannot believe that this is where his adventure into shrinking would end... that this is where his life would end.

"I'm a genius! I deserve better than this!" he shouts in frustration. "I ESCAPED! I WAS OUT!" he wails, furious.

A wave of despair washes over him. "Why? Why am I about to die with some teenager's slice of pizza, no more noticeable than that ant! "he laments.

He cries harder "I escaped..." he mutters and begins to chant it under his breath, his mind breaking down from the stress of his impending, terrible end.

---

Tony, none the wiser to the latest addition to his stomach, quickly downs the rest of the slice in large bites. The chewed food descending into his stomach buries the immobilized Bryan.

Tony gives no thought to the meal he had just gulped down, or the violent fate it will soon meet inside his stomach. He merely enjoys the feeling of fullness. Leaning back, Tony finally feels relaxed after the awful day at work. He enjoys a few hours of TV. Completely engrossed in a show an hour later, nothing indicates to Tony as his stomach begins to churn and break down the pizza. There is no care in the world at the moment for the 19 year old, because he has no way to know and thus no way to worry about the life lost to his digestive system.
111112222121112.title: Recaptured

choices: Bryan heads for the trash immediately
Bryan waits for an opportunity
11111222212112.content:
Bryan yelled out as he was expelled from the mouth, along with drops of saliva and bits of chewed food. He felt both terror for the fall, joy from escaping the mouth, and surprisingly, excitement as he flew through the air.

Nearing the ground, Bryan screams and braces himself for the impact that will end his life.

He lands roughly with a grunt and rolls a short distance. Gasping he opens his eyes, amazed to still be breathing. The carpet, in spite of being old, worn, and filthy still had enough thickness to it to absorb the impact of his fall. Bryan laughs nervously and shouts "YES!" looking upwards in triumph.

His view quickly dampens his mood. Above him Tony's shoes hover over the edge of the recliner where he rests his legs. The massive shoe soles are easily visible, as well as the bugs and grime trapped in the tread. A look in another direction reveals a giant roommate, who's shoes rest on the floor, making a deep indent in the carpet. Bryan immediately flees underneath the coffee table.

It seems useless as the giants remain still, light from the TV flickering across their faces. From this spot Bryan can clearly see both titans in their entirety. He is amazed by how massive they are. Their shoes each easily span a couple football fields and tower several stories tall. Naturally they don't rival the height off the hairy legs that stretch up towards their broad torsos. Their arms stretch downwards to their large hands, and thick fingers that can grasp mountainous objects and lift them with ease. Their faces, far above a fathomable height to Bryan, are similar to Mt. Rushmore; the teenagers' rugged features all the more magnified to the minuscule Bryan.

With their size the giants pose danger with every mundane task. Tony's simple footsteps in the kitchen had unintentionally ended the lives of all those ants, their remains somewhat visible in the tread above. Bryan could still hear the smack and squishes as Tony scarfed down the pizza. Though a normal act, it had almost left Bryan to be digested, unnoticed deep inside the giant's body. Mason swung his hand at a pesky gnat, his gigantic hand collided with the bug, sending it flying. These giants were so dangerous, especially to Bryan at this size, and they were completely unaware of it. Their actions that seemed so normal, ended lives of bugs and quite nearly Bryan, and they didn't notice or care. They had no way to see what large, terrifying, and destructive beings they were.

Bryan takes a step back, as he realizes he will have a hard time getting anything but grief from the giants. Intentional or not they are no longer normal people to him but rather monsters of devastation. He decides he must get to the antidote in the garbage on his own. And he must do it quickly before something else happens!
11111222212112.title: Epiphany

choices: Bryan begins his journey back to the kitchen
Something happens
111112222121122.content:
The fibers of the old carpeting proved large enough to keep tiny Bryan from sinking into it. He tried to ignore the noticeable sour smell the carpet produced from decades of dirt and food being treaded into it.

Leaning against the skyscraper-sized leg of the coffee table, the shrunken man felt rather safe. A feeling which gave him great relief, especially after the unbelievable trauma of having almost been eaten. The memory made him shudder. He felt a pang of resentment towards Tommy, who had carelessly left the package on the bus which brought Bryan to his current life-threatening predicament. If only Tommy had been more responsible, Bryan would be safe and back to normal at his nephew's college.

Bryan squinted, looking at the doorway that led back into the kitchen. He wanted nothing more than to make the journey, retrieve his formula, and escape this nightmare. The distance was daunting, a simple 10 feet translated to many miles of extremely dangerous terrain for the bug-sized man to cross, and then he would have to cross through the kitchen again.

He decided to stay put until the two gargantuan teens went to sleep. He couldn't gamble that the seated giants would stay put until he reached his goal, and trying to get their attention would only end in being stomped like an ant. Bryan settled himself as comfortably as possible at the base of the table leg and prepared to wait.

The tiny scientist tried to rest as best he could, but the dull roar of the television and the random deep booming voices from the gigantic teens caused him discomfort. It seemed surreal, and almost funny, that he was able to occupy the same room and view the same television without their knowledge. After what seemed like hours, a large gnat landed nearby causing Bryan to jump in surprise. It seemed uninterested in him as it investigated an unidentifiable crumb, it's hideous hose-like mouth determining if it was edible. Bryan looked in wonder, noting the creatures fragile translucent wings, before it suddenly took flight as the ground shuddered.

Mason had shifted his large feet as he slouched in the couch. This slight action on his part caused the tiny man discomfort as he watched the mountain-sized footwear move, causing further seismic activity. Further alarm spread when he heard a distant thundering roar. It repeated, almost rhythmically, and Bryan suddenly realized what it was.

"Snoring!" He said aloud, his voice sounding quite gravelly from his previous terrified screeching.

Stumbling around the large table leg, Bryan looked up at Tony, his huge sneakers still propped up, revealing the grime-filled tread. The giant BMX-biker's head sagged to the side, his mouth ajar as he emitted thunderous snores. A glance at the other giant showed him in a similar state, his head leaning forward sleepily.

The tiny man felt nervous, he didn't want to leave the supposed safety of the coffee table, but now was his chance.
111112222121122.title: Play it safe...

1111122221211221.content:
The task that faced him seemed simple enough. Get to his antidote, restore himself and escape this unanticipated nightmare. From the low, omnipresent rumble produced by the snoring giants, the tiny man fooled himself into thinking he had the luxury of time to accomplish his goal.
Every so often, he looked over his shoulder to gaze toward the giants. Tony's huge sneakers loomed overhead, and the tiny man stared up at the grime-filled tread of the massive shoes. He saw, among other debris, the remains of tiny, anonymous bugs that the unknowing giant must have obliterated without a second thought.
"Well, that won't be me now," Bryan said aloud, confident he could overcome the dilemma now that the two giant threats were slumbering peacefully.
Giant Mason, the titan responsible for bringing Bryan back to this cursed apartment, had fallen asleep, too. Although his antidote awaited him, the tiny man took a moment to admire the two sleeping giants, feeling a little safer now that they were no longer stomping around the room.
They looked immensely powerful, even asleep. The tiny man found himself attracted to their scale and power, but he knew that he should not let himself be diverted from his goal.
He took one last look over the massive forms, and then turned away with determination renewed to get to the antidote. If he had kept staring at them slightly longer, he might have noticed the tiny gnat that kept flitting around Tony's face, causing the titan's nose to twitch as the irritating insect kept brushing against the giant face.

The activities of the gnat became enough of a nuisance to wake Tony from sleep. He waved his hand at his face, brushing the insect away. It continued to flit around his face, and he kept swatting his hand at it.

Well, he was awake now. And he felt the need to get up and use the restroom. Brushing at the gnat again, he grazed the winged bug. It recovered, however, before hitting the floor.

The huge gnat buzzed past his head alerted then tiny man to the changed situation. As the gnat stopped its spiraling crash and flew away, tiny Bryan saw the giant shoe raised overhead, suddenly plunging him into shadow.

He screamed, but the shoe dropped without any hesitation, directly onto the bug-sized scientist's puny form. To his horror, Bryan found himself smashed into the grime-filled treads, right next to the demolished remains of a few puny ants the giant had crushed at some earlier time.

Tony stomped into the none-too-clean restroom, his sneakers slamming onto the tiles. He planted his feet apart, with one shoe in a puddle that had formed to the side of the toilet, as he relieved himself.
The tiny man survived the pounding steps across the floor, but then the shoe splashed down into the puddle. The filthy water rose up and filled the grooves in the tread. He struggled for a breath of air that didn't come. He opened his mouth to scream, but the filthy water washed into the open space.

Many minutes later after a lengthy piss, Tony zipped up and went to the sink to wash his hands. He never noticed the floating pale and lifeless speck he left behind in the puddle on the bathroom floor. A few crushed bodies of ants had also fallen out of the tread to float as additional debris in the puddle.
Not for days did anyone bother to finally mop up the puddle, and then they just left the dirty mop in a bucket in the corner, never having noticed the tiny man's body caught up in the slimy ropes of the mop.
1111122221211221.title: Drowned like a bug

1111122221212.content:
Bryan sobs and screams as the giant chews his food. He is shocked when a lump of soggy crust slams into him and scrapes him into a pile of moving food. He is shifted, again randomly flying about. Everything stops suddenly and the tiny scientist hopes against odds that his presence has been detected. The lips part and he sees the outside world, framed by jagged teeth littered with bits of soggy chewed food. A loud gust rumbles the cavern from behind and Bryan recognizes the over powering stench to be a burp. The lips rapidly shut and he feels defeated. Of course he is indiscernible from a crumb, the giant had no way to even guess what was going on.

The pile of food he is trapped in move backwards and Bryan feels it all sinking downward. "NO!! Please don't eat me! I'm a human! I'M A GENIUS!" he shouts hysterically. This of course gets no response and he feels himself moved down violently, surrounded by an amplified gulp, as the giant easily swallows him and the bite of pizza.

He sobs as he is massaged downwards, surrounded by hulking pressure. Around him the sounds of roaring lungs and a beating heart are constant reminders of the terrible world he has entered. The soggy pile is squeezed through an extremely tight opening, and finally lands with a splat on a growing mountain of chewed pizza.
