The tiny man looks around at the throbbing pink walls that encompass him. A shallow moat of the soda the giant had guzzled earlier surrounds the mountain. Above him there is a grinding and smushing noise.

Bryan stares at all of this, his face frozen in shock and terror. He suddenly glares upward. "You idiot! I am a genius and you just ate me! How id you not fucking see me!" he bellows. He lets out an animal-like wail, out of anger and defeat. Surely he can escape! He is a man of great intellect, he can't die in some guy's stomach with pizza!

The tiny man's thoughts distract him from the gulping noise and approaching deluge of soda. He is caught completely off guard as he is battered by the incoming soda and chewed food which knocks him unconscious. His body floats in the lake of soda, bumping against the scattered islands of chewed pizza. He never gets the chance to awaken.

---

Tony stares at the screen, tense as he show approaches its climax. It suddenly switches to commercials.

"Bullshit!" he grunts angrily. "Mason turns to him "The do it on purpose dude" he says unconcerned. "Doesn't mean it's not bullshit!" Tony shoots back before looking at Mason's plate.

"What? There's stuff to make nachos?" he says surprised. "Hell yeah!" he says excitedly without waiting for an answer and jumps from his chair.

Unknown to Tony this motion and his short walk to the kitchen causes a storm in his stomach, battering Bryan's tiny body against chunks of floating pizza. He returns to the chair just before the commercials begin and begins to quickly down the nachos.Tony doesn't think twice about the food as he pops it into his wide mouth and chews. He gulps down bite after bite effortlessly as he stares at the TV screen. Chewed mounds of cheesy nachos splash into the stomach forming a new mountain that tiny Bryan's unconscious form washes up on. Eventually Tony finishes up his nachos and pizza, finally comfortably full.

He decides, with the show finished, to go ride his bike around for awhile. He rolls it outside and rides it down the street, doing tricks that impress random bystanders. This fuels Tony's energy and he goes on for over an hour. Though he'd like to go longer, he is tired from the a long day at work and returns to his apartment, sweaty but happy.

As he walks up the stairs he fails to notice the gurgle from his stomach. Inside the soda has drained away, leaving only soggy piles of food churned by his movement. As he sits in front of the TV to play some Xbox live, his stomach begins to secrete acids that quickly work on breaking down the food from earlier, as well as Bryan's small body.

Tony doesn't notice a thing as his the food that had been sitting in his stomach is finally broken down. He hadn't given it any thought since quickly gulping it down earlier. He is focused on his games, unaware of what was happening at that moment, inside his stomach.

That night Tony passed out in front of the Xbox. He had earlier decided in spite of work it had been a good day. And for him it had just been another normal day. As he slept peacefully, his stomach moved the broken down remains of his long forgotten meal out of the stomach, the place where Bryan Smith's extraordinary day had ended. Permanently.
1111122221212.title: Gulped Down

choices: Pete notices a tiny bug on the floor
Bryan makes it to the kitchen safely
111112222122.content:
The huge youth's face loomed high above the tiny man, the flickering television casting frightening shadows on the giant face. Bryan struggled with renewed determination at the sight of Tony reaching for another slice. The colossal guy didn't even look as he grabbed another sizable slice, and proceeded to raise it to his unforgiving mouth, pausing briefly at an intense scene from the show.

"Help! I'm down here!" Bryan whimpered, his heart sinking in despair. He was hopelessly trapped, a massive bit of pepperoni firmly pressing him into the slimy cheese. A pained glance gave the shrunken scientist a view of an ant pulling itself from a different slice above him. The insect found it's scavenging in the fridge disturbed when the teenager arrived, and was trying escape from the dangerous Tony. Watching Tony's huge hand come into view again, the giant fingers grabbing this very slice, taking the doomed ant with it.

He cringed seeing this careless youth chomp down on this slice, his stomach turning at the thought of the poor ant. Never did Bryan forsee his current predicament. This little adventure was supposed to be a harmless surprise for his nephew's benefit, he thought, not becoming the first human bug to be eaten by a teenager.

A large shadow caught his attention, and Bryan cried out in vain. A huge finger plucked the heavy pepperoni roughly pulling tiny Mr. Smith with it, dangling wildly. His eyes took in the detail of the building-sized fingernail clutching the huge meat, its filthy non-manicured appearance disgusting the prim little man. His judgement was short-lived, as the giant face of Tony encompassed his view.

"No! Don't eat me! Please!" Bryan's voice cracked with emotion, choking on his own tears.

Before he could cry out pitifully again, everything suddenly changed. A deafening explosion blew the tiny man back, causing him to flail madly through the air at break-neck speed. His shrill little squealing went unnoticed to the two mammoth teenagers, one just recovering from a sneeze.

His vision darkened, the tiny man swore he saw stars as he recovered from the terrifying flight. His body ached, but miraculously appeared unscathed, his minute stature making him more resilient to falls, but not immune. Bryan thrust his head to the side, purging his stomach after such a violent fall.

Bleary-eyed, the tiny man took in his new surroundings. From a normal perspective, the tiny man was flung no more than 5 feet from his original predicament. From his small position on the floor, the distance seemed great, and the recovering Tony looked distant and ever dangerous.

-----------------

"Shit! Dude, don't spray that all over!" Mason started as his buddy let out an explosive sneeze. Tony glared, wiping his nose and retorted, "Fuck you, man". Glancing around the dim room, lit only by the flashing television and the light filtering in from the kitchen, he scowled. He had lost the tantalizing pepperoni, which alone was his favourite part of the pizza.

Unknown to Tony, his unpleasant sneeze had saved the tiny scientist's life, though the floor was no safer for such a small being.

The young man forgot, and reacted to a sudden wave of glorious violence from the TV. Tony idly swatted at an annoying, buzzing gnat as he leaned his other hand in for the last slice of filth-ridden pizza his eyes fixed on the flashing screen. Mason propped his large feet on the battered coffee table, taking a large swig of his soda.

"Yo! What're you two watching?" Pete interjected, as he entered the dingy living room from the hall. The red-headed youth was fully dressed now, wearing a black t-shirt, jeans, and beat-up Nike sneakers. His goofy demeanor, and laid-back attitude made him a fun guy. The three decided to get an apartment together after high-school, despite Tony being one grade ahead of them, and since they all enjoyed sports, such as biking and skating, it was a match made in heaven.

Tony still glued to the TV, replied with a grunt, "Walking Dead". With heavy steps, the tall Pete flung himself in a tattered armchair near the couch, unaware that he almost crushed a strange little bug. A low rumble emitted from Pete's stomach, and looking over at the plate near Tony, he asked, "Did you eat all the pizza, dude?"

The towering youth rose from his chair.

-----------------

Fortunately for him, Bryan was close to the leg of an enormous end table as a new giant entered the room. The ground trembled as a huge sneaker landed with a dull boom. Having forgotten about this third titanic teen, the little man dreaded having to deal with a third pair of massive feet.

"YO" Roared a deep voice overhead, causing the tiny genius to shield his ears. Taking this opportunity to look up at the frighteningly tall youth looming above, he steadied himself as the titan began moving again. The dangerous footwear raised up, almost in slow-motion, a frayed lace hung limply in front of the trademark Nike "swoosh". Heavy vibrations followed each thunderous step as the young titan crossed the room.

The heavy sneakers left impressions in the thick, grimy carpeting that covered the dingy room. Seeing the titanous teen taking a seat, the little man prepared to make his way back to the kitchen where he hoped to scale the trash bin in search of his antidote. Crawling through the revolting carpet, tiny Mr. Smith couldn't help but notice the variety of food and dirt in the carpet. With a shudder he even noticed the remains of a variety of insects stomped into the fibers by heavy feet.

His journey ran uninterrupted until a deep voice thundered, causing the tiny man to turn around. The huge Pete slowly rose to his full height and without a thought for any small creatures on the floor, began lumbering towards the tiny scientist.
111112222122.title: Off of the pizza, and onto the floor

choices: He is awakened by heavy vibrations
Something disturbs him
1111122222.content:
Pete stood in the kitchen dressed only in a t-shirt and shorts. An amused expression remained on his face after witnessing Mason miss the trash bin with his purloined box.

He was the youngest of his two roommates, Tony and Mason, his 18th birthday only a couple of months away. Tony was 19, and Mason was 18. Pete was considered the joker, always getting satisfaction by annoying his roommates, especially Tony, and constantly messing around.

"I am sure they'll send the cops after you for stealing that empty box." He snickered. "Also, the NBA called. Turns out they just can't use someone who can't score from 10 feet away." Pete grinned, and Mason idly grunted a profanity in response causing Pete to chuckle. He succeeded

His youthful mind returned to more important matters, which predominately concerned food. The teen knew that once Tony came home, he would raid the fridge and eat all the left-over pizza. Pete continued to the refrigerator in question, pulling it open.

A low grumble emitted from his stomach as his eyes rested on the cold pizza. He quickly snatched the greasy box, licking his lips in anticipation.

Pete liked the pizza cold, so he prepared to leave so he could enjoy it.

-----------------

Bryan could barely comprehend the massive visage of the titan that loomed before him.

His neck complained painfully as he craned his head back in order to look at the colossal teen's face. The tiny man felt he was looking through a fish eye lens, as the giant legs towered endlessly till they met the distant torso that supported a head that rivaled the moon in size. What further shocked him was the slight movements this gigantic being made, movements that seemed almost in slow-motion. It simply amazed him that something so huge could even move.

As his mind contemplated these things, he wasn't prepared to see the giant walk. Bryan's eyes grew wide as the left foot, which more closely resembled a mountain in size, lifted off the ground.

His mouth went dry as he broke into action, bolting in terror. The humongous foot crashed down heavily just a dozen feet away. Bryan was thrown by the powerful shock wave, his tiny voice shrieking in surprise. Landing roughly, he heard another more distant thud and felt the ground shudder as the titan continued his threatening stomping.

The tiny scientist watched the young colossus open an equally huge refrigerator with ease. Bryan looked at the giant bare feet that almost smashed him only moments before. The simple action of just crossing a room almost spelled death for the tiny man. He wanted nothing more than to wake up from this horrible nightmare.

Pulling himself back up, he steadied himself. "I need to get his attention. He has to see me!" He hoped in vain.

The refrigerator closed with a dull boom, and Bryan watched the huge red-headed teen turn. The large bare feet thudded heavily as they shifted. The tiny man jogged forward, waving his little arms in an attempt to be rescued. He began screaming desperately when he realized that the giant couldn't even see the ground because of the grease-stained pizza box he was holding.

"Nooo! Down here, help me! Look down!" Bryan stopped, jumping in an almost comic fashion. A single booming step and the huge teen was directly before him again.

Bryan squeaked in shock as a cruise ship sized foot soared overhead, bits of dirt and grime falling from the filthy sole. It thundered down heavily behind him, causing the ground to lurch once more under the tiny man's feet. A couple ants on the floor were crushed beneath one of the huge bare feet. The giant didn't take any notice as he continued his dangerous journey lumbered to the doorway.

It was hopeless, he thought in despair, watching the oblivious guy disappear into the hall. He was simply too small. Not to mention, these giants didn't even know he existed. The stomped ants had a better chance of being rescued than he did. His tiny body ached all over. The horrendous fall from the box, and almost being stomped upon was taking its toll. A slow progress brought him to the base of the nearby cupboards, which towered endlessly above.

His mind spinning, Bryan sat himself near a building-sized cheerio and collapsed into unconsciousness.
1111122222.title: Too small

choices: Roommate Tony enters just then!
Bryan steps into something...sticky!
11111222222.content:
Soft hands caressed Bryan as he lay languidly upon a gilded chaise lounge. One of hands raised, brushing his cheek before grabbing a clump of juicy grapes and bringing them closer for his consumption.

"Ah... I am a bit peckish! Grapes would be marv-...Ouch!" His bashful words twisted into a screech of pain as the graceful hand slammed both itself and the plump grapes directly into his face.

Suddenly, Bryan lurched from his dreams, blinking and twitching back to reality. His face smarted. Rubbing it, he glared at what seemed an unlikely "reality", before shrieking in terror as another painful impact hit his exposed hip. "Shit...!" Bruised, he scampered on his ass from a horrifying ant that loomed over him. "What is going on! Get back you six-legged freak!" The ant ignored this squeaking insult, and merely clacked curiously with invasive antennae.

Too busy glaring into the glinting eyes, Bryan was whacked in the side by one antennae again. It was an intense hit, whether the insect intended to or not. Bryan screamed and scuttled back again. The ant merely approached closer seeming more interested in the tiny man than before.

Lowering a head large as his torso, the ant clicked and clacked with extreme interest. Bryan was sure the foul creature had never encountered something like himself before. He was also sure encountering an ant this close would end very badly. Hoping to avoid that end, he timidly smacked at the hard, greasy, blackened head to dissuade it from getting any closer. The ant was unfazed, until one hit made contact with a squishy black eye the size of Bryan's fist.

"Oh, yuck!" The tiny man exclaimed as the over-sized ant reared backwards. Twisting in pain, the insect focused a glare that consisted of a dented, gushing blob and an inky orb full of fury. "That was...Uhh...Uh oh!"

Whatever the simple-minded ant had in mind, Bryan never found out, as not a moment later the angry ant was suddenly overshadowed by a larger organism from behind. One sickening snap followed a violent jerk and the unsuspecting bug was plucked into the air by an even larger bug; or, more correctly: an arachnid just short of out-sizing Bryan's garage. The tiny man responded to the ant's plight by screaming for his own safety.

The spider ignored the tiny squeaking pink-thing, allowing full focus upon the juicy ant now dead and ready to be devoured. Bryan screamed again, utterly beside himself with fear, and sprung up to his feet and promptly ran face first into the pocked siding of a massive stale cheerio.

Pressing his back against the crispy surface, he gaped wide-eyed at the terrifying spider. "Just...just stay back! Don't hurt me!" His pleads washed uselessly over the large arachnid, who showed not a shard of interest for "hurting" Bryan.

Deciding to flee, Bryan sidled awkwardly against the Cheerio and then launched at his first opening towards the seemingly endless expanse of open floor.
11111222222.title: There's always something bigger...

choices: The exterminator stomps through the kitchen in workboots
The exterminator decides to start downstairs in the basement
11112.content:
Bryan finished his preparations, leaving the box and payment on his kitchen table. He checked his watch, confirming that in less than half an hour, his neighbor would arrive to take the package to the post office, per his instructions.

He stripped off his clothes in his bedroom, then returned to the kitchen. He seated himself on his table before consuming the contents of the small vial.

The agent that years of testing had perfected quickly reduced him to a size of a mere quarter-inch, leaving him a pale, insignificant speck on the vast tabletop. He didn't marvel for long, knowing he needed to get inside the packing crate before Tommy's arrival.

He had started his journey across the tabletop when a sudden cacophony of noise, combined with a fierce gale, interrupted his trek.

His first thought was that Tommy had arrived early, but when he saw the huge man in the green uniform, a forgotten fact clicked in his brain.

"Crap! It's Monday!" Bryan cried aloud, his voice lost in the maelstrom.

His erratic work schedule meant that Bryan gave some people an unusual degree of trust. After a problem with ants in his kitchen and termites in his basement, he had hired a monthly pest service, giving them a key to his home so they could do their monthly maintenance during the day while he was at work.

The storm admitted into the kitchen swept clean the surface of the table. The almost empty package and the crisp $100 bill, picked up by the gust of wind, lifted upward before beginning their fall back toward the floor.

That same wind swept the unprepared tiny man right over the edge of his kitchen table. Everything happened so fast, he had barely time to scream, a feeble sound lost in the roar of the storm.

Then, with the closing of the door behind him, the employee with the local pest extermination agency brought a calm still back to the room.

That was of little comfort to the bug-sized man sprawled painfully on one of the kitchen tiles. Bryan had survived the impact at the end of the plunge from the tabletop, but at the cost of feeling stunned and brain-addled.

He had an instant to reflect on the perceived perversity of the universe. Thinking that he had planned so carefully, he was now reminded of that time-honored adage that "anything that can go wrong, will go wrong."

Bryan held his head in his hands, trying to find the strength to make it to his feet, as things prepared to get a whole lot worse...
11112.title: Murphy's Law Kicks In

choices: Tommy arrives, expecting cash and a package to mail
Exterminator helps himself to something from the fridge
111121.content:
His head still spinning, tiny Bryan Smith lurched to his feet, still discombobulated by the unexpected turn of events.

A thousand thoughts fought for supremacy, but survival instinct kicked into gear and claimed dominance in the shrunken man's brain when the titanic exterminator began stomping across the kitchen floor, his Size 14 work boots thundering across the tiles.

"Oh god!" Bryan screamed as adrenaline began to pump through his system. It was fight or flight time, and he knew very well the consequences of even imagining a fight against one of those enormous boots.

No, for the tiny man, reduced to the size of a bug by his own folly, it was definitely time for flight.

He didn't completely panic. "If I can make it to the baseboard along the bottom of the wall, I can avoid his feet," he told himself.

Of course, that involved a sprint across a wide distance of open floor.

As he stared up again at the enormous exterminator, his eyes took in the immense form. The guy wore a pair of tight jeans and an equally tight T-shirt emblazoned with the name and logo of the extermination firm. Earlier, the kitchen had looked humongous. Now, the gigantic human stomping across the floor made the room seem smaller.

Bryan swallowed weakly when his eyes lingered on the logo. Someone had a twisted sense of humor, he decided. The logo depicted the sole of an upraised boot coming down on a tiny bug.

He jerked his gaze from the logo, ventured to seek out the colossal face. The swarthy face looked youthful but powerful.

He mortified himself by sprouting wood as he let his imagination wander into dangerous territory, wondering what the titan might look like beneath his clothes.

"I don't have time for this," Bryan admonished himself. He wished he had managed to at least put on some of his pre-shrunk clothes before the unexpected arrival of the exterminator. Being tiny and naked made him feel doubly vulnerable.

"I just need to stay out of his way until..."

He didn't finish his statement because at that moment...
111121.title: Kitchen suddenly seems small

choices: Diego sees something tiny
Bryan reaches Tommy's foot
1111211.content:
At that moment, Tommy wasn't listening. "Damn, man," he said. "Get your foot off that package."

Diego hadn't heard the crunch, but he looked down and saw the mangled remains of the cardboard package. "Sorry," he said as he stooped to retrieve the battered box.

He handed it to Tommy, who frowned. The box looked in shabby shape.

"There was supposed to be some money," Tommy said. "To pay for the shipping costs."

Tiny Bryan knew that if Tommy left with the box, he was doomed to exile in a world of giants. At that moment, he saw the crisp $100 bill on the floor beneath the kitchen table. If he could get to the bill, he could make Tommy see him.

Without another thought, the bug-sized guy sprinted over the floorboards, racing toward the enormous paper currency.

"Is this it?" Diego's huge hand reached down and plucked the bill off the floor.

"Yes, that's it," Tommy responded loudly.

The teenager lifted his tight T-shirt and scratched idly at his stomach, dazzling the tiny unnoticed voyeur with an impressive show. Tommy had a natural muscular body, but enough plumpness to keep his features boyish and charming.

The tiny scientist pulled up short. "No! That's mine!" Mr. Smith screamed irrationally.

Tiny and naked he might be, but he needed to put an end to this chain of errors before matters got even more out of control.

He turned and saw Tommy's huge, bare feet enclosed in a pair of rubber sandals. Trying to think of a plan on the go, he decided that if he could climb onto the bare foot, he could make himself felt by the giant.

What he feared to think about was the possibility Tommy might mistake him for a tiny bug.

"Well, thanks," Tommy said. "I better get this to the post office like I promised Mr. Smith."

Seeing his only hope about to leave, the tiny man tried to run faster while screaming for Tommy not to leave.
1111211.title: Tommy meets Diego

11112111.content:
The tiny, naked scientist raced across his kitchen floor, well aware of the risk but desperate to climb onto his titanic teenaged neighbor's rubber sandal.

"He's my only shot at getting back to normal," the little man realized as he scurried like an insect, racing to reach Tommy before something unpleasant or nasty happened to him.

But in only a couple of steps, the teenager's stride took him across the room, even farther out of reach. The tiny man gazed up from the floor, seeing Tommy's huge hand reaching for the knob on the back door.

He had to hurry before Tommy's huge rubber sandals carried him out the back door and out of reach.

"No! Wait!" Mr. Smith screamed as his exertion caught up with him.

So, too, did fate.

Diego, his vision tuned to notice movement like the tiny man's, glanced down at the floor. He saw the jerky, scurrying actions of a tiny creature and his brain readily leaped to its programmed conclusion.

"There's a bug now!" Diego exclaimed in a loud voice with a tone of surprise.

Tommy stopped, his hand on the doorknob, and looked back toward Diego. He followed Diego's eyes and saw the pale speck on the kitchen floor.

Diego stomped across the floor until he was close enough to raise his right boot.

The advancing stomps from the giant's boots knocked the little man off his feet and, before he could recover, the enormous boot lifted over him.

"No! Wait!"

Even with the two giants looking directly at him, he could not make his screams heard to the titans, who equated his tiny size with insects.

Diego brought the boot down, and the impact hardly even resulted in much of a crunch.

"One down," the cocky young man announced.

Tommy laughed. "Guess you showed that bug who's the big man."

He then let himself out the back door, Mr. Smith's package in hand for the now totally unnecessary trip to the neighborhood post office.
11112111.title: One Down

choices: He remains between Tommy's toe for trip to Post Office
Before Tommy can get outside the house, Bryan falls off the sandal
11112112.content:
The tiny scientist found himself in close proximity to Tommy's huge, bare feet, which were enclosed in a pair of rubber sandals. Staring the short distance from his position to those massive feet and equally huge sandals, the enormity of his situation was brought home to the unlucky little man.

The fact he was tiny as well as completely naked made the speck-sized man feel even more vulnerable at the feet of his teenaged neighbor and the colossal employee from the pest control agency.

Given his options, tiny Mr. Smith knew that his fate rested with Tommy, no matter how unaware the titanic teen remained of his employer's unfathomable predicament.

But, even as he was formulating a course of action, Tommy announced his intention to take Mr. Smith's mysterious package to the post office.

Trying to think of a plan on the go, he decided that if he could climb onto the bare foot, he could make himself felt by the giant.

Tommy's announcement provoked the bug-like man into action. He raced across the floor, desperate to reach Tommy's closest foot.

Seeing his only hope about to leave, the tiny man tried to run faster while screaming desperately for help.

He realized that, if either of the monster-sized humans spied his scurrying movements, there was an alarming probability they would mistake him for a bug.

Luck smiled on the little man, or so he thought. He reached Tommy's left sandal.

"I made it," he said just as he realized that the thick rubber sole represented an obstacle as formidable as a 12-foot wall.

The tiny man tried to jump, clawing for a grip on the edge of the sandal. His fingers, failing to find purchase, slipped from the sleek rubber surface.

-----

"Well, since you are heading out, I can start spraying," Diego informed Tommy. "Believe me, you don't want to be around this stuff if you can help it."

"Yea," Tommy said, not really sure of what else to say to Mr. Smith's exterminator.

Hearing that Diego meant to unleash deadly poisons on his immediate environment, the shrunken man made a last-chance attempt to scramble onto Tommy's gigantic sandal.

Perhaps driven by fear, he finally got his hands over the edge and, by straining his muscles to the utmost, managed to pull himself to safety.

He rolled onto the narrow rubber ledge, close enough to the side of Tommy's cruise ship-long foot that he felt the teenager's body warmth.

Mr. Smith vowed that, if he ever got back to his normal size, he would undertake a workout program to give him the muscles that Tommy and Diego took for granted.

But, now he faced the challenge of retaining his position as Tommy lurched into movement.

Knowing how precarious his situation had become, he raced along the wall formed by the side of Tommy's foot.

Reaching the front of the huge foot, he was confronted by a row of toes, each of them dwarfing his entire body. Eager for some sort of secure position, the bug-sized man ducked into the wide crevice between Tommy's big toe and its nearest neighbor.
11112112.title: Monumental Effort

choices: Tommy heads to the lake at the park
Tommy visits the pool hall
111121121.content:
Mr. Smith had never felt lower in his entire life.

What had he expected? His entire plan had been a mad scheme from the start. He realized that now that it was too late to turn back.

For the moment, thoughts of his plan to ship himself to California for a visit with his nephew was the farthest thing from his mind.

Crouched in the dubious security between two of Tommy's titanic toes, the tiny professor's one hope now rested with simply surviving long enough to gain his teenaged neighbor's attention and assistance. The bug-sized scientist huddled in the wide crevice between Tommy's big toe and its nearest neighbor.

Those toes, he realized with a shiver that chilled his teeny body to its core, could easily reduce him to an unrecognizable pulp.

His mind rebelled at that prospect. Despite being a quarter of an inch tall, he was still a man. He had no intention of suffering the fate of a mere insect, casually crushed without a though by a careless titan.

His situation might have been less humiliating if not for the irritating stench of sweat and toe jam that assaulted his senses. "Doesn't Tommy wash his feet?" Tiny Bryan choked aloud.

-----

This task for Mr. Smith beat mowing yards and pulling weeds. In fact, Tommy could barely believe his good fortune. As soon as he dropped the package into the mail at a post office, which wasn't even crowded, he began to dream of ways to spend the money.

He had no idea that a flea-sized man had hitched a desperate ride on his rubber sandal in the space between two of his toes.

Tommy considered heading to a nearby park, where he could kick back, relax, enjoy wading at the edge of the small lake.

He also wondered if it might not be better to call a few of his buddies and have them meet him at their favorite pool hall for a game of billiards. He felt lucky and maybe he could bankroll his payment from Mr. Smith into an even bigger amount of money.
111121121.title: Safely Lodged

choices: Start spraying in the kitchen
Start spraying elsewhere in the house
111121122.content:
The shrunken scientist, reduced to a mere quarter-of-an-inch in stature, lodged himself as securely as possible between two neighboring toes belonging to his titanic neighbor.

Looking at his situation, the tiny man reflected on the ludicrous circumstances that had forced him to take shelter in the wide crevice between his teenaged neighbor's toes. The situation in his home, with the arrival of the enormous exterminator, left him little choice. Staying behind and facing extermination didn't appeal to the bug-sized man.

Unfortunately, he hadn't thought out every step in his impulsive action. He needed to get Tommy's attention, but even more urgently he needed to maintain his position between the teenager's enormous toes, which surprised him with the intensity of their rank odor. The speck of a man felt his little form being permeated by the nauseating stench of Tommy's foot sweat.

He overheard the enormous exterminator sharing some dispiriting information with Tommy about the effects of the spray. "It doesn't leave any bugs standing," boasted the handsome exterminator.

"First I even knew about Mr. Smith having a bug problem," Tommy said.

The titanic teen started moving, his sandals flapping loudly on the kitchen tiles, totally oblivious to the strain a simple step put on the tiny man trying to hold out between his toes.

He stopped abruptly at the back door as he reached for the knob. The sheer force of the sudden stop caught his tiny passenger unprepared. Momentum took control and launched the speck-sized man from between Tommy's toes and into empty space.

Or at least empty space until the tiny projective collided with the baseboard running along the bottom of the kitchen wall.

The bottom of the door passed over the limp form of the tiny man as Tommy exited Mr. Smith's kitchen, leaving Diego to his work.

Diego, just as unmindful as Tommy of the bug-sized specimen now seemingly lifeless on the tiles, fastened his facemask into place and picked up the canister of insecticide, having decided to...
111121122.title: Only Temporary Shelter

choices: Tiny Bryan flees to the outdoors
Diego spots something tiny
1111211221.content:
Diego directed the nozzle into every nook and cranny in Mr. Smith's kitchen, dousing a cloud of toxins into shadowy crevices to ensure the elimination of hidden pests.

He took considerable time to spray beneath the refrigerator and in a space between the kitchen cabinets and the wall.

Near the door separating the kitchen from the living room, Mr. Smith's bug-sized form finally stirred. His head ached, forcing him to hold his head in his hands for a few moments until the room stopped spinning.

The tiny man remembered trying to leave the house as a passenger on Tommy's foot, only to be thrown off and knocked senseless.

As he tried to collect his thoughts, he heard a loud, hissing noise. He turned in the direction of the sound and saw Diego's hulking form looming on the horizon as the large exterminator worked at the other end of the kitchen. The little man saw the large nozzle spray forth a fog of poison from the reserves housed inside the colossal canister.

With a jolt of fear, the shrunken man recalled the exterminator's remarks to Tommy about the toxic spray not leaving any bugs standing.

In his present circumstances, the tiny scientist imagined he would fare as poorly against the effects of the spray as any bug.

"I've got to get out of here," he said, struggling to get to his feet despite his dizziness.

As he watched, he noticed Diego's methodical approach to his work. The titanic exterminator coated every surface with a liberal squirt of insecticide. Soon, the entire house would be lethal!

While he still had time to do so, the little man considered escaping outside. The thought of being so tiny in a gigantic world terrified him, but not quite as much as facing extermination from a rain of toxic chemicals.

"If I get outside, I just have to get to Tommy's house," he reasoned. "He can help me."

Still, even getting across his neighbor's yard was a feat comparable to a trek through the wilderness.

As he debated, Diego got closer...
1111211221.title: Choices

choices: Diego stomps outside
Bryan encounters something worse than ants
11112112211.content:
Diego held the nozzle firmly as he sprayed the powerful chemicals on the baseboard.

The few stray ants that he caught in the spray writhed and shriveled in pain as the cruel poison took effect. The hulking exterminator showed casual indifference to the tiny ants suffering, they were just insignificant bugs after all.

Sidestepping, his heavy black work boots thumped loudly, some unnoticed ants found themselves crushed under the thick tread.

Continuing his ant Armageddon, Diego rapidly neared the kitchen door, where a miniscule scientist watched in awe.

__________

The tiny scientist stood at the base of the colossal door, a tiny speck smaller than a grain of rice.

He stared in stupified awe at the huge moving mountain of muscle in the distance. The massive young exterminator dominated the room with his presence, his heavy steps reverberating through the floor.

Bryan had little choice if he didn't flee. Either suffer a slow death from the horrific poison, or end up under a massive work boot. None of them were appealing, this titanic young man was too dangerous and obviously wouldn't take a closer look before spraying.

Turning to the unfathomable door, a door he used only this morning, Bryan looked for any means of escape.

His searching eyes widened as he approached the far right side of the door. A small crack in the moulding, barely noticeable to a normal person, stood at least 10 feet tall and a good many feet wide.

"So, that's how the ants were getting in..." He muttered, noticing the hulking ants escaping through the crack.

A heavy boom, followed by vibrations caused tiny Bryan to remember his plight, a quick backwards glance showing the huge, threatening Diego looming directly behind. Bryan jumped into action at the terrifying sight, hearing the ominous roar of the spraying poison.

He swiftly darted past a slow moving group of ants, and he ducked into the cavernous crack. Barely a second later, a thunderous boom shook the ground as a gargantuan work boot crashed down outside, mercilessly flattening the slow ants underneath. The thick, scuffed sole was covered in dirt and creaked as it supported the colossal man's weight.

The tiny man ran through the dark passage with blind hysteria. A loud explosion was heard from behind as the huge exterminator blasted the crevice with chemicals.

Bryan dramatically burst through the exit, stumbling, and landing adage distance from the exiting crack as a plume of poisonous gas seeped out.

Shaking, and with heaving breath, tiny Mr. Smith sat up and looked around.

The crevice had occurred naturally from the house settling with age, but was made usable by industrious ants in search of sustenance. They entered from a concealed location in the dirt surrounding the cement platform just outside the kitchen door. Bryan looked at the looming cement side, before he considered it too small and had thought about expanding it into a porch.

Glad to be alive, the tiny scientist thought about his next coarse of action.
11112112211.title: The Ant Armageddon

choices: His struggles attract notice...
The spider doesn't appear
111121122112.content:
Behind him lay the cavernous crack he had just escaped from, poison lazily pluming from it. Bryan had come incredibly close to being obliterated like ant ant by the exterminator that he contracted. Now, he was safe outside... Or so he hoped.

Yard work never much suited the busy genius. Besides his personal reasons, his hiring of Tommy to mow his lawn was out of necessity. He had never paid the teenager to do anything else, which left the rest of the yard rather weedy and forgotten. It never mattered before, but now it was all too apparent to the shrunken man.

"These weeds have really gotten out of hand..." His eyes studied a huge tree-like thistle, with spiky plumage. Surrounding the wretched plant was a forest of small grass-like weeds that looked like some kind of twisted forest to Bryan. This large foliage was still small compared to the looming cement steps nearby.

Looking back, Bryan knew he had no choice but to find some sort of refuge out here while the enormous exterminator worked. A shady spot in the grass forest would be suitable, then later he could return back through the cave to his kitchen. "This somehow works out, I won't have to worry about the ants when I go back in."

He knew he was being hopeful, but regardless, Bryan tried to make the best of his situation. The exterminator was just doing his job after all, right? Bryan still cringed at the thought of his close call, despite himself.

The brittle weeds were larger than he initially thought as he walked among them. Passing large boulder sized pebbles, and massive crumpled leaves, he marveled at his surroundings. It was all so alien to him. That this strange, hostile environment was only a small part of his neglected back yard. Thoughts, fears, and regrets filled his mind as he continued into the tangle of gigantic weeds.

Suddenly, he wretched to a stop. A sticky, almost wet, substance coated the better part of his right arm. "What the...!" He wriggled the arm in fury. It was no use, his limb was tightly stuck.

Stepping forwards, his right leg suddenly became stuck. Bryan squirmed in confused anger, his eyes widening with horror as he looked around him.

The entirety of his immediate area was coated in intricate silken strands, glistening with sticky strength. It was a cavern of the stuff, and the tiny man knew what it meant. "Spider!" Ants larger than he was were dead and bundled, even a decomposed dragonfly the size of a 747 hung loosely above. No movie could ever have hoped to capture the mortifying sight for the normal-sized person to see.

Further on a dark hole of glimmering silk rested just under a massive leaf. Bryan swallowed roughly, knowing full well the monstrous creature was undoubtedly inside.

He needed to get away before the arachnid discovered him!
111121122112.title: Something worse...

choices: The spider lunges
Something happens
1111211221121.content:
"...spider silk is stronger than steel..." The line rang in his mind as he vainly tried to free his arm and leg. He had read, or heard it somewhere, never considering that he would experience its terrific strength first hand. It was only something insects had to worry about... But, Bryan was smaller than most insects now, the gigantic exterminator almost killed him like some common ant.

These thoughts heightened his panic, causing his struggles to become more violent. The gluey substance covered the bare skin of his arm, and held him by his pant leg. Many minutes passed and his efforts proved fruitless, only rewarding him in exhaustion.

Goose bumps tingled his skin, and he felt noticed a large shape emerging from the darkness ahead. Eight spindly legs carried the common grass spider out into the open. It was the easily the most terrifying thing Bryan had laid eyes on, covered in oily brown hairs, gnashing mandibles, and overall huge in size. The worst part for the tiny man was when the many twinkling eyes seemed to bore right into him.

Bryan vainly squealed for help. His stomach churned furiously as he whipped himself about, trying to escape.
1111211221121.title: Not the kind of attention he wanted

choices: Diego begins spraying chemicals
Diego stomps off in search of the ant nest
11112112211212.content:
""No, no! I don't want to die!" A nightmare come true, trapped by in a web, face-to-face with a giant spider. Nothing could be more grisly than the demise that awaited him.

The spider stood still, considering this strange new prey. It seemed helpless, and the pitiful squeaks the wiggling creature made seemed to quell any fear in the large arachnid.

With practiced steps, the large ghastly spider approached.

----

Diego released the trigger on the spraying mechanism as he coated the last corner of the infested kitchen.

He surveyed the room listlessly. With sharp precision, the young man had sprayed the powerful chemicals in all the likely crannies. His gaze stopped at the base of the back door. A tiny crack in the plaster had caught his attention earlier, ants had been crawling into it.

Approaching it, Diego crouched down to investigate it again. A tiny ant still moved among dozens of dead ants, struggling against the fatal poison near the crack. He smashed it under his thumb, and covered the minuscule crack with some quick-dry putty.

"That is how they were getting in." He thought, standing back up. "Probably a nest of them outside." More often than not this was the case, and they would return if not dealt with. The owner, Mr. Smith, would surely want the infestation dealt with thoroughly.

The exterminator hoisted the canister of chemicals on his shoulder, and stifled a yawn as he pulled the back door open. Pebbles crunched under his boots as he stood on the cement block outside, looking around.

Diego had no way of knowing what his presence meant to the home owner...

---

Bryan had closed his eyes in an attempt to distance himself from his fate. He was going to be eaten by a spider that lived in the weeds in his back yard, and he was helpless to stop it.

A loud sound echoed from his left. The huge spider halted, timidly crouching only a dozen feet away. From his captivity, Bryan watched in awe as his kitchen door opened. Heavy booms were felt when the enormous exterminator stepped out onto the cement platform.

Forgetting all about his previous danger, the shrunken scientist gawked up at the huge man. An impossibly looming titan in green work coveralls, the young guy's presence dominated everything. Bryan watched from his tiny spot in the forest of tall weeds. The exterminator seemed to be scanning the ground near the door, his face shadowed by a company baseball cap.

When the huge face looked down, seemingly right at him, Bryan felt his heart leap. "I'm here! Yes! Help me, please!" It seemed so impossible, but surely... The titanic face showed no recognition, only the hard emotionless gaze of a labourer. A chill ran down his spine as the realization of this new situation set in.

The once imposing spider quickly fled to the safety of it's nest. Bryan watched it vanish into the darkness helplessly, before looking back up. Lifting over the edge of the towering concrete platform, soared a humongous black work boot.

BOOM!!!

With tremendous force it crashed down on the weeds. The leafy weed that housed the spider were mercilessly flattened under the boot. Bryan was sent reeling back as the webbing crumbled, his cries of shock tiny and unnoticeable. Shortly, a second explosive step shook the ground.

Bryan whimpered painfully, watching the gargantuan boot that almost crushed him shift. The ground, weeds, and everything else were destroyed by the thick tread. Somehow things have gotten worse for him.

The huge exterminator now loomed directly overhead, work boots callously planted into the ground, legs continuing endlessly up, and a massive hand wielding an ominous spray gun.
11112112211212.title: Imposing

choices: Find another way to get back inside his home
An even bigger spider has been watching and waiting
111121122112122.content:
The huge exterminator, his massive body covered by his coveralls uniform, planted his legs far apart and surveyed the backyard.

"Damn, this place is a jungle," he said, removing his baseball cap and showing a dome covered with short-cropped dark hair. "No wonder this guy's got a problem with bugs."

Below him, unseen, tiny Bryan Smith slowly realized he was still alive.

Spared the titan's merciless stomp, the tiny man tried to regain full control over his terrified mind. He needed to focus more than ever if he hoped to get out of this perilous situation.

Pushing him away from the brink of panic was the fact that the titanic hunk had frightened away the murderous arachnid. Of course, if the spider was wise enough to flee from Diego's massive work boots, perhaps the shrunken scientist would have done well to follow the creature's example.

Fleeing the titan, however, didn't do anything to help him get back to normal size. "I've still got to get his attention," the bug-sized man said.

He had to hope that the massive hand wielding that ominous spray gun didn't suddenly unleash a stray cascade or take a careless step and bring one of those monstrous, earth-shaking boots down on him.

"Well, back to work," Diego said, replacing his baseball cap on his head. He stomped deeper into the jungle of Mr. Smith's back yard, looking to see if he could find the ant's nest and eliminate the problem at its source.

"Oh god," the little man cried. "He's leaving."

The enormous boots sailed overhead as Diego stepped deeper into the unkempt yard. In no time, even the imposing giant vanished, his footsteps getting fainter, leaving the bug-sized scientist alone again.

The little man, without any immediate fear of the exterminator, ran toward his back door. He hoped to get back inside his home and away from the multitude of hazards a tiny speck faced in the great outdoors.

His hopes ran up against a literal barrier when he reached the crack that Diego had sealed with the putty. "What's he done?" Bryan cried. The putty, which had already hardened, removed his access back into his home.

Suddenly, he felt a chill and felt as if all manner of horrible, huge creatures were watching him from the darkness of the thick, twisted vegetation of the jungle that was his yard.
111121122112122.title: Banished

1111211221121222.content:
Huddled in the shadows of a rock at the base of the cement platform, lay another surprise for tiny Bryan Smith.

Eight shiny orbs glinted in the darkness, watching the shrunken scientist's passage. This male wolf spider had taken refuge when it felt the powerful vibrations produced by the gigantic exterminator.

After Diego left, unaware of the destruction he caused simply by walking through the weeds, the spider eyed Bryan. The tiny man was shuffling through the uneven landscape. Being noticeably larger than the grass spider, this new arachnid was a quick and deadly hunter. It would be quick and easy prey.

Bryan felt hopeless. Everything seemed bent on making his situation more miserable. His emotions kept threatening to overwhelm him as he made his way. First and foremost, he needed to get indoors again. It was pure folly to remain outside at his size.

His thoughts had absorbed his attention so much that Bryan didn't notice the large shape dart out from under a nearby rock.

The wolf spider was upon him so quickly that he only stumbled to the ground in response. Bryan looked up at it in speechless horror. He wasn't even allowed the courtesy of a screech before the beast lunged. Bryan's tiny form was snatched up in the cruel mandibles.

A few short thrashes were afforded when a sharp pain was felt on his shoulder and a horrific numbing sensation overtook him. The minuscule man's face was contorted in terror, his mouth releasing a silent scream.

Skittering backwards, the murderous spider carried its weak prey back into the darkness of the rock. Bryan was given one last glimpse of Diego, looming in the distance and spraying a hefty amount of chemicals at the ground.

Then it all went dark.
1111211221121222.title: Bryan's folly

choices: Escape the house
Get the giant's attention
1111211222.content:
When the tiny scientist opened his eyes, he felt pain lance through his body as if someone had stabbed a sharp needle through his skull.

He groaned, struggling into a sitting position on the kitchen tiles. He remembered having accomplished his objective of taking refuge aboard Tommy's gigantic sandal. His hiding spot between two enormous toes, however, hadn't prevented him from being catapaulted into space when his titanic neighbor merely took a few steps across the floor. He remembered being thrown forward, screaming, to slam into a wall.

He groaned again, realizing that after all his valiant effort, his achievement had been erased in the blink of an eye. The little man staggered as he got to his feet, cradling his face in his hands when the enormous room began spinning.

Suddenly, he felt the floor tremble, making him even more unsteady on his feet.

"What the..." The bug-sized scientist's question never got asked as the colossal exterminator returned to the kitchen, the enormous container of toxins strapped to his shoulder.

He felt sick in the pit of his stomach as he stared upward at the terrifying young man and flashed back to the conversation between Diego and Tommy that he had overheard.

Diego's statement about the toxin not leaving any bugs standing played back in the horrified little man's brain.

His bid to escape the house on Tommy's sandal had failed, and now the huge exterminator was ready to rain down a fog of chemicals on him.

Actually, for the moment, Diego was more interested in a snack and a drink.He had spent the past hour spraying in every likely hiding place where bugs might take shelter. He felt he deserved a break.

As he made a surrepitious raid on Mr. Smith's fridge, he had no idea that his actions were being witessed.

The giant's unexpected actions caused the tiny man to rejoice. Unstrapping the tank of bug spray, Diego let it slam to the floor. The impact knocked tiny Mr. Smith off his feet again, but he didn't mind. The giant continued to rummage through the fridge, even removing ingredients to make himself a sandwich.

"This is my chance!" The little man said aloud.

He intended to use this unexpected development to...
1111211222.title: Helping himself to a snack

choices: Diego drops a coldcut  slice on him
Diego sees something tiny
11112112222.content:
Knowing the clock was ticking, the shrunken scientist darted forward, the rough sketch of a plan taking shape in his mind even as he raced across the kitchen tiles.

He hoped he would have time to cross the vast empty space with the giant already distracted. He heard loud noises as Diego removed items from the monolithic fridge. He pulled to a halt and stared at the exterminator's massive work boots. Each boot looked like a city tower constructed of rough, scuffed black leather.

Then, with no warning whatsoever, the boots moved, as Diego took two steps back and closed the door to the fridge.

The tiny man screamed as the massive boots sprang to life, crashing down seemingly right next to him. Then, the boots lifted off the floor, and the giant moved to the kitchen counter with his ill-gotten gain.

When the tiny man recovered from the fright, he took a deep breath and forced himself toward his original destination. In doing so, he came even closer to the boots. He simply had to hope the giant wouldn't soon make any other unexpected movements.

Finally, he reached the base of the counter, which ascended hundreds of feet. He would have had no chance of scaling the vertical cliff if not for the tangle of cords and cables that supplied power to appliances ranging from his microwave to a blender.

Without another thought, he began the climb that, he hoped, would put him on a safer level with a giant.

In the meantime, the giant was on the move again, making the bug-sized man immensely glad he was no longer on the floor.

Diego, having searched the cabinets for a plate, placed a slice of bread on the plate. He was ready to start building a massive sandwich when he wondered if the fridge might contain some mayonnaise.

By ignoring the giant's impressive movements around the room, the tiny man climbed to the counter's surface in good time.

Now, standing far from the dangerous floor, he surveyed the room. He saw the giant on the horizon, the upper part of his huge body once again concealed within the refrigerator.

Tiny Mr. Smith raced across the counter, throwing himself onto the rim of the huge plate, rolling toward a 12-feet-tall brown wall.

Making contact with the slice of bread, he discovered that the porous surface of the bread allowed him convenient handholds.

He pulled himself atop the massive slice of bread just as the giant turned back toward the counter. The behemoth moved with a shocking grace that stood in sharp contrast to his overwhelming size.

Although he felt the need to run, or at least hide, the tiny scientist stood his ground.

He would make his stand in the center of the bread slice, the place the giant would be sure to look and notice him.

He knew he was taking a big gamble, but the alternative was to wait for Diego to douse him with a blast of bug spray.
11112112222.title: Making a stand

Diego was holding the sandwich level with his stomach

Tiny Bryan would make his stand in the center of the bread slice, the place the giant would be sure to look and notice him.

By climbing onto the piece of bread, the tiny scientist knew he was taking a big risk, but the only alternative was to wait for Diego to douse him with a blast of bug spray. He shuddered at the very thought.

No, he decided. Better to take his stand in the center of the bread slice, the one place the giant would surely notice him.

-----

------

The little man felt dismay, disappointment and then a sudden jolt of shock as the giant exterminator dropped the turkey slice on top of him. The heavy slice of deli meat smashed him headfirst onto the spongy surface of the bread.

The frightened little man realized he had been trapped between the major ingredients on the giant's sandwich. He had to escape before the inevitable happened. He tried to crawl forward, but his progress proved slow.

He began enjoying some forward momentum when he felt the entire sandwich sway.

That could only mean that Diego had lifted up the sandwich and was preparing to eat.

"No!" The shrunken scientist screamed, trying to force his way from his prison between bread and meat on the enormous sandwich.

He finally reached the edge of the slice of bread, poked his head out and saw...
111121122221.title: Getting the drop on him

Trying to climb back out
1111211222212.content:
Having fought and clawed his way out of the sandwich, the tiny man emerged along the edge of the lower slice of bread.

Gazing forward, he saw the a field of dull green that rose and fell with a steady rhythm. He blinked, then re-focused. He realized then that he was staring at the green shirt that comprised part of Diego's uniform.

He saw something else as well. An enormous silver belt buckle fastened at the front of the green pants worn by the youthful, handsome exterminator. The grille of the elaborate buckle was tantalizingly close. A well-timed leap and he could leave behind the sandwich and all the related perils associated with it and a hungry giant.

He knew he had mere seconds to come to a decision. Not trusting his chances as part of the sandwich, he pushed his way out and made a valiant leap.

He succeeded in reach the huge buckle, but by then the giant exterminator moved again. He tried to grab part of the metal grille, but his hand slipped.

Diego pulled out a chair and was taking a seat at the kitchen table. Unknown to him, his actions propelled the tiny man toward the waistband of the uniform's green pants. His headlong plunge sent him directly into the fabric crevice.

Diego stomps nearby, exiting the room
111121122222.content:
Diego prepared to open the jar of mayonnaise when he noticed a tiny black dot jumping around on the surface of his sandwiche. He leaned in closer to examine it, setting the condiment jar on the counter.

His brow furrowed in annoyance as he came to the conclusion that the tiny speck was a pesky little ant foraging for food on his sandwiche. Diego rose back up to his full stature, and lifted his huge hand in preparation to deal with the bug. Propping his index finger, he casually flicked the miniscule creature back onto the floor where he could deal with it later.

----------

Tiny Mr. Smith yelled as loud as he could, his voice cracking from the strain, in an attempt to get the colossal exterminator's attention. He was just about to adjust his method, when he heard a deep grunt, and realized the behemoth was looking right at him.

"Yes! Please, help me!" he screamed.

He stumbled backwards as the giant young man leaned in closer, his huge face encompasing his view. Bryan whimpered in fear as a hurricane of breath bombarded him, smelling of beer and cigarettes.

"I need help! Please!" Bryan yelled, nervous that the giant exterminator looked annoyed.

A gust of wind blew him off his feet as the titanic man returned to his full height. Mr. Smith craned his head back once again to see the face of the looming exterminator. This gaze was cut short suddenly as a gigantic finger nail appeared directly in-front of him, and before Mr. Smith could scream, rushed forward with a colossal amount of force sending him flying.

He felt like a rag doll sucked into a turbine as he hurtled through the air. Suddenly, he blacked out.

Tiny Mr. Smith awoke to a strange tickling sensation. He jumped back in surprise as he realized the rods tickling him belong to a SVU-sized ant that was investigating him with its antennae. Looking all around him, Bryan realized there were dozens of ants crawling around. The ants didn't seem particularly interested in him.

His body ached from the collision with the fingernail and the floor. He didn't have much time to appreciate the huge insects, or nurse his battered body, when he heard, and felt a heavy BOOM. BOOM.

A shadow fell over Bryan and the ants.

1111212.content:
The colossal man's work boots stomped down with such force that the helpless, shrunken scientist could easily have erroneously concluded he was in the midst of a violent earthquake.

The one shred of luck on his side was that the exterminator avoided his spot on the floor and stepped toward the refrigerator, using one muscular arm to effortlessly swing open the door on the fridge.

"What the hell's he doing now?" Tiny Mr. Smith watched and wondered.

The titan removed an enormous dark bottle. It looked unreal in the guy's enormous hand.

The tiny scientist watched as the exterminator screwed the lid off the beer bottle and took a long drink.

The little man also realized this was his best chance to get himself out of harm's way. With the giant's attention occupied, he sprinted across the floor toward the distant baseboards that trimmed the bottom of the kitchen walls.

He hadn't gone far when something else unexpected happened...
1111212.title: Right at home

choices: Tommy stomps toward door
Carlos stomps over to the counter
11112121.content:
The opening of the back door took the enormous exterminator by surprise. Carlos put the bottle down on the kitchen counter and wipe his mouth with the sleeve of his uniform.

"Who are you?" Tommy asked, stepping into the kitchen and closing the door behind him.

Carlos gave the teenager his most winning grin. "Mi hermano," he said in greeting. "I work with Patton Pest Control."

Tommy saw the man's uniform, as well as some of his equipment.

Meanwhile, on the floor, the teenager's shrunken employer gazed up at Tommy with renewed hope. "That's my boy, Tommy," Mr. Smith shouted. "Just tell him to leave. Tell him…"

"Oh, well, that's OK," Tommy said, dashing the tiny man's hope for a quick resolution of the problem of the giant exterminator. "I'm just here to get a package that Mr. Smith asked me to mail for him."

Carlos spied the small package on the table. "Is that it?"

"Yeah, it looks like it," Tommy said, crossing the room and picking up the package in one hand.

Tiny Mr. Smith realized his antidote, the only way to regain his proper size, was about to be removed from his reach. "No! Tommy! It's a mistake! I need that!"

Despite the vulnerability of his situation, the bug-sized man sprinted across the kitchen floor, intent on gaining Tommy's assistance in the urgent task of reversing his fate.

"So, Mr. Smith has a bug problem?" Tommy inquired.

Carlos shook his head. "No, nothing like that. This is just a monthly maintenance visit."

Neither of the titans noticed the little, pale bug that sprinted over the tiles...
11112121.title: Tommy finally arrives

111121211.content:
The tiny man continued to scream his futile protests.

"Tommy, just tell him to leave," the bug-sized scientist screamed.

As he sprinted over his kitchen tiles, his tiny, pale form blended well with the mottled, subdued coloring of the floor. He was making his way toward Tommy, although the towering teenager filled his tiny form with trepidation.

"SO, MR. SMITH HAS A PROBLEM WITH BUGS?"

Diego smiled and explained that his visit is simply part of a monthly prevention program.

Mr. Smith knew that he couldn't allow Tommy to leave with the package now. He would be stranded bug-sized without that antidote.

"Help me!" He yelled. Settled into a spot on the floor in front of Tommy's sneakers, the tiny man leaped wildly and waved. "Down here!"

When Tommy appeared to glance down, the tiny man celebrated. "That's my boy! Please, see me."

But Tommy just raised his eyes again when Diego asked another question.

"So, what's in the package?"

Tommy shrugged. "Dunno. Must be important. But Mr. Smith's one weird dude, so no telling. You ever met him?"

"Yeah, when he first hired me," Diego answered. "And he was a little weird. Kept staring at my fucking boots!"

Tommy and Diego shared a laugh that frustrated the tiny speck at their mighty feet.

Despite the peril inherent in his situation, the bug-sized professor sprinted closer to the teenager's shoes.

"What the hell?" The tiny man complained. "Why the hell would they think I'm weird?"

"I should really get going," Tommy said, and spared a glance at his feet. "What the..."

He squinted as something pale and puny scurried near his sneakers.

"I think your monthly preventative program might be missing a few, dude," Tommy informed the exterminator.

"Whatcha mean?" Diego asked, and looked at the floor when Tommy pointed at the scurrying little pest.

"There's always a few odd bugs," he said. "Why don't you do the honors?"

"Sure," Tommy said, lifting his closest shoe.

"No, wait!" Mr. Smith cried out. He turned away from the titanic teenager, sprinting as fast as tiny legs could carry him.

The vast kitchen looms all around him, and he scans desperately for shelter. The barren space is devoid of any hiding places within easy reach.

A shadow falls over him, and he looks over his shoulder as Tommy lowers his sneaker. He can see all sorts of debris he would never have noticed at normal size that has been smashed into the rubber soles of the colossal sneaker.

"Tommy, it's me! Don't step on me!"

"Wait!" Diego shouted at the last minute, thinking that perhaps he should identify the species of bug in order to know if he has to deal with something new.

It's too late, however. Tommy has already stomped down.

"What is it?" The confused teenager asked.

"Just should have checked to see what kind of bug that was," Diego said.

He dropped down on one knee. "Lift your foot."

Tommy obeyed, but Diego sighed in disgust. There wasn't enough left of the pitiful bug to even attempt to identify it. Tommy's stomp had been very accurate and had pulverized the big beyond recognition.

When the teenager lowered his foot, Diego joked with him.

"Once you're out of school, you should come work for me. You've got a real talent for exterminating."
111121211.title: Tommy's new profession

Stomp the bug
111121212.content:
With a fluid motion that caused his muscles to ripple and flex beneath his tight uniform, the gigantic exterminator walked toward Mr. Smith's kitchen counter. The kitchen's so often a hiding place for all sorts of pests, so he was being very thorough.

He just hadn't counted on anyone else being home when he made his monthly maintenance stoop.

He had no idea of the jaw-dropping awe and unmitigated terror that his few simple strides across the room caused the tiny, unseen owner of the home.

The shrunken scientist had dashed across the tiles making a direct line toward his teenaged neighbor. No matter what, he needed to prevent Tommy leaving with the package that contained the precious antidote.

"Without that, I'm screwed," the bug-sized scientist realized in desperation.

Despite his good start, however, his progress came to a screeching halt when Carlos in his gigantic work boots stomped across the floor.

When one of the massive shoes stomped down hard on the floor, the kitchen tile beneath the tiny man's feet shook from great force. The shock wave caused him to fall, sprawled out on the unforgiving tile.

Then, without any appreciable time to recover, the little man had to contend with another of the massive boots slamming down. This time, the huge, black boot slammed down even closer, and a blast of displaced air tossed the shrunken man bodily through the air to land closer to Tommy.


Looking up at his colossal teenaged neighbor, the little man saw that Tommy's hand was poised to open the back door.

"Dammit," he screamed. He got back onto his feet and tore off toward the massive teenager. "Stop! Don't go!" He screamed. "Please, wait!"

Before he left, however, Tommy had one last question for Carlos.

"So, is it going to be safe to come back in here in a few hours?"

He had promised to water Mr. Smith's plants, but he really just wanted a place to hang out with his buddies that lacked parental supervision.

"Oh, sure," Carlos said. He squirted a stream of toxin beneath the base of the kitchen counter and cabinets. "This stuff won't harm anything but bugs."

The two titans remained on the move, which presented a daunting problem for the tiny, unnoticed man at their feet.

"Please, look down!" Mr. Smith begged.

"Well, catch you later," Tommy said. The teenager pulled open the back door and headed toward the post office.

Carlos was about finished when he spied a pale little creature near the massive back door. Perhaps some little pest that had scurried into the house during Tommy's departure.

Routinely, mechanically, he decided to....
111121212.title: Bug among Giants

choices: Crawl beneath door and wander dazed in the giant yard
Exterminator means to block bug's escape
1111212121.content:
The gigantic man used his right hand to point the nozzle on the cylinder of toxin strapped across his shoulder. The bug presented a moving target as it fled toward the crack beneath the backdoor.

"JUST WHERE DO YOU THINK YOU'RE GOING?" He said in a teasing tone as he aimed the cylinder nozzle and squeezed the trigger grip.

Faced with the giant exterminator advancing on him, all thoughts of trying to establish a line of communication with the titanic man vanished. Shrunken Bryan Smith ran toward the narrow crevice between floor and door. It led outside into an even vaster world than he had yet encountered, but he didn't care. In a few more inches, he would be able to make his escape.

The stream of toxin splashed on the tiles so close to the fleeing little man that the splash doused his skin with droplets of the lethal liquid. The substance burned like acid against his bare skin, but he raced faster toward the door.

He heard a loud grunt of irritation as the giant realized he had missed. No matter. He simply aimed and sprayed again, this time successfully blasting the stream of toxic fluids onto the tiny pest.

The shrunken scientist went blind from the searing pain in his eyes, stumbling, falling, writhing on the kitchen tiles. The toxin burned his throat and lungs, robbing him of untainted air as he struggled to breathe.

He managed to crawl the remaining inch to the underside of the giant door...
1111212121.title: Sprayed

choices: His wait for Tommy is interrupted by bugs
Begin the journey to Tommy's home
11112121211.content:
If only he had managed to acquire his pre-shrunk clothing, he might have managed to evade the worst effects of the toxic chemical.

The spray had completely enveloped the bug-sized man, scalding his skin with its abrasive chemicals. He stumbled forward with his vision reduce to a red haze, desperate to keep moving, still clinging to the hope that he could escape beneath his enormous kitchen door.

At the same time he heard the giant's fearful roars and grunts as he continued his single-minded effort to eradicate the pale pest he had spied on the floor.


As he tried to breathe, fresh air create pain in his toxin-seared lungs.

Water… I need to rinse this stuff off me…


Where to find water, especially at his size, was quite a challenge.

•••••

The enormous pest eradicator swung open the door, looking for any sign of the pale speck. The hurricane-strength draft spawned by the sudden opening of the door, however, had swept the tiny man into the air and deposited him at the base of the two concrete steps outside the door. The impact was none too gentle, but by falling between building-sized boulders of gravel, the shrunken, naked scientist managed to avoid detection by the giant.

"I'VE GOT WORK TO DO," he said. "I can't be worrying about one freakin' bug."

He slammed the door closed, a sound that rang in the little man's ears. He tried to rouse himself, but his head remained swimming from the toxin that continued to work on Mr. Smith's system.

That's when he saw the coiled garden hose, still connected to the outside spigot. One end of the house was draped over the ground, providing an opening into a long tunnel of green plastic. He didn't know how much longer he could remain conscious as he clambered over the lip of the enormous hose and pushed deeper. He felt ecstatic when his bare feet splashed through puddles of water. In a mix of relief expressed by tears and giddy laughter, he got on his knees and splashed water into his eyes to rinse out the poison. When that soothed his eyes, he began to roll around in the puddle of water collected inside the hose, trying to remove the coating of insecticide from his bug-sized form.

"I did it," he said in a weaker voice.

Damn bug spray's not gonna get the better of me.


Still, he needed to plan his next move. Should he simply wait for Tommy. The teenager would eventually return. Or, he could be proactive and undertake a trek across the wilderness of the backyard, which was all that separated his home from the residence of Tommy and his family.

He could have tried to get back into his own home, but the thought of that stomp-happy exterminator caused him to shudder.

Going back inside, for the moment, wasn't an option.
11112121211.title: Escape

choices: Scampered away as something huge approached
Fell upon the tiny man!
111121212111.content:
"Oh no, they're everywhere!" Bryan cried.

His hands against both cheeks, Bryan looked around to realize the water-logged clearing was populated with ants. Bryan yelped, stumbling out of the path of one ant that came barreling past, whipping around antennae that could easily break Bryan's tiny neck.

The streaming herd of beastly bugs came from a jagged crack between the concrete steps and the foundation of Bryan's home. "I-I-I had no idea...! There are so many of them, all coming from my kitchen wall! Gross!" For but a moment, the tiny man was glad the exterminator had arrived and begun his work. Gulping, Bryan remembered he was now in the same danger as the invasive pests, and that his hard-working exterminator he paid was now over 4000 feet tall and bent on destroying all life, insect or not!

He shuddered again just thinking of the humongous man and his gigantic work boots.

"I'd better just-..." His vocalized thought suddenly cut off with choke yelp as the shrunken man was sent spiraling to the moist ground.

One of the ants stood over him, clicking and shifting fiercely. Bryan screamed at it, realizing those greasy mandibles could easy tear him asunder. The over-sized bug smacked him with both antennae many times. Each time more painful than the last as the insect tried to determine the tiny scientist's identity. He batted them away, only managing to bruise his arms, and cause the terrifying monster to scuttle closer.

"No! Get away from me you bulbous-eyed fucker!"

The ant paid little attention to the insult and...
111121212111.title: A herd of ants

choices: A huge work boot loom overhead
The huge exterminator begins spraying the ants and
1111212121112.content:
One antennae slapped squarely upon Bryan's forehead, sending the tiny man's vision into a swirl of darkness and flashing light. He yelped, trying to bat away more blows. His genius mind swam, concussed, but around a single thought: this was it! He was going to be bludgeoned to death by a fucking ant the size of his car.

That immediately became somewhat preferable when Bryan's defensive swipes with his right arm came to an abrupt halt. Warning pain and alarm shot through his body, eliciting yet another screech. His tender, thin arm was held firmly between two rugged, wickedly shaped mandibles that clamped his arm like a machine.

"Grr-uuck! No...! No!" Bryan protested, pulling weakly. He first heard it before intense sensation tore a horrific scream from the shrunken scientist's tiny lips.

CRRRR-UNCH!

"SHIIIIIIT!"

Merely something as slight as tightening both mandibles, the ant easily shattered Bryan's arm in twain. It was held just above the elbow, now twisted unnaturally with fingers twitching sporadically.

The ant decided the next course of action, if it was even capable of decision beyond mere instinctive reaction. It began tugging Bryan, pulling his almost upright as it attempted to gain a better hold. Such a strange, seemingly exotic catch would be a prize to present to the hive in this trying time. Bryan wanted to struggle, but his vision blurred again, blinking in and out. He was helpless.

Yet, this fate was still not to be. Dull sensation rumbled through the earth itself, alerting all the fleeing ants of what came not a moment after.

High above the water-saturated plain of dirt and weeds, the looming portal of Bryan's backdoor seemed to tremble with anticipation before violently pulling inwards with tumultuous effect. Muted quakes rattled through the landscape as one behemoth figure exited, huge boots slamming upon the cement plateau above them. The gargantuan exterminator surveyed the worldscape of Bryan's backyard, his lower face obscured by a huge face mask and the upper shadowed beneath a baseball cap. Bryan was cruelly dropped by the ant, who joined the trail of ants escaping towards the lawn, seemingly miles away. He lay there, large ants skittering past and gazed up at the massive man he hired.

The guy had been attractive, in a sort of rough tradesman sort of way, and the company he worked for was both trustworthy and fairly priced. Afterall, Bryan gave them access to his home. And always resulting in a thorough job. None of that mattered anymore. This guy seemed like nothing short of a monster. One that wrought wanton destruction without any thought -- neither cruelty or empathy played any part, it was just a job plain and simple.

Which seemed perfectly reasonable until Bryan found himself on the losing side with the ants.

He clutched his fractured arm, wincing but thankful to be freed of the large insect, and gazing upwards at the vertigo-inducing visage of the gigantic exterminator. Bryan felt a cold rush goose-pimple his flesh when the otherworldly face looked down, seemingly right at him. Distant shifting echoed from above before one work boot lifted and soared over the towering precipice of cement. It crashed down to the dirt below, landing with a quaking thud.

"Oh hell...no, no, no," Bryan said, between gasps fueled by pain and the thought that this gargantuan man meant to flatten the landscape beneath his huge boots. "Help me...please, just help me. I'll do anything--give you anything!"

Not that this guy was purposefully doing this. Not that he wanted to extract funds from the shrunken genius in exchange for his life. Realistically, the huge man would immediately stop his work if he knew of Bryan's plight. The guy was just doing his job -- what Bryan had paid him to do.

Bryan hobbled to his feet, dizzy, and watched as darkness overtook him and acres upon acres of terrain. His fears of death intensified as the giant's boot shifted, groaning beneath immense weight and pressing toe-first in the dirt while the heel rose up. Gazing up, he realized the behemoth was getting closer...crouching! Exhilaration pumped through his tiny body, mixing with adrenaline to further block out his fractured pain, and filling Bryan with hope. Surely he had been seen!

"Thank fuck! Oh, my god, thank fuck! I'm...-I'm..." Tiny peals of relief faded as Bryan found his tiny perspective utterly overwhelmed by the enormous mountain of man lowering closer and closer. Yelling to god seemed ridiculous god himself seemed to be looming right above him. Closer and closer the giant lowered, his topographic visage becoming more like the geography than face.
