choices: Bryan dislodges, falling back to the floor
Bryan is taken for the ride of his life
11211122212212121212112.content:
Was it divine intervention that gave Bryan the super-human stamina, or just pure adrenaline? He wasn't sure. It allowed him to sprint forward and scream with such ferocity that this had to be the climactic end of his outlandish journey.

Unfortunately, "the climactic end" could go completely different than what the shrunken genius wanted.

A mere speck upon a vast, barren wasteland of concrete, squeaking and squealing with such high-pitched vocal chords that the sound was all but entirely inaudible to the looming, oblivious behemoth of a man. The ground shuddered, a dull crash following the concussive shift of one huge sneaker that moved mere inches. Attention turned to the other sneaker, which groaned beneath intense weight, the colossal man adjusting his weight in preparation for movement. His shrunken sprint for rescue faltered, tiny feet skidding and changing direction. A literal mountain rose off the floor, lifted high by an endless tower of leg that directed the huge sneaker towards Bryan’s location.

Bryan screamed in vain for any shred of attention, but all he received was the distant jawline of a massive being utterly oblivious and incomprehensible in size. Then the sky was absorbed completely, dark shadow utterly drenching an enormous acreage of floor with one unnoticed speck of humanity lost within.

Huge square lugs crossed with an aggressive S-Trac design soared above, crafted from dulled tan rubber, worn down as it framed the huge bold logo “GLOBE” spanning from seemingly across the entirety. Boulders both larger and smaller than Bryan disfigured the hard rubber lugs, wedged among cemented dirt and horrifically smashed, pulverized insects that were embedded and dotted the canyonesque tread like bodies tangled on a battlefield. As a whole, it was simply too big to visualize at once. A nightmarish upside-down world looming overhead, all on display like a vast graveyard to would-be victims below.

Then it descended. Heel first, contorting Bryan’s minuscule perspective as it slammed down with roaring, concussive impact. Huge gaps in the worn lugs zoomed closer, becoming defined as Bryan was immediately absorbed beneath.

As if swept beneath a mountain slide, the shrunken man’s body was forced to fit between a debris-ridden space, held tight by harsh, chalky dirt around his legs, something chunky and squishy around his head, and the rest pressed hard against rigid, abrasive rubber. Air pressure increased, enough to make his ears pop and head throb painfully. Pressure all over. And warmth, which surprised him in his shocked state. Warmth radiated from above, creating an even more uncomfortable environment. It was too much. Bryan felt his body trembling, nearing convulsions as he panicked. His screams were unreal, feeling like something out of a dream. Tears, mucus, spit pooling.

He was a human being. A genius among them! No. Not anymore, it seemed. Now...what was he truly? What had he done to himself? Reduced to yet another of many unnoticed insects...lives...that ended up beneath this huge, towering, behemoth's vast skate shoe? His fantasies and ridiculous dreams kept hitting Bryan like cruel icy waves. This unknown titan didn't even know Bryan existed. How could he?

Any hope the tiny man might have retained was being squeezed out of him like a sponge. The pressure, weight, pain only worsened: the weight increased, signaled by deep, powerful groans from above his horrific prison. Bryan felt a heavy, dull vibration rattle the floor before-...

Sccccrrrrraaaallllllccccchhhh…

It was quiet at first, getting louder as the intense weight seemed to lessen and lift. Louder and louder, then Bryan felt the impossibly dense rubber seem to flex before the cement pressing into him from below pulled away. Air rushed through, light pouring in. Bryan gasped, immediately following with a scream. The ground kept pulling further away, his head spinning and ears ringing with the roaring squelch as the treads lifted off.

Bryan’s lungs sucked in less than he screamed out, utterly and completely absorbed with panic.
11211122212212121212112.title: A simple step

choices: Explore the huge store for more options
The giant returns
Other possibilities and dangers
112111222122121212121121.content:
Gravity tried to pull him towards the receding world below. It was working, bits of debris crumbled around him, joining a varied shower dislodging all over the vast tread. Bryan felt his body shifting, one leg freed and dangling, then another.

There was one problem with this: he was now many dozen feet in the air, rising fast.

He used a free arm to grab at some smashed debris around his head. It felt hard, even hairy beneath his fingers. Clutching it for a moment before it too shifted, cracking with a gooey snap. Something large came with it, and Bryan hung on as both he and what he held onto dangled free for a moment, his eyes locking with what seem a glassy crystalline gaze set in a mutilated mask of dark greasy armor. An alien -- some kind of monster out of science fiction!

No -- A fucking ant.

“No! No! NO!”

Then both fell free, dropping into gusty freefall to the world below as the enormous Globe sneaker loomed above, rising higher and higher with the roaring winds. The fall lasted mere moments. Bryan’s screams painfully cut off with a dull impact upon hard concrete. His breath was knocked out, allowing only sporadic gasps while he watched what resembled industrial topography of deep geometric ravines soar far overhead. It flashed memories of the huge spaceships from space films, rushing over the viewer with the intensity of a hurricane.

Bryan read the mammoth letters boldly cast in dark, dusty rubber as they rushed overhead: G....L....O….B….E. One fucking word that for some reason made this all the more terrifying.

Without further fanfare, like the tail-end of a huge plane as it took off, it was gone. Soaring off in the distance at an alarming, yet seemingly sluggish rate. Then the ground lurched and the air shuddered with a concussive boom as it slammed down. Moments later, the second followed and again...and again.

Trembling, Bryan had to remind himself that he just experienced was nothing but this titanic man walking. Simply taking a step. A fucking step. It made him shake all the more. The amount of god-like power and destructive force behind it absolutely jellied his mind. This man; This otherwise regular guy was an absolute force of nature, an omnipotent being that seemed incapable of anything but capricious destruction. More despotic god than anything Bryan could have ever related to. Bryan was nearly killed....atomized beneath what seemed more mountain than footwear. Murdered, and yet would it have been murder? Was he substantial enough to garner such a crime?

Bryan shuddered again, feeling duller quakes through the ground from the now unseen giant.

“What have I done to myself….? Oh my god…”

Just next to him lay Bryan’s tread-mate. He scuttled away from the sickeningly effaced ant splayed before him. It curdled Bryan’s blood as the most horrifying sight he’d ever seen. All gore and guts. Far worse than the dried smear he had stepped in before -- this one had been alive recently. Doing weird, pointless, but living ant business before it was reduced to a crushed, eviscerated mess of body parts looking more at home in a Cronenberg film than real life. And Bryan could have easily ended up the same way. Only by some twist of fate had he chanced to be wedged between the massive rubber treads and not atomized beneath like so many other tiny creatures. He had been lucky.

What now? Bryan trembled, ignoring further sounds of the oblivious store owner moving far off. Any and all contact with that monster seemed insane. Bryan was simply too tiny and that hulking fucker was too big. What was plan B?
112111222122121212121121.title: Bryan dislodges, falling back to the floor

choices: Bryan falls to the countertop
Bryan falls into a gigantic tin of chewing tobacco
Bryan falls among a huge snack
1121112221221212121211212.content:
“....RIGHT OVER HERE, MAN....” Impacted like a distant warning of thunder, deep and powerful, vibrating through Bryan’s tiny frail body.

He barely understood them, sounding more like monstrous bass than human speech, but he wasn’t taking any chances when the floor beneath began to quake more violently. The giant was coming back!

Running with all his might, the diminished scientist managed to put himself against the base of the mountainous counter nearby. Where, Bryan hoped, he would be safe. Bits of larger debris seemed to confirm this hope, chunks of rock, dirt, and other more organic pieces having collected here over time. All an unknown audience to the titanic passage of an in-cognizant behemoth whose massive sneakers obliterated anything foolish enough to venture out. The ground quaked harshly as one landed close-by, absorbing the horizon beneath a mass of dark rubber and looming over like an industrial mountain of filthy suede and stained nubuck. Rolling notes of thunder cascaded from higher than Bryan could see, noting what he realized must be a simple conversation.

Whatever plan B was, he needed to figure it out quick before the clueless dude flattened him.

As if plucked from the scroll of tropes, the subject dangled like a stretch of highway off a mountain. Constructed of synthetic fibers intertwining to create a large flat cable of dark steel that hung vertically from high above. A shoe lace, by any other name. Pros and cons rushed over his genius brain all at once. It something, to be sure, but a plan? Running up to that fucking thing? What if it moved before he got hold? What if… Bryan cursed himself. He could “what if” all day long and still be lost and in danger!

This was it! Getting off of the floor was the best thing he could do right now.

With a stifled war cry, he bolted out and towards the colossal enormity barely associated with a shoe. It seemed as if the journey swept past, as Bryan found himself nearing the enormous rugged rubber base, dried mud and plant matter staining the textured surface. Indicative of the locale this behemoth lived in. The target grew larger and larger as well, living up to the comparison of a highway and surpassing it. The end encased in a huge plastic tube, cracked and crumbling with age and everyday abuse. Despite his stupefied curiosity, the minuscule scientist wasted no time. Rushing past the aglet and gripping the massive weaves making up the even larger lace. Each micro-weave seemed as large as himself. Hard and steely, stained with grime and oil scraped loose from towering fingers, and teeny chunks of soil having embedded itself at random.

Bryan felt exhilarated. This was far, far beyond his comfort zone, but the thrill of adventure with an end made him almost giddier than frightened.

Far above the tiny man’s adventure, the colossus who cluelessly ruled over the unseen world below finished with the customer and chanced to look down. He looked past debris and microbial bits beneath his notice and instead locked on to his untied left shoe.

Each tiny hand dug into the thick weave easily, transporting him higher and higher up the now vertical mass of shoe lace. It seemed possible. All of these impossible odds suddenly seemed lighter and more in his favor. Something disturbed the usual movements and groans exhibited by the giant and his stationary shoe. From above descended living towers of flesh, splayed out in dramatic exaggeration as they seemingly fell upon Bryan and his location. Massive and rugged, one rushed underneath while another crashed down from above. His defense was but to lock in, choke up, and beg girlishly. The landmass of a thumb positioned close-by, any nearer and Bryan would have been smashed beneath. He had never seen fingers up close. Above all, they appeared as rounded formations, lined ruggedly lined and patterned with ridges designed over millennia by mother nature. Like the mantle of earth, huge splits and cracks decorated it, packed with oily deposits of skin flakes, dirt. The worst was the smell. Bryan gasped, realizing it smelt of chewing tobacco and sweat. Perhaps something else. It looked and smelled fucking in-human. Above this was a discolored keratin shelf that reminded him of rocky outcroppings, jutting out and imprisoning hard-packed grime, decaying skin cells, and microbial stalks of hair.

Immediately the familiar feeling of helplessness and animalistic terror returned. What had appeared to be an immovable mass of shoelace began rising in the air, lifted by such god-like digits that it seemed effortless.

This was bad. He needed to relocate pronto, if he wanted to live. One shrill announcement left his tiny lips and Bryan flung himself from the huge lace and against the calloused surface of the colossal thumb.

“Oohhhhhhhh shiiiiiiiiiiiittt!” Cried the tiny grappler.

Eyes shut tighter than a virgin’s legs and hands disgustingly clutched against oily calloused skin, Bryan endured the movements best he could. The rocking sensations lessened, instead becoming pure vertigo. Bryan began kicking his feet against the warm, rock-like skin. For naut, it seemed. Bryan was too tiny or this titanic dude’s callouses were too thick. Maybe both.

The hand rushed like a meteor through the air, allowing Bryan fleeting moments to view the colossus above it all. Large glazed, uncaring eyes look elsewhere upon a teratoid face of unfathomable size. Alien trees coated the upper regions, sandy-gold in color and thick like redwoods. The swarthy skin was stressed around the eyes and mouth, like ridged geography viewed from a plane, and striking Bryan that this behemoth probably had a warm, friendly smile. All viewing was cut off as the large hand rotated, showing a new landscape a fair distance below.

Worse of all, Bryan felt his grip lessen as G-forces seemed intent on dislodging him.
1121112221221212121211212.title: Not so good Plan B!

112111222122121212122.content:
Huge clumps of tobacco created an rough terrain. The smell equally took a toll on the tiny scientist's senses, as the dried, smashed leaves still kept a potency that hung thick in the air. Bryan rubbed his face, trying his best to keep dirt and grime off, but finding it impossible.

He wanted nothing more than his uneventful life as a scientist at EDL Labs. This was too much.

Breathing in cleaner air as the mess of smashed cigarette fell behind, Bryan allowed himself to daydream in order to escape his turmoil. He marched along. Relatively undisturbed by any other obstacles besides the wildly churned dirt hills and dunes created by gigantic campers and their vehicles.

Bryan allowed himself to idly think about things: Tommy, his beloved neighbour. Who by now was sending off an empty package, none the wiser. His favourite day-time show. A guilty pleasure, but one he kept up on.

Thoughts of the skies and the huge creatures that occupied it never breaching his pleasant reverie. As long as the ground didn't start up, there was no danger, right?

---

Perched upon a branch, far far up from the leaf-strewn ground below was a pudgy bird. A lovely blue colour washed across the feathers, turning a warm yellow near the bird's thin black legs. It twittered a likewise black beak, bobbing a deft head to and fro with two shining eyes that captured any movement.

It was a common starling. A year-round resident of these forests. Pleasant to look at, delightful to hear - that is, unless you happen to be an insect or the size of one.

Bouncing up and down the branch, the starling snapped up a few stray ants that ventured too close. The tiny insects wriggled down and joined an already large array of victims waiting in the dank gizzard. They would soon be easily reduced to digestible paste by bits of sand that ground anything organic deposited inside. The starling chirped happily. It shuffled further, spying another ant that was quickly dispatched.

By chance, the rotund bird peered off the branch towards the ground below. A world of leaves, rocks, bushes, and dirt was layed out and filled with numerous goodies that might tantalize the bird.

Then something did tantalize. A small speck of movement far below in the dirt, barely viewable by something with such keen vision such as a starling. With a giddy chirp, the starling was off and descending towards the foolish insect below.

---

Scuffing down another dune, Bryan grumbled more about dirt and how much he hated it. His pleasant daydreams had long since failed him. Instead replacing with grueling boredom as Bryan crossed another rough inclined making up a small fraction of print left by a large truck only hours ago.

It was when he gazed up, preparing to stomp up yet another steep hill that he saw the shadow drench both him and the surrounding region.

"Huh-what?"

Bryan looked up to see the dark outline of a monstrous beast swooping through the skies. He stumbled back, confused and frightened. It took only a moment for the gigantic beast to make contact with the ground. Dirt blasted outwards beneath the large, scaled feet that slammed against the earth with a hefty thud. Bryan screamed. His cry was outdone by a terrible shriek from the monster above.

Lunging back, he narrowly avoided a beak belonging to said monster. It crashed down, burying into the dirt not 10 feet from the tiny man. Bryan scream again, looking up the length of hard calcium and spotting a bulging black void of wet eyeball. The globular mass rotated wetly, locking onto Bryan with such fury and desire to almost drain his entire body of blood.

"Oh! Oh..oh! FUCK!" He squealed at the monstrous bird. The beak pulled back lifting back into the air above the minuscule scientist. This monster was well over a hundred feet and seemed more mythical dragon than bird. Throwing his arm out, waggled it defensively. "Back! G..g...get back! Away!"

The uncaring bird craned a huge head in order to gaze at Bryan once more. Heavy thuds rocked the tiny man as the massive creature positioned itself to better snatch him up.

"NO!"

Shimmying on his ass, he screamed as the massive beak descended once more. Quicker than he could ever have liked, it snapped around him and lurched skywards.

He tumbled about the hard, warm interior violently. Screaming, grabbing, clawing. His hand came into contact with a thick, slimy mass larger than himself which he attempted to latch upon. It only aided in his folly, as he felt the dark death trap jerk forwards and the warm muscle lift upwards to slide Bryan's tiny form deeper in. One more scream was afforded before he slapped against a muscly wall and abruptly slid downwards.

"Fucking shit! Oh my fucking-stick-of-shitting-fuck-fuck!" He couldn't believe this. It happened to quick; too abruptly. He was being swallowed by a fucking bird! "Fuck, fuck, fuck-...!"

Then without any ceremony, Bryan fell through more utter darkness and landed in tumultuous sludge of chunky, acrid paste. Pieces of god-knows-what pressed around him at all angles. Some were sharp, others blunt, and some prickly with hairs. Then the smell was enough to sedate Bryan out of his mind. It was a mixture of vile house cleaner, and something akin to shit. Worst than this sensory assault was the utter hopelessness Bryan felt. There was no way out.

"God....why!" Prayed the defeated man.

Rather suddenly a squishy gurgle could be heard and his hellish prison seemed to begin churning. As if to herald this wonder of nature, Bryan heard a dull, throaty chirping high above. He planned to curse it when something segmented and lined with hairs brushed past his face. His digust was brief before a suddenly blunt force crashed into him from behind. It shoved him with seemingly angry intent before he contacted another such object.

Bryan shrieked as the two masses of rough stone rubbed against his soft body in different directions as they attempted to pass each other. They succeded only when Bryan's frail spine snapped and his left limb tore off at the shoulder.

More revolutions followed: more hard stones impacted him to break his body further and rend it apart. Other bits of carapace and limb jabbed and skewered the doomed scientist. All in utter, soul-sapping, tormenting darkness.

Bryan finished with a gurgling cry before succumbing to liquidation.

---

Happily batting both of it's lovely blue wings, the starling ascended from the ground. It dained to land a few meters away. Some campers with their children pointed at the charming little bird.

"See it? That's a starling, kids. Look at him walk about with his little feet!"

The starling waddled around, allowing itself to be surveyed by the campers. It chirped playfully at the children, bouncing around. When they broke off to get closer, the starling coyly took to the sky once more. Swooping atop their vehicle, it watched them and waited for digestion. Inside the endearing little bird was a whirl of insect (and human) paste being quickly absorbed by a fast metabolism.

Satisfied, the starling took flight again. Sweeping over a campsite, it passed over the supply shop and promptly released a warm, white glob of shit from a dainty asshole hidden by lovely blue feathers. The shit hurtled towards the ground and splatted wetly on the hat of one camper exiting the shop.

"What the hell!" Matt cried out after both feeling and hearing the impact on his head. An Icee in one-hand, he used the other to touch the offending force. It was warm and had noticeably chunky little bits mixed inside. None of which Matt bothered to peer closer and notice their unusual resemblance to human bones. "Fuck! Bird poop!"

Wiping it off, he glared upwards.

"Aw, come on...God, why!"
112111222122121212122.title: Bird poop

1121112221221212122.content:
On his knees, the bug-sized scientist sobbed and sputtered in terror. He felt the hard wood beneath his shudder in response to the humongous bird outside. The light from outside the entrance suddenly became eclipsed, causing Bryan to shriek at the bulging black eye that peered inside.

It looked like a huge boulder, glossy and black like the darkest ink as if searched the gnarled interior for more prey. Locking onto the tiny, pale form that trembled inside, the huge eye throbbed greedily, blinked, and retracted.

A brief moment of grace allowed the shrunken man to wipe his tears. Hoping the beastly bird had left, Bryan struggled to his feet. His muscles shook, causing him to gasp fitfully between sniffles. "Is...Is it over...?" He barely questioned before the light blocked out once more and his sniffling became a scream.

Bryan's pitiable cry barely escaped before a beak the size of his garage crashed forward and snapped shut around his flailing form.

---

Retracting from the twisted hole, the bird raised a sleek head upwards. With an arching motion, it swallowed the captured prey without thought.

The interesting insect wriggled down, offering only slightly more resistance than the beetles did. All sensation ceased when the creature passed the esophagus and settled inside the bird's now pleasantly full stomach, mingling with the ants and beetles.

Giddily chirping, the bird pushed off from the tree and swept into the sky on graceful wings. It ducked low, passing over a grumbling truck just pulling into the vacant site. The bird banked, and sped upwards. Another bird of the same variety flew by with a challenging twitter, egging the bird to follow.

Both went sweeping through the clean forest air, chirping and tweeting with the endearing innocence of nature.
1121112221221212122.title: Innocence of nature

choices: He travels down the path
Somebody is walking down the path
11211122212212122.content:
Bryan was panicking. The surface below him shifted again, this time emitting an angry grunt that caused the tiny man to squeak in surprise.

"What is going on here?" He began when the knobby surface he stood on seemed to slide. Suddenly, a pair of antennae thick as telephone poles whipped into view. "I need to get out of here!"

Planning to slide off gracefully, Bryan stumbled towards the edge. He took care with each step, but found himself falling when the huge creature began moving. The bug-man was flung rudely, twirling through the air like some forsaken toy doll and crashing against an incline of sandy dirt. "Oof!" It was a hard landing, but Bryan recovered quickly when he saw the cause of all this disturbance.

"Holy crap! It's huge!"

The massive beetle rose from a cover of dirt, twigs, and crunched leaves. Waving both antennae, it released a guttural roar as if to reassure the shrunken man his place in the world. Then, as quickly as it did, the landscape-turned-beetle crashed over a large rock and made off into the huge forest.

Bryan just remained on his butt - staring in the direction the huge bug went. "Fuck," He said, both terrified and incredulous. "I mean, just seriously, fuck!"

He waited until the coast remained clear for a reasonable amount of time and the hugely magnified sounds of nature were all he heard. Standing up, the tiny man looked around. Debris surrounded him on all ends; massive leaves both broken and intact sloped over hill and dale like stadium canopies. Rocks both large and small littered in between twigs bigger than the tree that shed them, while the occassion bit of trash stood out like an object from space.

Bryan knew that he needed to traverse this unpalatable landscape if he wanted to find help and avoid an encounter far worse than the insulted beetle. He needed to find Matt!
11211122212212122.title: Insulted beetle

choices: A family's campsite
College guy's campsite
112111222122122.content:
The grandness of nature loomed around tiny Bryan Smith in all directions. Huge trees, bigger than anything Bryan could hope to compare, stretched endlessly into the sky. Rocks, twigs, and smaller fauna of mega proportions populated the immediate landscape.

It was a frighteningly alien world to the tiny man, who had rarely ventured out of the city before this. Nature was just a boring trifle to him.

"What the hell do I do now?" He said himself, trying to keep his emotions under control.

He could wait for Matt to return. On the other hand, what if Matt didn't come back? Bryan couldn't stand here all night! Help wasn't going to find him, he needed to seek it out himself.

Before him stretched the bumpy, rolling expanse of sandy dirt that made up what was likely a path. It continued out of sight in either direction for miles, leading to God knows where. Bryan clasped his hands pensively as he tried to think of what to do.

His nose suddenly detected a pleasant aroma. The shrunken man whipped his head around and sniffed curiously.

"Food!" He exclaimed. "Meat!"

A low grumble emitted from his stomach, reminding him that he hadn't eaten for many hours. The sumptuous scent seemed to be coming from behind him, away from the ominous pathway.

"Somebody is cooking food." Bryan said with an excited swallow.

Forgetting about his brother, the tiny man began stumbling through the thick brush towards the source. He found himself surrounded by tall blades of dried grass that surrounded him like a mini forest. As he continued, he began to hear distant noises. Low, exagerated voices, and what sounded like rumbling music.

Bryan noted these noises, thinking that not only would he get food, but also rescue from whomever was preparing it.

The tantalizing aroma fueled excitement in his tiny body. He passed under a huge leaf, passed many building-sized pebbles, and scrambled over twigs that resembled fallen trees.

He exited the grass forest through the large curled leaves of a weed to find...
112111222122122.title: Tantalizing aroma

choices: Go to Luke, he's staring at the ground!
Go to Jake, he's on the ground!
1121112221221221.content:
“Shut up!” Luke grunted, shoving his brother with a wide grin. Jake recovered a second later and landed a punch on Luke’s arm. Just before the two could really get into it, a taller figure appeared from the tree line and pushed between them.

“Nope!” he said loudly, casually shoving them aside. Luke stumbled a moment before turning around, “Fuck you Andrew!” he glowered. His cousin waved off Luke’s anger dismissively and dropped into a folding chair between the tent and fire pit.

“Boys!” came a concerned warning from the man at the grill. “Don’t kill each other just ‘cause you think I’m not looking!”

“Hey, I’m on your side Uncle Adam!” Andrew replied innocently as he fished his phone out of his pocket. There was a heavy sigh from the grill, “How ‘bout you guys find some firewood for tonight?” Adam suggested.

Luke ambled towards the fire pit, “We already did that!” he shot back unhappily as he settled into a chair across from Andrew. Jake grunted in agreement as he crawled into the tent, presumably to start playing on his Gameboy again.

Luke scanned the clearing his family had set up camp in. It sat mostly in shade, with warm summer light streaming through the branches. Healthy green shrubs lined the packed dirt of the clearing. Coloring dotted the bushes where flowers and berries grew. Unfortunately the beauty of the scene was lost on him, as well as his cousin and brother.

Stretching his legs in front of him, Luke glared down at his brand new Nike Air Force Ones. The blue and white sneakers were already covered in a layer of dirt after only having been here a few hours. He could think of a million places he’d rather be. Not that he didn’t like the outdoors. But to be there with his least favorite cousin and his lazy brother made it less than ideal.

---

Bryan peered around a towering blade of grass and yelped in terror as a ship-sized blue basketball sneaker slammed down in front of him, kicking up a cloud of dust. Accompanied by a monstrous roar, a white Nike Shox sailed overhead, dirt raining from its exposed sole. Bryan, fearing for his safety, cowered pathetically behind a boulder-like pebble. The thunderous noises ended abruptly.

Opening his eyes, Bryan could see two pairs of massive sneakers pounding away from him. To his right, flattened stalks of grass were slowly regaining their shape after being stepped on by one of the behemoths. Walking beneath a twig, Bryan tried to better study the clearing.

The group of titans had set up a campsite in a dirt clearing amongst impossibly tall trees. It consisted of a tent, and four folding chairs around a fire pit. Judging from the fact all four had blonde hair, Bryan assumed it was a family outing. One stood at the grill, facing away from Bryan and the other three. He was dressed in a simple green t-shirt and jeans, wearing a pair of battered tennis shoes.

Two of the giants sat across from each other, divided by the fire pit. The taller one was wearing an Abercrombie t-shirt and plaid cargo shorts with a pair of clean, white Nike Shox. His chiseled face had an arrogant smirk as he tapped away on his cell phone.

The other one had his long legs stretched in front of him. He clearly towered over 6 feet, thousands of feet for tiny Bryan. His flowing t-shirt and basketball shorts matched his bright blue and white Nike Air Force Ones. His steely gaze was focused on his shoes.

The only sign of the fourth giant at this point were his feet, protruding from the tent flap. His black shoe soles faced upwards, indicating he was lying on his stomach. Bryan could just barely see the word VANS written in red against the gray side of the shoe. He shuddered as he realized he could recognize the pulverized remains of a beetle trapped in the tread of the exposed sole.

“Seems I have a couple options for help…” Bryan muttered to himself.
1121112221221221.title: A Family Outing

choices: Stomped!
Food is ready!
11211122212212211.content:
From his little hideaway in the outlying grass, Bryan peered at the scene before him. Across the stretch of packed, dry dirt, sat the closest giant. His enormous body was settled onto a folding canvas chair like a god upon a throne. Bryan glanced once more at the other visible giants. One stood at the grill, even from behind looking to be many years older than the two that were seated near the fire pit. The last was still settled in one of the tents, only his dust-covered sneakers were visible.

"That one is closest," Bryan noted nervously. "and he is looking at the ground. He'll surely see me!"

The giant in question continued an idle downward gaze. Steely blue eyes, coupled with his light hair and eyebrows, made him a naturally appealing sight. Bryan stepped forth from his meager cover, glancing back at the flattened grass that still creaked back to shape. He turned back with a gulp and prepared to make contact.

Rolling ridges and indentations in the dirt made the tiny man's travel difficult. Only after stumbling over many circular slopes did he realize what had been the cause. Tread prints. The entire site was covered in similar prints: the circular Air Force style, the waffle Vans tread, and the ridged pattern left by the other two. It gave a tingling down Bryan's spine, reminding him just how tiny he had become.

The behemoth of a guy loomed closer. Bryan approached, glistening with hope.

----

Boredom gnawed at Luke's consciousness. He brooded idly, looking vacantly at his white and blue Nike Air Force One sneakers. Almost a month had passed since he bought them, and only now did they seem to show any sign of wear. His brow furrowed slightly at the thought.

He had been compelled, along with his brother, to go for a family outing. His father insisted it would be an "adventure", as well as "something worth doing". Luke wouldn't have minded that half as much had the presence of his cousin Andrew not been included in the package. The mere memory made the teenager sigh in annoyance, shifting his large feet in the grainy dirt. He then noticed something.

As if his sight suddenly shifted into focus, Luke saw tiny movement at his feet. He realized amongst the dirt and pebbles between his sneakers, minutely sized black ants had been foraging. Luke's sneakers had inadvertently smashed most of the scuttling insects when he sat down.

Lightly amused, Luke decided to entertain himself. He moved his blue and white high top: lifting one over a couple of the ants and crushing them, and shifting the other to grind more of them out. Insects, small as they were, rarely garnered notice from the tall teenager. In a boring pinch such as this, the insignificant bugs would provide him with some entertainment. Sliding his Nike over a few more, he slid it back, producing a coarse grinding beneath the hard circular tread. Luke's expression never changed from one of idle attention, nor did he consider how impossibly huge he appeared to the tiny ants below.

"Hey, Uncle Adam, how much longer... I'm gonna pass out if I don't eat soon!" Andrew complained without even looking up from his phone. Luke prepared to respond, glad for the chance when his father answered. "Gonna be a few more minutes, boys. Can't keep this grill hot enough to cook the damn things." Everyone resumed their activities, the sound of nature, cell phone alerts, and Jake's Gameboy breaking the silence.

Stifling a yawn, Luke looked back down and shifted his sneaker, revealing a mess of smashed ants, squirming victims, and unseen survivors. Luke was oblivious to this carnage. He only frowned when he figured that all the tiny bugs were gone. The blond youth shrugged, when he once more spied tiny movement near the toe of his right Air Force sneaker.

The pale ant was almost unnoticeable against the gray dirt. It had been hiding behind a small shred of bark and looked to be scuttling away. Luke grunted, and without wasting thought, prepared to finish it in the same fashion.
11211122212212211.title: Luke

choices: Bryan waits for the right moment
Bryan can't wait, he needs help now!
112111222122122112.content:
"Alright guys, come and get it!" Adam called out, still facing the grill. Luke froze, with his shoe an inch off the ground. While he was distracted the minuscule bug fled underneath his chair. "You just said it wasn’t cooking,” Luke said gruffly.

His father, still not looking back, shrugged. "A little red meat will be good for ya!"

Luke’s shoes crashed down onto dozens of unnoticed ants as he stood up. He looked over to see Andrew standing while still typing furiously on his phone. Wanting first pick Luke marched towards the battered folding table next to the grill.

Just as Luke reached out to grab a bun, Andrew elbowed him aside. “No, no, I’m number one. Get used to it!” he snickered. Luke was stunned for a moment before his face twisted in anger. “You asshole!!” Luke shouted shoving his cousin. Andrew stumbled backwards and crashed into Adam.

“SON OF A BITCH!!” Adam bellowed, dropping the tongs to grab his singed arm. “You two take this shit too damn far!!” Adam snapped.

“Dad I-“ Luke began. “I don’t wanna hear it!” Adam interrupted, “Just eat! I’ll be right back!” Without waiting for a response, Adam stormed towards their SUV parked outside the clearing, hoping to find their emergency first aid kit.

---

Bryan screamed in terror as the white and blue sneakers lifted over him. “NO!” He screamed, “I’M NOT AN ANT, DON’T YOU SEE?!” The shoes, easily the size of cruise ships, dropped lower. Bryan screamed again, putting his hands up in futility. Grains of dirt the size of boulders rained down from the filthy tread. Brian’s life flashed before his eyes before he realized everything had suddenly stopped.

Daring a glance upwards revealed the massive sole still hovering above, motionless. Bryan’s instinct beat out his curiosity. He bolted, grateful for the moment to escape. As he emerged from the shadow of the massive teen’s sneaker, Bryan couldn’t suppress a thrilled laugh of relief.

Up above the voices of the titans rumbled like distant thunder. Bryan stopped behind a towering chair leg, doubling over as he struggled to breathe. Looking forward he could see some aimless wandering ants for only a moment before the massive shoe crashed down mercilessly. The lofty chair he had taken refuge beneath shifted as the titanic teenager stood to his full height. With impossible ease, the giant pounded away. Bryan watched as one and then the other young titans pounded in the same direction.

He was in awe of their immense size, something the giants clearly were unable to appreciate. Their massive footwear crashed down onto the ground, completely altering the landscape. This massive teen had been grinding the ants into the dirt it seemed because he could find nothing better to do. Bryan was sure the kid was nice enough, at least to someone of a roughly equal size. At this size Bryan was just another bug: easily overlooked and carelessly disposed of.

He had been so sure that he couldn’t be confused with an ant, after all he was a human, and a damn smart one at that. But when the titan’s gaze had drifted onto his sprinting form, there was no spark of recognition. Instead the terrifying behemoth had moved his gigantic sneaker to crush the scientist as cruelly as he had to the ants.

Bryan jumped at the rumbling of a roar at the grill. He could see the older one gripping his arm while bellowing at the two who had been at the fire-pit. He then marched away, the ground trembling as his massive shoes slammed down behind the chair. Bryan stared in shock at the clouds of dust kicked up by each of the man’s footsteps. He was solely focused on his seemingly injured arm. Not an ounce of thought rested on the ground at his feet as he stomped by.

Bryan wasn’t only in danger at being disposed of because of he may be mistaken for a bug. No, even worse was that these giants could easily end his existence and never even notice he was ever there.

Bryan stared longingly in the direction he had come from. He had already been left behind by his brother Matt, whose whereabouts were completely unknown at this point. Should he venture in the wilderness he would be lucky to make it out alive, let alone actually find another person. And they would be just as threatening, if not more, than the group Bryan already had found.

He sighed miserably. This family was his best hope.
112111222122122112.title: Food is ready!

choices: A collapsing, mountainous burger
A huge pile of potato salad
1121112221221221121.content:
Luke and Andrew finished putting their meals together in silence. When Jake finally made an appearance he taunted them under his breath. He was more than happy to see Luke and Andrew in trouble, if only because he wasn’t.

Luke glared at him before returning to his seat. He glanced at the ground where he could see his footprints from earlier. He had forgotten about the ants just before he stood up. Amongst the crumpled black forms were a few survivors, barely alive and twitching.

Luke, uninterested in the ants anymore, glanced at his plate instead. He gripped the burger in his hands and took a large bite. It was perfect, the flavor washed over his tongue as he chewed. He couldn’t enjoy it fully however as he glared across the clearing at Andrew, who was downing scoop after scoop of his potato salad.

He poked his own potato salad unenthusiastically with a fork. This trip already sucked just like he knew it would! All because Andrew had to be here! He was such a dick! Andrew never let up on Luke and he wasn’t sure why.

“Luke! Come here!” his father called gruffly from the SUV. Luke stared at his dad, worried for a moment. He then figured this would be a good chance to explain himself, or rather blame Andrew since it was all his fault.

Luke dropped his plate to the ground, accidentally submerging the edge of it in dirt. He sidestepped the thick bushes beneath the thick trees, approaching his dad who patiently waited with a grim expression.

“Dad, it was A-“ he began. “Luke. No. I don’t want to hear it.” Adam interrupted pointedly. “I don’t care who started what, the point is this shit needs to stop.” Luke looked away, glaring at the line of trees on the far side of their clearing. Adam sighed, “Luke you can’t over react to everything Andrew does. That’s why he bothers you more than Jake. Jake doesn’t care, and neither should you!” Adam insisted. “I brought both of you here because you both need to learn to get along. You’re cousins for Christ’s sake!”

Luke faced his father again, but still said nothing. “Is that too much to ask?” Adam asked. Luke shook his head. “Thank you, you’re not in trouble and I’m going to give the same talk to Andrew, so go eat and let’s try to make this trip fun, yeah?” Luke nodded, smiling a bit.

He plodded back to the campsite, making sure not to walk near Andrew as his dad called his cousin over. Dropping into his chair he looked across the way at Jake who was trying to eat with one hand and play his Gameboy with the other in spite of each being a two-handed task.

Laughing at his brother’s ridiculousness Luke reached down for his plate.

---

Bryan remained under the chair, waiting for an opportunity to present itself. He watched the three young blonds shuffle around the table as they put their plates together, apparently shocked into silence by whatever had just happened. From this distance, they appeared more like normal boys and less like the fearsome titans they had become.

That didn’t last however as the monumental teenager returned to his seat. Bryan couldn’t help but wince at his every footstep that crashed down. Twigs that would have spanned several blocks snapped like nothing. Lofty blades of grass taller than redwoods were flattened in seconds. As his shoes would lift away it would spray dirt backwards as a final insult to the destroyed landscape left unnoticed in his wake. Never once did Luke’s eyes glance down to see what unfortunate things might be in his path.

Bryan trembled with the quakes in the ground as Luke’s colossal sneakers slammed down in front of the seat, the dirt crunching loudly. A sudden plop and subsequent creaking signaled that Luke had taken his seat. In front of him one of the enormous shoes lifted. It seemed as though the giant teen was observing the massacred ants.

To Bryan it appeared like a bomb had been dropped. Dozens of ant corpses were spread at random amongst the rough hills created by Luke stomping and sliding feet. Here and there he could see some survivors squirming or fleeing the scene. Above it all, like an alien ship, hovered the destructive shoe. Bits of dirt and dead ants dangled from the filthy tread.

Without warning the shoe dropped, landing with a dull thud over many of the remaining survivors. It seemed the giant boy was no longer interested in the puny ants now that he had a meal to focus his attention on.

Bryan sputtered as he tried to process the indifference the behemoth had for the lives he had thoughtlessly obliterated. Perhaps he had not been the best choice to attempt to contact!

He found himself frozen in fear. He could not bring himself to contact the monstrous teen, and yet was too scared to flee in case he was seen and successfully crushed.

Still trying to talk himself into some form of action, a booming voice echoed across the clearing, shaking Bryan from his thoughts. “LUKE!! COME HERE!!” it demanded. A city sized paper plate landed roughly in the dirt as the titanic teen stood up in response. “Luke” Bryan muttered as the giant pounded away. This monster’s name was Luke!

Feeling safer in the fearsome Luke’s absence, Bryan figured now would be the best time to flee. He sprung forward, hoping to reach one of the other towering boys before Luke returned. This took him right past the broad paper plate. He couldn’t help but stop and gape at it.

At his size, the plate appeared like a perfectly even slope in the landscape. The burger towered high like a cliff of food. Where a bite had been taken, Bryan could clearly see the glistening beef, melted cheese, and fresh veggies that were somehow more appetizing at such a massive scale. Even the misshapen hill of potato salad looked heavenly to Bryan!

He found he had walked up to where the edge of the plate was buried into the sand. He realized during the adventure so far he hadn’t thought about food. But now presented with this irresistible display it was all he could think about!

Before he knew it he was sprinting across the smooth surface of the plate. It appeared he wasn’t the only one with this idea. A few relentless ants also found the massive food to be a great discovery. Bryan crouched in front of a chunk of ground beef. Though undoubtedly an insignificant crumb to the giant, it could serve as many meals for the shrunken scientist.

After all the fear and physical strain, Bryan had been left with quite the appetite! As he stuffed his face, all he could focus on was the rich flavor of the beef. That is until a couple of quakes shook him to his core. Bryan twisted to look at what he should have already expected. The enormous teen towered high above, the sun illuminating his muscled physique like a god of lore. Panicking Bryan snatched what he could from the chunk of beef and sped back towards the ground.

Before he made it, a broad hand swooped out of the sky. It grasped the edge of the plate and lifted everything skywards, tilting haphazardly. Bryan couldn’t even let out a whimper as he was flattened by heavy g-forces.

Bryan found himself sliding uncontrollably towards…
1121112221221221121.title: Hungry

choices: Grab a napkin to clean the rest of it off
Push the food onto his mouth
11211122212212211212.content:
Luke lifted his plate and placed it in his lap. He glanced back to the SUV where his dad was still talking to Andrew. If he was gonna get along with that asshole, Andrew better make the same effort. Luke wasn't very good at playing the bigger man.

He looked down to see his loosely built burger had collapsed when he lifted his plate. He hastily put it back together, failing to notice a couple ants who had been caught up in the avalanche. Raising the sandwich to his lips he took a savage bite. As he chewed he looked beyond their clearing, where the sun rays reflected off a nearby lake. It was pretty warm, Luke wouldn't mind a swim...

Feeling an itch in his throat Luke coughed suddenly, putting his hand to his neck. He paused for a second and swallowed hard. The unnoticed ant responsible for the itch sunk down Luke's throat with the chewed food. Luke took a moment to regain his breath.

"You spit more often than you swallow?" Jake joked from where he sat. Luke didn't bother looking, simply raising a hand to flip his brother off. Jake scoffed, "Rude," he said shortly, pretending to be insulted.

Luke and Jake definitely messed with each other, though it was usually just good-natured jokes. On the other hand Luke and Andrew used fighting words that often broke out into actual fights.

Andrew plodded back into the clearing, fishing his phone out of his shorts. Dropping into his chair he frowned, "Fucker's dead!" he grunted, sliding it back into his pocket. "Wish I could say the same about you!" bounced around Luke's skull as he barely managed to suppress shouting out the retort. As long as Andrew wasn't directly attacking, Luke would make an effort to play nice.

Dropping his eyes back to his plate, Luke picked up his fork to start in on the potato salad. Munching on the first bite, Luke felt a pat on his back as his dad returned from the SUV. He felt a twinge of guilt upon seeing the large white bandage that covered his dad's arm. He glanced back at Andrew accusingly, though his cousin was leaned back, staring up at the canopy of trees as he munched on his own burger.

Luke scooped another chunk of potato salad, bringing it to his mouth. As the fork bounced off his teeth when he had an idea. Retracting the food, he used his other hand to pull the top of the fork backwards. Letting it free, he sent a chunk of potato salad flying through the air. With a splat it landed on Andrew's left cheek. Andrew's whole body flinched in shock, sitting up to look forward with a dumbfounded expression, mouth hanging open. Luke let out a booming laugh. Andrew in response scooped up a chunk of potato salad, shooting it into Luke's shirt.

"Geez your aim sucks almost as much as you do!" Luke exclaimed, though for once his words lacked an angry undertone. Andrew grinned mischievously and sent another chunk flying towards Luke. Upon hearing his brother's shout Jake emerged from the tent. "What's going o-" Jake was cutoff when Luke hit him in the forehead with potato salad. He was only down for a second before retrieving his own plate to join the food fight.

Adam stood by the grill, smiling as he chewed on his burger. Sure he wasn't thrilled about the wasted food, but he was definitely happy to see the boys getting along and having fun for once.

---

Bryan yelped as slid and tumbled chaotically, quickly approaching the misshapen mountain of what appeared to be potato salad. The ground below tilted again as Luke placed the plate onto his lap. Bryan was bounced upward by the shifting plate, screaming as he flew through the air, his flight ending abruptly as he plunged into the soft surface of potato salad. Above him the titanic teen remained totally unaware of the shrunken scientist's screams.

Bryan gasped, thankful to have finally stopped. Immediately he realized he was stuck fast waist deep in the mountain of slimy food. Spread before him were the collapsed remains of the burger, though the vibrant colors of the massive food still looked delectable. He stared in awe as a broad hand descended and with surprising dexterity for something so large, reassembled the burger. As the top bun was lifted to complete the sandwich, Bryan noticed a few squirming shapes in the bread's ketchup spread. The ants who had joined him on the plate were in the same situation as him! Their presence was no more evident to the massive youth than Bryan's was as he patted the top bun of his reconstructed sandwich.

The thick fingers bent around the sandwich as the giant lifted it skywards. Bryan craned his neck to follow its ascent. Still staring, Bryan grimaced at the loud crunched as Luke sunk his teeth into the massive burger. As he ripped away the island-sized bite, boulder-like crumbs rained down from above. Bryan spent a second wondering about the fate of the ants, before remembering he was at risk of the same one!

"HEEEEEEEEEYYY!!" Bryan bellowed, waving his arms. Above him the smacks and crunches coming from Luke's rising and falling jaw were more than enough to drown out his screams. His eyes were staring into the distance, indifferent to the meal he was about to gulp down. His oversight would could very well spell doom for tiny Bryan.

Quickly realizing screaming was ineffective Bryan began frantically struggling against the sticky potato salad. He made agonizingly slow progress. He paused when a thunderous cough rang out above. Once again straining to look upwards he watched as Luke pursed his lips. After a very audible gulp, Luke dropped his head down and took a gasping breath. Bryan started waving his arms in an attempt to take advantage of Luke's downward gaze, though his blue eyes seemed glazed over, not really focusing on the plate of food.

Luke let out a gusting sigh still recovering from choking. Bryan was buffeted by the gust that reeked of soggy beef. He was pelted by bits of food, and drops of saliva. He glared upwards, "Hey! I'm right here! I'm not a part of your fucking meal!" he shouted furiously. He was slammed with another gusting breath.

Exasperated, Bryan recovered and turned upwards again. He found himself staring into Luke's gaping mouth. There was just enough to glint weakly off his jagged molars and illuminate the uvula hanging over his throat. Spread at random across the massive tongue were soggy chunks of food. All that remained of the huge chunk of food the giant teen had just downed.

Luke's handsome face lifted upwards as his cliff-like chest continued to heave. He made no movement to continue eating, and Bryan renewed his attempts to escape in the much needed reprieve. He grunted, his scrawny arms burning from the effort as he struggled to keep his breathing even.

A shift of light and shadow drew Bryan's eyes upwards yet again. He was met with the Luke's apathetic gaze. Bryan didn't attempt to wave, knowing he had no chance of being noticed as long as he was trapped in the behemoth's meal.

A huge plastic fork held tightly in the giant's burly fist fast approached. It crashed into the mountainside near Bryan, cutting a huge mound free. Rising quickly, Bryan couldn't suppress a gasp as Luke's long tongue slipped out of his mouth to slurp up the food. Bryan was running out of time!

Adrenaline gave him new strength, and Bryan shouted excitedly as after another minute of struggling he felt his bonds loosen significantly. Not a second later, an opaque clear wall crashed down to his side. Recognizing the fork Bryan shouted in despair. "NO!!! I WAS SO CLOSE!!" he lamented as he was scooped up and easily lifted skywards.

"PLEASE NOOOO!" I'M IN YOUR FOOD, JUST SEE MEE!!" Bryan begged as he quickly approached the widening mouth. Above him, Luke stared forward, unaware of the tiny man about to meet his end within his meal. Beyond a wall of perfect white teeth, smears of potato salad greeted him from the tongue. Bryan again looked upward pleadingly, though instead of Luke's distant eyes, he was met with a pair of dark nostrils.

"NOOOOOOOOOO!" Bryan cried. As if in response the fork stopped abruptly, hitting the teeth with a dull crack. The mouth ahead snapped shut and the fork quickly fell away from it.

"YES!!! THANK YOU!!!!" Bryan shouted, choking on a joyful sob. A thick finger quickly approached, no doubt to retrieve him! He studied the swirls of the fingerprint, magnified to great detail as it approached. Bryan briefly panicked for a second he would be crushed against the finger tip, though that worry was put to rest as the finger inexplicably landed above him, pushing the tines of the fork back.

Bryan suddenly realized the giant still hadn't looked down once. He also became fully conscious of the position the fork was in.

"NO-" the air was forced back into his lungs as he flew forward at seemingly light speed. The landing was rough and sudden, leaving Bryan worried about whiplash. He opened his eyes, struggling to focus on where he had landed. Just above him and to his side are a pair of lips, thinner than Luke's. They are in shaped in an "O" of surprise, half chewed burger barely visible in the mouth.

Bryan feels the wall he is on shift as the jaw snaps shut, a gulp sounding from somewhere nearby. A booming laugh threatens to burst his eardrums as the rough movement continues.

---

Laughter rang throughout the clearing as the boys had their food fight, though they quickly ran out of ammo. What remained were chunks of potato salad that dotted the clearing. The boys started cleaning themselves up before returning to their movements. Andrew, feeling the potato salad still clinging to his cheek, tries to lap it up with his tongue. Only getting some he uses his hand to...
11211122212212211212.title: Food Fight!

112111222122122112122.content:
Bryan moaned, his head spinning from the rough impact, relentless movement, and reverberating laughs and shouts. He closed his eyes tightly, trying to shut out the outside world. He couldn't move, he couldn't think, he couldn't do anything but try to clear his head. However the giants' food fight gave him no rest.

Finally after almost two agonizing minutes, everything seemed to calm slightly. Bryan cracks his eyes open, feeling hungover. The bright sun elicits a groan from him. Other than his swirling head, Bryan is pretty sure he has remained intact.He forces himself to take stock of his surroundings so he could figure out what to do next. Turning to his side he happens to see a massive tongue burst from between the lips. It slithers towards him and starts to lap at the edge of the potato salad. Bryan attempts to shrink away before realizing he is out of it's reach. The tongue withdraws having only managed to get a small fraction of the food. Sighing in relief, Bryan continues surveying his surroundings and turns to his other side.

He doesn't get the chance to scream before the impossibly long finger smashes into him.

---

Andrew sweeps the potato salad from his cheek with his index finger, pushing it up and into his mouth. Sucking on the small portion of potato salad, Andrew pulls his finger free with a pop, a single strand of saliva stretching from his lips to his saliva coated finger. Wiping it off on his pants he looks first at Luke and then at Jake, chuckling as they also clean themselves off. He glances across the clearing at his Uncle Adam who is smiling and shaking his head as he munches on his sandwich. Andrew swallows before speaking, "Hey Uncle Adam, you think I could get more of that potato salad? I'm starving!"

All four laugh for a moment as they return to their meals. Jake leaves his Gameboy in the tent and sits at the fire pit with his cousin and brother. Adam quickly joins them, bringing with him the bowl of potato salad. They all eat, talking and laughing happily for the first time since they had started the trip.

Between bites of his burger, Andrew downs a healthy serving of potato salad. Preoccupied with the surprisingly good conversation, Andrew doesn't imagine the mutilated food descending into his gut. A tiny scientist's screams as he frantically beats against the soft stomach walls go totally unnoticed.

Before long Andrew gulps down the final bite of his burger, complimenting his uncle's cooking with a firm pat to his stomach. On the other side, a tiny man finds himself trapped amongst mountains of soggy, chewed burger remnants. He laments the time wasted on his stupid shrinking formula that had lead him here to his end.

When Luke suggests they swim, Andrew and Jake both enthusiastically agree. Adam decides to remain behind, still nursing his burnt arm. The boys head down to the lake, ripping their shirts off before jumping into the crystal clear waters. Andrew pats his chiseled abs, "Better be careful guys! We'll drown with these full stomachs" he says sarcastically. The jostling movement as Andrew swims serves to further imprison Bryan within the behemoth's bloated stomach.

Much later Andrew steps out of the lake, feeling strange standing on solid ground again. He feels a shift in his gut, followed by a long gurgle. "It begins!" he says with a smile, unable to appreciate the true horror of what was occurring within his body.

After drying off, Andrew joins the family as they roast s'mores over the fire. As he chews messily on his own s'more, Andrew is utterly unaware of the tiny man caught up in his healthy digestive system. Finally Bryan succumbs to the acids as Andrew gulps down his last s'more, retreating to his tent for the night.

The camping trip works wonders for the cousins. After a weekend of unexpected fun, the young men head home much closer than ever before. However Bryan had become closer to Andrew than anyone else ever could.
112111222122122112122.title: Closer than ever

choices: Jake suddenly gets up
Bryan attempts to scale the humongous Jake
11211122212212212.content:
Bryan returned his gaze to the giant who lay inside the nearby tent. Out of all the other giants, this one was obviously the best option for contact.

"He's laying down. Afterall, how hard could it be?" Bryan thought with a sprig of hope.

He repressed memories of his past experiences when trying to contact his humongous brother. Dwelling on past failures would get him nowhere. For now, he had to take this opportunity while he had it. Nodding agreeably to himself, Bryan set out on his new course.

Immediately out of the thicket of grass, the shrunken man found himself plodding over a terrain of devastated dirt. More than once did he find himself crouching suddenly to avoid the notice of a wandering ant or beetle. After a good dozen minutes, he happened upon the twitching remains of a pulverized spider. The cottage-sized arachnid had been cruelly smashed into the dirt by something of immense power.

The enormous tent nearing, Bryan scuttled out of another indentation all the while glancing back at the flattened spider warily. Suddenly the obvious dashed upon him.

"P-p-prints...!" Bryan whispered aloud, wide-eyed. "Oh Christ, these are all shoe prints! The entire landscape is covered with them!"

It was a phenomena that went hand-in-hand with human interaction of the outdoors, yet now it had been blown up to great significance. At a size smaller than most insects, Bryan found that even a single tread print left a rough series of indentations that would tire even the most able of outdoors men. He couldn't even comprehend the proper design due to their enormous size.

Cursing himself once again for his predicament, Bryan found himself nearly at his destination. Straight ahead--across a relatively flat, undisturbed plain of dirt--loomed the gargantuan tent. Made of two-toned material, it looked closer to a mythical monument of shiny plastic than a simple one-person tent. His gaze drifted from the huge shelter to the monstrous pair of sneakered feet protruding from it. A closer view brought the sneaker into a new light: the shoe soles sported an aggressive waffle design composed of hard black rubber with the bold red VANS logo spreading across the center of the sole at an angle. He noted the repeated logo also written in red against the dust-covered grey side of the shoe.

Cold spikes of fear threatened to paralyze the tiny man as he gazed. "I... Uhm... It's nothing but a young guy," He reasoned. "Just need to get his attention and... Yes, just have to get his attention. Easy enough..." The last statement sounded oddly questionable as Bryan mumbled it.

As the minute scientist continued, he passed the base of a looming tower of dark blue steel. Large, scuffed, stickers displaying various brands both known and unknown to Bryan covered the cylindrical structure. Noting large beads of liquid, Bryan discovered it was nothing more than a metal water canteen. The sheer size of it made such a possibility foreign to Bryan.

Passing the metal bottle, he avoided more deep indentations--these clearly left by the gigantic Vans worn by the nearby teenager. Suddenly they stood before him: soles facing upwards, and frayed denim jeans slightly visible from the tent. They shifted constantly, at random, each movement unleashed trembling shockwaves and dull thundering booms. Bryan stood gawking at them. Shuddering once more as he noted every clod of dirt, blade of grass, grit of garbage, and the barely recognizable beetle remains trapped in the enormous shoe tread.

It was bigger than many city blocks, covering impossible surface. He was simply awe-struck at the sheer magnitude of refuse packed into the tread of a teenager's shoe.

"Most of it is larger than I am, and this guy could care less!"

Gulping his fear, Bryan pushed away these thoughts and attempted to focus on his objective once more.

"I need to get his help!" Bryan resumed, determined.
11211122212212212.title: Bug-sized musings

choices: Reaching into his backpack for bug spray
Something else
112111222122122121.content:
"Fuck me!" Jake growled at the game. Dropping it in annoyance, he reached over the folds of his sleeping bag to retrieve an already opened bag of chips that lay nestled in the corner of his tent.

The bag proved to be nearly empty. Jake frowned at it, unable to recall eating that many chips. A small dark speck became visible to him as it crawled up the side of the bag, trying to get in. Creasing his brow at the pesky intruder, Jake brushed it off dismissively.

His stomach gurgled at him. He was hungry enough to eat his tent, much less an entire bag of chips, he sighed. Jake tilted his head and poured the contents of the bag into his mouth, in the process failing to notice the tiny ants mixed among the potato chip crumbs. He made quick work of the meager snack, feeling almost hungrier as a result. The Gameboy suddenly flashed, re-announcing his sixth "Game Over", and prompting him to try again.

He clicked the portable device off, bored. Like his brother, Jake had been obligated to go along on the annual family camping trip. It was something his father, an outdoorsy and all-around sport fan, had planned for them since they were kids. He couldn't deny the fun of taking a break from his mother and younger sister, and the chance to do some mountain biking and other activities was a plus. Yet, his cousin Andrew always seemed to act a perfect ass every year, pissing both Jake and his brother off to no end.

Jake itched the back of his head and readjusted the beanie he wore over his ear-length blond hair. His stomach emitted another reminder, leaving no room for argument. Flipping himself onto his back, he decided to investigate how the food was coming along.

Andrew spoke up just as Jake slid out from his tent and stood. "Hey, Uncle Adam, we gonna eat anytime soon? I'm wastin' away here!" Andrew's complaint seemed genuine, yet he didn't once look away from his phone. Jake grunted in amusement hearing a snide response from his brother before reaching for his canteen of Gatorade.

"What did I say before you two?" His father said, annoyed. "Knock it off already!"

Without delay came the expected swarm of mosquitoes and tiny gnats, excited to buzz around Jake's face. They proved agile enough to dodge the teenager's idle swipes, swishing this way and that in an attempt to enter his mouth and ears. Luke was visibly having issues also, as he occasionally swatted while focusing his gaze on his feet.

---

As could be expected, Bryan's determined passage suddenly halted when the circumstances abruptly changed.

"Oh crap! No, not now!" Obvious signs of movement from his chosen giant became apparent. He heard distant rumbles from inside the enormous tent, all indicating his time had run out.

His courage shattering once again, stumbled back. The gigantic skate shoes began shifting violently before suddenly flipping over with disastrous results. Hefty vibrations rattled the ground, accompanied by a frightening grinding crunch of dirt and gravel as the huge footwear moved. Like a mountain rising to life, the oblivious titan pushed through the tent flap. The giant rose to his full height, completely unappreciative of his gargantuan size.

The tiny shrunken scientist shook uncontrollably, terrified. Miles of thick, frayed denim settled like rolling hills over the tops of the titanic Vans sneakers. His towering legs seemed to stretch on and on, looming into the sky before meeting the deep black t-shirt worn over the teenager's thick chest. A white logo depicting some band, or perhaps some sport's brand stretched over the shirt's surface. Bryan heard the booming thunder of what must of been the other giant's talking.

Even from his minuscule perspective, it was obvious this teen easily stood over 6 feet tall like the other giant. This average height translated to thousands of feet for tiny Bryan, who couldn't even focus on the gigantic youth's distant face. That was, until the humongous face shifted and gazed downwards.

Dumbfounded, Bryan hesitated before breaking into action. "Yes... YES! Down here! Oh God, yes! I'm right here!" He sprung up, his thin legs sore and bruised, and began stumbling forward with flailing arms.

The strong youthful face showed nothing in the way of recognition. An expression of idle boredom, disinterest, and perhaps a hint of annoyance. Tufts of sandy blond hair poked from under a dark coloured beanie that was pulled over the titan's head like an enormous blanket covering part of the moon. He looked in his late teens, obviously athletic but with a mellow disposition.

Suddenly the giant shifted. His Vans sneakers lifting slightly before slamming down with powerful quakes. Another shockwave sent Bryan to his rear, screaming.

What was no more than slight shifting, felt like the end for something as tiny as bug-sized Mr. Smith. He couldn't help remembering the crushed remains of the beetle, unknowingly pulverized underneath the teenager's huge shoe. Bryan cried out for mercy, thinking the giant planned to flatten him when instead he reached an enormous arm overhead. Covered in light coloured hairs, it stretched arge building-sized fingers that wrapped around the towering monolith of a canteen.

With little effort the huge structure was wretched from the dirt, showering everything nearby, and lifted high above.

"He's just taking a drink...?" Questioned the tiny man, stupidly.

At his new size, even the most simple of actions looked exaggerated and nothing short of remarkable. The oblivious youth raised the tall sticker-coated bottle to his mouth and took great cascading gulps. Bryan snapped back into action too late, his gawking cost him the precious moment of the giant standing still while drinking. Car-sized drops of liquid hurled to the earth as the giant teen finished his drink. The young guy flung the metal bottle into his tent, and waved a large hand at his mountain-size face.

"What the hell is he doing now?" Bryan wondered.

Landing a powerful slap on his toned arm, Bryan realized the practically invisible specks that flitted around the behemoth's face. Another swipe and an injured gnat was sent plummeting to earth with a nearby crash. Two more landed shortly after, skittering painfully in the soft dirt with broken wings.

Without warning, the giant teen was on the move again. One sneaker raised into the air, the massive sole is suddenly visible. Large sections of previously trapped dirt dislodge, raining from the thick waffle tread. High above the teenaged owner turns his gaze, unconcerned with the ground he looks away, annoyed with the pesky insects. The gigantic skate shoe slams into the ground, obliterating an injured gnat and many unwary ants. The other shifted, grinding the ground loudly before lifting and taking a step with a dull thoom.

Still dangerously close, the enormous youth...
112111222122122121.title: Jake suddenly gets up

choices: Bryan approaches the table
Bryan approaches the grill
1121112221221222.content:
Bryan emerged from the thicket of dried grass to flat landscape of light grainy dirt.

His thoughts of food and rescue were interrupted when the ground beneath him lurched suddenly.

A young man of gargantuan proportions approached. His massive sandals crashed thunderously with each step, causing Bryan to lose his balance. Gaping, Bryan watched the huge sandals stomp by, leaving ridged tread prints and raining dirt with each impressive step.

Bryan watched breathlessly as the strange giant stomped over to a picnic bench. He had been completely unaware of the tiny man nearly crushed under his large sandal.

Two other young guys of equal age occupied the area already, one standing over an outdoor park grill, while the other lounged on the bench. The sandaled giant sat his impossibly huge form on the bench, placing a tower-sized beer bottle on the table.

"Damn... They're huge!" Bryan stuttered to himself. The sight was positively awe-inspiring, despite his previous encounters with his brother.

The three behemoths looked to be in their early-to-mid twenties. More than likely college students off camping for the weekend.

The giant that had nearly crushed him let out a thunderous laugh. He wore thick flip fops, jeans, and a long sleeved t-shirt. Raising the beer container to his lips, he took massive swigs of the liquid.

His buddy, sitting across from him, held a can of mosquito repellent. Sporting light buzzed hair, a black t-shirt embezzled with a band logo, tan shorts and a trashed pair of black sneakers. He released torrents of the chemical spray over his lean arms, pausing briefly to swat any fluttering insects. Grisly tattoos of flames and tribal patterns adorned his arms and thighs, giving him an even more fearsome appearance.

Timidly, Bryan turned his gaze to the last giant. The giant wore no shirt despite the flaring heat from the grilling meat. A dark red beanie covered his head, complimenting a nice coating of jet black stubble. Baggy cargo shorts and dirty white skate shoes were the remainder of his attire. Unable to control his stare, Bryan gawked at the mountain of rippling muscle as he idly joked with his buddies and flipped the patties.

They were quite far away to the minuscule man. Bryan watched in amazement every move the enormous young men made. Time seemed to slow down each time they moved, as if they were in water. He could feel light vibrations caused by the giant's enormous sneakers.

He had all but forgotten just how tiny he had become. Smaller than even a common ant, Bryan would have a hell of a time trying to contact them. A simple misstep would spell disaster for him, and these huge young men seemed to exude a naturally careless nature.

Despite this danger, Bryan had little choice. His only hope rested in gaining their attention!
1121112221221222.title: College Camping

choices: takes the can to the trash across the clearing
tosses the can in with his stuff
11211122212212221.content:
As Bryan continued forward, his gaze darted between each of the titans. Though he had decided to attempt to contact the giants, he realized he needed to pick a single one.

He quickly ruled out the one at the grill. The faded white sneakers were constantly shifting as the giant talked to and laughed with his buddies. Unnoticed by the giant, the grinding sound of shifting dirt under his massive shoes caused Bryan to shudder.

With the process of elimination started, Bryan pressed on. He angled his direction towards the towering table. Beyond it, the top of a gray and red tent was barely visible like a distant mountain peak. Also visible was its base, behind the tattooed giant. Two backpacks slumped over, their contents spilled in front of the tent.

Other than that, the clearing amidst a rough circle of thick trees was barren. There wasn’t even a car, as though the giants had hiked here.

“How far am I from civilization?” Bryan wondered as he noted his environment, “How far from home!?”

To calm his increasingly panicked mind, Bryan focused on the two behemoths at the table.

The tattooed one sprayed himself one last time, before capping the can and blindly tossing it into the pile by their packs.

“Jesus, Troy! You sure you get enough?” shouts the other at the table, pretending to choke. Troy glares at his friend and replies “I dunno, maybe not!” leaning back to reach for the can. As his hand closes around it he flicks the cap off. It flies under the table and when Troy leans forward to spray his friend in the face, his shoe crashes down onto the green cap with a loud snap.

Bryan watched in terror as an object many times larger than himself was obliterated by accident. Troy, roaring with laughter at his sputtering friend, dropped the insect repellent behind him without giving the splintered cap a second glance.

Bryan, who had already found Troy’s tattoos intimidating, lost any desire to contact him. This ironically left him with the one who had nearly crushed him. Bryan sighs, realizing that ultimately none were a “safe” choice. He steers himself towards the one in flip-flops, with still quite a distance to cover.

The colossus lifts the beer can to his lips and slurps loudly. With a disappointed grunt he looks into the empty can before chucking it towards a tree. Bryan watches the can disappear into the woods with a clang; the ease with which it was thrown was amazing and terrifying.

“Sean!” comes an exasperated shout from the one at the grill, “There’s a deposit on this site in my name! I’ll get charged if they find shit around here!” Sean sighs, but stands up. His flip-flops smack loudly against his feet as he searches for the can amongst the trees.

Bryan tries to stifle the fear rising in his chest as he nears the towering table.

Sean, having found the can, returns from the trees and…
11211122212212221.title: Cautious Approach

choices: Continue to approach Sean
Head towards their scattered supplies
112111222122122211.content:
Sean, holding the can in his hand marches across the clearing,ignoring the cloud of dust kicked up by his footsteps. With his eyes locked on the trash can across from him, Sean pays no attention to the ground at his feet.

"Happy Kyle?" he asks as he nears the garbage can and drops the beer into it. In the distance he can see where the path stretches away towards a lake. Slowly rowing towards its middle is a small boat with two guys in it.

"Fuck fishing" he thinks to himself as he turns to return to the table. He crosses the clearing in a few strides; the crunch of a beetle goes unheard. Reaching the table Sean drops into a seat, and continues his conversation with Troy and Kyle.

---

Bryan presses forward, his eyes locked onto the towering figure of Sean standing at the line of trees. After a moment of thought, Sean's gaze locks onto something across the clearing. He steps forward, not an ounce of attention on the ground at his feet. His sandal hits the ground with a resounding smack, kicking up a cloud of dust.

Bryan's eyes shift from the mountainous man on the move to the ground where he is headed. A black beetle is crawling across the ground. It never has a chance. Sean's flip-flop crashes down on to the beetle's back half with a gruesome crunch. Sean, none the wiser, continues marching forward, leaving the beetle twitching in the dirt.
