He pounds across the clearing, near where Bryan had first come through, and with a clang drops the can into what must be a garbage can. After a moment of hesitation, he spins around on his feet, his face blank of expression.

The ground quakes as he approaches once more. Bryan's eyes flick between Sean's towering frame, and the battered beetle. Just before reaching the table, one of Sean's flip-flops lands directly onto the Beetle, it's body disappearing from view. Bryan flinches at the sound of another crunch. Sean swings his leg onto the bench at the table and Bryan catches a glimpse of the beetle's mangled form hanging from the sole of the sandal. With a final thud, Sean plants his feet onto the ground, having taken his seat at the table again.

His voice thunders from above as he continues chatting with his friends, utterly unaware of the random life extinguished by his careless steps.

"What am I going to do!" Bryan panics, standing in the shadow of the picnic table.
112111222122122211.title: Disposed

choices: Bryan grabs a bite to eat
Bryan tries to find somewhere to get noticed
112111222122122212.content:
Sean decides he'd rather sit back down at the table and tosses the can towards his pack. He would throw it away when they packed up.

Unknown to him, his every move is being watched by a tiny scientist. Bryan waits in the shadow of a table leg, waiting for the right moment. He watches the flip-flops crash across the dirt and flatten small weeds. Sean returns to his seat at the table, his thick legs stretching upwards where the table obscures the rest of the giant.

Bryan, already having learned how abruptly things could change did not hesitate. He had already accepted that he would have to climb in order to get one of the towering young men to notice him.

Reaching the edge of the left flip-flop, Bryan stares up the side of it. Dust coated the black wall. This highlighted the numerous indentations that at normal size would be easily overlooked. Relief flooded Bryan; climbing for him would be no easy task! Any break was greatly appreciated.

Bryan, high on adrenaline, scales the sole of the flip-flop with relative ease. Heaving himself over the side of the flip-flop he gasps for air, ready to rest and celebrate his small victory.

Instead he gags. In front of him is the thick flesh of Sean’s bare foot. A film of sweat had combined with the dust kicked up by Sean’s footsteps, creating a stinking layer of dark grime. It was spread along the length of his foot where his skin met the sandal.

Sean’s jeans fold under his heel. Bryan rushes towards it, trying to hold his breath. Reaching the blue fabric, he is thrilled to discover its ridges are deep enough to serve as more handholds!

Without wasting another second, Bryan starts scaling the denim.

---

Sean slowly downs his beer, idly chatting with Troy across the table. However a loud grumble from his stomach stops him mid-sentence.

“Kyle, how much longer are those burgers gonna take? My stomach can’t run on empty!” he says unhappily, a hand against his belly.

“They’re almost done, how about you grab the buns so I can warm them up?” Kyle requests without turning around.

Sean, eager to start eating, stands and heads over to their scattered supplies. He snatches the bag of buns and tosses them to Troy.

“Open ‘em!” he orders as he starts digging for condiments. Troy obeys, but not without an indignant snort. Sean squats down, resting his butt on his heels as he searches. He feels a movement within his bowels and makes no attempt to suppress a fart.

“Dude!” exclaims Troy, waving his hand in front of his nose. Kyle turns his head, giving Sean an amused look.

Sean, having found everything, stands up. “Dude, yours are so much worse!” he says to Troy.

“Bullshit!” Troy laughs in response, as he hands the burger buns to Kyle. Sean dumps the condiments onto the table, and leans against its edge to watch Kyle cook.

After a second, Kyle’s hands points to the cooler. “Lettuce, cheese, and stuff’s in there,” he says matter-of-factly.

“Yes your majesty!” says Sean sarcastically as he reaches into the cooler for the rest of the ingredients.

“Damn straight! I’m the cook, I’m the king!” Kyle snickers. Troy and Sean both grunt disbelievingly, as the grill continues to sizzle.

---

Bryan holds tight when the giant’s leg moves suddenly. Each thundering step threatens to shake him free. Dust kicked up by the feet clouds around him as everything comes to a halt. For a moment nothing happens.

Then the wall of fabric begins to incline, becoming more level. At the same time, his area darkens, until more dark denim crashes down from above. Bryan, delighted at his surprising luck, grasps onto the new wall. It seems the giant has squatted down, thus cutting off a huge part of the climb!

A low gurgle is his only warning. A disgusting, noise rips past him, filling the air with noxious fumes. Bryan begins to cough violently; the sound of the titans’ laughter barely registers in his mind. As Sean stands up, Bryan has little clue as to what’s going on, his mind foggy from the poisonous air. His iron-grip however remains strong.

When Sean leans against the table, Bryan sees the nearby level surface. Only thinking of escaping to fresh air to rest, he lets go. Roughly landing on the table knocks the air out of his lungs, and he struggles for breath. His mind blank; Bryan lies on his back as Sean sets up the burger ingredients.

---

Sean watches Kyle scrape the last beef patty off the grill. Behind him, Troy has pulled out a large bag of nachos. A jar of salsa and a jar of cheese stand opened, just in front of the bag.

“Pour me some salsa?” requests Sean as he unwraps the cheese and lettuce. “Me too!” Kyle shouts from the grill, where he is quickly toasting the buns.

“Sure!” replies Troy, dumping salsa onto each of their plates.

Finished with the buns, Kyle places them onto the table, and Sean immediately reaches for one.

“Wait up, wait up!” Kyle says putting his hands up. “Let’s get picture of this! Day one of the three day weekend!” Sean puts the bread down slowly and waits as Kyle digs through his pockets.

“Wait, where’s my phone?” Kyle asks, a look of confusion on his face. “Seriously?” Sean groans.
“Dude, you need to get your shit together. You lose everything!” Troy laughs.

“Help me find it!” Kyle says, ignoring Troy’s comment. The three guys leave the table, searching amongst their things for Kyle’s phone.

At the surface of the table Bryan feels his strength returning. Sitting up he sees mountains of food spread before him, reminding him what drew him to the campsite in the first place!
112111222122122212.title: Stench and Luck and Stench

choices: onto the tongue
out of the mouth, onto Kyle's chest
1121112221221222121.content:
Bryan cannot resist the delicious aroma wafting to him. A tower of beef is just in front of him. He finds himself approaching it. The giants leave the table. Something about a lost cell phone.

"Oh good! They'll be gone for awhile!" reasons Bryan's starved mind. Before long he stands at the plate of meat. Though the edges of the plate are raised far above, a poorly placed meat patty droops over the lip of the plate, its edge resting on the table. Bryan runs right up to it and tries to take a bite out of the side. He is met with a tough, charred barrier.

Confusion and disappointment give way to understanding. Of course, the edges are singed! The inner part of the patty will be much more tender! He can see the giants in the distance, their eyes for once focused on the ground as they continue their search.

Deciding he has time, Bryan starts scaling the side of the patty. It’s very hot, but not quite scalding. Bryan however has become so consumed by his hunger that his senses are numbed to his surroundings.

Hauling himself onto the top of the patty he takes a few steps, drops to the surface, and digs his face into the beef. Taking a large bite, he groans happily; the warmth of the patty soothing to his aching body.

---

After a couple of minutes Kyle feels something hard under his foot. Lifting his white sneaker reveals his phone, a dust print of the phone tracked across the screen.

“And this is why I prefer Droids! An iPhone would’ve shattered!” he says happily, dusting the phone off.

“Dumbass!” laughs Troy as all three quickly return to the table and Kyle snaps a picture of the spread of food.

“Finally!” Sean says happily, snatching a meat patty hanging off the plate.

---

Bryan is literally stuffing his face when he hears a happy shout from behind him. He can see the shirtless giant had found his phone.

Disappointed Bryan grabbed another chunk before standing to dismount the patty. He watches the giants move towards him and in seconds they are towering over the table.

“Oh god they move so fast!” Bryan thinks alarmed. Before he knows it Sean’s hand appears and his thick fingers grasp the edge of the patty. A jarring movement knocks him off his feet, and he feels himself rolling aimlessly. With a short drop the movement halts.

A gray shirt stretched upwards to Sean’s face which was focused on something other than the patty. Bryan stood to escape when something fell from above, smothering him. Forced to lay flat on his stomach, Bryan recognized the yellow hue. It was cheese! And it was melting…

---

Sean drops the beef patty onto the bun on his tray. He fails to notice the minuscule speck that is a tiny man atop the burger. He drops a slice of cheddar onto the meat as he spreads ketchup and mayo onto the top bun.

Next to him, Troy is scooping salsa onto nachos and shoving them into his mouth while Kyle rips the head of lettuce apart for their burgers. Sean grabs a leaf of lettuce, but skips the tomato. No one had sliced them, and no one really wanted to. Finally Sean pulls a few pickles out of the jar, and drops all but one into the sauce on the bun. He pops the last one into his mouth, savoring the sour flavor as he chews.

His creation finished, Sean smashes the burger together. He lifts the sandwich to his mouth and takes a monstrous bite.

“Fucking fantastic!” he says through a full mouth. Kyle nods in his direction as he starts in on his own burger. While Troy finishes putting his burger together, he asks Kyle about the hike they wanted to do.

Sean, however, doesn’t join the conversation as he continues to chew. Gulping down his mouthful, he reaches for some nachos with his free hand and dumps them onto the plate. Dipping one in the salsa, he brings it to his mouth. The crunch as he bites down is music to his ears. Sean had seriously been starving.

Sean brings the burger to his mouth and takes another bite, savoring the smoky flavor of the burger flooding his mouth. Troy makes a joke, eliciting a roar of laughter from Sean and Kyle. Sean, unconcerned about manners, laughs with his mouth open. Half chewed piles of food, amidst strands of saliva stretching between his teeth are flooded with light. Bits of food go flying out of his mouth.

“Dude calm down!” Kyle says unhappily, feeling a few wet bits sticking to his bare chest. He wipes them free before biting into his own burger. Sean swallows his food and grunts apologetically.

Still starving, he brings more salsa-laden nachos to his mouth, his long tongue extending towards the spicy snack.
---

To say that Bryan was panicked would be an understatement. He was trapped by melted cheese, in some oblivious college guy’s burger. He could breathe, but he could not move. And now each second that ticked by as he waited for the colossus to tear into his food was an agonizing eternity.
A swift upwards movement is Bryan’s only warning. A deafening crunch is accompanied by a jarring quake. A glistening wall of white appears right next to Bryan’s immobile arm.

He yelps in terror upon realizing it is a tooth. He had nearly been bitten in half! The teeth move away, pulling the bite free. He watches as the lips close, just as the tongue heaves the bite towards the molars. Though he can see outside, his only view is of the massive Sean, and cheese still holds his entire body hostage.

The show is not over either. As Sean begins to chew, his lips part with every movement of his jaws. Loud smacking assaults Bryan’s ears as he is unable to tear his gaze away from the mouth. He can see the food, with each appearance it is less recognizable, flatter and soggier. The display is disgusting, especially at such a terrifying scale. Bryan notes it is a mere preview of what he would soon experience.

The lips purse shut and a wet gulp is audible. The lips part with a gusting sigh.

The mountain of food is gone. The tongue shifts in the darkness; Sean’s straight white teeth the only thing truly discernible beyond the lips.

Bryan braces for the next bite that will undoubtedly deliver him between the destructive jaws. Instead of moving forward, Sean’s other hand appears. Clasped in his fingers is an airplane sized nacho, a pool of dip glistening on its surface. The immense mouth widens, and the tongue slides forward. Bryan is disgusted to see strands of saliva stretch down the extended tongue. Soggy chunks of bread, beef, and lettuce are spread haphazardly across the tongue, with larger piles lining the sides by the molars.

In the back an arch of pink and a gently swaying uvula frame the blackness of the throat. Bryan knew it lead into the depths of this young man’s body. As a crunch blasted from ahead, Bryan sunk into deep thought.

Soon he would follow that bite of burger and this nacho, down the esophagus and into the stomach. This guy would gulp him down and wouldn’t even notice. He wouldn’t know the bite from any other. He probably wouldn’t even remember the meal!

“For him, it’s just a regular barbecue!” Bryan thinks in defeat. How had his incredible discovery landed him here!?

A tremor returns him to reality. Ahead Sean’s lips are parted, showing his mouth which is once more empty.

He feels himself moving forward as the cavern ahead widens. A foul wind floods his nose as he nears. Bryan however is in shock and doesn’t react. He only has one thought as he passes into Sean’s mouth.

“This guy has really nice teeth!” noting the lack of fillings in the towering, sharp edges of the molars.

A crunch, louder as it echoes around the mouth, stuns Bryan further. After a fleeting moment, chaos erupts. Crunches rumble in the darkness and Bryan feels himself moving randomly. Unable to control his trajectory, he begins screaming in terror.

After a couple seconds he lands on something hard.

A molar.
Bryan is totally unprepared for what happens next. Laughter explodes around him, as light floods the mouth.

He feels humiliated. He could not leave this world in a worse way. And though surely coincidence, this giant is laughing.

Another thundering guffaw shakes him free, sending him…
1121112221221222121.title: A Bite to Eat

11211122212212221211.content:
Bryan feels a glimmer of hope as he flies free. With a splat he lands roughly on the tongue.

"NO!!" he roars indignantly as the lips come together, sealing him in darkness once more. As he is re-launched into the hectic motions of chewing, his screams are mixed with sobs of despair.

As he feels the food abruptly pushed to the back of the mouth he lets out a final plea.

“PLEASE! PLEASE DON’T EAT ME!” he wails. For an instant there is nothing, and Bryan foolishly allows himself to hope.

With a wet squelch he is sucked into the throat, disappearing with the soggy mountain of chewed food. His agonized scream echoes for a single second amongst the chewed remains in Sean’s cavernous mouth.

A second later light floods the mouth as a massive nacho piled with salsa is shoved into the mouth, a crunch sounding as the jagged teeth come together.

---

Sean chews absently as he listens to his friends. He cannot feel the bite of burger’s descent into his chest. As the bite lands in his stomach, almost everything is drowned out by the sound of him munching on the nacho.

Bryan continues to plead for help from within Sean’s stomach. Sean however is preoccupied with an argument about which zombie video game was the best. He is completely oblivious to the drama playing out deep within his gut.

Sean continues to wolf down his burger and nachos as Bryan struggles within the stomach. Troy offers him a beer, which Sean gladly accepts after putting his second burger together.

Taking a swig of beer, Sean can feel it soothingly flow down his throat. The liquid floods his stomach, leveling the mountain of food that Bryan had been climbing.

Digging into the next burger, creates a perfect storm for his unnoticed passenger. The tiny scientist is treading beer as chunks of burger and nacho rain down from above, threatening to strike him.

Sean pops the last bite of burger into his mouth, chewing loudly before gulping it down and sighing.

“Dude that was perfect!” he says to Kyle as he cradles his full belly. Kyle grins and shrugs his mouth full as he’s only halfway through his second burger. Sean slurps down some beer and tosses a nacho into his mouth, chewing as he took in the scenery.

“Well now that you’re all calmed down, I wanna take a picture,” Kyle said, putting down his sandwich. Sean shrugged in agreement. Troy and Kyle sat next to him and Kyle held out his phone and snapped a picture.

Reviewing it showed the three young men in their prime, grinning happily.

“It’s gonna be an awesome weekend!” Troy shouted to the sky. “Hell yeah!” Kyle added.

Sean grinned at his friends. “This weekend will be perfect!” he thought happily. His stomach gurgled gently. The screams of a tiny scientist caught in a digestive storm went unnoticed.
11211122212212221211.title: Perfect

choices: lay down for a sec
put on a shirt and rejoin his friends outside
11211122212212221212.content:
Bryan screams as he shoots forward, his surroundings a bright blur. Following an abrupt collision, he finds himself stuck in place, as he's still drenched in saliva. Dazed, he groans in confusion as a thunderous voice shakes his world. In his blurred vision he makes out a rough hand approaching quickly. His scream is unnecessary as it sweeps below him before retreating. Above him, a crunch of lettuce is accompanied by small but noticeable movements. As Bryan's head clears he realizes he is stuck to the shirtless giant's chest!

Looking straight upwards he can see the fuzzy jaw as it shifts, a muted crunch with each movement. A bob of the Adam's apple precedes a loud gulp and Bryan swears he can hear the food being squeezed into the chest and landing with a plop in the stomach below. The colossus, unconcerned with the workings of his digestive system, takes another large bite out of his burger. Bryan stares, transfixed from his perch below. The giant, unaware of his captivated audience starts to talk loudly with his equally massive friends. His voice reverberates through Bryan, whose tiny form remains thankfully in place.

---

Kyle makes quick work of his burger. Popping the last bite into his mouth, he reaches across the table to make another burger as he chews. "Dude!" Kyle grunts through a full mouth. Sean and Troy turn to look at him. *Munch, munch!* "We gotta go..."*Gulp!* "hiking to the lake tomorrow." Sean nods enthusiastically while Troy shrugs, a nacho in hand.

"As long as someone doesn't get hungover, I'm sure it won't be a problem!" Troy pops the nacho into his mouth with a crunch while eying Sean.

Sean glares back jokingly, "It's only my sixth one!" he says through a full mouth, spewing crumbs at Troy.

Troy makes a face *Gulp!*"If you fuck yourself up, I'm not carrying you anywhere!" he wipes his cheek with his hand. "Swallow before you speak man!" he says, genuinely annoyed.

"You have a serious problem," Kyle nods in agreement as he starts in on his second burger.

The guys continue to chat and laugh as they finish off their meal. Later the sun is sinking towards the horizon and a cool breeze blows through the camp. Kyle shudders, goosebumps erupting across his exposed chest. He stands up and rushes towards the tent.

"You guys gonna build a fire?" he calls behind him. Without waiting for an answer he ducks into their shared tent.

Kyle decides to...
11211122212212221212.title: Safe Perch

choices: wakes Kyle up
decides its time to sleep as well
112111222122122212121.content:
Kyle sits down on his sleeping bag and immediately a lets out a wide yawn.

"It's been a long day" he thinks, as he begins to feel sleepy. "I'll only lay down for a sec" he assures himself as he lays on his back and closes his eyes.

---

Bryan had no clue what to do after ending up on the giant's bare pec. He was terrified if he should try to move, he would plummet from his rather safe and lofty perch.

So he was forced to wait as the titan devoured mountains of food. Bryan was glad he had gotten that bit of meat; whether or not it had been worth being nearly eaten and trapped on some oblivious giant's chest remained to be decided.

As the three voices thundered around Bryan, he struggled to decide how to contact one of these giants. Even if he had their attention, how would he get his message across? He really wasn't sure about that...

"I just need to focus on getting someone's attention first" he thought determinedly.

As the sun began to set, Bryan was still plastered to the chest, unnoticed. He watched the young men talk and laugh with each other. From his safe vantage point it was almost easy to forget what destructive and terrifying beings the giants were. From here they were simply a group of friends hanging out for the weekend. However the occasional gurgle from the digesting meal in Kyle's stomach reminded Bryan just how dangerous every little thing they did could be.

A cool breeze buffeted the tiny man, and he felt the skin beneath him bunch up into small hills.

"Goosebumps!" Bryan laughed at the magnified display at his size. He also felt his bonds loosen with the shifting skin.

"Oh!" Bryan shouted in surprise, his fear of falling returning full force. He reached for something to hold as the colossus began to walk. A few small hairs proved to be poor grips. With each step he felt his hands slip.

Suddenly noticing the light had gotten dimmer, Bryan looks around to see gray in every direction. He feels his grip slip, as the wall he had been stuck to tilts sharply. Bryan lets out a scream as he tumbles away.

After a moment he realizes he had gently come to a stop far sooner than he had expected Looking around he realizes Kyle had laid down, because he was inside the mountainous gray tent! Bryan had merely slipped partway down his chest. Standing up Bryan sees he stands on Kyle's toned stomach. Ahead of him the chest rises and falls with every heaving breath. It is a truly living landscape. Beneath his feet Bryan can hear violent gurgles as Kyle's meal from earlier is broken down out of sight. He shudders and rushes forward, eager to escape the frightening noises.

As he passes over the ribs, Kyle's breathing becomes a thundering snore. Bryan's clasps his hands over his tiny ears and presses on. He cannot stop, he has to make contact!

Finally reaching the neck without a problem, Bryan bypasses the Adam's Apple. He comes to the coarse, black stubble and without hesitating pushes into it. Bryan is running on Adrenaline as he feels he is nearing salvation. Using the hairs, he mounts the chin. Ahead he can see the parted lips, looking like small pink hills. The nose appears to be two pitch black caverns, a few small boogers caught in the hairs appearing like wild foliage.

Another deafening snore shakes the "ground", sending Bryan to his knees. The following gust of breath reeks of burger meat and salsa, causing Bryan to grimace in disgust.

Before he can get up and continue moving, Troy pops his head into the tent and...
112111222122122212121.title: Lay Down

choices: Bryan makes it to the phone
Kyle notices more movement
1121112221221222122.content:
Bryan walked towards the mountainous patty in a daze. Its coating of glistening grease beckoned him forward. His starved mind dismissed all other thoughts. That is until he stumbled forward with a yelp, landing painfully on his knees. He glared at the culprit: a simple splinter that was over half as long as he was.

Bryan shook his head, the small splinter reminding him of his grim reality. Oh sure he wanted food. But more importantly he needed rescue. He could eat after he had gotten someone to help him out. That needed to be his main priority!

Bryan scanned the table, searching for a good spot to be seen. In spite of his new-found resolve, Bryan still couldn't keep his mouth from watering. It was impossible to ignore the colorful spread of delectable picnic foods that towered over him like mountains.

Still searching, Bryan noticed a flash of movement out of the corner of his eye. He immediately froze, turning his head to discover the source. Another flash of movement near the food caught his full attention: an ant. Bryan quickly realized he could spot a few across the table, the creatures had already discovered the meal laid out on the table.

“Aha!” thundered one of the titans. Bryan spun around to see the shirtless one staring triumphantly at the iPhone in his hand. He strolls back to the table with his friends, tapping away on the device. Bryan gasps as they approach. Bryan had expected them not to seem so terrifyingly tall after climbing to this height. However they still towered above like moving skyscrapers, casting large shadows over the table.

---

Kyle snapped the picture of the tabletop displaying the meal he had put together, before dropping his phone into his pocket.

Sean glared at him, “You made us wait to eat and search all over so you could take a single fucking picture?!” he asked in disbelief. Kyle waved him away dismissively. “Shut up Sean, it’s not like you’re starving!”

A loud gurgle sounded from Sean’s midsection. He laughed “I think my stomach begs to differ! Hell, I feel like I could eat this whole table of food!” Sean stares greedily at the spread of food.

“Calm down fatass,” Troy said calmly as he pushed between Sean and Kyle and began building a burger. Following his lead, Sean and Kyle join Troy at the table and as they all sit down to seat, their conversation from earlier starts up again.

---

Bryan had run around ineffectually waving his arms when the giants had approached the table. They had been too preoccupied with their small argument, their eyes never dropping to the surface of the table. Bryan couldn’t suppress a yelp as the tattooed one sat at the table first. His large hand soared above, each finger stretching several city blocks. He watched dumbfounded as the titans began constructing their mammoth burgers. Each titan effortlessly lifted various food items that were easily larger than a city park. Bryan simply could not get used to the power these giants had and yet were so clueless to.
Even worse though, was that Bryan was making no progress. Multiple times it seemed their eyes had focused on his very spot, before flicking away. Bryan was completely beneath their notice.

“I’m right here!” he yelled furiously “I’m right in front of you! Why can’t you see me?” He spun around, trying desperately to find a good perch or something to be easier to see. However the flat expanse of the table gave him nothing to work with. The only elevated surfaces Bryan saw were on the various plates of food. But watching the giants snatch away the buns, patties, and veggies without so much as a passing glance gave him chills. Trying to be seen amongst their meal simply wouldn’t work.

A monstrous squish and crunch sounded behind him. He spun around to see the shirtless giant chewing through his first bite of burger. A piece of lettuce hangs from his lips, smeared with mayo. As Bryan watches, Kyle’s tongue slips out of his mouth like a snake to catch the loose piece of food. He laps at the smeared mayo on his lips, revealing the already deformed bite of burger in his mouth. Having caught the stray lettuce, the tongue retreats into the mouth as Kyle resumes chewing. All that remains are a few stray globs of mayo clinging to Kyle’s trimmed beard. Kyle doesn’t seem to notice as he chuckles at whatever his friends were saying.

It is then that Bryan realizes he is surrounded by the sounds of chewing. He spins around to see Sean grunting as he chews. He stops suddenly, bringing a chip piled with salsa to his lips. His mouth opens, revealing the soggy half-chewed piles of burger waiting to be swallowed. Sean simply tosses the chip into his mouth, content to let it mix together as he chewed. He struggles for a second to swallow all the food in his mouth. Before sinking his teeth into the delicious burger again, Sean’s voice thunders across the table as he talks with his friends. Bryan can see bits of food flying out of his mouth that rain onto the table below.

He finally turns to face Troy, who is clearly the fastest eater in the group. He is holding a single bite sized piece between his fingers as he chews. Bryan stares at it intently. The thing is large enough to feed him for months easily. And this giant would down it in a single, effortless bite. Troy gulps, his prominent Adam’s Apple bobbing. His eyes flick to the final bite of burger. As he returns to the conversation with his friends, his hand swings downward, dipping the bite of food into a lake of ketchup. His hand shifts, hovering his bite of food over the table. Bryan notices a scavenging ant in the burger’s shadow. Its antennae start moving quickly as if in reaction to the nearby food.

Troy’s grip unexpectedly loosens, dropping the bite of burger onto the table. “OOPS!” Troy booms, gingerly picking it up, happy to see it hadn’t fallen apart. As he lifts it skyward, Bryan can see furious struggles in the ketchup: the ant.

Troy, unaware of the latest addition to his food brings the burger to his lips. Bryan, still able to see the ant’s fruitless struggles, starts to shout “Ew! No, don’t e-“ he stops as Troy’s mouth opens, his tongue sliding forward, soggy bits of bread and meat clinging to its surface. Bryan watches in terror as Troy pushes the food between his parted jaws. The struggling ant is visible until Troy’s lips come together and begins to chew. The behemoth doesn’t notice anything out of the ordinary as he chews. He speaks with a full mouth, pausing mid-sentence to swallow. Before long, Troy is pushing a chip with salsa into his maw, unaware of the life he had just unceremoniously gulped down.

Bryan backs away. The colossal college students already overlooked him. Now it was clear that the simplest of actions like walking or eating could be incredibly dangerous. That could have been him being devoured unnoticed like a crumb! Bryan realizes with a sinking feeling he has no feasible plan. Around him, the monstrous young men continue to feast.

---

Troy swallows the last bite of his burger, coughing as he feels a tickle in his throat. Unaware of the ant he had just gulped down, Troy dismisses the feeling as he pops a nacho into his mouth. He continues chatting with his friends, all three unaware of the horrific display they are giving their unnoticed guest as they scarf down their meals. Troy is not the only one who sends a hapless ant on a one way trip to their gut amongst mountains of chewed food.

“Oh shit, I never even posted that pic of the food!” Kyle said suddenly, reaching into his pocket to retrieve his phone. “Fuck I thought there was a signal here!” he muttered disappointedly, placing the phone on the table

“Oh no! End of the world, can’t post the pic!” Sean said sarcastically through a full mouth. Kyle snorted in annoyance but gave no more reply.

“Well if we go on that hike, I bet you’d get a signal at the top of the hill,” Troy said, second burger in hand. Kyle nodded, “Yeah you’re probably ri-“ He abruptly stops to smash his thumb onto a wandering ant. “Augh fucking ants!” he says unhappily glaring at the flattened bug plastered to his thumb. “Where there’s one, there’s a million!” Kyle says as he wipes his thumb on the side of the table. “You might even be eating some!” he added.

Troy shrugs “It doesn’t really matter. They’re just ants… just a little more protein to digest!” he says unconcerned, rubbing his stomach. “Now about that hike…” Troy begins

---

Bryan tries to keep himself calm, unable to think of a realistic course of action. As if on cue, the shirtless giant placed his phone onto the table with a resounding smack, before returning to the conversation with his friends. Bryan sighed dejectedly; the giant hadn’t even glanced down!

But then an idea sparked a flame of hope. This giant, like many his age, spent a lot of time staring at his phone. And that phone was conveniently lying on the table not far away at all. Bryan started sprinting across the table to the monolithic phone as his mind fleshed out the details of his plan.

An earth-shattering thud breaks his focus and sends Bryan sprawling onto his knees. Not far away, the shirtless giant has his thumb pressed to the table. Bryan is awed simply by the enormity of his hand. Lifting away, the pulverized corpse of an ant was revealed on the thumb. Bryan shuddered; that easily could have been him!

How did these giants not realize how exceedingly huge and monstrous they were in this world? They were taking lives without even noticing. If they did notice, they didn’t even care.

“I need to get noticed for what I am now!” Bryan panicked, resuming his sprint across the table.
1121112221221222122.title: Overlooked

choices: "I don't think that's a bug!"
"Kyle you should record this!"
11211122212212221222.content:
Kyle pops another nacho into his mouth, looking at the mountain Troy is pointing at for the hike. “Yeah sure, “ he pauses to swallow, “Sounds good!” He glances at his phone again, wondering if its battery would last through the hike. Before looking away he notices a pale speck moving across the table.

Instinctively, Kyle moved his thumb over the bug to smash it. Just before crushing the thing out of existence he stops. He had an idea.

“Hey Troy,” Kyle says slyly. Troy looks up with a grunt, still wolfing down his burger. “You said you don’t mind some extra protein right?” Troy gives him a quizzical look, nodding as he gulps down the food in his mouth. “Prove it, try this one!” Kyle says, pointing at the pathetic bug.

As Sean and Troy lean in to get a closer look, it flees away from the group. “It knows!” Sean laughs “Run little bug! You’re gonna end up in Troy’s stomach!” Troy watches it flee for a moment, before licking his thumb and pressing it gingerly onto the bug.

“What is it?” he asks looking at Kyle. Sean continues staring at the bug as it squirms on Troy’s thumb.

“Hell if I know!” Kyle shoots back. “Who cares, just eat it, you said it doesn’t matter!” Troy shrugged, “Yeah, whatever, I don’t care.” With that he brings his thumb to his lips, stretching his tongue to simply lap it up.

Sean, still staring intently at the bug, sees Troy’s tongue burst from his mouth. Bits of food are scattered across the surface of the tongue, each easily larger than the bug. They probably wouldn’t even be able to see it one Troy stuck it to his tongue.

“Wait!” Sean shouts suddenly. Troy freezes, his tongue still hanging out of his mouth.

“What?” Kyle asks, turning to Sean. Sean faces him and replies:
11211122212212221222.title: Noticed, but unknown

choices: Something falls in his path!
Bryan attempts to communicate
11211122212212222.content:
Continuing forward, Bryan saw only two options: approach either the table with the two seated giants, or the single giant manning the grill.

Both seemed equally dangerous in different ways. In order to approach the table, Bryan would first encounter the giant wielding the bug spray. This behemoth by all accounts made the teeny man most nervous. His copious amount of tattoos, both on his calves and arms that depicted scenes of fiery skulls, brazen designs, and mythical beasts, coupled with the seemingly never ending stream of toxins he kept spraying, made the table an unappetizing target.

Bryan turned his judgement towards the more direct route: the grill.

"Shitting Christ... He's a damn monster!"

The view sent a tingle down his tiny spine. His tremendous back facing Bryan, the titan stood before the huge grill, shifting constantly as he worked it.

Bryan decided he must be some sort of athlete, at the very least. His thick legs coated in tangle of dark hairs and hard with muscle, while his shirtless torso presented an impressive physique. The monumental young man was both awesome in sight and positively intimidating. Bryan couldn't help but feel aroused looking at this living mountain; but knew better than to tarry and kept on.

The giant in question turned suddenly, grinning, and boomed. "ALMOST DONE, THESE ARE GONNA BE GREAT." Loud comments thundered in reply from the two seated behemoths. The shirtless one plucked a bag of wheat buns from the table and plopped it onto the ground near his feet.

Bryan watched the huge, oblivious face turn back out of view to the smoldering patties once more. He suddenly felt a twinge of hunger, quickly reminding him of why he came. Thoughts of juicy hamburgers invaded the shrunken man's mind, his gait slowing and saliva pooling in his mouth.

"Dammit! I am famished... It feels like years since I last ate!" He whined, looking with moist eyes at the towering grill protected by the gigantic shirtless hulk. "I wish I was invited to eat!" His eyes flitted to the misshapen bag of buns, laying near the giant's right shoe.

If he wasn't invited, he could always snatch a crumb or two! Bryan pictured himself stealing away like Zorro, purloined food in-hand. He afforded himself a giggle at such an image. Then he realized that he might be forced into such acts, like some kind of common insect. All while these guys continued their outdoor fun, thoroughly oblivious to Bryan's insignificant theft.

The idea that his mere presence here was utterly unknown to these campers made him feel slightly sheepish. He was, after all, literally creeping around and spying upon them - regardless of his intentions for innocent rescue.

Bryan had halted: not even halfway there, with many more leagues remaining between his tiny self and the grill. He shook himself from his thoughts and began running once more. He had to keep moving!

Rescue was imminent - or was it?
11211122212212222.title: Approaching the grill

choices: Run like hell!
Hide!
112111222122122221.content:
Despite the arduous journey, Bryan found himself nearing the grill.

It seemed that to his benefit, the world of giants moved at a much slower pace. Bryan seemed to recall during his research of tiny creatures and reducing matter in size, that smaller creatures had different perceptions of time. He had no idea if this was true, but it seemed evident by the giant's sluggish movements and thunderous voices.

He poured over these theories, keeping his eyes fixed on the shirtless giant before him and his body in constant motion.

The landscape was tricky for his tiny form. Indentations had been left by giant footwear had become intermingled into a mess of hills and dales. It proved irksome, and Bryan found himself running on level ground only to be sliding or climbing an incline moments later. Pebbles the size of houses and smaller dotted the land, while twigs and fragmented leaves made hefty obstacles.

Suddenly, Bryan noticed a shadow coat his immediate vicinity. From above landed a tremendous structure that crashed into the ground before him. Bryan screamed, flying backwards and painfully landing on his butt.

"What in God's name?" He said, sputtering. Covered in dirt, Bryan brushed it away and gazed at the sight before him.

It was a cylindrical object that loomed over a hundred feet. Strangest of all, it was a bright shade of red that seemed familiar somehow and appeared to be made of plastic.

"...THERE IT IS."

Bryan screamed one more, cowering when a humongous hand lowered from the sky and grasped the red structure with ease, lifting it away.

The huge appendage deposited the red cap onto the bench and then reached for a tower of insect repellent set near it. Bryan cried out in dismay, realizing he had inadvertently placed himself in the vicinity of the tattooed giant!

----

"Fuck me, Troy lay off that damn spray already, will ya?" Sean said, frowning as he attempted to clear the air.

Setting the repellent cap back onto the bench, Troy grunted and resumed his application of bug spray. He was on his third coat; having already covered his limbs twice since they arrived. Sean looked up from his phone, aware of the continued spraying and glared.

"Dude, you're gonna put me in a coma!"

Troy paused briefly. "Fuck you. These bugs are giving me hell, I fucking need all I can get." Two short sprays later, he looked up once more. "...I just have to cover my legs, just hold on."

Leaning over, the blond metalhead began generously covering his exposed calves. Both were heavily tattooed; both of which he had designed himself and enjoyed showing off. Finishing his left, he moved on to his right, quickly but thoroughly coating it with the noxious repellent. Finished, Troy happened to glance at the ground near his feet.

"What the hell is that?" He stared down at the weird creature. It was small; like, really fucking small. Troy began to leaned in closer before relenting. "Damn bugs."

He raised the can of repellent over the tiny bug. Without so much as a thought, he depressed the button and unleashed a cloud of toxins over the ground. Sitting up, Troy snatched the cap, covered the can as he stood up, and crossed the campsite to put it away.

---

Bryan gawked with amazement at the colossus before him. He snapped out of it and began attempting to gain attention.

"Help! Help me! Heeelp! Down here!" The shrunken genius hopped excitedly, flailing his limbs and thrashing his head.

Nearest him was an enormous black sneaker. The suede surface was covered in dust and dirt, worn patches and fraying cords spotted it. Stretching out and high into the sky was a tower of painted flesh. A hellish image of piled skulls and demonic creatures spanned across it. Bryan was able to discern the word "SLAYER" painted in the center of a barbaric pentagram. Higher up, past the summit of the giant's knees, Bryan could see his giant face looking over the table.

The giant opened his mouth, emitting a throng of thunder that was impossible to understand.

"Look doooowwn! I'm right here!"

As if in response to his plea, the titanic metalhead turned his attention downwards, grasping the can of repellent in one hand. Bryan took cover when a torrent of noxious spray burst forth, misting over the giant's calves and lightly sprinkling the ground. The tiny man cried out, covering his mouth to keep his mouth clean. He looked up, tears and mucus streaming over his face. The giant remained oblivious; continuing his work and never glancing to the ground.

"WHAT THE HELL IS THAT?"

Until Bryan inhaled once more, much to his disdain because of the putrid air, and prepared to cry out. Shifting his huge eyes, Bryan felt them lock onto him. He returned the gaze, feeling like a tiny human staring into the face of God.

"Yes! I am a person! You have to help me! Oh, please, help me!" Bryan yelled with all his might. He couldn't believe it - he was saved!

The giant had a face of planetary proportions. It would easily rival the moon, Bryan knew, and would take just as much effort to explore. He watched the thick blond brow come together, furrowing and creasing the tremendous forehead like the wall of a canyon. Long, bushy sideburns framed the stern face, reaching across the huge jaw before meeting in a strip of hair underneath the massive lips.

As the face neared, Bryan screamed louder and louder. He was scared beyond his wits, but knew this was the closest he had ever come. Surely fate would not screw him now? He waited for the young giant to save him, taking him home to be returned to normal and end this nightmare.

Bryan saw nothing but callous disinterest in the giant eyes. A stylized image of a police officer drawn to resemble a pig covered the titan's black t-shirt.

"Help me already!" The tiny scientist demanded, becoming impatient.

Then the huge, chapped lips parted in response and dashed Bryan's hopes completely.

"DAMN BUGS."

Almost instantly and without warning came the nozzle of the immense can of repellent. It hovered directly overhead - so close that an errant drip from it crashed into the ground nearby with a hefty thud.

"Noooooooooo!"

Then the dirt-crusted finger pressed down and unleashed a tidal force upon the bug-sized man.

Bryan was sent backwards. He whipped through the air violently, crashing back into the dirt many dozens of feet away, completely soaked in the slimy toxins. He imagined some broken bones, or perhaps the bruises would be the worst. Rubbing his eyes clean, he found he was wrong.

The bench creaked deeply in protest when the giant raised himself from it. Standing higher than Bryan could fully comprehend, loomed the callous young man. "...he-...help...heeelpp...." His tiny croaks were weak and rasping. "...pleeaseee.... hel-..."

No longer interested in the tiny world below, the giant lifted his shoe in preparation to move. Once again, Bryan devolved into high-pitched screams. The sky became darkened. High above, the sole of the giant's sneaker dominated everything. Bits of nature were crammed into the deep tread: dirt, pebbles, grass, and smashed bugs. It was a horrific sight to behold.

"...Please, I just want... to... go home..."

Then it descended.

THOOOM!

Then it lifted away.

Bryan lay there, still tumbled, now pressed into the dirt, but alive and intact. He felt the pounding footsteps slowly lessen, before he was left to himself.

All around him, the distinct pattern of tread was pressed into the dry dirt. Bryan truly realized his size, noting that he had been fortunate enough to end up in one of the raised indentations; specifically, in-between the lugs of tread.

Sore, but able, Bryan rose up and looked around. He decided to...
112111222122122221.title: Giant Metalhead

choices: Bryan is able to reach the bag!
The giant grabs another bun and spots the ants
112111222122122222.content:
Using the spatula, Kyle applies pressure to each patty. The sound of crackling grease and fat sending his mind into quasi-primal hunger induced thoughts.

"Almost done," He announces, turning to grin at his buddies. "These are gonna be great!"

Troy pauses his incessant application of bug spray to roll his eyes. "Uh-huh, too bad we'll be dust and bones before we eat 'em..." Sean snorts in agreement, extending his hand to grab his half-empty beer. He barely begins to swallow when suddenly he coughs it up. "Troy, goddammitt!" Glaring, Sean waves his hand to clear the air. "Why the hell are you spraying that shit on the table?"

"Keep your cool! I just saved our table from some ants," Sean followed his buddies gaze to the surface of the table just as Troy sweeps a few twitching specks off with his hand. "Tiny bastards are all over the place."

After a second, Troy continues coating himself with the repellant, ignoring the grumbles and curses as Sean wipes beer from his shirt.

Kyle ignores them both, knowing better, and snatches the bag of burger buns from the table. "Dude! Sean, grab the cheese and lettuce," He says matter-of-factly with a nod to the plastic cooler. Kyle drops the bag next to his feet, not noticing as crumbs fall around his feet.

"But, of course, your Majesty!" Says Sean sarcastically, leaning over to drag the beat-up container closer before opening it.

"Damn straight, bro! I'm the cook, I'm the fucking king!" He gives himself an ostentatious thumb to the chest with a grin. Both Troy and Sean snort with disbelief as the sizzling meat dominates the air.

---

The tiny man ignored the titanic commotion caused by the two seated giants. Each sound was increased to thunderous volume, sounding more like deeps booms of distant artillery than two guys having a conversation.

He even caught a few words that were understandable. Boisterous slang, and even what sounded like a name. Then one word made his blood run cold, "Ants" - and he glanced upwards to look at the tattooed giant. Bryan gasped, in-taking breath to scream otherwise when he realized the frightening behemoth wasn't even looking at him.

"What the-...!" Screamed the tiny bug-sized man as three large shapes were sent hurtling to the earth.

They contacted the ground with sickening thuds. One landed near him, the others farther away. Bryan peeked from under his raised limbs and gasped at the twitching creature. It was an ant. Coated in dirt and sticky with some kind of noxious residue; it twitched painfully, curling and contorting in the grip of death. Glancing upwards showed the tattooed giant callously uninterested in the tiny victim, already moved on as he continued his conversation.

Bryan cringed. He couldn't help but feel thankful in a selfish sort of way. It had not been him who was so cruelly disposed of; just a common ant - yet, he still felt sickened by the act. The way in which this creature - larger than a car to him - was so mercilessly removed from the giant's sight. It made him queasy, but his mind told him otherwise. "I'm not an ant. Even if I am smaller, they will see me!" His statement lacked weight, and he knew it, but the shrunken man continued on.

Barely a moment later, the world quaked with a tremendous thud. Bryan screamed as he fell back, coughing from a cloud of fine dirt that settled around him.

"Oh my God!"

Larger than a football stadium - or even a mountain, it seemed - stood an enormous white skate shoe that towered barely a hundred feet ahead. It was colossal, like a building with deep stitching of cable-like threads stretched to their limits, the thick white leather creased and scuffed from everyday use. Bryan felt his sense of preservation telling him to flee. Out of sheer terror and awe, he wanted to just run away like the minuscule insect he had become. Bryan pulled himself up, nervously scanning the once white wall of rubber coated with dirt from the campground. The mountainous shoe creaked and groaned as the owner shifted his colossal weight.

With an gritty grind, the sneaker lifted upwards in a gusting whoosh and crashed down further away. The quaking thud almost knocked Bryan from his feet, who looked at the massive shoe as disrupted dirt settled around it.

Immediately, he snapped from his trance and looked towards the now visible mass of plastic containing the burger buns. His gaze caught not by the multitude of crumbs strewn around it, but by slight movement both around and on the bag. It seemed Bryan wasn't the only one interested in a quick snack!

"Ants!" Bryan's realization was nothing short of exasperation.

The tiny scavengers mingled through the battlefield of crumbs that ranged from Bryan's size to building size. Two ants closest to him worked together to transport a crumb four times their size. They passed others who greedily excavated the fallen crumbs, some picking smaller pieces up, while others rallied their comrades for help.

Rolling booms of deep speech roared from above, sounding like thunder from an oncoming storm. Looking up, the tiny man watches the giant white shoe raise from the dusty ground. The giant's towering leg swings like a skyscraper-sized pendulum lifting the huge skate shoe crashes down on the ants and crumbs with a reverberating thud. The tiny scientist feared he would be next, but realized the exact opposite when an enormous hand lowered from the heavens.

The fingers were longer than buildings, coated in a sheen of grease and dirt. Dark hairs coated the hand like foliage coating a mountain-side. It soared downwards, headed for the huge bag of buns.

A deafening crinkle of plastic echoed all around, as the misshapen bag relinquished a set of continental-sized burger buns to the titan's grip.

Without further ceremony, the hand raised back into the sky, effortlessly lifting the monumental bun. It was simply amazing to Bryan that these giants had no inkling the power they commanded. More crumbs rained down, falling like spongy meteor upon the dirt and bouncing off the huge sneaker. High above, the sound of the oblivious titan's laughter boomed accompanied by his equally huge buddies. The giant shifts again, lifting his gargantuan shoe as he returns his attention to the grill.

The stretch of land where the shoe had been was now shaped into the pattern of the sneaker tread. None of the crumbs remained, and only a few squirming ants littered the stomped area. From his position, Bryan could make out the hills and dales of dirt as zig-zagging patterns deeper than irrigation canals. He realized with a shudder that the entire area was coated in various angles of the pattern, distorted and scuffed as the careless guy pounded around.

Bryan feels like running once more. This all seemed too impossible! How could he ever expect to gain even an ounce of acknowledgment from this massive brute? This guy was too fucking big. Bryan couldn't even look up past the giant's towering legs that seemed to go on forever.

Those crumbs were larger than he was and the giant didn't even notice as he obliterated them!

His thoughts shriek to a halt when he notices the massive bag again. It lay slumped over, the opening flush with the dusty earth and part of a bun exposed. If anything, Bryan could reach it with relative ease!

"I can run for it," He said. His tiny eyes flitting from the bun to the terrifyingly huge sneakers towering close-by. "This is my chance!"

Not wanting to over think it, Bryan began sashaying madly across the expanse of roughly patterned dirt.
112111222122122222.title: Crumbs and ants

choices: The giant places the bun on the grill
The giant notices specks moving on the bun
1121112221221222221.content:
Running, leaping, and more often than not stumbling brought the tiny scientist across the swatch of land between him and his goal. He had to reach it; he would reach it!

The colossal bag of burger buns lay haphazardly piled in the dirt. Transparent plastic making up the opening mingled with the gusty dirt, allowing anything small easy entry. This was Bryan's plan. Climb the bag and then one of the magnificently huge buns. It wasn't perfect, but just having a target in general gave the shrunken man hope.

Sliding down another of many inclines pressed in the dirt, Bryan began scampering up the next immediate slope just as the ground beneath him shifted. He surprised himself, jumping off the twitching dirt just as a submerged ant broke through the crest of dirt, clashing and clicking angrily. Bryan dared a look back before reaching the top and nearly falling down the next slope.

"Oh...oh, crap! I'm almost there!" He heaved, pressing on against the debilitating terrain.

All the while, thunder rolled down from the heavens. The speck of a man was too engrossed to listen to the looming giants and their monumental conversation. Thankfully the one nearby remained still, save for minor shifts of his gigantic feet. The two at the table seemed to be making a commotion about the food, while the one looming over Bryan and the grill talked about a cellphone. The comprehensible booming was far and few, but regardless of his journey, Bryan picked up a few words. He even heard some names. Sean and Kyle, it sounded like. Such average names seemed ridiculous to be applied to these massive and powerful beings.

An ant nearly threw Bryan over as it hurried along, vanishing over each rough incline far easier than himself. Many ants were heaving to and fro, some running aimlessly while others worked at the dry ground to pull their injured comrades free. Bryan ignored them, skirting around the twitching carapaces that dotted the dirt. He couldn't afford to worry about these stupid bugs when he himself was in danger.

The tumultuous terrain suddenly came to a stop. The tiny man blinked, looking ahead and seeing his destination a mere parks-length away. It was quick work, as the towering titan hadn't chanced to land his mega-sized feet here and compact the dirt beneath his tread.

"Hallelujah!" Bryan squeaked as he ascended the sloping plastic mountain. "Majestic mountains of fucking bread!"

Dirt had been splashed over the slick surface, allowing a much easier pace for Bryan who only slid a couple times. It was as if God himself was holding Bryan's hand, spurring his minute efforts on, that he made his way up to a building of brownish crust. It was huge. Easily dozens of times his insignificant height, and spanning limitless in either direction. Like some kind of yeasty-baked Berlin wall. Bryan jumped at it, feeling invigorated by his progress, and dug his hands into the soft surface with relative ease. And, it was rather easy: as he climbed, he simply poked through the crust with each foot and hand. He had already climbed well over a dozen feet before another climber rudely crossed his path, nearly dislodging him into a terrifying free-fall.

Bryan hissed at the ant as it effortlessly climbed. It seemed to him the mindless bug was just wanting to show off.

He resumed. Poking, pulling, poking, and pulling. The top was soon one more poke-and-pull which Bryan flung himself over breathlessly. "Thank Christ...I made it," He celebrated, lifting his weary self up and looking around. "Now to figure out what to do next!" Gazing over a lovely stretch of white, spongy bread was the golden domed mountain of the top bun. It reminded him of a stadium more than anything, but larger than any one he could imagine.

Deciding upon that, Bryan began awkwardly stepping forward to cross the deeply perforated surface. He had just paused to gaze down such a hole, when a quaking crash sent him reeling. Bits of fine dirt settled over the spongy bun, irritating Bryan's eyes. He kept his balance and turned around with a gasp. More dirt settled around the stained white rubber sole supporting a sneaker that rested over almost all the land Bryan had just been traversing. He breathed in, shuddering at the sight of the creased white leather bending and stretching against the giant's step. This sight alone was enough to bring Bryan back to the harsh reality of his minuscule world. Staring dumbly, he failed to notice until too late the rest of the towering guy leaning high above, reaching down.

Hearing the displacement of air, Bryan shot his attention skywards with a surprised scream. Looming now directly above him was the same hand he saw craning down from afar. Fingertips coated in grimy grease and dirt were attached to five stretching towers of flesh that connected with a palm big enough to blot out the sky. Dropping to his butt, the bug-sized scientist began a lengthy babble of shrieky nonsense as he scanned every callous and wrinkle on the giant surface above. It was all for naught. The massive hand descended, each colossal finger digging around the buns respectively with cataclysmic result.

This was entirely more terrifying than Bryan had planned, but in order to be seen, the giant had to lift him up with the bun! "Ohhhh nooo!" Bryan couldn't help but cry as he felt an intensity of vertigo crash against him as the giant lifted the buns off the ground. Memories of riding his one and only roller coaster came to him. The vertigo...the rush of wind...the fear. It was too much then, and this was so far beyond that experience, Bryan couldn't help but feel nauseous.

Wind and g-forces buffeted him, pressing his frail body into the spongy surface as he rapidly ascended thousands of feet. Everything was cast in ominous semi-shadow by the huge palm hovering above. An oomph of air escaped his tiny body as everything came to an abrupt halt. Rough vibrations followed, and the huge hand above lifted as the giant transferred the buns to his other hand. Rough fingertips appeared, poking around the flat surface of white bread to hold it from beneath. Bryan watched the domed bun pull away, held by massive fingers that carried it off to open space.

Suddenly, everything shuddered and shifted as the giant relaxed his hand slightly, giving Bryan a stunning view of the fuming hot grill far below. Huge red coals coughed out heat, glowing dangerously beneath pylons of blackened iron that spanned over the massive grill. He watched the other hand place the upper bun upon these pylons. It pulled away again, vanishing from view.

Bryan was terrified, but snapped back in to action. He had to act fast! "HEEEEEEEEEEELP!" His scream increasing in volume as the reduced man rotated to the giant above him. Bryan immediately started, gasping at the huge man's visage now towering directly above like a climber at the base of a mountain. It was breath-taking, at the least.

"Oh my," He pittered, gawking stupidly once more. Looking past the sloping mountains of muscle held beneath well-defined pecs coated with jet-black forests of hair, Bryan was utterly awe-struck by the godly face towering high above. It seemed so close, yet stretched so far; so high, that he felt positively overwhelmed. How could he dare speak to this man? This titan? Bryan felt so small and weak being almost face-to-face with such a gargantuan being.

He needed to -- no, he had to! "Please! Help me!!! Down here, look down!" He begged. The massive plain shifted and swayed in the titan's grasp, constantly interrupting his desperate cries. "Heeeeeeeyyy! You have to help me! Oh, God, please!"

It was then the giant opened his mouth, his massive jaw working up and down as thunderous speech exploded out. Then the giant's eyes snapped onto Bryan.
1121112221221222221.title: Progress!

choices: "Damnit, Troy, you didn't get them all!'
"Guys, this ain't no bug..."
11211122212212222212.content:
"OK; guys, let's-" the giant called Sean stopped mid-sentence as his eyes locked on to the miniscule man.

For Bryan, the speech was almost deafening. He was mere inches from the singularity that was the giant's mouth, and any words Bryan was screaming were utterly lost.

But the amazing titan of a man had stopped. And Bryan could see the two brown eyes squinting, focusing in, unmistakeably, onto him. Another yell got lost in Bryan's throat and turned into a pathetic whimper beneath the man's gaze. The scientist simply waved as the beefy giant squinted further. But why?
11211122212212222212.title: The giant notices specks moving on the bun

choices: Agreed to eat the contaminated bun
Grabbed it and tossed it away
112111222122122222121.content:
Kyle knotted his dark brow, gazing closer at the remarkably strange movement a the burger bun he held. If he wasn't just seeing things, he could swear it was...jumping. Jumping up and down like some kind of... Then another speck of movement dashed past the strange one, immediately diverting Kyle's lofty attention.

He grunted at it, feeling rather sheepish. "Gross! Ants!" Kyle said loudly, turning to the table. "Damnit, Troy, you didn't get them all!" Both his buddies stopped their actions and looked from him to the doughy bun in-hand. Kyle held it forward as evidence. "Dude, your goddamm spraying isn't doing a thing. The ants are wrecking the burger buns now!" He nudged the still-open bag with the toe of his shoe, righting it out of reach of the dirt.

Troy responded with an irksome frown and leaned over to view these so-called ants that escaped his wrath. "I don't know what you're talking about, I don't see-..." He then noticed the few squirming ants speckled across it. "Oh...fucking christ. You're right." Troy settled back again, merely offering a shrug a help in this problem when Sean loudly guffawed.

He told Kyle not to toss it, pointing at Troy as he voiced his solution. "Yeah, Troy, he's right. You take one for the team; we'll eat the clean ones, and you take the ant-flavoured bun since you're so fucking okay with it," Kyle sported an interested grin at this proposition. "Yeah. Sounds fair to me, bro." He added.

Both his buddies smiled their approval of this as Troy set the bug spray down and looked over the untoasted bun populated with ants. Not willing to let them get one over on him, Troy...
112111222122122222121.title: Damnit, Troy!

choices: “I’m not that desperate to see you eat it”
“I’ll give you $5 if Sean matches it!”
1121112221221222221211.content:
"You guys are such fucking pussies!" Troy snorted. "Sure, I'll eat the gross, wittle bugs!" Troy wiggled his fingers and widened his eyes in mock fear.

"But-" he said abruptly as he took the bun from Kyle, "-you gotta pay me!" Troy flashed a satisfied grin.

"Now who's a fucking pussy?" Sean shot back, eliciting a grunt of agreement from Kyle.

Troy rolled his eyes. “I ain’t no pussy! But you’re not getting a show without paying for your tickets!”

Sean and Kyle sighed in unison.

Finally Kyle said…
1121112221221222221211.title: Gotta pay for the show

11211122212212222212111.content:
“I’m not that desperate to see you eat it” Kyle said flatly.

Troy turned his head expectantly towards Sean.

“Eh… yeah, Kyle’s right. It’s not worth it.” He said with a shrug.

Troy frowned in disappointment. “You’re both fuckin’ cheapskates!” he grumbled.

Sean let out a small laugh before he started helping Kyle to investigate the remaining buns for ants. Meanwhile Troy looked down at the bun sitting in his open palm. Anyone giving it a passing glance wouldn’t even notice the tiny insects making their way across the bread. His eyes followed an oddly colored ant as it moved across the bun towards him.

“Not gonna eat you anymore!” He grunted. As if in reaction, the bug stopped and after a second started squirming. It kind of looked like it was jumping!

Troy cracked a smile. “I see you!” he said as he gingerly pinched the bug between his thumb and forefinger. He brought it closer towards his face.

---

After being mistaken for an ant and being heartlessly offered to be eaten as a dare, Bryan had felt immense relief when the two giants refused to pay their tattooed friend to devour him. His head spun as the ants around him harvested crumbs and zipped about seemingly in search of an exit.

Bryan was shaken from his thoughts as the titan’s finger tips spread out further. Staring upwards revealed the hulking man to be staring at the bun, though his gaze wasn’t focused on Bryan.

Without thinking about it Bryan rushed forward, waving his arms frantically.

“DOWN HERE!! PLEASE!! I’M NOT A BUG!!! I NEED HELP!!” he shouted at the top of his lungs.

He laughed manically as the colossus’ piercing blue eyes snapped onto him.

“NOT GONNA HEAT YOU ANYMORE!” he thundered. The words hated Bryan in his tracks. Though undoubtedly good news; the fact that the giant was so indifferent about eating him or not was horrifying.

Shaking the thoughts out of his head, Bryan began leaping in the air while continuing to wave his arms.

“PLEASE!! I’M NOT AN ANT!!” he begged.
Above, the massive lips stretched to bare his wall of teeth. They glinted with a sheen of saliva, and at this size the smile hardly appeared friendly.

“I SEE YOU,” he rumbled. Bryan felt relief flood his senses just before he was mowed down by a wall of flesh.

Trapped within the mammoth’s crushing grasp, Bryan couldn’t even inhale to scream. So he struggled silently as he was lifted even higher to the inquisitive giant’s distant face.

---

“What a weird looking bug…” Troy mumbled, “I wonder what it is…”

“Troy!”

Troy’s head shot to the side to face Kyle.

“Forget the bugs and help us set this shit up,” he said, nodding towards the cooler holding all the food.

“Oh yeah, sure,” Troy grunted in response, tossing the infested bun into the grass near the garbage can.

In his other hand he felt the minute struggles of the bug he had plucked from the bread. Without even thinking about it, Troy rubbed his fingers together to dispose of the odd insect. Indifferent to the small life he had needlessly extinguished, Troy simply brushed his fingertips on his shorts before stepping over to help his friends.
11211122212212222212111.title: Denied

choices: Troy washed the food down with his beer
Troy spit the food out
11211122212212222212112.content:
“I’ll give you $5 if Sean matches it!” Kyle said, elbowing Sean in the side.

“Hey!” Sean flinched, jumping away from Kyle. He eyed Troy and Kyle in annoyance before sighing dramatically.

“Fine! I’ll match Kyle’s $5” he groaned in irritation.

“And just in time!” Kyle said brightly, “The first burger patty is done!”

--

Bryan stood dumbfounded at what he was hearing. After having his hopes dashed when the first giant had mistaken him for an ant, another giant had chimed in and dared their friend to eat the ant-infested bun.

Correction: the ant and shrunken-human-infested bun. Not that these massive meathead had noticed.

“I’m obviously not an ant!” Bryan fumed, “JUST LOOK A LITTLE CLOSER YOU DENSE LOUTS!”

He glared upwards at the three titans who towered high above, faces bathed in shadow as they faced away from the warm sun. Their eyes were locked on each other as they discussed payment, ignorant to the minuscule scientist they were so apathetically condemning to be gulped down by Troy.

Realizing the situation had become hopeless, Bryan began sprinting across the doughy surface to try and reach one of the distant fingertips. He stumbled as he ran but remained determined to escape before the behemoth started eating.

--

“Gimme the bread!” Kyle ordered, “Otherwise your burger will burn!”

“I wanted the bottom bun toasted too!” Troy whined.

“Nah, that’ll kill the bugs! You gotta eat ‘em fresh and alive!” Sean replied tauntingly.

“Yeah!” Kyle echoed, holding his hand out for the bug-infested bun.

“Fine!” Troy grumbled, “Lemme just put on some ketchup first.”

--

Bryan’s lungs burned as he struggled to gulp in air. Though he wasn’t a complete couch potato, he had never been one to spend much time on athleticism. Now he severely regretted skipping the gym so often.

The pitted landscape of the bread heaved up and down like a ship at sea with even the smallest of the titan’s movements. Bryan willed his aching legs to keep up the pace. He was fast approaching the nearest finger. Once he latched himself to the hulking man’s thick skin, he could determine his next move!

So deep in his self-motivation, Bryan had failed to process any of the rumblings of conversation from the colossal men above.

It wasn’t until a shadow fell over him and the entire landscape of the bread that he turned his gaze upwards. Still running he gasped upon seeing the nozzle of a ketchup bottle seemingly aimed right at him. It hovered like an alien ship, with dark-red, flakes of dried ketchup dotted with dust coating the rim of the bottle’s mouth.

“NO!” Bryan shrieked, never slowing his pace. That is, until he was swept under a wave of thick ketchup.

--

After Sean handed him the bottle of ketchup, Troy looked down to see one of the ants heading towards the edge of the bun. Well he assumed it was an ant, it was colored differently but Troy couldn’t be bothered to properly identify the bug.

“Not getting away so easily!” he snickered. With that, he pointed the ketchup at the fleeing bug and smothered it in the condiment.

“Spread the ketchup with the patty,” Troy ordered as he handed Kyle the bun.

Kyle obliged, pushing the sizzling patty through the pile of ketchup to spread it across the bun. Taking it back, Troy quickly finished constructing his burger.

“C’mon brave man, eat it!” Kyle goaded him with an entertained grin.

“Look there’s one of your little victims!” Sean laughed as he pointed at Troy’s burger.

Troy glanced at the black ant scuttling along the side of the bottom bun.

“Guess that’s where I’ll start then!” Troy chuckled with a shrug before lifting the sandwich to his mouth and taking a huge bite.

--

Bryan squirmed, bathed in darkness within the burger. He had survived the tsunami of ketchup and the heat from what he could only assume was the arrival of the burger patty, but now he was trapped with no clue which direction was his best choice.

Not that it mattered. Even if he knew which way to go, his chance of making it to safety before the monstrous young man gulped him down were slim to none.

As if to confirm his bleak outlook, Bryan’s surroundings quaked violently. To accompany that was the distinct sound of crunching lettuce and squishing meat.

The behemoth had taken a bite.

Bryan couldn’t stop the sudden flood of emotions. Mere hours ago he'd been preparing to ship himself to his nephew! Yet it felt like a decade since Matt had come over unannounced, ruining everything! Now he was God-knows-where, beaten and bruised, trapped in some guy’s burger about to be eaten as a bet! It was all so insane!

Another quake shook Bryan to his core and he screeched in terror upon the appearance of an off-white wall just an arm’s length away. Its rough ivory surface was unmistakable. It was one of the behemoth’s teeth!

The teeth pulled away, easily removing what had been an impassable wall of meat for Bryan. He squinted as he was once more exposed to the bright sunlight. Straight ahead were the giant’s lips, framed by traces of a 5’o clock shadow. They shifted with each movement of the jaw, occasionally parting with an obnoxious smack to give Bryan a brief view of the food being decimated.

Bryan shivered unintentionally at the sight. While his life hung in the balance, he felt even worse knowing it was simply quick entertainment for the young giants.

--

“Mmmmmm!” Troy moaned pointedly, grinning at his buddies as he swallowed his first bite.

“You guys are such pussies! It just tastes like a regular burger!” he laughed before sinking his teeth into the sandwich.

“Keep that shit up!” Kyle dared in a faux-serious tone, “You won’t get paid!”

Troy frowned playfully as he chewed. He shook his head as he gulped down his next bite. “Nah! I want my easy money!” he shot back.

He flicked his eyes to his sandwich where a lone black ant was climbing up the bread towards the exposed burger patty. With a snicker, Troy stuck his tongue out to lap the ant off his sandwich.

“Delicious!” he barked, smacking his licks obnoxiously. This elicited a chuckle from Sean.

“Whatever! Seeing you act like an ass for $10 is worth it!” he teased, before taking a swig from his beer.

Troy flashed a goofy smile before taking another heaping bite of the burger.

--

Bryan was still struggling to free himself from the dense ketchup when a wet gulp from ahead caused him to freeze in horror.

He gaped as the lips parted, presumably to engulf him and the burger. Instead he was blasted with the young man’s deafening voice that showered him in warm spittle and bits of soggy burger. Bryan choked on the lingering smell of Troy’s rancid breath.

“Hey!” Bryan shouted. At least he was pretty sure he was shouting, he couldn’t hear his voice over the ringing in his ears. But he continued yelling, waving his arms trying to get the enormous young man’s attention. The entire burger tilted upwards, giving Bryan a clear view of Troy’s whole face.

Past the curved tip of his nose, Troy’s round blue eyes scanned the burger. His face contorted into a smile, but there was no warmth in his eyes.

In stunned silence, Bryan stared as Troy’s tongue burst from between his lips like a mythical monster. Coating its slimy, pink surface were clumps of soggy bread and chunks of mangled beef. The tip smashed onto a wandering ant on the burger.

It seemed Troy had done this on purpose as his tongue withdrew into his mouth with a slurp. The ant meanwhile squirmed in confusion until it disappeared behind the lips.

The mouth popped open with another explosion of sound. Bryan put his arms up in an ineffectual attempt to shield himself from the incoming saliva and food debris. The ringing in his ears that had been fading, instantly returned in full force.

“SAVE ME!! I’M A HUMAN!!” Bryan pleaded desperately. His only response was Troy’s lips stretching back into a smile, seemingly distorted at such a close-up. The saliva on his off-white teeth shined in the light, a couple pieces of food easily noticeable where they were caught between the ivory boulders.

A split second later and the mouth yawned open, revealing the mouth in all its glory. Strands of saliva, thicker than Bryan himself, stretched from the surface of the undulating tongue to the roof of the mouth. Flakes of lettuce, and more soggy piles of bread and meat were spread across the tongue. Moving frantically in the middle of the scene was the innocent ant Troy had just lapped up. At the back of the mouth, between two bulging tonsils, Troy’s uvula swung over the dark abyss of his throat.

“NO!! PLEASE!!” Bryan begged as he flew forward.

With a deafening crunch, he was sealed in darkness.

--

Troy munched on his burger, not giving a single thought to the hell he was putting the innocent ants through for a mere $10. In fact his only thought at that moment was that he wanted Sean to hand him another beer. Before he could, he felt a sharp pain near the tip of his tongue.

“AH!” he shouted, stopping chewing and bringing his free hand to his mouth. Sean and Kyle stared at him in confusion.

“Sean! Gimme a beer, one of the fuckers bit me!” Troy grunted.

Sean pulled a beer from the cooler with a laugh, “Ha! Your food’s biting back!”

As Troy grabbed the beer from Sean, he felt another jolt of pain from his tongue.
11211122212212222212112.title: Easy Money

112111222122122222121121.content:
Troy grunted again in pain as he lifted the bottle to his lips and drank deeply. Closing his eyes he, swallowed forcibly.

Taking a deep breath, Troy smacked his lips. “Whether they like it or not, these ants are taking a one way trip down!” Troy laughed, smacking his stomach loudly.

Deep within Troy’s stomach, the shrunken man was rocked by a sudden quake from the body surrounding him. As he struggled to move through the darkness, he tried to stifle a rise of panicked sobs. He screamed, begging for aid in spite of the air that was burning his lungs. In fact, he found not only were his lungs burning, but so were his eyes… and his legs… and his arms…

Before he knew it, Bryan collapsed in pain as he was quickly succumbing to the hostile environment of the stomach. He couldn’t tell if he was still staring in the darkness or if he had gone blind. As his senses dulled and the pain already started to dull, Bryan focused on the rhythm of gurgles that played as the stomach shifted and secreted more acid.

“I’m… I’m being digested!” Bryan struggled to string his thoughts together through the haze invading his mind. “I must be… first man… digested… alive… by a man!” Had he been fully conscious, Bryan would have been horrified at the circumstances of his demise. Instead, he simply smiled. “… first…” With that Bryan finally slipped into merciful unconsciousness, never to awaken.

Unable to imagine or appreciate the horror playing out within his own body, Troy continued to wolf down the burger as Kyle and Sean goaded him on. With each bite, Bryan’s body was further buried in an avalanche of chewed mush. Without another incident, Troy popped the last bite into his mouth mere minutes later.

“All gone!” Troy announced, following a quick gulp. With that he stuck out his tongue, revealing thick saliva strands and soggy chunks of bread and meat spread across his tongue. Sean quickly scanned Troy’s open mouth, confirming he had indeed gulped down all the ants.

As Kyle fished a $5 out of his wallet, Sean looked Troy straight in the eye.
