He returns to the garage and places the shears on a shelf high off the ground, safely out of Austin's reach. Mike then grabs a pair of gloves and a garbage bag. Without wasting another moment he returns to the line of hedges and begins picking up the largest pieces.

---

Bryan decides he wants this nightmare to end as soon as possible. The table is his nearest source of sure salvation. The living room is a far off mystery, and nothing else seems like a viable option. Besides he has no idea how much time he has before Mike returns!

Bryan crosses the kitchen staring in awe around the bright room. The white linoleum floor stretches ahead of him, its patterns and occasional dents like ditches and valleys to the minuscule man. The dining table and chairs are unnatural plateaus that tower high above. In the distance the kitchen counters and refrigerator are a backdrop like perfectly square mountains. However Bryan has little appreciation for the scenery and decorating skills of Ella Duggan. No, he is very focused on getting straight to the table as he has equated it with rescue.

After what seems like an eternity (but was more like 10 minutes) Bryan reaches the nearest leg of the towering dark wood table. Up close he can see that a combination of carved pattern and normally unnoticeable nicks in the wood make a very climbable cliff. Along with the leg connecting to the tabletop in a tapering slope, it would be relatively easy to mount.

In his early days as a scientist Bryan had been interested in geology and had spent some time rock climbing and the such. So he drew on his knowledge and very out of practice body to climb the table as quickly and easily as possible.

---

Mike dropped the bulging bag next to the garbage can. Looking back at the hedges, only the smallest of branches remain. Mike smiles deciding it to be a job well done. His footsteps echo slightly around the garage and Mike stops at the step leading inside. He kicks the filthy sneakers off, not noticing the dirt caked to the soles and the bug remains trapped in the tread. Pushing through the door into the kitchen his gaze falls onto the footprints Ella had been so unhappy about.

He really didn't feel like getting to them, but he knew that if he put it off, he wouldn't get it finished before Ella came back. He leans backwards through the door into the garage and grabs the broom. He quickly sweeps around the kitchen, unaware of how much dirt he is missing. Mike was never much good at cleaning, he's more of a handy man. Ella however would be happy enough with the effort and would be able to touch it up later. He returns to the broom to the garage and moves to the living room where he vacuums up the last traces of his careless steps inside. He sighs as he returns the vacuum to its normal place under the stairs, happy to have finished his chores for the day.

Glancing at the clock he sees he still has some time before the college football game will air. And he has to watch that. Not only because he is an avid fan, but because his younger brother plays on the team and while Mike couldn't be there in person to cheer, the absolute least he could was tune in on TV.

---

Bryan drags himself up the slope leading to the table and collapses on to the flat surface. He breathes heavily, so thankful to finally be horizontal again. He knows that a combination of determination and adrenaline is what barely got him up the table. He is exhausted and knows he will feel it in the morning. Hopefully in that morning he will be back to normal!

He thinks back to Mike as he rests. The giant man had returned when Bryan had been about three quarters of the way up. He watched his incredibly tall neighbor sweep the kitchen swiftly. His socked feet had roamed the floor at random, making Bryan all the more thankful to be safely off the floor. He left the kitchen and as Bryan finished up his climb the whine of a vacuum cleaner drifted in from the living room. Bryan was unable to stifle the nervous shiver the sound brought to him.

Feeling better Bryan sits up and scans the table top. The flat surface stretches away from him, the towering forms of the salt and pepper shakers as well as a napkin holder visible on the other side of the table. A few errant crumbs are scattered about, unseen leftovers from previous meals. Here and there, small cracks have opened up in the wood, posing a danger that the tiny scientist will have to watch for.

Bryan hears Mike before he sees him. The giant stomps through the archway from the living room and approaches the mountainous fridge. Bryan gasps lightly when he realizes that Mike stands higher than the fridge, his clean cut blond hair just above the top of the fridge. The man swings the door open easily and holds a can of beer in his hands. Mike raises the can to his lips and the sound of slurping liquid is heard briefly. His blue eyes scan the kitchen while his massive hand scratches his chin. Bryan half-heartedly waves his arms with a shout, knowing that Mike will not see him from his position.

---

Mike returns to the kitchen to grab a beer. He slams the fridge shut, pops the can open, and sips in the cool liquid. While refreshing, it reminds him how hungry he is. After getting Austin up and ready, trimming the bushes, and cleaning Mike's simple egg and toast breakfast is long gone.

Scratching the stubble on his chin Mike stares at the wall absently. On one hand he'd like to order some pizza and wings for tradition's sake. On the other hand, money wasn't growing on trees lately and every purchase was heavily scrutinized. It might be better to just make something.
11212211221122112211222222122211211.title: Climbing up

choices: Time to eat!
Eric and Jake come bursting through the door
112122112211221122112222221222112112.content:
Mike sighs. As good as pizza and wings sounded he knew the right thing to do would be to just make something. He digs through the cabinets and sees two bags of nacho chips. "Perfect" he thinks with a smile.

He grabs one bag and dumps some chips onto a plate. Before continuing he remembers how much more fun watching a game is with someone else. He had already called his buddies Eric and Jake, neither of whom were likely to come. Mike decides he could try calling his neighbor Bryan. The guy was a little weird and Mike didn't know him too well. But he was friendly enough; maybe he would make good company for the game.

Mike walks away from the plate of nachos and grabs the phone. He dials the number from the paper where Ella has all the neighbors listed. After a few rings he gets an answering machine. "Hello this is Bryan Smith. Sorry I didn't answer, leave a message if you need to!" A beep gives Mike's cue.

"Hey Bryan, it's Mike next door. Just wanted to see if you were interested in watching a game over some nachos and beer. You can head over if you get this later. Just thought I'd offer, see ya around." he says casually. With a click the phone returns to its holder and Mike crosses the kitchen to the nachos. He sprinkles shredded cheese and scatters leftover ground beef over the pile of nachos. Popping the plate into the microwave to warm it up he turns to search the fridge for some salsa and sour cream to add to the mix.

He locates the jars just as the microwave beeps from behind him. Mike places the jars on the table and retrieves the warm plate from the microwave. After dumping a generous amount of salsa onto the nachos while going easy on the sour cream, Mike puts everything away and admires the results.

His mouth watering, Mike grabs a mostly bare chip and tries to use it to scoop up the mix of toppings. Instead he pushes a lump of stringy cheese and meat off the plate. Unwilling to waste a bite, Mike pinches the chunk and drops it near the center of the plate. He picks up the plate, grabs his beer, and moves to the living room.

---

Bryan stands up as Mike turns his back to the table, digging through the cabinets. He uses his incredibly long arms to grab something from the top shelf. Bryan admires with slight jealousy the rippling muscles in Mike's arms, all the more noticeable at this diminished size. The giant places a bag on the table, down a ways from Bryan. Bryan continues to watch as the titan moves about the kitchen with ease. Mike returns with a stadium sized plate that crashes onto the counter with a thud, shaking the surface under Bryan's feet.

The quake knocks Bryan over as he watches Mike easily tear open the massive bag and dump some of its contents onto the plate. All the activity and movement of his mountainous neighbor is unnerving for tiny Bryan and he is relieved when Mike seems to think again, his movement halted.

He abruptly walks away from the counter and makes a call on the phone. Bryan uses this break to approach the plate, since he is more likely to be seen where Mike actually is. Mike's voice suddenly erupts across the kitchen, HEY BRYAN, IT'S MIKE NEXT DOOR. JUST WANTED TO SEE IF YOU WERE INTERESTED IN WATCHING A GAME OVER SOME NACHOS AND BEER.YOU CAN HEAD OVER IF YOU GET THIS LATER. JUST THOUGHT I'D OFFER, SEE YA AROUND." his deep voice boomed across the room. Bryan smiled in spite of himself. How nice of Mike to invite him. In normal circumstances he would have been interested. However at the moment it was terribly ironic since Bryan was already in Mike's home and so far hadn't been treated like a welcome guest.

While Bryan was lost in his thoughts, Mike had pulled cheese and beef out of the fridge and was spreading them over the nachos. Bryan stared awestruck as Mike's hand easily scooped up the plate with its mountain of nachos. It soared upwards without any effort from Mike. A slam and beeping indicated the use of a microwave and he could see Mike bend over to search the fridge. Bryan sighed and watched Mike, waiting for an opportunity to present itself.

A screeching beep echoed across the room, hurting tiny Bryan's ears. His hands to his head, Bryan observed the arrival of two towers and then the return of the plate, now steaming. He watched as the giant dumped thousands of gallons worth of salsa and less so of the sour cream onto the mound. This mountain of food seemed so excessive to Bryan and yet was merely a single serving for the titanic Mike.

Mike stared at the plate for a moment, a glint in his blue eyes. Hoping this was his chance Bryan jumped up and down waving his arms and shouting "Help me Mike! Right here! Help!" Mike's arm extended forwarded and Bryan cheered. However his fingers grasped something on the plate above Bryan's head.

"No! Right here!" Bryan shouted indignantly, disappointment flooding his mind.

Suddenly a massive and warm weight crashed into him. Struggling against it proved useless. He felt the weight shift rapidly and spin. Bryan was stuck fast and moved with it. With a sudden drop his movement halted and Bryan now felt like he was laying on his side. As the world seemed to rock and shift, Bryan realized with dread where he was.The strong smell of salsa, beef and cheese was assailing his nostrils. He now lay sideways, stuck in Mike's nachos.

With a thud his world stopped as Mike set the plate on the coffee table.
112122112211221122112222221222112112.title: Making Something Big

1121221122112211221122222212221121121.content:
Bryan struggles in the thick cheese as he tries to grasp the situation. Never had something like this crossed his mind when he had scaled the table! Looking up he can see Mike towering far above, a remote in hand, staring straight ahead. He collapses backwards, undoubtedly into a comfortable chair. The walls and ceiling become a blur as Bryan feels the plate move again. It settles in Mike's lap, his torso towering above. Bryan continues to struggle as the sounds of the game fill the room and light flickers across Mike's face.

Long, rough fingers appear from the side and pull a nacho away. Bryan shouts in panic as the cheese stretches and finally breaks. Mike lifts the nacho to his mouth above. Bryan cringes as a loud crunch sounds from above followed by a groan of satisfaction and then the muted crunching of chewing. Bryan struggles harder and manages to free his arm and upper body.

He stares up at Mike's face. "HELP ME!" he begs, waving his arms. Sound booms from the TV drowning out any shouts Bryan makes, and it doesn't sound like it will let up anytime soon. He can't help but feel like he's in a nightmare. The dangerous situation is made worse by the painfully loud sound, and surreal light flashing from the TV. Bryan is struggling to keep himself from completely losing it.

---

After switching to the right channel, Mike flops into his recliner. He moves the plate to his lap and stares at the TV. Cheers of fans and music from the band fill the room as the camera pans around the stadium. "Wow, that stadium is huge." Mike thinks to himself, unaware of gigantic he seems to his shrunken neighbor. Without looking down he snatches a nacho and brings it to his mouth. As he closes his mouth around the chip and the flavors mix together, Mike closes his eyes. "Mmmmmmmm!" he moans happily. This was the start of a good game.

The intro goes by and Mike absently picks at the chips mostly around the edge of the plate. He wants to save the best chips for when he gets really into the game, eating those chips while he stresses about his brother's team.

---

Bryan soon discovers that though he had freed his upper body, his legs had sunken deep into the cheese which had cooled and thickened. All his struggles had no effect. Mike pulls chips away from the edges of the plate as if to torture Bryan with the sound of crunching and swallowing as he watches more and more nachos get devoured.

Bryan however has not given up. He knows that his main hope lies with getting Mike's attention and he will not give up. There is no way a genius like him would leave the world in a plate of nachos over a football game. The sentence sounded so ridiculous that Bryan let out a manic laugh.

He stared up at Mike's face again while continuing to struggle. Occasionally he waved his arms and shouted.

Mike's expression changed from blank to more intense as the actual game started. When Mike leaned forward, Bryan was slightly mystified by how focused Mike was on the game. This was bad for Bryan since he was less likely to notice other things. But of course Bryan would get Mike's attention. Certainly, no one could eat another person without noticing, no matter how small!

Mike however remained focused on the game, his hand now reaching dangerously into the middle of the plate. Bryan eventually tired and, realizing his movement was doing nothing, decided to preserve his energy. Mike lifted chip after chip, some stuck together in groups, to his open mouth clearly enjoying every bite of the cheesy, meaty nachos and salsa.

Bryan shrieked in terror when the inevitable happened: Mike's long fingers, bits of meat and cheese clinging to the tips, grasped his chip. The chip next to his rose as well, connected by a string of cheese."NOOOOO!!!" Bryan wailed in terror as Mike lifted the nachos upwards. He struggles to move, but as before is stuck in place. The nacho stops even with Mike's lips, framed by well-trimmed stubble.

"MIKE! PLEASE DON'T EAT ME" Bryan pleads. His gargantuan neighbor takes no notice of the shrunken scientist trapped in the nachos. Mike senses the nacho hanging by a strand of cheese and he lifts the nachos over his mouth and leans his head back. His lips part and his tongue stretches forward, emerging like a monster from a cave. Bryan can see crumbs of chewed nachos, strings of cheese, and mounds of beef scattered across the long tongue. A strand of saliva stretches from his upper molars to his tongue and snaps as the tongue extends forward. Bryan tears his eyes from the terrible scene and stares past Mike's defined nose towards his eyes.

Mike through all this never moves his eyes off the screen, utterly unaware of the drama unfolding in his meal. His mind is barely on the nachos; he is much more focused on his brother's team since they currently have the ball. Oblivious to the terror of his tiny neighbor trapped in his food, Mike lowers the hanging chip into his mouth. His jaw shuts quickly and severs through the cheese. Loud crunching drowns out the sound of the TV as Mike chews the nacho just in front of Bryan.

After only a few crunches Mike's mouth opens again. Behind his perfectly straight white teeth lies a scene of destruction. Half chewed nacho chips lay in mounds between the molars, surrounded by soggy salsa and beef. Strands of cheese stretch between the sets of large molars, and the light from the TV illuminates Mike's uvula as well as a couple soggy bits of food stuck around his throat. Mike unconsciously moves his tongue slightly forward in anticipation of the incoming bite.

Sobbing uncontrollably, Bryan realizes that he is utterly out of options. A wall of stench and humidity hits him as he enters the mouth with the chip. From the roof of the mouth a chunk of chewed nacho falls and abruptly knocks him out just before the teeth shut around the chip in an ear-shattering crunch.

---

Mike absently pushes the chip into his mouth. Ignorant of the tiny addition on this last nacho Mike chews his food without a thought. When his brother's team scores he cheers happily, light flooding the interior of his mouth. But Mike is the only one there and no one sees the soggy, chewed piles of nachos spread across his mouth, framed by strands of thick saliva. Satisfied with the game Mike moves the food to the back of his mouth and swallows. Bryan's unconscious body however stays stuck to his tongue, no different from the other unnoticed crumbs of food stuck to Mike's tongue. As Mike lifts another nacho to his mouth, his tongue extends, Bryan's tiny body in the light one last time, nestled in a small pile of soggy corn chip. None the wiser, Mike bites down and swiftly chews the nacho. In the chaos Bryan's body is further beaten, but he doesn't awaken. Mike swallows, his bobbing Adam's apple signaling the passing of food, as well as the shrunken Bryan Smith, into his esophagus. Mike however gives no thought to his digestion system or the mounds of food he is sending into it.

With a splat, Bryan's body lands roughly on a soggy mountain of chewed nachos. Mike reaches for his drink and lifts it to his lips. A rush of beer clears the remaining bits of food from his mouth and it all goes cascading down his throat. The incoming liquid levels the mountain of food in a violent wave, but Mike is completely oblivious to the storm in his gut. He smiles as he puts his beer back down, enjoying the game.

Mike easily devours the entire plate of nachos, a fairly small portion for him. Bryan's body is quickly buried in layers of chewed nachos, saturated by beer. He never awakes as Mike eats and cheers on his brother's team.

Mere hours later Mike sits with an empty plate and a full stomach, happy to see his brother win. The door opens and Mike turns his head. Ella walks inside holding a smiling Austin.

"Little man!" Mike calls out as he stands up and walks over to his wife and son. He doesn't feel the food shift inside his stomach as he moves.

She smiles at him and says "He had fun with David! And momma had fun with Mary" while bouncing her toddler son.

"Well he missed Luke's game! They won little man! It was a really good game!" Mike says, leaning towards a giggling Austin. Ella looked towards the TV. "Well I see you won't be needing dinner" she teases.

"Just give me a couple hours and my gut will clear some space!" Mike declares, patting his stomach. Coincidentally, Mike's stomach begins to secrete acid at that moment. He doesn't realize it's happening but inside his toned body Mike begins to digest the nachos, and digest tiny Bryan Smith, to make that promise true.

11212211221122112211222222122211212.content:
Stomping through the grass, Mike leaned down and snatched the errant shears up with his large hand. A quick surveying glance confirms that the bush is properly tamed, its invasive branches no longer protruding into his yard. Looking at the ground, Mike noted that he needed to pick up the cut branches and leaves that surrounded the bush.

Mike prepared to return to his garage, unaware of the danger he posed by just walking through his lawn. The short inch-tall grass was easily flattened under his large sneakers, along with many unlucky insects. Forgetting that he closed the garage door when he let Austin out, he bounded up the porch to the front door.

Annoyed at the idea of having to take his shoes off, preferring to keep them on since he was always on the move, he roughly wiped his shoes on the welcome mat, the stiff fibers scraping the dirt, torn grass, and the remains of a tiny spider from his heavy treads.

A few scrapes later, Mike smiled, determining his feet clean enough to go inside.

------------------

The memory of his trusted neighbor Mike killing an entire community of ants without a second thought caused the tiny man to shudder. He knew that had he lingered, he would of been included in the deadly toxic spray. Never before had he felt sympathy for insects, but now, being the size of one, the tiny man could appreciate their plight.

He was sure Mike would help if he knew of his tiny neighbor's situation, the only issue was getting the gigantic guy to not mistake him for a bug.

Having made some decent progress, he was now in the otherworldly living room. On more than a few occasions, Bryan had been in this room invited by the friendly Mike for a BBQ. Everything appeared vastly different now in the room, the walls stretched up for miles and the ceiling light resembled a make-shift sun in its size and intensity. The floor went on seemingly forever and it was hard to believe he would of taken only 10 steps to cross the room, and would now it would take hours.

A heavy thudding sound followed by the sound of a door opening thrust tiny Bryan from his idle thoughts. "He's back already!" Bryan yelped with a start, as he heard distant booming stomps heading his way. He hadn't even gone to a safer location before his colossal neighbor's return, having only managed to put himself in a more dangerous position.

Looking across the room where the front door entered, Bryan saw the gargantuan Mike lumber in. A painful gulp sounded as the tiny man took in the impressive sight of his titanic neighbor again, before the gigantic man began stomping in Bryan's direction with terrifying speed.

Mike didn't look where he stepped as he continued to the kitchen and into the garage. The shrunken scientist was thrown backwards as a battleship-sized sneaker crashed before him. With big eyes, Bryan watched the huge footwear lift away as Mike continued his threatening passage through his house. The violent tremors subsided as the giant went out of sight, leaving tiny Bryan on the ground, his heart racing.

"He is so huge! How can I get him to notice me?" The tiny man thought, trying to figure a plan before the dangerous titan returned.

Far away a low, modern-styled coffee table caught his eye. Climbing that would hopefully be simple enough and give him a much safer vantage point. With a fearful look back where Mike was, tiny Bryan Smith hurried to the table.

-----------

Hanging the shears in their respective place on the wall, Mike turned to leave. His garage served as a work shop, with an entire wall holding an impressive variety of tools, a work bench, and his collection of sports equipment taking up another corner. Pounding up the cement steps, he meandered back to the kitchen.

Noticing the floor was covered in dirty tread-prints from before, Mike frowned. His previously dirty sneakers had left over a dozen almost perfect prints on the white kitchen floor, the Vans logo clearly legible on the heel section of the large prints. Mike liked to work on things, fix them and do other types of work, but he was never a fan of cleaning, which bored him.

The big guy followed the mess scoping out how much he would have to clean, following it back into the living room. As he was about to turn back to grab a broom, he spied a tiny pale speck maneuvering away from his feet.

"Damn, I don't need an infestation in here." He sighed. Lifting his left sneaker, he brought it down heavily on the tiny pale speck. Last thing he needed was Ella screaming over a single tiny ant, she was terrified of insects. Ella was always having Mike eradicate a bug on her behalf, as she would refuse to stop screaming until it was dead. Mike didn't care either way, as long as she calmed down.

Turning back to the kitchen, he went to the pantry to grab a broom so he could clean up the dirty footprints.
11212211221122112211222222122211212.title: Mike Is Not So Neighborly to Bugs

112122112211221122112222221222112121.content:
An objective in mind, namely the scaling of the fashionably modern coffee table in the center of his neighbor's living room, the bug-sized research scientist began his trek toward the massive piece of furniture feeling more optimistic than perhaps the situation warranted.

In his thoughts, shrunken Mr. Smith realized that the tabletop offered him a much safer location for attempting to attract his mammoth neighbor's attention.

After one last glance over his shoulder, he was relieved to see Mike exit the room and depart the house. Given this momentary reprieve, the tiny man set out at a swift pace in his bid to reach his destination without worries of an ill-timed step on the part of his gargantuan neighbor.

The tiny man felt a surge of pride as he made better progress than he expected. He had almost gotten midway across the floor toward the table when he heard the seismic pounding as Mike scaled the cement steps from the garage and stormed back into the kitchen.

Cursing at the sudden reversal in his fortune, the little man took one quick look at his towering neighbor and increased his efforts to reach the table.

At the same time, much to his increasing irritation, noticed his muddy footprint stamped across the immaculate kitchen floor. He meandered back toward the living room, unaware of the drama happening on the floor.

Tiny Bryan, almost breathless, his muscles aching, paused for a brief rest. "Please, please, don't come in the living room," the little man pleaded.

As if to fling his plea back in his face, Mike stomped heavily across the threshold separating the two rooms.

Tiny Mr. Smith screamed and fled toward the table. The big man paused, looking down to see how much cleaning the living room would require.

His eyes locked onto the sprinting form of a pale speck running away from his feet and toward the living room coffee table.

"DAMN! I DON'T NEED AN INFESTATION IN HERE!"

The fleeing bug-sized scientist heard the thunderous remark and felt his blood go cold. He stopped, turned and, frozen in place, watched Mike lift his right sneaker off the floor.

"No!" Mr. Smith screamed as the colossal shoe plunged him into shadow. "Please, don't!"

His neighbor's sneaker slammed down with a heavy thud, cutting off any last words from the terrified scientist.

Returning to the kitchen, Mike grabbed a broom from the pantry to quickly erase the dirty footprints from the kitchen floor before his wife complained, never knowing that he had just exterminated his next-door neighbor.

With a deep sigh caused by the boredom of household chores, Mike made a mental note to look up Bryan Smith later. Maybe they could stand around in the front yard, have a couple of beers, and just shoot the breeze.

His neighbor was a strange little man, but that probably came from being some sort of genius/scientist. As neighbors went, Mike didn't mind living next door to him. After all, Bryan Smith usually minded his own business and didn't get underfoot.

If only Mike could have realized the irony of his own thoughts.

112122112211221122112222221222112122.content:
His behemoth of a neighbour approached quickly. Thunderous pounding announced the giant's arrival, sending tiny Bryan Smith stumbling.

"Ahh-grrrrggah!" Bryan pealed, falling onto his rear. "No, not yet! I'm not ready!"

Mike's huge Vans sneakers landed heavily. The huge man remained unaware of his shrunken neighbour's dilemma, as he stood looming. More than experienced with such encounters, Bryan pulled himself upright and bolted for the very distant table.

Collections of dirt slowed his flight. It was piled in mounds, spreading over the normally clean floor in odd shapes. The bug-sized scientist tried his best to maneuver around them, ignoring powerful shudders and noises from behind. That was, until he heard Mike declare in his thunderous tone.

"DAMN," The curse was uttered with such force that it caused him to halt and turn around. "I DON'T NEED AN INFESTATION IN HERE."

Bryan felt his blood run cold hearing the friendly Mike's voice boom from high above.

His frightened eyes peered upwards, squinting to discern Mike's unfathomably huge and distant visage. The mega-sized man's face showed anything but recognition. Indifference, perhaps with a hint of annoyance lingered in Mike's light coloured eyes. Bryan couldn't help but gape, unable to accept that this gargantuan titan was a friendly, generous, and all-around nice guy.

Sudden movement diverted his stare to the gigantic sneakers planted like mountains of worn, dust-covered rubber and rough canvas with frayed off-white laces. Bryan had seen Mike wear the sneakers often. Yardwork, walking, or just casual wear, his neighbour wore the high top skate shoes whenever he wasn't working--and the footwear showed it. Dust coated the worn canvas, fraying cords as large as building supports stuck out at random from the stitching. The once white soles were now stained with dirt and grass, previously unnoticeable scrapes and pits now visible to his tiny eyes.

Bryan had never payed much attention to Mike's well-used sneakers before, preferring to glance at the tall, bulky man himself. Now larger than any battleship, they were impossible to miss. He recalled the sight of them pounding carelessly outside, flattening anything in their path, all without the gigantic owner's realization. Just like the helpless ants, Bryan would get his chance.

The leftmost shoe began lifting, as if in slow-motion. Bryan whimpered, stumbling backwards. "Oh, no! Mike, it's me, Bryan Smith! Your friend! Not a bug, I am NOT A BUG!" His wails were immediately lost upon the enormous man, who thought nothing of the tiny ants perspective.

Large chunks of dirt broke free from the worn waffle tread, crashing to the ground. It all seemed to happen slowly. The sole encompassed the tiny man's view of the sky. It drenched seemingly miles of floor in shadow, as if to tell Bryan escape was futile. He stumbled back clumsily, gaping wordlessly and taking in every detail of the massive hovering sole high above. Packed into the thick tread was a variety of specimens from Mike's front yard: mud, crushed grass, leaf shreds, and tiny unnoticed insect life-forms, including those from the anthill. Bryan noticed a few still moving among the compact debris, half their bodies smashed into the thick waffled tread.

Then time resumed, the sneaker slammed down with a deafening crash. Darkness enveloped Bryan's world when the tremendous force fell upon him.

Strangely enough, Bryan felt alive still. His body was compacted into something moist and earthy. All his limbs were bent painfully, one complaining so much that he thought it broken.

"I-I-I'm not dead...?" Bryan thought to himself.

It felt as if it was a bad dream and he was about to wake from it. This thought was shattered by loud, heavy creaking that emanated from around him. Mike was preparing to move!

1121221122112211221122222212221121222.content:
Mike casually lifted his foot and began walking back towards this house, congratulating himself on his small victory. Beneath his tread you could only brace yourself as again and again huge, shuddering impacts threatened to dislodge or crush you. Then there was the danger that he would step on something else that could jamb into his tread, ending you just as effectively. Mike whistled jauntily as he opened his front door and headed in.

Only after he was several yards into the house did his wife's warning's about shoes in the house come to mind. He rolled his eyes before turning around and stomping back over to the front door. He sat down on a bench just inside the door for a moment as he unlaced his shoes and casually pulled them off. He didn't want to leave them next to the front door for his wife to find, she got so upset about muddy shoes. He carefully picked them up and carried them toward the kitchen where he could clean them and possibly get himself a snack.

You made it into the house alive! Was your thought as Mike peeled off his sneakers. Now all that was left was to work your way out of the tread of the shoe, and get Mike's attention. When Mike crossed one of his legs over the other to pull his shoe off, you pushed with all of your might and popped free, landing on the surface of his jeans. You grab ahold of the fabric as he repeats the exercise with the other, and then watch as he casually carries the shoes that are many thousands of times your size off into the house.

You can feel his thigh muscle tense beneath you as he walks. The jeans are particularly tight on him, and if you were much larger you wouldn't be able to keep ahold of the fabric. As it is, you can keep your grip but only just. Mere inches away from you is Mike's crotch, and suddenly all that you can think about is the fact that even his cock is dozens if not hundreds of times bigger than you.

Mike stops off in the kitchen and scrapes the dirt from the tread down into the sink disposal. Your face goes white when you realize what he's doing, and the fact that the dirt washing away into the whirring blades could just as easily have been you. Mike sits the shoes down in the other half of the sink to dry and peels off his sweat soaked shirt. You admire the sight that you had previously only seen at a distance, as Mike heads toward the living room, and then up the stairs.

Mike walks, barefoot and shirtless, into his bedroom and shuts the door behind him. He lays down on his bed and you whoop at your good luck! All that you have to do is walk along the surface of his body and get his attention. You walk around his crotch and notice the intense heat coming off of it. You feel the odd sensation of his skin beneath you and begin to make your way through the hair that you had seen only from a distance before, and then his calloused palm impacts you from above.

11212211221122112211222222122212.content:
Mike surveyed his work with an approving nod. The once tangled and invasive bush now presented itself with a clean-cut look; rounded edges with near flat surfaces.

"Looks nice! Ella is gonna be happy to see this!"

A hefty breeze gusted through his front yard, stirring up loose cutting bits from the bush. His neighbour's yard was on the other side, the two yards separated by the hedge. Mike was able to spare some glances into the neighbouring yard, his brow creasing in response to what he saw.

"Well, she won't be completely happy," Mike said with a sheepish smirk. "Bryan is gonna have to clean his own yard up for that to happen. I should probably offer to give him a hand with it later."

He heard the front door open and his wife's voice ring out. "Miiiike! Honey? Are you keeping an eye on Austin?" The question broke him from his idle musings and brought a grin to his face as he turned to face her. Ella approached, dressed brightly in a summer dress and heeled slip-ons that never seemed to become dirty like his own shoes.

"Austin? What is this Austin, I know of no such thing!" He flashed a face to show he was kidding. "...and, don't call me Honey!"

Looking from her one year old child to her immature husband, Ella returned the sarcasm with a playful slap on the arm. "Come on, who here is supposed to be the kid again?" The garnered a chuckle from Mike, who stepped forward to retrieve the wiggling toddler from the grass. Austin greeted him with a fistful of torn lawn and by reaching for the bill of his cap.

"Get your own, little bud!" Cooed the young father to his son. Mike turned the tattered hat backwards and proceeded to hand the giggling child to his wife.

Ella received a small bundle of purloined grass to the face as well. She sputtered and turned her gaze to Mike. More than a head taller than the younger woman, she always managed to cut the tall guy down to size with only a glance.

"Mikey, you need to mow the lawn as well!" She readjusted her hold of Austin and surveyed the healthy grass. "I don't like Austin playing in such long grass. Dangerous insects thrive in it!"

Mike gave a passive laugh to her worries, but knew he was beat. "Stop worrying! I'll get on it right now. You take Austin back inside and leave me to finish this yard up." He followed them to the driveway - her feet barely disturbing the grass while Mike's sneakers left sizable impressions. Mike paused to grab the shears he left behind, and proceeded for the garage.

Ella waved Austin's tiny hand to him and returned to the house knowing full well that her husband's promise was better than gold. Good as he was, Mike put away the shears; glancing over the wall of tools he had erected on one wall, to a cabinet of rakes and shovels with a collection of sports equipment stacked both on top and to the side. His light eyes settled on the lawn mower settled near his mountain bike, already draped with cobwebs and dust since he last fired it up.

The machine had been purchased by him from the local thrift store last December. It was a bulky, well-used gas guzzler from over two decades ago, but ran well (if not loudly) thanks to Mike's tinkering.

He brushed the webs from it, dislodging a daddy long legs to the floor and freeing a recently stuck gnat from the silky trap. Mike had no inkling of his actions as he prepared to wheel it outside. The tiny buzzer decided to thank Mike by whizzing towards his face and into his eyes. Mike grunted passively and lazily swatted at it. When it returned for round two, Mike released his grip on the handles and brought his large hands together with a resounding clap. Years with the Navy in barracks and battleships made such a gesture like second nature to the man.

The mower wheeled out with a smooth, heavy grace as it crunched over the drive way and then the lawn.

Mike gave the lawn one cursory scan, seeing everything but the tiny lives that inhabited it. He was so far withdrawn from bugs and other small creatures, that the thought of callously destroying their homes and existence never crossed his mind.

Ready to begin, he gripped the plastic handled rope and pulled.

---

Bryan hunkered low, feeling almost safe due to the mass of ants around him. They seemed disinterested in him; as if he were nothing but a trifle or a waste of time. He looked over and realized the situation was different for his captor. Half a dozen and more ants poked, prodded, and even attempted to climb the large spider who thrashed angrily.

The spider backed off, but remained inside the clearing. Bryan shuddered, feeling the eight black eyes staring at him with hunger.

"Leave me alone!" He barked over the crowd of ants to the impatiently shifting spider.

It seemed only interested in finding a way past the ants in order to access the shrunken man. Bryan pressed himself lower to the grainy earth, incredulous at the simple-minded creature's doggedness. Any one of the scampering ants would provide a far more hearty meal than the thin and frail scientist; yet the large spider seemed adamant.

Impatience of his own threatened to overtake him. He refused to stay hunkered in the dirt among a crowd of busy, rude ants!

"Get the hell away!" Bryan screamed. "You stupid, fucking spider; GO AWAY!"

The spider of course did not respond, but something else did.

Far in the distance, Bryan heard a loud, cantankerous roar. He even felt it - rumbling a steady pulse through the very earth, shaking everything in sight. What was it?

Then the waves of heavy grinding clamour clicked some recognition in the tiny genius's memory. Specifically, one he had heard on many occasions from his next door neighbour's yard. "The fucking lawnmower! Fuck!" Normally, Bryan would emit an initial sigh of annoyance whenever the calamity would begin. He would then compensate himself for it by leering from his window to spy upon Mike's hulking form as he muscled the big mower around.

Now, the sound summoned a feeling of pure, unadulterated fear.

"Mike is mowing his lawn! With me in it!"

Bryan had seen a movie once, long ago, in which a group of shrunken people were nearly obliterated by the hurricane blades of an equally enormous device. Now it seems, Bryan would get to test the validity of those Hollywood scenes!

The ants seemed to react accordingly, racing to and fro instead of their previous meandering scuttles. Such pandimonium in both the noisy atmosphere and skittering bugs made Bryan's blood pressure rise. He wanted to flee; nothing more than to just run aimlessly in search of some shelter. Yet, that remained impossible.

Across the clear - now abuzz with alarmed ants - stood the spider: staring, watching, and waiting. Bryan nearly shrieked when making contact with those horrible eyes. The wretched spider was already bent on acquiring him for a meal, and seemed willing to give up life for the chance as well. He felt his weary heart sink.

"I don't want to die! What the hell can I do!?"

He knew Jessica because Tommy had brought her over once. Why Tommy did this he still had little or no idea, after all though he felt like an uncle to the kid, the two were little more than neighbors. Still Jess, as she liked to be called, was a nice enough girl, if a little bit of a nudist considering the clothes she wore barely covered a tenth of her body, and her favorite ‘shirt' consisted of a three inch band of cloth that rapped around her like a bra, causing her to jiggle slightly as she walked. Now staring at her from under a sheet of paper that was several times his size he watched as she surveyed the aftermath of the short lived party Tommy had attempted to throw. Obviously she found it not at all to her liking and scoffed at the mess left behind. Bryan hadn't been too upset yet by the wreckage in his living room, and had intended on cleaning it up himself later, now though Jess was doing it herself.

"PROBABLY THE ONLY REASON HE CALLED ME OVER," she said to herself, or at least she thought she was saying it only to herself, Bryan however could hear every word, and was of a mind to tell the girl off, mostly because he knew Tommy wasn't that kind of person. Of course for Jessica this meant her food options were limited to the bread and grain verity. The tiny man's plunge ended with him falling onto the most recent copy of his Scientific American magazine.

In the meantime, Jessica settled onto the sofa to enjoy her sandwich. The ceramic plate hit with a rattling noise when she lowered it to the coffee table, far from the tiny scientist's current location.

Feeling too exposed, the shrunken scientist dropped off the edge of the magazine and ran across the table to hide in the shadow of his television remote. The oblong plastic device looked as big as a Navy destroyer to the bug-sized man.

From time to time, he peered from his hiding place to watch Tommy's girlfriend tear into the sandwich. He shuddered, glad to have made his escape from her meal before she began to devour it.

As for his immediate plan of action, he had none. He didn't trust Jessica enough to risk contacting her. Besides, he worried that she might panic if she saw something tiny and lash out with unfortunate results for a little man no bigger than an ant.

So, for at least a quarter of an hour, he remained still and quiet in the shadow of the enormous remote. The impasse was broken when Jessica, now finished, rose to her feet and carried her plate back to the kitchen.

In the teenager's absence, the tiny scientist dared to venture away from the remote to have a quick survey of the coffee table. In addition to a couple of magazines and a remote, the only other item on the vast wooden plain was a stadium-sized ceramic bowl that he used for his wallet and keys when returning home.

Still coming to terms with the immensity of his surrounding, he ventured over toward the sheer drop at the edge of the coffee table. The floor looked hundreds of feet below him. Nervous, he backed away from the edge, just as he felt the floor vibrate from immense footsteps.

However, Jessica was no longer alone. Tommy had returned!

The sight of the imposing giant filled the little man with both hope and awe.

Then, the argument began.

"I've never heard such a ridiculous story in my life," Jessica said angrily.

"It's the truth," Tommy replied defensively. "Joe, get in here and tell her!"

The raised voices physically hurt the tiny man's ears. He tried to cover them with his hands and watched as Tommy's equally titanic friend lumbered into the living room.

"Well, I don't know why you're blaming me," she said. "I haven't seen any tiny men."

"What about bugs?" Tommy asked. "He looked a lot like a bug. We almost mistook him for one."

Jessica rolled her eyes. "No bugs."

Joe, as the two argued, made his way over to the sofa. He dropped down on the cushions and then raised his feet off the floor.

He didn't see the tiny form that raced across the coffee table toward the safety of the remote as he dropped his sneaker-clad feet onto the tabletop.

Tiny Mr. Smith's heart pounded as he made it back to the shadow of the gigantic remote control just as Joe's huge sneakers crashed down onto the table.

"Ahhhh!" The tiny man screamed in terror.

Although he had never been in any real danger, he could not help but stare at the two massive sneakers with the realization that he could easily have been squished beneath them.

He needed to get Tommy's attention, the sooner the better. With some effort, he climbed atop the remote. He ran through the rows of buttons, hoping to find a spot where he could attract Tommy's attention.

Now, not even the spot he has chosen for a hiding place remained safe.

"Can you two hold it down?" Joe said. "I'm going to find something to watch on TV."
