The cavern that was Joe’s mouth stretched far into the distance, ending where the slope of the tongue disappeared down into the throat, the uvula hanging ominously over the blackness. The twitching tongue lay flat, smears of chocolate and specks of color dotting its surface. Rows of molars lined the sides of the tongue, the soggy pulverized remains of previous handfuls of candy mashed into every crevice of the teeth. Light reflected off thick strands of saliva stretching between the quivering tongue and the pointed teeth.

The hand tilted forward, releasing M&Ms into the terrifying chamber. Bryan flinched at the loud clicks as the candies bounced off Joe’s teeth.

“NO PLEASE!” Bryan begged, looking up desperately. All he could see was Joe’s dark nostrils. Undoubtedly the teen was staring at the screen, barely aware of the candy he was dumping into his mouth, unconcerned with the destruction it would meet inside of his mouth.

Before Bryan began to slide forward, the hand tilted back. The teeth came together with a booming crunch as the teeth came together. Bryan was buffeted by the gust of Joe’s voice, the words indiscernible to the tiny man who covered his ears ineffectually.

He sobbed in shock, unable to tear his eyes from Joe’s mouth as the titanic teen chewed the candy. Every crunch sent a fresh wave of goosebumps down his still throbbing spine. Joe’s lips parted as he chewed, the smacking sound of the soggy candy nauseating his overlooked audience.

A few more crunches later, Joe’s lips smacked together as he gulped down the candy. Bryan had barely managed to sit up before he was sent screaming into the open mouth amidst other falling M&Ms.

---

Joe began to chew the candy in his mouth without a second thought. The light from the TV flashed across his expressionless face as he chewed with his mouth open. The crunches and smacks sounding from his mouth went unnoticed by the two teens. As Joe prepared to swallow the candy he felt a sharp pain in his gums. Wincing Joe swallowed the candy, and poked his tongue against the affected area. After a few seconds of unsuccessful prodding, Joe stood up.

“Where are you going?” Tommy demanded. “I need the mirror, there’s something stuck in my teeth,” Joe replied simply. “Don’t go! Remember, give Mr. Smith time to be safe from us!” Tommy said forcefully. Joe shrugged “I’ll watch my step!” he insisted as he turned towards the hall where the bathroom was. Tommy made a sound as if he would continue to argue, but Joe was already pounding out of the room, his eyes apathetically scanning the floor moments before his shoes slammed down.

Joe entered the bathroom and leaned towards the mirror over the counter. He opened his mouth, allowing the room’s bright lights to flood its interior. Joe could see his tongue, coated with chewed chocolate stretching to the back of his mouth. Unconcerned with the image of destruction inside his mouth, Joe pulled his on the corner of his mouth, stretching his lips back to reveal his gums at the base of his molars.
112122112211221122121211122.title: Snacking while Waiting

1121221122112211221212111222.content:
Staring intently at the mirror, Joe tried to discern what was causing him pain amongst the expected brown sludge of M&Ms that lined the base of his teeth and sat impacted in the crevices of the molars. Glints of light from the ropes of saliva that had formed when his mouth opened, distracted his searching gaze. He finally noticed a small pale speck that had been causing the minor irritation. Now able to see how it was positioned, Joe’s tongue slithered over the teeth like a monster. The brown smears and specks of color that lined the side of the tongue went were seen by Joe but never registered in his mind.

Joe never noticed the feeble movement of the pale speck, having instantly dismissed it as a candy shell washed of its color. Mr. Smith had against all odds sunk down the side of one of Joe’s teeth, instead of being crushed as expected. Now his screams of terror never reached Joe’s ears as his massive tongue lapped at the shrunken scientist.

Finally Joe felt relief as the tongue freed the irritant. Joe’s eyes followed the movement of his tongue in the mirror as it returned to its regular position. Staring into his mouth, Joe moved the speck to swallow and out of curiosity tried for a few seconds to swallow with his mouth open. Discovery he couldn’t, Joe shrugged and snapped his jaws shut. He turned away from the mirror and without thinking about it gulped down the speck.

Bryan’s pleas for help and screams of terror were lost within the confines of Joe’s body as he returned to the living room. Joe was unable to appreciate the enormity of his existence to someone as small as Bryan. The destructive potential of his every bite to Mr. Smith was lost on Joe, who never once considered that the man may end up in his food. Joe would never appreciate the consequences of his simple snack. There was no indication to the young man that the shrunken scientist he half-heartedly intended on saving was trapped in his stomach amongst melting sludge of pulverized M&M’s. He would continue snacking on M&Ms while waiting for the tiny man to get somewhere safe. Joe was looking forward to rescuing the tiny man so Tommy would feel better and quit being so irritating so they could finally get on with their day.
1121221122112211221212111222.title: Minor Irritation

choices: Something unusual happened
Nothing unusual(Considering the situation) happened
112122112211221122121212.content:
Fate is just being mean today, were the thoughts that passed through Bryan's stressed out mind as his world became encased in a saliva filled cavern that was Jessica's mouth. After landing softly, or at least softer than he would have otherwise, on the sofa cushion, Bryan was just about ready to believe himself safe when a huge black shadow passed overhead, and he nearly got an up close and personal experience with the seat of Jessica's jeans. Not one to take getting sat on sitting down Bryan ran as fast as he could over the cushion, which proved a better running surface than the bread.

A short run gave him a moment of safety as he had already been near the edge of where Jessica was sitting down, and now he stood at the absolute edge of his sofa, staring at a long drop that had a hard stop on the end, namely he was staring at the hard wood floor far below. Normally the problem of exactly how to get down from the height of the sofa would have been the center of his thoughts for the next few minutes, but thanks to a bit of salsa on the floor in front of his couch, Jessica slipped at the last minute and slammed into the couch, causing the cushion to crumple, and the ends to fly upwards, sending Bryan flying.

As if that weren't enough, instead of landing somewhere soft, like back on the couch he instead hit his fan high near the ceiling, a fan which he'd never turned off and was still spinning. He would never be completely sure how, but he avoided the fan blades as he went over them, and then, thanks to his matching velocity, landed on the top part of one of the blades safely, though he felt like his whole body had just been through a blender set to obliterate. After such a hard landing you would expect the universe to give him a break, but unfortunately for Bryan the universe was in no mood to give him a break, well unless that break happened to be in one of his bones.

Finding nothing to hold on to on the smooth fan blade top, Mr, Smith felt himself slide thanks to the force of the fan's spin, and was soon staring at an even longer drop, though this one would probably end with him splattered against a wall. Again his life would be spared, though it this case it was done in an unusual way. Losing his grip on the edge of the fan Bryan was flung hard towards the wall, but soon found himself falling again, this time to a spot just behind his sofa, a spot that quite luckily contained a paper plate that one of the boys had dropped back there rather than walk the ten feet into the kitchen to throw it away.

Normally a plate like this would still be so hard as to turn Bryan into paste when he hit it, but once again the universe worked to his favor, and instead of staying firm when he hit it, the plate bent under his weight thanks to the fact that the salsa had seeped into the plate, making it spongier. However, not only did it bend under his weight, Bryan found that it also broke, and he, plus a piece of the plate soon fell the remaining inches to the floor, a drop that would more than likely kill him even from this height.

He found that the drop lasted a bit more than it should though, and looked around to find that he and the bit of paper plate that had fallen with him were in fact floating in mid air, sitting just inside a vent behind his sofa. Thinking about how exactly it was happening led his mind to distract itself with thoughts of air current equations and mass to surface ratios that allowed him to ignore the fact that he was a very small man in a very large world for a few moments.

Those moments came to an end when a sudden roar echoed from somewhere below and he knew the vent was about to increase the air flow. It didn't take long for him to be proven correct and to be blown into the air again, holding tightly to the piece of paper plate that had given him enough surface to allow the air currents to carry him weights for as long as they had. That same piece also cause this new burst of air to take him within reach of his roof before coming down again, right back through the path of the fan blades.

This time his impact on the fan was softened by the paper plate, so it barely hurt him. Now the rolling bounce after his impact on the blade, that nearly broke his neck, and sent him hurtling over the side of the blade towards the floor below. After all this his final destination became the very same spot on the sandwich where he had been before, and this time he had no choices as Jessica shoved the sandwich into her mouth, taking a huge bite and him with it. For a moment everything was still as Jessica leaned forward looking at the TV and then she leaned back again, with an old Bugs Bunny cartoon on, she laughed a little as she began to chew, and Bryan knew that unless something spectacularly unusual happened, he was soon going to be part of a snack for Jessica.
112122112211221122121212.title: The Universe picks on Bryan

1121221122112211221212121.content:
(Due to one person asking me what I consider unusual if the other one isn't I have decided to post this. Note that the Prime Wave and various other elements in this ending pertain to a series of short stories published in a local SciFan mag under the pen name Simon Sez.)

Unfortunate Bryan was just beginning to comprehend the true horror of his situation, namely that he had just been shoved inside a young girls mouth and was about to be either chewed into a mushy paste or about to be swallowed and then digested, both situations ending in his rather painful death. Facing the certainty of his demise like a man, Bryan decided if he was gonna die he was gonna die spectacularly, and throwing all caution to the wind he ran over the sandwich, which Jessica still hadn't started chewing, and then took a dive down the back of her throat. If he didn't cause her to choke in surprise, at least he will have gone out with a splash, were the thoughts that went through his stressed out mind.

In a dimension 3 further along the Tau Axis of Time(There are three axises of time just as there are three dimensions of space) another scientist was about to take a diving leap of his own, though this one had a far more spectacular purpose, namely turning the experimenter into a living god. He would do this by harnessing a bit of Ancient Science, which said that if you had five particular elements together within a set amount of space you could create a powerful force known as the Prime Wave, a representation of the Multiverse that could be used to change reality based on the whim of the wielder.

The parts of the weapon included Infinite Depth, the power to contain the cosmos, basically by becoming a living black hole. The Ancients created this part by nulling the souls of some of their own, creating a new race called the DeadBorn, those born without souls. Exactly how they did this is still a subject of debate, but what matters is that they did it, and so it proves it can be done, nulling a soul, yet somehow along the body to continue living.

The second piece was Infinite Understanding, the power to comprehend the cosmos. With this power one could predict the movements of certain objects, be they planets of atoms, and thus know what will happen sometimes days in advance. Using this ability one could always place oneself into advantageous positions in either battle or life, basically winning every fight before it even began. The Ancients created this piece by allowing their children a glimpse at the Origin Stone, a stone that showed the beginning, nd through it one could see all that came after.

The final biological piece of the puzzle is Infinite Potential, for only with it could one match the Prime Wave's energies, and thus harness them for use. Infinite Potential for Growth and Change allowed the wielder to grow stronger simply by setting themself against an opponent this caused their body to automatically respond, and thus grow to a power only a little greater using the power of the opponent as a balance to allow this new found strength to exist. The Process which creates such a being is unknown to most people, though some have found it and used it to create living weapons that eventually choose to either self-destruct, or refuse to fight.

The next two parts were not biological, but instead were representations of time and space. The Ancient versions of these two artifacts are called the Heart of Ages, a physical representation of Time's Flow which appears to be a glowing yellow stone, and the Heart of Stars, a temporal representation of the physical universe which appears to be a small gray stone that shines with a thousand tiny points of light from within.

Now this particular scientist had already found and applied the three processes that gave him Infinite Depth, Understanding, and Potential, and with the aid of a supercomputer he was able to construct his own Heart of Ages, which he called the Time Hub, which allowed him to view all of time. However through no fault of his own he had no idea how to create a Heart of Stars, and had studied for centuries to solve the problem, finding it in a little read tome called the Apocalypse Journals.

By ripping open small wormholes in the fabric of space and time he was able to observe the Multiverse in the same way his computer had been able to observe time after being connected to a Time Matrix Generator. With these wormholes he would do the same thing, and allow his computer to construct a Heart of Stars based off the data they collected. There was only one flaw in his plans, though he couldn't have known it then. That flaw just happened to be Bryan Smith.

You thought I forgot about him didn't you? Well I didn't. Bryan had just chosen to take a screaming dive into Jessica's throat when a great funnel like distortion in space opened before him. Normally one would try and avoid such things, but considering Bryan's other option was to plunge head first into a vat of acid that's sole purpose was to turn little bits of meat like him into protein for this giant girl's body to absorb. Well considering all that he aimed his fall right for it.

When he emerged on the other side he was one with the cosmos. Everything in it flowed around him, and he could see it all, with his sight focused on the man before him, who was eagerly awaiting a stone which would complete his ultimate weapon and allow him to control the cosmos. Bryan, a small(Very Small) man from a small world on the edge of a small galaxy, at the edge of a universe that didn't even matter was now in a position to save all creation.

He did so, though he knew the only way to do it would cost him his life. With a surge of effort he reached out his hand and disrupted the incoming wormholes feeding information into the computer. By doing this he disrupted flow to the Heart of Stars that the madman was making, causing it to explode outward with the force of over two-hundred suns, vaporizing the mad man and his work in a fiery inferno. His last thought as he vanished into the maelstrom was that he, being no more than a few micrometers tall, had inadvertently been able to save the universe. Thinking this he also began to wonder if maybe lady luck had been with him all this time, just not in the way he wanted. Whatever the case this was, at least for him...
1121221122112211221212121.title: Bryan becomes a hero, even if no one knows it

choices: Bottom Right
Upper Left
1121221122112211221212122.content:
(Now before we go any farther I ask you to click back on your browser and reread the last choice you made. You see that part about ‘considering the situation'? Good, well let's list what the situation is. Bryan is an at least halfway respected researcher who invented a shrinking potion, and tests it on himself. Being an undisclosed macrophile he purposefully gets into a situation where he's small around people, and they have no idea he's there. At his particular juncture he is about to become part of a sandwich of a girl who actually thinks she's doing him a favor by helping keep his house clean. Alright now back to the story)

Bryan was dead. Well at least he would be in few minutes. The girl's mouth behind him began to close, and he watched in a mixture of horror and fascination as those white skyscrapers tore into the white plane behind him, slashing through something so many times thicker than him like it wasn't even there. Seeing a sight like this is enough to make a grown man cry Mommy!, Bryan however cried out some things that don't bare repeating, usually at the universe and lady luck that had scorned him.

It would probably have interested Bryan to note that at that precise moment as Jessica took him with her first bite of sandwich a combined force of Vl'hurgs and G'Gugvuntt war vessels hyperspaced into his living room. Their purpose? Why to destroy humanity and its progenitor the Earth of course. Unfortunately even when set tail to nose the one-thousand Crithack class Destroyers measure only about an inch and a half, though that inch and a half was more than enough to take out something the size of oh say, Bryan's house.

They were still charging their Giga Ion Cannons though when another fleet hyperspaced on top of them, and an epic struggle for survival was fought in the air over Jessica's head, with her not even looking up. This new fleet consisted of the Red(That's the human word for their species, what they called themselves was unknown) and was a little bigger than the combined fleets f the Vl's and G's, though this is odd considering that the average Red stands over twelve feet tall and has spikes over most of his scaly body.

They were as small as the other fleet though, because in an attempt to circumvent Earth's defenses the High Red Commander decided to miniaturize a portion of his fleet and send it in undetected, Earth Defense Command got wind of this plan however and came up with two counters to it. The first consisted of shrinking a EDC Carrier and then sending out its forces against the Reds, however after ninety-three percent of the fighters were lost due to the actions of the normal sized populace and other various happenings the EDC instead armed their people with flyswatters, and that worked just as well.

This particular Red ship was the Attack Carrier Por'tash'nah and had accidentally gotten an extra dose of the shrink ray, causing it to shift between dimensions as well, and wind up in Bryan's living room right on top of the combined fleet of the other aliens, who, though from our dimension, happened to be from another galaxy, the Earth they were mad at and wanted to destroy was in another dimension however, but they didn't care. One Earth was as good as another.

Just as the two fleets were about to engage in pitched battle the Red's discovered one of the oddities of interdimensional travel, namely that the laws of physics change between dimension, and that though their drive system, weapons, and generators still worked, their force fields didn't, and thus their ships began to explode with the force of small(Very Small) suns, which created a spectacular show for anyone looking at it, which considering Jessica was watching Bugs Bunny, and Bryan was watching teeth fall trying to chew him up, neither was so they missed it.

Only one ship escaped complete destruction, and that was actually because the pilot was also an inventor and had been trying out a new force field on his fighter's core, one that worked in our universe. Unfortunately for him the force of the explosion still shattered his windshield, and since the Red's breath a methane based atmosphere he died instantly, his ship liquefying his remains to prevent enemies from studying it.

This now out of control ship then spiraled down, and through one of those twists of fate that have been a part of this story since it began, it flew right into Jessica's mouth as she was laughing at Elmer Fudd staring into the end of his rifle as bugs pulled the trigger. This Red ship then crashed into the bread, which was still unchewed at all, and slid to a stop right next to Bryan.

Normally a scientist like Bryan would take a moment to think before he entered what appeared to be an alien spacecraft with no pilot, but considering he was about to be eaten by a young woman in his own home as part of light snack, he decided to skip straight to the random pushing on the hull for an entrance. Not finding one right away he instead climbed into the windshield and then sat in the pilot's seat, which was perfectly sized for him.

Another lucky break occurred here in the fact that the pilot/inventor had also installed a Neural Sonic Linker in his ship, meaning it read the pilot's thoughts instead of dealing with any of that usual manual control sticks or button pushing. He did this because of a sore he had developed on his finger during one of the weeks of flight training, which caused him pain whenever he touched something with the NSL he would never have to worry about that again.

Unfortunately Bryan knew nothing about the NSL or that it wouldn't activate until he pressed a particular button on the console. All Bryan knew was that right in front of him was an alien ship's control board, and two of the buttons were blinking. Like the rest of the ship the buttons were Red(Hence the name humans gave the race that made them) though the top left looked a little darker than the bottom right. Now he was faced with a choice, which one does he press?
1121221122112211221212122.title: Considering the situation

choices: Solid, like a bed
Porous, like bread
11212211221122112212121221.content:
Bryan, without any real idea of what he's doing, throws whatever caution he had left to the wind and pushes the button on the bottom right, hoping that a light color meant something better than a darker one. The button refused to go down easily, and he realized that if he couldn't get it down soon Jessica would remember that she had something in her mouth and would begin to chew. Panic overtaking him Bryan slammed his fist into the button, and was rewarded with a high pitched wail that tore through the ship.

He was not sure of the wail was a good or bad sound, but by this point he had ceased to care. His mind had finally registered the fact that he was breathing in pure methane, a poisonous substance to humans, and he felt like his lungs were dissolving. Unable to move, breathe, or even think straight, Bryan was relieved when a white hot fire seemed to come from all around him, and the pain, for a moment, ceased.

Bryan knew he was dead. There was no other logical explanation for the pain in his lungs suddenly ceasing as it did. Admittedly the pain was caused by the atmosphere aboard an alien starfighter he had only found because he had been at a very small size, which was probably one of the most illogical things that had ever happened to him. Still he was glad it was over. Now he could rest. Slowly, he found that he wasn't going to sleep, and in fact seemed to be more awake with each passing moment. Feeling the area around him he discovered he was on a plain of white. Was it porous or solid?
11212211221122112212121221.title: Pushing his buttons

112122112211221122121212211.content:
Bryan was surprised to discover that he was sitting on a plain of white that was solid, and as his eyes slowly adjusted he found that he could see that he was in a huge inclosure, one that he recognized. He was in his room, his bigger than the grand canyon room, and surprisingly it was getting smaller as he watched. He was growing again. Somehow Tommy and Joe had done it. They'd rescued him from getting eaten and digested by Jessica, and now he was safe.

Looking around he found that there was a person sitting in the chair by his bed, and he turned to face him directly, and when he got a good look at the man, he swore in at least a dozen languages, and would have continued swearing if he'd known any more swear words, but since he didn't he decided to wait until he was full size, and then figure out where the man had come from, and more importantly what he was doing in Bryan's room when two weeks earlier Bryan had kicked him out of his house.

The man Bryan cursed was in fact his cousin. An inventor like himself, though with much more grandiose designs. He had, ten years ago, started a company called Star Technologies, and it was now the leader in the cutting edge. From computers, to nanobots, to travel ad domestic, they developed tomorrow in those labs, and then sold it to the world at wholesale prices. He'd never gotten along with his cousin though because unlike Bryan, Aaron's morals were not what they could be, a fact made obvious by the fact that some of his technology eventually turned deadly. After a few minutes his size was what it had been before this entire fiasco began, and he was staring Aaron in his bright and smiling face.

"Hello, Cousin," he said cheerily, and Bryan jumped out from under his covers ready to beat on him, when he realized he was wearing his usual night clothes, which consisted of a pair of underwear and a t-shirt. Pulling the covers off his bed for some addition clothing Bryan stared meanly at Aaron, who continued to smile that annoying smile at him.

"What are you doing here Aaron? I told you two weeks ago I'm not interested in joining Star Tech," he shouted at Aaron, pointing angrily at the door to his bedroom. Aaron, for his part, seemed shocked by this pronouncement, and pulled out a calculator from his pocket. Typing in some numbers he began mumbling to himself as he got up and walked out the door. Bryan, now alone in his room, checked his body for the scrapes and bruises he had acquired on his little adventure, and was surprised to find that they were all gone, and he was pretty sure Aaron had something to do with it.

Getting dressed slowly, he was surprised to find his stuff was not put away anymore, as it had been in preparation for his leaving. Instead his closet was full of clothes like it usually was, and he pulled off a pair of jeans and shoved them on as fast as he could so that he could catch Aaron before he left. His rapid pace was shown to be unnecessary, as he found Aaron sitting at his table, calmly reading his paper.

"Aaron, what did you do!?" Bryan demanded, and Aaron slowly set the paper down in front of himself, and motioned for Bryan to take a seat opposite him. Doing so with only partially held back rage Bryan stared at his cousin, barely able to keep himself from leaping across the table and dragging the answers out of that still smiling face. The paper, today's paper, was slid across the table by his cousin, and Aaron pointed at it as if it explained everything.

"Bryan, would you please read the date on that paper?" he asked his cousin politely, and Bryan did so. At first he couldn't believe his eyes, and thought it was some kind of a trick, but when he looked back at his cousin, and then back over his house he realized that his cousin didn't care enough about him to pull a joke like this on him, and that the house was exactly like it was, two weeks ago. He wondered for a moment if everything he had experienced was a dream, but looking back at his cousin he saw that he was tossing a small device that looked like an ampule for medicine, though it had lights and readouts all over it.

"What I did Bryan, was safe your life. You know you really need to be more careful about where you shrink cousin," he said an off hand kind of way. So off hand that Bryan almost missed what he said and was about to yell at him some more before it clicked in his mind.

"What do you mean shrink?" he asked, hoping that his cousin was grasping at straws, but then from out of his other hand Aaron pulled a bottle of the shrinking potion Bryan had developed.

"I mean this stuff. I figured out your plan as soon as I heard about your upcoming vacation, and decided that you might need a little insurance. I'm surprised you take such dangerous risks Bryan. You never struck me as that kind of man, but then again I guess it is a fetish, and you made up some good reason in your mind about why you were doing it," Aaron told him, looking at the vial in his hand with interest.

"What are you talking about?" asked Bryan, this time in an interested way. He really had no idea where Aaron was going with this.

"Bryan, you're a macrophile. I don't know way but you get a kick out of being small especially around people. I really shouldn't talk considering I'm a voraephile myself, and that's almost the same, if a little more specific. Still I wonder if you even knew you were that, or that there are hundreds of thousands of people who are just like you out there. People who would pay money for the experience you just had," said Aaron.

"I don't know about them but the experience I just had was one of the most frightening in my life, and I don't think I'll ever do it again," he told his cousin straight to his face, though he knew it was a lie. Somewhere deep inside he wanted to do it again, and he also wanted to know what that device his cousin held was, and how it had brought him back two weeks into the past. Aaron followed Bryan's eyes, and smiled that annoying smile of his again.

"Do you like this Bryan?" he asked, holding out the ampule to his cousin. Bryan took the device and found that everything about it was dead, probably wasted saving him.

"What is it?" he asked Aaron as he handed the currently useless device back.

"I call it a Second Chance Tag. Basically it uses a form of quantum waveform manipulation to alter the structure of the temporal, making it so that when the wave form reaches the end, and your life with it, represented by a twisting in the wave, it sends the final pattern back to the moment in which the SCT is used, giving you a second chance at life," said Aaron as he put the ampule back into his bag.

"So, what is it you want Aaron, and don't tell me you don't want anything, you get that look in your eyes every time you have business deal forming in that twisted little brain of your's," said Bryan as he stared across the table at Aaron.

"You're right, I do have a business deal forming, one I think you'll like. I want to open a small side business. Macrophiles Anonymous. A business combining your little shrinking potion, with my SCTs and no dying involved in fulfilling a fantasy that sick twisted minds have, for reasons which are not discussed in good company," he told Bryan, holding the vial of shrinking formula, and his SCT crossed like a coat of arms.

"Have you talked to your shrink lately?" asked Bryan, though his own mind was already wheeling with the possibilities that this new business presented.

"No I haven't as a matter of fact, but I won't either. Bryan I'm offering you chairmanship of the board of this new Star Tech affiliate. You won't have to do anything but give me permission to use your formula, and I can promise you an eight to nine figure salary yearly, and benefits such as free uses of the facility, and our companions that we've already signed up for this little venture," said Aaron, pulling a large notebook out of his bag and placing it on the table in front of them. Inside the notebook were pictures of various people all with inserts saying things about what they'd do with small people, most of which would probably have gotten them arrested if anyone thought this was actually possible.

"You're serious about this, aren't you?" asked Bryan.

"I'm always serious Bryan. Now if you want my opinion I like Anna the best," he told Bryan, flipping the book to a page containing a beautiful Caucasian girl with red hair and green eyes. Her picture showed her eating a sandwich and the insert said something about wanting the reader to be in it.

"These people are all freaks," commented Bryan as he continued to flip through the book, which had the logo of Star Tech already on the cover, with a bigger logo for MA above it.

"Yes they are. Some of them are probably certifiable, but then again so are a lot of people who will actually want their services. Now Bryan, will you deny these people the chance to live a dream, and yourself the same chance, or will you sign on with me?" asked Aaron as he watched Bryan continue to flip through the book.

"That depends on something very important," said Bryan as he stopped flipping through the book and looked Aaron in the eyes.

"And what would that be?" asked Aaron.

"Is Tiffany free this evening?" he said, holding open the book and showing a picture of one of the girls.

"I'm sure we can make arrangements," responded Aaron, looking at the girl and complementing his cousin's choice. Together the two stared at each other in silence for a moment before breaking out in laughter. They stayed up half the night going over the details, and in the morning the two left, each knowing that they had struck the deal of a lifetime.

Trust the Force, or Lady Luck, or the author, whoever it is who's been contr
112122112211221122121212212.content:
Looking at the surface underneath his hands he was disappointed when it dimpled as he pressed into it, and then he ripped off a small piece and stuffed it into his mouth. A thought filtered through his stressed out mind that the alien fighter and the getting eaten by Jessica incident had been just a strange dream of some sort, and that he was actually still safe in his own home, which looked to be in titanic proportions to him, though he was hoping that it was just because he was imagining things.

He wasn't, and Bryan would figure this out as he looked around, and discovered that his vast plain of white was full of holes, some big enough for him to hide in. He saw nothing in the distance save his own home and was wondering what exactly had just happened, but his wondering would never be finished as that moment was soon punctuated by a series of massive earthquakes. Darting his eyes over the area in panic he at last found the source of the vibrations. It was Jessica, returning to the living room after going to the kitchen for a soda, which she was now happily chugging.

Bryan was able to finally figure out his situation after rubbing his head and finding a sore spot. On his little impromptu flight around his house he must have knocked himself on the head, probably on the fan, and then he'd dreamed the rest, including the getting eaten by Jessica and the spaceship, as he lay knocked out on her sandwich. Stress did strange things to a person's mind after all, and Bryan had been under a lot of stress.

It didn't take him long to realize that he was still in a stressful situation though, as the ground under him quaked as Jessica picked it up and brought her sandwich to her mouth. Bryan didn't scream, as he knew it to be a useless gesture, after all he had been screaming at everyone today, and no one had heard him yet. Luckily he was no where near the edge of the sandwich, and watched as Jessica's molars tore into the white plain. Slowly her mouth pulled away and he watched crumbs twice his size fall unnoticed to the floor.

Staring up at Jessica Bryan was considering something that was probably completely irrational, yet he knew it might work. Every time he'd done something, anything, to try and make his situation better, he had inadvertently made it worse through a series of unfortunate events, and just plain bad luck, and now here he was standing on a sandwich about to be eaten by his neighbor's girlfriend. Since trying to get out of things like this had landed him in the situation, Bryan decided it might be best to just sit and wait, maybe accepting his fate would somehow get him out of it.

High above Jessica was chewing on her first bite of sandwich, and deciding some things herself. One was that Mr. Smith kept fresh ingredients in his house at all times. After all he was going to be gone for weeks, and yet he'd obviously only bought the lettuce and stuff she'd used for her sandwich a day or so ago. The other thing she decided was that she would give that idiot boy of her's a piece of her mind when he got back from wherever he'd gone.

This was the third time in a month he'd forgotten about her and she wasn't going to stand for it. Swallowing loudly she licked her lips, getting any stray pieces of sandwich off them and then raised the meal to her mouth, intending to shove as much into her maw as she could in frustration at her boyfriend's lack of attention. Bryan was not privy to what was going through Jessica's mind, but he knew he had to decide now, jump off the sandwich, or stay on and hope for the best.
112122112211221122121212212.title: It was all a dream, well some of it anyway

1121221122112211221212122121.content:
Bryan's resolve at his luck wavered as Jessica's teeth came closer, and so with his usual bolt decision making he ran as fast as he could away from them. Unfortunately, the sandwich chose the moment to tip backwards, towards Jessica, and so his getting up caused his grip to loosen on the bread, and he fell right towards that gaping maw.

Jessica was too wrapped up in her own thoughts to wonder at the strange morsel that hit her tongue, or its odd taste of cotton, rubber, and meat. Instead she focused only on her anger, and shoved the sandwich into her mouth. She felt good as the bread crinkled a little under her push, and then she chomped down as hard as she could.

Inside her, Bryan was pushed back by the sandwich, and instead of being inside Jessica's mouth as she chomped down on her huge bit, he was already on the precipice of her throat, looking down a long dark abyss when all light suddenly went out. He had no chance to grab for a handhold when Jessica's mouth moved again, chewing her latest conquest, and throwing him against the back wall of her mouth, causing the throat muscles to contract automatically around the tiny morsel, and send it on its way.

That tiny morsel was in no way in agreement with Jessica's bodily reflexes, but found that his consent counted for little as Jessica's esophagus closed in around him like some fleshy water flume ride, sending him into a dark hole, that was surprisingly getting brighter the farther down he went. Fighting against the muscles as hard as he could did Bryan little good, and soon he felt as if his shoulder would snap under the pressure, before he quite suddenly was thrown from the tube into a larger chamber.

The first thing he noted was the smell, which was something like a cross between gas, and moldy cheese, but he didn't have long to consider the smell before he hit the bottom of the sac in which he found himself. Surprisingly the bottom was soft, a fact that made sense when he began wading his way through the mush that was Jessica's previous bite of her sandwich. From the grinding and crunching sounds overhead he knew the mush would soon have company, and scrambled as fast as he could to get out of it.

His luck allowed him to do so, and he was just jumping onto the soft, yet firm floor of Jessica's stomach when a loud gulp punctuated the thumping of her heart, and a moment later masticated ooze began to fall from the sky, right on top of the mush that it had been attached to not three minutes before hand. Staring at the odd meeting of mush and mush Bryan realized with a clarity that hit him like a ton of bricks, he was in Jessica's stomach.

Bryan for one did not care for the circumstances, and so ran for his life right up against the wall of Jessica's stomach and began to pound on it for all he was worth. He was gratified when the flesh he struck gave under his attacks, and then rippled like it was laughing. He thought for a moment that he had some effect that Jessica might feel, but instead he found a pore in the wall beside him that was almost bigger than him began to gush out a foul smelling liquid that flowed over the stomach's floor.

Bryan watched in both fascination and horror as the liquid slowly worked its way over the ground towards the mush, and then was down right hysteric when it touched the mush and began to bubble and smoke. He had apparently caused her stomach to begin its work, and he was forced to move away as a pore overhead began to spew acid as well. Finding a clear spot on the wall Bryan began to renew his attack on the fleshy prison, surprised that it gave so easily under his assault, and that it was always able to return to its original shape despite how far it stretched to get out of his reach.

Above and around him Jessica was just starting to feel better about her situation when she got the oddest feeling in her stomach. It was like a slight tickle below her left breast, and though it was very light, it seemed quite insistent on having her attention. A moment later it ended, and yet was soon back with even more force than before. Jessica came to the quick conclusion that she'd eaten too fast, and so decided to wash down her meal and hope for the best.

Shoving the last of her sandwich into her mouth she almost swallowed it whole, and then picked up the can of RC cola which she'd found stashed in one of Mr. Smith's cabinets. Lifting the can to her lips she tipped it back and began to take as long a pull as she could manage from it. She was not really a fan of the cola, and was just as happy not to taste it as it washed over her tongue, but was still of the opinion that it was better than beer.

Insider her stomach Bryan was of a far different opinion about Jessica's beverage choice. If she'd been drinking beer he would not be in a severe amount of trouble, but the instant that piece of sandwich landed in the fast filling lake behind him, he knew what was coming and braced himself. The stream of brown liquid began to fall a moment later from the hatch in the ceiling, one he had contemplated climbing too, but knew it wouldn't work.

The instant the liquid touched the stomach floor the walls began to move on their own, and Bryan was hit by the same surface he had been pounding on for a few minutes now. Jessica's stomach, in reaction to the sugar that had just entered, was working double time, and acid began to pour even more furiously from the walls. Seeing this Bryan was unable to do anything but stare, and then, with catlike grace he leaped over the undulating floor, and back to a still unmoving portion of the wall, trying on last time to get Jessica's attention.

"I'm in here Jessica! JESSICA!!!" he shouted as loud as he could, pounding and kicking at the wall with all his might. Jessica did not hear the shouts, which were being drowned out by the sound of her own stomach working if nothing else. She did however feel the tickling return with even more renewed force. Did she assume that she might have eaten a miniaturized human being with her sandwich and that he was trying to get her attention from within her stomach?

Not a chance. Like any sane person she had assumed that the tickle was just some gas build up, and so was leaning forward slightly now, pressing slightly on her abdomen. With an earth shattering force she let the air out of her stomach, unleashing a terrific belch which would have made Tommy or one of his friends very proud. Jessica was just as happy that no one was around to see her do it though, and then leaned back. The tickle had seemed to slide down for a moment, before vanishing altogether. Her stomach contended Jessica then went about cleaning Mr. Smith's home for his return.

Days later the boys would return to the house and frantically search it while the cops waited outside. They had been in lock up for a week because of excessively speeding, 127 miles in a 35 zone. They had told some bull story about a shrunken man and an antidote at his lab. Their search found no little man, or of Jessica for that matter. She had left for a month to visit her aunt up north who was in the hospital with some disease.

Jessica, Tommy, Joe, the police, and Zack would never figure out exactly what happened to Bryan, as Jess never told Tommy about her little visit to Bryan's house, deeming it unimportant. Neither Joe nor Tommy told anyone about the little professor either, thinking that maybe the police who'd let them go after the search of the house were right, maybe there'd been something weird in Mr. Smith's house that caused them to hallucinate.
1121221122112211221212122121.title: Getting to know Jessica, from the inside

choices: Phone Call Interrupts Jessica's Meal
The boys return
11212211221122112212122.content:
As Jessica lifted her sandwich toward her massive face, Bryan felt definite pangs of regret at having decided to stand his ground in an attempt to gain her attention.

When the girl bit off a sizable chunk of sandwich, regret turned to absolute terror. Bryan had shouted and waved his thread-thin arms, all to no avail. The tiny man scrambled backward, but in panic-induced clumsy haste he failed to see the deep pit in the spongy bread. His unexpected plunge back into the bread left him with no sense of direction. He knew that the sandwich continued to shift as he tried to find his way in the surprisingly large honeycomb-like tunnel in the fluffy white bread.

Jessica's first bite of sandwich, well-chewed and swallowed, reminded her that she had forgotten to pour herself a drink.

She placed her plate on Mr. Smith's living room coffee table and went to the kitchen to look in the fridge for something to drink with her sandwich.

She looked inside the refrigerator and sighed. "Typical bachelor guy," she said.

She saw a bottle of wine and some cans of beer. Then, she saw what she wanted. Grabbing the carton of milk, she walked to the counter. She sniffed at the carton's opening. "Smells all right," she said, although she double-checked by taking a quick peek at the expiration date. She had to squint to read the small letters. Jessica had always been a little near-sighted.

As Jessica poured herself a tall glass of milk, tiny Bryan found himself mired, quite literally, in more difficulty. He followed the winding tunnel, formed during the bread's baking process, looking for a way back to the surface of the bread. Without warning, however, the tunnel sloped steeply, and he tumbled into a pool of mayonnaise that had collected in the tunnel.

The tiny man tried to pull himself out of the oily mayo, but the thick substance held him fast.

The tiny man, as he struggled vainly, thought wryly that if only Jessica was a little more health-conscious, she would have avoided mayo on her sandwich.

Meanwhile, Jessica returned from the kitchen, still hungry, and with a glass of milk to wash down her meal.
11212211221122112212122.title: Something to Wash Down Her Meal

choices: Bryan leaps off sandwich and falls to floor
Jessica is still hungry
112122112211221122121222.content:
Tiny Bryan truly felt his size at the moment as he struggled to pull himself from a dollop of mayonnaise that had seeped into the slice of bread used by an enormous girl to build herself a sandwich.

For his current predicament, he had no one to blame but himself, Bryan admitted as the thick, oily condiment held him fast. He regretted his foolish plan to shrink himself and, with a neighbor kid's unknowing help, mail himself as a surprise to his nephew in California.

When the time came, however, for Tommy to mail the all-important package, the entire universe seemed to turn against the brilliant scientist.

He had survived numerous close calls until, in what he thought at first might be a lucky break, Tommy and his friend, Joe, had detected and, thankfully, correctly identified the tiny scientist.

The teenagers had rushed to Bryan's lab to recover the antidote. The bug-sized man had remained in his home, presumably safe, to await their return.

Enter Jessica.

Bryan had met Tommy's girlfriend on previous occasions, but now, knowing how close he had come to being mistaken as a pesky insect by Tommy and his friends, he had done his best to avoid detection.

He had succeeded, for all the good that did him, and now, unknown to the giant girl, was stuck inside the bread of her sandwich, held fast by a blot of mayo. He continued to struggle, knowing that if he didn't escape soon, Jessica would continue eating her sandwich and, consequently, consume him as well.

•••••

Jessica returned to the living room and had placed her glass of milk on the table when Tommy and Joe burst into the house.

Tommy, clearly surprised, asked, "Jessica! What are you doing here?"

Jessica sighed. "You asked me to meet you here," she said.

"Oh, yeah," Tommy recalled.

Joe stood next to his friend, sneaking covert glances at Jessica. He'd always thought his buddy lucky for having such an attractive girlfriend.

Tommy overcame his surprise at Jessica's presence. "We need to talk to Mr. Smith. They wouldn't let us in his lab!" Tommy blurted out.

"Tommy, there isn't anyone home," Jessica said. She took a seat on the sofa.

"We left him on the kitchen table," Tommy said, leaving the living room. "Mr. Smith! We're back."

Joe trailed his friend, who stopped and scanned the tabletop. "I don't see him!" Tommy exclaimed.

A very irritated Jessica caught up with the boys. "Tommy, I told you that Mr. Smith's not here!"

Tommy turned and faced Jessica. "You don't understand! He shrunk himself, and I accidentally demolished his antidote."

"We went to the lab but they wouldn't let us in," Joe chimed in.

Jessica stared at Tommy and then Joe. She didn't detect any signs in their eyes or mannerism. But a shrunken man on a kitchen table. "Are you both high on something?" Jessica demanded.

"It's the truth!" Tommy protested.

"Yeah," Joe said. "You should have seen Mr. Smith. He's made himself the size of a bug."

"That's not possible!" Jessica snapped. "Thomas, if this is some prank!"

"It's no prank," Tommy assured her. "Haven't you seen him? We left him there on the table."

"I didn't see any little man," Jessica said, beginning to waver. "I did fix myself a sandwich, but not at the kitchen table. If you really left him there, where has he gone?"

Tommy and Joe exchanged a glance. "That does make sense, Tommy," Joe said. "It's not like someone his size would get far."

Jessica looked angry now. "Yeah, where is he? Oh, Mr. Smith! Come out, wherever you are."

Tommy looked down expectantly at the table. "But, we both saw him!" Tommy said.

"You're both ridiculous!" Jessica pronounced. She turned and headed back to the living room to continue her meal.

•••••

Tiny Bryan, despite his sticky situation, managed to overhear most of the conversation. He screamed valiantly, hoping Tommy might be more alert to teeny sounds.

His additional incentive helped give him the strength to pull himself free from the mayonnaise. He climbed back to the surface of the bread just in time to see Jessica reaching for the plate that held her sandwich.

"No!" Bryan screamed as Jessica lifted her sandwich. "Tommy! Help! Don't let her eat me!"
112122112211221122121222.title: The Guys Return

choices: Between two massive Airwalks
Right next to a massive Airwalk
1121221122112211221212221.content:
Seated at Mr. Smith's coffee table, Jessica reached for her sandwich.

The tiny scientist knew it was now or never, so he took a blind leap. He plunged toward the floor, and survived the impact.

Still, the trauma of falling so far took its toll. He tried to rise to his feet, but his body and brain didn't cooperate.

"Tommy," he gasped before he passed out.

------

Jessica finished her sandwich, then announced that she was leaving.

"You're not going to help look for Mr. Smith?" Tommy asked.

"No, I am not going to help search for a tiny little man, because there is no tiny little man!" Jessica screamed at him. "Don't you even call me until you are ready to apologize for this stupidity."

With that, she marched from the house, leaving Tommy and Joe alone.

-------

Joe walked to the living room and seated himself on the same sofa where Jessica had finished off her sandwich. Somehow, he avoided planting his giant Airwalks on the spot on the floor where the unconscious little man was crumpled.

"Get off your butt and help me look," Tommy complained.

"Give it up," Joe said. "He's gone. Maybe he kept shrinking away until there was nothing left."

"Don't be a moron," Tommy said, and he returned to the kitchen to keep looking.

--------

As he regained consciousness, the tiny scientist opened his eyes and screamed when he found that he was...
1121221122112211221212221.title: Leaping to Freedom

choices: Joe checks his right foot
Joe checks his left foot
11212211221122112212122211.content:
Tiny Mr. Smith remained frozen in place after waking to find himself on the floor between two massive Airwalks.

In a mix of horror and awe, he stared past the titanic shoes, following Joe's enormous legs, staring up at the 17-year-old sprawled on the living room sofa.

"I have to get to safety," the bug-sized man realized. He decided to move slowly and deliberately, not wanting to attract any sudden attention until he placed some distance between himself and those shoes.

Joe flipped through channels on the flat-screen television, using Mr. Smith's remote control. If he had been more attentive, he might have noticed the tiny form that backed away from his shoes, sprinting away from the sofa toward the overhanging oval of polished wood supported on four thick pillars made of the same wood.

"If I can make it to the coffee table, I should be safe," the tiny scientist told himself.

Tommy, frustrated at the lack of success in his search, returned to the doorway into the living room.

"Are you still on your butt?" Tommy yelled at his friend. "I can't find the poor little guy, so I could use your help."

Joe dropped the remote on the cushions. "Oh, all right!"

Tiny Mr. Smith heard the exchange, and realized he was still too far from shelter beneath the coffee table. He redoubled his efforts, running faster, hoping to reach safety.

Joe took only a couple of steps. "I just thought of something," he said.

Tommy headed into the room, but stopped only halfway into the room. "What's that, genius?"

"Well, we have been stomping around all through the house," Joe said. "What if he's on the floor. We could already have squished him under our shoes!"

Tommy looked a little green. "Gross," he said. "I didn't think of that."

Slowly, he lifted one shoe, twisted his leg, and examined the sole. "Nothing there," he said, sounding very relieved.

He then checked the other one, again finding no evidence to suggest he had accidentally stomped his neighbor.

"Maybe you should check your shoes, Joe." Tommy said, still looking very apprehensive.

Joe, twisting awkwardly, tried to examine the sole of his right foot sneaker.

"I CAN'T SEE NOTHING," he grumbled. "DO YOU SEE ANYTHING?"

Tommy leaned closer, but the smell of the well-worn sneaker made his eyes water. He beat a hasty retreat and remarked, "NO. THAT ONE LOOKS CLEAN."

"GOOD!" Joe said.

"BUT MAN," Tommy chided his buddy. "YOUR FEET STINK."

"WELL, ONE MORE TO GO, AND WE ARE IN THE CLEAR."

Tommy frowned. "I SURE HOPE THAT ONE IS CLEAN, TOO. I CAN'T THINK OF A WORSE WAY TO GO THAN UNDER YOUR STINKY SHOE."

Joe slowly lifted his left shoe...

Joe slowly lifted his left shoe...

Both teenagers gasped at the same time when they saw the tiny blot smashed into the treads of Joe's left sneaker.

"IS IT...?" Joe asked.

Tommy, not all that willing to look closely at the crushed remains of his shrunken neighbor, gave the gruesome speck only a cursory glance and nodded his head.

Because of his squeamishness, he failed to see that the victim of Joe's shoe was, in fact, a real bug that had been stomped as the teenagers walked up the walk to Mr. Smith's front door.

"OH NO!" Joe exclaimed, then added quickly, "IT'S NOT MY FAULT. HOW WAS I TO KNOW?"

Tommy sighed, but he knew the truth of Joe's statement. "LET'S JUST GO," he advised. "WE WILL HAVE TO KEEP THIS SECRET. DON'T TELL ANYONE."

Joe nodded. Even if he told someone, who would believe he had stepped on and crushed a tiny shrunken man?

------

From his sheltered vantage point near one of the columnar legs supporting the massive living room coffee table, the itty-bitty man peered up at his gigantic neighbor and the teenager's best friend.

"What the hell?" Mr. Smith wondered aloud. "What are they doing?"

He tried to eavesdrop on their conversation.

------

"I DIDN'T MEAN TO STEP ON HIM!" Joe protested again.

"DID I SAY YOU DID?" Tommy snapped.

"LET'S JUST GET THE HELL OUT OF HERE AND NEVER COME BACK," Joe said in his loud voice.

------

"No! They can't leave me here." Mr. Smith left the protection of the table leg and made his way into the open area between the mammoth sofa and the coffee table.

Waving his arms over his head, trying to signal one of the giants, the tiny man screamed. "No one stepped on me! I'm still here! Down here! On the floor!"

About that time...
1121221122112211221212221111.title: Luck runs out

choices: Joe steps on him
The boys leave
11212211221122112212122211111.content:
Scientist Bryan Smith, after deliberately reducing his size with his latest invention, finds himself, as a result of a series of misadventures, on the floor of his own home at the feet of his teenaged neighbor and the boy's best friend.

Both boys, entirely by mischance, believe that Joe has stomped the tiny man. Beneath his enormous coffee table, which loomed over him like a strange alien temple propped on four massive pillars, the bug-sized scientist listened to the pointless argument of two clueless teenagers.

"You can't blame this on me!" Joe repeated again.

"Why the hell not?" Tommy retorted. "It was your shoe that stomped him."

The shrunken scientist, almost beneath the status of a speck or bug, ran out from beneath the colossal table. He waved his thread-thin arms over his head. "Tommy, he didn't step on me!" Bryan tried to shout at the top of his lungs. Everything depended on the two enormous teenagers locating and recognizing him.

He couldn't believe how enormous they looked. Formerly scrawny teenagers now looked like two mobile skyscrapers as they stood in the center of the room, overwhelming everything with their presence.

Again, Joe proposed they just get the hell out of Mr. Smith's house and never come back.

The tiny man darted closer to the two titanic teenagers, keeping a wary distance from footwear the size of cruise ships. They could move faster than a sea-going vessel, however, if the two teenagers moved carelessly.

Trusting his neighbor, tiny Bryan dashed toward Tommy's sneaker.

"It must have been a gross way to go," Joe speculated. "Imagine it. Stomped like a filthy bug."

"Quit talking about it," Tommy said, choosing not to think how he had let down his neighbor.

Joe snickered. "Well, if you think about it, was all his fault. Why did he shrink his ass in the first place?"

Tommy started to snap back, but the question gave him pause. Why had Mr. Smith done something so foolish and downright dangerous?

"I bet he just wanted to have some cheap thrills," Joe said.

"You're nuts," Tommy said. Of course, he didn't feel the tiny fists at that very moment pounding on the rubber sole of his right sneaker.

"Tommy! My God! Please, it's me! I'm here!" The tiny man realized his attempt to contact the titan was like pounding a stone wall.

Suddenly, the sneaker moved as Tommy started walking again. The shrunken scientist saw the shoe advancing toward him and screamed.

When the toe section of the enormous shoe connected, the impact propelled the tiny man bodily across the room for almost a foot.

He felt battered and bruised, but he struggled to get back on his feet even as he realized Joe was now following Tommy toward the front door.

"You're right," Tommy said. "Let's just go."

He knew if they left all hope would be lost….
11212211221122112212122211111.title: Joe defends himself

11212211221122112212122211112.content:
If they left him here, still shrunken to the size of a dust speck, he was doomed. The two teenagers were the only people in the world with a clue to what had happened to him, and now they mistakenly thought that he had been crushed underfoot.

He knew he had only seconds before they left, leaving him marooned in his tiny state.

He hurried into the open, moving away from the protection offered by the monumental sofa and coffee table.

Now, with their false impression of his fate, the two titans didn't exercise any caution as they moved through Mr. Smith's home.

Tommy entered the living room, with Joe following close behind him. He still felt awful for what had happened to poor, defenseless Mr. Smith. He shuddered as he imagined how the shrunken man must have felt as Joe's enormous shoe came down on him.

The miniature man felt a sense of relief when Tommy led the way across the living room. Through the entire crisis, up to the fatal misunderstanding, the teenager had acted surprisingly level-headed and sensible.

Mr. Smith waved his arms over his head, trying to attract the attention of one of the giants.

"Tommy! I am here! On the floor! No one stepped on me! I'm still here!"

The vibrations from the paired footsteps of the two titans combined to create a good imitation of an earthquake for the desperate shrunken man.

The little man's sprint had placed him squarely between the titans and the front door.

The little man screamed. "Tommy!"

For a second, he thought he had been heard. Tommy looked down, but simply in preparation for reaching for the door knob.

Unfortunately, he wasn't looking for tiny specks at his feet when he took the final steps toward the door.

The shadow fell over the little man, who realized that he had let desperation place him in the very peril the teenagers thought he had already experienced.

They hadn't stomped him the first time, but then he might not should have pushed his luck.

Tommy's right sneaker first plunged the tiny man into shadow, although he kept screaming until the very end.

Later, in his own room at his own home, Tommy removed his sneakers. As he did, he looked at his right foot sneaker and noticed a very tiny red stain crushed between the tread.

He found that very strange.

"But I saw the stain on Joe's Airwalk..." Tommy muttered.

Then, an uncomfortable thought clicked into place.

"Oh crap! If Joe didn't stomp on him, this means I did!"

He felt honestly remorseful, but he soothed guilty feelings by telling himself that he had no way of knowing.

He carried the sneakers into his bathroom, and cleaned the soles thoroughly under a jet of water from the faucet.

He felt bad, but that didn't mean he intended to get the blame in the mysterious disappearance of his neighbor.

"He shrunk himself down voluntarily," Tommy reasoned, although he wondered why Mr. Smith had wanted to be so tiny.

After all, in a world of giants, being that tiny was extremely dangerous.
11212211221122112212122211112.title: No Second Chances

choices: Tommy notices something tiny in the milk
Tommy wants a drink of the milk
1121221122112211221212222.content:
Bryan tried to steady himself on the massive slice of bread providing the "roof" of Jessica's sandwich as the girl grabbed for the plate.

Jessica, still irritated at her boyfriend's wild story, swept the plate off the table.

The plate kept going, but a blast of wind blew the tiny man off the sandwich. He began screaming as he plunged downward.

He landed with a splash instead of the expected splat. In an instant, he surfaced in a sea of white liquid.

"What in the..." Bryan began, but his voice trailed off as recognition dawned. "No! Oh great!"

He had fallen into the glass of milk Jessica had poured herself to enjoy with the sandwich.

He paddled to the edge of the glass, but an oval ring of glass three times his height proved a barrier between the top of the glass and the level of the milk. He tried to scramble up the slick walls, but splashed back into the white liquid with each attempt.

He immediately knew this was even worse than finding himself on her sandwich. He could jump free of the sandwich. Escape from the giant glass looked impossible.

------

Tommy continued to wear a bewildered look on his face. He didn't want to continue looking foolish in front of his girlfriend, but he knew he should try to find Mr. Smith.

Jessica sat down on the sofa in the living room to enjoy her sandwich. She glared at Tommy and Joe as she took a bite from the sandwich.

Then, she realized she had forgotten her glass of milk. She swallowed and spoke in a less angry tone.

"Tommy, could you bring me my glass of milk?" Jessica asked. "I left it on the kitchen table."

"Sure," Tommy said, eager to regain her good graces.

-------

Bryan, treading water, or rather milk, noticed the ripples spread across the surface of the milk.

Soon, the ripples increased as Tommy stomped across the kitchen floor toward the table.

He glanced around the almost bare table, looking one last time for his shrunken part-time employer.

Not seeing any sign of a tiny man, Tommy stretched his hand for the glass of milk.

Bryan, once again left in utter awe of the giant youth, splashed and screamed. "In here!" Bryan screamed. "Tommy, please. I'm in the glass!"

A wave submerged the tiny man as Tommy lifted the glass from the table and returned to the living room to deliver the milk to his girlfriend.
1121221122112211221212222.title: Change of Scenery

choices: Tommy gets strangled
Tommy swallows
11212211221122112212122222.content:
The simple motion of the glass being carried in Tommy's giant hand kicked up a tempest within the vast supply of milk held with the confines of the glass.

Between swamping waves of the white liquid, Bryan screamed for help. "Tommy!" The little man shouted. "Look down! Here, in the glass!"

Suddenly, the motion decreased. Tommy stopped in his tracks.

"Hey, Jess," he asked in his wheedling voice. "Can I have a drink of your milk? I'm thirsty."

Jessica felt like telling him to pour his own glass of milk, but she didn't feel like another argument. "Sure," she said.
