He panicked when he felt Tommy's tongue start pushing him toward the back of the cavernous mouth. "Tommy! No, please, don't swallow me," the tiny scientist screamed. "You can't do this!"

-------

"So, you about ready to start looking for your teeny neighbor?" Joe asked as Tommy chewed.

Although his mother had taught him better manners, Tommy didn't hesitate to answer, although he hadn't yet swallowed his food. So, with his mouth nearly full, he replied, "Sure, man. Give me one sec..."

Throughout his answer, the enormous teen spewed half-eaten crumbs of pizza all over the tabletop. He reached for his drink, ready to wash down his meal and begin the search for his shrunken neighbor.
112122112211221122121222221121211111.title: Another Bite

choices: Tommy drinks Mr. Smith
Mr. Smith evades another sip
1121221122112211221212222211212111111.content:
As he plummeted through the air, the shrunken scientist had only an instant to celebrate his freedom upon escaping his titanic neighbor's mouth before he splashed down.

SPLASHED! As he surfaced, sputtering for air, the tiny man realized he had fallen into a cold lake.

Then, as another fact snapped into place, he realized he wasn't in a lake. Being ejected from Tommy's mouth began to look like a temporary reprieve as he discovered he had fallen into the teenager's drink.

Talking with his mouth full, Tommy assured Joe he was ready to resume the search for his tiny neighbor. But, first, he picked up his cola to wash down his pizza.

As the glass tilted, the bug-sized man once again saw the teenager's cavernous mouth open wide. "Oh my god. Not again!" The tiny man cried, trying in vain to swim against the current as a river of cola began to drain into Tommy's mouth and down his throat.

The speck of a man just missed being washed over the lip of the glass and into Tommy's mouth.

As the cola began to settle, he tried to remain afloat. He heard the titanic teenagers discussing his fate.

"I don't understand why he would hide from you," Joe said.

"Well, I have had time to think about that," Tommy announced. "In that movie with the tiny kids, no one was paying attention to something so small."

"So, sort of like not noticing an ant or a bug," Joe said, finally getting it. "Now that you mention it, no telling how many ants we stomp every day and never know it."

Tommy frowned. "For now, just watch your step," he cautioned Joe. "Mr. Smith might be trying to get our attention right now."

They both scanned the kitchen, and at one point Tommy's gaze seemed to settle on the glass of cola.

"Yes!" The shrunken man exclaimed. "Down here! In your drink! Tommy, help me!"

Instead, Tommy wanted another drink before they began their search in earnest...
1121221122112211221212222211212111111.title: Another drink

choices: Tommy gets sicker
Tommy tries to throw up
11212211221122112212122222112121111111.content:
The tiny scientist had two goals, neither very easy considering his size of a mere quarter-inch.

He wanted Tommy to hear him, which meant he kept screaming futile pleas for the titanic teenager's attention.

He also wanted to stay afloat in the glass of cold liquid, which quickly chilled his tiny body to its core.

As Tommy tilted his glass, his shrunken neighbor quickly added a third goal to the list. Namely, he didn't want the teenaged boy next door to swallow him.

------------

Tommy chugged the cola in the glass, but he happened to look down just as Mr. Smith washed out of the glass and into the cavernous mouth.

The momentum of the river of soda rushed the tiny man through the enormous interior of the mouth and directly down the teenager's throat.

"Oh my god!" Tommy exclaimed. He spluttered, almost strangling himself, but he was too late. The last gulp of soda had disappeared down his throat.

"What's the matter with you?" Joe asked.

"Oh, hell, dude!" Tommy exclaimed. "I think I found Mr. Smith."

Joe looked surprised. "Where is he?"

Feeling a bit queasy, Tommy rubbed his stomach. "I think I just swallowed him."

----------

The shrunken scientist didn't count it as an honor at the moment to have traveled where no one had gone before. He clung to an island of pizza crust awash in the sea of cola Tommy had swallowed.

He knew the acidic cola was, for the moment, a better alternative than Tommy's own stomach acids. But the one would soon overtake the other as Tommy's body continued its digestive process.

----------

"I am sure I saw him!" Tommy repeated to Joe. "He was in my glass, and suddenly he got washed down with my drink. I didn't have time to react."

"How the hell did he get in your glass?" Joe asked.

Tommy continued to feel sick. "I don't know. Hell, what am I going to do? I swallowed Mr. Smith!"
11212211221122112212122222112121111111.title: Drunk

choices: Mr. Smith's confidence is misplaced
Mr. Smith's faith in Tommy is rewarded
112122112211221122121222221121211111111.content:
As the shrunken scientist clung with desperation to a disintegrating island of pizza crust awash in the sea of cola inside Tommy's stomach, he flashed back to that instant when he slipped out of the glass and over the titanic teenager's lips.

For one brief second, his tiny eyes had gazed upward and locked with his teenaged neighbor's eyes.

"Did he see me?" The shrunken man wondered. "Or am I just driving myself crazy?"

The fumes of digestion made it difficult to breathe, and he heard waves lapping at the edges of the rapidly shrinking island of pizza crust. He could barely see in the heavy, damp darkness.

He knew there wasn't going to be a reprieve, so why not just face the inevitable.

But, when his thoughts turned in that direction, his mind called up that instant when he had looked into his titanic teenager's eyes.

"I know he saw me," he muttered. He stood and defied the universe. "Tommy! It was me! Please, you have to get me out of here!"

----

Tommy paced back and forth in his neighbor's immaculate kitchen.

"I know that I saw him!" Tommy said in a voice creeping toward panic.

Joe looked uncertain of what to say. "Umm, well, can you feel him?"

"Can I feel him?" Tommy repeated incredulously. "What the hell kind of question is that?"

"Hey, you're the one swallowed your next-door neighbor, not me!"

"What am I going to do?" Tommy asked. He rubbed his stomach, trying to feel some sort of sign that his neighbor was indeed inside his belly.

But that thought made him sicker. He ran to the sink and retched, but nothing happened.

"You trying to bring him back up?" Joe asked as he ambled over to his buddy's side.

"Of course I am trying to bring him back up!" Tommy shouted.

-----

The more agitated the teenager became, the more his stomach churned, producing more acid that ate away inexorably at his tiny neighbor's refuge.

Of course, the tiny man had no way of knowing that the more Tommy stressed out, the quicker came his impending doom.

He remained almost eerie in his calm confidence that Tommy would save him.
112122112211221122121222221121211111111.title: Not feeling so great

choices: Tiny Bryan falls off the raft and is left behind in Tommy's stomach
Bryan and the tiny raft don't escape the stomach
1121221122112211221212222211212111111111.content:
As bits of the island of pizza crust crumbled away in the roiling lake of stomach acid, the tiny scientist began to worry. Soon, the island of pizza crust was transformed, thanks to the teenager's speedy digestion process, into a mere raft.

The sounds of Tommy's retching rumbled through the teenager's massive body, sounding very uncomfortable to his tiny neighbor's ears.

-----

"It's no good," Tommy announced in defeat. "I've never been able to make myself throw up."

"Maybe you could drink something disgusting," Joe advised. He opened the fridge and looked at the contents. "There's a carton of yogurt."

"I don't know...what's the expiration date?" Tommy asked, grasping at any straw.

Joe read the date. "Damn, it's still good."

"What else is in there?" Tommy pushed Joe aside and began to rummage through the fridge.

He found what he needed when he discovered a plastic container of fresh mushrooms that were well past their freshness date. The mushrooms looked ghastly white and had acquired a coat of slime. He felt sick just looking at them, and he had always hated mushrooms.

"Those might do it," he said.

"Better move over to the sink," Joe said.

"I can't just throw up in the sink." Tommy thought out his plan. "What if tiny Mr. Smith falls down the drain?"

Joe shrugged and looked beneath the sink, finding a plastic bucket. "Will this do?"

Tommy frowned. "Yeah, I think it will."

He plucked one of the slimy mushrooms from the carton. "Oh god, that looks awful," he said.

------

Waves of acid tossed the tiny pizza raft back and forth within Tommy's cavernous stomach. A nervous bug-sized scientist dared to hope the teenager might be working to save him from almost certain death by digestion. "I just have to be ready to ride right out of here," Mr. Smith said.

Suddenly, the contents of the stomach surged, tossing the tiny raft on the violent waves.

-------

Joe turned away, sickened himself at watching Tommy eat the disgusting mushroom and by the noise as his friend threw up his recent meal.

Unfortunately...
1121221122112211221212222211212111111111.title: Preparing for the surge

1121221122112211221212222211212111111111.content:
The surging tide tossed the tiny raft of pizza crust violently as it prepared to make its journey back up Tommy's throat.

The teenager's tiny neighbor tried with all his might to hang on to the raft, but the momentum proved too much for the speck-sized man. Just as the surge gained velocity, he fell off the pizza crust raft.

The lower esophageal sphincter closed off after emptying a significant amount of Tommy's recent meal from the stomach chamber. However, when the tight muscle of the sphincter closed again, an even more desperate Mr. Smith found himself on the wrong side, still trapped within his gigantic teenaged neighbor's stomach.

When Tommy finally stopped retching, he made a careful examination, but he didn't see any sign of his tiny neighbor.

"Uh, did you find him?" Joe asked without offering to get too close to his buddy.

"No," Tommy admitted in a defeated voice. "I guess I really did imagine it."

Meanwhile, inside the stomach, the teenager's shrunken neighbor discovered that Tommy's stomach was still producing a full load of powerful digestive acids, only now much of the food had been evacuated from the cavernous chamber.

The tiny man now faced the full fury of a teenager's stomach in full digestive mode. The acids began to sting fiercely as they surrounded the shrunken scientist.

"Tommy!" He shouted. "I didn't make it out. You have to try again! Tommy, please."

Tommy rinsed out his mouth and spat in the sink. The nausea from having to throw up began to recede.

"I still can't figure out what could have happened to Mr. Smith," he said.

"Don't sweat it," Joe offered. "You've done your best."

Gradually, the tiny man in the huge stomach grew too weak to struggle, and his protests were reduced to a few whimpers before he finally succumbed.

His last bitter thoughts reflected on how close he had gotten to rescue, only for fate to snatch his final hope away from him.
1121221122112211221212222211212111111111.title: Left behind

choices: Joe turns to Tommy terriffied
Joe goes into denial
1121221122112211221212222211212111112.content:
Mr. Smith was trapped in the pile of chewed pizza sitting at the very back of Tommy's tongue. Ahead of him rows of teeth towered over the undulating tongue, still covered with bits of chewed pizza that it seemed would remain in Tommy's mouth unnoticed after the massive teen gulped down the bite of pizza and his unseen passenger.

The rim of the glass appeared at the lips and a rush of liquid cascaded into the mouth. Mr Smith screamed in terror at the quickly advancing wave of cola.

---

Tommy tried to guzzle his soda so that he could start looking for his tiny neighbor. However trying to gulp down the whole bite of pizza as well as a stream of soda proved to be too much. He gagged on the overload and coughed out the contents of his mouth.

"Augh! What the hell?!" Joe cried out jumping from his seat. Tommy was doubled over, facing the floor, coughing and trying to regain his breath.

---

Mr. Smith lay on the ground feeling extremely dizzy. One moment he had been swirling down Tommy's throat with pizza and cola and the next he was practically in free-fall, violently ejected outwards into the blinding light.

As he regained focus he could see Tommy above him coughing and gasping, his mouth wide open. Mr. Smith stared at Tommy's mouth, the teeth visible behind the lips. He had barely survived his young neighbor's appetite and nearly went on a one way trip through the teenager's digestion system! It was terrifying and oddly humbling.

As he felt his senses return to normal and doing a quick mental check decided he was for the most part physically fine he stood up.

He decided to move away from the soggy pile of chewed food he had landed near, so as to be more noticeable to his massive neighbor.

---

Joe recovered from his initial shock and started patting Tommy on the back.

"Thanks." Tommy wheezed, his breathing returning to normal.

Joe looked at the pile of soggy chewed pizza, surrounded by a puddle of brown cola, on the linoleum floor.

"Ew, you gotta clean that up" he said making a face. Just before he looked away, Joe noticed a speck slowly moving away from the mess.

Joe tracked it with his eyes for a second. "Hey..." he murmured, "... Tommy you choked on a bug!"

With that Joe takes a step forward. Tommy's eyes locate it on the floor. "Huh?" he grunts.

Joe casually lifts his foot over the speck to crush it.

"Joe, WAIT!" Tommy shouts just before a loud smack echoes across the kitchen.
1121221122112211221212222211212111112.title: In Tommy's mouth a bit longer

choices: Try to communicate
Find somewhere secure for Mr. Smith and go get help
11212211221122112212122222112121111121.content:
Joe slowly turns his head to face Tommy. "Oh no." he whimpers.

Tommy inhales deeply. "Just don't move..." he says trying to sound confident. He lightly steps toward Joe, avoiding the mess of his chewed food.

"What should i do then?" Joe asks, panicked. Tommy frowns uncertainly "Just... Just lift up your foot a little bit... and... and I'll... um... look I guess" he stammers, his heart thudding in his chest.

Tommy leans down behind Joe's foot. "Okay be careful and lift it" he orders. Joe lifts the heel of his foot slowly. Tommy concentrates on the opening space. A strand of chewed pizza hangs from the shoe sole swinging. For a second it is the only thing moving. Then a speck begins rapidly moving out of the shadow.

"Don't move a muscle!" Tommy commands excitedly.

---

Mr. Smith had screamed in terror as the scene from his dream had become reality. Joe had lifted his filthy Airwalk over him, and without a moment's hesitation, the giant slammed his shoe down.

Time had slowed down as all at once Mr. Smith thought how the titanic teen was supposed to be looking for him, while also noticing the grime in his treads, while also remembering his nephew Zack whom he would never see again, for whom this entire ordeal had been orchestrated and Zack would never know. Just before the shoe made contact Mr. Smith thought "I'm a genius. This isn't fair." and then abruptly "My own fucking fault." Then the shoe crushed him into nothing.

Only he was still alive. Mr. Smith's ears rung and his body hurt from the deafening and jarring impact. But he was alive and in one piece. He laughed nervously as his mind rejoiced his survival. He was still trapped in darkness as Joe did not move his massive foot.

Mr. Smith realized a simple shift of the foot could abruptly end his celebration and he dared not move. Finally light appeared in the distance and the shoe sole slowly lifted upwards. Mr. Smith squinted in the flood of light. Ahead he could see Joe's shoe sole tilted upwards, strings of chewed pizza from Tommy's mouth hanging from the grimy tread. In the light he could see Tommy's face, full of concern.

Mr. Smith let out a whoop of joy and ran full speed towards the teenager's handsome face. As he ran recognition and joy glinted in Tommy's eyes and he shouted something that Mr. Smith failed to process. He did not slow down until he was clear of the shadow of Joe's shoe.

---

Tommy held out his finger to the speck of a man. Mr. Smith scaled it and Tommy brought his finger to his face. When his eyes focused on his tiny neighbor he could see that the man lay down flat, clinging to the fingertip. "Oh! Oops, sorry." he apologized, not realizing how jarring his movements were for the tiny man. His apologies however caused the tiny man to clasp his ears. Tommy lowered his voice and apologized again.

"I can't believe we found you..." Tommy said just above a whisper. He stared at the tiny man in wonder. It was incredible. Mr. Smith had survived nearly being squished by Joe... and almost being eaten by Tommy. For a moment Tommy tried to comprehend just how careless he and Joe had been with what seemed to be normal actions but had at the same time been life threatening for the tiny Mr. Smith.

Joe stared at the man on Tommy's finger unable to say anything; wave after wave of guilt assaulting him.

Tommy realized they were doing nothing. And clearly they had to do something.
11212211221122112212122222112121111121.title: Close call

11212211221122112212122222112121111122.content:
Joe whips his head towards Tommy but doesn't move his shoe.

"What?" he says sounding annoyed. "Are you trying to say that was your tiny neighbor?"

Tommy didn't say anything, his scared eyes shifting between Joe's face and his left shoe which was still planted in the same spot.

"It couldn't be him! It came from your food! You did NOT just almost eat your neighbor... how would he have even gotten there? It's not him." Joe finished his quick jumble of sentences sounding determined.

Tommy didn't reply immediately. He continues to look at Joe and his dirty Airwalk. Finally he replies, barely above a whisper "Then move your shoe."

Joe looks at his shoe, which he had been straining to keep in place. Jerking his left leg backwards, he keeps his balance by stepping on the tiptoes of his left foot.

"Wait! Don't move!" Tommy demands. "I'll look," he adds nervously.

Joe holds still obediently, balancing on the ball of his left foot.

Tommy leans down behind Joe and looks at the sole. The worn tread is crammed with darkened dirt and grime, as well as a flattened piece of gum. Nearer to the heel however he can see a red splatter, surrounded by crumbs from his mouthful of pizza.

Tommy cringes and lets out a strained breath.

"What?" Joe asks urgently. When Tommy doesn't reply Joe turns around, his shoe sole flattening out onto the floor and out of sight.

Tommy starts to protest before realizing it no longer matters.

"Joe..." Tommy trails off unable to form the words.

Joe stares at him, "No..." he whispers. His face contorts and then, to Tommy's surprise, morphs into anger.

"This was his fault! I didn't know! It was an accident! Why was he so tiny anyway?!" Joe paused before glaring at Tommy. "Besides, you almost ate him! So you're no Saint either" As Joe continued his voice was slowly rising and he was practically yelling at this point.

Tommy frowned and then felt himself become angry. "How the hell was I supposed to know?! You should have remembered we were about to start looking for a BUG-SIZED MAN!!!!" Tommy screamed at Joe, placing full blame on his friend for his neighbor's death.

Joe sputters, not forming any words. "BUG!!! SIZED!!! MAN!!!" Tommy repeats loudly, anger and sadness mixing together and being aimed at Joe.

Joe stares at Tommy, shock on his face. He then spins around. "Fuck you! FUCK YOU!!" he shouts running out of the house.

Tommy starts to follow, but upon hearing Joe's heavy footsteps he cannot bring himself to go on.

Tommy stares at the floor, trying to stifle tears, guilt, anger, and sadness threatening to overwhelm him.

Eventually he cleans up and goes home. He knows he cannot tell anyone, the story is too outrageous.

When the police come knocking about the missing Bryan Smith, Tommy can only tell them that the man had left him in charge of the house. His mother tells him that the man was something of a father figure for Tommy, so the police take what he says and do not come back. Naturally they have no leads.

When Joe tries to talk to Tommy at school a few days later, asking if he told anyone, Tommy glares at him and replies harshly "Of course not" before glancing at Joe's feet. The feet with the same Airwalks that had ended Mr. Smith.

"You're still wearing those?!" he asks incredulously, unable to keep calm. Joe stutters, "T..they're my only p...pair of sh...shoes."

Tommy stares at him in disbelief. "Fuck off" he says quietly and walks away.

Joe looks down at his shoes. He hadn't even looked at the sole since Tommy had. He wouldn't. He couldn't.

'It wasn't my fault' Joe began chanting in his head. It was the same chant he'd had since the other day at Mr. Smith's house. He walked down the hallway, trying to ignore the smack if his shoes hitting the floor.
11212211221122112212122222112121111122.title: Denial

112122112211221122121222221121211112.content:
“Yeah, you can have it. I’m not hungry anymore” Tommy sighed, pushing the napkin towards Joe.

Tommy stood up, “I’m gonna start looking, can you finish quickly and help me?”

Joe nodded as he finished his own slice off with a savage bite.

-----
Mr. Smith felt his heart drop as Tommy gave him away. As he left the kitchen Mr. Smith yelled “No Tommy! Don’t leave me! You’re my only chance!” But his pleas roused no reaction.

He heard a loud gulp behind him which sent a shiver down his spine. Mr. Smith turned in time to see a massive hand fly at him and snatch up the slice. Mr. Smith felt nauseous as the world went by in a blur. He stopped in front of Joe’s lips. The giant’s tongue appeared and caught some stray crumbs. Before Mr. Smith could react the mouth yawned open, the tongue shot forward and Joe took a bite of the slice.

Mr. Smith yelped in fear and winced but opened his eyes when he felt himself move backwards. He was still outside the mouth, still on the pizza.

“Joe!” he screamed, in yet a millionth attempt to get a titan’s attention. But Mr. Smith suddenly refocused on Joe’s mouth.

The young man lacked refined manners and often chewed with his mouth open. Mr. Smith was mesmerized and horrified by the sight. The lips parted and blurs of yellow shoved by the tongue could be seen just behind the teeth. When the jaws came together a sickening squish was heard. Mr. Smith watched unable to look away as Joe thoughtlessly obliterated his food.

He followed the jaw, up and down. Listened to the sounds as they became soggier. Watched the pizza become a disgusting blob. And suddenly the lips pursed and the familiar sound of swallowing was heard. Joe’s mouth gaped open and he stopped breathing. Mr. Smith realized what was happening too late. A deafening gale ripped from his throat. Mr. Smith coughed as the wall of stench hit him.

-----

As he chewed Joe imagined what he could be doing this afternoon. He could be shooting hoops or seeing a movie with a cute girl. But no. Instead he was helping Tommy search for his teeny neighbor. Joe didn’t even know the guy, why should he give up his afternoon for him. But he was willing to help his friend, at least for a few hours. If they didn’t find anything by then, he was done.

When he swallowed he felt some pressure in his chest. He let out a loud burp that made him proud. He was disappointed no one was around to hear it…

His mind moved on and Joe took another bite from the slice of pizza, savoring the rich flavor of cheese, pepperoni, and grease.

-----

Mr. Smith screamed again as Joe’s mouth opened again. Chewed chunks of pizza were spread across the tongue and jammed into his jagged teeth. The pizza shot forward as the tongue extended to catch it’s next victim.

“Noooooo!” Mr. Smith wailed as Joe’s teeth came together.

His world erupted into chaos. He felt himself thrown about and prayed he wouldn’t end up between the teeth. Light flashed through the cavern and he saw blurry glimpses of his kitchen. He could see flashes of teeth coming together and bits of pizza raining everywhere. The sight was like being in a horrible nightmare. He felt jealous of Joe. For the giant it was a simple snack. For him, it was a disgusting, chaotic, and deadly ride.

When the movement finally stopped Mr. Smith sighed in relief. He was still in one piece, and had managed not to puke. But his celebration was short lived. In less than a second Joe moved the slice to the back of his mouth. Mr. Smith managed to barely cry out as he was shoved down the throat and disappeared into the abyss.

He sat in disbelief as he was massaged down the esophagus with the pizza. He had been swallowed alive by a teenage boy. He gasped as, along with the food, he was dumped into the stomach. With a splat he joined the pile of chewed pizza in Joe’s stomach.

“no… No… NO… NO!!!” he wailed. “I can’t die in some teenager’s stomach like a piece of food!”

As he screamed in anger, Mr. Smith failed to notice the grinding sounds above him. As his shouts of fury quickly turned to sobs of despair he still didn’t notice the sound of a gulp. Only when the food reached the entrance to the stomach did he look up.

He gasped as the food slammed into him from above. It buried him and all the weight at the top of the mountain of chewed food caused an avalanche within the stomach. Mr. Smith was knocked out as the food settled with him near the bottom. He never awoke.

-----

None of this reached Joe after he chewed and swallowed the last piece. He didn’t feel the shifting mountain in his stomach. He didn’t even think about the food sitting inside him awaiting digestion as he half-heartedly searched Mr. Smith’s house. By the time he left to go home, his stomach had started digestion. But as usual Joe ignored it. He didn’t notice the gurgles emitting from his belly. He was completely unconscious of the food being churned and torn apart in his gut. He had all but forgotten the meal as he stared at the television that night, his stomach moving the final remains to the next step in digestion.

In spite of the horrible occurrence that had happened deep within his body, Joe didn’t give that pizza another thought. For him it had been just another uneventful meal, just another slice of pizza, just another piece of food, and nothing would ever make him realize otherwise.
112122112211221122121222221121211112.title: Just a slice of pizza

11212211221122112212122222112121112.content:
Mr. Smith looked up when the pizza suddenly halted.

"Yes!" he shouted, "I'm right here! Tommy, look down!"

-----

Tommy stared at the slice, still frowning at the thought of Jessica crushing poor Mr. Smith. However his eyes didn't really see as his mind considered and tried to deny that possibility.

"Well the only way to find out if you're right or not is to look," Tommy finally said decisively.

Joe looked up, a string of cheese hanging from his lips. He took a moment to swallow before replying.

"Whatever, I can look for an hour or two. But they're having a 'That 70's Show' marathon at 4," he replied seriously. With that he popped the rest of the slice into his mouth. He stood up, but stopped and turned.

"Hey when you're done, can I have this for the marathon?" Joe asked pointing at the pizza.

Tommy rolled his eyes. "Sure, whatever. You pretty much ruined my appetite with the crushing comment."

"Awesome" replied Joe with a grin. He closed the box and stored it in the fridge for safekeeping until he left.

"I guess I'll look in the living room while you finish," said Joe with a shrug. He disappeared through the door to the living room.

Tommy brought the slice to his mouth. As he took a bite, his eyes scanned the kitchen, looking for some sign of his minuscule neighbor.

-----

"Tommy!" Help me! I'm right here!" Mr. Smith screamed. But Tommy's eyes while seeming to look right at him, showed no sign of recognition.

While Joe stood and spoke with Tommy, Mr. Smith continued to try to slog through the cheese. His throat stung from the constant screaming, and his legs were sore from fighting through the thick cheese and sauce with so little progress. He stopped and looked up at Tommy’s face. He knew his predicament was near hopeless. Here he was a mere speck on a teenaged boy’s food, covered in sauce and indiscernible from the rest of the slice.

He felt the slice move under his feet. The giant’s eyes focused elsewhere as Mr. Smith and the pizza floated upwards, specifically towards the giant’s mouth.

“Tommy, no! Don’t eat me!” Mr. Smith pleaded.

His plea went unnoticed, as had all the others before it.

Tommy’s mouth widened and his tongue seemed to quiver in anticipation of the food. Mr. Smith could see the chewed remains of his previous bite still littered across the tongue and jammed into his straight, white teeth. The uvula hung over the entrance to a black hole in the back: the throat. The point of no return… his unwilling destination.

“Tommy! Please hear me! I’m on your pizza! DON’T EAT ME!!” screeched the tiny man. He struggled to move, to do something to prevent his obvious fate. His panicked mind struggled to find a solution. But as he passed between the lips and the wave of stench and humidity hit him, he knew there was none.

Tommy had gone from a beacon of salvation to a monster of destruction. Before Mr. Smith could let out another plea for help, Tommy’s teeth came together and with a rip sealed Mr. Smith and the slice of pizza inside his mouth.

-----
Tommy stood as he started to chew. He scanned the counters for any sort if movement. He sincerely wanted to help out his tiny neighbor who had been so kind to him over the years. He couldn’t begin to imagine what the world would seem like at that size. How hard it would be to get around. How easily someone it would be to be overlooked or mistaken for a bug and be crushed… Tommy grimaced at the thought, and continued searching while trying to remain positive.

-----
Mr. Smith screamed uncontrollably. Not for attention but from pure terror. He was being thrown about in pitch blackness. All around him was the sloshing and crushing sounds of pizza being annihilated. He knew he had to avoid the monstrous teeth, but he couldn’t see or much less control where he went. He felt a sharp pain in his back and for a moment panicked that he was about to be crushed. But he had bounced of the side of a molar and smacked face down into a slimy and wet surface. He took it to be Tommy’s tongue and grasped as tightly as he could, while more food rained down.

Finally it all stopped. Mr. Smith looked around in the sudden calm, but he was still unable to see. He felt the tongue move again and heard the squelch as Tommy swallowed the bulk of the pizza in his mouth. Mr. Smith sighed in relief, overjoyed to not have gone with it. He decided to yell out again and inhaled sharply. However he coughed on the stale air.

Light flooded the cavern again. Mr. Smith squinted as his eyes adjusted. He looked straight up to see a molar towering above him, a bit of cheese hanging off the side. To his right was the opening to the mouth. He could see still more chinks of food across the tongue. But beyond the lips he saw the world he once knew.

Though simply his kitchen counters he felt a sharp pang of regret. He wished he could undo all of this, and be safe and normal sized. A yellow plain dotted with red circles obscured his view. The pizza moved closer as Tommy prepared to finish the slice. Mr. Smith felt defeated. A tear rolled down his cheek as the pizza was shoved in. He gave no effort to scream as the light waned and the lips came together again.

-----

With his hands free of the pizza, Tommy began to gingerly lift up appliances to see if Mr. Smith had taken refuge beneath them. As he swallowed the bite he had just taken, Tommy felt more energized. He wouldn’t stop searching until he found Mr. Smith. With a renewed determination, Tommy smiled and continued to search.

-----

Mr. Smith hadn’t screamed when he was again surrounded by the sounds of chewing. He didn’t make a sound as he was swept to the middle of the mouth. When he was roughly forced into the titan’s throat he didn’t even grunt. As he sank deeper into the giant’s body he sat, frozen and in shock at his predicament. His only thought was that of regret and disbelief.

Mr. Smith, along with the pizza, were squeezed into the stomach. With a splat Mr. Smith’s island connected with the rest of the pizza Tommy had already swallowed. As he fell Mr. Smith snapped out of his inaction.

The sight of soggy chewed pizza sitting in the stomach and his fall had made him furious. Even more than that. He was a human being, an extremely smart one at that. He didn’t deserve to die unnoticed in some teenager’s gut with a pizza snack!

An animal like cry sounded from him. “NO! I DON’T DESERVE THIS! WHY ME?! I’VE DONE NOTHING WRONG!!” He ran around alternately stomping and beating at the stomach wall. Its gentle pulsing that didn’t respond to him seemed to mock him. This only made Mr. Smith more angry.

“DAMMIT TOMMY, HEAR ME!! I’M IN YOUR DAMNED STOMACH!!” he bellowed. He suddenly tripped over a bit of pizza.

He started to sob uncontrollably. “It’s not fair!!” he wailed. He heard a squelch and stomach acid began to pool around the hill of chewed pizza. Mr. Smith scrambled up the slope to avoid it. But he slipped on the soggy pizza and landed head first on a “ledge” of pizza. The blunt-force trauma knocked tiny Mr. Smith out.

-----

Tommy searched the kitchen and moved to the master bedroom. He walked carefully and reminded Joe to watch his step. Even after Joe left he continued to search. He was so focused on his search he didn’t notice how loud his stomach was as it churned and broke down the food from earlier. Finally late into the night Tommy’s mother came over and demanded he come home, unable to understand why he had stayed at the empty house so long.

Tommy’s shoulders sagged, but he didn’t try to explain to his mother. He knew she wouldn’t believe him.

“You’re probably starving! Have you eaten anything? I’ll whip something up when we get home,” she said.

Tommy nodded. He was hungry again, not having eaten anything since the pizza. He decided he would return the next morning after a good night’s sleep and breakfast. He would keep looking. He wouldn’t give up until he found Mr. Smith.

Between their chatter about a new video game, the chomping and greedy gulps struck Mr. Smith with ice fear. He was unable to tear his eyes as he watched each boy lift a slice to their wide open mouth and outstretched tongue. Piece by piece more of the pizza would disappear into their gaping maws.

Mr. Smith, horrified by this display, only fought harder against the thick cheese.

---

"Dude the graphics--" Joe paused to swallow "--are freaking epic!".

Tommy took another bite of his slice and nodded his head, "I know, Since Mr. Smith payed me I can afford it, I just need to go to the mall."

"We could go now..." Joe trailed off before popping the last piece of his pizza into his mouth.

Tommy gave him an annoyed look "No, we're gonna look for Mr. Smith when we're done!" he replied forcefully.

Tommy cut him off "It's just a game, I can wait..." however his voice betrayed his hesitation.

---

Mr. Smith's legs were quickly giving out, unable to be under such strain for so long. He could hear the giants discussing leaving for a game. Though hurt that a game could take priority over finding him, he hoped if they left he would be able to escape the pizza unharmed. He felt a jarring tremor and turned his head in fear. At the crust he could see a set of long, rough fingers grasping at the slice he was trapped on. Joe pulled the slice out of the box turning Mr. Smith's world into dizzying chaos. He cried out, tears streaming down his face, "Joe! Help me, please don't eat me!!"

---

"Let's just head off now, then we can get back sooner to look for him. Maybe it would give him time to get into a good spot to be found faster!" Joe suggested.

Tommy swallowed as he weighed his options.

11212211221122112212122222112121121.content:

Joe shrugged "Yeah, I guess we're his best chance for safety, huh?" With that he lifted the slice to his mouth and took a huge bite.

---

Mr. Smith stared up at Joe. The massive teenager had nearly taken him in with the first bite. He chewed with his mouth open, the obnoxious squishes and flashes of soggy food only served to deepen Mr. Smith's terror. While he admired Tommy's loyalty, he couldn't help but wonder what it would have meant for his fate had they left. He wasn't left with time to think as a loud gulp sounded in front of him. He had been so shocked by the bite and lost in thought, he hadn't moved at all!

"No! JOE WAIT!!" he screamed as the island of pizza moved beneath him. The giant however paid no attention to the screaming speck on his food. As his mouth widened, his tongue shot forward. Mr. Smith shuddered in disgust at the bits of cheese, bread, and pepperoni that clung to the tongue. Though mere remnants of the bite that had existed seconds ago, most were at least equal in size to the tiny man.

'That's all I am' Mr. Smith thought sadly. 'No bigger than a chewed crumb on some teenager's tongue'. Joe's breath was a wall of humidity that reeked of cheesy pizza. Mr. Smith gagged as he struggled to grasp his situation. Here he was a world leading scientist being eaten by his neighbor's buddy, unnoticed on a slice of pizza. All his intellect was worthless at the appetite of a young man.

Deep in thought he entered the mouth in silence. Joe's teeth came together sealing Mr. Smith in darkness for a moment. But as Joe began to chew his lips parted and Mr. Smith finally screamed as he was flung about randomly with the food being chewed.

---

Joe thought about the game he had just bought and how much he wanted to play right now as he chewed. But Tommy was right they should try to find the scientist guy. But he wasn't gonna try too long, if the guy wanted to be found he better make it easy!

Tommy stood up. "I'm gonna start in the living room okay?" He walked towards the doorway out of the kitchen. He spun around "And watch your step," he warned before staring intently at the floor as he left.

Joe wondered if the tiny man would be fast enough to dodge one of their feet. He felt something chewy between his molars and bit down harder, feeling a bit of juice trickle down his teeth. 'Good pepperoni' he thought briefly before swallowing and popping the last piece into his mouth. He stood up as he chewed and began scanning the kitchen wondering where he should look first.

The chip remains motionless for a few seconds, though it feels like an eternity as Mr. Smith stares ahead in fear. Finally the chip abruptly moves forward. "No! WAIT! YOU ALREADY FOUND ME!" Bryan screams in despair as the chip falls to the tongue. The lips seal out any light and a deafening crunch shatters the chip supporting him.

"NOOOOOOOOOOOO!!" the giant's nearly unrecognizable whispers sound more like the winds of a tornado from inside the mouth. "What are you doing!" Bryan sobs in confusion as the crunches of chewing surround him. Was this an extremely cruel joke? Was the massive boy pretending to eat him, and at the same time just happened to be actually eating him? Bryan didn't know, but these possibilities only made things worse.

"PLEASE DON'T EAT ME!" he screams in terror, unintentionally echoing Joe's words from moments before.

A giant hand, aiming right for him.

112122112211221122122112111.content:
The instant of relief at the discovery that he had hitched a ride as an unseen passenger in the cuff of Tommy jeans turned to dismay when the titanic teenager let his jeans drop and then handed them off to his busy mother for a spin through the washing machine.

The simple exchange represented massive repercussions for the bug-sized scientist. His world erupted into a maelstrom of motion and sound, brought to a bone-snapping halt when he made a soft impact inside a large yellow plastic laundry basket.

Sprawled like a dropped rag-doll on a vast surface of white cotton, the little man tried to inhale air into his lungs as he stared up at Tommy’s huge form as the teenager loomed large over the basket.

Tiny Mr. Smith heard Tommy’s mother thank her son.

“No problem,” Tommy said. “I’ll be in my room.”

The little man tried to command his muscles to move, but the ordeal had left him momentarily stunned. He started to cry out Tommy’s name when the teenager’s mother dropped her son’s jeans into the basket.

Fate smiled then on the tiny man. Looking at the time on the clock on the laundry room wall, she decided to leave the laundry until after she prepared dinner.

She turned off the light and pulled the door closed as she left.


He had endured so much, but he seemed destined for an even greater ordeal. The room had gone silent and still. Some light filtered through a small window, casting everything in a gray gloom.

The shrunken scientist groaned and sat up. “Where the hell am I now?”

He smelled an intense, rank odor and felt a dank moistness beneath him. Processing the available clues, he realized with some disgust that he had landed atop one of Tommy’s sweat-drenched socks.

Crawling as best as he could, the tiny man tried to remove himself from the immediate vicinity of the stinking sock. A heavy canopy of denim covered the basket, the result of Tommy’s mother adding the jeans.

As he moved across an uneven surface, he left the damp sock fabric. His head still ached, and his only immediate goal was to escape the reeking sock. His efforts soon left him exhausted. He eased onto his stomach and noticed he had come to rest facing a large square with numbers almost as big as his body. He read the words “100% Cotton, Size Medium.”

He had left the socks only to meander across a pair of Tommy’s worn briefs. Staring at the label, the scientist felt the jarring recognition of his current insignificance.

The realization took a lower priority than another concern. He needed to get himself free of the basket of a teenager’s laundry and try again to communicate with Tommy.

It felt like hours as the tiny man scrambled over each hill of fabric, trying not to think about how tiny he was compared to a pair of briefs. Suddenly, a slope of dirty white material took over, looking like an avalanche of snow over the red fabric of the briefs.

Bigger than a few city blocks, it was the last obstacle of laundry till the end of the basket. It still seemed to penetrate, and just as Bryan reached the end, he began gagging from the odor.

He looked around for a better way down than the sock.

Barbara sighed as she took off her oven mitts and untied her apron. It had been a long day of work, which included preparing breakfast, sweeping out the kitchen,, watering the indoor plants, preparing dinner, and... Laundry. "I almost forgot the laundry!" She thought tepidly.

With a swift whack, she swept off the remaining flour on her sleeves and hurried to the laundry room. Tommy always seemed to accumulate lots of laundry, and coupled with her older son, it meant a lot of work for her. Entering the small tiled room, she reached for the sizable basket, when she noticed a sock that had slipped off.

Before she could even reach for it, Barbara nearly dropped the basket in shock. A tiny scurrying creature revealed itself from under the dingy sock. "A bug!" Her vain voice wailed. Barbara was terrified of insects, and she knew that where there was one, there were more in the shadows. The thought made her skin crawl, and the continued sight of the horrific invader was sickening.

Setting down the laundry, she rushed from the room frantically, bent on having this dealt with before it became a problem.
1121221122112211221221121111.title: Spotted

choices: Nathan begrudingly takes the job
Tommy reluctantly takes the job
11212211221122112212211211111.content:
"Wait! WAIT!" Bryan cried at the huge woman.

Her eyes bulged with terror, locked onto tiny Bryan's form. The basket of dirty laundry he had just escaped from was cradled in her arms. It was obvious her overreaction from spotting the tiny man was far less than what he felt upon seeing her. The screech of terror and the declaration of "a bug" made the shrunken man more frightened than she could ever be.

"Stop...!" He faltered, unable to remember the woman's name. "...Just hold on! I'm not a bug!" Bryan loped towards the gigantic woman, trying vainly to make himself known as something other than an insect.

She never gave him that chance. Instead, she let out another shriek and tossed the laundry basket upon a nearby table. Bryan's ears rang painfully as the foolish woman fled the room with thunderous result. He bolted for her desperately.

"Please! I'm not a bug, I'm a man! Help meee!"

Her skirt swished around the doorway and she was gone, easily outpacing the insect-sized man. The tiny man stood there dumbfounded, incredulous at his own misfortune.

Only on the select few occasions had Bryan visited his teenaged neighbour's home. One of those visits he encountered Tommy's mother. She seemed very flustered, and busy. Her hair reminiscent of an out-dated beehive over a lined but kindly face. A typical single mother, overall. This seemed rather moot at the moment, since the woman not only failed to recognize him but had mistaken him for a bug!

She most likely wasn't going to hide under her bed covers either, Bryan figured. He needed to relocate himself before she returned to purge him. Voices and rumbling activity outside the room only exemplified this thought.

His body sore and bruised, he forced himself into cover underneath the washing machine and waited.

---

"Tommy!" Barbara cupped her hands to yell from the base of the stairs. No reply answered her repeated cries.

Goose pimples began creeping over her arms. She dared a nervous glance back to the hallway leading from the living room, searching for any skittering shapes upon the floor.

"Ohh!" She moaned. "Toooommmy! Come down here right now!"

This time heavy footsteps sounded in response to her pleas and her son came pounding down the steps.

Barbara's eldest son Nathan quickly descended the staircase, finishing the last step with a casual leap. He was fully dressed, looking as if he was going out. "What's all the shouting about, huh? Thought the freaking house was on fire or somthin'." Nathan attempted to passed her, but halted when she grabbed his arm.

His typical sass was reminiscent of her husband. She bit her lip. "Worse, oh my, much worse!" Pausing for dramatic effect. "There is a disgusting bug in the laundry room, crawling around and breeding!"

Nathan sighed and tried to lean away, his face clearly showing his opinion.

"Honey, be a sweet and get rid of it, won't you?" Lightly prodding her son, she stood slightly taller than his shoulder yet managed to direct his attention to the darkened laundry room.

Suddenly, Tommy appeared at the railing atop the stairs.

"What? What is going on? What're you all yelling for?" He questioned with a hint of impatience. He looked his two family members over, his mind still tormenting over the loss of Mr. Smith.

Barbara repeated the harrowing tale, her voice cracking when recounting her narrow escape. "It was in the laundry!" She finished, glancing between both of her visibly annoyed sons. Tommy looking oddly overwhelmed, while Nathan rolled his eyes still in his mother's hold.

"We all live here, the least you two could do is get rid of a single pest!" This was almost a weekly occurrence. Anything from an ant to a tiny moth sent their mother into a flurry of terrified shrieks.

112122112211221122122112111111.content:
Nathan twisted his lips grimly. His buddies had called and were probably waiting for him to arrive. He just wanted to go.

"Fuc-... I mean, fine. I'll stomp the stupid bug!"

His mother tore her gaze from Tommy and gave the eldest son a bright smile. "Thank goodness!" Releasing her impressively steel grip, she leaned in closer with a now serious expression. "There... In the laundry room! It nearly knocked me over when it attacked!" Barbara pointed with a trembling finger, sniffling indignantly.

Tommy remained motionless above. His expression was blank and his eyes glazed like marbles. Nathan glanced up and grunted. "Yeah, no problem little bro! I'll get the big bad bug for you and mom!" The sarcasm seemed to jolt his younger brother back to earth, which made Nathan grin until Tommy left without saying a word. "Weird fucker..." Nathan muttered under his breath, careful of his mother's hearing.

"Dear! It is probably crawling about and breeding in my laundry!"

She gave her first-born a nudge and cautiously followed behind his large form towards the laundry room.

---

Meanwhile, Bryan had huddled himself under the safety offered by the washing machine. Underneath it was spacious enough for Bryan the comfortably stand with more than 10 feet to spare. Bryan felt especially insecure. His only company being some large dust bunnies, crumbs, and a long forgotten sock stuffed farther back.

To his dismay, he though he heard some skittering noises in the inky depths.

"God... Please... Let Tommy come and find me! I'm begging of you..." The trembling bug-man prayed.

He had never been particularly religious, but felt it was his last resort at this point. Peering out from under his cover, Bryan was offered a perfect view of the humongous floor. It seemed to stretch on for miles until ending in a lofty closet. To his left, the doorway that Barbara had fled through led out into the rest of the family's home.

The dull voices from outside seemed to subside slightly, causing his ears to prick up like a cat. There had clearly been Barbara's shrill vocals, followed by two male voices - one Bryan had been certain belonged to his beloved Tommy!

Bryan opened his mouth to once more vocalize his thoughts when he was interrupted. The dim room suddenly burst brightly with a loud click!

"Tommy?" He squeaked. "Tommy! Is that you? Help me!"

Running into the open, Bryan froze at the stranger looming in the doorway. He gawked up at the strange giant's face, his face gaping like a confused gazelle. "Who the hell!" This giant was not Tommy; and not somebody tiny Mr. Smith wanted to interact with! Bigger, with a distinctly angry look - this behemoth could only be one person.

"The older brother..." His brain regurgitated memories of Tommy's older sibling. "...Nathan!"

He resembled Tommy: similar but shaggy and messier hair, and the same brows and nose. It all ended there. Nathan was anything but the nice and cordial boy that Tommy was. Impatient, rude, and dishonest as well - Bryan found him to be a big bully to his younger brother.

"LET'S GET THIS OVER WITH." Nathan thundered, scanning the room with bored eyes. "WHERE IS IT?"

Bryan suddenly went cold again. This was terrible! Nathan was here to stomp him like a fucking insect!

"No! No, no! I'm a man; your neighbour! Bry-..."

BOOM.

His pleas were cut off as the giant took a step into the room. Nathan's immense girth made the previously lofty space seem the cramped utility room it really was. Bryan wasted not a second more, scrambling back towards the washing machine.

BOOOOM.

The floor trembled with each monumental step the titan took into the room. Bryan felt like the bug he was accused of being, hiding in the shadows of the gigantic appliance. He truly was nothing but a tiny invader in their home - regardless of his wanting to be here. Nathan thundered again, his voice too low and muttled for Bryan to make out.

Outside of his shelter, the bug-sized man could see Nathan's colossal sneakers crashing down at random. The trashed black and grey DCs were fraying and caked with dirt. Bryan watched one nearest him lift off the floor, emitting a sticky squelch, and slam down heavily. The tan rubber tread was so worn, that little tread remained around the toe and heel region of the sole.

He realized with a gulp, that anything underneath would most certainly be reduced to paste!

---

"I don't see it!"

Nathan shifted back and forth in the room, glancing around the floor for any small shapes. "Just give me the spray and I will coat the place real quick."

He scratched his neck impatiently, listening to his mother clatter to the kitchen. Working all morning long, and he was being forced into bug duty. Again. His cell phone rattled, signaling yet another text from his friends.

Suddenly...
112122112211221122122112111111.title: Bug Duty

1121221122112211221221121111111.content:
The washing machine underside was both spacious and safe for tiny Bryan. He watched from under this mountainous appliance, sharply gasping with every jolting quake as Tommy's older brother moved around the room.

Why was this happening? How could it have happened? Bryan had been so careful in his planning! He would be having a much-needed cry right now if he wasn't so damn scared.

"What is he doin-..." Bryan's body lurched, bones and teeth clacking. One tattered sneaker slammed against the ground, grimy and gritty against the flooring to a nearly deafening degree. Tones of powerful speech could he heard from high above as Nathan angrily complained the bug was nowhere to be seen. Bryan goaded his doubts on with squeaky fervor.

"MOM, I CAN'T WASTE MY TIME AGAIN WITH THIS..." Again? Bryan thought. It was ludicrous to imagine that this terrifying experience was literally nothing but normal for them. How many tiny creatures had been through this? Hiding in this very spot? Mindless insects that they were - but, Bryan was considered no better at this point.

The titan stood stationary, his back facing the two machines, and thundered again at his mother. Underneath the appliance, Bryan was afforded only a view of the lower-half of the massive skate shoes planted in the distance. The steely two-toned suede worn and marked like long forgotten battleships left to rust. Stretched across the frayed surface was a DC logo in high contrast of neon green turned brownish with use. Right now, it was easily the most harrowing thing Bryan could imagine.

Pattering out for a closer look at the goings-on, Bryan gazed up the looming column that was Nathan's right leg. Just this one appendage was so big. Tiny Bryan had no chance against the entire monstrous being that was his beloved neighbour's older brother.

"If only I could..." Imagining himself flying away, the bug-sized man looked airy when he spotted movement upon the massive skyscraper-sized leg. "What the fuck?"

It was indeed movement. Barely visible against the faded black denim mountain, was a brave mountain climber of a spider. It tittered along looming folds, vanishing and appearing again as it descended - all while the oblivious behemoth grumbled high above. A professional couldn't have done it better, as the eight-legged creature slid, dropped, and descended the towering length of pant-leg. George Mallory would be rolling in his grave right now if he knew Bryan's admiration for the spider.

Reaching the hem - a terribly worn, jagged, mess of frayed denim barely covering the equally worn shoe - the intrepid spider quickly dropped down past the large logo and past the discoloured sole nearly thrice the creature's height. Now on the massive plane of flooring, the spider planned to finish the adventure by escaping to safety. But, Bryan knew better.

He shouted a vain warning at the foolhardy creature. It was terrifying. Eight legs and all, but he had developed an admiration for it, and didn't want it to fall after stowing away so bravely.

No such luck.

"HUH?" Bryan attempted to gape upwards, but realized his own safety might be in jeopardy and scampered back to cover. Without warning, the giant moved, his huge DC suddenly shifting, nearly crashing upon the spider as it did. "THERE IT IS... GOT IT."

The callous tone of the distant statement struck Bryan like a brick wall. He looked to the fleeing arachnid. Running, fighting, moving forward at seemingly break-neck speed, all in order to survive. Nathan - so powerful; so huge; so far *above* this simple spider. He never thought twice about obliterating it.

The mountain of suede and rubber creaked, groaned, and stretched. Nathan's unfathomably huge foot moving inside as it always did, but this time with a purpose. It lifted off the floor, revealing a tan coloured tread that spanned enough space for a residential development. It was nearly worn flat at the toe. Bare hints of the capsule-shaped grooves were visible, some clogged with dark gunk, dirt, pebbles, among other things he couldn't identify. Bryan squeaked fruitlessly as Nathan's sneaker loomed over the doomed spider. Landing with a powerful thud, the spider vanished from view.

Seconds passed, and the huge grimy footwear began dragging backwards. Deafening squeaks and grinds blasted tiny Bryan as he steadied himself. He was awe-struck by such casual power and cruelty. In disbelief, he just stared at the sneaker as it lifted once more, exposing the terrifying tread to the minuscule world once more, rotated, and crashed down. Pulverized bits of the spider were pasted to the worn sole, while the carapace was left behind in a grisly mound of guts. The other followed suit, slamming down heavily.

Finished with his task, Nathan turned and pounded towards the door. Unknowingly leaving behind the real "pest" and not the one he himself carried inside from his own disorderly room. A loud *CLICK!* and the room went dark.

A tiny speck under the washing machine watched Nathan leave. Bryan was lost for words, and more importantly, devoid of any hope. "That could have been me!" He felt a twinge of sorrow for the unlucky spider, but preferred the current outcome. It could have been him! A moment was needed to calm his tiny heartbeat. That spider had been far larger than himself, and it stood less than zero chance. How the hell was he going to do any better? "This... This is a disaster. I need to just hide and get out of here!" Liking that idea, he still remained hidden until all noise and activity went quiet.

Then he padded out in to the open...

After a terrifying fall broken by the very rank sock he detested, Bryan found himself utterly surrounded by it. It canopied overhead spaciously like a stadium, a grotesque humidity beginning to form. Bryan quickly exited via fold reduced to crawling as he sucked in the fresh air. It was then that he heard...

"It escaped! To breed, and spread its spawn all over my house!" She shrieked at Tommy, who looked un-amused, and annoyed. "I am calling an exterminator!"

Barbara made quick work in dialing up Eric, a local exterminator she often phoned to deal with "infestations". He nicely agreed to come over to the house the next day to deal with the bugs, and preform a full sweep.

Barbara bustled about, jumping at every shadow, and swearing she felt insects crawling on her. Nathan shrugged off her warnings and decided to visit the local bar in the meantime.

-------------

During all this dangerous commotion, Bryan made it from the laundry room, which was fortunately near the living room, in search of Tommy. He stayed along the moulding, hoping to avoid attention from Tommy's frantic mother.

Bryan dashed to the side when Tommy's humongous sneaker crashed down as the gigantic teen grabbed his coat. "Tommy! Don't leave, please! No!" The tiny scientist yelled. He wanted to chase him, but the titanic teenager's massive steps easily outpaced the bug-sized man. Despair washed over him as he watched Tommy, his only hope, leave the house with his frantic parent.

The ground shuddered again. Bryan found himself stumbling back to the massive wall as Nathan stomped nearby, his dirty socked feet sending shockwaves with each step. With a superficial gag, Bryan recognized the sock as the one he was climbing over. The oblivious giant lumbered over to a pair of ratty DC skate shoes, slipped them on and left the house too.

Unaware of what was to come, Bryan decided to rest in a slight crevice in the moulding. He fell right asleep on the rough, hard surface from exhaustion.

Getting out of his white pick-up truck, Eric shouldered a large tank of insect toxins and grabbed his toolbox. His heavy work boots clomped loudly as he approached the door, and proceeded inside.

The living room looked clean enough, no outward signs of an infestation. Eric shrugged, dropping his toolbox to the ground heavily. Exterminating bugs was an easy job, and Eric never had any problems doing it. His clients were usually scared housewives like Barbara who called him to deal with a minor ant infestation, which he was only glad to take care of. Popping in some earbuds, he prepared to being spraying.

Unbeknownst to him, his powerful presence woke a particularly tiny creature on the other side of the room.

-----------

Loud thumping noises woke Bryan with a start. His eyes were crusted with sleep. Another loud noise accompanied by tremors shook him out of his sleepy state.

"Tommy...?" Bryan muttered as he looked out over the vast living room terrain. A huge man stood on the other end of the room, he looked unfamiliar to Bryan. A short buzzed haircut, and a strong masculine face gave the massive stranger a very intimidating look. He wore thick denim jeans, a grey t-shirt, and work boots. When the giant moved, powerful vibrations rattled the floor.

Suddenly, the mysterious titan turned to reveal a gargantuan canister strapped to his muscled back. "An exterminator!" Bryan exclaimed with dread. His colour drained as the gigantic man began spraying the baseboard with chemicals.

"Why is there an exterminator?!" The tiny scientist wondered, when the realization hit him. Barbara. The frantic woman called an exterminator! Bryan's luck had gone from bad to worse. Everything about this behemoth scared him, especially those massive work boots. He was trapped, and alone, this guy was his only option.

What could he do?

112122112211221122122112111122.content:
Bryan shot back into consciousness with a start. A calamity of noise broke the silence of the house. Loud thundering footsteps rumbled through the floor.

"Tommy?" The tiny man questioned to himself. His arms felt weak as he pulled himself up in order to get a look.

Effectively blocking what he desired to see was an armchair. Rather ugly with a pea green floral pattern held up by dated oak legs. Bryan ventured out of his tiny haven in order to get a better view when suddenly he saw.

An enormous stranger appeared across the vast living room. His long legs were clad in light coloured baggy work jeans. A grey T-shirt emblazoned with a logo, and pair of heavy work boots on his feet. The humongous man carried a heavy toolbox, which he set upon the ground with thunderous result.

Bryan gulped timidly as he squinted in an attempt to discover the identity of this huge stranger.The giant lifted the lid of his toolbox and began rummaging around, Bryan noted many objects he pulled out; A pair of gloves, flashlight, and a few unidentifiable boxes. His eyes then drifted to a sizable container set near where the man stood. The sight of it sent a shiver down his spine, a sticker that stated "TOXIC" with a skull was stamped on the visible side.

"What the...?" Bryan said with a curious leer. "Is that-... Insect spray!"

Dread immediately filled his tiny form when he realized what he was looking at. This man was an exterminator! "An gigantic one at that!" He cried, stating the obvious aloud.

Somehow his situation had gotten worse. Much worse.

"I am smaller than most bugs!" The introduction of this new, terrifying giant meant certain doom for the shrunken scientist. "I have to get his attention!" He wondered if the offending insects realized their certain doom. The sheer enormity of this behemoth made him a danger, but equipped with toxins, he was as good as any apocalypse.

As Bryan was coming to his realizations and stating them aloud to himself, something was approaching from behind. Crawling on six strong legs, an ant the size of an automobile, just as dangerous as the huge exterminator in it's own right, crept steadily towards the unaware scientist.

Everything seemed set for the little man. He had just been finalizing his meager, and rather foolhardy plan when he detected disturbing noises from behind.

The ant fell upon him swiftly, giving the shrunken man no more than a second to squeal in protest. Bryan blacked out from terror at the mere sight of the ant's terrifying mandibles clashing together. Lifting the minuscule form easily for transport, the thoughtless insect quickly skittered away, ignoring the towering giant that had already begun his work far across the room.

Bryan's unconscious mind convinced itself that he had been killed. He had always been frightened by insects to an embarrassing extent. This minor fear was now transformed into a reality as he was carted away by the monster-sized ant.

Intent on returning to the hive with its prey, the ant raced along the baseboard.

1121221122112211221221121111222.content:
Twisting and writhing proved futile for tiny Bryan who was held prisoner by the ant.

The ant carried him with remarkably strong mandibles. He was held firmly, yet not enough to cause any injury which surprised him. What did this monstrous insect have planned? Bryan attempted to wriggle some more, even going so far as to antagonize the beast by beating his fists upon the creature's head. He finally resigned himself to wait for an opportunity.

Bryan was able to examine his environment. Craning his neck, from his awkward position, he tried to determine where he was being taken. He had only been in Tommy's home a few select times. The frighteningly large space around him was anything but what he recalled of the family's small suburban house

The floor had changed from the pale blue tangle of carpet in the living room to a flat spread of hardwood flooring. Recognition clicked, the ant was carrying Bryan towards the kitchen! Terrible thoughts of what awaited him stirred his mind. Was he being taken to the nest? Would he be torn limb from limb by a mob of the giant ants? Or perhaps he would be given to the queen ant?

His face showed a ghastly image of terror at these thoughts, despite their ridiculous nature.

The shrunken man had been frightened by the behemoth of an exterminator, and what might befall him should he be mistaken for a bug again. Now he was unsure which fate seemed preferable. Being torn apart and eaten, or poisoned and crushed? All these thoughts spurred feelings of panic. Bryan had never once thought of any repercussions that shrinking may cause.

Yet here he was, captured by a common ant, while a gigantic exterminator stomped oblivious to his presence. Not to mention the fact he was hopelessly separated from the antidote!

Lost in thoughts, the lighting suddenly changed as the ant continued under a gargantuan cabinet. His thoughtless captor suddenly came to a violent halt. The ant began struggling fiercely, its long antennae whipping around threatening to whack Bryan in the head.

"What is going on?" He asked with a shrill yelp.

The ant had inadvertently become stuck fast in a sticky substance that coated the ground. Bryan realized it was none other than a simple sheet of glue paper. It had likely been lain down a few weeks earlier, as there were numerous other creatures and dust trapped in it. The simple and cheap pest trap now looked like a lagoon of sticky liquid a few hundred feet long.

Bryan felt the cruel mandibles begin to loosen. The frightened insect seemed to forget about the tiny man as it tried desperately to escape from its own captivity. Bryan's elation at this opportunity for escape turned sour as he felt himself slipping from the ant's grasp. Directly below lay the sticky surface, waiting for another victim. Gripping one of the thrashing antennae, his other hand searched for a hold on the bug's greasy exoskeleton. He was determined not to become stuck like a common insect!

Feeding from his adrenaline, he attempted to scramble up the gigantic ant's head.

Smaller than an ant, Bryan would be easy prey to the dangerously oblivious man. He wished Tommy was here. Bryan felt sure that the helpful teenaged neighbor would be his saviour.

Taking a deep breath, Bryan....

112122112211221122122112111122212.content:
"There must be some way..." Bryan muttered to himself thoughtfully.

No more than a minute speck on the kitchen tiles, Bryan gazed around the room. The huge cabinets and appliances created an odd, almost fantastical vista for the tiny visitor. It was like he had been transported to another dimension, a dangerous and highly volatile world that he didn't belong in.

That was just it--he was too small. Frustration and panic threatened to overcome him, fueled by continued commotion from the humongous exterminator at work in the next room.

"Oh God! I can't just stay here!" His hands became sweaty and tears misted his eyes. Down on the floor, among scurrying ants and dust, Bryan was sure to be disregarded as "some bug" and sprayed into oblivion. He needed to move!

Two vehicle sized ants scuttled by him. They ignored Bryan completely as they hurried towards the nearby wall. "I wonder if they know about the exterminator?" Bryan wondered aloud, watching the two insects vanish into a dark crevice in the moulding. He noticed many ants doing the same: crawling along in sparse lines towards any cover, some carrying tiny, glistening white eggs.

Bryan realized he might be better off following them and hide from the terrifyingly gigantic tradesman until Tommy returned.

Hiding. Such a thought was repugnant to him; a genius such a he, hiding like some common insect that invaded somebody's home. Yet, he didn't see any other choice. How could he ever hope to get the gigantic man's attention?

"How could I have done this to myself?" He moaned in desolation.

Besides his diminished pride, Bryan thought about other possible outcomes. What if the exterminator proved thorough and ended up spraying into his hideaway? Bryan shuddered to think of the grisly, painful demise resulting from inhaling the toxic chemicals. He wracked his face and looked upwards at the distant ceiling light. It emitted a low hum and attracted barely discernible gnats that buzzed lazily, blissfully carefree. Then a second outcome struck him. What if he happened upon a hiding insect? A spider, or even an ant? A second encounter wasn't likely to go in his favour.

Scaling the enormous counters began to seem a feasible route to the tiny man. The mega-sized hutch he was currently under had tall, smooth legs that stood like monuments of smooth wood. It would be nigh impossible to climb them. Over a sizable distance of open tile floor stood the mighty countertops, stretching up an impressive height like cliffs. Bryan took in the sight, swallowing hard.

A trashcan sat against the edge of the counter, looming like an otherworldly tower of reflective metal. This object alone was not interesting, but what hung alongside it caught Bryan's attention. A towel, supported by an inset rack, hung almost the entire height of the cabinet to the counter with one end barely brushing the floor. Bryan felt sure he would be able to climb his way through the thick fibers to the top. He was sure to be seen and rescued there!

Noise from the next room disrupted his thoughtful musings. The distinct sound of spraying chemicals sounded disturbingly close.

Bryan felt his sweating hand losing grip on the wriggling antennae.

Determined to escape, he didn't want to think of what would happen should he fall into the glue. His feet scrambled over the insect's smooth greasy head. The thrashing mandibles could be heard clicking and crunching just below. Bryan felt his hand slip.

He cawed out in terror, fearing he would slip into the ant's ravaging mandibles. Instead, the ant gave a particularly violent thrash in a desperate attempt to free itself and flung tiny Bryan. The squealing scientist toppled rear-first into the sticky glue with a wet thud.

"No!" Bryan reacted. He attempted to pull himself up and only managed to get his hand stuck as well. "No, no, NO!"

His legs and hand were hopelessly stuck. Only his torso and other arm were spared the cruel glue that clung to his body like slimy gum.

Loud wailing clicks and grunts came from the ant who still struggled nearby. The stupid creature paid him no mind as it shook and thrashed, causing a sickly crack when one of its six legs tore off.

Bryan stared at the pitiful insect with horror. The giant ant was more than willing to dismember itself to escape. Bryan felt nauseous from the mere thought.

"God dammitt!" He returned his attention to his own plight. How the hell would he escape this? The glue felt like nothing short of cement, holding him firmly. He had never given a thought to the fate of insects caught by these merciless traps. In fact, he had lain out a few in his own home weeks before.

The ant seemed to fall still, as if at attention. Bryan halted his own struggles in turn, wondering at the large insect. Then he felt it.

Heavy thuds. No, heavy thunderous booms. Turning his head, Bryan was afforded a nice view of the kitchen from under the cabinet. He felt his spine chill, watching a mountainous pair of work boots lumber into the kitchen. Each heaving step sent powerful vibrations through the floor, rattling the tiny prisoner of the glue trap. From his lowly perspective, Bryan could only see the boots and some of the thick, frayed denim of the huge exterminator's jeans. The enormous boots stopped their thunderous procession just before the tall cabinet.

Clacking madly, the ant had begun struggling again. Bryan ignored it, having eyes only for the colossal footwear.

"Holy shit..." The bug-sized man felt weak as he tried to comprehend the sheer size of the mammoth work boots. They were mountainous towers of creased brown leather, the heavy lugged sole covered in flecks of mud and dust. He gulped at the thought of what might be pressed into the thick treads. As if to prove their enormous size, another ant scuttled by the nearest boot, looking positively minuscule as it fled.

Bryan grimaced as he watched the ant vanish behind the thick cabinet leg, wishing he could do the same. He felt like an animal caught in a trap, waiting for the hunter to finish it.

"I can't just stare," He bristled. "I need to make myself known!"

The stationary boots suddenly rose into action, shifting seemingly at random. Bryan went weak again, feeling all his courage leave him as he wondered what the huge man was doing.

Standing before a tall wooden hutch, Eric scribbled some quick notes onto a clipboard. With the living room finished, he was prepared to start in the kitchen.

He gave the room a cursory scan. Spider webs in the upper corner, and a sizable gap under the refrigerator seemed likely hot spots. Marking down more notes, he shifted his gaze to the hutch. The cabinet contained an assortment of decorative kitchen items. As an exterminator, Eric was more interested in the gap created by the legs of the hutch, allowing yet another haven for pests.

"Let's take a look" Muttered the gruff exterminator. Gravel from outside crunched lightly under his boots when he crouched down to look.

Eric grunted when the bill of his cap bumped against the cabinet. He pulled the hat backwards, and proceeded to investigate. His small flashlight illuminated the musty under-space, revealing dust bunnies, a pencil, and a sheet of glue paper that glinted slightly. The homeowner, Barbara, had mentioned something about glue traps he recalled.

Shifting position, he reached for the glue trap, patting his hand for a moment till he felt it.

He looked at what was the "catch-of-the-day." Almost a dozen tiny black ants lay entombed in the sticky glue, as well as a small wolf spider. Fewer still continued to move, their diminutive struggles almost invisible to the tall man. The large exterminator squinted at the hopelessly trapped ants, unable to appreciate their fear of him. He carefully plucked one of the ants from the trap, and brought the writhing bug close for identification.

Glancing at a small pocket book of insect species, Eric determined this was a classic infestation of Carpenter Ants. He rubbed the tiny creature out between his fingers and reached for his clipboard to take note. As he did, he chanced to notice other movement from the glue paper.

Smaller than the already minutely sized ants, he had taken this pale speck to be a crumb.

The tiny man shielded his precious eyes from the harsh flashlight beam.

As if in reply to his pleas, the powerful LED vanished and in its stead appeared a hand of humongous proportions. Gloved in thick suede, the hand crashed into the floor heavily. Lifting, it shifted position, and slammed down again, this time flattening a terrified ant. It seemed to be crashing down at random.

"Noooo!" He yelled when the chaotic hand raised seemingly over him.

His whole world lurched violently. The gigantic gloved hand effortlessly brought the park-sized glue trap out into the open. Bryan felt his arm crack painfully from the harsh jolting.
