"Hey, Justin," one of his teammates said in a booming voice. "Don't move. I see a freakin' bug there next to your foot."

In the next instant, the mesh net swooped through the air and the tiny man found himself tangled in the thin mesh material that, ironically, was too small for even someone as tiny as him to fall through.
11212211221122222212211122.title: Collected

choices: Justin takes Mr. Smith home
Justin runs into someone in parking lot
112122112211222222122111222.content:
The big football jocks wanted to get their extra credit assignment over with as quickly as possible.

So far, anything that scurried, crawled or darted within view became easy prey for the three titans, who had already imprisoned several bugs in the glass jars they carried with them.

"Hey, Justin," one of his teammates said in a booming voice. "Don't move. I see a freakin' bug there next to your foot."

When the tiny scientist heard the loud voice of the enormous jock, he fully expected one of them to bring a massive shoe down on top of him.

Instead, a muscular arm swung a mesh net through the air, trapping the tiny man within the thin mesh netting that, ironically, was too small for even someone as tiny as him to escape.

Justin grunted in success as he lifted the net and saw the struggling bug. As he looked closer, however, he cursed and drew the attention of his friends, Biff and Blake.

"Guys, this isn't a bug," Justin said. "It's a freakin' tiny man!"

On his back, trying to keep his limbs free of the holes in the mesh net, the shrunken scientist stared up through the new into the intimidating faces of the trio of gigantic, muscle-bound football jocks.

"Crap, he's right," Biff said. His blue-gray eyes locked with cold disdain on the struggling tiny man. "But he's smaller than most of the other bugs we've caught today."

Justin wouldn't have wanted his friends to take notice, but he felt himself growing stiff as he stared in fascination at the trapped little man who was no bigger than the nail of his little finger.

"What should we do?" Blake asked, crowding closer and thrusting his face toward the net. "Give him to Mr. Mendez with the rest of the bugs?"

"Like hell," Justin said with malicious intent. "Yo, bug-man! Why are you so small?"

Finding himself addressed directly by the awe-inspiring giant, Mr. Smith stammered. "There...there was a mix-up," he managed in a wavering voice. "Can you help me?"

"What's he saying?" Biff asked. "Make him speak up!"

Justin, who had detected more of the words than he wanted to let on, scowled. "Forget it," he said.

He plucked the helpless little man from the net and dropped him into an empty jar.

"Can you two keep your mouths shut?" Justin asked.

"Sure, Justin, but..." Blake began.

"No discussion," Justin said. "Let's just keep the bug-man our little secret."

Biff grinned, catching on. "Right!" Biff exclaimed. "Finders-keepers, eh?"

Justin resisted the urge to roll his eyes. Sometimes, Biff and Blake could be total morons. "Yeah, something like that, Biff."

In the jar, after recovering from being so callously dropped from a bone-jarring height, Mr. Smith shouted protests at the giants.

"Hey, Blake. You got those lids with the punched-out airholes?"

"Why don't you guys drop off the rest of the bugs to Mr. Mendez?" Justin suggested. "This little guy can go home with me."

Biff looked disappointed. "Can we come over and play with him later?"

"Sure," Justin said.

He held the jar to his face, and to his embarrassment, tiny Mr. Smith took a couple of steps back from Justin's enormous face despite the fact a half-inch thick layer of glass separated them.

"Welcome to your new home, little man!" Justin gloated. He felt himself at full mast in his pants, and didn't want his buddies to notice.

"Go on," he ordered.

On and off the field, Biff and Blake followed his commands. Lowering the jar, Justin walked out of the wooded lot and toward the high school parking lot.

Justin's day goes bad again

But, thanks to Mr. Mendez's hard line on the issue, Justin now had his own personal tiny man!

The little man's thread-thin arms gestured frantically while Justin could tell he was screaming at the top of his lungs. Mr. Smith, near the tip of the tongue, feels himself rise as Tommy shuts his lips and starts moving the chip to be crushed. He screams as he is practically hurtled towards the molars as Tommy starts to chew.

He feels himself being pushed repeatedly against the side of a lower molar, the deafening crunches just above his head as he rolls with the movement trying to stay as far from surface of the teeth as possible. After a bit he feels a longer movement and guesses he has joined a glob of soggy chip to another part of the mouth. He hears a splat as the food is crushed and finds himself flying away from it landing on the tongue with a roll. The chaos has left him confused and he stays where he is.

When everything stops he hears an indescribable noise and can sense something large rolling right by him. The tongue shifts and he hears a gulp.

Mr. Smith can’t help but let out a sigh of release. As Tommy groans, sending a gale ripping out of his throat, the light from the open mouth shows Mr. Smith he is now near the back of the mouth, sitting next to a round pile of chewed food.

“Oh God, what can I do?” he laments.

The tongue underneath him moves forward, flowing out of Tommy’s mouth like a snake. The bits of chewed food glint in the light and Mr. Smith is simply amazed that the friendly boy he knows is so oblivious to the destruction he is causing literally right under his nose.

A ball of meat smothered in ranch is now flying towards the teenager’s mouth and his unnoticed passenger. Mr. Smith stares at it, unsure how to react. He feels himself giving up; he is no match for the giant boy’s appetite. Sooner or later he will join a bite down the throat.

---

Tommy and his friends intently follow the man with the ball, as though their concentration would improve his ability to score. Tommy groans unhappily when a shot is swatted away from the net.

He looks at his plate and chooses a large BBQ wing. Tommy, being the fan of ranch that he is, drags it through the lake of white sauce. Having already swallowed the last chip is tongue rolls out of his mouth before the wing is very close. Strands of saliva mixed with ranch stretch from the upper molars to the extended tongue. Chunks of chewed chips are jammed into his molars and are scattered across his wide tongue, more dense in the back. Joe glances at Tommy to say something and sees this display. But it is nothing to him and as Tommy’s tongue disappears into his mouth with the wing, he has already forgotten the image.

“Dude, we should’ve bet Justin! The Pistons are winning! Man… I would’ve loved to have taken the money from the jackass… “Joe trailed off.

Tommy turned to him still chewing “Lyg ee woodve payed oo!” he says through a full mouth, bits of wing flying out of his mouth.

“Huh?” says Joe.

Tommy sighs and holds his finger up, signaling Joe to wait.

He focuses on chewing the large bite faster and struggles to move it to the back of his mouth. Earlier than he should have he forces it down into his throat and gulps. As it is sinking into his esophagus Tommy turns to Joe and says “Like he would’ve paid y—“ before he says 'you' he starts coughing violently.

He puts his hand to his neck and thinks in chewing so fast he must've not noticed a bone in his food.

Andy comes up behind him and smacks him in the back “Aren’t these supposed to be boneless??” he exclaims.

---

Mr. Smith didn’t turn away from the bits of meat pelting him. He swayed with the movement of the tongue underneath him, and didn’t try to scoot away from the growing pile of food beside him. Eventually the ball of food shifted and slammed into him, the saliva and meat adhering his side to it firmly. Knowing this was his inevitable fate he did nothing.

As Tommy finished chewing he seemed to try to speak, before the pace of the teeth quickened. This change of events vaguely intrigued Mr. Smith, but mostly the tiny man was waiting for the end. The ball of chewed wing, bits of chip, and Mr. Smith are pushed down the slope of Tommy’s tongue. The boy speaks over the descending food. Mr. Smith’s free arm and leg brush the side of the throat as he descends which gets the entire cavern shaking.

This turn of events shakes the tiny man out of his stupor. Glancing around he feels hope rise in his chest.
11212211221212121.title: Not a real game until...

112122112212121211.content:
Tommy shuts his eyes tight and strains the muscles in his neck. He focuses everything on forcing the food down his throat.

He feels it start to slide down, a painful jabbing scratching him from the inside. He can feel it moving easier though and one second later he can't feel it at all.

He takes a deep breath and reaches for his pop. As he takes a swig Steve stares at him.

"Better hope that wasn't a bone!" he warns.

Tommy shrugs. "Whatever, its gone now," he replies. The four boys then return their attention to the game as it returns from a commercial break.

---

Steve was technically right. It wasn't a bone in the sense the boys would have thought. Mr. Smith,being the culprit of Tommy's choking fit did have a skeleton, no matter how small. Tommy on the other hand was completely wrong.

His bite of food wasn't gone. It was passing through his chest, down the esophagus on its way to his stomach. And more importantly Mr. Smith was there, riding the bite down.

He felt completely crushed. He had let his hopes up, only to be violently swallowed anyway. He was slightly mystified by how much effort Tommy had put into sending him and the food down his throat. He had watched as the light of freedom shining from the front of the mouth was cut off and the pressure had forced him into the ball of food. Then the entire thing sank deep into the pit of Tommy's throat.

His concentration is shattered as he yelps when the food slips into the stomach, landing with a splat on the chewed chips Mr. Smith had seen only a minute before. He couldn't believe the situation he was in. Unceremoniously gulped down by his teenage neighbor, no different from a buffalo wing or potato chip. Soda rains down onto him and he feels himself snap. He is done. His situation is hopeless and he is tired. He cannot even muster the energy to be angry. He simply accepts that this end was directly his fault, and unfortunately most likely no one will ever figure out what happened to him. He leans back and stretches out, trying to get comfortable to use his last moments in deep thought.

Tommy continues to eat, the fading pain in his throat is his only reminder of choking. He doesn't worry about what had gone wrong because like he said the food is gone. And to him it might as well have ceased to exist. After he thoughtlessly swallows, the food makes its way unnoticed through his chest, landing on top of the forming mountain of food. When Tommy scratches his belly he doesn't realize less than an inch from his fingers lies the food that is "gone" as well as an unnoticed passenger.

Mr. Smith is soon buried by the snacks that Tommy continues to devour and passes out from a lack of oxygen before digestion can kick in. After their team won, Tommy had his friends help clean up before they left. Ready to go, he took one last glance around the room, satisfied it was clean enough that Mr. Smith would be happy when he returned. As he shuts and locks the door his stomach starts pumping out acid and churning the soggy food sitting inside of it. This causes a gurgle to sound through his belly. Tommy unconsciously puts his hand against his stomach and pats it. He doesn't give a thought to his hour-gone meal. All he can think is how he is going to use the money Mr. Smith gave him to bet on the Pistons in their next game.
112122112212121211.title: Gone

choices: There was a bug in my food!
That looks like a tiny person!
112122112212121212.content:
Tommy leans down towards his plate as he coughs some more. With a hacking noise the lump of food tumbles out of his mouth, landing with a splat on the plate.

"Nasty" Andy laughs before returning to his seat.

Tommy takes a swig of his big gulp, washing away any other dangerous bits of food before returning his attention to the chewed chunk.

---

Mr. Smith squints in the light, far brighter than the interior of Tommy’s mouth. Although he can’t see he starts flailing his free arm and leg in hopes that he will be seen. In his slowly adjusting vision he can just make out Tommy’s head floating above, seeming to stare right at him. Mr. Smith tries waving harder.

---

"Aren't these supposed to be boneless?" Tommy asks gruffly. He glares at the food and starts poking it. “Stupid Pizza Hut, my throat still hurts.” He adds unhappily.

“Get over it, quit being a pussy!” Andy grunts, glad that this was all happening during a commercial break so it didn’t matter anyway.

“I’m at least gonna find the bone so I know that’s what it is!” Tommy replies. As he pokes the slimy ball he sees something out of the ordinary. Looking closer he realizes…

It’s a shard of chewed chip. A piece from his earlier bite had stuck out and choked him.

However just before he turns away his eyes detect a slight movement. He leans in again and sees some tiny thing flailing out the side of the chunk of chewed food.

Tommy gasps and his eyes widen “Oh God…”
112122112212121212.title: Finding a Buried Bone

choices: Joe
Andy
1121221122121212121.content:
"Ugh! There was a fucking bug in my food!" Tommy shrieked. His exclamation irritated his throat enough that he descended into another fit of coughs.

"Voice that high, you could sing some fucking opera" taunted Joe before sympathetically pushing Tommy's soda within his reach. Tommy, unable to stop coughing, responded by merely flipping him off. In response Joe started laughing obnoxiously.

"Hey the game is back! Keep it down!" Andy snapped, irritated by all the background noise. Steve on the other hand, who had been silently watching everything unfold, stood from his seat.

"Well since no one else is doing anything, I'll take care of the bug!" he said confidently. None of his friends gave any indication they heard him as Joe kept laughing, Tommy wheezed, and Andy just turned up the TV's volume.

---

Mr. Smith is waving his arm so vigorously that it starts to hurt from the effort. His eyes slowly adjust to the light, giving him a better view of his massive surroundings. His furniture appears like distant mountain peaks and sheer cliffs in unnatural colors. However he is most fascinated by what dominates the scene. The four enormous teenagers.

Directly above him is Tommy. Though the tiny man takes comfort in seeing a familiar face, he can't help but feel nervous so near the behemoth that had nearly swallowed him down! Tommy glares down at the chunk of food trapping Mr. Smith. His handsome face is twisted into a frown and is bathed in shadow, giving it an ominous look. This doesn't help Mr. Smith's anxiety since Tommy is frightening enough just by being so incredibly huge.

A long thick finger appears from the blur of light surrounding him. The pitted fingernail seems to be aiming right for him, eliciting a girlish scream from the tiny man. Instead it lands out of Mr. Smith's sight, though he does feel its jarring impact, coupled with a wet squish.

Fighting off a wave of nausea, Mr. Smith finds himself in sudden darkness. An automatic look upwards reveals Tommy has leaned in closer. His blue eyes look like ponds as they dart over the chunk of food. He exhales lightly out of his nostrils that hover over the scene, buffeting the tiny man with his breath. However Mr. Smith is unconcerned with this, continuing to wave his arm desperately.

Finally Tommy’s eye seems to snap onto him. His pupil widens, and Mr. Smith cheers having finally been discovered.

Tommy’s voice abruptly thunders past him, temporarily deafening the minuscule scientist. He hadn’t heard the whole sentence, but one word repeated in his head: bug. He had been mistaken for an insignificant pest!

A glance upwards reveals Tommy turned away, seemingly coughing once more. Instead the titanic teen named Steve is approaching. Mr. Smith waves his arm again, more weakly than before. The impossibly tall young man reaches down, his thick fingers the size of airplane cabins.

“No!” Mr. Smith tries to scream, but with his ears still ringing, he has no clue if he actually made a sound.

---

Not one to be easily grossed out, Steve pinches the chunk of soggy food between his fingers and retreats to the kitchen to toss it out. He pauses in the doorway, scanning for the trash can. Assuming it’s under the kitchen sink, he approaches the cabinet, and discovers he is correct.

Just before he pitches the food into the trash, Steve pauses and brings it closer to his face. It only takes him a second to locate the squirming pest. Snickering at its pathetic struggles, Steve gets an idea.

He squeezes the bug free from the food and holds it trapped between his fingers. Tommy had already suffered from it, but Steve just couldn't pass up the opportunity! It only takes him a second to decide to use the insect to prank...
1121221122121212121.title: Bugged

choices: They're gonna sneak into the lab!
They need to find Mr. Smith's lab partner to help
1121221122121212122.content:
"Holy shit" Tommy breathes. He leans in closer not believing his eyes. But now that he's seen it, he can't help but think it's a tiny man.

His friends see him get closer to his food with a look of utter shock on his face.

"Dude" Andy laughs "It wasn't going to kill you, quit being so dramatic!"

Tommy ignores him, "Look at this" he says.

"What?" Joe asks, his curiosity piqued.

"Just look!" he insists, pointing.

Joe's eyes lock onto the tip of Tommy's finger and at first he sees nothing. But as his eyes focus he sees a strange looking bug... that kinda resembles a tiny person.

"Whoa" is all Joe can get out.

Andy jumps up and walks over, "What's so interesting guys?" as he pushes in front of Tommy to see.

"Oh fuck!" he cries out jumping back as if it might get him.

Tommy leans forward and carefully scoops the chunk of food with the tiny man on it onto his finger. He brings it to his eye and tries to make out more detail.

The tiny person is waving frantically and as Tommy stares, it starts to look very familiar.

"Mr. Smith?" he gasps.

---

"YES!! TOMMY YES!!!" Mr. Smith screams in elation as the giant boy utters his name. He is still waving, never having faltered even when the massive finger tip seemed about to crush him.

"YOU HAVE TO HELP ME GET BACK TO NORMAL!!!" he wails.

---

"Mr. Smith is that you?” Tommy says in wonder. Suddenly realizing the tiny man’s voice probably didn’t carry he held his finger to his ear and motioned for someone to turn of the TV. Joe scrambled for the remote and with a click the room went silent save for the teenager’s heavy breathing.

“Is that your neighbor?” asked Steve from behind Tommy.

“Shhhhh!” Tommy shushed him and listened carefully. He could hear the tiny man screaming that he needed help, but he couldn’t make it out very well.

“I can’t believe this” Joe murmured, his eyes wide.

“You’re telling me!” exclaimed Andy.

“We’ll help you but I can’t understand you!” Tommy said to his finger. “Somebody find a microphone” Tommy ordered.

Steve looks up and seems the Karaoke Machine Mr. Smith received from his sister (Zack’s mother) a few Christmas’ ago. He rarely used it, but had kept it because of the nice gesture.

“Here,” Steve says simply as picks up the microphone and switches the thing on.

Tommy walks over and places his finger near it.

---

‘I can’t believe its finally over’ Mr. Smith thinks to himself. He feels more joy than ever before as the giant teenagers work to communicate with him. He already had a promise of aid, now they just needed the details to do it. He looks at the mesh of the microphone, takes a deep breath and starts yelling.

“Can you get me out of this?!” he bellows into the massive microphone.

“SURE” rumbles from above and Tommy’s other hand flies at him and Mr. Smith struggles to stifle a cry of fear. He is surprisingly gently pushed out of the food which Tommy unceremoniously shoves off his finger. For a moment Mr. Smith gets ready to reprimand the young man, but then remembers that this boy s his savior and more importantly he wants to waste no time in returning to normal.

---

“… we need to go to my lab…” Mr. Smith’s voice is weak but clear over the microphone.

Tommy nods, remembering the office building near the airport where Mr. Smith worked.

“I participated in an experiment and it went wrong,” continued Mr. Smith. He had decided it best to leave out that this was intentional. “The solution… the antidote is at my lab. When we get there this can all be done.”

“And then he’ll owe us, right?” chimes in Andy, the initial shock of the situation fading.

“Shut up,” Tommy growls in response. “He won’t owe us anything, I almost ate him!” The sentence registers in Tommy’s head. He had nearly eaten his neighbor without knowing it. Just 5 minutes ago he was watching a game, chowing down chips and wings like nothing was wrong while poor Mr. Smith went through who knows what trying to get his attention.

‘And what did I do?’ Tommy thought ‘I tried to eat him, like part of a wing’ The thought made him nauseous. He looked at his belly and poked it. What else had he eaten without ever noticing?

“Hello!?” Joe snapped his fingers in front of Tommy’s face.

Tommy blinked, remembering he was with his friends, and now they had instructions on what to do.

“Sorry…” he muttered. Rather than explain what he had thought, he stood up.

“Well, c’mon! We gotta go to the lab right now!” he said motioning with the hand that didn’t hold a tiny human.

“Wait!” Mr. Smith’s voice drifted from the speakers. “I haven’t told you what to get, or how to get into my lab!”

“Oops, I just felt so bad since I…” Tommy trailed off.

“It’s okay Tommy, really. Anyway…” and Mr. Smith explained what they needed to do.
1121221122121212122.title: Finally Found

choices: The boys drive home
They get out of the car and run after Waldo
11212211221212121222.content:
"You need to go find my lab partner. He doesn't know much about the experiment, but he'll be able to figure out what to from my notes!" Mr. Smith informs the towering teenagers.

"His name is Walden Lake, find him in the phone book. Tell him Bryan needs Waldo!"

Tommy nods "Okay, where's the phone book?" he asks looking around.

"Here" says Steve holding it up.

"Aren't you just a great little detective" says Andy with a smirk, but nobody replies.

"Joe, you call him" says Tommy.

"Why me?" he asks incredulously. " 'cause I'm holding the guy, Andy's too obnoxious-" "Hey!" "-and Steve's too quiet" Tommy replies smoothly completely ignoring Andy's protest.

Joe sighed "Fine". He opened the phone book and ran his finger down the L page. He settled on a number and started dialing. After the second ring someone picked up.

"Hello?" said the voice. "Hi, Walden... I mean Mr. Lake... I um... well, Bryan says he needs you Mr. ah... Waldo" Joe stumbles through the sentence.

Silence on the other end. "Why can't he talk to me? And besides its my day off!" replies the man.

"Say its an emergency, and to meet us at the lab ASAP" Bryan urges the gigantic young man.

"Well... it's an emergency and you need to... I mean could you meet us at the lab?" he asks, similar to a child asking for a toy at the mall.

A sigh sounds from the other end of the line "I suppose, but this better be good!" a click signals that the call is over.

"We better get going!" says Tommy. When Mr. Smith doesn't protest this time he walks to the door. "C'mon guys, we can take my brother's car." Like a flash he's out the door, his friends close behind.

---

Mr. Smith sat in Steve's hand while Tommy drove them to the lab. He was still so glad to finally be making progress on the situation. He was glad it had been Tommy who had found him. Andy didn't seem as trustworthy, Joe while good intentioned probably wouldn't have noticed anything, and Steve seemed to quiet to have spoken up. And now Tommy was spear-heading the effort to return him to normal, something Mr. Smith was deeply grateful for.

His thoughts moved to Waldo. He and Bryan were friendly though not too close. The man just wasn't that social. He was prone to crankiness, and coupled with his overly technical mind he wasn't far from a stereotypical nerdy scientist. But the man was very smart, and he wouldn't have any trouble using the notes to return his tiny co-worker to normal. Mr. Smith felt so good, things finally were right.

---

Tommy pulled into a parking space in front of the low building. Looking around he realized he didn't know what the guy looked like.

As though reading his mind Andy piped up from the back seat "What's Waldo even look like?"

Tommy shrugged but jumped when a man tapped on his window. Tommy rolled it down and stared at him. The man was unremarkable. His skin was pale, but not abnormally so. His hair was short, black, and had some gel to hold it in place. His gray eyes looked uninterested behind a pair of wiry, silver glasses. Tommy also noticed he already had a lab coat on.

"Well I'm Waldo. I'm assuming you're the kids who called me. So what's the emergency?" his voice contained a hint of annoyance.

Tommy gave him a quick story of what had happened and what Mr. Smith had told them. Waldo's face shifted between surprise and disbelief several times.

"Where is he?"he says finally. Steve holds his hand up from the passenger seat.

Waldo stares at the speck in the boy's hand and reaches for it. "Give him to me," he demands "I'll return him to normal, if you said its in the notes I can do it." Steve carefully turns his hand into Waldo's. They both watch as Mr. Smith moves down the slope onto Waldo's palm.

Without another word the scientist spins around.

"Wait!" Tommy calls after him "Where are you going? We want to go!"

"Not necessary!" Waldo replies dismissively without turning back. He looks down at his shrunken co-worker.

"What a discovery you've made Bryan!" he says happily. "You would make a great test subject!" he laughed. Tiny Bryan waits for a 'just kidding' but it doesn't come.

He looks up worried, to see Waldo seeming to stare through him, deep in thought.

"I could really benefit from the credit for this..." he trails off. "Of course I'd have to test it some more, but that's what I have you for!" he says. To Waldo Bryan is now another test subject, no different from a lab mouse. "Nothing personal" he adds to the tiny man on his hand.

Mr. Smith feels his world spinning. Things had gotten really bad really fast! He finds himself hoping that somehow Tommy will rescue him again.

---

Tommy watches the man walk away, periodically leaning down to talk to the tiny man.

"I want to go with them, we're part of this." Tommy murmurs.

"That guy obviously doesn't want us there" Joe states with a shrug.

"Yeah..." Tommy trails off.
11212211221212121222.title: Where's Waldo?

choices: Coffee table
Floor
11212211221212122.content:
Tommy is completely absorbed in the game on the TV, oblivious to the tiny man trapped inside his mouth. As his team gets closer to scoring he finds a cheer beginning in his throat. Low and quiet at first, it slowly increases in intensity with every step the player takes.

“C’mon!” Tommy shouts in anticipation.

---

Mr. Smith is zig-zagging across the constantly shifting landscape of Tommy’s tongue like a drunkard. The flickering light from the TV that streams between Tommy’s towering white teeth does little to aid the speck of a man.

A rumbling suddenly starts behind him and Mr. Smith gasps in surprise before choking on the stale air. He turns around and stares at Tommy’s throat in the near darkness. The young man’s uvula sways gently over the dark abyss of his throat, which is where the now louder sound seems to be coming from.

Mr. Smith tries to quicken his pace but Tommy’s tongue is moving more now. Obviously something is exciting him. Mr. Smith trips and lands with a splat. Instead of getting up, he does his best to get his face dry and covers his ears. Frowning he squints at the increasing light as Tommy’s mouth opens wider. He can feel his entire body vibrating as the whole cavern is shaking from Tommy’s voice. Flecks of spittle are flying through the air and Mr. Smith can only wonder when everything will calm down.

Suddenly the sound blasts ten times louder behind him as the tongue shoots up. Mr. Smith wails uncontrollably as he is launched forwards.

---

None of the massive boys notice the tiny speck that flies out of Tommy's mouth with his spittle as he yells. Its landing is unseen on the...

in a couch cushion, with Mr. Smith near the edge of the table
112122112212121221.content:
Tommy jumps up with his friends cheering. As the games they plop back onto the couch and continue to watch, happy the Pistons are firmly in the lead.

---

Mr. Smith groans. His entire body aches after his rough landing on a thankfully empty paper plate. However he knows he can't waste much time crying about it. He doesn't seem to have any injuries and he has learned already that plates are not safe places. Grunting as he stands he moves as quickly as he can towards the edge, limping a bit from the lingering pain. He stops at the edge and looks down the stack of paper plates. The spaces between them look like good handholds and footholds.

Mr. Smith crawls off the side and starts inching downwards. Looking up and to his left he can see Tommy's face illuminated by the flickering screen, a vague grin as he watches the game. The light glints off his teeth and Mr. Smith shudders knowing mere moments ago he was in there.

Mr. Smith drops the last few feet (at his size) to the table and gazes upwards. He doesn't bother yelling as the thunderous sounds of the TV almost drown out his own thoughts. Around him are towering bags of chips, and stadium-sized containers of wings. Every now and then a huge hand will appear and snatch a wing, or with the thunder of the crunching bag pull hill-sized handful of chips away. Out of sight he can here the chomps and crunches of the boys eating their food.

He gazes around wondering how best to get the teens' attention

---

As the quarter wraps up, a member of the boys' team tries to make a shot from across the court. When he misses the boys sigh in disappointment, though not too surprised. Suddenly it seems as though the volume has doubled when the commercials begin. Tommy jumps and searches for the remote.

"Where's the remote?!" he shouts to his friends over the din. Well they start checking their chairs Tommy starts shoving the food on the coffee table around expecting it to be under some food.

---

Mr. Smith is walking slowly between the food when the commercials start. Though already deafening, the increase of sound actually makes his tiny eardrums throb and he instinctively covers his ears. He sees another huge hand appear but rather than reach for food it pushes a bag of chips over, sending the building-like object to the left and blocking the tiny man's path. He gasps as a pizza box soars over head and lands on a container of wings which is then shoved to the right. A bag of Doritos is pushed towards Mr. Smith. Before he can react, the container of dip slams into him from the side.

---

Tommy is searching frantically, almost knocking food on the floor. The commercial is so loud he is nervous it might blow the speakers, they were already pushing the limits with the game. And he is pretty sure Mr. Smith would be pissed to have a broken TV... which would lead him to find out the Tommy had his friends over too...

---

Mr. Smith is pushed one last time when the remote is finally located...
