Try scaling the couch to get to Tommy
112122112212121222.content:
Tommy jumps up with his friends cheering. As the games they plop back onto the couch and continue to watch, happy the Pistons are firmly in the lead.

---

Mr. Smith screams in terror as Tommy's massive sneakers plant themselves on either side of him. A deep roar shakes the tiny man to his core as the gigantic teenagers cheer. When Tommy flops down onto the couch his right foot leans over revealing the sole of his shoe to Mr. Smith.

He groans rubbing his back, knowing that the floor is not safe and he as to get moving. But when he turns to find a hiding place he can't help but stare at Tommy's huge shoe. The black sole is worn, though the deep tread is still very visible. Small pebbles and packed dirt are packed tightly into the tread. He also sees what looks like the flattened body of a spider. The tiny man feels no remorse for the dead bug, but worries he might meet the same fate. Coupled with all the other things trapped under Tommy's shoe reminds him that Tommy doesn't even have to pay attention destroy him with a single step.

With that thought bouncing around his skull Mr. Smith scurries underneath the sofa, as it's the nearest safe haven. He gets their undetected, knowing that the massive boys are engrossed in their game.

From under the couch Mr. Smith tries to come up with a plan to get Tommy's attention as well as I getting recognized for what he was so he didn't end up another flattened body trapped under Tommy's sneaker.
112122112212121222.title: Down Under

choices: Climbing higher on Tommy's jeans
Tommy moves
1121221122121212221.content:
At a quarter-of-an-inch tall, the tiny scientist knew his plan left him no margin for error. A mistake, a wrong move, and he could end up a smear beneath his colossal teenaged neighbor's sneaker.

Ironically, that same huge shoe played a crucial role in the shrunken man's scheme. "If I can climb that shoe, I can reach Tommy's leg, and…." He let his voice trail off. He didn't know what he might do if he could reach the teenager's gigantic leg.

"Keep climbing, I guess," he told himself as he exited the security that he had provided himself by hiding beneath the living room sofa.

None of the titanic teens had made the slightest move for the last few minutes, convincing the bug-sized man that the time to make a move was now. He raced toward Tommy's closest sneaker, which happened to be the one worn on the teenager's right foot.

The closer he got, however, the more disheartened he felt. The shoe looked bigger than the cruise ship he had traveled aboard during his last vacation. He got close enough to reach out an touch the wall of rubber that comprised the sole of the sneaker. The rubber wall, almost four times his height, stretched out for hundreds of feet.

He decided to circle around the foot, hoping to discover some means of scaling the massive footwear.

"Please, don't move," the little man whispered in a prayer.

His survey of the entire length of the shoe gave him no better idea for climbing the monstrous shoe.

Then, he happened to glance at the neighboring shoe, located a few hundred feet away.

"Yes!" The little man exclaimed when he saw a dangling shoe lace.

He raced with a surge of energy, soon drawing close to the dangling lace.

"Perfect," he said, noticing lots of frayed fibers, some large and rope-like. "This should be a cinch to climb!"

Indeed, with considerable exertion, he managed to climb Tommy's sneaker. Once he reached the top, he stood on a thin ledge and faced a wide wall of denim. Folds in the stiff fabric provided pathways, but they were steep and unpredictable. At any second, the giant teenager could get on his feet and start walking about the room. The results could be catastrophic.

"But, without his help, I'm doomed," the shrunken man told himself.
1121221122121212221.title: Climb Tommy's Shoe

choices: Check back in with tiny Mr. Smith
Itching continues, so Tommy removes his shoe
11212211221212122212.content:
During a commercial, Tommy glanced at his glass and noticed he needed to refresh his drink. Without another thought, he lifted himself from the sofa and walked toward his neighbor's kitchen and it's well-stocked fridge. His sneakers stomped loudly across Mr. Smith's immaculate floorboards.

He grabbed one of the big bottles of carbonated cola from the chilly refrigerator and re-filled his glass. With plenty of ice cubes remaining, he didn't bother adding additional frozen cubes to the glass.

Before he picked up his glass, he felt a peculiar itch inside his shoe. He slipped his sneaker halway off his foot, then replaced it.

Tommy then put the soda bottle back into the fridge, closed the door and grabbed his drink. On the way back to the sofa, he felt that same itch, but at a new location. The strange sensation had shifted beneath his toes.

He placed his drink on the coffee table, took a seat on the coffee table and flexed his toes. The itching, which was centered between his big toes and its nearest neighbor, seemed to subside.

By that time, the game resumed and his attention once again became riveted on the action played out on the screen of Mr. Smith's big-screen, high-definition television.
11212211221212122212.title: Tommy moves

choices: Mr. Smith ends up beneath Tommy's sole
Mr. Smith ends up beneath Tommy's heel
112122112212121222121.content:
When the tiny scientist found himself lodged like a bit of lint between his teenaged neighbor's sweaty toes, he felt a fresh wave of humiliation.

His situation continued to inflict new blows to his ego as he realized that he was so small and helpless that he didn't even register in Tommy's awareness.

Or, at least, he barely registered. As he tried to move and find a better location, his feeble movements caused irritation to the sensitive skin between the teenager's giant toes. The irritation caused an itching that intruded into the fringes of Tommy's awareness.


As he sank into the sofa cushions, Tommy flexed his toes. That simple action caught the bug-sized scientist off his guard. He would have cried out, but as the toes flexed, they gripped his tiny body with a crushing pressure.

The tiny man began to see stars, and then as Tommy flexed his toes a second time, the pressure left the tiny man limp and unconscious.

By that time, the game resumed and Tommy's attention returned to the action played out on Mr. Smith's big-screen television.

He did notice that, for the moment, the itching had ceased. Tommy propped his feet up on the coffee table. The new position caused Mr. Smith's tiny, motionless form to slowly begin sliding from the teenager's giant toes to a position that would leave him in a dangerous position beneath Tommy's wide, smooth sole.
112122112212121222121.title: Worse and worse

choices: Warming Up...in Tommy's Mouth
Clumsy Tommy...Spills the Drink
112122112212122.content:
Tiny Bryan managed to remain on the surface of the enormous ice cube as it bobbed in the waves of the cola sea.

"Here's your drink," Andy announced as he gave the glass to Tommy when he returned to the living room.

As the glass changed hands, Bryan fought not to slide off the iceberg. His tiny body felt frozen. His lips and fingertips turned blue from the direct contact with the ice.

His teeth chattered. "I...I..I've just got...to...to get his att---attention," he said as he lifted his gaze and saw Tommy's enormous face framed in the oval of the glass.

"Pu-please...he...help!" Bryan shouted.

Tommy, more interested in the game than quenching his thirst, placed the glass on the small table next to the sofa.

"Now, try not to make any more messes," Tommy said. "Mr. Smith would not like it if he knew what we are doing in his house."

The cola sea looked calm, but Bryan shivered uncontrollably from the intense cold. If Tommy didn't notice him soon, the shrunken scientist knew he would freeze to death.
112122112212122.title: Cold Case

choices: Tommy licks up the drop
Tommy wipes the drop on his sleeve
1121221122121221.content:
Having scarfed down so much food during the game, Tommy could feel the pressure in his belly. However he was still thirsty and the cola in his hand sounded so refreshing. He hoped it would fit. Deciding his thirst outweighed any discomfort Tommy lifted the glass to his mouth.

---

Bryan was shivering so much it hurt. He was developing a headache from his teeth chattering. However these problems were insignificant as he knew there was a good chance his young neighbor would soon gulp him down without realizing it. Unable to come up with any solution for his predicament, Bryan treaded soda and prayed for a miracle.

As Tommy moved the glass towards his mouth, Bryan let out a surprised cry. "Ah-ya-ya-yaah!" he shouted through his chattering teeth. Had it not been for the awful situation he might have laughed at the awkward noise. Tommy's exhaled out his nose, bringing a very welcome gust of warmth that caused waves across the lake of soda before dissipating. Within a second any warmth it had provided merely made the return of the cold more intense.

"Tommy!" Bryan shouted desperately gazing upward. Tommy's face was illuminated by the TV. Past the towering nose were Tommy's blue eyes, staring ahead at the game, unconcerned with the drama playing out in his drink.

As he tilted his drink Bryan screamed again. His view quickly changed to Tommy's upper lip as it stuck into the glass. He felt a strong current pull him towards Tommy's mouth as Tommy took his first drink. The upper lip quivered as Tommy sucked more liquid into his mouth, the peach fuzz on it barely noticeable even for the shrunken man.

Bryan wasn't much of an athlete, actually he wasn't an athlete at all. Despite his best swimming efforts he soon found himself bumping into Tommy's lip. The gigantic boy seemed about to drain the whole glass!

---

Tommy drained most of the glass in one pull. As he pulled the glass away to take a breath he felt a drop of soda trickle onto his lip.
1121221122121221.title: Drink, Drunk

11212211221212211.content:
Bryan had shut his eyes when he had been sucked under the surface. However he soon found himself able to breathe again, and not nearly as cold as before. He opened his eyes to discover he sat on Tommy's lip. He sat in a drop that had escaped the glass without entering the mouth. "Yea-" Bryan started to shout in celebration when suddenly something slammed into him from behind.

He grunted as his eyes shut instinctively. He felt himself move and when he opened his eyes he was in darkness. The air was also humid and smelled rotten. Light appeared in front of him, lighting up a silhouette of Tommy's upper teeth from the light that streamed between his open lips.

"Noooo!!" Bryan screamed in anger. He hadn't even been able to celebrate before he ended up in the place he had so much wanted to avoid. He beat his fists on the spongy surface of Tommy's tongue in frustration. The thing simply continued to sway gently. Bryan's anger had no effect whatsoever on the massive muscle.

---

Tommy licked the drop off his lips automatically. His thoughts as he did so were on finishing his soda. It tasted so good, and he could feel his thirst almost quenched. His eyes focused on the game he put the glass to his lips and gulped down the rest of the soda.

---

Bryan stared as the lips parted wider allowing more light into the mouth. Tommy's teeth towered above him, strands of saliva stretching between them and the tongue. He cried out when he recognized the approaching rim of the glass and stood to run away. He took only one step when the wave of cola hit him from behind. He rushed towards the gaping black hole at the back of Tommy's mouth which deformed itself into a steep cavern as Tommy swallowed the last of his soda.

As Bryan cascaded downwards in the waterfall of soda through Tommy's throat he felt slightly stupid for trying to outrun the tsunami of pop in the first place.

Bryan's descent into the stomach was rough as he stopped for half a second with the soda at the sphincter closing off the stomach before falling one last time into a lake of soda. The lake was warm as the heat radiating from Tommy's surrounding body had brought it to a comfortable temperature.

Bryan treaded the soda as he started to cry from the helplessness of his situation. He could see floating chunks of food, unrecognizable from being chewed, swallowed, dumped into the stomach, and stirred by the incoming drink.

"Tommy please don't digest me!" he cried out knowing it was fruitless.

Knowing he would be dead soon and there was nothing he could do about it was a huge blow to the man who considered himself quite the genius. All this intellect brought to an end by his teenage neighbor's digestive system. "Hell, my intellect is what brought me into Tommy's digestive system!" he shouted aloud.

Unwilling to die by digestion Bryan made a hasty decision. He swam downwards, sadness in his heart and waited until his body would force him to inhale the soda. At least he would choose when he went and it would be quick...

---

Tommy watched the game unfold, the light from the TV flickered across his emotionless face. Except for the occasional cheer Tommy remained motionless. He had gotten used to the feeling of his full stomach and had pushed thoughts of it out of his conscious mind. Occasionally however he would place his hand over it and rub instinctively.

Tommy's gut was comfortably filled with chips, wings, soda, and one floating, unconscious, tiny man. But the contents of his stomach were not on Tommy's mind. As his hand yet again unconsciosly moved to his stomach, his only thought was how he wished he had made a bet on his team.
11212211221212211.title: Tommy gets the drop on Bryan

choices: Steve reached into the bag
Steve tilted the bag and poured chips onto his plate
11212211222.content:
The tiny man leaped with all his might and surprised himself by succeeding in his goal.

Clutching the fragment torn from the enormous chicken to his chest, the bug-sized man ran away from Andy's plate. He chose to hide in the shadow of a hangar-sized bag of chips as he tried to tear off manageable chunks of chicken meat from his prize.

Was this what he had reduced himself to? Scurrying like a bug among oblivious giants, foraging for their scraps and crumbs?

His stomach rumbled and answered his question. "With some food in my stomach, I'll be more ready to..."

His thoughts evaporated when Tommy stretched out a huge hand and plunged it inside the bag of chips. The teenager's tiny neighbor heard the awful crunching noises as Tommy's huge fingers slammed closed around a handful of chips and pulled them out of the bag. Mr. Smith looked in shocked horror at the sheer size of his teenaged neighbor. Seated as he was on the floor, only Tommy's torso towered over the transparent surface of the coffee table. That was still more than enough to make the tiny man feel overwhelmed.

"I want some chips, too," Joe announced, not wanting to wait for Tommy to finish.

For a moment, both of the giants tried to shove hands into the bag of chips.

"Damn, wait your turn," Tommy complained.

The little man had seen enough. He started to sprint for cover elsewhere.

Joe withdrew his hand, but as soon as Tommy finished, he shot his hand back toward the bag. He didn't even realize that he was about to cross paths with the fleeing bug-sized man. As the huge hand slammed into him, the shrunken scientist screamed and was pushed deep into the bag of chips.

Still in shock, the tiny man watched the redwood-sized fingers close around an enormous quantity of chips. "No!" The little man screamed as he scrambled backward.

Joe got a hearty handful of chips, and things might have been fine if not for Steve.

"Hey, toss me that bag of chips," the other enormous teenager told Joe.

With his free hand, Joe clutched the bag of chips and tossed it over to Steve.

Inside the bag, the tiny man felt himself caught up in an avalanche at the chips shifted position, burying him beneath a layer of the gigantic fried snacks as they readjusted one the bag fell into Steve's hands.

"Hey, be careful," Tommy cautioned. "Don't make a mess in Mr. Smith's house!"

"Sure, we'll be careful," Steve said with a bit of sarcasm.

The little man was still trying to get his bearing when...
11212211222.title: Bagged

11212212.content:
The tiny scientist had spent the past couple of hours exploring his gigantic home at the extremely diminutive size of a quarter-inch tall. His progress hadn't taken him out of the living room before he depleted his energy.

The bug-sized man curled into a tiny ball next to one of the massive wooden pillars supporting the plush armchair that was one of several gigantic pieces of furniture in the room.

He figured he needed to be well rested and energized when Tommy returned. As he drifted deeper into unconsciousness, vivid thoughts returned to the forefront of his brain. He recalled the sight of the two titanic teenagers as they had loomed over him in his own home. Those awe-inspiring mental images lured him into strange dreams as he enjoyed a brief nap.

When Tommy and Joe returned to Mr. Smith's home, they were accompanied by their friend, Andy. Like his buddies, Andy was a rather typical teenager. He wore an old T-shirt that clung to his body. A well-worn pair of jeans hugged his lower half, and he wore a ratty pair of Vans sneakers.

"This house is so freakin' awesome!" Andy exclaimed as they entered the kitchen through the back door.

In the living room, the commotion from three giants entering his home jolted Mr. Smith from his sleep and a dream that had found him tiny and scampering at the feet of titans.

Now, with the floor trembling beneath his own tiny feet, he realized that that dream was rapidly coming closer.

"What's this guy do for work again?" Andy asked. "He must be loaded to have a house like this!"

As they entered the living room, Andy gasped. "Is that a flat-screen TV?"

"Hey, what does your neighbor do?" Joe asked when Tommy wasn't immediately forthcoming.

Hearing the questions from Andy and Joe, Mr. Smith somehow got new hope. Perhaps Tommy and his friends were not that bad. If he could make contact with them, there would be a good chance (if they could only recognize him) that they would help him.

His optimistic thoughts were cut off, however, as the three titans tromped into the living room and his teenage neighbor chose to respond.

"Actually, he's supposed to be some brilliant scientist, but he's still just a nerd," Tommy responded. "And, if you ask me, he's not even all that bright. I mean, he can't be that smart if he pays me these big bucks just to mail a stupid package for him."

Tiny Mr. Smith, who had always regarded Tommy as a kind kid who did hard work for him, felt crushed at the teenager's indifference and ingratitude.

"Tommy, gonna play the bad ass now?" Joe remarked in a joking tone.

"I could care less, as long as this guy pays me that much money, I will play nice and do whatever he wants. It beats getting a real job at the McDonalds."

The shrunken man stared up and noticed that each of the titans had helped themselves to a soft drink from his fridge as they made their way into his home.

They all laughed and Tommy tilted the can of soda and guzzled half its contents. For tiny Mr. Smith, the giant's actions produced an awesome display of immensity and strength.

"Besides, how would he ever know? Right?" Tommy chuckled.

"Unless he has the place bugged?" Joe said.

No, they wouldn't find any hidden microphones or cameras, but the tiny man reflected on the irony. The only "bug" near these giants was his unlucky self.

"Don't be stupid," Tommy said. "Why would he do that?"

"You're such a lucky guy, do you know that?"Andy asked. He chuckle and continued. "I wish I had a neighbor like this moron that I could milk like a cow."

It was too much! Caught up in his anger and disappointment, the little man charged into the open. "Get out!" Bryan screamed up at the giants. Forgetting that they represented his only hope of returning to normal, he just wanted them gone.

"Oh, gross," Andy remarked when he saw a pale insect scurry away from the plush armchair that he had eyed as a comfortable seat.

"What?" Tommy responded.

"It's a disgusting bug," Andy said, pointing in the little man's general direction. "Down there!"

Tiny Mr. Smith's righteous anger evaporated. "Oh god. What have I done?"

He turned and ran back toward the shadows beneath the armchair. Even as he tried to cover the distance as fast as he could, he still picked up the loud words of the conversation between the titanic teens.

"He can't be very smart anyway", Joe said. "With all these bugs in here, I mean, come on, who ever would allow them to share his own home?"

Hearing this, Andy got an idea. "You have to lay down a good word for me," he told Tommy. "If he's that stupid and lazy, he may pay me, too, if I take care of his bug problem!"

"Yeah, sure," Tommy answered his friend.

He kept it to himself, but Andy's plan was actually a good idea. Of course, Tommy would tell Mr. Smith he had taken on the job of eliminating the bug problem in the house.

He saw Andy lift his foot high off the floor, ready to stomp the offensive little bug.

Tommy yawned, barely reacting when Andy brought his sneaker down with a sturdy thud. He was content to let Andy do all the real work.

"One down," Tommy remarked and slapped Andy on the back.

It was the truth after all, even if Andy deserved the credit for taking out the first bug.

Besides, where there's one bug, there's sure to be others. He told himself that if they encountered any other bugs, he would make sure he took out a few of the little pests, personally!

Best of all, Tommy figured with self-satisfied smugness, he could not wait to let Mr. Smith know what he had done for him!
11212212.title: Disillusioned

choices: Tommy follows Joe to the living room, box in hand.
Tommy heads to the living room, leaving the box on the kitchen table.
1121222.content:
As the gentle breeze momentarily subsided, Bryan found himself thrown across to the far side of the table, seemingly miles away from his transport box and all important vial of shrinking antidote.

“Let’s see what we got here,” Joe said curiously as he checked out the contents of Bryan’s refrigerator. “Ah, soymilk...yuk!’

“Man, I wish I hadn’t even brought you now,” Tommy stated mildly perturbed as he reached down and grabbed the box on the kitchen table. “You’re right. It sure is light.”

“Cabernee Sovra…,” Joe tried unsuccessfully to read the label of the tall red bottle. He pulled the cork and took a giant swig. Then quickly headed for the sink and spewed the nasty liquid from his mouth. “Fuck, what is this shit.”

“It’s wine you bonehead,” Tommy stated. “Now stop messing around.”

Joe took one last look in the refrigerator. He pulled out two green bottles that were nearly hidden in the back behind the orange juice. He turned with a big smile and held them up for Tommy to see. “Now that’s what I’m talking bout.”

Joe tossed one of the Heinekens to Tommy. Minuscule Bryan just stood on the kitchen table unnoticed in a speechless stupor as he watched the two teen titans making themselves at home.

“Wicked! A plasma T.V.,” Joe blurted out as he noticed the giant plasma screen in the next room. He headed for the living room, his bottle of Heineken in hand. “Tommy, you gotta check this out.”
1121222.title: Making Themselves At Home

choices: Tommy sits down on Bryan's chair
Joe sits down on Bryan's chair
11212221.content:
Bryan watched helplessly as Tommy left the kitchen, the shipping box still held in one of his enormous hands.

He still heard their loud voices. "Joe, I've been to Mr. Smith's home before. Now, let's get out of his living room before you break something."

In dismay, Bryan saw the two teen behemoths walking back into the kitchen. He felt so dangerously small, exposed on the vast tabletop.

The boys continued to drink the beers they had taken from his fridge.

Suddenly, Joe walked toward the table. He lowered his arm to put his beer on the tabletop. Although nowhere near tiny Bryan's location, the tiny man screamed in panic for that one uncertain moment.

Then, as Joe turned, he bumped the table.

The impact was just enough. An unprepared Bryan found himself falling. The plunge ended on another vast wooden surface.

Stunned and sore, he gazed around and realized he had landed on the seat of one of the kitchen chairs.

"LET'S JUST SIT DOWN AND ENJOY OUR BEERS!" Tommy suggested.

Suddenly, Bryan felt his chair pulled out and watched as a huge, denim-covered ass prepared to take a seat.
11212221.title: Have a Seat

choices: Bryan plummets back to the floor
Tommy leans forward, ending Bryan's slide
112122211.content:
In horror, Mr. Smith willed his legs and feet to move. He sprinted across the wooden plain, but there was no where he could go.

Tommy planted his denim-covered butt in the chair at Mr. Smith's kitchen table and took another drink of his beer.

He tilted the chair back and smiled as Joe settled into the chair across the table from him.

"SO, LIKE, SHOULDN'T WE MAIL THAT PACKAGE?" Joe asked.

"AWW, WHAT'S THE RUSH?" Tommy said, tilting his jar back farther.

"DON'T FALL BACKWARD," Joe warned.

"I DIDN'T PLAN ON IT!" Tommy retorted.

------

With some shock, the tiny man realized he hadn't been squished beneath his teen neighbor's ass when Tommy sat down on the kitchen chair. There had been just enough space for a tunnel of denim to form where the jeans hugged the massive teenager's huge cheeks.

Before he could feel too relieved at this unexpected salvation, Mr. Smith felt the ground begin to tilt.

Slowly at first, the tilt in the landscape suddenly began to escalate and he felt himself sliding back through the tunnel, his tiny body slipping along the polished wood.

"Tommy!' Mr. Smith screamed in his weak, ineffectual voice. "Help me!"

The arch of in the tunnel of denim sped overhead as the teeny man continued to slide as the giant tilted the chair, unknowing of the effect that was producing for the shrunken unseen man.
112122211.title: Seated

choices: The neighbor's cat rushed into the kitchen
Joe's dog has followed them and runs inside
1121222112.content:
Just as suddenly, Tommy leaned forward in his chair, bringing all four legs of the chair back onto the kitchen floor.

Of course, his unseen, shrunken neighbor had no way of knowing the reason for the end of his steep slide, but he remained grateful for the abrupt halt.

Now, if he could only get safely from beneath the expanse of the teenager's denim-covered butt.

But, at any moment, the slightest shifting of the teen's mighty bulk could result in the tiny scientist's gruesome obliteration.

On his feet, the speck of a man raced along the denim tunnel, hoping to emerge into the light and find a way to contact his massive neighbor. At this point, Tommy was his only hope of rescue and restoration. The tiny man didn't dwell on the fact that the irresponsible and reckless teen now held such absolute and unknowing power over his fate.

"CAN'T WE HEAD TO THE POST OFFICE AND GET THIS OVER WITH?" Joe grumbled just as tiny Mr. Smith emerged into the open space of the kitchen chair not occupied by Tommy's butt.

Tommy grunted and rose to his feet. "BE WORTH GETTING IT OVER WITH IF IT MEANS I DON'T HAVE TO HEAR YOU COMPLAIN."

Far beneath his notice, the tiny man felt a wave of dismay and defeat.

"No," he screamed. "Don't leave me here!"

Joe followed Tommy to the back door. When he opened the door...
1121222112.title: Halting the slide

choices: Tugging on the collar makes the dog swallow Bryan
Joe evicts the dog (and Mr. Smith) from the house
11212221122.content:
When Tommy opened the door, a bundle of fur and nervous energy burst into the house.

"Joe! It's your damn mutt!" Tommy complained as the dog rushed into the kitchen and began sniffing near the chairs where the two teenagers had been seated.

"Riley!" Joe said sternly.

The dog kept sniffing the chairs, picking up the scent of its owner and his friend, as well as something else.

The horrified shrunken scientist tried to back away when the Godzilla-dog flung its forelegs onto the seat of the chair and started sniffing.

"Ahhh! Fuck! Get back!" The tiny man screamed.

"Get him out of Mr. Smith's kitchen before he makes a mess," Tommy yelled.

The dog's ears, being more sensitive, picked up tiny Mr. Smith's frightened cries and lunged forward.

"Oh shit!" Mr. Smith squeaked. "Tommy! Help me!"

The shrill little squeaks seemed to really get the mutt's attention. Its tongue lolled out of its mouth and it started licking the chair seat.

Joe laughed as he tried to grab the dog's collar. "Riley'll eat anything that's not nailed down."

"Well, don't let him eat anything here in Mr. Smith's kitchen," Tommy said.

"Forget that!" The tiny man screamed at the unhearing teenaged giants. "Don't let him eat me!"

Suddenly, the huge, slimy tongue lapped up the tiny man just as Joe got his hands on his dog's collar and pulled Riley away from the chair.
11212221122.title: Riley

112122212.content:
"LET'S JUST SIT DOWN AND ENJOY OUR BEERS!" Tommy told his friend.

Stunned and sore, Tommy's tiny neighbor overheard the statement. He leaped to his feet and gazed around at his surroundings. He groaned in dismay when he realized he had fallen onto the seat of one of his kitchen chairs. The box and the antidote were both suddenly completely beyond his reach.

And that, in an instant, became the least of his worries.

The little man was knocked on his butt again as a titanic arm pulled out the chair. Before he could right himself, the shrunken scientist gazed up just as a massively wide denim-covered ass prepared to sit in the chair. His scream got abruptly cut off.

Tommy also took a seat at the table with his friend. They clinked their beer bottles together.

"I'm glad your neighbor gives you the run of this place when he's gone," Joe said.

"Yeah," Tommy agreed. "And I think he will ever notice a couple of beers missing from the fridge."

They finished off the beers and started to leave. "I still need to get this to the post office," Tommy said, giving the little box a rattle.

Joe exited the door ahead of him, which let Tommy notice the little red splotch on the seat of his jeans.

He chuckled and said, "Joe, you sat in something."

Joe tried to twist to see what his friend was talking about.

"It's no big deal," Tommy said. "Barely noticeable."

Joe shrugged. "C'mon, let's get to the post office and drop off that package so we can enjoy the rest of the afternoon."

Tommy closed the door behind them. "Yeah, it shouldn't take long."

Now, no one would ever know what had become of the unfortunate Bryan Smith. The truth, that a much-respected and quite brilliant research scientist with EDL Labs, had become nothing more than a smear on the seat of teenager's denim jeans would never be guessed.
112122212.title: Smashing Exit

choices: Tommy mails his package
Joe volunteers to mail the package for Tommy
11212222.content:
Bryan watched the two giants depart his kitchen.

Just before leaving the room, Tommy lowered a colossal hand and returned the shipping package to the kitchen table.

Seconds later, he heard the noise from the other room as the giants watched television on Bryan's plasma screen set.

The tiny man burst out in shaky laughter. His entire body trembled, and he could not control his laughter. His thoughts kept racing about in his brain as he recalled how enormous Tommy and his buddy had looked to him. Nothing could have prepared him for how far apart he existed from his former world. He had turned himself into a speck that could be tossed about by a wayward breeze.

Finally, he managed to control his nerves. His heart beat at a more normal pace, and the adrenaline shock began to fade. His eyes focused on the enormous shipping box.

"I can still manage this," Bryan said. He raced toward the shipping box. On his way, he also retrieved the vial containing the formula to his antidote. He looked at the fluid within the sealed glass tube. He shuddered again as he recalled how closely he had come to losing the important vial. At his current size, he would never be able to make more of the antidote.

He stashed the vial in a pocket of his shirt, took a deep breath and walked toward the box. He found the entry incision he had sliced into the box. He picked up muffled conversation from the other room.

He questioned whether he shouldn't abandon this madness and use the antidote.

No, he decided. Despite Tommy unexpected early arrival, the situation was once again under control.

Bryan squeezed through the incision and made his way into the interior of the box.

Now, all he had to do was wait for Tommy to finish his job and mail the package.
11212222.title: Going Through With It

choices: Tommy and Joe go to the post office.
Tommy and Joe meet some friends on the way.
112122221.content:
Bryan wandered around within his small transport box with increasing fascination. To the shrunken scientist, it seemed as big as a warehouse. The white handkerchief wrapped around endlessly throughout the entire box. In the far back corner of the box, Bryan spotted the spare clothes he had packed, along with the bread crumbs. He reached down and picked up one of the “crumbs”.

“My God!” Bryan exclaimed aloud as he held the breadcrumb with both hands. “It’s as big as a fucking basketball.”

“At least I won’t go hungry,” Bryan thought as he dropped the mega-sized crumb back to the pile of six or so other ones. “Hey, look at that.”

Bryan noticed a beam of light shining through one of the air holes he had so carefully created. He walked up to the peep hole and peered out. He could see the two teen giants in the next room. They were indeed whoppers. Bryan estimated they stood at least 1500 feet tall. He was a little disappointed that Tommy wasn’t taking his job so seriously.

“Okay, here we go,” Bryan thought to himself as he watched Joe and Tommy re-entering the kitchen, headed right for him. Intense excitement filled his gut as if he was waiting on the start of some wild roller coaster ride at an amusement park.

“Come on Joe, I’ve got to get this package in mail,” Tommy insisted as he approached the kitchen table. He easily reached down and picked up the small feather-light box with one hand. He held a half drunk bottle of beer in the other. “I want to pick up that skateboard after I mail this thing.”

“Dude, chill,” Joe retorted as he lifted the Heineken bottle to his mouth in an effort to guzzle down the remaining contents before they left. He gave Tommy a small nudge. “Almost done bro.”

Joe’s playful shove was just enough to tip the Heineken bottle in Tommy’s hand. A small amount of beer spilled out, directly onto the box.

“Shit. Look what you made me do,” Tommy blurted out quite pissed at Joe. “Man, there’s beer all over it now.”

“Calm down Dawg,” Joe responded as he took a paper towel and started to wipe the beer off the small box. “See, no harm done.”

“Dude, this part of the address is all blurry now,” Tommy said as he noticed the spilled beer had caused the ink on the address label to run. He handed the box to Joe so he could see the damage he caused. “What am I going to do now?”

“Don’t worry. I can fix this,” Joe said as he examined the blurred address label. “It’s just this one number that’s messed up. I’ll take care of it.”

Joe found a pen and began writing over the blurred number on the address label. “Number two, one, eight,” Joe spoke as he “fixed” the obscured number. “See buddy, all better.”

“Are you sure that’s the same number that was on there before?” Tommy asked with a slight skepticism. “I can’t screw this up.”

“Dude, I’m sure,” Joe responded with a mischievous smile that left Tommy a little uncomfortable. “Don’t sweat it.”

Through the commotion, tiny Bryan had found an edge of the giant handkerchief and held on. He hadn’t planned on such a rough ride. He could only make out a couple sentences from the thunderous voices outside the box. Bryan regained some confidence as he put his hand on his shirt pocked and felt for the vial of shrinking antidote. He then tried to prepare himself what he knew was going to be one hell of a ride.

“Okay Joe, let’s go,” Tommy insisted as he took the small box and gripped it tightly in one hand.

choices: Overnight, please.
That two to three day deal
1121222211.content:
Bryan hadn't counted on such a rough ride, and the package containing the speck-sized scientist hadn't even reached the post office.

In hindsight, as he felt his nausea grow more severe from the constant motion, he regretted not installing the equivalent of a seatbelt inside the shipping package.

••••••

As Tommy walked to his vehicle, he juggled the package from hand to hand. Suddenly, he glanced at his friend. "Here, catch!" Tommy said, tossing the package to Joe.

Joe caught the package in one hand and watched as Tommy dug into the deep pocket of his baggy jeans for his keys.

•••••

Bryan screamed as he felt the warehouse-sized package turn topsy-turvy. The tiny man, thrown against the roof of the box, in the next instant felt the stomach-churning sensation of falling as he dropped back against the insulating handkerchief.

"What the fuck's he doing?" Bryan screamed in dismay.

••••••

The two youths piled into Tommy's vehicle. Joe stashed the package on the dashboard.

Tommy started the engine and pulled onto the street. He tried to think of the quickest route to the local post office.

•••••

Bryan made a valiant effort not to throw up. Finally, and not a second too soon, the box came to rest. After his stomach settled, he groaned and did a quick check. He felt certain he has suffered some bruises, but he seemed to have escaped more serious injury.

"What's the hell is Tommy doing anyway?" Bryan wondered aloud.

He saw a pinpoint of light and recognized one of the air holes. The hole admitted a pinprick of light, but Bryan discovered the hole was located too high on the wall of the box for him to peer out.

He got onto his unsteady feet. The floor beneath him trembled with a low, steady vibration.

Then, as he patted his shirt, he felt a sickening splash of horror. "The vial!" Bryan yelled. "Where the hell is the vial?"

In the upheaval, he had lost the vial with the antidote.

"Where is it?" Bryan cried.

He realized that the warehouse-sized box held a handkerchief with yards and yards of cotton fabric. The vial could have landed and gotten lost anywhere!

Suddenly, a terrible impact caused Eric to go airborne once again.

••••••

As Tommy turned his car into the parking lot of the post office, his front left tire dropped into a huge pothole in the asphalt.

"Damn, dawg!" Joe said.

"Sorry," Tommy said. "Fucking potholes!"

"That's your tax dollars at work, man," Joe joked.

"Hand me that damn package," Tommy said.

Joe grabbed up the package. "I'll go with you," he said, keeping the box in one hand.

"All right, man."

They entered the building and waited in line for about five minutes. Finally, a bored-looking man asked if he could help them.

"I need to mail a package," Tommy said.

Joe, who had read a poster with a listing of postal rates, tugged on his buddy's arm. "Hey, man," he said. "Look at the money you can save if you don't send that box overnight!"

"But Mr. Smith sounded really firm about that," Tommy said.

"But, man, look at how much more money you can pocket!" Joe said. "Think of that board you want."

The impatient postal worker glared at them. "Well, how do you want to mail your package?"

"Uh, how long does priority mail take?"

The man sighed. "Usually two or three days."

"Go for it," Joe said. "Mr. Smith's going to be gone for seven days. How will he know if you didn't send the package overnight?"

Tommy took the package out of his buddy's hands and placed it on the counter. He turned to the postal worker and said...
1121222211.title: Rough Ride to the Post Office

choices: Bryan arrives at Zack's dorm.
The box gets lost in the mail.
11212222111.content:
Bryan had not anticipated how unbearable the journey would be traveling within the small box. All his previous experiments had been highly controlled. He shuddered to imaging how much rougher the journey would get after he was in the official custody of the post office.

He wished he could just end this hair-brained idea, but the all important vial that could restore him to normal size was lost—somewhere within the box. Bryan had just short of twenty four hours to find the shrinking antidote. Then, without warning, the box was tilted on its side, sending Bryan falling onto one of the walls of the box.

“Overnight, I guess,” Tommy replied reluctantly to the postal worker. Joe sighed and gave Tommy a look of disappointment. “Hell, I’ll still have about eighty five dollars left Joe.”

“Okay—step to the side, fill this out, put the package inside and seal it shut,” the postal worker instructed Tommy as he handed him a large pliable overnight envelope. “That will be thirteen sixty five please.”

Tommy addressed the overnight envelope, reading the address out loud as he wrote.

“Hurry up, Dude,” Joe urged Tommy impatiently. “We’ve got to get to the skate shop.”

The giant’s voices from outside the box sounded like distant thunder. Bryan could hear Tommy’s voice read the address as he was labeling the overnight envelope. As he listened intently to the slightly muffled boom of Tommy’s voice, Bryan thought he heard the words two eighteen.

“Nooh, that’s not right at all,” Bryan thought to himself as a nervous chill overtook his tiny body. “I must have heard that wrong.”

“All set,” Tommy said with a smile as he handed the overnight envelope over to the postal worker. “C’mon Joe. Let’s go.”

The postal worker tossed the overnight envelope into a large bin as Tommy and Joe exited. The brilliant research scientist was on his way.

“I should have thought to bring a fucking flashlight,” Bryan thought as he sat in the now darkened box within the overnight shipping envelope. As the words “two eighteen” popped into his head again, he began an urgent search in the darkness for the lost vial of shrinking antidote. “I’ve got to find that fucking vial.”
11212222111.title: On The Way

choices: The college guy opens the package
The dude leaves the package outside Zack's door
112122221111.content:
Zack left his dorm room to head for his first class.

On his mind was the promise from his uncle that a special package would be arriving. Bryan had told him to expect a delivery in a couple of days.

"Well, it has been a couple of days," Zack said to himself as he closed the door to Dorm Room 212.

Last evening, overcome with building curiosity, Zack had phoned his uncle. He only got Bryan's voice mail.

Instead of leaving a message, he had hung up the phone, figuring he could wait one more day.

Zack strolled through the corridor. As he passed Dorm Room 218, the door opened suddenly and a big, half-naked guy stumbled into the hall. He wore a pair of form-fitting boxer briefs.

"Hey, Zack," the guy said. He had dark, disheveled hair and he looked at Zack through sleep-bleary eyes.

"Hi, man," Zack said. "I'm headed to class. Uh, shouldn't you be on your way, too?"

The guy laughed. "I stayed up late," he answered while scratching absently at the crotch of his shorts. "Thought I'd blow off my morning classes."

Zack shrugged. "Well, see you later."

Zack liked the guy, but he was almost too much of a slacker for Zack.

Zack exited the dorm building and headed across campus toward his first class. Only a moment after his departure, a postal carrier entered the dorm building with a brown sack filled with packages and letters.

••••••

Inside the package, Bryan's torment continued. His trip, courtesy of the U.S. Postal Service, had been an endless hellish nightmare. The tiny man had lost all track of time. He didn't have a clue to how long he had been in the box. He had tried to locate the missing vial of antidote.

After hours of crawling in darkness on his hands and knees, Bryan finally gave up on locating the vial within the warehouse-sized box stuffed with yard upon yard of cotton fabric comprising the handkerchief he had placed in the box for insulation.

Fortunately, during his searching, he did locate one of the basketball-sized crumbs of food, so he did manage to avoid hunger pangs during the torture of the journey.

••••••

The postal carrier stopped outside a dorm room on the second floor of the building. He knocked on the door.

A big, muscle-bound guy in boxer briefs opened the door.

"I've got a package for Zack..."

"Huh?" The guy looked like he had just rolled out of bed.

The postal carrier frowned and shoved the package toward the college student. "It's a package for Room 218."

With the package safely in the guy's hands, the postal carrier turned and walked away.

Zack's dorm neighbor looked down at the label on the box. He saw his own dorm room number but Zack's name.

•••••••

Inside the box, tossed back and forth again, Bryan managed to find a stable niche in the folds of the handkerchief in time to hear an indistinct conversation. Once again, he heard the words "Room Two Eighteen" uttered by a giant.

"That's not right," Bryan said. "What the hell's going on?"
112122221111.title: Delivered

choices: Rick notices something small scurrying from the box.
Rick doesn't notice Bryan as he runs from the box.
1121222211111.content:
Rick tossed the package on his desk, walked over to a small fridge, and pulled out a half drunk Mountain Dew. He guzzled the bottle dry in a few seconds. The buff college guy headed back to his desk and plopped down in wooden chair, creating an unsteady creaking noise.

Rick flipped the package over a couple of times and then re-examined the label.

“Fuckin’ Zack don’t live here,” Rick said to himself as a bit of curiosity began to set in. “Guess the fucker who sent this got the address wrong.”

“Probably something from Zack’s rich uncle,” Rick thought as just a tinge of jealousy set in as he thought of Zack’s sweet little blue sports car. “Guess I’ll give it to Zack when he gets back from class.”

Bryan was tossed as the box was turned upside down a couple of times. He heard a distant boom as a strange giant talked, but he couldn’t make out any words. He just knew it wasn’t Zack’s voice. Bryan thought he heard the postal carrier earlier say he had a package for room two eighteen.

“This can’t be right,” Bryan thought nervously as the box became eerily motionless. The thought of being delivered to the wrong room and a complete stranger terrified the tiny scientist—especially since he had no way to return to normal size without the vial of antidote that was lost earlier. “I know I put 212 on this damn package!”

Rick sat thinking for a couple of minutes, trying to completely wake up. He brushed his fingers lightly across the overnight envelope wondering what was inside.

“Hell! I’m just going to open the fucker,” the muscular college guy mumbled defiantly. “Its got my fucking address on it anyway.”

Bryan froze when he heard the thunderous intentions of the strange giant from the outside world. “Oh God no, this can’t be happening!”

Rick easily pulled away a thin strip from the top of the envelope and gave a quick look inside. He reached in and pulled out a little cardboard box. His large hand engulfed the small box as he examined it from all sides. He chuckled as he tossed it in the air a couple of times, and even held it up to his nose and gave it a quick smell. “Fuckin box is light as a feather.”

A small amount of light entered the box as it left the overnight shipping envelope. Bryan’s mind raced for some sort of plan. He was beginning to realize his package had been misdirected and he was about to be discovered by some strange giant. The bug-sized man knew there was no time to resume his search for the lost vial that could return him to normal size. “I gotta fucking hide!”

Bryan tucked himself just under an edge of the immense handkerchief, positioning himself so he could just peek out from the edge.

Rick positioned the box on the desk before him, and reached into a cup. He pulled out a long pair of sharp scissors. He placed the pointed tip of one of the razor sharp legs of the scissors on one edge of the box and gave a quick JAB.

“Ooooh Fuck!” Bryan screamed as the sharp metallic scissors entered the box with a loud, powerful screeching noise. “You’re going to kill me!”

Rick pushed and pulled the scissors in a sawing motion until he created a major tear in one edge of the box. The brawny guy then poked two fingers in the tear and effortlessly ripped open the small box. Curiously the box seemed to contain only one white handkerchief.

Nothing could have prepared Bryan for the sight he was currently witnessing. The young man before him was a monster. Bryan shivered as he peeked from behind the handkerchief, looking skyward at the looming figure.

Suddenly a gigantic hand began to descent toward the handkerchief, and him.

Consumed with fear, Bryan began to run.
1121222211111.title: Meet Rick

choices: Bryan keeps trying to communicate
Rick wants a better look
11212222111111.content:
Bryan, having spent the last couple of days trapped helplessly within the giant box, made a quick dash for freedom. Leaving the package behind him, Bryan sprinted across the giant's desktop.

He stopped when he found himself exposed on a vast, flat surface. The tiny man spun himself around in a full circle as he looked desperately for a place of concealment.

Suddenly, a huge stretch of familiar white fabric dropped down onto the surface, trapping Bryan between the box and what he recognized as the handkerchief the giant had removed from the box and then dropped on the desktop.

Bryan, in total confusion, raced back toward the box.

“WELL, WHAT THE FUCK?” The giant said in a loud tone.

“Oh shit!” Bryan changed direction and ran back toward the handkerchief. He didn't dare even look up. He reached the outer edge of the huge expanse of white cloth and flung himself forward to land in a crevice formed by a fold in the cloth.

But, instead of offering the speck-sized man any protection, the fabric began to buck and warp as a giant hand picked up the handkerchief.

Rick, having spied the tiny creature's darting movements before hiding in a fold of the cloth, shook out the handkerchief. His sharp eyes saw a pale form fall onto the desk.

Bryan, on his back, opened his eyes and saw a massive hand, palm side down, rushing toward him. The hand filled his entire range of view. He could not even see the hand's owner, although he knew the giant must be one of his nephew's fellow college students.

He screamed as two colossal fingers reached toward him.

Two enormous fingertips closed on his tiny form and grasped him. “No! Let me go!" Bryan cried. " Zack! Where are you?”

"NO WAY!" Rick said. Intrigued, his voice began to take on an excited edge. "IT'S A LITTLE MAN!"

Bryan felt as if he might explode. He knew the giant must be exerting barely any pressure, but the shrunken man felt as if trapped in an enormous vise.

At least the giant recognized him as a human being! For a few seconds, Bryan feared being mistaken for a bug and indiscriminately squished by the colossal college student.

“WHY THE HELL'S ZACK HAVING A TEENY-TINY MAN SHIPPED TO HIM?”

Rick turned the packing box on its side.

He unclasped his fingers and let the tiny speck of a man drop onto the label spread across the surface of the box.

Bryan, glad to breathe freely again, looked beneath his feet. For the first time, in hand-scrawled letters bigger than his body, the tiny man got a glimpse of the blurred label and Joe’s bungled attempt to fix the damage.

“Room 218!” Bryan exclaimed. His fear confirmed, he lifted his face and stared up at the colossal guy. “No! It was supposed to be 212. Where am I?”

Rick stared in amazement as he saw Bryan take a few steps on the white shipping label.

“AWESOME!"

The giant's voice, so close and so loud, terrified Bryan.

Bryan, who had been staring at the damage where Rick had ripped into the box with scissors, turned and stared up at the giant. He felt very insignificant under the giant's intense scrutiny.

The huge man's hairy chest spread out like a mountain. The giant's head and shoulders looked like higher peaks in an unbelievable mountain range.

But, Bryan reasoned, this giant surely knew his nephew. Maybe, he hoped, the giant could help him.

"Can you help me?" Bryan screamed as loudly as he could. "My nephew's a student here!"

Rick continued to stare without changing his fascinated expression.

"He can't hear me," Bryan said.
11212222111111.title: Rick Makes A Discovery

choices: Size Comparisons 101
Bryan resists
112122221111111.content:
The giant watched tiny Bryan’s every move.

“MUST BE SOME SORT OF REPLICANT,” Rick muttered. “OR A TINY CLONE.”

Bryan, from atop the erroneous mailing label on the savaged box, listened to the giant. “No! I just shrunk!”

“ZACK MUST HAVE ORDERED A TINY CLONE. COOL!”

Bryan couldn’t believe his ears. The hulking moron must have watched far too many bad sci-fi flicks.

“I am Zack’s uncle!” Bryan shouted, but as he stared up at Rick he had to face facts and admit his puny voice could not reach the giant’s ears.

“WHAT WILL THEY THINK OF NEXT?” Rick wondered aloud in a voice filled with admiration for his unexpected find.

The giant leaned back in his chair, and Bryan gazed up at Rick’s sprawling body. He had a weird mental image of himself as some sort of prize from a Crackerjack box.

“I DON’T GUESS ZACK WOULD MIND ME HAVING SOME FUN WITH HIS TOY,” Rick said. “JUST SO LONG AS I DON’T BREAK IT.”

“It!” Bryan said indignantly. “Toy!”

Then, he swallowed hard as he wondered what Rick had in mind for fun.
112122221111111.title: Crackerjack Prize

choices: First, Rick wants to have a conversation...
Before a conversation, First, Rick wants to establish just who's in charge h
1121222211111112.content:
"AT LEAST, I'LL TRY NOT TO BREAK IT. BUT THEN AGAIN, IF I GET A LITTLE CARELESS, I'LL JUST NEVER MENTION IT TO ZACK." Rick didn't have animosity towards Zack, but he did think that he was a little spoiled and even bratt sometimes. It wasn't going to kill him to not recieve a package.

"AFTER ALL," Rick mused, justifying his actions. "IT IT *IS* JUST A CLONE. THERE MUST BE AT LEAST A HUNDRED OF THESE!"

Despite the ideas entering Bryan's head about his next science expiriment -- cloning? maybe, he thought -- Bryan was ambivalent. At least he'd made contact, but on the other hand -- look who he'd come into contact with. A lacrosse player with a brain that seemed to be smaller than the puck.

Still, Bryan was incredibly afraid and humiliated. At his normal size, Bryan would have been intimidated by Rick. But at a fourth of an inch tall, he was, well, three hundred times as intimidated.

"HEY, HOW TALL ARE YOU, ANYWAY?"

Bryan wasn't sure how to respond to the comment, but realized quickly that he wouldn't need to. As Rick had said that, he reached toward Bryan. Bryan shrieked, utterly afraid. The mere width of Rick's finger was 25 feet across.

Bryan wanted to run but he realized that he couldn't just jump -- it was a 50 foot drop to the ground, one that Bryan wasn't sure he could survive, even at the falling velocity of his newly diminished state.

The enormous finger bearing down on Bryan and getting closer, Bryan made a split-second decision. He jumped *towards* the finger.

The finger was close enough to Bryan that he could reach it. Bryan hit the front of the finger, and he immeditaley grabbed at a part of the underside of the finger. It was slippery, but Bryan realized that such factors were irrelevant in his shrunken state. The mere presence of sweat on something was enough to make Bryan cling to it.

Sticking to the bottom of the finger, Bryan had originally attended to make himself fall from a lesser distance. But he realized that Rick was quicker than he'd given him credit for; directly under him was Rick's other hand. He was trapped.

"LET ME GO!" Bryan screamed, as loud as he could.

The hand suddenly turned over and Bryan fell into the other hand, which contracted slightly. Bryan felt like he was in a dome; the edges of the hand rising up around him.

Rick has very good hearing, and he was sure that he had just heard a call for help. A miniscule one, but definitley there.

"YOU...YOU CAN TALK?"

Of course, Rick had assumed that Bryan was mute, as well as a clone. Bryan sighed.
1121222211111112.title: Escape Attempt.

choices: Bryan understands
Bryan tries one last protest
11212222111111122.content:
"Let me go!" Bryan shouted, trying to make his demand sound as stern as possible.

The ludicrous reality of the situation, however, left Rick straining to hear the tiny man's demand. The giant lacrosse player didn't seem at all pleased by what he managed to hear.

With Bryan still held in the middle of his palm, Rick began to slowly form a fist.

Bryan shrieked and demanded, again in a barely audible voice, that Rick stop.

"LISTEN TO ME!" Rick said in a voice loud and unmistakable. "I COULD CRUSH YOU LIKE A BUG. THE ONLY REASON I DON'T IS ZACK PROBABLY PAID A LOAD OF MONEY FOR YOU."

Bryan started to interrupt, but Rick kept talking. "YOU WILL DO AS I SAY, OR ELSE..."

Rick raised his other hand and formed a tightly closed fist for emphasis.

Bryan looked across the gulf to Rick's huge fist and felt his resolve diminish.

"AM I UNDERSTOOD?" Rick demanded.
11212222111111122.title: Rick Takes Charge

choices: Bryan tries to get to the floor.
Bryan thinks of a way to contact the giant in this room.
11212222111112.content:
Bryan ran with all his might from the box onto the vast plain of Rick’s desk. He didn’t dare look up. He spotted an enormous stapler and quickly scurried behind it, hidden from the giant’s view.

“What the fuck is this crap,” Rick mumbled in disgust as he lifted the handkerchief from the ripped open box and gave it a quick once over. “This has got to be some kind of joke!”

Rick gathered up the box and its contents with one hand. He grunted as he tossed the handful in a small trash can.

At least safe for the moment, Bryan was mesmerized as he took in all the features of the young titan before him. His hair was dark and a little grungy, and his massive face was covered with dark stubble that looked to be about two day’s growth. And even to a normal sized person, he would be considered a big guy. But to tiny Bryan, he was colossal.

Bryan then began to look around the immense dorm room. The floor was littered with dirty clothes, textbooks, and an array of other items typical to a college dorm room. The entire room smelled of dirty socks and stale pizza. Bryan noticed a strange blue and gold helmet sitting high on a shelf and a handful of UCLA lacrosse posters tacked to the walls.

“This guy’s a pig,” Bryan thought as he looked around the giant’s room.

Bryan froze as the giant stood up, sending shock waves throughout the desk. The young giant was impressive enough sitting down—but when he stood, it was truly breathtaking. Bryan looked on in awe at the mountainous college guy clad only in a tight, well worn pair of boxer briefs. He felt very insignificant and small.

The shrunken scientist watched as the overly hairy behemoth walked over and plopped face down on his bed. He seemed to be out in a matter of seconds.

Bryan was slightly relieved to know he was at least at UCLA, and probably in his nephew’s dorm. Somehow he had to find a way to contact Zack.
11212222111112.title: Lacrosse Players are Big and Hairy

choices: Bryan falls into the well-worn Nike shoe.
Bryan falls onto a stray sock, next to the shoe.
112122221111121.content:
Bryan pondered his situation as the behemoth of a college student began to snore. The bug-sized man took in the vastness of the dorm room once more and then fixed his eyes on the garbage can in a nearby corner.

“The antidote must be in there,” Bryan thought as he remembered the giant trashing the box and its contents. “I’ve got to get down from here.”

“Oh fuck!” The tiny man screamed as he peeked over the edge of the desk. “That is a long ways down!”

Bryan searched for a way off the mountain of a desk that trapped him. It seemed hopeless as he walked from end to end. Even an experienced rock climber would have found it impossible to traverse. Until, Bryan noticed the power cord from a lamp dangling to the floor below. He surmised it would be no problem to climb the cord to the floor below.

The quarter-inch tall man wrapped his arms and legs around the thick cord and carefully began his descent. It was much more difficult and terrifying than he thought it would be. About half way down, he began to get tired and disoriented. He looked down, and to his horror, could only gasp at the king-sized Nike shoe below. The opening of the shoe was directly below him, stuffed with an equally terrifyingly enormous sock.

“Gotta hold on,” the tiny man thought as he felt his grip begin to loosen. “Nooooooooh!”
112122221111121.title: Big Lacrosse Players Wear Big Shoes

choices: Rick awakes and reaches for his shoes
Bryan finds a way out of the shoe
1121222211111211.content:
“Please,” Bryan begged his straining muscles. “Oh god! I can’t...”

He never got to finish the words “hold on.” As he lost his grip on the thick cable, Bryan screamed as he fell about a foot, or the equivalent of nearly 300 feet from his diminutive perspective.

Despite the terrifying plunge, the impact proved relatively soft. Not only was his mass of no great significance, but the bottom of the sneaker’s interior provided a soft surface for his landing.

He immediately noticed the powerful stench that permeated the giant’s Nike shoe. In this competition, the rank odor of dirty, sweaty socks now completely overpowered stale pizza and other scents.

A rolled up sock blocked the way into the toe region of the shoe and also added to the overwhelming stench of foot sweat within the interior of Rick’s enormous shoe.

Bryan got on his feet, noticing how the surface beneath him felt damp and squishy. He stared up at fifty-foot walls that completely surrounded him.

"God! This guy must have monster-sized feet!" Bryan said with a twinge of fear.

In fact, Rick did wear size 16 sneakers.

“I’ve got to get out of here,” Bryan said. The terrible smell made the tiny man feel sick to his stomach.

His antidote, he hoped, could be recovered from within the giant’s trash can. Failing that, he could attempt to make contact with his nephew.

None of those existed as possibilities, however, if he could not find a way out of the giant’s shoe.
1121222211111211.title: In a Size 16

choices: "Yes, I am hungry."
"Thanks, but some other time."
11212222111112111.content:
Despite repeated attempts to scale the walls of the giant sneaker, the tiny scientist made no detectable progress at all.

Slowly, his strength faded, his endurance dwindled, as the powerful fumes from the sweat-permeated spongy bottom of the sneaker engulfed him at every moment.

Then, outside the shoe, the tiny man heard a noise.

Before he could determine it's origin, he felt the shoe lifted.

-----

Rick grabbed his shoes, preparing to slip them onto his feet for a trip to pick up some food. Still bleary-eyed, he didn't see the tiny form that plunged down into the depths of the Size 16 shoe, coming to a stop near the toe region of the colossal footwear.

He slipped on the shoes, grabbed his wallet and keys and headed out the door.

------

Inside the shoe, the space that had seemed so enormous to the shrunken scientist suddenly became very cramped as the huge lacrosse player shoved his bare feet into the sneakers.

The tiny man was tossed to and fro, before he was finally thrown into the gap between two of Rick's huge toes.

There, he struggled to remain, fearing a worst location, such as beneath one of those huge toes or even the wide sole of that bare foot.

------

As he left his dorm room, Rick met Zack in the hallway.

"Want to get something to eat?" Rick asked.

Zack, of course with no idea that his uncle was a passenger in his friend's shoe, answered...
11212222111112111.title: Sharing the shoe with Rick's foot

choices: Proceed to the burger joint
Zack postpones dinner and heads back to the dorm
112122221111121111.content:
"Yes, I'm starving, man," Zack answered.

"Cool," Rick said. "I'm hungry, too."

He lifted his shoe and stomped it down quickly, trying to dislodge a pebble or bit of crud that had gotten caught beneath his toes. Seemingly having done the trick, he suggested they head to a burger joint near campus.

"Sounds good to me," Zack answered.

They left the dorms and got into the new car that Zack's uncle had bought for him. As they departed campus, and with his brain finally kicking into gear, Rick remembered the package that had arrived with his address but Zack's name.

"Hey, man," he said. "I forgot to mention that I think a package for you got delivered to my place."

"Oh, sweet," Zack said. "I've been expecting something from my uncle."

"The same guy who bought you this car?"

"The one and the same," Zack said. "We'll open it when we get back to the dorm."

Rick coughed. "Uh, I already opened it, man. I wanted to make sure it wasn't for me."

Despite being irritated that Rick had opened his package, Zack chose not to make a big deal of it. "So, what was it?"

Rick laughed. "That's the thing, man. I couldn't tell it was anything except a freakin' handkerchief."

Zack frowned. "That can't be right."

"I swear to you man," he said. "Except for that handkerchief, that damn box was empty..."
112122221111121111.title: Dinner

choices: Rick and Zack head back to Zack's dorm
Zack and Rick head back to Rick's dorm
1121222211111211111.content:
His nephew's largest toe trapped the tiny man between the ridged skin covering the massive appendage and the moist, spongy interior of the sneaker.

If finding himself trapped in his nephew's shoe had seemed bad, finding himself now caught under one of the college students toes must be infinitely worse.

He tried to wriggle right, then left, to crawl from beneath the oppressive weight of the enormous toe. Although he was unbelievably smaller than his nephew, the little man's actions proved adequate enough to be perceived by Zack.

Suddenly, the toe and its neighbors flexed. The incredible weight forced the air from his lungs. The tiny man tried to scramble free, convinced that if the pressure increased much more he would get smeared between Zack's toe and the inside of the shoe.

Before he could do so, the entire shoe slammed down with incredible force. He was thrown free of the toe, but was now trapped in the cramped niche of space at the tip of the sneaker, facing that row of menacing toes.

He rubbed his side, feeling sore and bruised. Zack, by merely flexing his toe, had come close to breaking several of his tiny uncle's ribs.

He wished he could overhead any of the conversation between Zack and his huge friend, but being trapped inside the shoe muffled any sounds form the outside world.

As the temperature inside soared, he had to wait in fear and discomfort, hoping he could make it out in one piece and get another chance at making contact with his nephew. Zack now represented his only possibility of regaining his size and a normal life.

While the two college students ate their burgers, the little man was given a brief respite from the constant pounding he suffered whenever his nephew was on the go and walking. Each step also threatened to dislodge him and send him back beneath Zack's toes or, even worse, under the long, sleek bare sole or heel of the massive college student's foot.

The heat and humidity inside the shoe combined to make him drowsy, but he was jerked back to full alert when Zack started moving again. He hoped his nephew was headed back to the dorm. If he could hold out a little longer, Zack was certain to take off the sneakers.

"I'll have to be ready," the tiny man thought. "He's my only hope of getting out of this mess."
1121222211111211111.title: For the duration

choices: Rick gets ready for lacrosse practice.
Rick tosses his shoes in his gym bag.
11212222111112112.content:
Deep within the pit of the gigantic jock’s massive sneaker, Bryan began to get a little queasy. The air around him was thick with putrid foot stench. It was all he could do to keep from throwing up. “How could any guy’s shoe smell this fucking bad?”

Bryan knew he had to escape this hideous smelling shoe as fast as possible. The thought of ending up an insignificant red smear on the bottom of some college guy’s foot was not the way he wanted it all to end.

The quarter inch tall scientist walked around the towering walls of the sneaker, surveying for any possible way to climb out. The fabric was extremely worn and smooth. The walls of the sneaker would be impossible to scale. He kept walking around the wall of the sneaker looking for any means of escape. When he saw the enormous number 16 stitched high on the side of the shoe, he nervously gulped—and moved on.

He made his way to the jumbo sized sock balled up in the front of the Nike sneaker. The massive opening of the sock loomed directly in front of him, and it really stank. Bryan held one hand to his nose as he approached. As he looked upward, Bryan noticed many folds in the sock extended to the very top of the shoe, almost like a fabric ladder.

A huge adrenaline rush washed over Bryan and his heart pounded. He jumped up to the first fold in the damp musky sock, and then reached for the next highest fold. The tiny scientist no longer cared about the sock’s heinous smell. It was now his salvation.

Bryan reached the top of the shoe rather quickly and carefully crawled out onto the ledge that was the top of the shoe’s tongue. He stood with the satisfaction and pride of someone that had just scaled some daunting cliff or dangerous mountain. “God—this is one fucking huge ass shoe.”

The climb down would be easier, but no less dangerous. He began his descent through the maze of shoelaces, headed for the toe. When Bryan reached the toe of the shoe, he had to rest. As he sat on the dirty worn shoe leather, he pondered his situation. The tiny vial of antidote that could restore him to normal was probably in the enormous waste basket. At his meager size, Bryan knew it would be nearly impossible for him to retrieve. Somehow, he would have to get help from a giant.

But this giant made Bryan very nervous. What would a guy like that do if he found someone as small as him? Would he even recognize him as a man, or think he was just some bug, and stomp him out of existence with those huge feet of his?

Suddenly Bryan froze as the room became silent. The giant had stopped snoring. The silence was pierced by a thunderous yawn. Rick had awakened.

“Fuck! I’m going to be late for practice,” Rick thought aloud as he rose from his bed and glanced at the clock. Bryan watched in horror as the gigantic college student’s massive form came into view.
11212222111112112.title: Escaping The Shoe

As Rick’s enormous feet hit the floor, the entire dorm room shook. Tiny Bryan lost his balance and fell. He began to slide down the massive toe of the sneaker to the floor below.

Bryan landed with a tiny plop on the floor. Shaken, but unhurt, his attentions focused on the colossal young college guy that had just awakened.

The six foot five athlete stood tall and stretched his arms high over his head, nearly touching the ceiling with his fingertips. Rick let out a long pronounced yawn that literally produced goose-bumps on the bug sized scientist that was witnessing the awe-inspiring events from far below.

As Bryan looked at Rick’s enormous bare feet directly in from of him, he realized once again just how small and insignificant he really was. The stunning college student that stood before him could stamp out his existence with nothing more than one of his gigantic toes.

Realizing that Rick might soon be needing his sneakers, Bryan began to traverse the immense dorm room floor for a better hiding spot. “I’ve got to get away from these fucking shoes!”

Bryan ran as fast as he could in the direction of the nearest wall, in hopes of finding a spot least likely to be stomped on by the massive feet of the giant that he currently was sharing this room with. Tiny Bryan watched the giant’s actions from the corner of his eye as he ran through a maze of dirty clothes strewn randomly about, scattered cd’s, empty pizza box’s and beer cans.

Rick quickly pulled on a clean t-shirt and a pair of gray cotton shorts with a small UCLA lacrosse logo stitched on the side. As he reached for his Nike sneakers, he swatted at an annoying fly that was buzzing around. The common housefly buzzed over a pizza box and swooped over tiny Bryan at lightning speed. Uninterested at the tiny human man, the fly continued its speedy flight until it landed inside the waste paper basket on the other side of the room.

* * *

“Oh fuck!” were the only words the quarter inch tall man could manage as a fly the size of a small horse buzzed directly over his head. Bryan watched with relief as the detestable monster disappeared from sight into the trash can.

Miniature Bryan once again focused his attentions on Rick as he watched the behemoth slip on his white athletic socks and Nike sneakers. He cowered in his hiding spot near a wall of the dorm room and wondered what he should do next. Trying to contact the giant that occupied this room seemed out of the question.

Bryan watched fearfully as Rick finished tying his massive sneakers. The titanic athlete then grabbed a gym bag and began to stuff it with various lacrosse gear and some clean clothes.

* * *

The housefly buzzed around inside the trash can in search of its next treat. Rick’s messy dorm room had been a smorgasbord of unlimited delights for the lucky fly. The nasty fly continued its investigation of the trash can until it landed on a strange glass container that was leaking a liquid with an unfamiliar smell. The greedy fly gulped up all of the strange substance until there was none left.

* * *

Just as Rick was about to head out to lacrosse practice, he noticed a bizarre buzzing sound. He looked around the room in an effort to locate the unusual noise. The buzzing kept getting louder and louder.

“Where the fuck is that noise coming from,” Rick murmured to himself as he scanned the small, messy dorm room. His eyes then focused on the small trash can. “What the fuck?”

Suddenly with the explosive power of a small stick of dynamite the trash can was violently ripped apart. The detestable creature that burst from the can was a housefly the size of a small dog. And it was growing rapidly. Rick backed away to the far side of the dorm room. He grabbed a baseball bat that was leaning in the corner.

As Rick lifted the bat in an effort to defend himself, the vile, menacing fly had grown to the size of a Saint Bernard. He watched in disbelief as the disgusting creature flew around his room, releasing at random a nauseating liquid that seemed to dissolve whatever it touched.

Just as Rick though of making a quick dash for the door, the hideous fly flew by and released its acidy saliva all over the door and the handle. It then started to fly right at Rick. The muscular college athlete lifted the bat and prepared to swing.

As Rick sprinted across campus in an effort to make it to practice on time, Bryan held on as best he could to the unknown smelly cloth that surrounded him. In near darkness, Bryan’s surroundings shifted alarmingly as the monstrous contents were jostled about. The shrunken scientist feared at any second he would be crushed by the gigantic college athlete’s size sixteen sneakers.

Rick made it to the gymnasium in record time and headed for the locker room. In the locker room, his teammates were already in the process of getting changed for practice. After some quick small talk with several of the guys, Rick slung his gym bag down next to his locker and unzipped the bag. He pulled out some pads, a helmet, his sneakers, and a gold Under-armour t-shirt.

Rick placed his street clothes in the locker and quickly got dressed in his lacrosse practice gear. He pulled on an extremely snug fitting gold Under-armour t-shirt, and then proceeded with his socks and sneakers.

“Man, I really gota do some laundry,” Rick said to himself as he took a quick sniff of his Thorlo socks before his put them on his oversized feet. “Maybe next week.”

* * *

Bryan covered his eyes as the bright light of the locker room flooded the gym bag. As the light revealed the contents of the gym bag, Bryan was horrified by the wickedly huge lacrosse gear that surrounded him.

Before the bug sized man could even manage a scream, Rick’s monstrous hand entered the gym bag and began pulling out the huge pieces of lacrosse gear, one by one. Bryan held on with all his might to the putrid smelling t-shirt, horrified as the burly lacrosse player lifted it high into the air.

As the Under-armour t-shirt was lifted, the folds in the shirt straighten out, and tiny Bryan lost his grip and began a quick descent to the hard cement floor below.

Luckily, the miniaturized scientist landed on one of Rick’s humongous Thorlo socks. He quickly scurried off the sock onto the dull gold painted cement floor just before Rick’s massive hand reached for his sock. Bryan surveyed the vast locker room in disbelief. The thunderous voices of the rest of the lacrosse team echoed throughout the locker room. The sight of the gigantic athletes changing into their lacrosse gear was nothing less than breathtaking.

Tiny Bryan was awestruck as he looked skyward at the impressive athlete. As the hulking lacrosse player finished up by donning his should pads and helmet, the transformation was complete. Now, nothing less than a colossal gladiator towered over Bryan. The meager scientist stood mesmerized at the awesome sight. Bryan soon regained his senses as Rick’s massive shoe rose and passed directly over him.

* * *

Rick closed his locker and quickly headed to the field with his teammates, oblivious to the traumatized quarter inch tall man he left next to his locker.
