Bryan hit the floor as he ridiculously thought that staying low could save him from Rick's colossal shoe should the titanic athlete step down on him.

Fortunately, the shoe merely sailed overhead as the big lacrosse player joined his teammates on the field for practice, leaving the locker room deserted of everyone except for the tiny, traumatized scientist.

For several minutes, Bryan stood, trembling, aghast at how close he had came to being squashed beneath the giant shoe.

When he felt more calm, he took an unobstructed look around the vast room. He saw several benches rising up like strange plateaus from the flat, gold-painted floor. The rows of lockers rose like metal cliffs. A few colossal gym bags looked the size of a sports coliseum to the tiny man.

The atmosphere reeked of a strange blend of powerful odors, including mildew and the unmistakable sweat of the jocks who used the locker room.

Bryan saw a stray sock beneath one of the benches. After a quick jaunt, he stood in the shadow of the enormous sock. A pungent odor from the damp, sweaty sock filled his nostrils and stung his eyes.

Despite his curiosity, Bryan beat a hasty retreat from the immediate vicinity of the sock. Choking and near tears, he took in some desperate breaths of semi-fresh air. "I've never smelled anything that awful!" Bryan exclaimed only to hear his teeny voice get lost in the vast emptiness of the locker room.

As his head cleared, more pressing thoughts intruded into his consciousness. Back at the dormitory, he had at least been close to making contact with his nephew. To get back to normal size, Bryan still needed to get help from Zack.

"And, last time we talked, Zack didn't play lacrosse," Bryan said, putting his brain to work to think of a plan.

He needed to think of a way back to the dorm. The most obvious way, he decided, would be a return trip via Rick's gym bag.

The big jock, unfortunately, had secured his bag inside his locker.

"He'll have to get changed," Bryan thought. "When he does, I'll need to be ready and find a way back inside the bag."

Bryan was secure in his goal, confident that he could prepare himself to get back inside the giant gym bag as soon as his nephew's titanic friend returned and removed it from the locker.

That was the plan at least, until the thundering roar rushed upon him with the return of Rick and his fellow lacrosse players from their practice. The giants took him by surprise, forcing the shocked shrunken scientist to seek immediate cover.

Unfortunately, the only nearby source of concealment rested with the stray sock beneath one of the benches. Despite his earlier experience with the sweaty sock, the bug-sized man had no choice. He scurried over the tiles and dived into a fold in the sock.

Immediately, the offensive odor from the damp, sweaty sock filled his nostrils and stung his eyes. The little man almost gagged from the stench. His fear and awe of the giants made him suck in several deep breaths, which only made his situation even more unbearable when instead of fresh air, he inhaled the air made rancid from the scent of jock foot sweat.

He had no choice but to cower in his hiding place, hopefully waiting for the giants to finish and leave the locker room.

That option might have worked, if one of the giants hadn't noticed the sock and reached for it.

Tiny Bryan felt the sock leave the floor, but he wasn't going along for the ride. He slipped and fell from a height of several inches, landing hard on the unforgiving floor. His tiny body was sprawled on the tile.

Knowing he was even more vulnerable, he forced himself to his feet and prepared to run when a massive foot slammed down next to him. Another few inches, the foot would have landed squarely on top of him.

Too shocked to move, he froze in place. He stared at a row of toes, even the smallest of which massively larger than his shrunken body.

Rick, seated on the bench, planted his feet firmly on the tile floor. He had already stripped off his practice garb, leaving him in nothing more than his jock. Of course, most of the other lacrosse players were in a similar state of undress.

Bryan watched in terror as another pair of huge bare feet slapped across the damp tiles. He could not move, terrified that if he made any sudden movements, one of the jocks would mistake him for a bug.

"You doing anything later?" Rick asked one of his buddies.

"Don't know. Got anything in mind?" Jason asked. Like most of his fellow players, Jason was a burly, intimidating brute with extreme muscle. He also had feet almost as large as Rick's Size 16s.

Jason also had exceptional vision, and as he talked with Rick, he noted a tiny, pale creature close to Rick's toes.

"Man, there's some sort of disgusting bug down there near your foot," Jason warned.

Tiny Bryan heard the jock's words and immediately felt icy fear seize his insides.

"Where?" Rick demanded, lifting the foot farthest from the tiny man.

"No, your other foot," Jason said.

By now, a couple of other players meandered closer, their own bare feet slapping the tiles, adding to the rising panic in the shrunken scientist's brain.

Rick looked down and saw the tiny, pale bug. He watched as it scurried across the tiles, heading under the bench where he sat.

Bryan panicked and ran, but he did have enough thought to head for the doubtful shelter beneath the massive locker room bench.

"This is what I do with pests like that," Jason announced.

The tiny man heard, but kept running, most unwilling to discover what the huge lacrosse player did with pests.

Bryan sees his massive nephew above who's eyes are widened in surprise. Also widened in surprise is his mouth. Half chewed pieces of chips sit in piles between his teeth.

112122221111212221.title: Starving College Student

1121222211112122211.content:
SPLAT!

He gasps as he opens his eyes again. He struggles to swim in the strange surface. He looks up to see the handkerchief covering the round container he found himself in. It lifts away and he can see his nephew's massive face staring down at him.

Has Zack realized his mistake and found me? Bryan wondered. His answer was quickly received when a chip appeared and scooped out some dip.

“No!” Bryan shouted in disbelief. He watched Zack’s tongue slip out of his mouth to claim the chip. Reality hit him like a ton of bricks as the crunches from Zack’s mouth reached Bryan’s ears.

He had fallen into the chip dip, and his nephew was hungry.

--

Zack followed the falling handkerchief with his eyes as it settled onto his jar of chip dip. Seeing nothing else he tossed the piece of cloth to the floor. He pulled another chip out of his bag, dipped it and popped it into his mouth.

Why would Uncle B send me a handkerchief? he wondered silently. He put the box down and reached for the sandwich. Lifting it to his face he took a huge bite without glancing at the food.

Maybe he made a mistake and didn’t send it. Or maybe this was a weird prank considered Zack. Neither theory sounded very convincing but he could think of no other possibilities. He decided to call his uncle to figure this out. Well he would in a sec, he wanted to eat a little bit first.

--

Bryan searched for an escape. But the walls towered high above. Not that he could reach them; he couldn’t seem to propel himself through the dip even in the slightest. He looked up at his nephew again. Zack’s attention seemed to have gone from the box to his sandwich. Bryan stared awestruck as his nephew took a hillsized bite. It disappeared into his mouth effortlessly. He didn’t want to meet the same fate.

“ZACK!!” he screamed, waving his arms above his head. “I’M RIGHT HERE! JUST LOOK DOWN!” Zack didn’t seem to notice anything awry. But then he glanced at the dip.

“YES!” shouted Bryan. And a chip appeared, it shoveled its way through some dip, rose above and quickly disappeared into Zack’s mouth.

“NO!” shouted Bryan, furious over being overlooked. And so he watched Zack continue to devour his sandwich and chips. The whole time he struggled to gain his massive nephew’s attention, but to no avail.

--

Zack popped the last bite of the first half of the sandwich into his mouth and reached for his phone. He flipped it open and sped dial his Uncle’s house. As it rang he dipped a chip and brought it to his mouth. His mouth widened to eat it but he stopped when he heard the answering machine.

After it beeped he left a message. “Hey Uncle B. I got your package but I’m kinda confused. Call me back ok? Bye.” And he hung up.

“Damn it Uncle B, what the fuck are you doing? Don’t send me some weird ass gift again.” He grumbled. With that he brought the chip into his mouth. As he chewed he reached for the other half of his sandwich.

--

Bryan was letting his voice rest as Zack pulled out his phone. After putting it to his ear Zack’s arm reached for something Bryan couldn’t see. He cried out as a large chip appeared. It bore down right towards where Bryan floated. He struggled to move and started screaming in terror, but nothing he did made a difference. So his gigantic nephew scooped him up with a mound of dip.

“ZACK, HELP ME!” Bryan screamed as he flew upwards.

He slowed in front of the lips. He gasped in horror as they parted. His nephew opened his mouth and for a moment Bryan saw his nephew’s teeth glint in the light. He was so close he could see the plaque at the gum line of his nephew’s perfectly straight teeth (courtesy of braces paid for by Bryan). But then the mouth shut and the chip was pulled back.

Bryan looked up hopefully. “YES! RIGHT HERE!” he screamed.

A deafening gale tore past him as Zach spoke. Bryan coughed from Zack’s bad breath, it was truly awful this close up! He was too close to discern the words, and was still coughing as the chip was pulled further from Zack’s mouth.

His ears rang from his nephew’s words. But through his pain he still picked up “DAMN IT UNCLE B, WHAT THE FUCK ARE YOU DOING? DON”T SEND ME SOME WEIRD ASS GIFT AGAIN!” Bryan felt a pang of hurt. He thought Zack liked the little things he sent him.

However he wasn’t given time to linger on this as the chip lurched forward. Bryan screamed as Zack’s mouth opened yet again. In the moment before he entered the mouth he clearly saw the mounds of soggy bread, lettuce, cheese, and ham spread across the outstretched tongue. And worst of all he saw the black hole at the back of his nephew’s throat leading to oblivion.

“NO ZACK, DON’T EAT ME!” begs Bryan as the chip drops to the tongue. He gags on the humidity and stench of the air inside his nephew’s mouth. Zack’s breath may have been bad before, but now it was ten times worse.

Zack pays no heed to his unnoticed uncle on his snack and begins to chew. Bryan is jarred as one side of the chip is crushed. After a few swift movements of the jaw destroys the chip, Bryan drops to the tongue, landing in a pile of dip as his nephew continues to chew. Covered in soggy chip dip, Bryan is ironically overjoyed to have something to keep him relatively still. Zack stops chewing suddenly and Bryan braces for the food to be swallowed.

--

Zack lifts his sandwich to his mouth. Without bothering to swallow the chip he takes a bite of the sandwich. As he chews he struggles to understand his uncle’s intention with the package. Unable to think of anything he turns his TV on and starts to channel surf. He automatically swallows his food and again lifts his sandwich to his lips for another bite.

--

Bryan is surprised to see the mouth opening.

“ZACK!” repeats Bryan, trying one last time to get his nephew’s attention.

He gets a good look around his nephew’s mouth. Chewed piles of chips stick to the sides of the mouth and are spread across the tongue in clumps. Massive amounts are jammed into the molars and hang from above suspended by strands of saliva. Before Bryan can even shudder at his surroundings he is greeted by an incoming sandwich. The mouth widens as Zack takes a bite of his sandwich.

Bryan feels something in him break. He can’t fight anymore, it’s too late. It had been too late for awhile, he had just refused to believe it. As his nephew starts to chew Bryan is rained on by bits of food but luckily never lands between the gnashing molars. He is tossed about violently, struggling to process his impending doom.

Zack finishes chewing and moves the mixture of chip, dip, and sandwich to the back of his mouth. With a loud gulp Bryan disappears down his nephew’s throat with the food. As Bryan sinks deeper into his nephew he feels his temper rise.

“How could my nephew eat me?!” he shouts. But he realizes the fault doesn’t lie with Zack, but rather himself. This only makes him angrier. Fuming, he and the sandwich are squeezed into the stomach, landing on top of the growing mound of masticated food in Zack’s stomach

“How could I be so stupid?!” Bryan yells. “Why would I do this? Why couldn’t I visit Zack on a plane like a normal uncle? No wonder he thinks my gifts are stupid, I over think everything!” he shouts.

In his pause he hears a gulp from above. Bryan gasps and tries to move but finds he is held fast by the soggy food. He stares up in dread as his nephew’s next bite approaches. It appears at the valve above and is slowly squeezed through.

Bryan throws his hands up in a futile attempt to protect himself as the food crushes him into unconsciousness.

--

Zack continues to mindlessly eat his sandwich and chips as he tries to find a TV show to entertain him. The last bite of sandwich disappears past his lips and he works on finishing his chips. The moment the food is in his mouth, Zack has already forgotten about it. He chews based on habit and swallows. He doesn’t give an ounce of thought to the food as it sinks deep into his body. He rests his hand on hisstomach, unaware that it is mere inches from his eaten food and uncle who sit awaiting digestion.

He dozes off in his chair, the gurgles and groans of his stomach soothing him deeper to sleep. He dreams happily of beach babes and bonfires in the summer. On the other hand the inside if his stomach is a storm of churning acids, tearing his meal apart. When he awakes the next morning Zack gets ready for class like he always does. He grabs a quick breakfast on the way, his gut already empty and demanding more.

Zack continues to call his uncle and is horrified to hear he has gone missing at the end of the week. Zack sits down in shock and picks up the mysterious box he had saved for a week. He feels horrible that the last thing he thought of his uncle was how stupid the gifts he sent were. But he knows that his uncle couldn’t have heard that so it was ok.

He stares at the box for some clue, never noticing the microscopic vial that falls to his desk. He munches on some chips as he thinks. He doesn’t realize the similarity of the moment and it passes. He puts the box down and sighs unhappily. All he can do is pray his uncle returns. With that thought in his mind Zack smiles hopefully and pops another chip into his mouth.

He landed, not with an unsettling squish bur rather a bouncy thud.

When he opened his eyes, he found himself on a vast, spongy white surface. He looked around, and up, which is how he saw his nephew's huge features beaming down at him.

Trying again, the tiny scientist waved his arms. "Zack, it's me! Your uncle."

Zack reached for his sandwich, eager to dig into the first bite of the ham and cheese on white bread. He failed to discern the pale speck sprawled on the top piece of bread on his sandwich.

As his humongous nephew lifted the sandwich toward his mouth, his precarious location finally dawned on the bug-sized man.

"Oh no!" He screamed as he tried to get to his feet on a wildly unsteady surface. "I'm on Zack's sandwich!"

In the next instant, Zack opened wide, showing off a cavernous mouth and rows of massive white teeth to his unseen and petrified uncle.

"Wait!" The little man protested in a shrill scream. "Zack! Don't eat me!"
1121222211112122212.title: On a Sandwich

Just after taking a huge bite from his sandwich, Zack heard his programmed ring tone. The college student dug his cell phone from his pocket and spoke with his mouth still full.

On the other end of the line he heard the voice of one of his friends, who informed him of an off-campus party planned later that evening.

“Are you in?” Zack’s friend asked.

Zack chewed and swallowed before he answered. “Yes, sounds sweet, man!” Zack said. “I’ll pick you up.”

As he waited for a response, he took another bite of his tasty sandwich. If he had bothered to look closer at the top piece of bread in his sandwich, he might have seen a pale speck waving frantically in an attempt to gain his attention

While chewing, he groaned, letting a shower of crumbs escape his mouth. “Oh, man,” Zack complained. “You know how I feel about Jason.”

He almost regretted agreeing to attend, but decided not to let Jason ruin a chance at a good time.

His friend thanked him and hung up. Zack looked down and saw that only a single bite-sized portion remained of his sandwich. He popped the last morsel into his mouth and decided to…
11212222111121222122.title: Hungry Zack

choices: Zack's shirt pocket, where he fell with other crumbs
Zack's stomach
112122221111212221222.content:
Tiny Bryan’s screams of desperation fell on deaf ears when his gigantic nephew’s loud, obnoxious ring-tone began blaring.

As his behemoth of a nephew balanced his sandwich while digging for his ringing cell phone, he almost dislodged his shrunken uncle. Just in time, he answered the phone, and his tiny uncle regained his balance and wasn’t sent hurtling toward the unforgiving floor of Zack’s dorm room.

Motivated by the reprieve, the tiny man regained his footing on the massive piece of bread forming the top of Zack’s sandwich. “Zack! Please, look down! It’s me!”

The huge college student swallowed, and his speck-sized uncle was forced to watch the titan’s massive throat muscles pull down the pulverized bite of sandwich.

“YES, SOUNDS SWEET, MAN!” Zack said in response to the caller on the other end of the line. “I’LL PICK YOU UP.”

Then, in a sudden motion, he brought the sandwich closer to his face and opened his mouth wide.

His helpless uncle screamed wordlessly as he saw himself hurtling toward his nephew’s cavernous open mouth.

His hungry nephew enjoyed the tasty sandwich. He chewed, listened to his friend, and then groaned. His actions sent a shower of crumbs escaping his mouth.

“OH, MAN,” Zack complained. “YOU KNOW HOW I FEEL ABOUT JASON.”

He almost regretted agreeing to attend, but decided not to let Jason ruin a chance at a good time. He listened to his friend as he chewed.

“ALL RIGHT,” Zack said. “I’LL PICK YOU UP IN A COUPLE OF HOURS.”

After he ended the call and slid his phone back into his pocket, Zack looked down and saw that only a single bite-sized portion remained of his sandwich.

He popped the last morsel into his mouth and then rubbed his stomach as he decided to play some video games.

Meanwhile, his shrunken uncle is forced to try to contact his gigantic nephew from inside...
112122221111212221222.title: Killing Time

1121222211112122212222.content:
Playing the sequence of events back in his mind didn't make them any less unreal.

Throughout his huge nephew's phone conversation, the tiny man evaded fate, until all that remained of Zack's sandwich was one small morsel left between the college student's fingertips.

“ALL RIGHT,” Zack said into his phone. “I’LL PICK YOU UP IN A COUPLE OF HOURS.”

He then slid his phone back into his pocket. Zack then looked down and saw that only a single bite-sized portion remained of his sandwich.

For his tiny uncle, it looked as if his enormous nephew was staring directly at him.

"Yes!" The little man shouted in excitement. "Zack, it's me..."

Not even thinking anything of it, Zack opened wide and popped the last bite into his mouth, never hearing the wordless scream of terror produced by his uncle as he saw his nephew's cavernous mouth opening wide.

Somehow, the bug-sized man avoided being chewed to bits between his nephew's set of healthy teeth. Instead, he managed to fall onto the titan's muscular tongue with the pulped remnants of the last bite of the sandwich.

“Zack! Please!" The tiny man screamed. "You can't eat me!"

Almost as if in response, the huge college student swallowed, and his speck-sized uncle was forced to the rear of the titan’s mouth as massive throat muscles pulled down the pulverized bite of sandwich.

In the dark, moist mouth, Zack's tongue churned the food around.

"No! Zack! I'm here! Please, don't eat me!"

The titan swallowed. The sounds of the contracting muscles sending him down a long chute of no return still echoed in the panicked little man's ears.

"He swallowed me!" The shrunken scientist realized when he landed in the pit of the college student's stomach.

He pushed his way through a sludge comprised of the well-chewed sandwich and realized how lucky he had been to arrive in one piece.

If that could be considered lucky...

"I've got to try to contact Zack!" The little man realized. Even as his brain raced to think of a way out, stomach acids began to seep into the sludge to reduce the meal to its basic nutrients.

-----

Zack decided to take a nap since he didn't have to meet his friends for a couple of hours. He spread out on the small futon in the dorm.

He yawned and rubbed a hand over his stomach. "That was a good sandwich," he said aloud.

Of course, he had no clue that his sandwich had contained an actual passenger, now just a measly portion of a meal being quickly digested in his stomach.

He thought that he should call his uncle and question him about the weird package. "Why would he have sent me an empty box?" Zack wondered as he grew drowsy.

Inside his stomach, after a flurry of panic, his tiny uncle also grew sluggish.

A couple of hours later, waking refreshed from a nice nap, Zack visited the bathroom and then left to pick up his friend. He already felt hungry, and wondered if he should pick up something else to eat.

First, however, he made the call to his uncle, which went straight to voice mail.

"Hey, Uncle Bryan," Zack said in a cheerful voice. "Got your package. Was it supposed to be some kind of joke? Anyway, I don't get it, but you can call me back."

His stomach gurgled. As he slipped behind the wheel of the Acura his uncle had purchased for him, he belched.

"Guess some of that sandwich was still with me," he said with a laugh.
1121222211112122212222.title: Last gift to his nephew

11212222112.content:
“Go ahead and make it priority mail,” Tommy informed the postal clerk a little sheepishly—then turned to Joe. “That really is a better deal just for one more day.”

“What the fuck,” Bryan thought angrily as he heard the muffled conversation of the giants outside his box. “I told him overnight mail.”

Tommy handed the hundred dollar bill to the man at the counter and awaited his change. The clerk gave the bill a quick but thorough glance, and then returned ninety six dollars and fifteen cents in change to the anxious teenager.

The postal clerk wrapped the box with several priority mail stickers and tossed it in a huge bin. “Can I help the next person in line, please?”

“I should have sent it overnight like I was supposed to,” Tommy mumbled guiltily as he and Joe exited the post office. “I hope I didn’t let Mr. Smith down.”

“Dude, one extra day. Two at the most,” Joe tried to reassure his friend with a pat on the back. “Now let’s head over to the skateboard store before they close.”

* * *

“I can’t endure this shit for two or three days,” Bryan thought to himself, regaining his composure as the box took a momentary break from its rough journey. He noticed the small amount of light entering through the pinholes was becoming dimmer. “I’ve got to find that fucking vial.”

Bryan searched for what seemed hours for the all important vial of shrinking antidote. His search was constantly impeded as the box randomly lurched and was jostled about. Suddenly, the shrunken scientist was unnerved by a bizarre clicking noise, evidently from some sort of postal machinery. And then, due to the smooth motion, he guessed the box had been placed on a conveyor belt. Bryan had never really thought about all the intricacies that got a package from point a to point b, until now.

After searching half the night, Bryan had no luck in finding the vial that could restore him to normal size. He found one of the enormous bread crumbs and bit off some of the stale, tasteless food. Bryan then realized, due to the haste of this plan, he had also forgot to pack some water for the trip. Demoralized, the meager man laid back and fell into a deep sleep.

Bryan was awakened later by a thunderous roar. Strong vibrations shook the small box. He guessed that his package was being placed on an airplane. Bryan wrapped himself in the soft handkerchief the best he could, and tried to get some more shut eye. Luckily, his package would arrive at its destination in only a day and a half.

10:30 AM

Rick turned the dial on the combination lock of his college mail box. The tall, muscular college student reached in and pulled out several letters and a small box.

“Hey, what’s this,” Rick thought aloud as he glanced over the curiously light package, noticing the mailing label. “Oh, this package belongs to Zack.”

As Rick headed back for his dorm room, he met Zack in the hallway.

“Hey Zack, you got a package,” Rick informed his dorm neighbor and frequent drinking buddy. “I think they put it in my box by mistake.”

“Thanks man,” Zack told Rick as he took the small box into his custody, and gave it a curious once over. “I’ve been expecting this.”
11212222112.title: Journey to Zack

choices: Zack's curious roommate notices the box
Zack returns from class
112122221122.content:
Wrapped soundly in the soft handkerchief, the tiny man had endured, as best he could, his rough passage to his nephew in California. From time to time, whenever shipment lulls presented themselves, Bryan even managed to sleep.

A new round of jostling woke Bryan from his sporadic sleep. His sense of helplessness increased with no way of knowing what was taking place outside the box.

He wondered, certainly not for the first time, how much longer he would have to remain trapped in the box.

Then, he heard a loud male voice that got his immediate attention.

"HEY, ZACK! YOU GOT A PACKAGE."

Zack? Bryan dared to hope! Maybe his torturous journey was coming to an end.

"I THINK THEY PUT IT IN MY BOX BY MISTAKE."

Bryan felt the box lurch. He grabbed the handkerchief with his fists to keep from being tossed to and fro.

"THANKS, MAN! I'VE BEEN EXPECTING THIS."

Bryan, despite the odd, muffled quality of his nephew's loud utterances, recognized Zack's voice at once.

Zack would be able to rescue him from this horrible ordeal.

••••••

After taking the package from his friend, Zack headed back to his dorm room.

He looked at his watch. "DAMN! I'M GONNA BE LATE FOR CLASS."

Zack placed the package on his desk. "I GUESS I'LL HAVE TO WAIT UNTIL I GET BACK FROM CLASS TO OPEN UNCLE BRYAN'S SURPRISE."

Inside the box, Bryan listened in horror. "No! Please, Zack, open the damn box. I can't stand any more time in here!"

The complete lack of motion and an eerie silence, however, told the frustrated tiny man that freedom remained still out of reach.

With little else to do, he made his way to one of the air holes to peek into his nephew's dorm room.

Bryan saw a building-sized computer printer, a desk lamp that resembled a gleaming metal tower and a colossal cabinet. The peephole gave him a very limited view. Impatient, Bryan debated whether he should exit the box on his own.

He tried to find the incision that, at his normal size, he had cut into the box to allow his entry at shrunken size. "Maybe I'll find that damn vial in the process," he said aloud.

His search, however, yielded no success when he heard a loud noise.
112122221122.title: In Zack's Room, Still in the Box

choices: Zack hears a crunch as he sits on the package
Zack doesn't notice that he has sat on the package
1121222211221.content:
An important fact that the little man had forgotten was that his nephew shared his dorm with a roommate.

On a previous visit with his nephew, he had met Johnny, a rather irrepressible practical joker and, at least in Bryan's estimation, most likely a bad influence on Zack.


Now, under much different circumstances, the shrunken scientist was about to encounter Johnny yet again.

He heard and, surprisingly, felt the arrival of a giant. Johnny's clomping footsteps around the dorm sent vibrations through the small package. Inside the container, the little man waited anxiously for the big moment.

"Hurry, Zack! Open the package, please!"

On his way toward his bed, Johnny saw the little cardboard box on Zack's desk.

Inside the box, face pressed against the peephole, Bryan felt a jolt of shock when he realized the giant was not his nephew.

The shock turned to fear when he saw Johnny looking straight down at him or, in reality, at the box. As the giant stretched out his hand to pick up the box, the tiny man knew he might be in for big trouble.

Lifting the box in one hand, Johnny read the mailing label. He shrugged and lifted the box near his ear and gave it a terrific shake.

Inside the box, even nestled in the soft confines of the handkerchief, the little man was unprepared for the whiplash violence from the curious giant.

Not hearing any tell-tale rattles or other clues, Johnny grew bored and dropped the box into the seat of Zack's chair. For the tiny man, the box landed upside-down, making his disorientation even worse.

As he crawled through the cloth folds in the handkerchief, the tiny man was simply relieved to be out of Johnny's hands.

At that moment, Zack returned. Entering the dorm, he found his roommate had arrived ahead of him.

"How's it going?" Zack asked.

Johnny, now sprawled on his bed, gave Zack a friendly nod. "Not bad."

Zack pulled out his desk chair, so eager to open the delivery from his uncle that he didn't notice that the box had been moved from his desk into the seat of the chair.

Johnny saw the impending disaster, but his interest in always setting up his friends for pranks and jokes kept him quiet as Zack planted himself into the chair.

FRIDAY—2:30 PM

“Man, I’m sure glad that fucking week’s over!” Zack exclaimed as he entered his dorm room. He pulled off his back pack and tossed it on a dresser. Reaching into a small fridge, Zack pulled out an ice cold Heineken. He had gotten the taste for this expensive beer from his Uncle. He glanced over at his desk. “Well, I wonder what ya got me Uncle B.”

* * *

“Zack!” Bryan screamed at the top of his lungs as he watched his enormous nephew enter the room. “Get me the fuck out of here!”

The site of his nephew filled tiny Bryan with exhilaration. As soon as Zack opened the box, he would be safe in the hands of his giant nephew, whom he trusted completely. Although, Bryan was a little anxious as he thought of what it might be like if Zack actually held him in one of his gigantic hands.

The shrunken scientist’s imagination ran wild as he contemplated first contact with a giant. In the pit of his stomach, Bryan felt like he was on the starting incline of some terrifying roller coaster. Then, Zack turned and looked at the box, and him.

* * *

Zack took the small box in his hands and sat down next to his desk, totally unaware of the fragile contents. He carefully examined the box, contemplating what was inside. Zack flipped the box over a couple times, and then gave it a gentle shake. He loved surprises, and his Uncle had hooked him up with some doozies in the past.

“Man, I bet its Superbowl tickets,” Zack exclaimed with enthusiasm. “I mean, the box’s light as a feather.”

* * *

“Whoa, careful Zack,” Bryan yelled as he tumbled backwards and slid to the other side of the box when his nephew picked it up. When Zack flipped the box over, Bryan plunged to the roof of the box—then suddenly fell back to the bottom. “Nooooh. Zack…Stop!”

But his nephew had no clue the stressful situation his was putting his uncle through. He was just having fun trying to guess what surprise the box held. He held it a couple more minutes as he took a few gulps of his beer.

11212222112221.content:
Within the box, Bryan could almost taste freedom.

Then, a loud noise and a booming male voice interrupted Zack’s investigation of the package mailed to him by his uncle.

“WHAT YOU GOT THERE, ZACK-MAN?”

Somehow, in one of those twists of fate, Drew, a 20-year-old prankster, had been assigned the same dorm with Zack, who had been enduring his roommate’s antics ever since.

Usually, Zack handled Drew with his good-natured attitude. “MY UNCLE SENT ME SOMETHING,” Zack answered.

“YEAH?” Drew asked in a curious tone. “WHAT IS IT?”

Inside the box, given a moment of peace after Zack’s curious investigation, Bryan managed to make his way to one of the peepholes. He could not see his nephew, who he decided must still have the box in his hand, but he got a good look at Drew.

The big college dude leaned forward and took a close look at the box in Zack’s hand. He saw the mistake on the label. “DUDE, YOU’RE LUCKY YOU EVEN GOT THIS. YOUR UNCLE PUT THE WRONG DORM ROOM NUMBER ON THE LABEL.” Drew said. “SO, ARE YOU GOING TO OPEN IT?”

Zack wanted to open the package, but he hesitated. What if Bryan had sent him something really cool like tickets to the Superbowl. He knew Drew would try to horn in and persuade Zack to include him in the plans.

“MAYBE LATER,” Zack said. “UH, I’VE GOT TO RUN A QUICK ERRAND.”

Zack placed the package on his bed. “I’LL BE BACK SOON. UH, YOU PLANNING ON STICKING AROUND THIS AFTERNOON?”

“NAH! I’VE GOT SOME THINGS TO DO, TOO.”

Zack cast one last glance at the small package. He would walk to one of the campus eateries and get a snack. By the time he returned, he could open the package in privacy.

Or so he hoped.

Inside the package, staring out a peephole at the two giant college students, Bryan could not get over how awesome and mighty they appeared.

But, he also felt incredibly frustrated. “Come on!” Bryan yelled uselessly. “Let me out of here! Zack! Please.”
11212222112221.title: Drew Interrupts

choices: Tiny Bryan loses his grip and falls!
Drew decides to go out with Bryan still hanging on!
112122221122211.content:
Slumped in his desk chair, idly tapping his cellphone, Drew found his eyes wandering to the tantalizingly mysterious package on Zack's bed. His roommate appeared reluctant in opening the box in his presence, which to a regular person would signal that it is none of their business, but made Drew all the more curious.

Zack knew his roommate was a card, and much to his annoyance, Drew was always finding new ways to joke around and irritate Zack. Otherwise, the two got along wonderfully, Drew being a basketball enthusiast like Zack, and them both liking the same films and music.

Leaning forward in the chair, the college guy glanced around and listened. With a perfectly innocent expression, Drew stood up and stepped over to the bed. With a last cautionary glance, the guy snatched the package and looked at it in anticipation.

What interesting bit of contraband might be inside? Drew's mischievous mind couldn't wait any longer, and without a seconds delay, he easily tore the box open.

____________

"Damnit, Zack!" Tiny Bryan complained at the sight of his oblivious nephew leaving the room. How much longer would he have to stay in this blasted box? With an impatient sigh, he turned his little gaze to the giant roommate.

Leaning back in a desk chair, the colossal Drew casually tapped away on his cellphone. The youth looked about the same height as his nephew, with had medium length brown hair, and a fairly muscular build. He was dressed in a striped sweater, jeans, and a well-worn pair of blue and white Nike sneakers.

The little scientist couldn't tale his eyes off the roommate, imaging just how huge the young guy was. Bryan also noticed how the youth kept glancing in his direction. He wondered if the big guy sensed his staring.

With surprising speed, the titanic Drew suddenly rose up and stomped towards to bed. The box trembled from the heavy steps, and without warning the tiny man flew back as the giant picked up the package.

"Not again!" He squeaked, as his body did a somersault into the handkerchief.

RIIIIIIIP!

Light flooded the spacious interior of the box. Bryan scrambled out of the fabric desperately, and looked up at the impressive sight above him.

"WHAT THE HELL?" Thundered an incredibly deep and loud voice. Looming above him was the planet-sized visage of Drew. His huge brow furrowed at the strange contents of the box.

Shock and awe overtook the bug-sized Bryan, as he hawked up at the impossibly huge face. The ground lurched nice more as a colossal hand with building-like fingers snatched the handkerchief, roughly pulling it from the box, sending the tiny man's provisions flying.

"What are you doing! You idiot!" He screamed indignantly as he pulled himself up. Bryan didn't trust this young giant, but he needed to stop this careless treatment before he was injured by the colossal brute. Jumping with waving arms, Bryan succeeded in getting attention, seeing the huge eyes look back down and lock onto him.

"A FUCKING BUG? GROSS." Drew's huge voice stated with animosity.

"What!? No, I-..." His cry was cut off as the humongous box up-ended, sending him into a violent free fall. His little wailing screams didn't even reach Drew's lofty ears as the titan turned the box over, dumping what he thought was a bug out.

His minute form crashed into a thick, coarse material after falling for what seemed like a lifetime. Digging his tiny fingers into it, the shrunken scientist hung on. A quick look down gave made his stomach turn as he realized he was hanging on to Drew's gigantic pant leg. Far below, Drew's massive right sneaker rested, pressing firmly into the carpeted floor.

_____________

A grunt of disgust, mixed with disappointment was the reaction Drew had upon opening Zack's box. The strange napkin hid a tiny little insect underneath, which Drew promptly dumped out of the box.

"Crap, where did it go?" He muttered, looking at the floor before his feet. He had planned on stomping it quickly, not thinking it could fly away or something, and unaware that the "bug" might not even make it to the floor.

With a frown, Drew stuffed the useless napkin back into the torn box, and dropped it back on Zack's bed. What a disappointment, he thought.

Now bored, Drew prepared to...
112122221122211.title: Dangerous Curiousity

choices: Drew begins stomping around the room
Drew notices the bug again
1121222211222111.content:
The strain upon his tiny fingers was unbearable. Bryan dug them in once more, attempting with all his might to keep his grip upon the enormous denim.

"Oh, no! No, no, no, NO!" The shrunken scientist squealed as he looked down once more. "Dear fucking God, NO!"

Vertigo made his entire body shake badly, his fingers threatening to slip through the thick threading once again. The astronomical distance down to the floor was positively daunting. He must easily be many hundred of feet in the air!

Drew's deep, powerful voice thundered high above him. The words seemed to reverberate through the giant's body, rattling Bryan's teeny form. Shifting movements came shortly after, causing Bryan to shriek in terror as he prepared for the worse. The giant was going to take a step!

"You moron! How could you be so damn careless! Help me, rig-..." The tiny man's insults were instantly absorbed by the huge mountain of denim and space around him. Looking up the dauntingly tall expanse of Drew's body--he couldn't even see the young student's face from his perspective. Like the movement of a mighty glacier, the denim landmass began shifting as Drew prepared to move.

Bryan felt his body swing into open air, held only by his weak grip. Far below the gigantic sneaker--tattered and dingy with dirt and wear--began to lift off the carpeted floor. The view Bryan had made the experience all the move dangerous and frightening; watching some so powerful and so enormous move was surreal. He was swung roughly, his throat rasping from the cries and screams for help.

BOOM!

The sneaker slammed down again, buffeting the ground thunderously and sending a shockwave of force through the behemoth's body. All this was of course inconsequential to Drew, who had no inkling of the power and size he presented as he simply cross the dorm room. Bryan, on the other hand, was flung forward then backward to crash into the strong wall of denim. He felt his arms near tear from socket as he held on desperately.

"I can't take anymore of this... My fucking arms are gonna fall off, dammit!" He cried out with rasping dread.

Oblivious to his plight, Drew kept his gaze fixated before him and continued his procession.

THOOM!

The speck-sized man was lightly rattled watching the other foot lift, swing forward a great distance and crash into the ground heavily. Bryan knew what was coming. It seemed to make it worse when the sheer cliff of material shifted again.

This time the monumental shelf of denim he hung onto shifted at an angle, sloping his arms. Crrrruuuuunch! The left shoulder cracked out of socket from the stress, sending a tremendous amount of pain through Bryan's little body. He instantly lost his grip and tumbled.

Screaming, he fell.... and fell.

"Shiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiii-...!" Air buffeted past him, throwing his frail, injured form around. "-iiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiit!"

Bryan was given little image of where he was falling. Everything was a blur, his head spinning and his stomach threatening to purge itself. He suddenly made contact. Slamming hard into a surface before falling a short distance again, then crashing into the fibrous ground.

The tiny genius groaned. Among the flashing thoughts in his mind was the fact that he was still alive: evidenced by the incredible shoots of pain he felt.

Suddenly, the ground trembled fiercely with a heavy sound. Bryan clutched his injured arm and rolled over, struggling through the cacophony of thick carpeting around him. Right beside him a large expanse of the thick carpet had been compacted by some tremendous force, slowly retaking shape. All feeling of pain and misfortune left him when he took sight of the source. Only a step away to somebody of regular size, but translating to what seemed like a whole mile to Bryan, stood Zack's gargantuan-- and dangerously oblivious--roommate Drew.

Bryan lay in the tangle of large fibers in a transfixed state of awe. His initial impression of the big guy from the safety of his box had been one of idle curiosity and fantasy; that view didn't do the college student any justice. He was gigantic, if not absolutely ginormous. The sheer magnitude of his size was more than daunting to look upon. Drew currently faced away from Bryan, paused before the desk opposite Zack's bed.

Bryan had nearly forgotten his disastrous encounter as he greedily took in the behemoth roommate's form. His head was covered by a woven hat, allowing some of his shaggy brown hair to be seen over the sweaters collar. He shifted, wholly unaware of the tiny set of eyes watching him. Bryan looked over the giant's broad shoulders, past his waist, over the enormity of his loose jeans and to the titanic footwear.

"This is unbelievable..." Bryan whispered, staring intently. He had never interacted with humans before while shrunken. Despite the misgivings of all that had happened, Bryan was enthralled by this encounter. His nephew's roommate barely felt like a fellow human being to Bryan. Instead, he appeared like some vastly superior (not in intellect, of course!) being--completely unaware of the raw power and danger he posed to smaller beings.

The severity of his situation had yet to sink in, and Bryan only realized it too late. Drew lumbered into motion again, finished with his task on the desk, he turned around. His large feet shifting and slamming heavily into the carpet, sending shaking tremors through the dorm room floor.

Squeaking, Bryan's mind clicked back into reality just as...
1121222211222111.title: On the ground

11212222112221112.content:
Fiddling with his own contraband on the desk, Drew shifted his weight and bit his lip.

"Where the hell did I put the rolls?"

Pushing the loose drugs in a pile, he turned around to check elsewhere. He knew Zack would throw any of it away if he left it out, so Drew was in the habit of keeping it in his desk, or backpack. The ragged black and brown backpack was slumped against the side of his bed, next to an equally trashed skateboard. Nearly everything he owned was scuffed up in one way or another.

Drew side-stepped and snatched his pack up, plopping it heavily on his own bed.

"Shit... What did I do with them?" He grunted in annoyance. An overall good student and chill guy, Drew still found himself mentally lacking at times.

Pulling a hamburger wrapper out, he tossed it towards the trash when he happened to glance down.

"There you are ya little fucker!" Drew said lightly with a smirk when he spied tiny movements on the floor. "Don't even think about tryin' to fly away this time!"

The tiny speck seemed to halt movements, as if in reaction to his statements. Drew knew better. Bugs were just stupid creatures, only capable of hiding and fucking stuff up. It began scurrying towards Zack's bed at a slow pace. One large step caught him up with it and he positioned his feet on either side of it.

"Shoulda stayed outside, bug," He stated with a flat tone, completely forgetting that this bug had been intended for his roommate. "Meet my size fucking thirteen!"

With that said, he lifted a grungy Nike skate shoe over the bug and stomped down. Drew could never hope to imagine the small insect's feelings, never for a moment thinking it was anything but a common pest. That his lovable and goofy demeanor was unappreciated by the bug who saw him much differently; impossibly gigantic, cruel, and uncaring.

Finished, Drew stepped back and resumed his backpack digging. Any thought of the bug washed away when he discovered his prize: tattered paper rolls for rolling his smokes.

"Aw, fuck yes!"

Settling back into the desk chair, he prepared the smokes and propped his feet on the desk. Drew started some tunes going from his phone and relaxed. It wasn't until his smoke was reduced to a stub that his roommate returned. Zack entered, began shrugging his backpack off when he sniffed the air.

"You dumbass, what the hell are you doing?" Zack snapped at his stoned roommate. "I told you not to smoke that crap in here."

Drew shrugged in response, his attention directed to his phone. Zack approached, looking over at his bed quickly he did a double-take. The packed lay on its side, flaps open and handkerchief on the floor. "Seriously? You opened my mail! Shit, dude, what is wrong with you?"

"Dude, what'dya freaking out for? It was a joke, man! There was nothing but a shitty towel and a bug inside," He explained to Zack. "I did you a favour. Stomped the tiny bastard before it escaped."

Zack glowered at his roommate, glancing momentarily at the propped sneakers that faced him. The soles were filthy. The Nike "swoosh" was barely visible among the worn coloured tread, packed with dirt, grime, and if he looked closer, various bugs and a smashed spider from earlier that day. If Zack had also looked closer, perhaps with a magnifier, he may of noticed the very tiny splotch of crushed minutely-sized gore and bones near what looked to be the torn top half of a human torso pressed into clods of grime.

This went completely unnoticed to Zack, who could care less about some bug that stowed into the gift his uncle sent.

"Yeah, thanks a ton for the favour, I owe you one." Zack's tone dripped with sarcasm. "Whatever, man. Just lay off that shit and let me do my homework."

Drew sighed, taking a final drag of the smoldering stub. As he rubbed it out on his desk, a fly that had been buzzing the room for hours landed lazily upon his chest. Stoned and careless, Drew chuckled and expelled his smoke upon the confused insect. It stumbled from the smokey gale, obviously distressed and bewildered. He plucked the fly between his fingers and considered it's struggling form before flicking it towards the window absently.

"It's your lucky day, bug" He said under his breath, amused at his own magnanimous action.

Bored again and dozing, Drew leaned back and readjusted his shoes over one another causing bits of dirt and grime to fall free from his treads.

Zack would never know the fate of his uncle, who had thought his plan so flawless and clever that nothing could go wrong.
11212222112221112.title: Size Thirteen

choices: Drew returns.
Zack takes a close look at the "bug".
112122221122212.content:
In frustration, Bryan took his fist and slammed it into the wall of the small cardboard box. “Zack, get me out of here right now!” The tiny man returned to a peephole and glanced out into his nephew’s enormous dorm room.

Bryan watched his nephew’s roommate Drew mill about in the room for a while. Bryan was mesmerized and awe-struck as he watched the titan drink a soda and gobble down a bag of chips. It was still incomprehensible just how small he had become. Bryan continued watching the giant college student until he suddenly left.

Bryan located the small tear in the box and thought seriously about exiting, but thought it wise to remain in the relative safety of the box until Zack’s return. He sat and waited for what seemed at least an hour.

Zack returned to his room with a bag of food and a chocolate milkshake. He slammed the door and placed the bag and shake on his desk. He grabbed the package his uncle had sent from his bed and gave it another really good look.

“Okay, let’s see what we got here,” Zack said with a big grin as he anticipated the surprise that awaited him in the box. He dug his finger into box and began to rip it open. “Oh yeah, almost there.”

* * *

Bryan was startled by Zack’s return. The door to the dorm room made a loud shudder-some crashing noise when Zack slammed it shut. The tiny scientist ran to the peep hole to get another glimpse of his mountainous nephew. “Zack, please get me out of here!”

Almost on queue, Zack abruptly reached for the box containing his shrunken uncle and took it to his desk. Tiny Bryan was tossed backwards, but soon regained his composure as the box’s movements steadied out. As Bryan looked out of the peep hole again, he got an up close view of Zack.

He was huge. The miniature man found it hard to even think of the behemoth that held him as his nephew. Bryan cringed nervously as he felt the box being ripped open by his hulking nephew. He wondered if this crazy plan was such a good idea after all.

* * *

Zack effortlessly ripped open one side of the little box, and then carefully tore open the entire box from end to end. Curiously, the box only seemed to contain a white handkerchief. Zack lifted the handkerchief and examined it closely. “What the fuck. Is this some kind of joke?”

He glanced down at the torn box, and noticed what seemed to be a little bug scurrying around. He slowly lowered his finger until it was directly above the small “insect”. The little “bug” moved around frantically trying to avoid the giant’s finger. Zack chuckled as he followed the “bug” around with his finger.

“Well Uncle B.—you sent me a handkerchief and a bug. I guess the handkerchief is to wipe the bug guts off my finger when I pulverize the little piece of shit.”
112122221122212.title: Zack Opens The Box

choices: Zack tosses the box in the trash
Drew takes a closer look into the box
1121222211222121.content:
Bryan could not believe the words he heard, but they were far too loud for him to have misheard.

"No! Zack! You'll kill me!" Bryan shouted in panic as he heard his nephew's ominous threat.

Of course, to Zack eyes, the tiny creature in the box looked like a bug, not his uncle.

That distinction meant little to Bryan as he saw a deadly digit descend toward him.

Another loud voice interrupted. "HEY, ZACK-DUDE! WHAT ARE YOU DOING?"

The menacing fingertip withdrew from the box. "NOTHING," Zack said in a voice heavy with disappointment.

"YOU OPENED THE PACKAGE," Drew said.

Bryan, still recovering from the shock of almost being smashed beneath his nephew's fingertip, gazed out of the savaged box to gaze at his nephew's huge roommate. Drew looked like some mammoth human mountain.

"YEAH," Zack said. "I THINK MY UNCLE IS PLAYING SOME SORT OF JOKE ON ME."

"YEAH? WHY?" Drew asked. He moved closer and gazed down at the open box.

"NOTHING IN THERE BUT A HANDKERCHIEF AND A DAMN BUG."

"Nooh!" Bryan shrieked. "Zack, please look closer. You've got to see me."

"WELL, SCREW THAT," Drew said. "LET'S GO OUT AND DO SOMETHING TO TAKE YOUR MIND OFF THAT CRAPPY GIFT."

"YEAH, YOU'RE RIGHT." Zack reached for the box.

Bryan's feet flew out from beneath him as Zack grabbed the box. "Zack! Help!" The tiny man screamed.
1121222211222121.title: Disappointment

choices: Giant college guys add more trash
The trash gets collected
11212222112221211.content:
Zack, with no knowledge of his uncle's dire predicament as a tiny, shrunken man within the package, treated the box none too gently as he prepared to leave with his roommate Drew to engage in some activity to help soothe his disappointment.

The box rocked to and fro as Bryan's enormous nephew stomped through the dorm room. For the tiny man, everything erupted into a blurry chaos.

"Let's head over to the student center and shoot some pool," Drew suggested.

"Zack! You've got to find me!" Bryan screamed as he violently lurched back and forth inside the box. "Help!"

As the two guys departed Zack's dorm, he passed a trash receptacle in the corridor. "Well, so much for my uncle's surprise," Zack said as he aimed the box toward the half-filled container.

The package left Zack's hand and plunged into the enormous trash can. The impact ejected the tiny man from within the confines of the box only to leave him trapped within the even more massive environment of a tall aluminum garbage container lined with mile upon mile of black plastic.

Bryan rested prone on the mound of garbage within the can's plastic liner. When, after a pause of a few moments, he realized he hadn't been killed, he tried to determine the seriousness of his situation.

He stood on a discarded envelope in the shadow of the building-sized cardboard shipping package. A sizable chunk of someone's discarded burger rested a short distance from the package. In addition, someone had tossed in a colossal "Big Gulp" cup, old candy wrappers, a couple of soda cans and assorted other debris.

Bryan felt truly insignificant, knowing he had been tossed away like worthless garbage. He also knew, without a doubt, he was trapped in the deep pit. The smooth plastic offered no possible means of escape.

The sticky, sweet residue of soda had leaked onto some of the papers, and the stench of stale food filled the tiny man's nostrils. He gazed at the discarded box and almost longed for the confines of his dark shipping package. He just wanted a place where he could curl into a tiny ball, sleep and perhaps awaken to find all of this horror was merely a bad dream.
11212222112221211.title: Trashed

choices: Keep searching for the antidote
Try to hitch a ride out of the trash
112122221122212111.content:
Bryan observed his alien environment. Here he was the size of an ant in a trash can. All because his meeting with his nephew hadn't gone as planned... well basically it hadn't happened since Zack had completely overlooked his presence.

So he was trapped. He searched for a way to climb out, but the walls covered by the smooth plastic bag stretched thousands of feet above. Despite himself Bryan felt a lump rise in his throat, he just wanted to cry. This whole thing had been an awful idea, and now his situation had become downright hopeless.

Just before he allowed his grief to overwhelm him he remembered something. And he felt like a complete idiot.

The antidote! Though lost, it was not gone! Bryan turned towards the box, its base nearly level with him. Bryan rushed across a chocolate wrapper and yelped with joy when he saw the slit he could enter through. This was so easy it must be a sign! Feeling confident that he would find the antidote once more he sprinted into the box to begin.

-----

Zack returned hours later from shooting pool. Drew had left with some friends and although they had invited Zack to join them, Zack chose to return to his room. He needed to sleep before school tomorrow.

As Zack passed the trash can he pulled out some scratch tickets from his pocket and tossed them.

"Damned waste of money" he grumbled, before entering the bathroom to shower.

-----

Bryan was exhausted. He had been searching for hours. But the box was so large and so far the antidote was nowhere to be found. He worried for a moment that it had flown out of the box. He sighed and kept looking. Only if he finished searching unsuccessfully could he worry about the antidote lying somewhere in the massive dorm.

He heard the door slam shut and glanced upward. The trash can shook as someone approached. Large objects appeared from the sky and landed next to the box. Bryan recognized Zack’s voice but didn’t try to shout as the steps faded away.

He would keep looking for the antidote.

-----

Zack emerged from the bathroom feeling clean fifteen minutes later. He glanced at the trash can again and jumped.

“Oh shit! I threw a winning ticket away!” he exclaimed. He took a moment to dry his hand off before reaching into the can to save his four dollar victory.

-----

Bryan was right next to the slit leading out of the box when he heard Zack’s exclamation. He had searched a good portion of the box and still found no antidote.

Hearing Zack‘s statement left him with a second to decide what to do.
112122221122212111.title: Treasure in the Trash

choices: Zack can just barely hear his Uncle speak.
Zack can not hear his Uncle.  He is too small.
1121222211222122.content:
As Zack tore open the small box, Bryan found it hard to contain his mixture of emotions. Anxiety quickly merged into excitement as the tiny scientist felt the box being ripped open by his enormous nephew. When the entire box had been torn apart, Bryan found himself exposed to the outside world. His colossal nephew loomed ominously over him.

Consumed with fear, Bryan watched as Zack effortlessly lifted the handkerchief that surrounded him. He was now vulnerable, completely at the mercy of the young giant above. Bryan swallowed nervously and then began to wave up to the giant and shout, “Hey Zack—down here. It’s me, your Uncle Bryan.”

After hearing his nephew utter the “bug” word, Bryan erupted in a fit of panic. “Noh, I’m not a fucking bug!” the tiny man screamed with all his might as a jumbo finger rapidly descended upon him. Bryan wanted to cry as the huge, fleshy digit hovered mockingly above him, ready to squash out his existence at any moment. Bryan began to run in an attempt to escape sudden doom. But the threatening finger easily mimicked his every movement. And then it began to lower even more, almost touching him.

* * *

Just as Zack was about the squash the tiny bug with his finger, he began to wonder why his uncle would play such a bizarre practical joke on him. It was so unlike him. He had never displayed much creativity or a sense of humor. He lifted his finger and decided to have a closer look at the package, and the little “bug”. Maybe he missed something. Zack lowered his face to the opened package and looked real close.

“What the fuck,” Zack uttered in complete disbelief. He closed his eyes tight, shook his head, and then took another look. “It’s a tiny man.”

The quarter inch tall scientist sighed a breath of relief. Being squashed to death by a giant college student’s finger wasn’t the way he wanted to exit this world. And he was also thankful he had somehow managed not to piss his pants.

“Uncle B.—is that you?” Zack whispered to the bug sized human below him. “What the fuck did you do to yourself?”

“YES!—Zack, it’s me!” Bryan screamed with all his might at the God-like creature above. “I shrunk myself and had myself mailed to you as a surprise.”

Bryan found himself becoming exhausted from all the yelling and Zack just loomed above with a quizzical look on his face. He couldn’t even hear him.

Zack could see his tiny Uncle was trying to talk to him, but he couldn’t hear a word his miniature Uncle was saying. “Uncle B.—I can’t hear anything you’re saying.”

Zack reached for a note card and placed it next to his tiny uncle and said, “Hop on this, Uncle B.”

Bryan carefully stepped onto the massive platform, then fell to his knees at he felt the ground beneath him suddenly rise. He had no idea what his giant nephew had in mind, but Bryan trusted Zack completely.

Zack tilted the note card and his tiny Uncle slipped off right into the palm of his enormous hand.

Bryan landed with a tiny plop on his nephew’s massive hand. Bryan found himself in the middle of a lake of pink, squishy flesh. It glistened with a thin layer of sweat, and Bryan studied the lines and crevices of the giant hand in amazement. He reached down and thoroughly felt the surreal surface with both hands. It was an experience he could have never imagined. It was awesome.

Zack was a little amused at his tiny Uncle’s fascination with his hand, but the big question was how did this all happen. He lifted his hand up close to his face and softly spoke. “Uncle B.—how did this happen to you?”
1121222211222122.title: In Zack's Hand

choices: Bryan explains.
11212222112221221.content:
Bryan began to speak very quickly, trying to explain his situation. However, to Bryan's horror as the words came out quickly, Zack shook his head.

"I CAN'T YOU HEAR YOU, UNCLE B."

Bryan sighed audibly - audibly to someone his size, not to someone the size of Zack. That gave him an idea, suddenly. He reached up and tugged at his own ear.

"EAR?" asked Zack, perplexed. Then he got it. "OH! ARE YOU SURE?"

Bryan nodded. Cautiously, Zack raised Bryan up towards his own ear, which looked like a cave. In his sweaty hand, Bryan was trying hard to stand up. With a sudden motion, Bryan fell and nearly slid off the side of Zack's hand. He was stopped by Zack's finger, which siezed him and put him back on the hand. Bryan was breathing hard and visibly afraid by the near accident; Zack smiled mischeviously. He liked the fact he had saved his uncle wihout - literally - raising a finger.

Bryan managed to crawl off of Zack's hand with relative ease, landing in the curved ground of his nephew's ear.

"Zack?" he called out, as loud as he could.

"I HEAR YOU LOUD AND CLEAR, UNCLE B.!" In reality, Zack could just hear his voice, but the idiom was apt enough. "NOW, WHAT HAPPENED?"
11212222112221221.title: Lending an Ear

choices: Zack decides to consult his smart friend Alex.
Zack's roommate Drew returns.
11212222112221222.content:
Bryan realized any attempts to verbally communicated with his giant nephew would be futile. This was just another one of the many flaws in what he thought was a foolproof plan. He continued to explore the massive hand that held him. Zack’s fingers extended out like mighty oak trees. Suddenly, Bryan was startled from the sudden motion of Zack’s hand as he stood up.

“Well, since you’re here—I guess I can give you the grand tour,” Zack said to the bug-sized man he held in the palm of his hand, and not really sure what else to do. “Now hold on tight. I don’t want to drop you or something.”

Bryan looked on in awe at his enormous surroundings. The small dorm room looked massive to the shrunken man. The walls were covered with gigantic posters, and Zack’s collection of ball caps hung impressively on several hooks.

“What am I going to do with you,” Zack asked his shrunken uncle, becoming a little distressed. “I just wish I could talk to you.”

Zack sat on his bed, his miniature Uncle safely in the palm of his hand, and tried to figure out what he should do.
11212222112221222.title: The Grand Tour

choices: Zack takes Bryan to see Alex
Alex comes to the dorm
112122221122212221.content:
“THIS IS REALLY WAY WEIRD!” Zack declared.

Although his tone registered his excitement, he spoke in a normal voice, but at close range the words boomed in his tiny uncle’s ears.

“Oh, god. Keep it down, Zack,” Bryan complained. “You’ll give me a headache.”

He looked up again and shivered slightly as he saw the intense gaze turned downward as Zack’s enormous eyes focused on him. “I must look like a speck in his hand,” Bryan realized.

“THIS IS SORT OF COOL,” Zack said. He punctuated his statement with a deep laugh. “I CAN’T BELIEVE I THOUGHT YOU WERE SOME SORT OF FREAKIN’ BUG!”

The recent memory of his nephew’s giant finger looming ominously over his tiny body produced another shiver of fear to pass through Bryan’s shrunken form.

He also had a sudden, rather urgent thought.

“What am I doing just sitting here in Zack’s hand?” Bryan berated himself. “I need that antidote.”

He tried to stand on the surface of his nephew’s palm. He spread his legs apart and tried to balance. “Zack!” Bryan shouted as loudly as he could manage. “There should be a vial in the box. It contains the antidote!”

He heard Zack laugh again. Actually, he felt the rumble of laughter pass from Zack’s hand and reverberate through his own tiny body.

“GIVE IT UP, UNCLE B,” Zack said. “I CAN SEE YOU’RE EXCITED, BUT I CAN’T HEAR A WORD.”

“Zack, please,” Bryan begged. “I need that vial!”

“I HAVE AN IDEA!” Zack said, getting on his feet again.

He picked up the notecard and lowered it to his palm. “HOP ON,” Zack urged.

Bryan did as instructed by his giant nephew. Zack lifted the notecard very carefully and placed the enormous card and his tiny uncle on his desk.

“I NEED TO MAKE A PHONE CALL.” Zack explained. He pulled a cell phone bigger than a yacht from a pocket in his pants.

Bryan watched his nephew punch in a number. “How can I make him hear me?” Bryan wondered.

“HI! ALEX!” Zack said. “LISTEN, I NEED A BIG FAVOR.”

Bryan, in complete awe, looked away from his titanic nephew and surveyed all the enormous objects on Zack’s desktop. He felt so absurdly small.

Zack continued to speak with his friend. “IT’S REALLY IMPORTANT. YOU COULD COME HERE...OR WOULD IT BE BETTER IF I CAME THERE?”

Bryan’s stance became more alert. “No! Zack, you can’t leave me here alone!”

“OK!” Zack finished. “SEE YOU SOON.”

Bryan was left to wonder about the decision. Was his nephew’s friend on his way to Zack’s dorm or did Zack mean to leave to visit Alex?

While Bryan pondered on that, Zack crossed the room and picked up the box and the discarded handkerchief. “I DON’T GUESS WE NEED THESE NOW.”

Bryan watched in dismay as Zack tossed the box and handkerchief into a trash can.

“Oh no!” Bryan cried. “The antidote’s in there somewhere!”

He didn’t have much time to worry before his colossal nephew turned his full attention back toward his tiny uncle.
112122221122212221.title: Zack Seeks Help

1121222211222122211.content:
Zack walked over to his desk and looked down at his speck of an uncle.

“Don’t worry Uncle B.—my friend Alex will know what to do,” Zack told his Uncle trying to act as upbeat as possible. “He’s the smartest guy I know.”

Tiny Bryan looked upward at his mountainous nephew in awe and disbelief. He still found it hard to adjust to his humongous surroundings, especially the giants.

Bryan found the thought of some other college kid being able to help the situation rather ludicrous, and was a little pissed off that his nephew thought someone else was smarter than him.

“Now, I just gotta figure out the best way to carry you over to Alex’s room since your little box is all tore up,” Zack explained to his tiny Uncle as he moved a little closer. Zack positioned one hand level with the edge of his desk, and placed the other one just behind his miniature uncle. He slowly moved his hand on the desk toward the edge, forcing his Uncle into the palm of his other hand. “Just jump on my hand Uncle B.”

Bryan found it a little unsettling to be forced onto his giant nephew’s hand in such a manner, but he just went along with it for now. In an instant, Bryan was lifted high into the air as Zack lifted his hand.

“You’ll be safe here in my pocket,” Zack said softly to his Uncle as he placed his hand next to his shirt pocket. “Just jump in.”

Bryan climbed onto the top edge of the pocket and tried to hold on with both arms. His intentions were to hang on the top edge so he could see out, instead of being in the dark at the bottom of the pocket.

But after a few seconds, he lost his grip and fell to the bottom of Zack’s enormous shirt pocket. Zack chuckled softly. “You’ll be safer that way Uncle B.—that way you won’t fall out.”

Zack locked the door and began the trek across campus to the high rise dorm where his friend Alex lived. He checked his pocket a couple times to make sure his Uncle was doing okay. “Don’t worry Uncle B.—almost there.”

Zack entered the lobby of the high rise dormitory, got on the elevator and headed up to the seventh floor. When he got to Alex’s room, Zack gave a couple knocks on the door. After a response from Alex, he opened the door and walked in.

Alex sat at a desk in one corner of the room playing Tetris on a laptop computer.

Bryan had managed to climb to the top edge of Zack’s shirt pocket. He peered out and surveyed the room of his nephew’s friend. A long table that extended the entire length of one wall was packed with an array of various pieces of test equipment. An expensive looking telescope was positioned next to the window, and a near life-size poster of Albert Einstein was taped to one of the walls.

“What’s up Zack,” Alex greeted his friend with a big smile. “What’s this big favor you need?”

“Well, it’s more like a little problem,” Zack responded as he walked over and gave Alex a firm pat on the back. “It’s a little strange so just listen and don’t laugh.”

Zack went on to explain to his friend about the small package he received containing his extremely tiny Uncle. “And the worst part is that I can’t hear what he’s saying because he is so tiny.”

“Well, being the size of a bug would explain that part,” Alex responded at the verge of completely cracking up. “And just when did you start doing drugs, Zack?”

“I know it sounds crazy, but you won’t be laughing in a minute when I show him to you,” Zack said. “He’s right here in my pocket.”

Zack looked down and saw his miniature uncle holding on to the top edge of his pocket. He reached down with a massive hand and let his bug sized uncle climb onto his palm. Zack carefully lowered his shrunken uncle onto a textbook that was sitting on Alex’s desk.

Bryan surveyed the thick shiny textbook, noticing the title.

“Wave Particle Duality & de Broglie Waves Made Easy,” Bryan read the title to himself as he walked along the surface of the humongous book. “This is one of my favorite books. This Alex guy must be okay.”

“What the…,” Alex exclaimed wide eyed unable to finish his sentence. He sat frozen in his chair looking down in complete disbelief as a tiny man waved up at him. “This can’t be. It’s impossible!”

“I told ya smarty,” Zack said with a chuckle, amused at his friend’s reaction. “You got any ideas on what I should do?”

Alex just stared at the shrunken man for a few minutes and then said, “Hold on just a minute, Zack. I’ve got an idea.”

Alex opened the drawer to a nearby metal cabinet and began rummaging through an assortment of various electrical devices. “Got it!”

“Put this in your ear,” Alex instructed Zack as he handed him a small earpiece and then placed a very small wireless microphone next to tiny Bryan. “You guys do your catching up. I’ve got some work to do.”

Alex took a handful of items he had collected from the storage cabinet and spread them out onto his worktable.

“Zack, can you hear me?” Bryan nervously spoke into the mic Alex had placed next to him.

“YES! YES!” Zack responded unable to control his excitement. “I hear you loud and clear Uncle B.!”

“Now tell me what the fuck happened to you,” Zack demanded as his tone became more serious. “How did you get like this?”

Tiny Bryan spent the next ten minutes explaining his fool hearty plan in its entirety to his gigantic nephew. “It was just supposed to be a big surprise for you Zack.”

He continued the story about how he had lost the antidote during shipment, and it was probably somewhere in Zack’s trash can back in his dorm room. Zack just sat silently with his mouth wide open, mesmerized at his tiny uncle’s every word.

“Okay, all finished,” Alex exclaimed with pride as he rejoined Zack and his bug sized uncle. “Just let me have that mic for a second.”

Alex carefully positioned the microphone inside a very small box that was hooked to a silver chain. He held the chain up as the box dangled precariously below.

“Now you’ve got something to carry him around in besides your shirt pocket,” Alex explained. “And best of all—you can talk to each other.”

“You’ve got to be kidding me,” Bryan thought angrily as he looked at the box and chain. “I’m not going to be put in a box and worn around someone’s neck.”

“Cool,” Zack replied to Alex as he handed him the little box and chain. He looked down at his miniaturized uncle. “Look what Alex made for you.”

His first question to Bryan related to the specifics of how the shrunken scientist had overcome some rather formidable obstacles in successfully reducing his size to such minute proportions.

Bryan, impressed despite himself, marveled that Alex seemed such a true prodigy. He also felt awe at the young man's gigantic physical form.

Alex looked tall and lean, dressed at the moment in a pair of faded denim jeans and a form-fitting T-shirt. He had unruly black hair, pale skin and dark eyes concealed behind wire-frame glasses.

Other than the colossal size difference between them, Bryan imagined they might have a lot of common ground to discuss over a cup of coffee.

"I can't even feel you," Alex said in a voice low with awe.

Bryan, beginning to feel confident Alex didn't mean to let him drop to the distant floor, began to relax. After all, hadn't he always wanted to enjoy being tiny and totally under the control of some all-powerful giant?

"HEY, THAT'S COOL!" Zack said, noticing his speck-sized uncle in his friend's hand.

With the two titans looking on, the tiny man waited for the restorative agent to catalyze, usually signaled by mild muscle tremors and some slight nausea.

Instead, to his mounting unease, nothing happened. His muscles felt stable, his stomach wasn't the least upset and he also could not detect even a millimeter of growth.
