Twelve inches of growth overnight would normally qualify as a growth spurt by any definition.

For Bryan, however, the spurt stalled out, which left him only a foot tall and faced with some awkward situations.

After waking up the morning after his arrival and finding the antidote had grown him to nearly 12 inches tall, Bryan kept hoping that the formula would do its job and complete the process.

Each day for the past three days, Zack's friend Alex visited and took careful measurements.

Today, like the other days, found the same result. "I'm sorry, Mr. Smith," Alex said. "You're still only 11.5 inches tall."

Bryan adjusted the handkerchief, which he wore like a toga. It was the same handkerchief he had used inside the package to cushion his journey to Zack.

"It's all right," Bryan said. He kept pulling on the handkerchief. He had his tiny pre-shrunk clothes, but they would not fit now. He certainly could not borrow anything from his nephew's wardrobe.

His voice, while squeaky in its new pitch, allowed for communication with his giant nephew and Alex.

"Uncle B., I am really sorry about this," Zack said. "Isn't there anything else we can do?"

Bryan watched as his nephew eased his big body into a chair and looked down at him. In comparison to his uncle, Zack looked about 36 feet tall.

Alex cleared his throat. "Maybe I should have asked first, but I made a stop before coming over today," Alex said.

Alex reached into his backpack. He pulled out some plastic-wrapped packages. Bryan looked with some distress at the plastic dolls on the other side of the plastic.

"That's cool!" Zack said as he looked at the male dolls dressed in Army fatigues.

"The store didn't have a lot of variety," Alex said. "They did have some superhero action figures, but I didn't know how you felt about spandex."

Zack picked up the box and effortlessly tore away the plastic wrapping. His uncle watched with increase unease as Zack began to strip the fatigues off the plastic doll.

Zack dropped the pants and shirt on the floor in front of his uncle. "Uncle B., try them on!"

Bryan took the clothes into his small hands. The fabric felt scratchy and the dolls didn't come with such extras as little undershorts. He raised his eyes and noticed the intense scrutiny from Zack and Alex.
1121222211222122211211111.title: Awkward Situations

1121222211222122211211112.content:
A short while later, Alex left to return to his place, promising to return soon and consult again on the problem.

Left alone with his tiny uncle, Zack made careful preparations for Bryan's comfort and safety, emptying a match box and stuffing a wad of cotton inside the cardboard container.

Once Bryan settled into the cozy box, Zack tiptoed into his bedroom, doing his best not to jar his uncle too severely. He placed the little matchbox bed on the stand next to his bed.

He peered down into the box. His uncle looked almost lost in the huge wad of cotton.

"Don't you worry, Uncle B," the huge young man promised. "If we can't get you back to normal, at least you'll be in good hands."

Needless to say, his nephew's attempt to ease his mind backfired. Now, as he tried to get some sleep, Bryan's mind raced on the thought of what would become of him if he remained a speck-sized man in a giant world.

Finally, simple exhaustion won out, and he drifted off to sleep.

•••••••

"I don't think he ought to have to live like this," Zack said in a downcast tone to his friend, Alex.

"I know," Alex admitted, looking down, way down, at the tiny man standing between their feet on the floor of Zack's room.

"You remember what I discussed with you," Zack asked.

"Yes," Alex said.

"I...I just can't do it."

Alex clapped a hand on Zack's shoulders. "I'll take care of it for you," he said. "Just step outside for a moment."

The entire time, Bryan listened to their conversation with growing unease.

"I am sorry, Dr. Smith," Alex said after Zack left the room. "We have done all we can. You are never going to grow back."

"Wait," Bryan tried to shout. "Where did Zack go?"

"I'm sure you would rather just end it quickly," Alex said.

"End it?" Bryan squeaked. "What are you saying?"

Alex raised his huge shoe.

"No!" Bryan gasped as the shadow engulfed him.

"Just hold still, and I will make sure this is done quickly," Alex said.

"No!" Bryan tried to run. "I don't care! I still want to live! Please, you can't..."

••••••

Suddenly, Bryan fell, hitting his head on the floor. The commotion also woke his sleeping nephew.

Zack opened his eyes and saw his uncle standing in the room, normal size again, and rubbing his temples.

"Ow, damn, that hurt," Bryan said.

Suddenly, he saw Zack, who looked normal again.

He looked down at himself. "I'm normal!" Bryan exclaimed.

Bryan blushed then. "Normal...and naked."

"It's okay," Zack said. He tossed his uncle a pair of his boxers.

As soon as Bryan pulled on the shorts, his nephew gave him a huge hug. "Good to have you back," Zack said.

"It is good to be back," Bryan said, looking up at his nephew. Looking up a little higher than usual.

Zack noted his uncle's alarmed expression.

"What's the matter, Uncle B?"

Bryan confided his worry. Soon enough, a quick measurement confirmed that Bryan had not completely grown back to his full height.

"I am two inches shorter," Bryan complained.

"Well, look at it like this," Zack said. "It beats being two inches tall."

"I suppose," Bryan said, thinking back on that awful nightmare just before he woke to find himself, almost, restored to normal.

"But, if I hadn't grown back, you would have taken good care of me, right?"

"Sure," Zack said. "You could have counted on me!"

"Good," Bryan said.

"You know, I get spring break in a couple of months," Zack said. "I'd love to visit you. Maybe we could conduct some followup experiments."

"I don't know," Bryan said. "Maybe I ought to take my research in a new direction."

Zack didn't push too hard. He wanted to play it cool. There was no need to let his uncle know how big a thrill he had experienced finding himself in complete control of a tiny man.

"Well, no need to decide now," Zack said.

Ever since discovering his shrunken uncle and learning of his impulsive (no, it's more like insane) scheme, Zack had felt a creeping resentment in the back of his mind.

He had always thought of his uncle as brilliant and, yes, slightly geeky, but what could have possessed him to shrink himself to bug size and make a trip via the U.S Postal Service inside a package?

Inside the bag, trapped in the plastic prison of the pill bottle, the bug-sized scientist had no way of monitoring the activity of his gigantic nephew and his two colossal friends.

He tried to tell himself it was better that way. The humbling circumstance of finding himself transported in an pill bottle began to make him see that he might have made a mistake.

He trusted Zack, but as his adventure had already taught him, the world's a dangerous place full of unexpected surprises when you're only a quarter-of-an-inch tall.

He didn't know how long he had spent inside the bottle when the car hit a bump. No serious damage except for the fact that the lid popped off the bottle. His nephew must have failed to snap the lid securely in place.

Unfortunately, the bottle had been placed inside the bag in a way that now caused the tiny man to begin sliding along the curve of the smooth plastic walls toward the now enormous opening of the bottle.

He tried to gain some traction, but he only accelerated his slide down the two-inch section of smooth plastic. Suddenly, just like that, he fell out of the bottle and landed on a soft surface. He didn't know it at that very moment, but he had managed to land inside a folded pair of his nephew's boxer briefs.

.....

The three college students gathered around the blue Acura and gazed at the two flat tires... one on the front driver's side and the other on the rear of the vehicle on the passenger's side.

"What are the chances of two flats?" Rick said.

Frustrated, Zack kicked up sand and pebbles. "Dammit," he said. "I've just got one spare!"

Todd tried to get a signal on his cellphone. "Not getting anything, man," he reported.

"We passed that gas station just a couple of miles back," Rick said.

"It was more than a couple of miles," Zack said.

"No, it wasn't," Rick retorted. "I'm sure."

"Anyway, great short-cut," Todd said.

"Yeah, why did I listen to you?" Zack piled on. "There's not even any other cars on this damn road!"

"Look, you and I can walk to that gas station," Rick said, trying to sound reasonable. "Todd can stay here with the car."

Zack didn't want to be reasonable, but he didn't see any other choice. He sighed and agreed.

His friends had been gone almost a half hour when Todd's stomach began to grumble. Thinking that Zack might have packed some snacks, he reached into the car for his friend's duffel bag.

Opening the back door, Todd reached across and grabbed Zack's bag, pulling it towards him. Unzipping it he began rummaging through the clothes hoping that Zack might have tucked a muesli bar or some other food in amongst his belongings. Pulling the clothes towards him as he dug in amongst them he didn't notice the tiny man who was laying on a pair of Zack's underwear, blinking in the unexpected bright light.

- - - - -

Bryan tried to focus as the bag was unzipped but having been locked away in darkness, the sudden brightness of the desert sun had his eyes watering and blinking. He had the vague impression of a giant shape looming over him and he tentatively called out to who he presumed was his nephew, "Zack, I fell out of the bottle."
He had no real warning as the clothes beneath him suddenly lurched upwards as the giant rummaged through them. Bryan felt himself sliding towards the giant and his vision finally cleared just in time as he was flung into the air by a sudden movement by the giant pushing the clothes around.
Bryan had no time to yell as he saw a wall of denim hurtling towards him. He slammed into it and immediately started to fall downwards. He saw a lifeline and managed to grab it, holding on for dear life as the giant continued to move around.
As his vision cleared he realised that he was hanging from some loose threads from the top of the jeans pocket of this unknown giant. As the giant continued his hunt through Zack's bag Bryan tried to get a better grip but he could already feel the thick threads slipping through his hand. With a yell of frustration he lost his grip and plummetted downwards. Luckily the giant's leg was bent and it provided a steep slope that Bryan tumbled and slid but he could see the precipice formed where the giants knee bent the leg back the other way. Trying to halt his fall he scrambled for a handhold but he was moving too fast and there were no more loose threads.
With a scream he shot off the knee of the giant and into open space. His plunge was arrested quickly by the simple act of him hitting the side of the backseat of the car and he bounced back towards the giant, hitting the loose denim covering the giant's calf, then he dropped straight down.
The various impacts knocked the wind out of him and he was sure he would be covered in bruises but at least they had the effect of slowing his fall so that when he finally hit a flat surface he wasn't killed on impact.
For a moment he just lay on his back where he was, gasping in air and thanking the heavens that he was still alive. Slowly his sense of where he was crept back in and he groaned as he realised his predicament had continued its run of bad luck.

112122221122212221121112121122.content:
“No, no, no!!!” The tiny scientist screamed in outrage at the injustice of this latest setback.

Making this particular twist of fate even harder for him to accept was that he placed the blame squarely on his nephew, the person he had misplaced his trust in from the very start of his misadventure.

Ever since having been “surprised” by the arrival of his shrunken uncle, Zack had reacted with almost monumental indifference to the real dilemma that Bryan faced at such a small size in a world of giants. Even the indignity of having been dropped into a pill bottle and stuffed into the college student’s duffel bag (for his own good… like hell!) had been instigated by Zack, who was more concerned with interrupting a road trip with his friends than to take a moment to consider the welfare of his favorite uncle.

Now, the bug-sized man found himself mercifully at rest on a vast terrain of sand and boulder-sized pebbles. He definitely did not want to remain outside the refuge offered by the enormous Acura he had purchased for his nephew only a few months ago.

After he swallowed his aggravation, he started to make a survey of his surroundings when he noticed the huge sneaker planted on the ground only a few feet away.

Suddenly, with almost no warning, that same giant sneaker lifted and then slammed down only a few inches from his location, sending up an eruption of grains of sand and grit.

The terrified little man looked up, seeing one of his nephew’s titanic college buddies.

“Zack!” The tiny man screamed, not realizing that his nephew had left on a quest for assistance to solve their problem of two flat tires.

------

Todd, having failed in his search for any hidden food caches in the automobile, walked around the vehicle and parked himself atop the hood, trying to gaze into the distance for any sign of his returning friends. He hoped they would bring back some snacks or at least something to drink.

As he looked around the vast, flat desert landscape, everything looked so harsh and monotonous. “Wish to hell they would hurry up,” he said aloud.

He didn’t notice as a tiny man no bigger than a puny bug crept over the sand and dirt, taking exhausting detours around pebbles now grown to the size of immovable boulders.

With the desert sun beating down on him, Todd removed his shirt, figuring he could soak up some rays until Rick and Zack returned.

------

The tiny scientist, grateful that Zack’s huge friend hadn’t accidentally trodden on him, took a moment to collect his wits and catch his breath.

He watched the titanic college student move around the vehicle, his gigantic shoes lifting clouds of dust and grit.

He felt some relief when the huge man settled on the hood of the car. At least he posed less of a threat seated than stomping around in those colossal sneakers.

Tiny Bryan still detected no trace of his nephew or Zack’s other friend. As he made a timid survey around the vehicle, he saw the problem. One of the mammoth tires, now deflated and sunken into the sand, had sprung a flat. He realized that Zack and his friend must have gone looking for help.

“Doesn’t he keep a spare?” Little Bryan wondered aloud.

Suddenly, he saw that the titan was on the move again. He tensed to run, but this time the huge youth only stood and removed his shirt. Bryan stared in awe at the incredibly muscular body exposed by the now shirtless giant.

"Oh my god!" The tiny scientist exclaimed as he saw the titan's muscles ripple and gleam beneath the bright desert sun.

112122221122212221121112211.content:
Alex stared down at the tiny man, his dark eyes narrowed to focus from behind his wire-frame eyeglasses on Bryan's shrunken form.
Bryan remained acutely aware of every detail of the young man's enormous body. Alex looked impossibly tall, dressed at the moment in a pair of faded denim jeans and a form-fitting sweatshirt. His unruly black hair cascaded over his pale forehead head.

"Do we have an understanding, Mr. Smith?" Alex inquired, keeping his tone light and casual.

Bryan looked far up into the sky towards the face of the enormous Alex. 

Bryan still felt a little shocked that Alex had disconnected the mic so that he couldn't hear him. The odd sense of isolation made him feel a little nervous. He realized that perhaps he should play along for the moment.  

He gave a cautious nod to let Alex know that he understand what he wanted, and that, within reason, he agreed to it!

It didn't take long after Alex saw Bryan nodding his miniscule head that a grin started to creep across his face. 

Up until that moment, Bryan had thought that restoring his size was foremost on Alex's mind.

Those assurances, however, had been freely offered only when Zack was still around.  Now that it's just the two of them, Bryan sensed a slightly different mood from his nephew's titanic friend.

He wasn't at all sure he liked the mood that he sensed from Alex. He watched as Alex reached out and activated the microphone.

The huge hand reached over and effortlessly moved the giant metal switch with complete ease.   The loud click and then a slight humming in the air alerted Bryan to the device's re-activation.

"You can hear me again?" Bryan asked tentatively.

Alex nodded.

"Hey Alex, what was that all about?  Why did you turn off the speaker there?"

Alex laughed. "I suppose I wasn't paying attention. Sorry 'bout that, little guy."

Alex lowered his face down to the surface of the table.

Considering that mischievous smile on that enormous face, Bryan's not sure he can put too much faith in Alex's honesty.

Then again, it's possible, Bryan decided, that Alex might not even realize he had smiled. 

Because of his much smaller size, everything about the giant's facial expressions are much more exaggerated — even a tiny smirk really shows!  

"No problem," Bryan spoke hesitantly into the mic.  

"And I didn't wanna worry Zack," Alex confessed.

Bryan felt his heart beat faster at that revelation. He meant to ask Alex to explain, but his question got cut short again as a shadow loomed vastly over him. Alex's giant face moved much closer.

Bryan instinctively backed up until he realized with logic that Alex wouldn't smash his face into the table.

When Alex does speak at this close proximity Bryan is forced to cover his ears.

"Please not so loud!" Bryan pleaded through the microphone.

"For such a tiny guy, you sure have a big brain," Alex said. "I can't imagine all the obstacles you overcame to find a way to shrink."

Bryan's plea, transmitted through the mic, brought an instant apology. "Oops, sorry!" Alex said. He lowered his voice.

As the booming voice gets more bearable, Bryan noticed that Alex isn't moving his face any further away. 

He noticed things about your face now that a normal-sized person would never see, such as tiny pits from acne, as well as dark hairs forming stubble that appears quite thick to the shrunken man.

"Well, I did have a lot of trouble in getting here," Bryan recollected. "I thought my plan was perfect, but at least I did make it here in one piece."

"Yeah," Alex agreed. "Lucky for you...and me."

That intimidating smirk formed again on Alex's face.

"It was supposed to be a big surprise for Zack," Bryan said, now fully into communicating his incredible story to such an attentive listener. "He is always telling me to take a vacation, so this time I thought not only would I listen to him, I would let him take total charge!
"I thought this would be a cool thing to do, though as soon as I started on this adventure, I wasn't so sure," Bryan admitted. "And now he's leaving for Vegas.
"So even this part isn't turning out exactly as I thought."

"Nothing ever goes exactly as planned," Alex said with sympathy for the little guy's plight. "I'm sure we could still arrange for some adventure for you!"

As Alex spoke, Bryan watched the smile on the huge face grow even bigger

"Oh man, I'm just so glad to be noticed finally!" Bryan said, unwilling to quit talking now that he has started his story. "I had quite a disastrous adventure just to get here.
"All I want to do now is chill for a little and take a breather."

Alex made a disapproving noise. "Oh, that's no fun..."

Alex open his mouth, and suddenly he is exhaling.

Blowing his breath across the table toward Bryan. It's like the game where kids blow pennies across tabletops.

The action, totally unexpected, takes Bryan completely by surprise.
He saw the huge mouth open, but not expecting anything to happen, Bryan just stare dumbfounded, until Alex started to blow toward him.   
The tiny man is immediately assaulted with warm moist breath of a hurricane force. He is literally lifted off his feet and blown across the surface of the table.   

"Alex!" Bryan cried out. "I..." is all he is able to get out of his mouth before the mic wire is ripped out of his tiny hand and lost in the wind storm.

At the same time, Alex, laughing like crazy, stared down at Bryan's clumsy antics in the face of the gust of wind.

Bryan tried to get a fair distance from Alex, but the giant is still blowing and the tiny man is still being pushed back further along the smooth tabletop.

"I could blow you away!" Alex announced with vigor.

At least by talking, however, the giant shut off the windstorm.

Bryan saw how he had been blown within a few centimeters from the end of the tabletop.

He rested there, as the winds die down to be replaced by loud reverberating deep laughter.   

He listened as Alex started talking in between chuckles.   

Bryan tried to get up on his feet again and started yelling a couple of expletives at the giant, but without the benefit of the mic, Alex has no idea what Bryan is saying.

"Hey, I can't hear you, Bryan."

Finally on his feet, the tiny man realized he should be quite bruised from being blasted like that.

His scientific mind kicks into gear. "I am fine," Bryan said aloud. Thinking about the situation, he realized that his much decreased mass versus surface area must now mean that he is less prone to being hurt from simple falls.

But that logical thought is interrupted by the rage he felt at Alex's actions.

On his feet, walking fast towards the huge grinning face, Bryan froze.

He realized in any other situation, this would look ridiculous, a bug-sized man walking to confront a giant like this.

It must look so funny, but Bryan cannot help feeling angry. He slowed his approach, trying to keep a bit of a dignified look to his walk.

Then the huge mouth begins opening again, and Bryan realized there is no way to have a "real" confrontation with Alex.

The scientist saw that Alex is simply waiting for him to start any kind of argument, so he can blow him away again.

Bryan determined not to give the giant the opportunity. He would remain calm and in control—

Suddenly, Alex flicked his tongue out of his mouth.

Bryan stopped and lifted up his hands as he saw the huge tongue.
Totally unprepared, Bryan watched helplessly as the huge tongue darted out of the gaping mouth. Stopped in his tracks, Bryan fell down again.

Alex closed his mouth, hiding his tongue back behind his lips. He laughed again.

Being this close to the giant mouth again, the laughter is just booming in Bryan's ears. The tiny man is on his butt from the shock of Alex's tongue and now he has got his hands over his ears from the laughter.
Bryan began to realize the futility of his situation and the fact that he has lost even the semblance of control.

Bryan is left to wonder if that is what Alex had in mind all along.

"Well, we're gonna have a really fun weekend," Alex pronounced. "And you've been left in really good hands."

As the giant's laughter died down, and Bryan looked up again at the huge face smiling down at him, he felt incredibly small and powerless.

Bryan thought hard about everything he'd worked for, putting together his plan and creating the shrinking and antidode solutions. It would feel like a waste to quit now. So he positioned himself near his peekhole, and sat down, with nothing else to do but watch the game.

Tommy was great at shooting the ball, as were Mark and Jeff, but Joe was truly the best player on the court. He dribbed like the ball were only an extention of his body and moved gracefully across the asphalt. Bryan was actually getting into the game, getting tense when the ball was stolen and excited when points were scored.

Suddenly, Joe sprung through the air to dunk the ball. One of the other players, Mark, jumped to block him. The ball hit Mark's hand, bouncing away from both of them.

Bryan was curious at first, trying to figure out where the ball was until he heard the enormous smacking sounds against the concrete and the reverberations through the ground. The ball hit the package as if it were bowling rather than basketball, and Bryan immediateley felt the results.
11212222121.title: B-Ball Turns Bowling

choices: Bryan faints
The other two giants are leaving the court
112122221211.content:
His ears continued to ring and his head pounded.

Bryan, as if in a daze, recalled seeing the enormous basketball coming toward the shipping package. The awful sound of the huge ball bouncing against the court's asphalt pounded in his memory.

When the ball knocked the small package off the bench, a huge chasm had been ripped in the container. The tiny man had spilled through the rip in the package and found himself sprawled on the scorching asphalt.

An intense dry heat assaulted him in waves. Bryan saw the shadowy interior of the package. "I've got to get back inside before I'm roasted alive!"

He struggled onto his feet and staggered toward the package when a huge hand reached down and plucked the shelter away.

"Is it all right, Tommy?" Joe asked.

Tommy looked at the package. "There's a rip in this corner, but I can use some tape and fix it up." Tommy answered.

Bryan yelled in a hoarse voice, but the titanic teens heard nothing. Sweat soaked the tiny man's body.

"Wait," Bryan cried out weakly, feeling faint from the oven-like heat rising off the black asphalt. "Please, don't leave me here."
112122221211.title: Feeling the Heat

choices: Bryan encounters an insect
Someone is walking
1121222212111.content:
The rain drop smashed into him like fist, pushing his already unconscious body further into the asphalt. The sudden chill woke Bryan. His clothes and skin were soaked with sweat and he felt light-headed and weak. The box, along with the antidote, was gone. And not one of the four teenagers remained. And it was raining.

But that, Bryan had to remind himself, was probably the only reason he was still alive.

He cast an eye around the dark, empty court. Here and there, the rain was coming down only lightly, but Bryan saw gallon after gallon fall from the sky. They looked like tiny glass beads, shattering as they hit the ground around him. If they didn't scare him so badly when they exploded in front of him, Bryan would have thought they looked very beautiful.

Not knowing what else to do, he wandered toward the edge of the court. The ground was still hit under his feet but quickly cooling.

It was unsafe to wander around at night; at a fourth of an inch tall, that didn't change. He heard noises around him: crickets singing mournful songs, dogs yelping. Every so often, he heard feet in the distance but they were too far away to be of any help.

He had shrunk himself down a few times, but never had he been outside. Glancing around with wander at the huge, green canopy, Bryan could barely believe it was only grass. The emerald poles seemed to choke the damp soil, growing tightly together. Bryan had to climb over and around them. He realized, after a few minutes, he did not actually know where he was going.

The sidewalk surprised him somewhat, until he remembered he was in a city park. He must have reached the edge.

Bryan looked around, helplessly. What was he to do? The sidewalk stretched on. Cars whipped by every so often, but the road was otherwise quiet. He had no idea what time it was.
1121222212111.title: A Night in the Park

choices: A more nasty bug than the placid beetle arrives
Someone is walking
11212222121111.content:
Your average city park teems with a multitude of life, much of it unseen by people, despite the zoological abundance literally at their feet during any visit.

Bryan's neighborhood park ranked as average in most terms. Nothing would have stood out under most ordinary conditions.

His current circumstances, however, hardly ranked as ordinary conditions. At his paltry size of a quarter of an inch tall, nothing about his surroundings struck the tiny scientist as ordinary.

The incredible variety of plant life in the park ranged from trees and tall shrubs to cultivated flowers, plants and grasses. Bryan found the trees almost impossible to contemplate. They stretched to such heights that not even the tallest city skyscrapers aspired.

The vast savannah of grass intimidated him. He could travel easily between each blade of grass, but the overhead fronds drooped down, enclosing him beneath a green canopy that made the tiny man claustrophobic despite the enormity of everything around him.

Bryan knew, from an academic standpoint, something about the workings of an ecosystem. The diversity of the park's plants, in turn, maintained an incredible number of insects and invertebrates.

For instance, about 200 species of spider alone make their home in the average city park. Bryan didn't know such precise facts, which probably spared his mind the torment of such fearsome worries.

The park in Bryan's neighborhood included tranquil pools and larger ponds, which allowed for an even greater diversity of life. These sources of water helped the insect population expand to include dragonflies, damselflies and many other aquatic species.

Bryan felt like one of those contestants dumped onto a deserted island, to fend off the land and survive to win monetary prizes. He always dismissed such television fare, but he had sometimes been absorbed, sort of like watching a traffic accident, into watching some of the so-called reality dramas.

His prize, however, was literally survival. He could only return to the normal world by surviving the dangers of the park and finding someone to assist him in his quest to regain his size.

Finding assistance had to take a lower priority for now as his "fight of flight" reflex kicked into action with the sudden appearance of a hideous and mammoth creature.

The curious monstrosity lumbered awkwardly on six spiky legs, its rounded body covered with protective armor plating. Two fearsome mandibles extended from the creature's head, which also included beady black eyes and spiny antennae.

Bryan, if he had wanted to make a direct comparison, would have barely reached the large beetle's abdomen.

Instead of any such possibility, Bryan cowered behind a pebble until the huge beetle, at least four times his size, disappeared into a forest of grass off to one side of the sidewalk.

The tiny man trembled, unaware of the harmless nature of the bug, thankful to have escaped harm.

The bug drove home the fact that he had fallen, like Alice, into a very weird world.

Now, he only wanted to escape. The possibility of such a feat, however, didn't look very promising considering his quarter-of-an-inch size.
11212222121111.title: New World

choices: Run!
Look for a weapon!
112122221211111.content:
The weary, bedraggled scientist stood on shaky legs, moving away from the shelter of the boulder-sized pebble that had provided refuge from the lumbering insect.

He mentally forced his legs to move, taking halting steps, pushing himself onward. The only way to escape his predicament was to make contact with someone of normal size.

He wasn't ready to give up, although nagging him at the back of his brain was the cold, hard fact that rescue meant he would have to attract the attention of a passing titan. He reasoned that his best chance of doing that would be to get back to the asphalt of the outdoor basketball court or one of the park's meandering concrete pathways.

He was making slow progress when suddenly a new insect monstrosity charged toward him, seemingly coming from out of nowhere.

This creature, a far cry from the armor-burdened beetle that had startled him earlier, looked much more threatening. The monster's large bulging eyes focused unerringly on the tiny scientist as the creature's long, slender legs carried it swiftly over the terrain.

The shrunken man screamed when he saw the large curved mandibles that clicked ominously as the killer bug closed the gap.
112122221211111.title: Hungry Bug

choices: Two kids
A man jogging
1121222212111111.content:
Mr. Smith's field of expertise, not being based in entomology, meant he didn't recognize the fearsome bug as a Tiger Beetle. Even had he known the specific identity of the bug, that might not have made him feel much better.

Among the world's millions of insects, tiger beetles are a large group of beetles known for their aggressive predatory habits and running speed. The fastest species of tiger beetle can run at a speed of almost six miles per hour, which, relative to its body length, is about 22 times the speed of Olympic sprinter Michael Johnson.

In other words, despite a determined attempt, there was no possible way Mr. Smith's two legs could outpace the six legs of the fierce insect hunter.

He reached a vast stretch of pavement... the sidewalk through the park, but the insect was rapidly gaining ground.

He didn't know how much longer he could force himself to move. The only thing that kept him going was the humbling thought that he could be exterminated by a mere bug, an insect he could once have crushed with no effort at all.

Suddenly, he heard, and felt, a terrific rumbling.

He looked skyward just in time to see...
1121222212111111.title: Run for your life

choices: A park ranger appears
A man walking his dog appears
11212222121111111.content:
Mr. Smith screamed when he saw two boys, perhaps brothers, as they walked the path through the park. One looked slightly older, and taller, but they both looked huge.

Before he could do anything other than scream, the older boy's shoe sailed overhead, stomping down squarely on the oncoming beetle.

Mr. Smith heard the sickening crunch.

The boys, however, never noticed, and kept walking, soon leaving the gruesome scene far behind them.

Weakly, as he strained to recover from his exertions, Mr. Smith called out to the two young saviors, "Thanks! I owe you one."

At least he kept his sense of humor about the absurdity of his situation.

Then, he scurried closer and saw the mangled remains of the bug. He needed no leap of imagination to know the grisly mess could easily have been his own remains.

The two boys, probably not over 10 years old, could have obliterated him with one unaware step.

For the tiny man, who still retained the amazing intellect that was partly to blame for his dilemma, that was the most humiliating blow of all.

He knew he needed to get help, but any possible help meant trying to contact titans that could easily obliterate him in the blink of an eye

He could easily have given up hope, except at that moment...
11212222121111111.title: Owe you one

choices: Falling into a boot
Biting a park ranger
112122221211111111.content:
Park Ranger Joseph Hannigan enjoyed his job supervising the city parks, always eager to lend a helping hand or make sure that park property remained protected.

He stopped at the usual bench for his mid-day lunch break. He unwrapped a sandwich and unscrewed the lid on his water bottle.

The 24-year-old city employee wore the usual park uniform of brown cargo shorts, crisp green shirt and a wide-brimmed hat. His legs, toned and tanned, slipped into a pair of hiking boots. He remained unaware that one of the lacings had come undone and now dangled on the concrete sidewalk beneath the bench fittings.

Tiny Mr. Smith found the park near his home a frightening terrain filled with roaming alien creatures and humongous trees dwarfing the still huge shrubs that loomed over a jungle of grass blades and weeds.

Being chased by the vicious beetle and encountering two gigantic grade school boys had left him feeling even more morose about his chances of ever finding a safe haven, let alone regaining his normal size.

Depression would have to wait, however, when he heard the slap of the rubber tread of a pair of mammoth hiking boots slamming on the pavement.

The steady stride of the giant meant that the boots were almost upon him before the bug-sized man even had time to react. In his panic, he flung his arms into the air as one of the boots smashed down.

The giant's step missed him, as did the subsequent steps as he made his way to a towering bench.

When the peril passed, the little man dared to raise his eyes. Thankful to still be alive, he studied the enormous man, evaluating the wisdom of seeking help from the behemoth.

The shrunken man knew he needed to seek help, and he had no choice but to look for that assistance from the titans who had once been his peers in a normal human universe.

He felt his spirits lift slightly when he recognized the man as an employee of the park. It was the job of rangers to help park visitors, and the speck of a man could only hope that applies to visitors regardless of size.

As he neared the enormous park bench, which was supported on four massive columns of industrial steel, his gaze fastened on those boots that had stomped so dangerously close only a few moments ago. With one casual move, the giant park ranger could easily obliterate him in the blink of an eye and not even know what he had done.

His courage almost deserted him. The tiny man considered running away and waiting for another opportunity, but at that instant he saw the lace that dangled from the giant's right boot. At least an inch of the lace was draped over the pavement.

Speaking aloud in his excitement, the tiny scientist said, "I can climb the lace, and reach the top of his boot and then..."

His voice trailed off. He didn't know what he should do once he reached the top of the boot. He saw no socks exposed above the boots. Conceivably, he could get close enough to touch the titan's bare leg and...

"And then what?" The little man asked himself in a forlorn voice. His brain, the same one that had gotten him into his dilemma, predicted that the giant would never feel something as tiny and insignificant as he was now.

"But I've got to try," he shouted into the vastness of the park as he lunged toward the lace, which was twice as wide as he was tall.

Without letting any other thoughts get in the way, he began to climb...
112122221211111111.title: Park ranger

choices: Bryan attempts to get the giants attention.
A group of scavenging ants give Bryan unwanted attention.
112122221211112.content:
Cautiously, the tiny man stepped out from behind the vehicle-sized pebble. At normal height, this pebble would be no larger than a grain of rice, but to Bryan, it concealed him completely from the terrifying beetle

Bryan stood and looked around nervously. Where should he go? The chance that he might encounter another frighteningly large insect unsettled him. He knew that he couldn't just stay where he was if he ever hoped to get help.

His frantic thoughts were interrupted as he felt slight tremors reverberating through the ground.

_________________

Robert Williams jogged back to the spot where he and his girlfriend Judy sat. The young couple both attended the nearby college, and had ventured to the park to enjoy a picnic together.

The 20 year old guy worked at the local petroleum station as an attendant. He stood an impressive 6 feet 1 inches, a good head taller than his slightly younger girlfriend. Rob sported short, almost buzzed, blonde hair with a light patch of facial hair on his chin. A casual dresser, Rob wore a t-shirt, jeans, and DC sneakers.

His size thirteen sneakers easily flattened the grass with each step as he approached. The last thing on the young man's mind was the small plants and insects he was crushing. Rob was too busy thinking of the ham sandwiche Judy had made for their picnic.

_____________

Little Bryan barely had time to cry out as the entire landscape was thrown into shadow. A gigantic sneaker crashed down just before him, the thunderous shockwave threw him back. He just had time to take the terrifying site in, before the grass-stained footwear lifted in seemingly slow-motion and out of sight.

Still in shock, Bryan heard (and felt) the thunderous footfall grow distant. Bryan was still shaking as he pulled himself upright. Crying despite himself, he watched slack-jawed as the previously sturdy blades of grass recovered from being flattened. It occurred to the insect-sized man that this plant had adapted itself to this treatment, at least to an extent.

"If only I were so resilient..." He muttered gravely.

His current predicament was so far from what he had initially planned. How could he have been so stupid to think that shrinking himself was a good idea? He wiped blood from his nose as he tried to concoct a plan.

Glancing around, he was completely surrounded by the tree-like grass. He needed to get a higher vantage before he started wandering blindly again. Looking to his immediate right, he saw a broad blade of grass that looked climeable. Bryan took a deep, albeit shakey, breath and scrambled up the plant.

To his surprise, the climb was rather easy, and he suddenly found himself with a panoramic view. All around was a sea of grass that seemed to stretch for miles. All except for a sight that both frightened and enticed the tiny man. Not too far off, he saw the two young lovers, sitting on their huge expanse of blanket. Bryan licked his lips hungrily as he noted the mountain of food piled next to the colossal pair.

The miniscule man had not eaten since before he shrank himself. Shaking his head, Bryan focused on the important fact. He needed help. More importantly, he did not want to spend a night in a forest of grass teeming with fearsome insects. The couple was his best and only option.

Sliding down the grass blade, Bryan sprinted in the direction of the picnic. He made good time, with little interruptions,and found himself suddenly on the edge of the classically-patterned picnic blanket. Gulping nervously, he took in the entire scene.

First and foremost, Bryan shivered at the unfathomably huge form of the young guy. His bulky frame positively dominated the area. The titan sat with his huge legs half-extended before him and his giant sneakers feet firmly planted. Bryan couldn't help but whimper at the sight, especially since he recognised the dirty DC sneakers as the ones that almost flattened him. A loud sound startled Bryan out if his memory when the giant coughed and spit.

"Don't spit like that near the food, Rob! It's disgusting!" Cried the girl, who looked clean and manicured in her summer dress and heels.

"DAMNIT, SORRY. HAD A BUG IN MY MOUTH." His deep voice boomed like thunder to little Bryan.

Unbeknownst to the giant college student and his girlfriend, man watched. Bryan swallowed nervously, as the scene was reminiscent of a animated movie he once saw.

Bryan decided now was the time to act...
112122221211112.title: Someone is walking

choices: Picnic moves forward
The young  lovers get "distracted"
1121222212111121.content:
The towering young woman laid out the containers of food, as well as a couple of plates and utensils for her and Rob. Bryan watched the giantess easily move these gigantic things like they were nothing. He decided he ought to approach a giant and wait for an opportunity to present itself. He settled on approaching Rob, who was closer. At his size even an inch closer was a major difference.

Above him the two titans began to eat while Bryan slowly zigzagged between platters and bowls. They were piled with, what were to him, tons of food. Wondrous food! Bryan's stomach was getting the better of him and he unconsciously drifted closer to each bowl and plate he passed.

---

Judy smiled at Rob and gestured to the food. "Dig in" she said simply. Between them lied a platter of fried chicken, a huge bowl of potato salad, a smaller container of fruit salad, a stack of sandwiches, and a small bowl of deviled eggs.

Rob didn't need any more invitation. He had been anticipating this picnic all day and, knowing how good of a cook Judy was, had eaten very little. While he began piling food on his plate, Judy reached for a bowl of fruit salad.

Rob snatched a bowl of potato salad and uses the spoon to dump it onto his plate. In his haste he scoops a chunk onto the blanket instead of his plate.

“Whoops” Rob grunts as he pinches the chunk of food between his fingers and pushes it into the rest of the pile. He lifts his fingers to his mouth and licks them clean. His face lights up and he turns to Judy.

“Fucking delicious!” he says proudly. Judy gives him a half-hearted smile. “Can you try saying it a little more sophisticated?” she asks gently. Rob gives her a funny look before loudly saying “Why I do declare, this is quite delectable my lady!” in a poor British accent. Judy laughs and pokes him in the chest.

He looks at her plate which has a pile of fruit and a lonely sandwich half. “Aren’t you gonna have more?” he asks. Judy shakes her head and mutters something about her diet. Rob shrugs knowing he can’t convince her otherwise. He grabs a chicken wing and bites into it savagely, savoring its rich and juicy flavor.

---

Bryan is stunned and mortified. He cannot believe what had just happened. His mind replays in slow motion what had just occurred.

He had been nearing the giant named Rob. The young man reached over and around him as he piled what looked like mountains of food onto his plate. He had shifted position, his long shoes now facing Bryan. Caked into the patterned tread was dirt, grime, and ripped grass blades. A few unnoticed bugs who hadn’t escaped Rob’s footfall hung loosely from the shoe sole.

Bryan shuddered, but kept walking as he passed Rob’s plate. A shadow appeared above him and he could hear the squishes of some soft food being dumped onto the plate. Before he knew it he was crushed and lay in darkness. His mind panicked he had been mistaken for a bug and braced for the end.

Instead he felt himself lifted into the light, stuck to what had landed on him. With an audible plop he stops moving. The giant man is looking at him as he sticks his long fingers into his mouth far above. He sucks them clean before his eyes glance ahead and he roars something at his girlfriend.

Now Bryan is trapped in the potato salad, the giants above booming at each other. The young titan reaches down and lifts an airplane sized chicken leg to his face. He tears into it savagely and Bryan feels his heart skip a beat. What could he possibly do?
1121222212111121.title: The picnic begins

choices: Try to wedge between the teeth
Try to get Rob's attention from inside his mouth
11212222121111211.content:
"You ready for finals?" asks Rob as he chews. Judy nods, as he knew she would. "I just need to keep working on my history, there's so many dates to remember!" she replies unhappily. "How about you?"

Rob pauses to swallow. "Hell yeah! I'm ready to graduate and have a great summer!" he says with a wide grin. "With my babe of course! ...and them other girls at the university..." he adds. Judy glares jokingly. "You ass!" she laughs. Rob simply shrugs and lifts the leg to his mouth again.

"God this is so good!" he says through a full mouth. Judy smiles "I experimented a little with all the food. You need to tell me what you think." she tells him. Rob swallows and replies. "So far so good!"

Rob reaches for a deviled egg and easily pops the whole thing into his mouth. "Mmmmmm!" he says happily. Judy laughs and says "If you like everything I might think you're lying!"

Rob shakes his head as he swallows "You've never made a single piece of bad food!" He picks up his spoon, digs into the potato salad, knowing it will be as good as the rest of the spread. He pauses as a gust of wind blows Judy's hair into her face. He laughs loudly before placing the spoonful into his mouth.

---

Bryan is making slow progress as he struggles to free himself. Above he can hear the giants speaking and eating. Every now and then tiny bits of food rain down onto him from the giant's mouth above. Bryan curses as he continues to struggle in the mushy off-white mountain. A shadow darkens his spot and he looks up in fear.

Rob lifts what looks to be an egg the size of yacht to his mouth. The entire thing disappears into his mouth, his jaw moving rhythmically as he chews. Bryan struggles faster but it seems to be counter productive. Always more a man of intellect than that of physical strength his limbs already burn and scream for a break.

Again a shadow darkens his area but Bryan refuses to look up, not needing the sight of more food disappearing to terrify him further. But when a curved, clear wall appears to his side he yelps in terror. He feels his part of the mountain shift and he finally looks up. Rob is staring right at him, or rather the pile of potato salad. In his hand, terribly magnified, a plastic spoon that Rob is using to lift a chunk skyward. This chunk just happens to hold a very unfortunate tiny man.

Bryan's mind shifts into slow motion as his mind spins to come up with a solution. Unable to think of one Bryan takes in every detail of his view. Rob's face look friendly from his blue eyes to his smiling mouth, which show off a set of perfect teeth. A gust blows past and the gigantic face scrunches as Rob shuts his eyes. Bryan sees a small black speck hit the food he is trapped on. A small fly, at the mercy of the wind, has now also become stuck in the food.

Rob takes no notice of the new addition, as the spoon stops in front of his face. He apparently sees something funny as his mouth opens and laughter booms out of it. Bryan however is focused on the mortifying scene ahead of him.

Past Rob's jagged, white teeth his tongue bobs up and down with the laughter. Smeared across the back of it are bits and piles of the chicken and egg that had disappeared down his throat already. Between his large molars, crammed with chewed remains, a thick strand of saliva stretches from top to bottom. In the back, the gaping entrance to his throat frames his long, swinging uvula.

"Noooooo!" Bryan screams in desperation as the spoon moves forward. He is hit with the stench and humidity of the cavern as the spoon lands on the tongue. The light dims and a scraping sound is heard as the spoon leaves the pile of food in Rob's mouth and his tongue begins to maneuver it.

Before long Rob's saliva has freed tiny Bryan from the food and he falls to the tongue. It's rough, undulating surface feels warm, slimy, and disgusting but the tiny man holds on tight nonetheless. He hears squelches and squishes as Rob chews the food and moves it to the back of his mouth. Bryan feels the tongue move underneath him and with a loud squelch it seems the food has moved on.

Bryan laughs crazily from shock. He can't believe he made it! He then remembers he's hardly safe at the moment. Inside some young man's mouth was still a massive danger. The lips part slightly allowing light to enter once more. Bits and smears of food spread across the tongue ahead of him. Mr. Smith looks behind him to see Rob's front teeth tower above him. Their surfaces look like sheer cliffs. Bryan knows his time is limited and he must act quickly.
11212222121111211.title: Picnic Moves Forward

choices: Bryan wakes to a world of denim
Bryan wakes up as they leave
112122221211112112.content:
Shaking himself, the tiny man sets to work trying to make himself know to this terrific giant of a man.

"I'm in his freaking mouth for Godsakes! How does he not...!" Bryan paused his verbal thinking to scream when the bumpy surface shifted suddenly and all light was cut off with a dull crash.

"Fuuuuck!"

Sliding over massive bumps that coated the gigantic surface, he quickly groped for a clump of mashed food larger than himself. The air was thick and heavy, only making his turmoil worse, and stank pungently. Unable to see, Bryan could only clutch the food, praying to God that he didn't become part of this behemoth's meal.

Light burst in from between the huge lips as they parted, glaring past the towering teeth like sunlight through a cityscape.

Bryan screamed vainly, trying to keep steady as the plain of gooey flesh moved beneath him. From behind, his tiny voice was rendered useless by an explosion of guttural breath and sound. Thrown against the nearest taste bud, Bryan clutched his ears. The thunderous notes exploded past him, feeling like the shockwave of an explosion. The giant was speaking!

Saliva squished noisily around him, both spraying into the air and falling from the ridged roof like vehicle-sized stalagmites.

He couldn't waste any more time screaming; Bryan had to do something more! "Notice...ME!" The bug-sized scientist proclaimed with surprising vigor. Digging his nails and biting his teeth, he assaulted the tender taste bud. It was difficult. The taste bud, out of many hundreds, was almost his size - but, he scratched and dug into it with ferocity. Putting every ounce of strength; every ounce of frustration and anger from this whole ordeal in it.

Suddenly, the tongue slid roughly and a finger the size of a building entered.

---

"How interesting..." Judy smiled, leaning upon her hand as she listened.

"...Oh, and then Bobby dropped the camshaft," Her boyfriend said, spitting with every other word. "Almost on his foot! The dumbas-... Uh... the dummy had a freakin' hangover still, and there he was trying to move parts!"

Each word entered Judy's mind before politely exiting out the other side. She understood little, and cared less for Rob's talk about his work. Still, he liked to gab, and she would sit quietly while he did.

"The boss was-..." Rob frowned suddenly, twisting his mouth. "Eck...the fuck..?" He poked his finger into his mouth, causing Judy to frown. She opened her mouth to chide his language, but didn't have the chance when he furrowed his brow and stuck two fingers in. Not a moment later, he pulled them out with a grunt.

Judy wretched back, disgusted by both the action and the cause. "Some damn bug in my mouth; little motherfucker bit my tongue!" He said. An expression that was nowhere near Judy's disgust on his face, instead he looked unimpressed. Between his index and thumb, coated in a sheen of saliva, was a minutely sized speck that wriggled helplessly. Sloshing his tongue around for others, Rob continued to stare at the tiny voyager, rolling it between his digits.

Then he shrugged and simply wiped it off on his jeans.

"That is disgusting! How did you get that in your mouth for Pete's sake?" His girlfriend looked mortified, no longer leaning languidly, but sitting upright.

Rob shrugged again, smacking his mouth while he cleaned with his tongue. "Tiny bitch probably jumped in my food... I don't know," His mouth felt cleaner now, he thought, despite the potato salad and few ants still remaining between his teeth. "Who cares? Just a teeny little one anyway."

His dismissal was ineffective against Judy, who placed her plate upon the basket. She hated bugs. Even thinking of or looking at them made her feel sick. The mere idea that one could be in his food made was almost too much... But, what if they got into her food? It was too much.

"Okay, okay... Don't worry about it. I'm sorry for being gross!"

She began covering up, grabbing each container and clipping the lid over. There was no chance she would let her delicious food become lunch for a bunch of gross insects. Rob watched, giving her a look. "Come on, I don't want to go yet," He reasoned with a soft edge to his deep voice. Setting his hoodie up in a bunch, he patted it. "Let's lay down and enjoy this great day - we don't get to do this, like, ever!"

"Plus, I feel a food-coma coming on!" He added with a grin.

Judy stopped, and looked at him. He was too much sometimes - but, she loved him for it. "Oh... Okay," Clipping one last container, she shifted over to him. "...you big dope!"

The young lovers laid down: Rob stretching his long bulk over the entire blanket, laying on his back and propping his thick arms behind his head. Judy leaned against his shoulder and they both relaxed.

Relaxed and unaware of the tiny "creature" stuck on Rob's knee by a glob of spit.
112122221211112112.title: Biting the tongue

choices: To get the giant's attention!
To escape!
1121222212111121121.content:
Gasping, Bryan thrust his eyes open. His heart beat like a hammer, slamming in his chest like a caged animal. Pulling upright, his body peeled forth from a pool of wet goo.

"Ack! Shit..." Pulling himself free, he gagged slightly. "Gross... Ugh! How could this happen? And, where the hell am I...?"

As if in answer, the ground shuddered and seemed to move. Bryan fell over, slopping into the drying pool of saliva once more as he did. This time, he screamed in anger and humiliation, leaping out. His whole body was covered in the drying spit, creating an almost cellophane-like material that smelled like crap. Disgust washed over him and he began to wipe it off when he heard a distant rumble.

His whole body went limp with disbelief as he stared. "Holy.... Oh, my... Oh, God."

Bryan went into to noiseless gawking, realizing what he was looking at. Somehow - someway - while he was incapacitated, he had been relocated to the pant leg of the monstrous titan that nearly ate him for lunch. Bryan had trouble keeping himself focused. Just looking from his tiny location, across seemingly miles of thick blue denim, past a black mass of cotton that hung against the titan's torso, to a distant face propped up by a mountain range of huge arms.

"It's... He's laying down!" He noticed half-mindedly.

The extreme angle made the giant seemed otherwordly... In fact, more specifically, the giant resembled an entire world!

Bryan could barely discern the distant face. It was blurred such, that he still could only tell the overall features of the huge man. Turning around, he saw the other leg across a limitless chasm of space that ended with the patterned picnic blanket. Behind him, over far less land, but long and treacherous as well, ended the pant-leg with a huge sneaker that tilted to the side.

It was all too much for the tiny man to take in at once. He felt himself panicking - almost hyperventilating! This giant fucker was just too huge!

He was having trouble believing they were even the same species. That this gargantuan landscape was living, moving, breathing; just like himself. Bryan looked back towards the vastly distant face. The giant shifted his head, eyes closed, moving his large arms. Moments later, Bryan felt his world tremble slightly in reaction to the mundane movements.

Trying to collect his emotions, he gulped. "Okay. Alright. Yes... just fine. This is my chance to get somewhere!"

Bryan could use this chance to trek across the length of leg, across the huge torso, and get this behemoth's attention... face to face! Or, he could climb down and escape. That was a very viable option that seemed limitlessly safer, but wouldn't get him any closer to being saved!

Turning, the tiny man decided...
1121222212111121121.title: Waking up...

choices: Biting the giant finger
Rob lifts his hand away
1121222212111122.content:
His gaze shot from the two gigantic human beings. The female sat quiet and modestly, sipping a beverage and smiling at her companion with loving interest. The huge young man on the other hand kept a steady roar of conversation, his booming voice reverberating through tiny Bryan's body. Bryan noticed the young girl seemed especially interested in the man's opinion of the food--of which he took daunting portions of at a time.

The bug-sized man looked on. "Young lovers... Great." Taking an impressive bite of what looked like potato salad, the young man leaned in a gave the girl an wet kiss of approval. He also said her name.

"Judy. Her name is Judy." Bryan noted out loud, continuing his eavesdropping. Not more than a moment later, he caught the giant's name from Judy. "She called him Robbie" Bryan repeated turning his gaze from the two unaware giants. The name Robbie hardly seemed to fit such a frightening behemoth of this stature.

Satisfied momentarily with his eavesdropping, Bryan looked over to the impressive display of food in the distance. His stomach rumbled. "Crap, I forgot how hungry I was. When did I last eat?" It had only been over a day, yet Bryan felt as if he has been running in this nightmare for years.

He was just pondering the possibility of purloining the gigantic couples food when he heard strange noises.

Bryan turned quickly to face an oncoming group of ants. The hideous insects quickly surrounded him, one brushing an antennae larger than a telephone pole against him. He shrieked at the unwelcome touch, and reeled back in terror. "Get away!" He yelled.

They had him surrounded. Seven of them to his measly one. It was a frightening situation for tiny Bryan, as he had always been terrified by any insect.

One approached suddenly. Clashing mandibles and bulbous coal-black eyes made Bryan cry out for mercy and squirm into a tiny ball. The large ant swiftly inspected the trembling ball and with a loud click, clack, it seemed to communicate to the other ants. The sound of many legs scuttling away prompted Bryan to peek from his huddled position.

"They're... They... They're leaving!" Bryan almost giggled. He was unsure why, but they had deemed him unworthy of consumption. It was the best stroke of luck he had yet.

The ants had resumed a hurried crawl towards the enormous, looming form of Rob. Seeing the automobile-sized beasts in comparison to the dizzying size of the giant made Bryan remember just how small he was. The giant young man continued his endless thundering dialogue, that appeared to be an exciting story for him, but less interesting to his girlfriend who feigned interest in between bites.

"Now, all I need to do is get their attention!"

Rob was closest, but by far the most dangerous. Judy was seated furthest, separated from Bryan by a mass amount of food that was constantly being disturbed by her hungry boyfriend.

He looked back to Rob. "It will have to be him. He is sure to notice me if he stops blathering for just a moment..." He looked the giant over, cringing at the familiar sneakers. One hand held a paper plate piled high with food in his lap, while the other wielded a plastic fork that brought large portions of the meal to the giant's mouth between sentences. Drops of crumbs and glomps of food rained to the ground with eat colossal bite and made an easy destination for the ants.

The shrunken scientist steadied himself in preparation, and looked upwards to the sky. "Please... I just wanted to go back to normal... I-..." His empty prayers suddenly halted when distant movement and a shadow encompassed the area.

"Oh shit!" Bryan was upended when the ground lurched due to a gargantuan hand crashing down.

Impossibly huge, it slammed down almost directly on the group of ants. Bryan saw that only three of them remained, the others presumably smashed beneath digits larger than buildings. Bryan looked up towards Rob's distant face, fearing he meant to smash the minuscule invaders, but Rob showed no sign of notice as he belted an uproarious calamity of laughter from his own joke. He had taken a break from eating, and set his hand down to rest.

The sheer danger posed by such an involuntary and oblivious action scared Bryan. It never ceased to astound the tiny man how dangerous the world became when reduced to a smaller size. Most of it because of the massive callous behaviour displayed by his fellow humans.

Sighing, he just began to resume his journey when he spotted the remaining ants. They bustled angrily around the much, much large foe--in reality Rob's index finger--and looked as though they intended to attack it. The realization smacked Bryan suddenly and he began running and yelling as if to halt them.

One ant approached to attack...
1121222212111122.title: Eavesdropping

choices: Fly swatting!
Rob notices other bugs on the blanket
11212222121111221.content:
The scent produced by the crushed bodies of fellow ants had sent the fierce forager into action. Mandibles clacking noisily, the speck-sized ant rushed towards the enormous wall of flesh.

Noticeably smaller than an ant - and far less adapted to such magnified environments - Bryan had difficulty traversing the patterned vinyl blanket. Miss-stepping, Bryan fell over himself with a grunt. Laying still, he peered at the giant hand that rested casually before him like a flesh-toned mountain range.

A tiny specks caught his attention as it approached Rob's index finger. The tiny man swallowed, fearful of what might happen next. "I've gotta get away before..."

Reaching the side of the behemoth finger, the ant wasted not a moment before lunging at the offending mountain of ridged flesh. Evolved to be sharp and strong, the ant's pincers sunk into the thick wall of calloused flesh. Bryan's gaze shot upwards, looking toward the humongous man's face for a reaction.

Nothing.

The tiny scientist's held breath released in one fell gasp. Seconds went past, and the titan remained unaware of the minuscule assault upon his finger. The determined ant, unable to realize his opponents power and stature, remained adamant. It wriggled, attempting to thrash back and forth to cause maximum damage to the building-sized finger. Bryan looked on, noting as the tiny creature twitched that it had become stuck; unable to pull either pincer from the thick flesh.

"Oh God, the stupid bug is stuck!" He cried out, still huddled on the ground as if he were watching an interesting sport.

Rob continued to chat high above, oblivious to the tiny world below. Other ants began collecting around the stuck ant. Their movements and antenna motions seemed to suggest that they were trying to determine how to release the trapped ant. One began climbing the huge finger, while the others uselessly batted their comrade with concerned antennae. The whole spectacle seemed comical, but sadly desperate.

Akin to a shifting glacier, the hand suddenly shifted and began to lift upwards. The climbing ant was sent flailing off by intense forces, while the trapped ant whipped back and forth violently as the hand raised higher.

---

Scratching the side of his left hand, Rob gave Judy a playful grin.

She paused her idle nibbling of a strawberry, and returned with a quizzical look. "What are you smiling at me for? Is there something on my face?"

"Besides the usual pretty lips, eyes, and nose?" His deep tone sounding kind, yet intolerably corny. "I'm just thinking how lucky I am to have a girl like you!"

Shifting his position, he seated his legs up and planted his feet flat before him so he could lean over to give her a peck. Her face flushed from the affection. Setting her small plate of fruit down, she giggled. Judy loved it all. His cheesy lines, his gruff appearance due to his job, and especially the soft demeanor he adopted especially for her.

The cute moment suddenly shattered when Rob burst out with a loud curse.

"Fuck these flies!" He said with a frown. One buzzed off of his knee, barely avoiding a large hand. More of them busily investigated fallen crumbs on the blanket, and zipped around Rob's face.

Taking another bite of his potato salad, he used his free hand to swat at the increasingly annoying insects. One fly came near, slower than the rest due to an almost unnoticeable malady, and made the gamble of buzzing towards Rob's chest. Ready for action, Rob set the paper plate down and brought his hands together with a clap.

"YEAH! Got you!" Parting his hands revealed the smashed remains of an over-sized fly across his palm. While he smiled in triumph, Judy clucked in disgust at him.

She retrieved the wicker basket and began sifting through it. "Really, Rob? On your hands? That is so gross!" Judy made a gagging noise when he reached for his plate again. "Use the flyswatter, for goodness sakes!"

Keeping the green-coloured plastic mat from her, she passed it over to her boyfriend. She had learned to pack such things whenever they went outside to eat.

"Awesome... Prepare for the SWAT, ya little shits!" Setting his plate aside once more, Rob brandished the cheap fly-swatting tool. Judy rolled her eyes at his silly "boyish" behaviour before preparing to cover up the food from the insects.
11212222121111221.title: Meal Interrupted

choices: Sweep the blanket clean
The old-fashioned way: stomp the ants!
112122221211112212.content:
With a thwack, Rob slammed down the swatter upon an unsuspecting fly resting on the blanket. Lifting it, he scanned for more victims. Judy snapped a lid over the container of potato salad, ignoring him and lightly humming.

Scratching at his blond buzzed-cut hair, he spotted another foolhardy fly land nearby. "Easy as cake..." He grinned, feeling no remorse for these tiny "stupid" bugs.

Snapping it down, Rob cursed. The fly had easily flown out of danger, buzzing into the air as careless and blissful as ever. It hovered away, heading towards Judy and her plethora of still-uncovered food. Rob however didn't notice; only staring at the blanket with annoyance before grinning enigmatically.

"Ants!" Rob grunted, unimpressed. Surveying the tiny black specks upon the blanket, he smacked the swatter upon a group of them. Judy gasped. "Oh my...!" She dropped the plate she just picked up. "Robbie, there are ants on your plate!"

Shivering with disgust, Judy began to imagine the invasive insects crawling all over her. She turned to her boyfriend who had set the swatter down and was twisting his thumb upon the blanket. "They are everywhere for goodness sake," She slapped his shoulder. "Do something before they ruin all my food!"

Her strike was anything but powerful, yet he recoiled playfully anyway.

"I am! The thumb of God serves judgement swiftly and justly." Viewing the tiny lives as nothing but mere entertainment, he slid his thumb over a couple more; reducing them to smears.

His immature behaviour was simply too much. Judy stacked the containers and stood up. "Stop joking around and get rid of them - this is disgusting." Rob turned away from his work and grinned at her. Not in the mood, she pinched his ear.

"Owch! Fine, alright!"

Unable to appreciate what she had enabled, Judy watched her tall boyfriend stand up.
112122221211112212.title: Picnicking with Ants

choices: Bryan survives the devastation and is on Rob's foot
Bryan meets his fate
1121222212111122122.content:
Rob had shed his socks and shoes a while ago as the afternoon had heated up. As he stood up to his full impressive height for people at normal standards, Bryan cowered in fear as the giant's visage blocked the sun out. He stumbled back and fell onto his back as his neck craned up along the length of the towering giant, the giant face turning downwards at him in a devilish sneer.

Bryan quickly got up and started screaming at the ants to move, he knew what this young man was about to do and his best chance was to get the ant's to disperse fast enough as to delay disaster. The ant's never even looked up from the feast of crumbs they were feeding on in the landscape of the multicolor picnic blanket fabric. Completely ignoring Bryan and his unthreatening size and unable to process the threat of the giant looming above as his scale was beyond their small world. Robs voice thundered above as the ground began to shake.

Judy rolled her eyes as her boyfriend stood up to his full height, hand on his hips attempting to look godly.

Robbie stamped his feet in place as he thundered in a deep bellowing voice below "You have disobeyed your God, now suffer the punishment of the heavens".

Robbie slowly and dramatically raised his long athletically veined bare foot over the group of ants and lowered it as he laughed maniacally.

Judy snorted at this, her boyfriend might be a little on the immature side but this was probably the most efficient way of getting rid of the ants all at once. Robbie had size 14 feet, she almost felt sorry for the ants as he watched her boyfriends sole descend upon them.

Bryan started to run as he watched the giant raise an unbelievably large foot over himself and the unsuspecting ants. The giant was booming something loudly as the giant expansive soul hovered above his form, the foot too large to possibly escape from under in time.

Then all hell broke loose as the sole descended, and the proverbial slightly sweaty flesh colored sky fell. Bryan sarcastically thought to himself "I feel like Chicken Little" as the giant's sole crashed down upon him. The ant's finally sensing a disturbance and fleeing as fast as they could.

Robbie was actually having fun. Initially just trying to tease his girlfriend with the overly mach display of pest control, he soon enjoyed the game as he continued exterminating the ant's lucky enough to escape the shadow of his foot after the first stomp. He walked around the small area of the blanket, crashing his feet down on various ant's until their numbers dwindled to zero under his soles. He felt kind of sad after he got them all, but the fuckers had gotten on his girl's nerves and had to go.

He sat down laying opposite his girlfriend, feet crossed at the ankle facing towards her head as he smirked toes wriggling.

Judy yelled "eww gross Rob, you got Ant gut's all over the bottoms of your feet!"

Rob laughed and grabbed one of his large feet as he slid it up his leg angling the sole facing it towards his face as he saw a battlefield of smeared ant corpses littered across his long large soles. He smirked as he saw some half crushed ants wiggling, trying to escape the rest of their mashed bodies adhered to his sole. He absentmindedly began flicking them off his feet as he talked to his girlfriend.
1121222212111122122.title: The old-fashioned way: stomp the ants!

choices: To a mountainous baseball cap nearby
Vainly trying to reach Tommy
1121222212112.content:
Turning over the box in his hand, Tommy knew taping it up would be easy and suffice. He didn't hear any sound of damage as he shook the box. Plus, he thought, the tear is much to small for anything important to fall through.

Little did the teen realize that the boxes most important passenger had fallen through this "small" tear.

None of the huge guys even thought about the tiny world threatened by their huge feet.

"You guys up for another game? I'm pretty pumped." Tommy said as he wiped sweat from his brow. Mark and Jeff were good players, and he only ever saw them at school.

Mark itched his beanie-covered head idly as he responded. "Nah. We've gotta head back, Jeff borrowed his brother's car."

Jeff replied gruffly in agreement as he stepped past Tommy to grab his hat and backpack. From his tall perspective, Jeff didn't even notice the tiny black ants occupying ground his sneakers landed on.

A smaller white speck dashed vainly from his large Adidas.

------------

The minutely sized scientist staggered as he stood.

"The box! Tommy, help me! The antidote is in there!" Bryan cried out, trying vainly to project his voice. Just looking up at Tommy's huge visage made him dizzy.

Seemingly in response to his pitiful cries, Tommy's huge thundering voice hit his ears painfully. Bryan covered them, the deep voice reverberating through his tiny frail body.

Releasing his protective hold, he was suddenly bombarded by another deeper voice.

"...WE'VE GOTTA HEAD BACK...!" The little man was able to discern briefly as the ground suddenly lurched violently. He was flung back to ground, the warm asphalt irritating his arms immediately.

The ground shuddered accompanied by heavy booms. Bryan was in shock, trying to get his bearings as a massive shadow loomed over the area.

"Tommy! Help me, ple-...!" He exclaimed blindly before being violently cut off as a sneaker the size of many city blocks crashed down nearby, causing a powerful shockwave to tumble the bug-sized man.

The massive footwear towered before him, the Adidas logo plainly visible. Bryan took in every terrifying detail as he gawked, utterly petrified. A hard rubber sole stood over four stories high, it appeared almost new, only lightly grass-stained and mud. The rest of the popular style of sneaker looked positively alien, employing a lime green and black scheme. Its sheer size was almost uncomprehensible, not mentioning the titanic hair-covered leg looming endlessly.

A thunderous grinding sound chilled the little man as the huge sneakers aggressive tread shifted on the asphalt.

Everything seemed as if in slow motion. Another heavy boom thundered from behind, sound further away.

"I- I- I need to get out of here!" His terrified mind managed to process the thought, sending his body into motion.

The tiny man ran...
1121222212112.title: Giant guy, giant feet

choices: takes his hat off
continues eating
11212222121121.content:
Bryan sprinted towards a multi-colored mountain just ahead of him. His teriffied mind demanded cover, and he thought of nothing else. He deftly dodged boulder-like pebbles scattered across the ground. He thankfully only saw a couple of monstrous ants who didn't seem to react to the behemoth quickly approaching.

Bryan, reached the gargantuan object just as a titanic black shoe crashed down behind him. Glancing back, he couldn't see the ants anymore. They had been crushed, unnoticed by the enormous young man. He screamed and literally jumped onto the edge of the thing. It gave him a sense of security.

A moment later Bryan screamed again when G-Forces tore at him as he rapidly soared upwards. As everything settled Bryan realized where he was. He was on a hat, on the giant's head. Worse, it wasn't Tommy's.

---

Jeff stepped up to his hat, a couple of ants disappearing unnoticed beneath his long sole. Snatching it up, he pulled it over his dark hair.

"See ya!" he called back, ignoring Tommy's requests for another game. As he crossed the grass towards Mark, who was waiting impatiently at the car.

As the car rattled down the street, Jeff's stomach growled loudly.

Mark laughed, "Damn dude! You're louder than the radio!" Jeff stared down the street, a Taco Bell sign in the distance.

"You want Taco Bell?" he asked. Mark shrugged "Sure, but what about your brother?"

Jeff grinned "Fuck 'em! He can wait. I'm hungry!"

---

Bryan clung to the thick fabric of the hat, terrified he would be shaken loose. The faded fabric of the car's interior made up his sky, as he silently prayed for help. Though not a religious man, Bryan had become desperate.

The clunker rattled to a stop, mystifying the tiny man. He yelped in surprise as the ground beneath him heaved. His grip however didn't waver and he found himself bobbing as the behemoth he rode approached a mammoth building. "Taco Bell" was spelled out over the double doors.

---

Jeff and Mark ordered from separate cashiers. As they filled their drinks, their orders were called out. "I love how fast you guys are!" Jeff said to the cashier, who merely smiled before returning to work.

Dropping their trays onto a random table, the two towering boys plop into their seats. As Jeff tears into his first burrito, he scratches at the edge of his hat.

After a moment he
