"Joe! What the hell are you doing here?" Tommy asked. He knew that it probably wasn't a good idea for his friend to be wandering around in the same room with his tiny neighbor.

"What kind of greeting's that?" Joe asked.

"Sorry," Tommy tossed back in a distracted way as he continued to scan the counter, unaware of the tiny speck that dodged out of the path of his huge shoes. "Uh, you never saw anything, umm, strange, while you were waiting, did you?"

"What do you mean?" Joe asked. "Strange?"

Meanwhile, still shaking from now almost being stomped twice within the span of a few seconds, Mr. Smith tried to scream for help. Unfortunately, he could not make himself audible to the two titanic teens.

"Look, Joe, maybe this isn't a good time..." Tommy started.

Yes! Mr. Smith rejoiced. Send him home!

Instead, the teenager wavered. "OK, you can stay... but just be careful... uh, I don't want any of Mr. Smith's stuff to get broken."
11221112211212.title: Mr. Smith falls off the counter to the kitchen ...

choices: Back to Mr. Smith's home
He falls out of the tread during journey between the houses
112211122112121.content:
"You have some of Mr. Smith's stuff here?" Joe asked.

Tommy, so nervous he was having difficulty thinking, frowned. "No, I just mean," he trailed off. He considered confessing everything to Joe, but he knew his buddy too well to be able to trust him. It would just complicated the situation.

"Look, I am going to have to go back to Mr. Smith's place soon," he said to Joe. "So maybe..."

Joe shrugged and leaned back against the counter. "I'll just go with you."

Tommy kept scanning the countertop, wondering where his tiny neighbor could have gone.

"What you keep looking for?" Joe asked, taking note of his friend's weird behavior.

"Nothing," Tommy lied. "Let's just go."

The tiny man, who had braved the odds to try to get closer to Tommy, was caught unprepared when Joe pushed away from the counter and slammed both sneakers onto the tiles. "I'm ready."

Neither teenager heard the shrunken man scream as Joe's shoe slammed down on him.

Perhaps fortunately ... time would tell ... fate conspired to keep the shrunken man alive. But he found himself tightly wedged into the well-worn tread of the teenager's sneakers. The tread was already lined with mud and other debris picked up in a normal day of walking.
112211122112121.title: Breakage

choices: Tommy isn't done having fun
Tommy wants to hear what Bryan has to say
1122111222.content:
The deep voice hit Bryan like a physical force, hurting his ears, and the accompanying breath moved him across the counter. "Help me!" he yelled, but he knew that the collosal teenager couldn't understand him very easily.

But Tommy's first inclination wasn't communication with tiny Bryan. At first, he was amazed and then somewhat smug. Realizing that the minute man had actually been affected by his voice, he began to blow, softly at first, then a bit harder. To his surprise, Bryan actually left his feet, falling onto his butt and then skidding treacherously close to the edge.

"I THOUGHT YOU WERE GOING ON VACATION," commented Tommy, before prodding at Bryan again. Bryan deftly avoided the finger, but it followed him as he moved, hovering like a spectre.

"I was," Bryan responded, "But, you see -- "

Before he could even finish his sentence, Tommy had reached down with his whole hand, sweeping Bryan into it. He fought it, but couldn't resist the overpowering strength. The teenager made a fist, trapping all of Bryan's body but his head tightly.

"Please..." Bryan struggled, his past explanations forgotten. "You're hurting me."

Tommy expressed a flicker of emotion, a tiny smile, before quickly increasing pressure and then letting go, dropping the man into his other palm. He was about the size of a small grape.

Released, Bryan tried once more to get Tommy's atention but the teen is still learning his new power. He begins to move his hand up and down quickly, sending Bryan through the air like a jumping bean. Once, twice, three times, the miniscule scientist felt the ground drop out beneath him, then a nauseating ascent, and then landed in the fleshy palm. He clung to it, but Tommy was still bouncing the tiny man.

Finally, Bryan hit the ground and vomited. Tommy froze for a minute and then said, "Ewww." Turning his palm over nonchalantly and letting Bryan fall hard onto the table top, he narrowed his eyes. "Don't go anywhere," he said.

Where would I go? wondered Bryan, panting.

Tommy washed his hands and then returned, sitting on a chair and eyeing Bryan.
1122111222.title: Jumping Bean

choices: Tommy lets Bryan enter the box
Tommy puts the box out of reach
11221112222.content:
"Ok, Mr. Smith," Tommy said, his glittering dark eyes fastened so intently on his speck-sized neighbor and employer. "How the hell did you get so tiny?"

Bryan, modestly, kept trying to shield himself with his hands. "Tommy, do you think you could let me go inside the package?"

"Why?" Tommy asked in his normal tone of voice.

Bryan cringed, putting his hands to his ears. "Please, not so loud," he said.

Tommy lowered his voice. "So, what do you need in there?"

"I packed some clothes that should fit me," Bryan explained.

"We're both guys," Tommy snickered. That wasn't exactly the truth. Seeing Mr. Smith the size of a lint speck didn't make Tommy think of him as a grown man and an authority figure.

"Yeah, but..." Bryan began.

"You don't have anything else stashed inside that little box, do you?" Tommy asked.

"No," Bryan lied quickly. If he could get inside the box and access his antidote, he could put a quick end to Tommy's sudden power trip.

When Tommy remained silent, Bryan started to walk across the table toward the box.

Tommy brought his massive hand down suddenly, blocking Bryan's path. He knew his hand must look like a wall to the tiny man.

Terrified, the tiny man looked up at Tommy, who no longer looked like the kid next door. He looked like some fearsome young god. "Tommy, please," Bryan said.

Tommy grinned, enjoying how much he had control of the situation.
11221112222.title: Bargaining with a Titan

choices: some friends
a friend
112211122222.content:
Tommy, like most guys his age, didn't think much in terms of long-range planning.

He enjoyed feeling powerful and mastering the almost unimaginable situation of finding himself utterly and completely in control of a grown man's fate.

He failed to look ahead to the next time he needed an easy job for quick cash. Indeed, his sense of gratitude for all the odd jobs Mr. Smith had arranged for him in the past seemed forgotten as he stared down at the bug-sized man blocked by the barrier represented by Tommy's hand on the tabletop.

Bryan cursed when Tommy's enormous hand dropped down to thwart access to the shipping box. Tommy, if he even noticed Bryan's irritation, didn't show any sign of concern. Instead, he moved his hand and lifted the small box off the table.

"I really don't think you will need this," he informed the tiny, stunned scientist. "Not yet."

Tommy took a few steps away from the table, opened a cabinet door and stashed the box within the kitchen cabinets, far beyond tiny Bryan's reach.

Bryan watched in amazement every move made by his undeniably handsome, enormous employee.

Tommy pushed back one of the chairs and took a seat at Mr. Smith's kitchen table. He grinned as he stared at the puny, pale figure cowering in full view of his gaze.

Bryan tried admirably to shield himself from Tommy's prying eyes, but only succeeded in drawing the giant youth's attention to parts he would rather have kept under wraps.

Tommy laughed and, without warning, pulled off his T-shirt. "Wow, it's hot in here, don't you think, Mr. Smith?"

Bryan felt his mouth gape open as he stared at the muscular torso of the young giant.

Tommy, pleased with the expected reaction, stretched and flexed for his appreciative audience.

Bryan realized how Tommy was leading him by the nose, or rather by one part of his anatomy, but he felt helpless to tear his gaze from the incredible sight.

"Well, this is your lucky day, Mr. Smith," Tommy said. "I can stay here, as planned, and look after your house and make sure you are in good hands."

"If you'll only help me grow back, I wouldn't need you to..." Bryan began.

Tommy looked at the tiny man. "In fact, I think I will call over..."
112211122222.title: Tommy Demonstrates His Superiority

choices: The friends arrive
Someone calls for Bryan
1122111222221.content:
Tommy reached beneath the table and fished his cell phone out of a pocket. He held the phone as he punched in a buddy's number.

Tiny Bryan stood, motionless, in shock, at finding himself a prisoner to the teenager's whims.

"YO, JOE," Tommy said into the phone.

Bryan listened, trying to fill in the missing parts of the conversation.

"I'M OVER AT MY NEIGHBOR'S HOUSE," Tommy said. "THE SCIENTIST GUY. YEAH, THAT'S THE ONE."

Bryan stood, staring up at Tommy's monumentally huge body, admiring the curves of his pecs and wishing he could see more of the youth's flat stomach concealed beneath the horizon of the table's edge.

"YEAH, I'VE GOT A SURPRISE. GET OVER HERE..." Tommy said.

"No!" Bryan squeaked. "Tommy!"

"OH, AND SWING BY AND GET JEFF AND MARK, TOO."

Great! Bryan thought to himself. Tommy wanted to invite three other teen titans over to gawk at him. He needed to do something to stop Tommy before the situation spiraled more out of control.
1122111222221.title: Large and in Charge

choices: Nephew Zack's on the line
Someone at the lab's on the line
11221112222212.content:
"Tommy!" Bryan shouted so loudly his throat hurt. "You must listen to me!"

Tommy, however, pushed his chair back from the table and stood. Once again, Bryan felt awed in the colossal youth's presence and watched as Tommy strode across the kitchen. Tommy opened the kitchen cabinets.

"Tommy! We've got to talk!" Bryan shouted in vain.

Finally, finding what he wanted, Tommy turned back to the table. He took his seat again and plopped a water glass on the tabletop.

Bryan stared at the towering glass.

Tommy grinned and tilted the glass onto its side, holding it in place with his huge hand.

"Climb into the glass, Mr. Smith," Tommy said. "We gotta keep you somewhere safe while my buddies visit."

"I am not getting in that glass," Bryan objected.

When the tiny man didn't immediately comply, Tommy used his free hand to brush across the surface of the table and push the shrunken scientist into the glass, which he quickly righted.

Trapped, Bryan ran quickly to the sloping glass wall. He pushed his palms against the smooth glass.

Tommy lifted the glass toward his face. Bryan froze as he saw the titan's pleased grin and wide eyes.

"Wait 'til the guys get a load of you," Tommy said as he twirled the glass in his hand.

Bryan's nerve failed him, but before Tommy could inflict more humiliation, a loud ringing echoed in the glass.

Tommy placed the glass on the tabletop. The ringing noise continued.

Finally, Bryan identified the sound. "It's my phone!" Bryan realized.

Tommy debated whether to answer the phone, but the ringing didn't stop after three rings.

"Hello," Tommy said after he picked up the phone.
11221112222212.title: Call for Mr. Smith

choices: The guys have arrived
It's only Joe
112211122222121.content:
Tommy heard a confident male voice on the other end of the line.

"Yeah, Uncle Bryan?" Zack said. "Is that you?"

Tommy coughed and looked down at his tiny neighbor held securely in the glass. "This is Tommy."

Zack dimly recalled the teenager who mowed his uncle's lawn and performed other chores. "I need to speak to my uncle," Zack explained. "Could you put him on the line?"

Again, Tommy peered into the glass. He saw his tiny neighbor leaping wildly and just barely detected Mr. Smith's squeaky, outraged shouts.

"I don't think he can reach the phone right now," Tommy said. "I mean, well, he's not here."

Something in Tommy's tone triggered Zack's suspicions. "He left you there inside his house?"

"Yeah, he did," Tommy responded. "What about it?"

Zack swallowed the urge to get smart with the teenager. "Just tell him to give me a call when he gets back, ok?"

"Sure thing," Tommy said, extremely relieved to get off the line with his neighbor's nephew.

Bryan stared up at his colossal neighbor. "Who was on the phone?" Bryan shouted. "Tommy, was that call for me?"

Tommy started to reply, but a ringing doorbell interrupted their exchange. "That must be the guys!" Tommy exclaimed.
112211122222121.title: Call from the nephew

choices: They lost track of Mr. Smith
More humiliations
1122111222221212.content:
"Tommy!" Mr. Smith protested in a voice that was embarrassingly shrill. "I demand you tell me who was on the phone!"

Tommy ignored the tiny man's squeaks from inside the towering water glass when he heard someone ring the front doorbell.

"That must be the guys," Tommy said. He tapped on the glass walls of his neighbor's prison before striding out of the kitchen.

"Tommy! Come back! I forbid you to bring anyone into this house!" The little ant-sized man tried to give orders that went unheard.

A few moments later, both the giant teenagers returned to the kitchen. Although the wall of glass tended to distort everything, Mr. Smith could not help but stare at them in awe. Formerly skinny teenagers, Tommy and his friend now looked like impossibly huge titans.

"Have I got something to show you!" Tommy said.

"Yeah?" Joe asked, rising to the bait. "Oh, by the way, could not get hold of the guys. I guess it's just us this evening."

Tommy picked up the water glass, sending Mr. Smith careening from side to side in the deep container. Handing the glass to Joe, Tommy invited him to look inside it.

Joe looked, then frowned. "So? It's just a bug!"

The tiny man screamed in frustration. "I am a man, not a bug!"

"Look closer," Tommy said.

Joe brought the glass closer to his face. "Oh, shit! It's a tiny, little dude."

"Yeah, man!" Tommy said. "It's my neighbor. He shrunk himself."

Tommy proceeded to provide more details of the situation to Joe, conveniently editing out some parts of the story.

"So, he needs me to take care of him for awhile," Tommy concluded.

Joe's interest waned. "So, you're gonna babysit the little twerp all weekend?"

Mr. Smith beat his fists against the glass walls.

"It won't be bad," Tommy said. "We can hang out in this cool house."

Without asking, without even giving his action much though, Joe had tilted the glass and dropped the tiny man into his open palm.

Of course, the bug-sized scientist had no wait to know the teenager's hand was waiting to catch him. He screamed in terror, landing in the middle of Joe's hand.

"Shit, he really is tiny," Joe said, staring at him.

"Tommy! Make him put me down!" The outraged little man screamed.

"Put him on the table," Tommy said. "I want to show you the TV set in the living room."

Joe tilted his hand and the little man fell off the suddenly steep slope of the giant hand. He was still checking himself for bruises when he heard Joe's voice loud and clear.

"There's another one!" Joe said. "Another tiny man!"

Both teenagers looked at the floor, but Tommy laughed. "Naw, that's a real bug."

Then, without missing a beat, he raised his shoe and stomped the filthy bug.

"Can't have those things crawling around near Mr. Smith," Tommy said. "They could be dangerous."

The titans left the kitchen, leaving a shaken, terrified little man in their wake. Mr. Smith replayed Tommy's stomping of the helpless, tiny bug, only his brain edited the footage to insert him into the scene.

"Oh my god," Mr. Smith cried. "I'm in the hands of two blundering, over-sized morons."
1122111222221212.title: Joe arrives

choices: Tommy returns, blissfully unaware an ant has "replaced" Mr. Smith
Joe's stomps mean serious trouble for Mr. Smith
11221112222212121.content:
The tiny scientist walked near the edge of his kitchen table, but he got dizzy when he peered over the precipice and tried to see the distant floor.

He was still thinking of himself in the place of that helpless bug that Tommy had just stomped into oblivion. The irony that he had placed his fate into the hands of a skinny teenager wasn't lost on the shrunken man.

"I need to make him see reason, and end this before something happens…"

Suddenly, the heavy quaking beneath his feet warned him of the return of the titans, otherwise known as Tommy and Joe.

Tommy's enormous form loomed over him, and the teenager's dark eyes regarded him with a mix of fascination and dismay.

"Wow, Mr. Smith!" Tommy said. "I can't believe you're so tiny. Even when I know it's you, it's hard to even notice you."

Great! As if he didn't feel puny and low enough. "Listen to me," he began. "I need you to…"

"Oh, I have to run back my house, but I will be right back," Tommy announced. "But, Joe will look after you."

What? Had he heard right?

"Tommy, that's not a good idea…."

But the teenager was no longer listening, and after Tommy left the house, Joe ambled around in the kitchen. The giant youth sat down in one of the kitchen chairs and stared at him without communicating.

Not that Mr. Smith cared. He didn't really like the way Joe looked at him, both irritated and bored.

The silence was broken when Joe's phone rang. In his haste to answer the phone, he leaped up from his seat, bumping the table.

Joe never even noticed his action, but Mr. Smith felt the explosive force as the teenager rocked the entire table and jettisoned him into space.

"AaahhhhH!" He screamed as he fell toward the floor.

*****

Wrapped up with his phone call, Joe glanced at the table and saw a pale form crawling over the wooden surface.

"Yeah, you wouldn't believe what Tommy has me doing," he said.

With the phone pressed to his ear, he didn't hear the tiny screams coming, not from the tabletop, but from the floor near his gigantic sneakers.

In an instant, the little man had been ripped from the haven of the kitchen tabletop to the perilous floor tiles.

"Joe!" He shouted, desperate to make himself heard. "You idiot! Down here!"

From time to time, as he continued his phone conversation, Joe glanced at the table. Each time, he saw the pale, tiny form crawling erratically.

Weird little dude, the teenager thought to himself. Why doesn't he just stay put?

Of course, had he looked closer, he might have noticed that the tiny form on the tabletop belonged to an ordinary little ant. The timely arrival on the scene by the tiny insect had ensured that the teenager hadn't noticed the absence of his friend's shrunken neighbor.

He felt parched, so he walked toward the fridge, never noticing when his sneakers slammed down, forcing the bug-sized scientist to run for his life in his own kitchen!
11221112222212121.title: Losing track of Mr. Smith

choices: Tommy stomps him
Tommy doesn't stomp him... yet
112211122222121212.content:
"What the hell are you doing?" The shrunken scientist screamed up at Joe as the oblivious teenager stomped toward the fridge, forcing the tiny man to race out of the titan's path. No sooner did he veer one way, however, than Joe's giant Airwalks slammed down in his path.

And, with each stomp, the titan came closer to landing one of the cruise ship-sized shoes squarely on top of the terrified speck of a man.

As he flung open the fridge, Joe landed his right Airwalk on the tile floor mere inches from the sprawled form of a bug-sized man. The teenager's massive footstep had knocked the shrunken man off his feet and across the tiles as if struck by an explosive blast. The little man groaned as he tried to get back onto his feet.

"Idiot!" He screamed. Why wasn't Tommy's blundering friend paying more attention?

Joe grabbed a can of soda from the fridge, pulled the tab and lifted the can toward his mouth. Far below, Bryan heard the loud exit of the carbonated fizz as it escaped from the opened can.

Before the little man could think of his next move, the colossal teenager started walking back toward the kitchen table. Thankfully, that took the life-threatening sneakers far from the tiny little man, who had a brief interlude to catch his breath and collect his thoughts.


"I don't see how Tommy can be friends with that moron," Bryan said aloud as he watched the monstrous teenager pull out a chair and sit down at the table.

As he got settled, Joe looked down at the table. "Where'd you go, Mr, Smith?"

Across the room, Bryan listened in bewilderment. "I'm here," he shouted. "You knocked me off the table!"

"Oh, there you are," Joe said, never once looking back toward the fridge.

Now, Bryan really felt confused. "I'm not on the table! What is he talking about?"

On his feet again, the tiny man started across the vast kitchen floor, determined to get closer and discover what was going on.

He hadn't gotten far, however, when the front door open, which introduced the quake-like footsteps of another enormous teenager as Tommy returned to the house….

"How's Mr. Smith?" Tommy asked Joe as his own sneakers bore down on the tiny unseen man directly in his path….
112211122222121212.title: Joe is so careless

1122111222221212121.content:
Tommy asked Joe if Mr. Smith was all right as his own sneakers bore down on the tiny unseen man directly in his path. Neither titan bothered to glance at the floor where the "real" Mr. Smith was desperate to avoid their careless footsteps.

"He's fine," Joe answered, shrugging his shoulders and making a bored gesture toward the kitchen table. "He's running around like some maniac."

Tommy took another couple of steps closer to the table for a better look. Sure enough, the little speck of a man kept pacing in random circles on the polished tabletop.

"You OK, Mr. Smith?" The titan bellowed down at the bug-sized figure on the table.

The scurrying form paused. "I forgot… I can't hear you, anyway," Tommy said, but he misinterpreted the halt in the creature's movement as a signal that all was OK.

"Who the hell is he talking to?" Mr. Smith shouted as he gazed up at the two massive teenagers. When Tommy had taken the steps to the table, one of his equally massive sneakers had almost taken out the shrunken scientist. The little man still shuddered as he recalled that second of absolute, freezing terror when the shadow of the sneaker had come down on him…

….missing him by mere inches. And then, with amazing speed, the sneaker had taken another step and left him alone.

As he continued to stare up at his huge teenaged neighbor, Tommy put his hands on the table and looked down at the speck. Something wasn't quite right….


"Joe, come here," Tommy said.

The summons brought those colossal Airwalks closer to Mr. Smith, who most certainly didn't want any place near those lethal, enormous shoes. Fortunately, Joe, like Tommy, stepped over the shrunken man and stood next to his friend, staring down at the tabletop and oblivious to the floor.

"He's doing it again," Tommy said. "Running around like that…"

"So?" Joe asked, not bothering to hide his irritation.

"Why's he doing it?" Tommy wondered aloud.

"I don't know," Joe said. "Why would he shrink himself down to the size of a damn ant? He's weird."

"Yes," Tommy said, not disagreeing with any of his friend's assessment of his neighbor. "But I am not sure that's…"

… he leaned closer and really focused his eyes on the scurrying little creature. Nothing matched. It looked dark and tiny. It had more than two legs, unless Mr. Smith was crawling on hands and knees…

"Joe, you're a moron!" Tommy shouted angrily. "That's not even Mr. Smith! It's a freakin' ant!"

Joe looked closer, and laughed sheepishly. "Well, hell," he said. "I think you're right."

Tommy slammed his hand down on the tiny creature, which disappeared into oblivion from one distracted, casual blow from the titan.

"You've lost Mr. Smith!"

"Whoa! Me? How did I lose him?" Joe demanded.

"Never mind! We have to find him!"

Mr. Smith listened to the conversation with increasing awareness. "Yes, Tommy will look for me now!"

In preparation, he ran toward Tommy's shoes. He waved his arms to attempt to gain the huge teenager's attention. "Here! On the floor!"

Tommy turned. "We've got to look for him." He scanned the table. "Where could he have gone?"

"I fell off the table," Mr. Smith shouted. "I'm on the floor, down here at…."

Suddenly, Tommy moved. Once again, a dark shadow fell over the little man, who found his mouth open in a gape as he was suddenly too terrified to even scream.

The shoe dropped down as Tommy walked across the kitchen floor. "He's got to be nearby," he said. "Help me look."

Joe groaned. "Your neighbor's a real pain, you know that?"

The boys searched, Tommy a little more diligently than Joe, for nearly half an hour. They found no trace of a tiny man. Of course, Tommy never thought to look into the tread of his left sneaker, where a close examination might have found some remains of the squished little bug-man who had been pulverized in an instant, stomped just as the enormous teenager was beginning his search.

"Maybe he will turn up," Joe offered.

Tommy just frowned. "I can't believe you thought that ant was Mr. Smith!"

"Well, you did, too, for a moment," Joe countered.

"I think I would know the difference between Mr. Smith and some bug!" Tommy protested.

Joe suddenly got an idea. "Maybe that ant ate Mr. Smith! He was awfully tiny."

"Don't be stupid!"

Tommy never figured out the mystery, but he wasn't adjusting his thinking. After all, he probably destroyed countless bugs in the course of daily life and never even knew it. What was one more little bug stomped and squished beneath his feet? He would never be the wiser.
1122111222221212121.title: Unaware stomp

1122111222221212122.content:
Casting a casual glance toward the tabletop, Joe frowned. "He's just running around in circles," the teenager said, unable to tell the difference between the tiny ant and Tommy's shrunken neighbor.

Tommy walked over to the table and joined his buddy. He looked down at the tabletop, but he expected to see something tiny and his eyes obliged his expectations.

"Don't worry," the teenager said. "We'll keep you safe, Mr. Smith."

"Yeah," Joe added in a sulky tone. "We won't let any big, nasty bugs eat you for dinner."

"Shut up!" Tommy ordered. "Don't listen to him, Mr. Smith. If we see any bugs, I'll take care of them."

"That's what I said!" Joe objected.

"No, you were trying to scare him," Tommy said.

Down on the floor, Bryan listened to the titans talking about him and grew ever more frantic.

"No! That's not me on the table," he shouted in vain. "I'm down here! On the floor!"

"I'm getting a drink," Tommy announced unexpectedly. "You want something?"

Joe shrugged. "No, thanks. I'll just keep an eye on your itty-bitty neighbor."

On the floor, Mr. Smith braced himself as Tommy's footsteps rocked the tiles beneath the bug-sized man's feet. He tried to force himself to feel braver than he actually did.

"Tommy!' He ran toward the titan's advancing sneakers. "Here I am!"

Something about his tiny, darting movements must have succeeded... at least in part.

"I can't believe it," Tommy said, pausing in his trek to Mr. Smith's fridge. "There's another one!"

"Another what?" Mr. Smith and Joe asked at the same time. Only Joe's question registered with Tommy.

"An ant. Here on the floor," Tommy answered.

"They must be getting into the house through some crack or something," Joe said. He stood up from his seat at the table and walked over to stand next to his friend.

Tiny Mr. Smith gazed up as the two titans stared down at him.

"Wait! It's a mistake! I'm not a bug!" The little man screamed.

"I guess I get to do Mr. Smith does another favor and exterminate this one, too," Tommy said.

Joe laughed. "Look at it. It's not even got the sense to try and run away."

Tommy turned back toward the table. "Mr. Smith, you're gonna owe me some extra pay for acting as your exterminator," Tommy said.

"That's a good one," Joe said with a laugh.

"No! Look closer! It's me!" Mr. Smith screamed.

Looking down at the table one last time, Tommy tried to assure his neighbor.

"Don't worry, Mr. Smith. I'll be glad to take care of your bug problem."

With that, he turned back toward the ant on the floor. It still hadn't moved far.

But, at the last second, it tried a burst of speed to evade Tommy when the teenager lifted one of his sneakers.

"Bye-bye, bug," Tommy said, stomping down and finally squishing .

As if to make certain, he doesn't just step on it. He scraped his sneaker several times from side to side, reducing the pesky ant to nothingness and a thin layer of film on the underside of the shoe.

Joe, who had watched everything with amusement, sat down on the table.

"Watch it!" Tommy shouted in warning. "You'll sit on Mr. Smith."

"No, he's still here," Joe said, seeing the little man still racing around like mad. He lowered a fingertip and said, "See?"

Then, he noticed something.

"Hey, Tommy... come here."

"What is it?" Tommy asked, coming over to the table.

"I think this is an ant, too," he said. He pointed with his fingertip almost on top of it.

Tommy squinted. "Hell, you're right! So, where is Mr. Smith?"

Joe stood up, and both he and Tommy started scanning the table.

"You think that ant ate him?" Joe asked.

"Don't be stupid," Tommy said. "It's barely the same size."

Tommy got on his knees and looked under the table. Joe stood behind him and noticed the undersides of Tommy's sneakers. The dirty soles were smeared with the remains of little bugs and ants.

"Gross, man, your soles are really dirty," Joe said. "I think I see some bug legs smashed on them."

"Who cares about that?" Tommy snapped. "We've got to find Mr. Smith!"

Of course, they never did, and Tommy never put two and two together to come to the conclusion that a case of mistaken identity had been Mr. Smith's undoing.
1122111222221212122.title: Time runs out

choices: Tommy scoops up Mr. Smith
Tommy snacks as Joe texts
11221112222212122.content:
Joe appreciated the television set, but without Tommy's enthusiasm. A bit spoiled, Joe's family had their own state-of-the-art entertainment center at their home.

"We're not going to stay here much longer, are we?" Joe asked.

"Of course, we are," Tommy answered. As he spoke, he flipped through the channels using Mr. Smith's remote control. "I can't just leave Mr. Smith on his own. He's so tiny and helpless. I've got to keep an eye on him."

"Whatever," Joe said, less than thrilled to find himself roped into babysitting for a grown man the size of an ant.

With Tommy fully engaged with Mr. Smith's television, Joe wandered back into the kitchen. Instead of giving any attention to the speck-sized scientist on the table, the teenager opened the refrigerator.

From the tabletop, tiny Mr. Smith watched in disbelief as the teenager not only ignored him but raided the fridge as if he wasn't even in the room.

"You could ask permission," the tiny man said aloud, knowing his voice would never reach the titan's ears.

Joe grabbed what he wanted from the fridge and, making a stop at a cabinet on the way to grab a bag of chips, made his way to the table. He lowered the bag and a huge, white plastic container onto the tabletop as he settled into one of the chairs.

Mr. Smith, near the center of the table, struggled to identify the objects the massive teenager placed on the wooden plain. "Oh, how's Mr. Smith?" Tommy asked after he swallowed the bite.

"Fine," Joe lied.

"Fine! Fine! The moron has dumped me in the dip!" The listening little man screamed.

He wanted to play the hero, perhaps become the "savior of the day" by pretending to discover the tiny man in the dip at the last moment and bringing about a last-second rescue.

Bryan Smith spent the better part of the morning attending to the final details of his impulsive scheme. When he was satisfied he had taken care of every single detail, he carried the packing box to his kitchen table, placing the carton a few inches from the napkin holder and the paired salt and pepper shakers.

Inside the cardboard carton, he had placed insulation to cushion his journey and also stashed the antidote that, eventually, he would need to grow back to normal size. He looked down at the tabletop, feeling the excited fluttering of butterflies in his stomach.

He left the room to take a quick shower. Afterward, he didn't bother getting dressed.

"What would be the point?" Bryan asked himself. "After all, once I shrink, they definitely won't fit."

Besides, he had also placed some tiny pre-shrunk garments inside the shipping carton. He could use wear those once he arrived in Zack's hands.

The research scientist walked barefoot into his kitchen. Bryan's eyes focused on the gleaming glass tube he had left on the countertop near his microwave. He took the vial of shrinking formula in his hand. He watched, almost hypnotized, as he sloshed the pale blue liquid within the glass tube.

"Here goes nothing," he joked aloud and upended the vial.

He swallowed the liquid in a single gulp. The formula remained rather bland except for a faint metallic aftertaste.

Bryan felt the surge of inner heat that seemed to radiate out in waves. He had felt the sensation on previous occasions, and he knew he had to move fast. By the time he walked a few steps toward the kitchen table, he had already lost a couple of feet of height and was shedding inches rapidly. The swiftly working shrinking agent fooled even his intellectual brain into thinking that the room was expanding in all directions.

He stepped on the seat of a kitchen chair as he lost approximately half of his size. He had to use the chair as a step onto the surface of his kitchen table. Although he had undergone the astounding transformation on several other occasions, he still marveled as his surroundings appeared to grow.

He walked across the tabletop, toward the shipping carton. Even as he got closer to the box, it grew larger... and larger still!

In the space of mere moments, the brilliant research scientist shrunk from six feet tall to a mere quarter of an inch. As on past occasions, his body felt somewhat numb for a few seconds after the shrinkage ceased. He looked around his kitchen, almost breathless at comprehending his familiar world from the lowly status of a bug.

After he re-asserted control over his body, Bryan took in his surroundings with the same sense of wonder he had experienced the first time he used the formula to reduce himself.

Bryan stared across the vast expanse of the kitchen table. The shipping package now resembled some large building far away on the horizon. He continued his trek across the level tabletop.

Suddenly, an awful sound split the silence. Taken completely by surprise, the loud ringing noise panicked him into flight, and the tiny man took shelter near the colossal napkin holder as the almost deafening sound repeated at regular intervals.

On the third blast of sound, the little man recognized both the sound and the pattern.

"It's my phone," Bryan said, laughing at how something as mundane as a ringing phone had caused him to seek shelter in a blind panic.

The phone rang a few more times before the ringing stopped. "Sorry," Bryan quipped out loud. "I can't reach the phone. Leave a message."

He was about ready to leave the shelter of the napkin holder when another sound, even louder, assaulted his ears. He heard pounding at the front door, and almost at the same time, someone began beating on the back door in the kitchen.

He cowered and covered his ears with his hands. "What the hell?" Bryan wondered. "It's too early for Tommy..."

"BREAK IT DOWN!" A man's loud voice roared.

There followed a horrible crash as the back door flew open, admitting three men in black uniforms and heavy black boots stormed into his home.

The tiny man, watching from hiding, recognized one of the black-clad giants as the head of security for EDL Labs. Bryan knew him as a no-nonsense by-the-book type of man. He remembered that his name was Andre Franklin, a strong, muscular black man who looked huge even when Bryan wasn't shrunken to the size of a bug and gazing up at him.

"What are they doing here?" Bryan wondered.

Andre barked out orders for the other two guards. "I WANT HIS COMPUTER AND ANY DATA STORAGE DEVICES."

The two men stomped out of their room, their big black boots stomping on the floor boards with enough force to send vibrations through the floor and into the table, shaking the tiny research man's footing.

Bryan's main work for the past decade had been on developing anti-cholesterol drugs, but he had used the lab's resources to work on his own secret project. Terrified of the huge security guards, he cowered in his hiding spot.

Bryan was helpless to intervene as Andre walked to the edge of the table and reached down, taking the shipping package into his hand. The tiny, unseen man prayed that he would simply put the package back on the table.

No such luck! Andre slipped the package into a wide pocket in his uniform jacket.

"No!" Bryan wanted to scream. The package held his only available supply of shrinking antidote.

About that time, the two men re-appeared, carrying Bryan's computer and a box with DVDs and memory drives.

"NO SIGN OF DR. SMITH, SIR," one of them informed Andre.

"NO PROBLEM," Andre said grimly. "WE CAN DEAL WITH DR. SMITH LATER. THE BOARD WANTS ALL COPIES OF THE PERSONAL RESEARCH THE EINSTEIN WAS DEVELOPING ON THE SIDE."

Somehow, tiny Bryan realized the reference to "Einstein" wasn't being spoken in any manner complimentary to him.

"YOU GUYS TAKE THAT STUFF BACK TO THE LAB," Andre ordered. "I AM GOING TO WAIT FOR DR. SMITH TO GET HOME."

"WHAT DID HE DO, ANYWAY?" One of the men asked.

"THAT'S ON NEED-TO-KNOW," Andre said. "LET'S JUST SAY THAT THE GOOD PROFESSOR IS IN FOR A WORLD OF HURT IF I GET MY HANDS ON HIM!"

The bug-sized professor followed the conversation with an increasing sense of dread.

Tommy's mouth gaped in shock as he stared at his two friends.

Andy growled and punched Joe in the arm. "Well?" he demanded "Why'd you say that?"

Joe frowned and rubbed his arm before replying. "I dunno, 'cuz he should know what he just swallowed." Joe then turned to Tommy seeming to expect a reaction. Andy grunted in disagreement before also turning to face Tommy.

Tommy stared blankly at them for a few more seconds before doubling over in laughter. Now it was Joe and Andy's turn to stare in shock.

Gasping for air Tommy looked at his friends and said "Wow you guys are really good actors, you almost had me convinced!" a grin still plastered to his face.

"What?" his friends said in unison. "No! Seriously dude there was a little man in that pill!" Joe insisted.

Andy however smiled and said "Yep you're right. We just wanted to see if we could convince you."

Joe turned to Andy a look of annoyance on his face. "What are you talking about? There was a tiny man in there!"

Tommy rolled his eyes. "Drop it Joe," he said with a hint of annoyance in his voice.

"Yeah Joe, forget it." Andy agreed "I told you we should've put something in it instead of leaving it empty and saying there was a person in it! I don't even know why I agreed to try that!"

"Yeah dude, that was pretty stupid... I mean a tiny man? C'mon!" Tommy said, the end of his sentence punctuated with a laugh.

Joe sputtered for a moment trying to think of something to convince his friend. Realizing he couldn't and deciding it wasn't worth it, his shoulders sagged in defeat. "Fine," Joe said "It was a stupid idea." He figured going along with it would be easiest so that they could move on.

"Glad to see you recognize I'm not THAT stupid," Tommy said.
11222121221111211221122.title: Tommy doesn't believe them

choices: Tommy's food doesn't agree with him
Tommy's digestion is kicking in
112221212211112112211221.content:
"Now let's get something to eat, all I had were some Cheetos. I'm starving!"

"Let's go to McDonalds!" suggested Andy. Without waiting for an agreement from his friends he went strolling out the door. Tommy shrugged and followed him. Joe stared at Tommy's back as he followed him, still thinking about the tiny man in the pill. However he too was hungry to worry much and his thoughts shifted to what he should order at the restaurant.

-----

Mr. Smith had been beating on the walls of the capsule ever since Tommy had reappeared. He was sure that once he got his attention this whole ordeal would be over. But Tommy hadn't inspected the pill, instead proving to his friends that he wasn't scared to do what they asked. So as Mr. Smith battled for Tommy's attention he watched the teen titan's mouth get closer and wider. For a split second he saw the white teeth glint in the light, a strand of saliva stretching from his tongue to his upper right molars... then he was plunging into the cavern. The pill made contact with the tongue and Mr. Smith grunted as he hit the bottom of the capsule roughly. Before he head time to orient himself, a massive rim approached himself and the mouth. A torrent of water gushed over the edge, sweeping past the giant teen's teeth and smashing into his trap.

"Noooooooo!" he had screamed in horror as he found himself swept to the darkness in the back of the cavern. The ride suddenly become even rougher which the tiny scientist hadn't considered possible as he plunged into the throat, the sounds of his young neighbor swallowing him magnified in surround sound. The water flowed away and tiny Mr. Smith gasped in terror as he realized he was being massaged down the youth's esophagus. Through the walls of the capsule he could hear the beating heart and gusting lungs hard at work. The pill stopped suddenly before being squeezed through a sphincter with little effort.

Mr. Smith yelled as he floated for a moment as the pill plummeted downwards. It landed with a splat and again Mr. Smith slammed into the bottom of the pill. He sighed, thankful for the horrible ride to have finally stopped. Ignoring the dull ache all over his body he did his best to look around. His pill appeared to have rolled down the side of a sodden orange pile. Mr. Smith grimaced as he recognized it to be the remains of some Cheetos Tommy must have eaten earlier. Though once a favorite a snack he doubted he would ever have any again... assuming he could get out of this mess.

The entire chamber rumbled, seeming to signal it wanted more than the Cheetos it currently held. He gazed around the stomach feeling defeated. Mr. Smith sat down and hoped something would happen in his favor.

-----

The boys stepped into the lobby of the restaurant and stared at the menu. Tommy felt his stomach growl in anticipation. "Well I know what I want" said Andy, stepping forward to order a chicken nugget meal. Joe followed suit getting a McChicken with fries and a chocolate shake. Joe went to find a table while Andy filled his drink. Tommy, finally knowing what he wanted opened his mouth to order and looked to see the cashier smiling at him.

"Jessica! Hey!" he said happily. His stomach went into butterflies seeing his girlfriend.

"Hey big boy, what're you doing here?" she asked, still smiling.

"Just hungry" he shrugged pointing at Joe and Andy.

"Well you should've come earlier, I just finished my break" she said unhappily.

"Oh... well we can hang out tonight right?" Tommy asked hopefully.

"No," she replied flatly "I'm going to New York to visit my aunt for spring break, remember?"

"Oh right" Tommy mumbled "Well I guess I'll call you then."

Jessica sighed but didn't reply as her manager walked by. She stood up straight and asked "What can I get for you?"

Tommy, knowing how strict her manager was didn't push the conversation further. "Can I have two cheeseburgers, a medium fry, and a large soda?"

Jessica punched it in and gave him his cup. After paying he stopped at the soda fountain to get some Mountain Dew before joining his friends at the table.

"Aw look at the lovebirds!" Andy taunted. "Whatever" replied Tommy sipping his soda, "At least girls will look at me!" he added with a grin.

"Screw you!" Andy replied punching Tommy from across the table.

-----

Mr. Smith stared around the massive cavern trying to pass the time he could not count. He noted the rough walls. His analytical mind began spouting out facts about digestion, and peristalsis, and hydrochloric acid... he shook his heads to stem the flow of thoughts not wanting to dwell on his likely doom. He turned his attention to the pile of soggy Cheetos observing the destruction they had suffered between Tommy's merciless teeth. Again he shook his head before realizing it would be very difficult to avoid thinking about being digested considering he was in a stomach. He struggled to shut out his surroundings but his panic was growing.

The stomach around him growled again. Though Mr. Smith didn't know it Tommy had just walked into McDonalds and the aroma of food had tripled his hunger. Mr. Smith did however notice a change when Tommy saw his girlfriend as the cavern seemed to quake a bit. Confused Mr. Smith simply hoped for the best.

Instead after a minute, a deluge of yellow soda flowed into the stomach. Mr. Smith cried out as his capsule shifted in the shallow lake of pop.

"Tommy! What are you doing?" he shouted.

-----

Jessica appeared carrying a tray with the boys' food.

"I came up with an excuse to come out here" she explained dropping the tray onto the table before kissing Tommy. "I had to do that before I left, didn't want to wait a week" she said with a smile.

"Don't worry I'll call you every night" Tommy replied sincerely.

Jessica hugged Tommy before rushing back to her post at the register.

"Pfffft!!" Andy made a farting noise.

"Grow up!" replied Tommy as he ripped open a packet of ketchup and squirted it onto a napkin. He dipped his fries and popped them into his mouth.

"Mmmmm that'll hit the spot!" he groaned happily. As he swallowed the fries he unwrapped a cheeseburger, raised it to his mouth and took a bite. He waited to swallow before turning to his friends.

"So what made you think to convince me there was a tiny man in that pill?" he asked before taking another bite from his burger.

Joe swallowed a bite of his sandwich suddenly very aware of its descent into his chest. He had forgotten about the tiny man.

Andy however just shrugged "We saw that movie where the kids shrink cuz of their dad's machine... It just popped into our heads I guess" he replied.

Joe put down his sandwich, unable to continue. His friends didn't notice as they discussed that movie while plowing through their meals. Joe watched as Tommy took a huge bite out of his cheeseburger, chewing quickly and swallowing as he listened to Andy. Without looking down he snatched up some fries, dipped them in ketchup and brought them to his mouth. His friend's mouth yawned open and the tongue shot out covered in chewed burger bits before everything disappeared behind Tommy's lips again. As Tommy chewed and swallowed Joe stared at his chest and belly, imagining the food joining the tiny man in the stomach. For a moment he felt sincere remorse.

However he thought suddenly it was just some tiny thing that couldn't be human. Something that tiny didn't matter. Feeling better Joe picked up his sandwich. He bit into it and focused on joining his friends' conversation. He chewed and swallowed without a second thought. He didn't consider where his food was going nor where Tommy's went. It was as if the moment hadn't happened.

-----

Inside the stomach Mr. Smith heard a grinding noise accompanied by what sounded like a groan of joy. A distant gulp confirmed what was coming. He cried out as a soggy yellow blob appeared through the sphincter. The movement of the stomach had shifted him away from the center and he watched the chewed fries hit the stomach floor. Mr. Smith felt a bit nauseous as he witnessed Tommy's meal from within the giant boy's stomach. He tried not to remember that what he saw was food that moments ago was being chewed up in Tommy's slimy mouth before being unceremoniously gulped down in the same manner he had been, and then being followed by more mounds of fast food.

As more food cascaded in and began to bury his capsule, Mr. Smith was thankful for his enclosure. Before long he was completely buried but he could still hear the sounds of Tommy chewing and swallowing his food from above as well as the splats as the mountain of greasy sodden food grew. The stomach growled and began to shift. Mr. Smith yelped and then curled up in the bottom preparing himself for disaster.
112221212211112112211221.title: I'm Lovin' It

1122212122111121122112212.content:
Tommy popped the last bite of his cheeseburger in his mouth, chewed and swallowed. He sipped on the last of his pop and then looked expectantly at his friends.

"Ok, now what d'you guys wanna do?" he asked.

Joe shrugged but Andy had an idea.

"Let's head to the mall and check out the new arcade, everyone who's been there says its great."

Tommy frowned, "I don't wanna walk there though, I'm so full!" he said rubbing his stomach for effect.

Andy shrugged, "I know the bus we could take..."

"Sounds good to me!" Joe chimed in.

With that the boys got up from the table and threw the trash remaining from their meals away. Each one looked forward to seeing the new arcade, hoping it would be as good as promised.

-----

Mr. Smith noticed acid pooling around the bottom of his capsule. He began to panic as he realized that Tommy, without realizing it, was starting to digest his meal.

"TOMMY, HELP ME! GET ME OUT OF HERE!" he screamed. While most of him recognized that his efforts were futile, a small part of him refused to give up on the young man who had been so dependable in the past. He started beating on the walls of the capsule.

The acid levels continued to rise, and Mr. Smith could see its quick effect on the food. The soggy, chewed mush of fries and cheeseburger slowly started to break down as the stomach's movement became more noticeable. As Mr. Smith moved about the capsule he suddenly became aware that the floor was becoming spongy. He looked down and gasped.

The acid was very slowly burning through the capsule. Mr. Smith remembered that he was in a pill meant to be digested as a means of delivering whatever medication it originally had. This meant his barrier would eventually be destroyed and he would join the masticated remains of Tommy's food.

He began to sob as he realized his situation had no hope and he had only been fooling himself since Tommy had swallowed him.

No! He had been fooling himself since he had swallowed that shrinking serum that he would be able to stay safe shrunken in a world of giants. He finally realized just how insignificant he had made himself. Here he was a brilliant scientist, swallowed by a giant teenage boy without a second thought because a dare from the giant's friends. And now he was doomed to be digested with the giant boy's meal, no more noticeable than a crumb. And it was all his fault, he ad no one to blame, he had put himself in this situation.

"Stupid, STUPID! NOOOOOOO!!!" he wailed in rage and agony. Mr. Smith had finally realized that he was done for and there was nothing he could do about it.

-----

As Tommy sat on the bus chatting with his friends he didn't think about the meal he had finished off mere minutes ago. He didn't know of the drama playing out in his gut. He was deaf to the cries of anguish echoing around his stomach. He didn't know that as his thoughts focused on the arcade, his stomach filled with acid and began to break down his food.

He couldn't feel the peristalsis that rocked Mr. Smith's world and violently stirred the soggy remains of his meal. He didn't know that as he leaned over to Joe to make fun of another bus rider's clothes that Mr. Smith's pill suddenly emerged at the top of the storm of chewed food and stomach acid. He didn't know that suddenly, the tiny man felt a glimmer of unfounded hope.

However he did notice his stomach gurgle loudly suddenly. He glanced down for a moment before Andy pointed out that the next stop was where they would get off. His mind dismissed the gurgle and his excitement for the arcade became the center of his attention.

What Tommy would never realize was that gurgle was the signal of the moment that the capsule finally broke. Mr. Smith screamed as he was sucked out and tossed into the digestive storm. He only lasted a few seconds before being pulled under a wave and attacked by the acid. As Tommy walked into the arcade his tiny neighbor passed out.

Tommy's digestive system did its job and killed foreign life that found itself in the young man's stomach. And so Mr. Smith died inside Tommy's belly with no one any the wiser.

In his absence, Mr. Smith was missed by those who knew him, including Tommy who had looked up to the man as a role-model. No leads were found in his disappearance in spite of a very thorough investigation. Everyone was devastated as they were forced to accept they would never see Bryan Smith again.

While Joe pointed out that they had found the tiny man the same day Mr. Smith went missing, Andy shrugged it off. He managed to convince Joe and himself that they hadn't seen a tiny man, and it was just a weird bug. They also never shared any of this with Tommy, who never remembered to bring up the pill again.

Tommy for a short while was focused on Mr. Smith's disappearance but whenever he felt too sad about it, he found he could soothe the pain with a cheeseburger and some fries.
1122212122111121122112212.title: Unnoticed passing, unforgettable absence

choices: The capsule falls apart and "frees" Bryan
Andy coughs and the pill shoots out of his mouth
112221212211112112212.content:
"Fine," Andy declared. "I will."

When he stretched out a hand to pluck the capsule off the table, Joe grabbed his wrist. "But you can't…"

"Yes, I can," Andy said. "I'll prove that Tommy's nothing but a big baby."

"What's the big deal anyway?" Tommy wanted to know.

Andy pinched the capsule between his thumb and forefinger, lifting it toward his mouth. His action tossed tiny Mr. Smith from end of the capsule to the other.

"What the hell?" The tiny man squeaked. He pounded against the curved walls and screamed for them to let him out.

Andy parted his lips and popped the pill into his mouth. Joe, watching this development, looked a little pale.

"What's your problem?" Tommy asked his sickly-looking friend.

Joe stammered and pointed as Andy made a big production of swallowing, including a very audible gulp.

"Woah, dude," Joe finally blurted. "That's cold."

"What the hell are you talking about?" Tommy demanded.

Andy patted his stomach. "Might as well tell him now," he said, looking at Joe.

Joe looked at his best friend and confessed everything. "There was a little man in the pill, and Andy just swallowed him."

Tommy laughed and looked at them like they had both lost their senses. "That's the craziest…"

At the same time, Andy shifted the pill into another part of his mouth with his tongue. He hadn't any intention of swallowing and loosing the tiny pet. He'd been pretending to freak out Joe.

But the saliva in his mouth was already at work, slowly melting away the walls of the capsule….
112221212211112112212.title: Andy accepts Tommy's challenge

choices: Still in Andy's mouth
Spit out, unnoticed
1122212122111121122121.content:
Andy moves the pill under his tongue as Tommy gives both him and Joe disbelieving looks.

"Seriously? You're gonna try to get me to believe that load of shit?" Tommy asks sounding annoyed. "There's no effort in that! That's not even believable." he added dismissively.

Andy contemplates briefly showing Tommy the pill when Joe's voice interrupts his thoughts.

"No! Seriously there was!" Joe protests, facing Andy. "And he just swallowed him like whatever!"

Seeing Joe all flustered and pale, Andy decides he can deal with Tommy later. Andy just shrugs, remaining silent.

---

Mr. Smith had quit pounding on the capsule walls just after being popped into the mouth. Though he heard the sound of a gulp he remained in the mouth. Dull thuds accompanied his rough movement about the mouth. The giant teenager's tongue easily relocated him as it pleased.

In the dim light streaming in from the barely open lips, Mr. Smith could see rows of massive molars, dotted with fillings. A long uvula swayed over where the tongue stretched downwards into the blackness of the throat.

He cried out in surprise as the tongue maneuvered him once more and he lost his balance. he came to stop underneath the massive tongue, it's pink surface plastered against the pill wall. Under the tongue, with the saliva glands, a lake of saliva surrounded the pill.

Just as Andy shrugs at Joe the bottom of the pill liquefies due to the saliva.

"Augh!" Mr. Smith yelps, attempting to escape the thick, sticky liquid that slowly floods the interior. A moment later the side of the pill breaks. Mr. Smith, seeing his confines rapidly break down, decides its time to flee. He pulls himself through the expanding hole in the side and treads through the saliva, attempting to get out from underneath the tongue.

He reaches the gum-line, and see's Andy's jagged teeth towering above him. A sudden shift of the tongue pushes saliva, as well as Mr. Smith, up onto the surface of the tongue. He gasps and holds tight onto the undulating surface.

---

Joe turns back to Tommy. "Dude! He just swallowed someone this is so fucked up!" Joe says panicked. Tommy fixes Joe with an impatient look of disbelief.

"Bullshit," he grunts.

Joe's shoulders sag and he turns to Andy. :Dude! Why the fuck did you do that? Seriously, that's cold!" Joe reprimands.

Andy stares at him blankly and then deciding that Joe is really not being very entertaining spits the pill out into his hand.

"I didn't swallow it! You are such a little bitch!" Andy says impatiently.

Tommy's eyes flick onto the pill though he attempts to feign indifference. Joe gasps as Tommy's eyes detect nothing inside the pill.

"Nothing in the pill! You guys are so full of shit! This wasn't even funny!" he says unhappily, turning to leave.

Joe gapes at the pill. "Where'd the tiny man go?" he asks desperately.
1122212122111121122121.title: Freedom at a cost

choices: Tommy logs on to Facebook and sees Mr. Smith's pic on Andy's FB page
Andy suggests they shoot some video
11222121221111211222.content:
"He's so tiny he could get squished beneath my big toe, and I'd probably never even feel him," Andy declared in a loud voice betraying far too much enthusiasm for Mr. Smith's comfort.

As the shrunken scientist continue to listen, the enormous teenagers continued to dream up horrifying scenarios, each more gruesome and frightening than the last.

Andy let his huge index finger hover menacingly over the tiny man in the palm of his hand. "I could rub him out with my finger!"

"No!" Mr. Smith tried to crawl across the teenager's palm, away from the shadow of the immense fingerpad.

After tormenting the tiny man with his threatening finger, Andy came up with a new idea. "You got your phone, man?" He asked Joe.

"Yeah," Joe replied.

"Take a picture of the little dude in my hand," Andy said. "Let's post this to my Facebook page."

Joe grinned as he slid his phone from his pocket and activated the camera function.

"He's so tiny, it's hard to get him in focus," he complained to Andy.

Indignant, the tiny man gathered himself to his full height of a quarter inch tall and berated the two teenagers. "Are you kidding me?" Mr. Smith stormed at them. "I need help, and you're wanting to make me an update on your Facebook page!"

"He's squeaking at me again," Andy said.

Joe snapped a picture and nodded his head. "Yeah, he does that."

"Now, let's get that picture uploaded," Andy said.

"Better put him back in the bowl," Joe suggested.

Andy, none to gently, dropped tiny Bryan back into the enormous glass bowl.

"Hey, take one of him in the bowl, too," Joe said. "We'll upload it, too."
11222121221111211222.title: Back to the Bowl

choices: Head to Joe's house immediately
Call Joe on the phone
112221212211112112221.content:
To add to his complete humiliation, the enormous goldfish bowl faced Joe's computer, granting the bug-sized man an unobstructed but distorted view through the curved glass at the gigantic monitor. He saw Joe's Facebook page and his latest photos, pics of himself looking far too tiny in Andy's colossal hand and then looking lost, tiny and vulnerable in the enormous glass bowl.

What was the matter with Tommy's friends? They should be trying to help him, but they acted like his misfortune was entertainment for them.

"Hey!" He shouted. "Get me the hell out of here!"

"LOOK AT ALL THESE COMMENTS!" Andy said.

"YEAH," Joe said, squeezing next to his friends. The two teenagers blocked Mr. Smith's view of the monitor. "They all think we faked the pics."

"HEY, I HAVE AN IDEA FOR A HILARIOUS PIC," Andy said. He turned and thrust his huge hand into the bowl.

A terrified little man wanted to run, but the bowl offered no hiding places. Soon enough, the giant teen plucked him from the bowl, holding him pinched between thumb and forefinger.

"TAKE MY PIC NOW," Andy commanded. He moved his hand over his open mouth, dangling the little man.

Mr. Smith looked down and saw the cavern that opened to admit a view of a long, dark tunnel at the back of the teenager's throat. "Noooh! Please! Don't eat me!"

Joe snapped the pic, and they were soon uploading it to Facebook. Of course, Andy returned the tiny man to the bowl. "DID YOU HEAR HIM SQUEAKING? HE MUST HAVE THOUGHT I REALLY MEANT TO EAT HIM!"

Meanwhile, Tommy had gotten himself a soda and sat down at his computer to surf. He opened Facebook and noticed updates and photos on Joe's page.

He looked closer at one of the pics.

"Oh my god! Is that Mr. Smith?"

He opened another photo and saw Andy dangling his neighbor, now shrunken to the size of a bug, over his open mouth,

"What the hell have they done to Mr. Smith!" Tommy exclaimed.
112221212211112112221.title: FB

1122212122111121122211.content:
The two giants got another bright idea, and placed the tiny, unfortunate Mr. Smith on the floor. They proceeded to stomp around the room, disregarding the tiny little man as he scrambled to get out of their paths, never knowing if one of the titans might accidentally land one of their sneakers on top of him.

Andy stomped past, careful to keep his eyes locked on the little speck scurrying on the distant floor beneath his feet. "Better watch out, bug-man," the teen taunted, launching his foot over the little man and letting it slam down at a safe distance.

"Ha!" Joe said. "Watch this!"

He walked toward the little speck, and as he got closer he loomed overhead of the terrified bug-sized scientist. Joe stopped and raised his foot, letting it hover over the tiny man.

"Take a photo," he ordered Andy, who kneeled down on the floor to get the camera focused on his friend's raised shoe and one cowering little speck of a man.

"That should be a good one," Andy agreed, and they both rushed to the computer to download the latest photo from the camera and upload it to Facebook.

The abandoned little man was left on the floor, still trembling from fear and outrage at the way the two thoughtless teens treated him.

"If Tommy were here, he would save me from these two morons!" The tiny man said aloud.

Suddenly, the front door burst open with a noisy crash and tiny Mr. Smith looked in shock as Tommy stomped into the house.

"All right, you idiots!" Tommy shouted as he came through the door. "Where the hell is Mr. Smith?"

"Tommy! Stop!" Andy screamed.

Joe, who had been posting the new photo, yelled for Tommy to freeze.

"I will not," Tommy declared angrily. "I saw those pictures you have been posting! Where is he? What have you done to Mr. Smith?"

The little man in question had tried to run, but Tommy's shocking and swift entrance caught him off guard. His sneakers rained down a litter of debris they had collected during his walk through the front yard, including dead bugs.

"Stop! Tommy…" Mr. Smith screamed.

"Tommy, stop!" Andy and Joe yelled in unison as they frantically scanned the floor for any sign of the little speck.

"Oh gross," Joe said when he realized what Tommy's dramatic entrance must have caused.

"What are you jerks talking about?" Tommy asked.

"He was on the floor, dude," Andy said. "Eew, I think you stepped on him."

Tommy, now feeling very sick, lifted his shoe and saw an extremely tiny dot of red on the floor.

The boys realized they might have gotten themselves into a jam, but Andy and Joe quickly deleted all the "faked" photos from the Facebook account while Tommy used a napkin to clean up the tiny spot on the floor.

"See what you idiots caused," Tommy grumbled as he swiped the floor with the napkin, which he then wadded into a ball and dropped in the trash.

He did feel sorry that his own desire to help had caused such a disaster, but he was more sorry that he might have to get a real job now that he wouldn't have Mr. Smith to pay him to do chores any longer.

That really sucked.
1122212122111121122211.title: Rushing to the rescue

choices: Joe probes his tiny pet's limits
Joe makes a fist
1122212122111122.content:
After being scooped up in the building-sized fish net, the tiny scientist found himself entangled in the fine mesh fabric of the net as the gigantic teenager stared down at him.

Despite a helpless fury at this casual treatment, he admitted that the dip net might have been a safer alternative than the curious titan snatching him between two colossal fingertips.

But enough was enough. He tried to disentangle, but found one arm caught in the mesh. As he tried to extricate himself, he kept shouting at the huge teenager.

"I need Tommy!" Mr. Smith shouted. "Could you call him?"

He wrenched his arm free, but Joe didn't look very responsive, although the tiny man had difficult reading the expression on such a huge face.

Joe smiled widely, amused at the insect-like chirps produced by the little man's shouts. "DON'T WORRY," Joe said in loud tones that he modified to try to sound soothing. "I'LL TAKE GOOD CARE OF YOU."

Somehow, that reassurance, coming from the huge teenager, didn't strike the shrunken scientist as very comforting.

"I don't need taken care of," he muttered, more to himself than anyone else since, obviously, Joe could not understand him.

Suddenly, Joe tilted the net. Caught in mid-air and plunging fast, the tiny man screamed, but landed with an "oof" in the center of Joe's wide palm.

Winded, he remained at rest for a few moments, as the teenager continued to study him.

"YOU'RE INCREDIBLE," Joe said, extending his index finger to give the speck a gentle prod.

Seeing the oncoming colossal fingertip, the little man screamed...
1122212122111122.title: Into Joe's Hand

choices: Bryan scales the bed
Bryan scales Joe's night stand
11222121221112.content:
One of Joe's massive Airwalks smashed into the carpet dangerously close to the tiny scientist. A concussion of air sped away from the vicinity of impact.

The buffeting from a near miss convinced Bryan he didn't want to get any closer to the huge shoes and the giant wearing them.

But, when the giant didn't move for an extended period, the tiny man debated whether he should make another attempt to get noticed.

Tommy's departure having effectively stranded him, he realizes his only hope is to contact Joe.

•••••••

Joe took a moment to use his remote control to scan his TV grid, searching for something worth watching. While doing so, he remained motionless, oblivious to the speck-sized man between his feet.

•••••••

Bryan, when the titan remained still, ran toward the closest sneaker, which happened to be Joe's right foot.

He reached the gigantic shoe, but enjoyed only a fleeting instant of elation.

What should he do now?

He pounded against the wall of the sneaker's sole. "It's like hitting a rock wall!" Bryan exclaimed.

"Joe!" Bryan tried screaming. "Please! Down here! Next to your foot!"

He ran along the length of the tall rubber sole, looking for any means of scaling the shoe.

Suddenly, the shoe rose in the air, shocking Bryan.

The shoe slammed back into the carpet, sending a shockwave that knocked Bryan off his feet.

••••••••

Having found a program to hold his interest, Joe flung himself onto his bed. He stretched out comfortably, his interest absorbed by the screen.

•••••••

Bryan recovered quickly when the titan's second shoe, also airborne, missed him as Joe collapsed onto his bed. The huge teen increased the television's volume, causing his unseen guest a great deal of discomfort.

Bryan saw Joe's form stretched out on the bed. Bed and youth joined together like some unreal mountain range.

"At least he isn't stepping around the room now," Bryan said gratefully.

More than ever, he realized he needed to gain the titan's attention.

"He's my only hope now," Bryan realized.
11222121221112.title: Joe Remains Oblivious

choices: wakes up
rolls over, moving his hand away
112221212211121.content:
Bryan stared up at Joe's long, socked feet that hung off the edge of the bed.

"I need to get to him!" Bryan thought desperately. He scanned the bed as he continued moving, too scared to remain in one place very long.

After a moment he could see a blanket drooped from the surface of the bed down to the floor.

"I can climb that!" Bryan realized. With an elated cheer he sprinted across the floor.

---

Joe watched an entire episode of the show, and didn't change channels as another one started up. Laying in place on his comfortable bed, he felt his eye lids grow heavy. Though he tried to stay awake, a few minutes later he was gently snoring.

---

Bryan gasped for air as he hauled himself over the final ledge onto Joe's massive bed. He hadn't anticipated how difficult it would be! He was thankful for the various wrinkles in the fabric where he had been able to rest. Without those he would never have made it to the top.

The room spreads out in front of him like a valley. The faded carpet resembles a field, albeit one littered with crumpled shirts and two large and filthy sneakers. The dresser against the other wall is reminiscent of a distant hilltop, the TV placed on it looking out of place. The program flashes across the screen. Its voices and laugh tracks create a comforting background noise that reminds Bryan of normalcy.
