Even more unsettling, his shipping package with the antidote and all his supplies for the journey now rested on a cliff that loomed more than 1,700 feet over his head.

As his situation dawned on the tiny, naked scientist, he was left with very little time to consider contingencies. Slightly ahead of schedule, his teenaged next-door neighbor intruded onto the scene. Once entering via the back door, Tommy and a pair of old, disintegrating sneakers stomped across the kitchen tiles.

"Oh, shit! He's early!" Bryan exclaimed.

Although he has known the teenager for years, Bryan felt an unmistakable sense of awe as he stared at the titanic youth. Part of the thrill, he realized, came from the fact he knew the giant. But anything familiar about Tommy had vanished now that Bryan beheld him from such an insignificant perspective.

"It's just Tommy... same scrawny kid I have known for years," he intoned. "But look at him!"

Then, his mind snapped into self-preservation mode when Tommy continued his trek across the room toward the kitchen counter. Each of the worn rubber soles of the old sneakers slammed down with ear-splitting blasts as they came closer, threatening to mash him like the bug he had become.

He didn't even have time to scream for assistance. The shadow of a sneaker engulfed him...
1242.title: Shrinking Down Fast

choices: Bryan tries to make contact
Tommy exits, leaving Bryan desolate
12421.content:
Everything happened so fast. He drank the formula and barely had a chance to intake breath before his entire being was reduced to a speck upon his kitchen floor.

It had never worked like that before. The many times Bryan had experimented upon himself, drinking the exact same concoction, he always had a slight grace period of almost a minute.

"Oh crap, I'm on the damn floor! This is not good!"

Bryan had been so absorbed with his own plight that he forgot just what time it was. Looking up at the sheer cliff of counter, towering over 1,700 feet into the sky, he suddenly froze when loud noises invaded from behind the back door.

With a squeaky turn and light creak, all blown up to near thunderous notes, the humongous door was pushed open. Immediately, a gale of hurricane winds giddily swept into the space.

Bryan barely had a chance to scream before he was thrown backwards. "Oh, shit! He's early!"

Early by only a few minutes - a fact that was innocently unimportant to Bryan's teenaged neighbour Tommy. The gigantic teen entered the room with pounding stomps, each one sending tremendous vibrations through the tiled floor. Bryan pulled himself up, screaming in both fear and surprise.

"It's just Tommy... same scrawny kid I have known for years," He intoned, staring banjo eyed at the giant in question. "But look at him!"

Unaware of his neighbour's presence, Tommy rotated his planetary-sized head. A tiny black speck buzzed past his face, speeding quickly to dodge his enormous hand. Tommy easily stood more than 3,000 feet tall. Not as tall as Bryan's older and more athletic nephew, but such details were almost unnoticeable when smaller than a common ant.

Lifting an enormous arm to check the time, the titanic teenager suddenly broke into action.

"Fuuuck!" Bryan belted as he whipped himself around and fled.

The ground jolted with each godly step. Heading for the base of his kitchen island was his only option, but unfortunately, Tommy had the same idea.

Another humongous shockwave sent the tiny man to his face. Turning over, he was presented with a rare front-row angle of Tommy's monumental sole. Nothing more than a regular sneaker sole by any means, but now clown to titanic scale. Every ridge of rubber stood out like deep canyons. Some filled with dried mud or pebbles, while others were worn down almost flat.

Bryan could only open his maw once more and shriek. "Noooooo!" He vainly put his arms above him, unable to think of any other action to save himself.

Seemingly to hover briefly, the tread stretched over the section of floor in all directions. Then it descended.

THOOOM.

It met the ground with such introduction that tiny Bryan was slammed flat against the ground by intense shockwave. And he lay there, disheveled and trembling, but somehow still alive.

"What...How am I-..."

Before he could speak his question, he was rudely interrupted. In the dark, but somehow not pressed flat, he was greeted with an avalanche of dirt that fell upon him. Struggling, he froze again when light suddenly returned. Tommy's huge sneaked lifted off the floor as he stepped away from the counter. Bryan stared at the filthy tread - watching it raise into the sky, moving away at such impossible speed before landing with a hefty crash.

He pulled himself up, spitting and scraping dirt from his naked body. Immediately, Bryan realized his trick to survival - without thinking, he had fallen into one of the many ravine-sized gaps between each tile. "Thank you mother for convincing me against linoleum!" Looking around, he spotted Tommy's gigantic being across the room. The hapless teenager had no idea he nearly erased his neighbour's existence like a mere insect. Tommy clutched the package in one hand, idly tapping it against his leg, while he read the small note Bryan had left him with the juicy bit of currency attached.

Scampering back onto the mesa-like tile, large chunks of dirt and grit had been left behind from the giant's tread. Each one larger than himself, but just as insignificant. Bryan frowned at the mess as he looked back to Tommy. "Ever heard of wiping your feet? Ugh!"

The ridiculous comment went unheard by the gigantic teen who stood immensely tall and so far away. Tommy only crumpled the written note, pocketed the valuable one, and prepared to leave.
12421.title: Thank you Mother

12422.content: The sneaker hovered over Bryan, wobbling as if Tommy was unsure of where to go. But then the sneaker came down, squishing Bryan.
12422.title: Squished

choices: Bryan is swept off the tabletop and becomes a drifting human dust particle
Bryan wins a desperate dash to the shipping carton
Tommy has brought a friend with him
125.content:
The more he contemplated the potency of the formula, the more the idea of an extremely small size appealed to him.

One inch would be nice, but half an inch would be nicer. But, then he asked himself, why stop there?

He imagined himself being a mere fraction of an inch, staring up at his handsome nephew.

"Zack would love it!" Bryan convinced himself.

He knew that shrinking himself that small could be considered extremely reckless, but he had never been someone to only throw himself into a project without going the extra mile.

The next morning, as time approached to drink his formula and shank himself to the size of a sixteenth of an inch, he began to feel nervous and have some second thoughts.

After all, he was going to be so small that even a mere inch mark on a ruler would span nearly 100 feet. "My God! Zack will look like he's a mile tall!"

Reflecting on that, he realized he was going to be so drastically small it might be difficult for Zack to notice him.

"If I am going to do this, I should at least write a note to Zack," he reasoned.

After all, he would need his nephew's help to regain his size once they had both enjoyed the "big" surprise.

He sat down at his table and carefully wrote out a note. He felt a little foolish putting the venture into words, but he felt more secure when he had finished, signed the note, and then folded and placed it inside the package that would provide his transport to Zack's college.

Now, all that was left to do was to shrink.

He stared at his vial of shrinking formula. He smiled faintly as he lifted it to his lips. He stood next to the kitchen table, looking down at the small cardboard box.

He drank the contents of the vial in a single gulp.

The speed of the shrinking process shocked him. With his size rapidly vanished, he barely managed to clamber onto the surface of his kitchen table. Less than a moment had passed since he had swallowed the formula before he found himself one-sixteenth of an inch in size. He had entered another realm.

The shipping carton now loomed like a nearly 400-foot-tall building from the vast plain of the surface of his kitchen table.

The alien vastness of everyday objects cast a spell that left the mote-sized scientist mesmerized.

His reverie ended, however, when his back door opened. His next-door neighbor, perhaps a few minutes early, had arrived to carry out his task of mailing Mr. Smith's package.

Tommy's entrance into the Smith home was accompanied by a world-shaking force of a springtime gust of wind that roared with insane speed across the vast tabletop to collide violently with the shrunken scientist...
125.title: 1/16th of an inch tall

choices: clinging to Tommy's shirt
on a couch cushion
on the carpet
1251.content: As the titanic teenager entered Bryan's house, he was swept off into the air. Tossing and turning in the air, Bryan can barely see where he is being carried. Unable to tell up from down, he finds himself clinging so something soft but firm. When his disorientation fades, he glances around and realizes that he is...
1251.title: Gone with the wind

choices: The nearby restaurant where he suddenly shrinks!
The grocery mart where he suddenly shrinks!
The gas station where he suddenly shrinks!
13.content:
Waking at 10:00 am the next morning, Bryan nearly leaped from the bed as he hurried into the kitchen. Today was the day he thought. The day that he really put the miraculous formula he concocted that was capable of shrinking him smaller than an eighth of an inch to the test.

Set before him on the kitchen table was a shipping box the size of his hand. Rather unremarkable at a glance, the current contents included an ordinary handkerchief, and a collection of minutely scaled supplies. These included everything Bryan would need for his journey. Bread crumbs, blankets, and a barely visible bottle of liquid. This liquid is the most important item he would have after shrinking, it was the antidote.

A careful check of the contents to be sure all necessities were there, and Bryan turned his gaze to the vial sitting on the counter. Roughly the size of his thumb, this vial contained the breakthrough formula. Bryan was able to develop it with ingredients and chemicals he had meticulously smuggled from EDL labs where he worked. The resulting concoction was a pale blue liquid that tasted bittersweet, and almost instantly shrunk the user.

With a heaving thrust, he sat himself on the counter. His whole body trembled in excitement, it always did at the thought of shrinking himself. The feeling never waned, even after testing it briefly six times already. This time would be the longest. He grabbed the bottle.

"Here goes nothing! Zack, here I come!" Bryan mumbled aloud. Licking his lips and swallowing nervously, he brought the glass vial to his lips. One quick motion, and he down the bitter liquid, his eyes closed in anticipation.

A full ten seconds later, the scientist opened his eyes, prepared to take in his new surroundings. Bryan found himself staring at his refrigerator, the numerous letter magnets still at eye level. Strange, he thought, the formula usually worked after only a few seconds, the longest having taken only ten. So far an entire minute had passed and he remained unchanged.

Bryan remained seated on the counter, waiting for the expected change. 10 minutes passed. Then 25, and then 45 minutes. It was already passed 1 pm, and yet the formula had done nothing. His mind wandered over various explanations. Could he have developed some sort of resistance to it? Or, perhaps something went wrong while preparing it? He frowned as he stood up, annoyed and confused.

He needed to examine himself back in his makeshift laboratory. Reaching for the telephone, he dialed Tommy's phone number.

"Hello, Tommy? This is Mr. Smith. I am afraid that I will be cancelling my trip till further notice." Tommy responded with disappointment, sad that the promised payment would be delayed. Bryan apologized, and hung up the phone. Bryan hated to disappoint the teen, but he needed to investigate this problem.

The confused scientist spent the rest of the day trying to determine the cause of his formulas failure. He preformed numerous tests on himself and the extra shrinking solution.

Bryan finally resigned himself to sleep after finding no solid results, his mind was beyond weary from stress and confusion.

With a start, he woke late the next morning. Wandering gloomily to the kitchen, he sighed st the sight of the unused shipping box. "How could his formula not work?" He thought angrily as he reached to open the fridge.

Another distressed sigh emitted from the bedraggled man as he took in the empty refrigerator. He had purposefully not stocked it in preparation for his trip. His stomach grumbled noisily, demanding sustenance.

Dressing himself, Bryan went to....
13.title: Bryan plans for the adventure of a lifetime.

choices: Look for Tommy and try to attract his attention/assistance
Wait for Corby to return and gain his attention
Go in search of Corby, which would take him to the kitchen
131.content:
Some hot food would do wonders to re-focus his mind on the problem at hand, so Bryan pulled on some casual clothes and grabbed his keys and wallet from the bowl at the antique stand near the front door.

His highly organized brain kept chasing possible theories to explain the baffling failure of his shrinking formula, but he could not let everything slide because of a minor setback.

Bryan drove the short distance to a local diner less than five minutes from his home. As a consequence of living alone, he often took his meals at the diner rather than trying to cook for one at home. The diner's fare was average, and attracted most of its patrons by virtue of its convenience.

The diner wasn't too crowded when he entered. Most of the day's breakfast rush had already thinned out. He chose a booth at the rear of the diner and smiled when his favorite waiter approached.

"Morning, Mr. Smith," Corby said, handing the college professor one of the tattered menus.

Bryan smiled as he took the menu, but he kept his eyes on Corby, who was a handsome 20-year-old working his way through college with his job waiting tables at the diner.

"How are classes?" Bryan asked, admiring the tall, handsome youth. Corby stood several inches taller than Bryan, and had a nice body outlined nicely beneath his T-shirt decorated with the diner's logo.

"Not bad, but between working here and trying to finish my end-of-term projects, I've really been stretched thin," Corby said.

"Let me know if there's anything I can do to help," Bryan volunteered almost too eagerly.

"Thanks, that's good of you, but I'm not taking any science classes this semester," Corby said politely. He didn't mind that the professor was often less than subtle with his infatuation. It ensured generous tips.

"So, what will it be?" The college student asked the older man.

"Diet soda, a club sandwich and fries," Bryan said, pausing to consider the last aspect of the order.

"Hold the mayo?" Corby volunteered, knowing that the professor had been focused on trimming some less healthy items from his diet.

Bryan felt his stomach grumble. "You know, I think I will just risk it today," he said. "I'm starving."

Corby grinned. "No problem, professor."

He took back the menu and went to turn in Bryan's order at the very moment Tommy and his best friend entered the restaurant.

Tommy saw the professor and made a beeline toward the booth.

"Hey, professor!" The teenager said as his friend, Joe, followed behind him, obviously less enthusiastic.

"Hey, Tommy," Bryan said.

"I'll just grab a table, over there," Joe said, not hiding his complete indifference to the older man.

Once they were left alone, Tommy asked, "So, what happened with your vacation...and that package you wanted mailed?"

Bryan couldn't just blurt out that he had meant to mail himself halfway across the country to his nephew's dorms.

"Just a few unexpected problems," he answered. "But, I'm working on them."

Tommy brightened immediately. "Well, you just let me know. I'm still available to help."

"I appreciate that," Bryan said. "You'll hopefully hear from me soon."

As he talked to the teenager, the professor began to feel a strange sensation that spread out from his complaining stomach and caused his entire body to tingle.

"I'll catch you later," Tommy said and turned to join Joe at a table on the other side of the restaurant.

Bryan, at the moment, was startled by the sudden queasy feeling. It was all too familiar.

Suddenly, he felt himself falling. He screamed out Tommy's name, but his voice seemed swallowed by a sudden darkness as he collapsed into his own clothes.

His position in the corner of the booth concealed his disappearance from the smattering of customers elsewhere in the diner. Suddenly freed of his body, the clothes slid to the floor, hidden by the laminate tabletop.

Finding himself suddenly tiny and naked, the shocked scientist stumbled out of his own pants and onto the dingy green and white pattern of the diner's linoleum floor. From his lowly position, he gazed up at the underside of the table and saw giant wads of ancient gum left behind by rude patrons.

"Oh no!" Bryan squeaked as he realized that the shrinking formula had finally taken effect after its inexplicable 24-hour delay.

The seriousness of his situation made itself plainly obvious. He was a mere eight-of-an-inch tall on the floor of the huge diner, several miles from his home and the antidote.

Suddenly, two massive sneakers thudded down on the linoleum and he heard Corby's massive voice.

"HERE YOU GO, MR. SMITH."

The tiny man heard the clatter on the other side of the table as Corby placed his order on the laminate surface.

The tiny man knew he was safe from the huge footwear as long as he remained beneath the table.

"But I can't just stay here forever," he said, trying to think of a move.

"MR. SMITH?" Corby asked, looking around for any sign of the man.

Finally, he shrugged and decided that he must have gone to the restroom. Besides, he had other customers. He left the sandwich and soda on the table, making a mental note to return later and see if Mr. Smith needed anything else.

As the giant footwear thudded away, Bryan broke out of his paralysis.

"No, wait! Don't leave!"

His feeble words went unheeded, hardly surprising given his extremely diminutive size.

He had two options:
131.title: Shrinking at the diner

choices: Cross the Room
Stick to the Walls
1311.content:
Bryan scanned the shadowed area under the table. Crumbs from meals of previous patrons were scattered across the floor, like boulders to the tiny man. Where the booth and wall met his eyes could discern the movement of what was probably a scavenging ant.

He shuddered and started walking briskly in the opposite direction. As he neared the edge of the table’s shadow he became more aware of the noises of the active restaurant. His table was around a corner, in the back. Bryan treasured his privacy, and this had become his favorite spot. It also was the reason no one had noticed his “little” problem.

Now the clangs and sizzles from the kitchen mixed with the thundering voices of hungry customers. Stopping, he allowed the noise to wash over him. He had to be proactive and get help quickly, if he wanted to return to normal. With a deep breath he strode out from under the table.

SMACK! *SQUEAL* A large black shoe missed him by inches as it marched by. “Oh!” Bryan cried out as he scrambled back under the table. Corby, unaware of the close call, returned to the kitchen holding a tray of dirty dishes. Bryan breathed heavily due to the close encounter. He needed to be more careful, he wasn’t used to dealing with people at this size. Marching out into the open simply wasn’t an option.

After taking another minute to calm down somewhat, Bryan forced himself to venture out again. This time he stayed against the sheer cliff formed by the towering booths, all of which were luckily unoccupied.

A few more customers had come in to the restaurant, although it was still fairly empty. Bryan noted this and knew that less people meant less giants to worry about. Over the din of regular noise a loud laugh rang out. Bryan’s face brightened when he heard it. Tommy had arrived at the restaurant a few minutes after he had and was just across the room. That thought dampened his mood. Tommy was across this massive room.

Bryan needed Tommy’s help, there was no doubt. And he would eventually get to the teenager’s table if he stuck to the walls. But Bryan was no fool and knew if he went as the crow flies across the room, he would get there much faster… of course with a much higher risk…
1311.title: Get to Tommy

choices: Approached Mike
Continued to trek towards Tommy
13111.content:
Bryan clenched his jaw and sighed. He had decided to be proactive. That meant making difficult decisions that would be for the better. He glanced around the room, making sure no giants were approaching and began to trek out into the open.

He moved as quickly as he could, terrified a giant would come stomping through with careless and fatal steps. He ran past various boulder sized crumbs and hairs like fallen trees. At normal size the debris was undetectable, but for him they were obstacles in his frenzied flight.

Brian flinched at the sound of monstrous voices that swirled together like thunder. These people, whom he had been one of mere minutes ago, were now terrifyingly huge. Their complete ignorance to his presence, coupled with their heedless and casual power made them deadly threats to the tiny man. He remembered the close encounter with Corby’s shoe. He needed to avoid the massive customers and get noticed by Tommy! Brian wasn’t sure how to do the second part but decided he could figure it out later.
Continuing to flee, Brian struggled against the growing tightness in his chest. He was not an athletic person, having spent most of his time exercising his mind rather than his body. He realized now that he should have considered some training before attempting to reduce himself down to such an insignificant size.

Brian wheezed as he began to unconsciously slowdown from exhaustion. He forced himself to press forward though. In an attempt to measure his progress, Brian counted the faded tiles still stretching between him and Tommy. Two white, one green, two white, one green and so on. He counted thirteen, each one stretching several football fields’ worth.

Brian was hit with the desire to look back, but was scared to see his pathetic progress. In an effort to keep himself distracted Bryan stared at Tommy and his equally huge friends. However the sun shining through the windows blinded him, forcing him to face the ground.

His breathing was becoming more labored and somehow staring at the ground felt slightly better. Scratches, chips, and scuffs were easily visible on the aged tile that stretched before him. This only held his attention for less than a minute. Finally overwhelmed by curiosity, Bryan looked back.

Five tiles. He had counted quickly to such a small number. Disappointment and exhaustion combined so that Bryan stopped and fell to his knees. Having been consumed by his thoughts for much of the run, Bryan had assumed it would be further than that!

He wheezed in the shadow of a towering table. He felt tears of hopelessness stream down his face. He was miles from home, and from the antidote and no one would ever suspect he was miniaturized on the floor of his favorite diner! Who would ever even imagine such a preposterous idea?

A harsh ring perks Bryan’s ears. He looks up, wiping tears from his eyes to see the front door has swung open. From the table he has stopped below he has a clear view of the door. Bryan recognizes the blond behemoth as he strides in. It’s none other than his towering neighbor Mike Duggan!

Taking advantage of the “seat yourself” policy Mike strolls across the room towards Brian’s cowering form. Brian whimpers pathetically, feeling particularly vulnerable in the open space below the table. Mike’s white high-tops stomp closer, affording Brian a view of the smudges of dirt and grime that mark the wall of the sole.

The shoes stop mere inches from Brian and he is unprepared for the deafening screeching as Mike effortlessly pulls a mountainous chair from the table. His shoes squeak as they shift allowing Mike to drop into the seat, causing the lofty piece of furniture to creak under his weight. The tiny man stares up the jean-clad legs which meet at a gray shirt that stretches further upward beyond where the tabletop obscures his face.

Bryan jumps as a pair of soiled black shoes approaches the table seconds after Mike had sat down. Each titanic sneaker crashes down blindly onto the various obstacles Brian had been dodging mere minutes ago.

There is a rumble of exchanged words as Corby and Mike talk. Brian, figuring Mike made a more convenient savior than Tommy, began to cautiously approach his massive sneaker.
Suddenly Mike’s face appears from the side of the table, his piercing blue eyes seemingly staring straight into Bryan’s.

“Mike! Help me! I’m right here!” Bryan yells, waving his arms.

“YEAH CORBY! I WOULD SAY YOU HAVE A BIT OF A PROBLEM!” he says seriously, eliciting a confused grunt from Brian. Mike’s right shoe lifts up without warning, flying closer to Brian.

“no… NO!” he screams in terror. The sole becomes easily visible, various dirt and grime packed deep into the tread. To his relief it passes him, and Brian watches as it slams down onto a couple of wriggling black ants. He snaps his head back up to his colossal neighbor.

Mike’s handsome features are twisted into a warm smile. “HAHA, DON’T WANT THESE LITTLE GUYS AROUND HERE! THAT’S FOR SURE!” he laughs, as his head disappears to face Corby again. The shoe remains in place. Brian can make out half of one of the ants struggling at the edge of Mike’s shoe, where it’s back half had been crushed.

Bryan sputtered in fear at the unprovoked and merciless attack Mike had made on the ants. All because they were so insignificant to him. Above he could hear him laughing with Corby, having already dismissed the lives beneath his massive foot.

“That could’ve been me!” Brian gasped in fear. Mike had always been so nice and helpful! But now at this size he was simply monstrous! Instinct told Brian to run, but logic reminded him that he still needed help.

“I’m no ant!” Brian roared to himself, “They’ll see that!” he added to reassure himself. Feeling more confident, Brian...
13111.title: Fantastic Voyage

choices: Mike looks down and spots another bug!
Mike is standing up!
131111.content:
Filled with confidence, Bryan clenched his fists with vigor.

Only problem; he could not convince himself to move. Like a rusted toy, his tiny legs remained in place, despite his increasingly desperate attempts to move them.

"What...the....fuck...?!" He said, grunting angrily to pull his feet off of the floor.

Without realizing it, Bryan had blundered into a spot of liquid that dried to an almost glue-like substance. Both his little pink feet were firmly planted in it, with little leeway. His right foot pulled a little bit, yet remained stuck fast. Bryan screamed. A primal cry filled with all the emotion he had been building up since this began.

"Dammit!"

Oblivious to both his world and plight, Mike adjusted his enormous shoe slightly. It dragged backwards, grinding against the tiled floor with a gritty noise and finished with an idle shift of the toe region. The minor movements sent bothersome aftershocks, rattling tiny Bryan who barely kept his balance. If he fell, the bug-sized man might find his naked body stuck in the unnoticed gunk permanently.

Distant pounding alerted him of another passing giant. The behemoth remained out of view, his gigantic sneakers only visible while he stomped nearby. Bryan watched, noting with a spark of recognition that they belonged to another employee of the diner. They crashed out of view, passing another familiar pair that belonged to Corby.

Meanwhile, Bryan's entire body had become soaked with sweat. All his pulling and crying, Bryan feared any further attempts might very well rend his sensitive soles from his feet! Yet, when he did so, his foot peeled and popped from the sticky spill. Bryan cheered, balancing with huffing breathes. He felt his other foot squish slightly, moist from his own sweat. With a final leap, he plopped onto dry tile as a pile of sweaty limbs.

Bryan pulled himself up, clearing his face of sweat and thanking his lucky stars. "I've gotta be careful...! That was a freaking deathtrap!" He gazed at the spot in question, roughly the size of a large puddle and visible only as a pinkish slime.

A loud crash exploded behind him. Squeaking, the tiny scientist remembered his mission: get Mike's attention!

Due to his lowly position upon the floor, this could only be done one way. Bryan would have to scale his gargantuan neighbour's huge sneaker! The leftmost one rested nearby. Bryan could only stare at it as he did before - a positive mountain constructed of hard rubber, dark canvas and suede, with laces thicker than trains. Worst part, Mike was constantly shifting his feet: tapping, sliding, and twisting them while he simply waited for his order.

Bryan could think of nothing else but the ants Mike cruelly erased. Stomping them underneath without a second thought just because they dared to expose themselves under his table!

"He will see me! He's got too! Mike is my friend - he's going to save me!"

Steeled once again, Bryan ran towards the shoe - intent on his rescue. The towering footwear remained still as he approached, only emitting audible groans and gritty crunches as the giant man's foot shifted inside.

Bryan quickly found himself nearing the looming rubber sole. He grimaced, noting every wear and tear of the previously white surface. It was coated in collections of dirt and dried mud that collected in every crevice and scrape. Predominately, a light green stain had been washed over the the lower half, coating the entire sole. This discolouration was a result of Mike's yard work, Bryan realized. It seemed each time Mike stomped through his yard, either to mow it or rend humongous weeds from the earth, were all evidenced on the sides of his shoes.

Deciding to not waste any more time, Bryan walked towards it, reaching. Suddenly, the shoe shifted again - dragging away from Bryan as it did and leaving behind collections of dirt. The tiny man jumped back, afraid for his life. The huge wall of stained rubber halted a few dozen feet away - nothing more than a couple inches to the oblivious owner.

A dark, smeared mass had been revealed pasted to the hard floor almost directly before the shrunken man. Bryan tore his awe-struck gaze to inspect it, but quickly retched back when he realized what it was. "An ant!" He gasped, clutching at his mouth daintily.

The unfortunate creature had been devolved into a chunky, obliterated smear by the careless giant's tread. Legs, antennae, guts, and exoskeleton all crushed with such force to almost render the tiny life unrecognizable.

Bryan cried out despite himself. He never liked bugs: especially ants. Yet, now he was reduced smaller than them and dropped into their terrifying world. He couldn't help but feel horrified - and sick to his stomach!

Backing away, he returned his judgment to the tremendous footwear towering above him. Before this, Bryan could never have thought of Mike as anything but he helpful, nice, and neighbourly guy that he was. Shivering slightly, Bryan felt as though this friendly guy had been transformed into a capricious titan that wrought nothing but death and destruction wherever he walked.

Loud noises caught the tiny man's attention, redirecting his gaze past the gigantic hightop sneaker and up the looming tower of denim that was Mike's leg.
131111.title: Approaching Mike...

choices: Bryan is stuck in the giant tread!
Bryan is barely alive...
1311111.content:
Still waiting for his order, Mike idly flipped through a laminated display set on his table.

Pausing on a few pages, but ultimately uninterested, his stomach wanted nothing more than the food he ordered. He replaced the display next to a bottle of ketchup and yawned. Just then, a single black ant revealed itself from hiding and began frenzied trek across the enormous tabletop.

Thoughts of his wife and child, along with food rolled through Mike's mind before suddenly evaporating when he caught sight of the tiny explorer. It continued, slowly from Mike's lofty perspective, but topping the charts of the local ant colony for speed before meeting up with a single crumb near the center of the table.

Mike smirked at it. Dumb, pesky creature, he mused. They always seemed to be crawling around where they shouldn't be. Lifting his hand, thumb poised out, he reduced the ant into a mixture of smeared body parts and crumb. The diner couldn't be blamed; after all, where ever food existed, so did tiny invaders. Mike frequently arbitrated his home and yard for them on a consistent basis.

Whether it was his own desire to be thorough, or just fate, Mike happened to lean over and gaze underneath the table.

"Hah, these little guys don't give up!" He smiled with clement judgement.

Like before, he moved his sneaker to deal with the stubborn invader. It utterly dwarfed the tiny black dot of a life, casting it into shadow before he slammed it down.

For Mike; that was it. A simple maneuver of his large foot and he was done. He had no reason to think anything else of what he had done. If the tiny creature had survived in the deep, aggressive waffle pattern of his sneakers, or if he even had a right to decide the insect's fate. To him it was nothing more than insignificant and unimportant.

Lately the man had started talking about a new project with huge potential. Maybe he had left for that. ‘I’ll just have to remember to ask him next time he comes in’ Corby thinks to himself. Deep in thought, Corby eats on auto-pilot. He is barely conscious of the bites of sandwich and fries he pops into his mouth.

He lifts the sandwich up and takes a large bite. A piece of lettuce, smeared with mayo hangs from his lips. Looking around the diner at the customers, Corby does what comes naturally, and sucks the lettuce between his lips.

‘This is a really good sandwich!’ he thinks to himself as he swallows the bite.

---

Bryan struggles in the thick sauce and darkness. He feels the movement every time Corby moves the sandwich or takes a massive bite. He has no sense of direction or even any way to tell if he is actually moving. Bryan tries calling for help, but his cries are muffled by the sauce and bread surrounding him

A nearer crunch lets light stream in and Bryan turns towards it. The lettuce beneath him moves forward taking him with it. Bryan sees a pair of lips grasping the lettuce and screams, frantically trying to avoid Corby’s mouth. His arms flail trying to find an anchor.
1312222.title: Big Bite

choices: Try something nearby
Get awayfrom the food, Corby's messy
13122221.content:
Bryan's arms graze the bread, however he gets no solid hold. Behind him Corby's lips move as he begins to chew the bite. Loud crunches sound as the lettuce shifts with the movement of Corby's jaw.

"Corby, no!" he screams in terror, trying to crawl backwards. Looking up he can see Corby's defined nose hovering above, his eyes however are focused elsewhere. Of course, why would he bother staring at his food. Just as Corby opens his mouth with a smack to suck the lettuce in, Bryan feels himself fall backwards. Yet again he is in free fall.

---

Corby swallows his bite. Suddenly he wishes he had a cell phone to distract himself, but he just didn't have the extra money for it. Daniel marches by with a tray of drinks. He pauses and looks at Corby "You're cleaning the table you're eating at!" he says seriously, before leaving to deliver the drinks.

Corby glances at the table to see some drops of ketchup and mayo, apparently from eating. He licks some extra sauce from his lips and gulps down the remains in his mouth.

'Whatever, I'll clean it when I'm done' he thinks with a shrug before dragging more cooling fries through ketchup.

---

Bryan lays on his back in a puddle of sauce. Towering over him is Corby's torso, cloaked in his work shirt. The underside of his jaw moves until he gulps down the bite in his mouth. A thundering voice seems to get Corby's attention before the giant glances downwards.

His gaze seems directed at Bryan who waves weakly. As if in response the giant licks his lips and swallows before returning to his meal. Bryan flinches as the crunch of the latest bite sounds from above. He had narrowly escaped being eaten by Corby, now he had to get his attention.
13122221.title: Tabletop

choices: Tommy stops to talk to his school friends
Bryan dashes out of hiding to try for Tommy's attention
131222212.content:
Dropped in a large pond-sized pool of sauce made from a blending of mayo and ketchup, the shrunken research scientist pushed his way toward the edge of the glob.

While in a perfect position to gain the handsome waiter's attention, Mr. Smith's fear of the massive, powerful youth caused him to balk at any strategy that might have brought attention to himself.

The brush with death by being devoured by the mammoth waiter left him shaken and not quick to trust in Corby's dubious mercies.

After all, the college-aged youth had just consumed Mr. Smith's meal, with no indication he felt remorseful.

"I've got to get away from this idiot!" Mr. Smith screamed to himself.

Suddenly, Corby pushed the wide tips of two cold fries into the drops he had let fall onto the otherwise clean tabletop. Mopping up the mess seemed preferable to having to wipe down the table.

As the tiny man saw the massive fries coming toward him, he pushed free and ran toward a silver and white tower on the edge of the horizon. Sparing a quick glance over his shoulder, he saw giant Corby swipe up the mayo/ketchup with the fries, popping them into his mouth. Chewing quickly, he swallowed and got to his feet as the unseen little man continued to run across the tabletop in the opposite direction.

As he got closer to the strange tower, he recognized it as a gleaming metal dispenser filled with white paper napkins. He ducked behind the tower, daring to gaze across the vast plain of the tabletop. Corby, feeling full by his stolen meal, rose to his feet and prepared to get back to work.

At that moment, three hungry teenagers from Tommy's high school entered the restaurant. They saw the empty table vacated by Corby. A few blots of ketchup didn't bother them. They just wanted the first available table.

Bryan froze in place in the shadow of the towering napkin dispenser. He gazed up at the epic trio of teenagers. The tallest youth had black skin, dark brown eyes and a strong, intimidating face. They all wore their school's blue and gold sports jerseys, which fit tightly over their muscular torsos.

The shortest youth looked Latino with a warm brown skin and black eyes. He wore a baseball cap on his head, which covered his hair.

The last teenager to take a seat at the table had light brown hair and green eyes. He was almost as tall as his black friend, but not quite as well built. Nevertheless, to the tiny, unseen scientist they each looked like colossal titans.

To make matters worse, he saw Tommy and his friends approaching the table, which meant they were leaving the restaurant. Tommy represented his best hope for rescue, but he could not remain in hiding and try to contact his gigantic neighbor.
131222212.title: Choosing to hide

choices: The giant flicks Bryan
The giant attempts to smash Bryan
1312222122.content:
"I need to end this nightmare! They have to recognize me!"

Without allowing any further thought, Bryan pushed himself off from the towering napkin dispenser and sped into view.

His desperate flight into the vastness of open table-top was slow. He cried out, turning his head to and fro and attempting to animate himself while still keeping his break-neck pace. It all seemed pointless as the enormous space around him seemed to swallow all his efforts up.

"HEEEEEEELP ME!" His throat began to feel hoarse and dry. "Look down! Help me, I am down here! Right in front of you!"

A thunderous concert of booming rumbles and thooming laughs responded. Bryan couldn't even understand the speech produced by the gigantic teenagers. Their huge lips would move and moments later the explosive thunder would follow. He felt as if he had intruded upon a meeting of gods.

High above loomed the ebony hand and wrist belonging to the tall, intimidating teen. It landed with the concussive force of a falling skyscraper and sent tremendous vibrations through the table. Bryan was flung off balance and onto his rear, flopping painfully against the hard surface.

Bryan's brain suddenly kicked into gear. Huge, thick fingers lifted at random before crashing back to the table with dull thuds. The rest of the dark skinned arm stretched over the immediate horizon like a mountain range. An enormous wrist watch of dull steel wrapped around the titanic hairy bulk that constantly shifted and flexed. He gulped nervously, but relented knowing this was his chance to get their attention.

Fate had different plans for the shrunken scientist.

"AN ANT? GROSS."

Bryan froze and dumbly gawked at the monumental face high above him.

The already intimidating teenager now looked downright terrifying. His thick brow was coated with a throng of dark, wiry hairs that gave him a powerful look. It moved like surface of a great mountain, knotting together with annoyance. Bryan whimpered, unable to contain himself as warm urine ran down his right leg.

"I.... am n-n-n-not an ant...!"

His argument went unheard, evidenced by the blank look of annoyance in the huge eyes. They bored down upon his tiny form, as if attempting to extinguish his pesky presence by just staring at him.

Bryan had never expected nor prepared for such an encounter. His formula was only meant to be used under safe and controlled conditions. He had absolutely no idea what to do.

"I am NOT an ant!" He yelled, this time with vigor.

Up until now, the titanic teenager had remained relatively still. Staring at the tiny man, and briefly turning his planetary head to make a thunderous remark. Bryan began to slowly approach the giant, hoping to make meaningful contact. He knew he had to act fast!

The dark-skinned titan had other plans. Bryan screamed when the once-resting hand suddenly lifted into the air and loomed overhead. He stared upwards, taking in the enormous palm and craning fingers. A lighter colour than the rest of the dark skin, the palm was wrinkled and creased like landscape seen from a plane. The fingers curled inwards, all except the index.

It shifted and seemed to position itself over the tiny man.
1312222122.title: Unprepared

13122222.content:
Miraculously Bryan grasps the bread and holds tight. Beneath him, the lettuce continues to slide forward. In the back of his mind Bryan registers some pleasure in being surrounded by all the sauce.

Just ahead, Corby chews up the bite and sucks the piece of lettuce between his lips. Bryan slips downwards through sauce before stopping in a melted slice of cheese. This gives him a perfect view of Corby's lips as he chews, occasionally parting with a smack and a flash of chewed food. They clench as he swallows the bite down. Corby uses his other hand to drag some fries through ketchup, still holding the sandwich in front of his face.

Bryan struggles to move as he has no choice but to watch Corby's massive tongue slither out of his mouth. Mounds of chewed fries, flakes of lettuce, and balls of soggy bread and meat are scattered across the tongue. They are mere remnants of the mountains of food that Corby is easily devouring. A glance upwards confirms that Corby is unaware of the destruction just inside his mouth as his eyes focus elsewhere. As the fries disappear into his mouth and he begins to chew, Bryan tries shouting and waving once more. In spite of his great intellect, no feasible ideas come to mind.

Bryan forces himself to look away as he tries to think of a way out. The sounds of chewing wash over him as he searches fruitlessly for an escape plan. A loud gulp permeates his thoughts, returning Bryan's attention to Corby's massive lips.

His mouth yawns open, again revealing the shifted piles of chewed food spread across the tongue. Light streams in, reflecting off strands of saliva between jagged molars and a swaying uvula over the darkness of the throat. Corby inhales as he goes in for the bite, the sharp sound of a gale stinging Bryan's tiny ears.

As the sandwich enters the cavern, he is finally hit with the stench and humidity inside the giant's mouth. For Bryan this was literally the end game; for Corby it was a single bite in a relaxing but forgettable meal.

---

Corby sinks his teeth through the sandwich, another satisfying crunch sounding across the table. Unaware of his minuscule customer trapped in his mouth, Corby begins to chew. Crunch after crunch fill his ears, making the sandwich more satisfying. Bryan's screams of terror as he is thrown about randomly go completely unheard by Corby. Occasionally the mouth opens to illuminate flying, soggy bits of food and glimpses of sharp teeth, deepening Bryan’s terror.

With hardly any thought, Corby moves the lump of food to the back of his mouth. Bryan attempts to fight but it is no use as with a simple gulp, Bryan is forced down Corby's throat with the food. Corby, utterly oblivious and dismissive to the workings of his digestive tract, begins to think about his school projects as Bryan enters the stomach with a splat.

Corby easily downs the rest of the sandwich and fries, each bite quickly forgotten as it’s gulped down. Soon a mountain of food forms in his stomach. While continuing to scream for help, Bryan attempts to scale it. With no way to know of the struggle inside his toned torso, Corby lifts the glass of soda to his mouth and drains it. As the last gulp of soda disappears down his throat, Corby doesn’t feel the mountain of food in his stomach leveled by the incoming waterfall.

Bryan struggles with anger and disappointment that his genius discovery had led him to the inside of a handsome young man's gut. When Corby returns to work, his movement causes wave after wave to stir the food violently.

Later while taking an order, Corby's stomach groans as acid begins to flood his stomach. Unaware of the shouts of terror echoing around the mounds of food in his gut, Corby smiles and mutters "excuse me.”
13122222.title: Anchored

choices: Bryan enters the kitchen
Something happens
Somebody sees him
1313.content:
Bryan wrung his sweating hands together, apprehensive about his decision.

"This is bad," The now shrunken scientist scolded. "Oh dear, this is REALLY bad!"

Needless to say, the familiar interior of the diner looked vastly different from such a teeny perspective. A seemingly endless terrain of white and brown tiles stretched around him. The floor hadn't been swept that day, as apparent by the boulder sized crumbs and debris covering the floor. Other marks on the floor, likely invisible to the normal eye, looked positively unpleasant to his tiny eyes. One in particular seemed to move. Where Corby's monster-sized footwear previously stood, Bryan was able to discern the half-flattened body of an ant.

"Damn, that bug is bigger than me!"

Gazing at the unfortunate ant, his eyes threatened to tear up. Not for the suffering insect, but for himself and his dangerous situation. The ant twitched violently, thrusting its head back and forth and trying to move whatever mangled limbs were still attached.

Trying to remain calm, the tiny genius returned to formulating a plan. He knew that he above all needed somebody's help.

"Corby. I just need to find him and get his attention. I can count on him!" The slim hope brought a much needed smile to his lips.

Stepping free from the shaded sanctuary offered by his table, Bryan stuck close where the booth met the floor. He scanned the patrons, looking for any sign of Corby. Among them was a few people seated on the bar stools, as well as many occupying booths like Bryan's. His longing gaze went from Tommy and his friends, drifting to some police men that were seated three booths down. The two cops would surely give him the assistance he needed, yet all the same, the thought of them inquiring or possibly reporting Bryan to EDL Labs made him think against it.

Suddenly, with his long strides, appeared Corby from around the counter. His arms laden with many dirty plates, his eyes anywhere but the ground. Bryan sprinted, waving his arms and leaping.

His diminutive motions went unnoticed. Corby continued by, his long feet thudding heavily and covering vast distances with each step. Twisting around, he shoved through a tall door that swung noisily shut behind him. Bryan felt dejected. He barely covered what would translate to a foot of space trying to catch up to the gigantic waiter. The busy waiter was always moving and never halted for more than a moment.

"I need to get to the kitchen!"

The floor remained clear: all patrons were seated, and only one other waiter was present. He would be forced to cover a great distance of open tile. On this side of the diner, only Bryan's booth and a few bar stools were available. Besides a young couple seated at the counter, there would be no other obstacles. Bryan nodded and set coarse, speeding clumsily around large crumbs and clods of dirt.

He neared the door quickly. It loomed high against the wall, stained from many hands and spills throughout the years.

Entering the final stretch, Bryan....
1313.title: Searching for Corby

choices: Bryan suddenly shrinks!
Bryan goes into the store to begin his shopping
Bryan decides to go to another establishment first
132.content:
Bryan scowled as he locked up his home and shuffled to his car. This set-back likely meant many days of shuttered solitude as he deciphered the conundrum that halted his entire plan. He needed to restock his fridge, as he had purposely emptied it in preparation.

His thoughts proved to be focused on anything but the road as he drove, nearly passing a stop sign and then screeching to a halt when an elderly woman suddenly crossed the street. She shouted ornery cries of anger at him while he sped away, barely bothering to grumble in response. Around the next turn, Bryan caught sight of his destination, ""Samson's Super Market."

The tall steel sign alone spoke volumes of the establishments age. Built in the 1960s, when Bryan had been a child, the market boasted to be the "largest stop for your modern grocery convenience". It remained largely unchanged since then, almost to the point of disrepair. Cracked asphalt, weathered paint, and even the shopping carts looked to be at least three decades old. The interior was a similar story, albeit cleaner and with somewhat updated fittings.

Tired, groggy, and on-edge, Bryan parked his car, avoiding stray shopping carts and roughly bumping over an uneven slab of asphalt. His vision blurred a bit when he stepped out of the car.

"Coffee, I'll need plenty of coffee..." He noted with a scratch to his head. His head was swimming.
132.title: The Supermarket

choices: Find someplace to hide!
Bryan runs out into the open asphalt
Bryan runs to a group of enormous shopping carts
1321.content:
Bryan yelped, narrowly avoiding a bee as it buzzed near him.

He rested his hand over his heart, as if to steady the beat. Flying or crawling, insects terrified him. His whole body suddenly shuddered, and dizziness swept over him again. He was rubbing his head, leaning against his car when a voice called out.

"Good morning!" A deep, youthful voice greeted. Bryan looked up to see a teenaged supermarket employee pass by. He wore the usual uniform garb; tan shorts, black button-up work shirt, and black sneakers. The older scientist just stared, slightly smiling as he watched.

Bryan's failure to reply went unnoticed to the young employee, who strode up to collect abandoned carts. Despite his ill feeling, Bryan couldn't help but leer, something he often did when grocery shopping since the store employed many of the town's high school and college age guys. He had previously hoped Tommy would get a part time job here, effectively completing his menagerie of youthful eye candy.

His peering was suddenly interrupted when a sharp sensation took hold of him. Bryan sank to the ground, hidden from sight by his car, and felt breathless as the realization hit him.

"This... Shrinking... I'm shrinking!" His moan barely escaping his lips. "Dear God... No... This can't be-..."

Suddenly, as if a light switch had been flicked off then on, Bryan landed with a thump on the warm asphalt. The sensation left almost instantly, returning his body back to normal. Yet, as the scientist rose, all was not normal.

"Shit... I've shrunken!" Bryan cried.

His whole body went numb. Goose pimples coated his body at the thought of his predicament. His formula had obviously had a delayed effect--a very delayed effect! Bryan whimpered, taking in his terrific surroundings. Surprisingly flat, yet covered in ragged boulder larger than him, stretched seemingly endless miles of asphalt. It looked as if he has been transported centuries into a future decimated by lava and boiling heat. It was a complete wasteland.

"Holy hell!" Yelled the diminutive scientist as he took in the enormous shape looming above, before, and around him. "My... My... My car! It is fucking massive!"

The sight was impossibly huge, taking up nearly all of the sky. He rubbed his eyes again and again trying to comprehend the sheer size of his once compact-sized sedan.

Bryan began to panic. His formula had been purposely developed to shrink a human being to a size smaller than a grain of rice. This in itself was a fantastic and marvelous discovery, yet only when used in a controlled environment. This was anything but a "controlled" environment. "I need to find help!"

He looked around, hearing a roaring buzz that sounded like a 747 taking flight. A ship-sized bumble bee roared overhead, soaring higher and higher till it vanished from sight. Shortly after, the ground began to shudder. The vibrations became catastrophically violent, sending tiny Bryan to his knees. Boulders of asphalt, each larger than himself shifted and rocked as a thunderous sound filled the air.

"Fuck!" An enormous vehicle, far larger than his own exploded by, moving at a dizzying pace despite its impossible size. "Fuck, fuck, fuck!"

He huddled in terror until the ground seemed to settle. Only minor vibrations disturbing it, telling of many more monstrous vehicles far away.

"I have to get out of here! Oh god, somebody help!" He turned, looking for a destination and trying to formulate a plan.
1321.title: The parking lot

choices: He shrinks in the produce section
He shrinks in one of the isles
Something completely unexpected!
1322.content:
Padding along, Bryan only felt a light sensation of lightheadedness coupled with minor churns of his stomach.

"Must have been something I ate..." Muttering under his breath, barely thinking of his own condition. Instead, his mind clung to thoughts of his failed formula. Never had it fizzled like this. He stepped over the curb and headed through the threshold of sliding glass doors, passing into the market's cool interior. "....Perhaps I miscalculated one of the chemicals, or maybe boiled it too long..."

Bryan nearly bumped into a pile of boxes, barely halting himself before collision. They were thoughtfully stacked only a few feet before the doors. He frowned at them. They were definitely out of place, he noted and looked around.

Other customers walked by, unfazed by the boxes, while a crew of workers were grouped on the other end of the store. It appeared the place was enjoying some major remodeling. The far right side of the building was cleared of most displays and dotted with large machines. Bryan eyed one, looking it over and glancing at the man who approached it. With a thunderous roar of motor, it burst into life and began sluggish animation directed by the worker who pushed it. Customers idly continued their shopping despite this, passing the dust-coated workers with both carts and baskets.

"Figures they would be redoing the damn floors right now. Ugh, gives me a headache!" Bryan complained.

Rubbing his temple, but too sickly to care, Bryan headed towards an isle in preparation to shop.
1322.title: The Grocery Store

choices: Bryan enters the coffee shop
Bryan suddenly shrinks on the sidewalk
Bryan sees somebody he knows
1323.content:
Bryan recovered from his bout of dizziness, resting his hand lightly upon his forehead.

"Ugh!" He groaned.

Before him lay his destination: the supermarket. His strangely groggy mind and overall sickly demeanor made grocery shopping the last thing he wanted to do.

"Christ, I need to grab some caffeine first before I collapse..."

His bleary gaze drifted from the stone and glass facade of the market to the other establishments that lined the same shopping centre. An ice cream shop, various fast foods, gift and sport stores, and lastly, the single coffee shop that occupied the space. The coffee served in the cafe was nothing to write home about, but would serve in a pinch

Bryan glanced around, eyeing one of the teenaged grocery market employees that pushed a line of abandoned shopping carts across the asphalt. The boy returned his look with one of confused curiosity, causing Bryan to redden and hurry across the parking lot. Among an array of signs, a cartoonish cat glancing knowingly at a steaming "cup o' coffee" adorned the coffee shop's sign . Only a few customers sat inside the building, chatting or staring blankly at their phones, while others walked in and out with cups in-hand.

A young man sat next to a planter sunken into the cement next to the cafe. He busily preformed a drum solo on a make-shift set of drums, long hair swishing over his face and a plastic lid of money sat near him. He was shirtless, displaying an impressive physique that drew an idle inspection from the passing scientist. The racket produced by his performance was a clangorous mess of noise that somehow remained rhythmic despite itself.

Bryan passed quickly, preferring to avoid any charity, and hurried to the door.
1323.title: First things first

choices: Bryan approaches the humongous street drummer
Bryan decides to find his own way
13232.content:
Bryan rubbed his temple softly and groaned.

"What the hell....?" His vision blurred once more, halting his procession towards the shop. Nearby a bench sat nestled against the coffee shop, offering a respite for the weary man.

Moving towards it, Bryan began to note a strange tingling sensation running through his body. Unable to make it to the bench, he pressed against a stone column with a grunt. "W-w-hat....? This feels... -it can't be!"

Yet it was unmistakable - he was shrinking! The sensation was familiar enough to the brilliant man, who developed the formula and tested it on himself many times. This - unfortunately - was no test, and Bryan felt terrified.

He attempted to pull himself away from the supporting column, yet his flimsy muscles failed him. A muttled croak was all he could muster before everything abruptly went black.

A falling sensation. Then painful impact and Bryan bolted back into consciousness. His head felt as if it had become calcified and his whole body tingled still.

THOOM. BOOM. THOOM.

"Nuhhh... Gah." He rubbed his face. Breath seemed to come sparingly, but with each intake it became easier. "God almighty, what the fuck?"

Throbbing sensations seemed to reverberate not only through his body, but the ground itself. He stood up, without thinking he reached for the nearby column for support and met only empty air. "Damn!" Bryan stumbled but managed to regain his balance. "What is going on...?"

Then it became clear to him. Looking around, Bryan rubbed his eyes and felt himself trembling - not from weariness, but fear. He had shrunk! It had seemed almost like a dream, but here Bryan stood; incredibly tiny and vulnerable. Examining his surroundings, he took in the enormous sight of the cement column he leaned against before. Now it stretched high above and looked more like an alien construction from another world. Around him spanned dizzying lengths of concrete landscape. Large chunks of gravel were strewn about, ranging from vehicle size to larger. Tiny black shapes seemed to move through the boulders, yet they were indiscernible at this distance.

He had never been reduced anywhere but his own home before. The safe, controlled environment of his clean suburban home. "This is anything but that..." Bryan gulped.

Beneath him, the ground began to tremble - almost rhythmically. BOOM. THOOM. THOOM. BOOM. It was the same sensation he felt earlier, yet now it was clearly not in his head.

Turning, Bryan looked over a mass expanse of concrete wasteland to view the source. His mouth only hung open in response to the identification. The leering scientist had noticed the young man before. He was seated before a set of make-shift "drums" - which appeared to be nothing but overturned plastic buckets - and had a small plate set out for money. A classic musician, who looked the part with his long hair, unshaven chin, and shirtless torso.

Now, the tiny man viewed the young street drummer in a completely new light. The formula shrank the imbiber to a measly height: barely a centimeter in size!

"He's fucking gigantic!" Bryan thought aloud.

The gigantic street drummer was much more than "gigantic" now. His movements appeared sluggish and extremely powerful. Each time the drum stick met one of the overturned containers, a shuddering vibration traveled through the ground and a dull explosion thundered. Sweat jostled loose with each movement, falling from his muscled arms and chest. The giant man was nothing short of god-like.

Bryan shook himself from his stupor and returned to the situation at-hand. "I can't stand here gawking! I've shrunken out in the open without any antidote... I need to get help pronto!" Voicing his plight aloud made it seem all the more frightening.

Here he was: shrunken miles away from his home! Bryan had never intended to be in this type of situation. He had no plans or measures to rescue himself with.

He needed help!
13232.title: A new perspective

choices: Make for his car
Hide in one of the other establishments
13233.content:
Bryan slumped his thin body against a thick column of brick and cement that supported the coffee shop's exterior.

He ignored the sensation of dirt and other particles transferring onto his clothing. Everything seemed to swirl still: his vision blurring and resisting any attempts to focus while his brain seemed bent on turning his muscles to gelatin.

As he rested, customers of the establishment passed him on their way in and out. Some were completely ignorant of the sweat-soaked man, while others looked him over and covertly whispered to their fellows. Bryan ignored all this and finally settled himself onto a wooden bench set near the column. Sitting seemed to help somewhat, giving him use of his regular sight and senses.

Immediately, Bryan noticed the familiar mane of slicked white hair that belonged to none other than his boss, Dr. Thompson.

"Oh, what are the fucking odds?" He rasped, peering with bloodshot eyes across the parking lot. Dr. Thompson closed the door to his sleek Volkswagen and directed himself towards the busy cafe. "Shit! He can't see me... I am supposed to be on vacation!"

His body seemed to have stabilized, allowing Bryan to awkwardly slide from the bench and behind the brick column for cover. Bryan patted sweat from his forehead, nerves wracked by both his boss and the concerning condition bothering himself. By all means, Bryan knew he needed to head back home, but risking contact with Dr. Thompson was far worse.

Checking the older gentlemen's progress, Bryan frowned. Thompson had paused at the curb, bending over with a look of pain twisting his already lined face. He seemed to be uselessly pawing at the ground in search for something.

"His glasses..."

Dr. Thompson was nearing the ripe age of 70 - a fact he would elaborate with anyone foolish enough to inquire. Without his dated, and frankly silly looking spectacles - the man was more blind than a Soul-singing bat.

This was his chance! Bryan could stride away from this awful predicament without his boss ever knowing.

He debated his choices: attempt to return to his car - a path that would take him directly past Dr. Thompson - or, he could hide-out in one of the many other establishments nearby.

Bryan decided to...
13233.title: Bad timing

choices: Bryan enters the pizzeria and shrinks
Bryan enters the thrift store and shrinks
132332.content:
The adjoining shopping center contained a menagerie of other businesses.

Closest was the pizza parlour, "Stronghold Sam's Pizzeria". Bryan frequented the place far less than he used to. After realizing the convenience and choice company at the local diner; the tacky, loosely medieval-themed pizzeria seemed lacking.

He glanced at the sign thoughtfully. The cartoon image of Stronghold Sam in his steel armour seemed to beckon him over with a four-fingered wave and a toothy grin.

Grimacing, Bryan looked past the pizza parlour. A second option stood in the form of a sizable establishment. Big blue letters proclaimed the title of "THRIFT CENTER" over a set of sliding doors and windows. Bryan had frequented the place many times in search of equipment he could scrounge for his at-home laboratory.

Dr. Thompson would never enter such a place, of that he was certain.

Remembering his predicament, Bryan checked on Thompson's position. He cursed, learning that the old man had found his glasses and was in the process of dusting them off meticulously.

Bryan had to act fast, or risk being discovered by the aging, yet perceptive, old scientist.
132332.title: Hideaway!

choices: Bryan wakes immediately
Bryan is rudely woken
1323321.content:
Speeding his pace, Bryan glanced at his destination: the Stronghold Sam's Pizzeria.

It seemed like every step was a trifle. Bryan felt absolutely prostrate as he rounded a cement planter, nearly stumbled off the curb, and kept his feet from tripping each other.

Finally, he faced the thick wooden door. It sported a dark, worn finish and an ornate wrought-iron handle. Bryan grabbed it and let his weight push the swinging door open. It squeaked shut behind him, proclaiming his arrival with a canned "ding-dong!". Immediately, the scent of warm cheese, stale bread, and mildew overtook his senses. The establishment remained as he left it many months ago: dingy, outdated, and cheap.

He also felt a slight better. It was strange, but he ignored it and merely sighed.

"I can just wait in here till Dr. Thompson leaves," He said. "Just a half hour, at least."

The elderly scientist would likely retrieve his spectacles and continue with his quest for coffee. It usually took him that long just to purchase the drink before returning to the laboratory.

"Unless..." Bryan immediately felt his body ripple with goose pimples. What if Dr. Thompson had seen him? He was a perceptive old coot. Or... Worse. What if his boss was here in search of Bryan? "Oh God..."

His hands trembled at the thought and his face ran white. Bryan stumbled on, keeping his eyes on the scuffed maroon and tan linoleum as he did.

Suddenly, he jolted at the sound of a voice.

"Hey there, welcome to Stronghold Sam's!"

Bryan turned his head to view the employee who stood behind the counter. A stocky guy wearing a Stronghold Sam's shirt stood next to the register and grinned at him. Still weary and bit confused, Bryan merely nodded and passed by the counter. His mind lightly peppering him with memories as to why he used to frequent the place.

He angled towards one of the tables, but paused. The sensations began returning; but this time, something else... It felt familiar.

Bryan turned himself away from the table and headed in the direction of the restrooms. It would do him a world of good to wash his face off. With each step, the odd rippling grew stronger, as if his muscles were attempting to act on their own. He was passing the arcade games, bothered by their sharp melodies, when it struck him.

"No!"

The exclamation sounded more like a hoarse croak. Bryan failed to notice this loss of volume. His only thoughts sped back and forth in his mind; he was shrinking!

As if the realization was the trigger, Bryan immediately felt the floor wretch from beneath him.

He fell for a moment, then his body hit the ground and his head with it.
1323321.title: Shrinking at the pizzeria

choices: Dr. Thompson
A handsome, yet unknown teenager
13233212.content: "HEY!", a voice booms from above Bryan, "WAKE UP!" Bryan feels groggy. The surface he is lying on is definitely not the cold tile floor of the pizzeria. He's lying on something warm, soft, and very lumpy and irregularly shaped. He slowly opens his eyes, drained from his shrinkage. As he looks around at his surroundings he realizes he's sitting up in a giant palm. "OH GOOD, YOU'RE UP." Bryan suddenly looks upward at the titanic face above him. He realizes that it is...
13233212.title: Bryan is rudely woken

choices: Bryan escapes into a dangerous world
Bryan escapes into EDL Labs
132332121.content:
Bryan's shock threatens to overpower him. His vision fades in and out. Light to darkness.

"What...? No, no.... Dr. Thompson... I can..." His superior's gigantic face seemed to warp and stretch. His vision darkened again.

Then Bryan passed into unconsciousness one more.

---

Plucking his spectacles from the ground and replacing them upon his nose, Dr. Thompson dusted himself off.

Bryan Smith, his employee, quasi-assistant, and trusted associate, was his target. He had been suspicious of the wiry man for many weeks now. Notably, after Mr. Smith had responded to a simple remark about missing chemicals and equipment with a sputtering excuse before exiting the room. This instantly set off finely tuned alarms in his aged brain. He knew something was not right.

After reviewing the missing supplies, as well as tracking Bryan's habits; he had come to a fairly good conclusion.

"He must be pursuing that ridiculous pipe dream of his... To shrink himself!" The old scientist had explained to his superiors weeks ago. "Many times he has brought the idea to me: asking for advice and even assistance! I, of course, put him in his place!"

EDL Labs had requested that he investigate further. Equipment had been the first to vanish: measuring cups, glass tubes, and even a pricey burner. Then, the chemicals began to disappear. Small amounts at first, but then more noticeable quantities. Dr. Thompson would not let this wretched behavior continue!

Glancing back to the coffee shop, he saw no sign of his frantic target. Grumbling, the hawk-eyed scientist scanned the shops; halting his eyes upon one in particular. He noticed Bryan bump against the large door and shove through it.

"Not as quick as you think you are, eh!"

With a swooping motion, Dr. Thompson quickly hobbled in pursuit. He licked his thin lips and clucked haughtily. It would be a pleasure to apprehend Bryan Smith!

He reached for the imitation iron handle, but quickly paused. "Ick! How filthy!" Using his handkerchief for protection, he proceeded through the door and into the establishment.

Repulsive smells and tacky music assaulted his keen senses almost immediately.

"Stronghold Sam's", as it was duly called, was in fact everything it seemed to be. Trashy, unclean, and filled with the unsophisticated slobs that were naturally drawn to holes such as this. Walking carefully, he impatiently scanned the interior while wringing his knobby hands. Near the back of the large space, Bryan Smith could be seen shambling away. As Dr. Thompson pursued, the thieving man vanished behind into the "arcade".

His joints complained of such an excursion. Never one to back down, the scientist followed and rounded the corner just in time to witness an extraordinary event.

"By the Gods...!"

If he had not seen it with his own eyes, he would have called hogwash. Yet, he saw it; Bryan Smith had quite literally lurched from the ground and reduced in size. It happened in only a matter of seconds.

Quickly wiping his stupefied expression, Dr. Thompson glanced around for other watchful eyes. None.

Nodding, he knew what to do. A small plastic cup sat empty on the control console of a flashing machine, left behind by some careless individual. This repugnant behaviour worked in his favour. The cup would make a perfect holding cell for Bryan Smith!

Keeping it ready, he approached the spot where Bryan had been reduced. As it was, Dr. Thompson had no idea if the remarkable reaction left the user disoriented due to such quick reduction in scale, or if the user could acclimate quickly without side-effects. He scanned the floor. Grimacing at spots of dried gum and sticky stains. A black shape moved, slowly but a consistent pace moving away from him. Gasping, the old man crouched down and prepared to snatch the shrunken Mr. Smith.

"What is this? Just an ant!" He fumed. Then his eyes drifted to another shape that seemed to twitch. "...By Jove! There he is... Tinier than even the common ant!"

Not one to dilly dally, he reached into his pocket and produced a pair of tweezers. It, along with a set of other tools, was something the elderly genius had carried since his youth. Using them, he plucked the shrunken man off the ground. Bryan Smith appeared to be unconscious, limply hanging from the metal tool that far out-sized him. This only made Dr Thompson sneer. This discovery may have been ill-gotten, but it was nothing short of impossible. A gold mine, in fact!

He placed Bryan into his palm. "Wake up, Mr. Smith!" He noticed movement from the tiny shape. "Oh, good. You're up! We're going on a little trip..."

With that, he deposited the impossibly tiny human into the cup and swiftly exited the establishment.

---

Bryan woke with a scream. He thrashed as if held by strong hands, moving back and forth violently. Coming to, he steadied himself and looked around.

"Oh, no!"

It wasn't a dream! He had shrunken and been found by his snooping boss! "This is not good... What do I do?" He felt tears scorch their way down his cheeks while looking at his surroundings.

All around him, forming a complete circle, loomed tall frosted walls. Plastic, they appeared to be, and coated in dried drops of liquid that far out-sized him. Bryan screamed. A flat surface with large print and images formed a makeshift ceiling. Yelling for mercy and begging to be released. He didn't know quite what was happening.

"He'll probably take me to be charged for theft! I'll be thrown into prison!" Another thought shoved to the front of his mind. "Or... They'll experiment on me at EDL Labs! Interrogate me, until I tell them the formula..."

Bryan gasped girlishly, clutching his mouth. He couldn't let that happen; no matter which it happened to be! There had to be another way!

A hefty jolt shook his world and threw him over. Clutching his head, he cried and prepared for the worst. Nothing happened. The slight swaying and rumbles continued again. Bryan sigh and looked ahead. His eyes widened and he released a gasp.

Directly ahead of him, not more than 12 feet, was a gaping crack in the cheap plastic. He could easily fit through!

"Thank you!" Bryan screamed to the printed sky above.

Not wasting another second, he dashed forward and prepared to leap...
132332121.title: Dr. Thompson

choices: To the floor of Andre Franklin's office
To the floor of the hallway
1323321212.content:
The tiny man passed through the split in his prison with a barely audible whoosh. He suddenly found himself spiraling into nothingness before colliding with a cliffside of wiry fabric.

Grabbing onto it, Bryan held on for dear life as the strange mountainside lurched violently. Wind rushed past, buffeting his miniscule body as if he were bracing against a hurricane. A loud crash echoed from below. Bryan followed the noise, peering downwards and screaming as he saw the cause.

An enormous leather shoe stood far below, farther than Bryan could properly figure as he stared wide-eyed with realization. Another quaking crash alerted him and he spotted another shoe in the distance.

"Oh no... Oh, God, oh man! I'm on Dr. Thompson's pant leg!" The giant mass lurched again as the huge shoe lifted for another step below. "This is NOT good!"

His voice was instantly sucked into oblivion by tidal winds that crashed against the moving leg. Another huge crash and the shoe landed far below. Bryan looked up, spotting the prison he had escape from being held in the gigantic hand of his elderly boss. The tiny crack in the plastic was barely visible, probably how Dr. Thompson failed to notice it.

The cliffside of tweed fabric jolted violently, causing Bryan to scream as his grip lessened. He slid downwards, screaming for but a moment before he regained his hold.

"Please! Dr. Thompson... Help me!" Bryan cried.

Regardless of his punishment, he didn't want to meet his end falling to his death from the pant leg of his irksome boss! Any plea proved futile as the gigantic Dr. Thompson continued, utterly unaware that his prisoner had escaped.

All motions halted suddenly, leaving the shrunken scientist a moment to breath and gather his bearings. He looked out, trying to spot where the old man was taking him. Up ahead, at the end of a cavernous hallway stood a door that Bryan recognized. It was an EDL labs door - that he immediately knew - but, the name on it struck him.

Bryan mouthed the distant letters printed in bold black upon the metal door. "Andre Franklin, Security Chief!" His immediate reaction was that of terror. Dr. Thompson - the cruel fucker - planned on immediately turning him in! To the shoot-first-ask-questions-later security chief, no less! In his hysteria, Bryan snapped out of it when he heard his boss speak.

"WELL, WELL! I TOLD YOU, YOU WOULD GET YOURS SOMEDAY, MR. SMITH!" The oblivious old man thundered towards the empty cup he held. "TIME FOR A RECKONING!"

All Bryan could do was roll his eyes. The wrinkled geezer sounded like some B-movie villain for godssakes. Without warning, Dr. Thompson resumed his walking and Bryan shrieked as the crease he held onto shifted, threatening to throw him off like the insect he was.

"No, no, no!" He pealed, jolting with every step the giant took. Perhaps staying in the cup was preferable! "Eeeeeeeek!"

It was no use, Bryan felt his grip jerk free and he fell...
1323321212.title: Botched escape

choices: Explore his immediate vicinity
Venture out and look for help
132332122.content:
Bryan panicked. He was staring into the positively colossal face of an unknown giant, held in a massive palm thousands of feet in the air.

"HEY! WAKE UP LITTLE MAN!"

The tidal force of air whipped against his tiny, naked form. Bryan whimpered, trying vainly to cover himself. He turned red with humiliation, while his body trembled in terror. He looked at his giant captor with trepidation.

Then he gasped. If he wasn't mistaken... He was being held by Tommy!
