Bryan blinked. The planet-sized face seemed to change again - this time morphing into Corby - a waiter at the local diner. "What the hell?"

Suddenly, and rudely, Bryan lurched out of his dream. He was coated in a sheen of clammy sweat and his body convulsed slightly. Slowly, Bryan calmed himself and tried to figure out his situation.

"I've shrunk!" He squeaked. It sounded as if his voice had gone up several decibels, even to himself.

Fortunately, his nightmare remained just that. Bryan found himself laying on an expanse of faded linoleum, surrounded by bits of dirt and dust. He still felt shock and anxious, but nothing compared to the reality of that dream!

"Oh, God! I've shrunken in the damn pizza place! Fuck!"

Distant drone of barely recognizable music filled the massive amount of space around him. Beyond many hundreds of acres worth of filthy floor loomed humongous arcade machines. All of them larger than anything Bryan had ever seen. He craned his neck, gawking at the nearest one: Street Fighter II. It was beyond imagination in both scale and design. Transforming from a regular, dated video game into something straight out of a Sci-Fi novel.

Stepping backwards without thinking, Bryan suddenly bumped against something. Cold, hard, metallic, and freaking huge. He yipped and spun around to face it. A thick wall of worn, ridged metal. It was almost thicker than he was tall.

Gulping, he climbed it and realized what it was. "A nickel...! A giant piece of change!"

Sliding off, Bryan began to finally realize his predicament.

Unlike all his past shrinking experiments, all preformed in the safety of his home, this was frightening. He felt the familiar sensation of wonder and amazement, but along with it an overpowering dose of terror. This was far from a controlled and safe environment. The helpless genius had no back-up plan, nor any method of rescuing himself!

Here he was tinier than a grain of rice, afraid, and completely at a loss. What could he do?
132332122.title: Nightmare to reality

choices: Bryan shrinks smaller than a bug!
Bryan shrinks... and transforms!
1323322.content:
Bryan sped across the parking lot, nearly tripping over the curb as he hurried through the sliding doors.

Shifting his gaze back and forth, Bryan quickly took in the thrift store environment. Huge halogen lamps hung between metal rafters that spanned above, casting a mellow light. Rows of white shelves packed with donated products lined the entirety of his left, while over a dozen racks hung with clothes populated his right. He never liked to admit, but he frequented the place often enough that he knew his way around.

"Long time, no see Bryan! How's it going?" Greeted a young employee who pushed a cart laden with used goods. It clunked and squeaked to a halt over the scratched, pitted cement floor that once sported a coat of salmon paint.

Bryan froze. His body felt clammy and his stomach was churning itself into knotts. This feeling, he feared, was associated with the shrinking formula.

Continuing his pace, he grimaced. "Doing...just fine, thank you...." He glanced at the name tag hanging around the young fellow's neck. "...Mike"

Mike nodded coolly and grinned in response while Bryan quickly headed towards some less populated isles. He stopped under a sign hanging above that read, "Electronics", and sighed. With the slow and nosey Dr. Thompson still trundling around outside, Bryan was all but trapped!

"Oh, God..." He groaned. "What is happening...?"

Suddenly, his symptoms intensified. Now he was certain: he was shrinking!

With a gasp and a weak yelp, Bryan attempted to push off from the shelf and flee to his car. He couldn't allow himself to shrink in such an uncontrolled environment, even if that meant confronting his boss.

Before he could even land one step, his entire world lurched...
1323322.title: Thrifty Shopper

choices: Mike sees a heap of clothes dropped on the floor
Dr. Thompson sees something tiny
13233221.content:
Bryan Smith balled his hands into fists in an attempt to defy the shrinking process, as if he could cling to his normal size.

It was no use. Suddenly, he saw the room swell rapidly, and an enormous heap of fabric collapsed on top of him as he felt himself falling until he smacked into the hard surface of a faded salmon floor.

This was the worst possible scenario. He had shrunk, back down to bug size, in an uncontrolled environment. He had no ability to influence anything about the situation. Finding himself naked and tiny, he did his best to quickly escape from beneath the heap of clothes he had been wearing only seconds ago.

He wishes he hadn't emerged when an enormous black leather shoe stomps down only inches from him. Terrified, he looks up and sees his colossal boss. Dr. Thompson looks like a terrifying, mobile skyscraper. The befuddled old man has his glasses off again, cleaning them yet again.

He might be old, and he might not be that quick, but he almost squished one of his most brilliant research scientists beneath his shoe!

In fright, bug-sized Bryan Smith screams and flees in the opposite direction from the shoes of his boss.

That also proves to be a mistake when Mike wanders over to ask if he can be of any assistance.

For a moment, the tiny scientist imagines the question is directed at him, and not Dr. Thompson.

"Mike! Down here!" On the…. ohmygod! Watch out!" Bryan sees an enormous sneaker raised in the air. His eyes practically memorize the tread as it comes down toward the floor. "No! Don't step on me!"

The stomp comes nowhere close to Bryan's position, but that is two close calls, which is two too many in his opinion.
13233221.title: Bryan shrinks smaller than a bug!

choices: Mike goes to toss the clothing in with the donations
Mike drops the clothing off at the check-out counter
132332211.content:
With the same cool demeanor as always, Mike wandered over to greet an elderly man that seemed rather frazzled. This type of customer, he figured, either meant one of two things: the guy was on something - a drug or some shit; or, he was another one of the rest home's lost sheep.

"Hello sir, anything I can help you find?" Mike had begun, looking at the aged individual who would most certainly be cast for a mad scientist role.

Mike's friendly service sparked an annoyed twitch as the old guy looked him over. "What? No! I don't need anything or any help from this...place!" He said while righting a pair of horn-rimmed glasses. The expression of calm never left the employee's friendly face as he nodded and mentally confirmed this guy's number. Another fucker from the rest home. Any task was better than this, prompting Mike to leave when his shoe stepped down on something soft.

A zagging pattern of dust and dirt was left by his sneaker on the white button shirt. Unnoticed to him was a pale speck that scampered over the white fabric having barely avoided his careless step. Annoyed at the mess, but not surprised, Mike leaned and grabbed the discarded clothing listlessly feeling a pointed tap on his shoulder as he stood.

"Young man, I may just need your asinine help after all," The elderly asshole started with old-fashioned eloquence. "Did you see a man enter this establishment not five minutes past? A rather...thin and strange looking person?"

Never missing a beat, Mike let not a hint of annoyance show on his face. He grinned a half-smile and responded coolly. "Sir, we get a lot of people like that. Gonna have to be more specific."

Mike continued his friendly grin as Dr. Thompson's face twisted into a display of furious wrinkles. He flared his nostrils, looking the young employee up and down. His casual clothes: t-shirt, shorts, cap, long socks, and filthy footwear were displays of flagrant delinquency. A skateboarding malefactor, Dr. Thompson surmised. Lazy and impertinent, wasting his precious time!

"Nix, nay, nada...!" The wrinkled scientist blurted. Thoroughly annoyed, he wanted to leave this filthy establishment. He straightened his glasses, glared once more, then about-faced and hurried away grumbling, but not before finishing with a final "Nertz!" directed at Mike.

Balled up clothes under one arm, Mike watched the old man pass through the sliding doors before shrugging.

"What a fucking dick!"
132332211.title: Elderly customer

choices: Bryan is lucky!
Bryan is not so lucky!
132332212.content:
Sniffling and righting his glasses, Dr. Thompson gave the young employee a hard look.

"Did you see a man enter this establishment not five minutes past?" He asked rather impatiently, but with a methodical edge. "...a rather thin and strange looking person?"

A pair of horn-rimmed glasses rested on his wrinkled face, looking larger than needed and continually sliding down the bridge of his nose.The elderly man seemed to ignore this and continued glaring at the young man.

If the attitude irked Mike, he did not show it, but per usual just gave a half grin and responded cooly.

"Sir, we get a bunch of people like that..." Flat and easy, Mike never missed a beat. He idly scratched his neck and adjusted his hat in the process. "Gonna have to be more specific."

Dr. Thompson's face seemed to harden. He gave Mike an inspecting look, flaring his nostrils. Both the employee's appearance and demeanor spoke volumes of his intellect, the old scientist deemed. Asking such an impertinent and likely lazy youth was a waste of his valuable time!

Unaware of such harsh judgment, Mike thoughtlessly reached down and straightened the tube sock covering his left leg. Dr. Thompson frowned and sighed loudly.

"Nix! Nay! Nada!" He began turning away. Thoroughly annoyed, he wanted to leave this deplorable establishment. Bryan Smith would escape for now, it seemed, but not for long!

Steadying his glasses with one hand, the aged, yet perceptive old scientist caught sight of something on the floor. "...Dear Lord!"

One hearing this in-passing might be led to believe a great discovery was just found, but this was not the case.

"An insect! A filthy, dreadful insect!"

Mike immediately followed the knobby finger pointing downwards, his eyes passing over the fallen clothing and spotting the offender. A single tiny speck. Not black, but a pinkish colour, and so tiny it was difficult to see.

Stepping back, Dr. Thompson clucked and sniffed in disgust. Had he been younger - and less indignant - then he may have realized this "insect" was in fact the subject of his search. Before entering, he had already judged the cleanliness of the building to be inferior. Now - he had his proof!

"It's just a lil' ant... no worries!" Mike said as he looked up at the ornery old man.

Lifting his nearest foot, he stepped down over the bug's location without hesitation. He didn't even bother to grind his shoe, since it was so tiny. With his other foot, Mike swept the clothes into a pile against the shelf and looked back to the offended customer calmly. "See? No problem. They get in here occasionally, but nothing to worry about." Truthfully, the store was home to many an insect and spider. All varieties being brought in by accident with each donation.

Mike's effort was for naught, as the man merely responded with a curt sound.

"Ick!"

Then vanished around the shelf and shuffled out the sliding doors, shaking his wrinkled head and muttering.

"Shit... What a dick!"

Grabbing the clothes, Mike looked at the old man - still visible through the glass doors - and shrugged..

---

Muddled and loud, their enormous conversation was nothing but thunder to the shrunken man.

"HEEEEEEEEELP!"

Bryan wailed, hopping and waving his arms.

"Down hereeee! Help meee!"

His clothes made a tumultuous mountain to his side, large hills and dales created from simple folds in the fallen fabric. Bryan would have given more thought to their remarkable appearance if he did not have other sights to behold.

With heavy thuds, Dr. Thompson moved backwards. The usually frail and uninteresting old man now looked positively remarkable. His huge leather dress shoes lifted and pounded at random, each time causing Bryan to jolt with fear. He was now afraid more than ever of his boss, not of the man's usual threats and remarks, but of his intense size.

Bryan sped away from his clothing. His hope that the more he distanced himself, the better chance he had of being noticed.

Truthfully, Bryan felt frightened to be discovered - by his boss, Dr. Thompson no less. Yet, he knew that his situation was dire and above all, he wanted to be rescued. He passed by an enormous strip of fabric created by the cuff of his shirt. The material sloped to form a cascading knoll of thick, wiry cords. It was difficult to imagine all of it together was nothing more than his familiar white shirt he wore almost daily.

His feet padded against he rough concrete and his voice rang high. "Look! Look! It's me! Bryyyyyan Smiiiiith!"

Suddenly the ground lurched with a tremendous crash. Bryan was thrown to the ground, allowing him a front row view of the new danger.

"Holy fuck...!" Other words seemed to escape his genius brain, reducing the shrunken man to wordless gapes.

Mike's humongous sneaker rested far ahead, pressed firmly against the ground as it supported the giant's tremendous weight. Seemingly far enough that two football fields could almost fit, Bryan could see every single scrape, scuff, scratch, and particle of grime. It easily outmatched Dr. Thompson's worn shoes, both in size and power.

Bryan had many occasion to talk and "spy" upon the young employee. He had surmised that Mike was somewhere in his twenties, gave off a gruff, yet carefree attitude, and stood tall and lean. The scent of smoke also permeated the air around him, which Bryan cattily remarked about often.

Now the scent only made him uneasy and nervous. Mike positively loomed - high enough that his massive face was barely visible. His tanned leg towered from the mountain of stained white rubber and worn black suede followed by a white sock that coated the tremendous calf.

Booming tones echoed from the giant's mouth; impossible for the bug-sized man to understand. An enormous hand reached down, gripping the thick cotton and blindly pulling it. The sock was adamant, and immediately creased again once the huge digits left.

Bryan sprang up, breaking from his descriptive trance and began screaming.

"Pleeeeeeeease.... See meee!"

He felt tears begin to moisten his cheeks, slurring his pleas. It was more than pointless! Tiny as a grain of salt; an ant would have better luck being heard.

"...DEAR LORD!" Came the thunderous reply from his now titanic boss.

Bryan jumped. The words emitted so far had been difficult to understand, but such an exclamation from the astute Dr. Thompson was clear. He had been seen! Bryan immediately agreed; Thank the Lord!

Instead of being plucked from the dangerous floor, Bryan realized he was only being pointed at - and rather accusingly to boot!

"Heeey!" Bryan waved hopefully, slightly unsure.

Then more thunder followed from the elderly giant's mouth. Bryan felt both his heart sink and his muscles tense. "A what? Did he just say ins...-" He was rudely cut off by a slight tremble, followed a booming response by the giant employee.

Clenching his tiny fists, Bryan glared up at his boss. He had been denoted as a mere bug! Inhaling, he prepared to right this heinous wrong until a mere second later he was interrupted by a low sticky squelch from behind. Darkness followed shortly and Bryan realized his danger.

Looking up, Bryan emitted his explanation as a wordless scream.

Lacking the foresight of any common bug, Bryan had inadvertently blundered in the path of the thrift store's arbiter: Mike. All he could see was the colossal underside of the titanic employee's shoe. The tan tread was heavily worn from everyday use; the zig zag tread was packed with dark dirt, grime, various pebbles, and the torn pieces of a price tag, stained and jammed into the huge tread. Bits and chunks crumbled off and tumbled to the ground. Bryan shivered as he noticed the distinct remains of a mangled spider in the deep tread next to a large logo that read, "VOX". Only a few legs remained with the smeared carapace; the rest having been obliterated by the giant's oblivious step.

He couldn't even run, his disbelief and fear were so great. Bryan merely stared up at the grimy surface above and continued to scream.

THOOOOOOOM...

Time caught up and his world went black as the sole descended.
132332212.title: Ick! A filthy bug!

choices: As the crow flies - down the isle!
Investigate his surroundings and formulate a plan
1323322121.content:
It felt as if he had been buried alive. Intense pressure forced itself upon him from all directions, pressing both air and hope from the bug-sized man.

Bryan couldn't even scream. His face was pressed mercilessly into unforgiving cold concrete. On his backside, what felt like dirt and sharp gravel attempted to absorb his body. He tried to thrash, but even the slightest movement was impossible.

Dull, deep groaning was audible from above. It sounded as if some huge monster was shifting as it searched the tiny man out. Another heavy creak followed shortly and Bryan felt his entire world move, grinding him against the ground slightly. Unable to open his eyes to even see, he could only smell and taste.

Dirt. Slimy dirt... and... Rubber.

All Bryan could focus on was the terror. He didn't want to die. Most of all, he didn't want to die from being crushed to death - or worse, suffocated!

Painful tears began to seep into the lines of his squished face, irritating numerous fresh scrapes and cuts.

Just when he felt he could take no more, Bryan heard another deep, dull groaning. Cruel shifting followed, and he was briefly twisted against the ground before the pressure began to increase. It was brief, but painful, before suddenly letting off with a loud, sticky noise as the huge rubber surface lifted off the cement.

Light flooded in, Bryan's eyes shot open and he emitted a scream. He realized he was being lifted off the ground; watching the rough, painted cement move below him.

Then he crumbled free and fell towards it.

"Aaaaaiiiieeeee!" Contact was painful, but even so his body screamed relief from the immense pressure.

Flipping himself over and Bryan gasped.

Any cries were caught in his throat. The worn and filthy tan tread of Mike's sneaker raised off the ground, looming above. Bits of grime and grit falling free from the aggressive zig-zag patterns, like chunks of ice crumbling off a glacier. Bryan felt vertigo in his spine, thinking about his close call only moments ago. It seemed to move slowly, almost barely at all. The rubber sole easily spanned four or five football fields of mass, each indentation and ridge deep enough to fit Bryan, while the lugs of tread could easily crush him.

Bryan stared like a frightened deer, looking over the immense surface and still imagining himself caught underneath. His tiny body smashed into the dirt and grime Mike picked up around the store during the day

High above, Mike continued his step, utterly and completely oblivious to the torment beneath his shoe.

BOOM.

It sailed on. Making contact with the floor and sending an explosive shockwave through it. Now looking at the heel of the tremendous footwear, Bryan felt dumbfounded. With just one step, the sneaker covered miles of ground with little effort. Presented on the faded white rubber heel, the footwear's logo stood out in heavily worn letters.

Sound from his right startled him and Bryan realized his mountain of clothing had somehow been removed. In its place stood the huge sneaker's equally enormous mate. Just as worn and dingy, it sported a dusty black lace that hung loosely and cascaded to the floor. The simple string was far larger than any train and draped a hundred feet from the metallic eyelet high above.

Bryan stared at it blankly; both afraid and thoughtful. His mind was concocting a rough plan of scaling the untied lace and getting Mike's attention. Before he could act on it, his chance was taken.

The giant's monolithic legs shifted and sluggishly leaned down. Two hands that could easily demolish many city blocks appeared along with thick fingers that easily snatched the errant shoe laces. Bryan watched with awe-struck amazement. Every movement was a display of sheer power and magnitude that it left the bug-sized man stunned.

Bryan snapped out of it and jolted himself upright and began screaming. He wasn't so stunned as to let this opportunity fail him!

"Miiiiiiike!" Each step caused pain. Blood trickled from superficial wounds on his naked body.

The behemoth sales associate's face was now visible. Mike's huge eyes were dull and bored as they concentrated on the laces of his large sneaker. A massive dark bill from the hat he always wore shadowed the young man's face. His expression nothing more than ordinary despite such cosmic proportions.

"Down here! Pleeeeeeeeeease! Miiike!"

With a shocking motion, the giant hands pulled with impossible strength and tightened the frayed laces into a clumsy knot. Unable to appreciate Bryan's predicament, Mike merely blinked and stood up again.

Emitting the same grimy squelch, Bryan watched the huge sneaker lift off the floor. The sole was packed with similar collections of dirt and organic matter - all completely inconsequential to Mike.

BOOM.

Bryan stood and watched the giant employee depart. Each step sending duller vibrations than the last. The humongous titan lumbered around the corner, leaving tiny Bryan a lonely speck upon the cement floor.

Despite his need for rescue, Bryan felt a flush of relief that the now gigantic Mike had left. The towering guy would have smeared the shrunken scientist into paste like a common insect - for all intents and purposes, he nearly did just that. Bryan would have been another nameless, forgotten victim, and his fate would never be discovered. After all, who wastes time studying a bug before stomping it?

These thoughts made him shiver. Bryan felt very exposed suddenly, standing out in the open floor where he nearly met his end. Worst of all; he was stark naked!

He decided to first find safe ground and continue his reflecting later. To his advantage, the store seemed rather slow today. Usually, there would be a decent stream of customers milling about in search for treasures, while the establishment's employees patrolled each isle periodically. Bryan was spared any of these as he jogged towards the nearest shelf.

It took nearly ten minutes, but he arrived at the base of the looming metal shelves. Collections of donated electronics loomed on the immediate surface above, thick cords hanging down occasionally. On the ground level with Bryan, collections of dust, dirt, and discarded scraps of rubbish were heaped against the wall. He cringed to see what looked like cobwebs coating an area to his left. An enormous rubberband lay before him, carelessly dropped by a customer as they greedily pulled it off a wrapped cord. The massive rubber strip was easily quadruple his height and emitted a strong, unpleasant smell.

"God...! This place is so filthy, I never noticed!"

From a normal perspective, all this rubbish would be nearly unnoticeable. Just bits of dust and dirt that normally lined the underside of any store.

Bryan heard nearby tones of thunder and turned his attention down the vast stretch of isle. A customer loomed, paused with an item in-hand as they questioned the towering form of Mike. The words were indiscernible, but whatever Mike said seemed to satisfy the customer's inquiry. The gigantic employee grinned, nodded then turned away with pounding steps and stomped out of view.

Releasing a sigh, Bryan calmed himself.

He needed some form of action or plan. If even Dr. Thompson would mistake him for a bug (that heartless bastard!), then Bryan knew anyone else would probably not even regard his diminutive existence.

Without warning, an ant scampered past knocking him over. While Bryan shrieked, the busy insect kept moving without hesitation as it journeyed along the base of the shelving. Bryan merely picked himself up and huffed. "I've just been knocked aside by a bug! This is humiliating...!" As he spoke, he trembled. Knowing just how under-sized he was even in comparison to a lowly ant.

Looking around, Bryan considered his options.
1323322121.title: A lonely speck

choices: Try to contact this giant
No way! Hide and wait
13233221211.content:
Staring with a spaced expression, the now bug-sized genius looked across a wilderness of filthy cement. The ant he met moments ago scampered on, keeping itself near the protective shadow cast by the continental shelving.

"Hmph! You hive-minded bastard!" He called after it.

Now it was his turn to find a destination. He had been here many times, and by all means should be able to figure out a decent place for rescue. "I don't even look like an ant! Just gotta get somebody to realize that." It was then Bryan, becoming lost in thought, was forced back to his shrunken reality when the ground began shaking.

He didn't have to wait long until a man appeared around one of the shelves. Bryan had trouble associating this stranger as a mere "man". Like his previous encounter, Bryan found this man; this being - who was many, MANY, thousands of times his tiny size, to resemble something far greater than just a mere human. He was simply to fucking huge to even be anything but a god.

But, he was just a normal guy. Wearing a regular baseball cap with some NFL logo, a typical shirt, grey cargo shorts, and thoroughly normal white DC sneakers. A regular guy, by all accounts. Bryan couldn't help but gawk at the towering mountain of a man - watching as he lumbered around the shelving, each sneaker lifting off the grainy floor before crashing down again with a powerful thud.

Suddenly, the giant opened his mouth, turning his gaze to a young five or six year old that giddily pawed at the items on the shelf. "...CAREFUL, HONEY. LET'S GO FIND THE TOYS."

It was like understanding the rolling of thunder or the explosive boom of a volcano. A behemoth force so much greater than himself, that he felt struck dumb by the sensation of understanding such words.

The titanic child roared in agreement and pounded off towards the promise of toys. Still looming above the worldspace of littered cement, the gigantic man's strong features were twisted into a warm smile as he watched after his excited child. Looking from his tattered footwear, past thick legs forested with tangles of dark hair, higher than a continental shelf-sized torso, to his planetary face crowned with a green-and-black hat. His godly gaze never wavering downwards.

Frozen with doe-eyed awe, Bryan stared. All he could think was how the frilly fuck was he supposed to get a shred of attention from this guy? Should he even try?
13233221211.title: Giant customer

choices: Bryan tries to get David's attention
Another giant approaches
13233221212.content:
Rifting cracks larger than most vehicles were spread across the ground at random. Other imperfections dotted the immense landscape, including large patches devoid of paint, hard patches of dried grim, and varying craters left behind when the cement was poured. Some were deep enough that Bryan could easily rollerskate, or even fill with water to create a large pool.

Dispersed among this vast landscape were pieces of grit, dirt, and unidentifiable crumbs. Bryan could see other large objects laying in the distance - the closest he identified as a forlorn price tag.

"Wow..." Bryan commented as he walked. "I never knew it was this filthy!"

He nudged a strange twig laying at his feet. Curious, he crouched and picked it up for closer inspection. "Yuck! It's a leg!" Throwing it with disgust, Bryan realized the entire mass of "gunk" plastered against the floor was a smeared insect.

"Ugh!" He groaned. Wiping his hands in revulsion, he backed away and tried to occupy his mind. "I need to...figure something out," Looking around gave him many options of destination. The area seemed quiet besides the occasional buzzing insect, or distant giants idly shopping. Thrift store employees also popped into view, stomping across an aisle and vanishing from sight. All so far away it was difficult to discern their identities - which Bryan was thankful for. He wanted to be prepared next time.

"I just need to be seen for who I am. Dr. Thompson fucked everything up last time, that ornery bastard!"

Towering over him like an enormous canopy, Bryan continued his plotting under the relative safety offered by the shelf. He might be able to journey around the store and locate somebody he trusted. After all, if he could help it, Bryan did not wish to throw himself in to the arms (or in his case, palm) of the first stranger to discover him. A fine plan in theory, but Bryan knew the vast downside of it.

Trekking through the gargantuan thrift store at a size barely comparable to a grain of salt was nothing short of foolhardy. Sitting with arms clutching his legs, Bryan huffed. It would take hours of herculean travel to even make it to the check-out counters. Not to mention the added danger of careless customers or employees - all to absorbed in their own world to care about the one at their feet.

He shuddered slightly, remembering his encounter with the gigantic store employee, Mike. "...It wasn't his fault... He didn't know..." This statement only made him more uncomfortable. If Mike - a friendly, reasonable, helpful person - didn't recognize him, then who would?

Feeling frightened, the tiny man noticed movement out in the grimy wasteland of cement floor. Two black shapes crept from a crater in the floor, many meters away, but close enough to be identified as mere ants. Except these "mere ants" were now the size of SUVs and just as powerful.

Bryan watched them. Despite his distaste for the insect world, he felt interested in their minute activities.

Another crept from behind, climbing up from the same crater to join his fellows. "Huh. They must hide in those to keep safe from nearby people," Bryan noted, amused. "Clever little troopers!"

Despite their almost endearing curiosity, Bryan knew to keep his distance. The common bug was now considerably higher on the food chain than himself. Tiny, soft, and pink; Bryan was no match for the armoured ants. They would make short work of him, being but a bare mouthful for their potentially massive nest. One of them approached a jagged, brown object easily three times its size and attempted to lift it. Not a moment later, one of the other ants offered assistance and the two of them lifted the crumb off the ground.

Bryan felt as if he should clap. It was an impressive feat, by any standards. They were gross to him, but rather remarkable in their adaptability. "If only I could be so versatile!" He said, and at the same time detecting an audible disturbance in the distance.

Not a second later, Bryan felt the ground tremble. Then again and again, increasing in strength.

He complained dumbly, about to stand up when the floor before him - ants and all - was shrouded in darkness.

Then, like the felling of a great monument, landed something so large that Bryan was thrown to the ground. Grime and debris was sent careening wildly by the displaced air caused by the deafening crash. Bryan looked on in frozen awe of the megalith of gray and yellow sneaker looming where the ants had been.

From the bright yellow rubber sole to the mass of gray and back suede, he stared in shock. Across the sheer mountain of gray suede upper stretched a large black line of suede curving around to create a familiar logo even at such magnified levels. Higher up, a worn tag the size of a billboard was stitched that read "VANS" in stained, yellow font. Just like before, Bryan was stunned. It was huge; fucking bigger than he could imagine. Like an entire mountain designed to be worn by a faceless god.

The shoe suddenly shifted, creaking dully. With grimy appeal, it lifted from the ground. The thick, yellow sole sounding as if it was peeling itself off the dirty floor.

Bryan didn't even notice the two missing ants, or even the lone survivor, who lay in a mess of half-crushed carapace and legs. The tiny man watched the huge sneaker's flight. As it soared forward, taking but a simple step, but covering a tremendous distance. Bryan's gaze was not only of stupefied awe, but in disbelief. He recognized the giant!

He steadied himself when the ground jolted again, stiffening from the thunderous crash landing. The mega-sized island of a sneaker came to a rest, slightly farther away, but now facing the shelf Bryan was hiding under.

"I...It..." Bryan babbled, gazing at the titan who began sluggishly crouching. The giant's face lowering into focus; a face Bryan knew from many meetings and conversations. "...David! Holy fucking shit!"

With that same friendly expression upon his now colossal face, David was barely recognizable. He wore the same baseball hat, covering his reddish-brown hair, and shading a face framed by a thick beard covering only his jaw. Ever since Bryan had grabbed a small radio, garnering David's attention, he had always been willing to shoot the breeze whenever they met. He was a bit younger than Bryan. Already divorced, and die-hard baseball fan - of which Bryan feigned interest.

Now, he simply appeared otherworldly. David was a tall, stocky man by normal standards, but now by Bryan's comparison he was completely god-like. An arm, bigger than a bridge, hovered high above as it supported an equally ginormous hand that held an object of interest for the gigantic owner. From below, Bryan watched the huge hand deposit the item back onto the shelf with an audible crash. Suddenly, without warning, David stood back up.

"Oh, no! I'm down here... me, Bryan Smith!" Bryan squealed, leaping into motion as he flailed forward without thinking. "Heeeelp me!"

Cursing himself for wasting the opportunity of David's crouch, Bryan vowed not to fail completely.
13233221212.title: Thrift Store Buddy

choices: Bryan climbs the cord
Bryan is unable to climb the cord
132332212121.content:
The giant's simple motion of standing up again nearly caused tiny Bryan to collapse. He was so huge that Bryan was overcome with vertigo just watching him move. Unwilling to give up, Bryan ran straight for David's shoe.

Like before, it loomed bigger and larger until the brightly coloured rubber sole was towering many dozens of feet.

"Down hereeee! Saaaaave meee!"

Bryan ignored his squeaky voice, and raced ahead. He reached the sheer wall of bright yellow rubber and flung himself against it. Thumping and racking his thin arms against the hard surface. Never would the now tiny man have imagined himself beating upon his thrift store buddie's sneaker. Bryan had only briefly noticed David's large foot size - what he presumed to be a size thirteen and a half - and the man's eclectic taste in athletic footwear. Now, all he could see was a vast wall of yellow rubber that only made up the sole of the huge skate shoe.

Gouges covered the textured surface. Some were smeared with deposits of dark dirt or mud, others packed with various gunk. They were relatively new as far as David was concerned. Higher up, above the toe-cap, large frayed cords jutted forth among frays of dark suede fabric.

The air was thick with permeating smells of rubber and harsh sweat. Bryan tried to forage on, knowing if only he could get attention, David would rescue him. Yet, the creeping realization of what happened to the ants moments before struck him. The reduced scientist was nothing more than a mere speck; unnoticeable and insignificant.

David shifted his other foot, slamming it heavily as he turned. Only then did Bryan realize his foolishness. "No! Waaait! NOOOO!" Completely detatched from a world so tiny; so far beneath him, David took a step forward.

Bryan stumbled back as the huge mountain of rubber creaked and shifted. Then the air was filled with a horrific sound as the deep, grimy treads pulled away from the dirty floor.

The tiny man about-faced and ran. He devolved into high pitched shrieks, feeling the harrowing sensation of something huge soar overhead. It was familiar to Bryan - yet this time, he was merely an observer caught in the front lines of a behemoth's gait. He felt like time had slowed to a crawl, as if fate wanted him to take in all he could from his tiny perspective.

Above, the entire skyline became overtaken with the mass plane of deep, tread. Bryan watched it pass overhead, moving as if in slow motion, yet far faster than he ran. Each cell of the waffle-tread was big enough to house the bug-sized man. Each one another display of unknown grotesqueness. Dirt filled most of them, picked up from all over during the day; huge boulder-sized pebbles of whitish brown colour were jammed at random. Bryan watched as an entire section of the tread passed over, coated in a dark, sticky blotch of gum with bits of crumbs and debris pasted in it. Only when he noticed the twitching remains of two ants crammed into the thick waffle lugs, did he stumble and fall roughly to the ground.

Looking up, he identified one of the ants as a segmented mess across the gap between two lugs, and the other ant still barely alive as it dangled helplessly from a chunk of grime. As fast as they came into view, they were gone as the sneaker soared overhead. Bryan screeched when a hunk of dirt dislodged and crashed nearby. Large as the pond in the local park was the enormous sneaker logo in yellow and white against the dark tan waffle tread.

The huge letters were twice his size, situated into a skateboard design. Bryan mouthed them silently. "VANS 'OFF THE WALL'." The he gasped. Pressed in-between the letters of "Wall" were broken chunks of shell once belonging to a snail. David had unknowingly obliterated it when he left home this morning, reducing the tiny life inside into paste and only leaving bits of shell wedged between his treads.

Only moments had passed, but what felt like a lifetime for Bryan and suddenly the heel passed above. The sole came to an end, freeing tiny Bryan as it flew ahead, utterly uninterested in his tiny life.

Crash landing far ahead, the ground shuddered in response. With similar drama, David carelessly lifted his other foot in-turn, never glancing nor thinking about anything that ended up underneath. Bryan watched from increasing distance as the sneaker he toured lifted and slammed down; taking the giant farther away.

Strangely enough, as Bryan pulled himself up, he felt himself change. He could still see his massive friend, looming far off , but something had happened. Bryan no longer saw him as David - no, he now saw him for what he truly was; at least at this size. A humongous force of unstoppable, uncaring, and immeasurable power. An entity that was incapable of caring for anything so tiny as an insect, and in extension: Bryan.

And, all he was doing was shopping. Never even knew I was here.

"No... No. Fuck, no..." Bryan shook himself. "They can't help it. They're just too damn big - but, they will help me..."

Still, even as he verbally convinced himself, Bryan shuddered. Twice now he had almost ended up like a common bug. And, both times he had survived. He couldn't be sure if it was luck or not. Sighing, the coast was clear once again. He wasn't going to wait around like an idiot.

David's near disastrous visit had caused one benefit. Bryan looked right at it, dangling not but a couple hundred feet away. It hung from the shelf above, like a train teetering off of the precipice of a cliff, and coiled against the rough ground. A simple electrical cord by any means, but a way up for tiny Bryan!

Using the cord, Bryan could scale the shelf and find shelter among the city of appliances, radios, speakers, and amplifiers. With any luck, he would be near face-to-face with anyone else examining items from the shelf. Instead of scuttling around the store, Bryan could leisurely await rescue upon the shelf.

Bryan grinned. He felt as if his first stroke of actual luck had come. This option seemed much safer, not to mention a needed respite, but mostly to keep himself from the dangerous floor.

Jogging forward, Bryan aimed for the dangling cord...
132332212121.title: Overstepped

choices: Bryan was only a head short of a gnat!
Bryan had completely changed into a gnat!
13233222.content:
With a painful smack, Bryan's face collided with the hard ground. His balance had been upended when the ground seemed to literally vanish from beneath him.

He had shrunken before; many times before, in fact. Not one of them had felt like this. Painful sensations jetted from his fingertips to his toes. Bryan tried to curl into a fetal position, but his body denied him even such a small pleasure. It seemed as if he was... changing!

The pain seemed to change into tingling sensations. Rippling over his skin as it went from pale and soft, into something harder and grotesque. Next was his basic shape: that began to bend and twist into something inhuman. Bryan shrieked. A scream that would rival the loudest aria, yet even as he did, it too changed.

Then the convulsions ceased and he fell limp. It seemed to subside so quickly, Bryan wondered if he had experienced some kind of seizure. Pulling himself up, he realized what had happened.

He had both shrunken and changed...
13233222.title: Transforming!

choices: "Help" comes stomping his way
Bryan tries to master the art of flight
132332221.content:
Everything was wrong! Skittering about on six legs instead of two, he panicked.

"What in God's name!" His voice sounded airy and shrill, as if he was squealing through the spinning blades of a fan. "What happened!"

He attempted to paw at his face, only to find all six of his legs jerk and send him to the ground. It was unbelievable. Somehow - some way - he had transformed! Righting himself once more, he carefully scuttled forward. The feeling of so many limbs was nothing but alien to him and downright confusing.

"Fuck... Fuck, fuck, fuck..."

Bryan then tore his concentration from his new shape to gaze at his surroundings.

"...FUCK!"

Around him, going for miles upon miles, spanned a landscape of cement. At this level, the coat of salmon paint was all he could see, occasionally interrupted by deep craters and gouges in the worn cement. In the distance, shelves of tremendous altitude towered up into the seemingly endless sky. With his new shape, Bryan had trouble craning his gaze to see the tops.

He felt panic wash over him. Never had he shrunken anywhere but his home. NEVER. The idea of such an excursion was not only terrifying, but idiotic! Reducing himself to such a minuscule size was never to be done anywhere but controlled environments. Bryan shot his had back and forth, taking in the huge and frightening vistas.

In his panic, he suddenly felt something flitter upon his backside, causing him to yelp in surprise.

He paused, thoughtfully and this time consciously controlled the sensation. Movement once again brushed his back and Bryan gasped. "Wings!" Turning his head, he caught sight of them: Glossy, thin, and coated in translucent veins - they were fucking wings! Only then did he realize what he had become. "I'm some kind of bug..."

Unknown to Bryan, the very formula he had consumed had been inadvertently tainted by a blundering gnat. The confused insect had been drawn to the liquid by the sweetness Bryan imbued it for taste. Landing on the thick mixture, the helpless gnat was caught and slowly absorbed.

Continuing to ruffle his wings, Bryan began to feel slightly elated. This strange, and otherwise frightening side-effect was fascinating. It felt as if he had been transformed via magical spell. This would surely be worth many volumes of notes and observations once he... Oh no!

His face went pale and he swore his blood ran cold. He was trapped at this filthy thrift store, tiny as can be and without antidote!

"I need help!"
132332221.title: Unexpected side-effect...

choices: Bryan flies around
Bryan looks for help
1323322212.content:
Gazing upwards presented a whole world of open airspace already populated with buzzing gnats and flies.

Bryan focused upon one fly that swept low, soaring overhead with noisy wings, and whipped back high again. He shivered, but felt elated just watching. "Well, he makes it look so damn easy! If I could fly like that, rescuing myself would be a cake-walk." Returning attention to himself, he focused upon the muscles that controlled his wings.

They fluttered slightly. His back tingled lightly, and with a sigh, he tried again. This time the wings buzzed into life, as if powered by something other than himself.

"Whoop! Yes!" He squealed. "Holy Christ... I-I'm...flying!"

Lifting many feet off the rough ground, he whipped forward clumsily. Quicker than he thought, he hurled back to the gritty floor with a hard crash. Bryan slid many feet, bumping against a large crumb before stopping with not an ounce of grace.

He bit his lip, determined. "Again!"

Symphonic roar of buzzing wings buffeted his backside and the half gnat, half man glided into glorious flight.

"Whooooooopeeee!"

Finding it difficult to keep himself level, he went forward, able to slow his pace by dulling the beat of his wings. The wind blasted past his face and legs, feeling like he was sky-diving from a plane instead of simply flying mere feet in the magnified isle of a thrift store. Bryan pealed once again. His mind awhirl with the possibilities of his situation. Other fliers passed him; from behind, below, above, and both sides. The gnats ranged from his own size to larger, while the bulky and ornery flies being quite larger - some bigger than most trucks!

Higher and higher, almost level with the second tier of shelving he glanced down at the floor below. It was already many hundreds of feet down - and he was barely three feet above the ground to the normal viewer. He zipped past a huge cord that dangled from the shelf, marveling at how it no longer appeared mundane but larger than a city street.

"This is freaking amazing," Bryan said. "But, I need to focus and find help!"
1323322212.title: The Art of Flight

choices: Try to get the giant employee's attention
More obstacles arrive
13233222122.content:
To the regular viewer, nothing but a pale dot buzzed giddily through the air. To Bryan, he was a experiencing the world from not only a different perspective, but in a completely new way.

Giggling, he zipped along an expanse of cluttered electronics. All of which were now of comparable size to most city skyscrapers. He was able to almost see himself reflecting from the face of a humongous digital clock. "Hah! It looks like the freaking Sears Tower!" He yelled despite the air pummeling his face.

Pausing his flight, the tiny man-turned-gnat hovered thoughtfully. "I should find help!" He buzzed. "All this frolicking can wait till I am out of danger!"

Aiming himself, Bryan prepared to pass around the huge shelf. His tiny position remained only three shelves above the floor, easily over a thousand feet high. The shelf continued much higher, looming above his current view. Looping with increasing skill, he passed underneath a cord that hung over the ledge, dangling a couple hundred feet in length. Another larger insect flew past him, barely whipping into the mess of huge donations as if to escape.

"Goddamn bugs are so rude, I swear!"

Stilling flying, Bryan had his attention abruptly directed when an enormous moving mountain passed around the corner. He screamed a note of shrill, terrified buzz, looking at the approaching titan who headed straight for him.

"Wait... Aaarccccghhhck!" His protesting shrieks were immediately absorbed by the seemingly limitless wall of approaching fabric. Looming before him, splashed across the huge cotton surface like a landmass in the ocean, was a towering logo in graphic letters.

Bryan buzzed with ferocity and attempted to avoid the oblivious titan's path. The giant quickly passed, continuing his path utterly unaware of the danger he posed. For Bryan, in the form of a tiny gnat, it was like trying to avoid a meteor of continental size.

He dived out of the titan's path only to be suddenly met with tremendous hurricane winds. "Aaaaaieeeeeeeeee!" Caught in a nasty gale, Bryan was sent careening and barely normalizing himself in time to land upon the shelf. From there, the tiny gnat-man watched the careless giant stomp away. More importantly, his gaze noticed something else about the huge man; he wore a thrift store vest!

"Who is it?" He wondered, skittering towards the edge. "Not, uhm, whats-his-name...Mike! No..."

Acting, for all intents and purposes, like a curious gnat, Bryan watched the massive employee come to a shuddering halt before a shelf. Crouching down, he began inspecting the shelf full of cups and stemmed glasses while tiny Bryan watched from afar. He recognized the giant's short, slicked hair; as well as the athletic shorts he wore. But, like many times before, the name escaped him. For his brilliant mind, Bryan had an awful time remembering the names of people he met.

Not really caring about names, he prepared to leap into flight. It seemed help had found him - however inadvertently! "He'll help me - no problem!"
13233222122.title: Help finds Bryan

132332222.content:
Everything was wrong. Bryan could barely keep a coherent thought, much less a complete one.

"Wwwhaaaaa izzz haaappeeehhnnninnnng?" He squealed.

The world around him was even more confusing. Gigantic surroundings of such immense size were only magnified by a strange filter of crystalline quality. Bryan skittered around, confused and frightened. Each thought seemed to become shorter and more primal.

What went wrong, what is happening? He tried to cry out again, but only produced shrill, unintelligible buzzing.

His next thought came out jumbled. Without him realizing, Bryan's once brilliant mind was slowly degenerating into something simple and primal. If he had been given a chance, the unfortunate man might have identified it as animal instinct.

"Nooooooooo...."

This cry was the last noise he made that barely resembled human speech. With that, Bryan Smith effectively turned off and in his place the mind of a simple gnat took over.

---

Glancing down, Mike frowned at a fallen bag laying in the middle of the isle he was in. He thoughtlessly grabbed it and returned it to the shelf already laden with other donated bags and backpacks.

It was a common enough occurrence - finding dropped and forlorn merchandise just laying on the ground. Customers apparently never felt inclined to treat the thrift store with any respect. Mike merely turned away and resumed his idle patrolling, passing around a corner shelf and into the electronic isle.

Immediately his trained gaze locked upon a heap of discarded clothes. "Really? In the middle of the damn floor?" He stomped towards the clothing, failing to notice a tiny gnat take off to avoid his large gait. "It looks like some fucker took all his clothes off..." Not that such an act would be of any surprise - loonies seemed attracted to the place like flies to a bulb.

He leaned down, reaching for a shirt that lay atop the other pieces. Before his fingers gripped the wrinkled shirt, Mike was distracted by a slight buzz that passed his ear. Without even looking, the culprit displayed itself: a tiny black dot that lazily bobbed through the air. It buzzed right before Mike's face, as if to greet him.

"Stupid bitch..." Focusing both eyes on the incredibly tiny bug, his face showed little emotion. The gnat's attitude was anything but impressive to Mike who merely poised his hands and brought them together with a clap. "...too easy."

Peeling them apart, he idly inspected both hands for the remains. Finding none, Mike immediately lost interest in the bothersome life and crouched to grab the clothes. Unnoticed by him, the foolish gnat had been mortally wounded, but remained intact only to tumble from a fold of skin and fall to the floor far below. It lay upon the filthy cement, twitching and suffering with an inaudible noise.

Mike scooped the discarded clothes up in his arms. A scent reached his nose, somehow familiar as if he smelt it in passing. Recognition began bubbling to the young man's mind before he carelessly dismissed it for thoughts of lunch and after-work activities.

As he lifted his foot to walk; all thoughts of the dispatched gnat had already been forgotten. Mike would have never noticed the tiny black shape twitching pitifully in the shadow of his foot before he slammed it down, pressing the tiny creature into lifeless gore between the worn treads of his shoe.

Set upon a shelf was a set of thin glass vials of obviously scientific origin. The young employees eyes immediately noticed them in-passing, which Mike took a mental note. Mike liked to keep friendly with frequent customers by pointing out items of interest - and he knew Bryan would be curious to look at them.

Mike deposited the clothes into a bin and set off to locate the customer, never realizing he had unwittingly helped all but erase Bryan Smith's existence.
132332222.title: A gnat's fate

choices: Run over and try to get the giant's attention
Stay hidden until the giant leaves
Something else happens
133.content:
Maneuvering his red sedan into the last free parking space, Bryan stepped out of the car. Before him stood the cement building, the once white walls stained from age and weather, one side of it serving as a convenience store and the other as an automotive repair shop. The parking lot was located near the back of the building, with the gas pumps located in the front of the building.

Bryan rubbed his stomach as it growled indignantly, he really hoped they had his favourite orange scone in stock.

As he walked, a loud clinking sound caught his attention. Looking down he saw a discarded bottlecap roll to a stop before him, not particularly notable since the parking lot was rather litter laden. He continued around the corner, an unpleasant smell tickling his nose causing it to wrinkle.

One of the young station employees leaned on the wall ahead, a cigarette in one hand and a cellphone in the other. Bryan knew him by sight, the tall 22 year old's name tag read Derrick. He was dressed in the usual Keystone station company shirt, black slacks, and sneakers. The attendant didn't seem to notice Bryan as he passed, too engrossed in his cellphone.

Bryan stepped through the threshold into the store, the cool conditioned air washing over him mercifully. "Hey there, Mr. Smith. Good morning!" Greeted Paul, the station manager, a burly man in his late thirties. He was dressed in a worn company shirt, black carpenter slacks and work boots. Bryan greeted him back as he continued to the counter where the pastries and coffee resided. His stomach grumbled an impatient reminder.

Returning shortly to the counter with his scone and coffee, Bryan noticed a group of tiny ants crawling over the counter top. Paul approached the counter, and noticed Bryan's staring. With a grunt he brushed the ants off the counter, sending them to the floor, and looked back at Bryan with a friendly smile.

"Will that be everything?" Paul said as he rung up the items, and Bryan promptly nodded. With a friendly wave, Bryan exited through the sliding glass doors and back outside. He had already almost finished the scone, and drank the warm liquid gratefully as he passed Derrick and back around the corner to the parking lot.

The hungry man stopped as he finished the last of the pastry, despite it being packaged and not fresh, it still filled the gap in his stomach. He was almost feeling better despite his perplexing situation in the laboratory, before a familiar feeling became apparent in his gut. His face went pale as the sensation continued through his body, his muscles tingling. This sensation was one he exclusively associated with shrinking.

Not a second sooner, then the ground seemed to lurch beneath his feet, his vision blurring as his body seemed to both stretch and condense. He hit the ground roughly moments later, the feeling subsiding quickly as his body recovered. Bryan sat up stiffly and rubbed his head, his face nearly white from shock and panic.

While still in the same location as before, the surrounding landscape appeared vastly different. Towering before him was the cement wall of the gas station, looming many miles in height. All around him spanned an endless landscape of asphalt, dotted with boulder-sized pebbles and gigantic bits of trash. His heart sunk as he took in this whole new world.

Every test Bryan had preformed with the shrinking formula was done under a controlled environment in his laboratory. The little excursion he had planned wouldn't of even seen him leaving the safety of the shipping box, and always with the antidote close at hand. Murphy's Law struck against him now, as the falsely failed formula lay dormant until now, shrinking him to an incredibly tiny size far away from the antidote, which still lay in the cardboard box at his home. This all seemed like some horrible nightmare to the now little man.

Stepping towards a huge structure, tiny Bryan realized what it was with a lump in his throat. The barely noticeable bottlecap he had kicked earlier now rivaled any building in size, standing almost twice as high as the shrunken man. He approached it, marveling its size and imagining the dozens people it could easily house. A sudden chill went down his spine as he caught sight of a horrid being that appeared around the corner of the bottlecap. Ducking behind cover, Bryan watched an ant the size of a truck meander before him. The disgusting creature appeared shiny with grease and covered in fine hairs crawled along, busily brushing the ground with it's revolting antennae.

Bryan was never a fan of insects, and before now, had never thought of encountering one at a shrunken size. The huge beast seemed to discover what it was searching for, and speedily raced off, leaving the tiny man behind.

Standing back up, Bryan walked away from the spacious bottlecap, his mind clocking at full speed in search of an answer. How could the formula still take effect almost 24-hours later? What caused it to lie dormant in the first place? And, more importantly, how was he going to survive in a world of giant insects? His little feet walked over a massive wad of hardened gum, pressed flat into the ground.

All around him was filth, now unmistakably visible from his new perspective. Ponds of noxious liquid dotted the landscape, along with crushed cigarette butts bigger than metro trains. The foul smells that accompanied such a terrain were also magnified, causing further discomfort to the distraught man.

As he approached the corner of the massive cement wall, a new, yet very familiar scent assaulted his nose, the smell of cigarette smoke. With timid steps, Bryan walked around the corner, his jaw nearly dislocating as he took in the sight. The previously encountered ant seemed trivial when compared to the now gigantic station employee. Still leaning against the wall, his cigarette nearly spent, the young station attendant looked positively god-like. The tiny man watched as the giant's huge arm lifted the burning cigarette to his lips, and expelled a hurricane-worth of smoke from his massive nostrils.

Snapping from his stupefied gawking, Bryan needed to formulate a plan. The titan's gigantic footwear loomed in the distance, the Fallen skate brand logo visible in the dark suede material making up the sneaker. The ground trembled as the sneaker shifted slightly, Bryan swallowed hard as he imagined just how huge it was up close.

His only coarse of action was to try and get the young titan's attention. Unfortunately, Derrick barely noticed him before at normal size, how could Bryan ever hope to get the careless guy's attention at a size smaller than an ant?

He decided to...
133.title: A whole new world

choices: The sliding doors
The fuel pumps
Explore elsewhere
1332.content:
Still hiding, the shrunken scientist considered his options. All of them seemed not only ridiculous, but beyond dangerous and frightening. He shuddered, looking up the tremendous mass the young station employee now stood made Bryan all but pee his pants.

This guy was fucking huge now - easily bigger than anything Bryan could think to compare, and likely far beyond noticing him as a teeny little speck against the filth-ridden asphalt. The titan animated suddenly, shifting his towering girth; lifting an enormous arm to deposit the nearly spent smoke between his lips and reposition his feet. Bryan watched, wide-eyed and slack-jawed, as the furthest sneaker slide against the gritty asphalt, suddenly lifting off, and swung over the other shoe with sluggish grace. With a dull, but heavy thud, the worn skate shoe settled, positioned on the toe with the exposed sole looming to the world.

Bryan immediately lost all confidence. The motion, a mere shifting of the feet, was so commonplace; so casual; that the busy scientist would never have noticed before - but, now took on almost godly significance.

He couldn't help himself staring - taking in the mind-boggling sight looming far, but close enough to stand above the landscape like an alien monument. The sheer surface of many zig-zagging crevices spanned around the white Fallen logo, which was almost blotted out by a revolting mass of unidentifiable grime. The tread around it was crammed full of various debris. Near the toe, the dark rubber was heavily worn, but spotted with dark splotches of gunk, mud, and oil from around the station. The heel was in similar shape - well-worn from everyday use by the gigantic owner. What looked like smashed M&Ms were jammed into the tread, along with more pebbles and dried oil.

This all phased the tiny man like a tourist gawking at a new world wonder. Bryan was overwhelmed. He just couldn't believe how huge it was - some stoner-type gas station clerk's sneaker, blown up to become the biggest, most impressive, and utterly intimidating thing ever. All without the owner ever knowing, as he casually spent his break smoking while leaning up against the station wall.

But, Bryan didn't write Derrick off as potential help simply because of his colossal size. The tiny man spotted something else wedged and scattered randomly against the massive sole - something more organic and downright disturbing. Tiny black shapes that Bryan recognized to be ants. Most smashed beyond recognition, but more than a few intact enough to be alive and twitching, hopelessly trapped in the cayonesque treads of Derrick's gargantuan skate shoe.

All, Bryan realized, without the young titan even knowing they existed. It seemed Derrick's prefered spot for taking his smokes had become a populated collection of ants attracted to M&Ms dropped the day before. The gigantic station attendant stomped over them without regard, never once thinking of their minuscule lives as he lit up and listlessly poked at his phone.

This was all the frightened man needed to decide against running out there. He was smaller than those ants - how the hell would he fare any better?

"No, I'll figure something else out. Something, err, better; that won't be so dangerous." Bryan reasoned, never taking his eyes off of the exposed sole.

Suddenly, a loud grunt rumbled from above, jolting Bryan from his thoughts. He glanced up to see Derrick holding what looked to be a mere nub of smoldering paper. The behemoth snorted, his expression nothing but tried and bored. Raising one massive arm, he rubbed the forearm against his nostrils, snorting, and then swung it downwards and hurled the cigarette butt towards the ground.

It sailed like a falling meteor, headed far away from Bryan who still squeaked for cover. Crash landing, the garage-sized butt rolled over the filthy ground, spewing smoke and cinders as it went, and reducing a surprised ant to smoldering ruin as it did. That was preferable, as Bryan watched the angled shoe lift away, landing on the asphalt with reverberating crash. Faster than something that huge should move, the other sneaker pulled off from the ground, raining bits of dirt and grit as it sailed towards the glowing cigarette butt. It slammed down, merciless and absolute, as it dragged backwards.

Bryan steeled himself against the intense vibrations. He dared a craned look upwards, realizing the huge guy wasn't even looking down.

The violent action stopped abruptly. The gigantic skate shoe creaked as Derrick merely shifted his weight, swinging his impossibly long leg and lifting his other sneaker off the ground. The step ended with a dull boom, shaking Bryan who sat unmoved and gawking. With a thunderous twist, the other sneaker raised and sailed away in the same fashion.

The behemoth employee stomped away, utterly unaware of his titanic presence and power. His thick arms swayed at his sides, each hand looking big enough to uproot the city park, and each booming step seeming cataclysmic as the huge skate shoes smashed anything caught underneath. Bryan gazed at the back of the giant's head as he lumbered away, wondering how he ever possibly could have been able to interact with this monster of a guy.

"Fuck!" He spat out, feeling as if it was only now safe to speak. Derrick stomped out of view, his huge form vanishing into the sliding doors set farther down the building. "Fucking... He was fucking huge!"

Bryan immediately thought back to his mixing of the formula and his decision to increase its potency, and in turn, the effective size it reduced him to.

His legs dripped, feeling warm. Patting them, the shrunken man realized he had urinated himself more than a few times by just watching the humongous employee move. Biting his lip, he had a hard time steadying his shaking limbs even.

"I need to get out of this nightmare!" He realized not even an hour had passed and he was nearly fraught with panic.

Trying to stay calm, Bryan said. "Just need to get help, any help at all, I just need help!" He was a genius - and, one to be reckoned with once he had his mind to it.

He padded forwards, approaching the mass of acrid debris that remained of Derrick's cigarette. It was nothing but a mound of ashes and shredded paper, bits of rubbish visible in the devastation. The tiny scientist could still feel the tremendous vibrations caused by the oblivious titan: each step a powerful, bone jarring, boom.

Bryan realized he needed to get moving. The longer he moved around, looking around the massive environment, the more hope blossomed in between desolation and dismay. His first encounter with a regular-sized person had been memorable - and, oddly exciting in more ways than one. The bug-sized man actually felt excited to continue this accidental adventure.

His next destination was to...
1332.title: Stay hidden until the giant leaves

choices: Bryan ran to the left
Bryan ran to the right
Bryan froze in terror
1333.content:
The burly station manager stuck his head out of the store and snapped at his employee.

"Derrick, finish that cigarette and get back to work," Paul ordered in a loud voice.

The 22-year-old man rolled his eyes and took one final drag on the cigarette.

"All right, all right," Derrick said. After he inhaled one final puff of smoke, he casually flicked the cigarette butt toward the dirty, greasy asphalt at his feet.

The fleeting exchange between the two titanic men terrified the tiny man who remained unnoticed at their feet.

If their massive bodies and thunderous voices were not enough to instill fear, Derrick's actions directly imperiled the shrunken scientist.

The speck of a man shrieked as he saw the incoming missile headed toward him. The cigarette butt landed on the asphalt, still burning with a harsh, orange glow and producing copious amounts of thick, suffocating smoke. If the discarded cigarette butt had landed with slightly more precision, the tiny man would have been instantly crushed or burned to a cinder.

The thick smoke got into his eyes, blinding him. Choking and coughing, he stumbled across the pavement trying to distance himself from the smoldering paper-wrapped cylinder.

With his eyes blurred, he stopped and looked skyward at Derrick's enormous body. With the smoke still filling his lungs, tiny Bryan's attempt to shout for help ended with racking coughs.

Suddenly, Derrick lifted his sneaker before heading into the store.

"No! What are you doing?" Bryan screamed.

Then, realization dawned. The giant young man was preparing to grind out the discarded cigarette butt beneath the sole of his sneaker.

"Oh no!" The tiny man cried in shock. "I've got to get out of the way."

As the giant sneaker crashed toward him, the desperate shrunken man had only seconds to react.
1333.title: Dangerous Derrick

choices: A gigantic Paul stomps around the corner
The pursuing ants appear behind Bryan!
13332.content:
The huge sneaker soared overhead, time seeming to almost stand still as it descended.

Bryan's eyes widened as he took in the horrifying view of the gargantuan sole. The aggressive tread was filthy. Mud filled the majority of the thick tread, with bits of grass and food visible throughout, and numerous unlucky insect guts. Bryan even noted a torn price tag wedged near the heel.

Suddenly snapping from his stupor, the little man cried out and dashed to his right. "I'm not going to die! Not like this!" His shaking voiced croaked.

Lunging through the air, he aimed for the nearby safety of the looming cement wall. He landed roughly in a vile pond of noxious water that had collected at the base, barely noticeable to somebody like Derrick. Before he could even get his bearings a thunderous crash sounded behind him, sending a heavy vibration through the ground. Bryan turned around, his body covered in the slimy liquid, to see Derrick's massive skate shoe take up his entire view.

The sole was dirty, covered in grime accumulated by stomping around the gas station day after day, and towered over two stories to the bug-sized scientist. Bryan tensed in fear as the gigantic sneaker began dragging back, causing the ground to tremble and the sound of grinding gravel to fill the air. He was so awe-struck by what proved a simple action to the young titan, but to Bryan struck him as the beginning of the apocalypse.

-----------------

Annoyed that his seemingly short break was over, Derrick casually tossed the spent cigarette to the ground.

It landed near his left sneaker, smoldering brightly. Barely glancing down, Derrick stomped his skate shoe down and dragged it back roughly. Pulling his phone out again he read a new text message from his buddy, not even remotely aware of the tiny white speck nearly squashed by his huge sneaker.

He quickly tapped a reply to the text as he turned to go back to store. His large shoe obliviously stomped down on a few ants, missing only a few of them, as he walked to the sliding door and hoped Paul wouldn't give him flack for his extended break.

-------------------

With shocking speed the huge sneaker suddenly lifted causing Bryan to cry out in fear, his immediate assumption that he was next.

"Please! No!" He screamed internally, covering his head.

A distant explosive thud caused him to look up again. His entire body was trembling as he watched the mountainous Derrick stomp heavily away towards the sliding doors of the building. Bryan cringed with each step the titanic guy took, weakening tremors reaching his body before disappearing altogether as Derrick lumbered out of sight. Before him, the obliterated remains of the cigarette covered many acres-worth of the ground before him.

The shrunken scientist couldn't believe at this point that he could ever have interacted with such a gargantuan being normally. He was almost stomped out of existence when the giant simply put out his cigarette! Bryan felt horribly helpless and afraid. How could he ever hope to get somebodies attention?

His self-pitying thoughts were interrupted when he noticed movement ahead. His spine chilled as he took in the sight of a group of terrify ants approaching, he had forgotten the car-sized insects that also threatened his meager existence. His immediate thought was to escape.

Once again, he chose his right which proved to be a cavernous crevice in the mountainous cement block that made of the wall of the structure. Bryan couldn't afford to consider what may possibly be inside the darkness as he stumbled blindly into it. His tiny hands groping fruitlessly in the darkness, searching for any handhold. His heart sank and his pace became desperate when he thought he heard the monstrous ants pursuing him.

Just before his little heart gave out in terror, a brightness ahead of him gave the little man hope. Bryan dashed towards it, stumbling on the rough ground beneath him, he didn't care where it led, long as it was out of this hellish darkness.

His wriggling form burst forth into the light melodramatically. With hurried, grateful gasps, Bryan took in his new surroundings.

Stretching miles around him was the dirty tile floor of the gas station interior. Each tile was many hundreds of feet in length and width, giving the landscape an alien-like appearance. The nearby wall was made up of mammoth drink fridges that towered many miles high and emitted a loud rumbling electrical hum. A new feeling of awe washed over him as he remembered browsing this very part of the store for coffee over a half hour ago before this all began.

Suddenly...
13332.title: Back inside

choices: Dessert first!
Put in on the desk for later.
133321.content:
"Derrick," Paul calls across the empty store. He receives no response.

"Derrick, I need you to watch the front for my break!" he adds urgently. 'Lazy little shit is probably still smoking' he thinks unhappily to himself. Only taking a couple of steps he notices a pack of two chocolate cupcakes on the floor.

With a grunt, he reaches down and snatches it up. Chunks and crumbs rain out of a hole in the packaging onto the ground.

With a sigh Paul takes the time to pick them up,unconsciously rolling the crumbs into a ball between his thumb and finger. "Can't let the fucking ants have it!" he mutters at the floor.

"Who're you talking to?" Paul stands up and glares at Derrick who had just come through the back door. "Right on time!" Paul growls sarcastically, eliciting a dismissive grunt.

"Keep an eye on the front while I'm on break" Paul says gruffly as heads into the back office. Derrick merely grunts again.

---

"DERRICK!" roars from behind Bryan. He spins around to see Paul standing near the cashier counter. His mountainous form dwarfs each of the towering displays around him.

"DERRICK I NEED YOU TO WATCH THE FRONT FOR MY BREAK!" he thunders, taking a large step forwards. His boot squeaks against the dirty linoleum. Fear of the frayed boots, stained with oil and other filth washes over the tiny man. Bryan turns to run, despite knowing it was useless. Two more squeaking thuds end with a confused grunt. Bryan, continuing to run, turns backwards. Paul seems to be staring directly at him, a look of concern on his gruff features. Bryan halts and begins to wave his arms, "Yess! Right here!" he cheers.

Paul reaches down, grease trapped in the fingerprint of his thick, calloused fingers. Bryan whimpers and steps backwards, bracing for impact from the massive hand. However it flies overhead and a loud crinkling sounds as Paul clasps his hand around a fallen pack of two chocolate cupcakes. Bryan is awed by how easily the large package is lifted. As it soars overhead, large chunks rain from a hole in the package. He screams in terror as crumbs many times his size crash down randomly.

Bryan, after discovering he had not been struck, is not given the chance to celebrate his luck. With a gusting sigh, Paul's begins pinching the crumbs between his huge fingers. Bryan shrieks as Paul's thumb smashes into him. The greasy cupcake pushes against his other side and he finds his movement restricted. Bryan moves with the rolling movement between the thumb and cake, but thankfully remains free of the sticky bits of food.

From here he cannot make out any words, but can feel vibrations every time Paul speaks thunderously.

---

Paul drops into his aged office chair. It creaks in protest of the violent movement. He dismissively flicks the ball of crumbs into the trash. He is about to do the same with the cupcakes when his stomach growls loudly. His eyes flick to the package in hand as his mouth waters.

He had brought a lunch, but the cupcakes sounded pretty good right now!
133321.title: Breaktime for Paul

choices: Bryan has fallen to the desk
Bryan has been licked up
1333211.content:
The cupcake sounds too good to pass up! Paul rips the packaging open and grips the damaged cupcake. Without considering the filth coating his fingers he opens his mouth wide and stuffs the cupcake in, closing his lips around his fingers. He pulls them free and begins to chew happily, disregarding the film of saliva on his fingers.

Tearing away the last of the wrapper, he snatches up the other cream-filled chocolate cupcake, still whole and undamaged. He lifts it to his lips as he smacks his lips trying to chew the dry pastry. After swallowing the bite, Paul pauses, staring at the cake in his hand. At the same time he unconsciously uses his tongue to dig for lumps of food trapped against his gums. Following another gulp, Paul widens his mouth and takes a monstrous bite of the cake. He is unaware of how obnoxiously he is chewing, since he is alone in the room.

---

Bryan is flooded with relief as Paul flicks away the massive ball of cake. Thrilled not to have gone with it, he is also happy to have the pressure removed. A resounding growl interrupts his thoughts. Bryan isn't given the chance to ponder its source as the thumb he is stuck to moves quickly into the glistening plastic wrapper of the cupcakes.

Before he knows it, a large brown cake appears. Bryan is just enough towards the tip of the thumb to be in the clear. The holes in the bread are massive caves to him. He simply cannot see it as a simple snack.

Above he can see Paul's delighted face. However the hungry look in his eyes chills Bryan to his core. He suddenly realizes what is about to happen.

"No!" he shouts as he flies upwards. Paul's wide mouth, framed by thick stubble, stretches open. He is greeted by a line of straight teeth, faded with age. Bryan screams as he joins the cupcake into the mouth. To his side is a pink, slimy wall. Beneath him, a jagged molar glints just before everything goes dark.

"No don't eat me!" he wails. A loud slurping noise assaults his eardrums as he is violently pulled back. He finds himself blinking in the light. Ahead of him are Paul's lips, shifting as he works the cupcake around his mouth.

Bryan laughs manically. He had escaped! Though he was still stuck to the thumb and was now coated in saliva, he was at least not eaten.

Again his celebration is cut short by Paul's movement as the giant tears the other cupcake free coming to a stop in front of the lips. With a smack, they part. Mounds of soggy black cake are easily visible as Paul chews.

*Smack, smack! Gulp!* Bryan hears the passing of the food and shudders. Paul's mouth widens as his huge tongue probes around, confirming the bite was gone.

After a moment's pause and another gulp the lips widen and the tongue stretches forward. Bryan is greeted with thick cake mush coating the tongue, the occasional spot of cream easily visible.
