Strands of thick saliva stretch from the tongue like webs. The jagged molars are now crammed with compacted cake. Bryan wails at the revolting sight.

Once more he is pushed into the mouth, more aware of the thick, reeking air within. The teeth come together with a loud crack and then Bryan emerges coughing, with only a small part of the cake remaining.

Ahead of him Paul continues to chew with his mouth open. Closing his eyes to avoid seeing the thick piles of cake and excessive saliva, only makes Bryan more aware of the deafening smacking and snorting coming from the mouth ahead of him.

---

After a loud gulp, Paul pushes the remaining bite of cake into his mouth, savoring its powerful, sweet flavor. He rubs his fingers together for a second before licking them clean. He then reaches across the small desk to grab his beat-up lunchbox to continue his meal.
1333211.title: Delicious cupcakes

choices: Through a small tear in the box of drinks
Under the massive cooler
133322.content:
Bryan's new perspective made the rather small and drab interior of his local petrol station look utterly different. An entire city could easily fit on the spread of linoleum tile floor before him with plenty of room left over. It all was familiar, yet he felt like he arrived on some strange planet of towering coolers, shelves and miles of huge tile. Bryan simply couldn't wrap his mind around it.

Just like outside, numerous details became apparent to the tiny man. His persnickety brain couldn't help but note how filthy the floor appeared, as it was littered with dirt and other refuse. The base of a huge cooler nearest him also appeared in similarly distasteful condition, covered with dust and dried soda from spills. Bryan bemusedly considered that health inspectors could make great use of his shrinking formula when evaluating an establishments cleanliness.

Gazing around, he had almost forgotten his shrunken peril in his awe-struck daze. Murphy's Law decided against this brief complacency as Bryan heard a rough skittering noise from behind, causing him to turn around.

His heart sank in terror when he saw the three ants emerge from the dark crevice he had exited through only minutes ago. Bryan had already been unpleasantly afraid of insects before, but at his current size, this fear had skyrocketed to outright terror as the smallest insect proved to be larger than he was. The ants seemed to be searching for something as they communicated via their antennae to each other, emitting a vile clicking sound from their dangerous mandibles.

"They haven't seen me... I just need to-" Bryan's train of thought was cut suddenly as the foremost ant seemed to look directly at him with horrifying black eyes. The ant seemed to signal its fellows with a hurried motion from its antennae, and the three sped towards the tiny scientist at a frightening pace.

A pathetic yelp and tiny Bryan clumsily turned around running away from the horrid creatures. His little legs felt incredibly slow as he sprinted desperately. He wished that he would of decided to go for those morning jogs he had been considering for years but been too "busy" to begin. Bryan raced towards the dust bunny ridden base of a mountainous cooler, having no other options other than the open floor.

The ground began to shuddered noticeably, and heavy booms were heard.

-----------------

Derrick walked around a shelf containing a variety of sweets, his muscular arms bulging as he carried a container of beverages to be stocked.

He stopped before the cooler that contained the beverages in question and set the weighted box to his side. Fishing out a small utility knife, Derrick prepared to cut the box open when he noticed four tiny bugs slowly moving to the base of the cooler he was stocking.

"Little fuckers" He muttered casually as he stood back up. Lifting his nearest sneaker, he stamped it down on the three insects clustered together that seemed to be following a smaller one. Looking over where the other bug was, he didn't see it. It must have crawled under the cooler, he thought casually. It was all inconsequential to him, as bugs in the station were quite common, especially during summer.

Returning to his duty, Derrick pulled the cooler door open and began stocking the drinks.

-----------------

Tiny Bryan Smith lay paralyzed with fear in his hiding place. He couldn't believe how many times now he had come so close to death, he closed his eyes wishing that he never invented the shrinking formula.

Bryan's hiding place was...
133322.title: The pursuing ants appear behind Bryan!

choices: Stay where he was
Climb into the phone
1333222.content:
From just under the cover provided by the cooler Bryan sucked in deep breaths, trying to get his panic under control. His efforts were not at all helped by the view in front of him. Derrick's enormous sneakers almost filled his vision as the giant young man filled the cooler with soft drinks. Every little movement of the giant man caused his feet to move slightly and Bryan's overactive imagination had no problem at all picturing him being squashed like an ant.
"Ok. Gotta keep it together," Bryan muttered to himself, trying to get a grip on his situation. "He can't step on me while I'm under here, so I'm safe for the time being. I just have to work out a way to make contact with someone who can help me."
Just to prove that the gods really do have a sense of humour, those two thoughts suddenly collided in the real world.
- - - -
Derrick fumbled for his phone as it vibrated in his pocket. He looked around casually to make sure his boss didn't see him answer it - Paul was a stickler for him not using the phone unless he was on a break. Trying to juggle two bottles of drink and his phone Derrick nearly jumped out of his pants when he heard Paul's booming voice, thinking he had been caught. His iphone slipped out of his grasp and dropped to the ground. The phone hit his foot and bounced under the cooler.
Muttering to himself Derrick set the two drinks in the cooler then got down on hands and knees. Slipping his hand under the cooler he probed blindly for his phone.
- - - - -
Bryan nearly wet himself when the phone came sliding into his 'safe' space so suddenly. His next thought was elation - he could use it to get help! Then he realised just how absurd that thought was - the phone was bigger than most office blocks. But his rational mind saw a possibility as well.
Although he doubted he could climb onto the phone, right in front of his was the ear phone jack and he was small enough to climb into it.
The tiny scientists frayed nerves took another hammering then when huge fingers slapped down on the floor, searching blindly for the phone.
With barely any time to consider the consequences Bryan knew he had to make a snap decision.
1333222.title: Under the massive cooler

choices: His apartment
A friend's house
13332222.content:
With an impressive leap, Bryan pulled himself into the cavernous phone jack.

He had little time to consider the ramifications as the giant's huge fingers slammed the floor blindly nearby. A jolting motion told Bryan that the hand had found the phone, pulling it away with lurching force.

Pressing his tiny hands against the warm metallic surface for stability, he watched the outside view whip around violently. Derrick's mega-sized face appeared momentarily before being blotted out by a giant finger. His pitiful screams were instantly swallowed in the compact space.

His world went topsy once more. Bryan was sent careening into the curved sides of the jack as the obvious giant carelessly handled the device.

Regret was the dominant feeling as the tiny man endured the violent ride. The huge pink wall suddenly vanished and Bryan felt vertigo as the phone slid down into darkness.

---

Derrick grinned at the errant cell phone in his hand. The damn thing had been dropped many times, yet still remained intact save for a small crack on the corner of the screen.

He had no way of knowing that a very tiny passenger had taken refuge inside the seldom-used ear phone socket. Tapping a quick reply to his girlfriend, he swiftly deposited the smart phone back into the front pocket of his work slacks. Clomping footsteps sounded behind him.

"Derrick, I need you at the pumps outside." Paul appeared around the corner shelves suddenly.

"Sure thing." The laid back attendant replied with an agreeable grunt.

Placing the last two bottles in the cooler, he headed out to the gas pumps. A truck driver needed assistance with a loose axle, which proved to be an easy fix. Watching the truck pull away, Derrick inspected his phone again, only to find that the battery had died. He had forgotten to charge it the night before.

"Fuck me..." He mumbled and dropped it back into his pocket, unaware of the danger the action caused to an unseen stowaway.

The remainder of his work day was then spent without interruption from his phone. A kid tore open a bag of crisps, spraying them all over the floor. Derrick listlessly swept the crumby mess up, stray chips crunching under his shoes.

Glancing up an hour later, the clock displayed 5:30 pm in bold font. The end of his shift. He grabbed his flannel over shirt, pulled a frayed baseball cap over his black hair, and hopped into his car.

Cranking the beat up jalopy into gear, Derrick drove to...
13332222.title: Stowaway

13333.content:
The seconds wiled away in slow motion as Bryan stood awestruck. Shadow darkened the ground and the sky was blotted out completely by the titanic footwear.

He couldn't believe how huge it was. The young gas station employee could not fathom his enormity and power, or appreciate the devastation he caused with casual actions.

"This can't be happening..." He thought. "Surely, I don't die like this..." His wide-eyed stare showed disbelief.

The sole spanned many football fields, gunk and pebbles wedged in the aggressive tread pattern. Bryan was able to discern all of it, clods of mud, boulder-like pebbles, and even a few flattened M&Ms. Gruesomely visible in the heavy tread were ants, flattened by the gargantuan guy without notice as he worked. In the middle of it all, Bryan noted the skate shoe logo, "FALLEN", now an off-white colour surrounded by the black rubber tread.

All this spanned only a few seconds, excruciatingly slowed down to the minuscule scientist. He had forgotten the cigarette butt, which had been already so huge to him, pluming noxious fumes nearby.

His mind raced, unable to accept what was happening, and frozen in utter terror.

----

Having done this many, many times, Derrick didn't even think when he dragged his sneaker back, and twisted. He turned and continued to the sliding door, oblivious to the world around him, especially that of an ant-sized man. A light crunch sounded as he approached the sliding door, his sneaker smashing more spilled M&Ms and tiny ants on the dirty asphalt.

The careless young man returned to work, resuming his tasks with the same casual attitude he always employed. Derrick's only concern was how bored he was, and his future plans that night with his buddies and girlfriend. Each thudding step dislodging bits of dirt, chocolate, and many unfortunate insects. The teeny red splotch pressed in further with every step.

Bryan would be reported as missing only a day later. The rushed article detailing his disappearance was only glanced over by Derrick in the morning. Proclaiming that the zany man had stolen experimental supplies from the laboratory he worked at, which may of played a part in his disappearance. It even mentioned that he may of altered himself in some way, and requested information from the public.

This was all unimportant to Derrick. Police retrieved Bryan's car from the station, and questioned Paul and his employees about the missing man. When asked, Derrick only shrugged in response. The fact that Bryan visited the station escaped his memory.

He idly flipped to the Sunday comics.

"Garfield..." He muttered in amusement, propping his sneakered feet on the table, exposing the filthy soles.

Bits of the mashed M&Ms remained, and with closer inspection, one might think they saw impossibly tiny bits of bone and clothing.
